<h2>abandon[sound:abandon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">放纵：</font>carefree, freedom from constraint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]added spices to the stew with complete abandon 肆无忌惮地向炖菜里面加调料</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unconstraint, uninhibitedness, unrestraint</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">放纵：</font>to give (oneself) over unrestrainedly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abandon oneself to emotion 感情用事，abandon herself to a life of complete idleness 放纵自己过着闲散的生活</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indulge, surrender, give up</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">放弃：</font>to withdraw from often in the face of danger or encroachment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abandon the ship/homes 弃船，离家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]salvage 救援</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">停止做某事：</font>to put an end to (something planned or previously agreed to)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the bad weather forced NASA to abandon the launch  坏天气迫使 NASA 停止了发射</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abort, drop, repeal, rescind, revoke, call off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]keep, continue, maintain, carry on 继续</div>
<h2>abase[sound:abase.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">降低（地位、职位、威望或尊严）：</font>to lower in rank, office, prestige, or esteem</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]was unwilling to abase himself by pleading guilty to a crime that he did not commit 不愿意屈就自己去承认一个莫须有的罪名</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debauch, degrade, profane, vitiate, discredit, foul, smirch, take down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elevate, ennoble, uplift, aggrandize, canonize, deify, exalt 使高贵，使有声望</div>
<h2>abash[sound:abash.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使尴尬，使羞愧：</font>to destroy the self-possession or self-confidence of ,disconcert, embarrass</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Nothing could abash him. 没有什么可以使他感到难堪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discomfit, disconcert, discountenance, faze, fluster, nonplus, mortify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]embolden 使大胆</div>
<h2>abate[sound:abate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">减轻（程度或者强度）：</font>to reduce in degree or intensity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abate his rage/pain 平息他的愤怒/减轻痛苦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]moderate, recede, subside, remit, wane, die (away or down or out),let up, phase down, ratchet (down)，taper off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]intensify</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">减少（数量或者降低价值）：</font>to reduce in amount or value</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abate a tax 降低税收</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]de-escalate, deplete, downscale, dwindle,</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]augment, promote  增加</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">停止，撤销：</font>to put an end to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abate a nuisance 停止伤害</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrogate, annul, invalidate, nullify, rescind, vacate</div>
<h2>abbreviate[sound:abbreviate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">缩写，缩短：</font>to make briefer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abbreviate the word “building” as “bldg.” 将“building”缩写作“bldg”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abridge, curtail, cut back, syncopate ，truncate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extend, protract, elongate, lengthen, prolong 延长</div>

<h2>absolute[sound:absolute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">专制的：</font>unconstrained by constitutional or other provisions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]absolute ruler  专制的统治者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arbitrary, autocratic, despotic, dictatorial, monocratic, tyrannical</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无限的：</font>unqualified in extent or degree; total</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]absolute silence 鸦雀无声</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]complete, utter, deadly, downright, out-and-out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]qualified 有限的，有保留的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">完美的、纯净不掺杂的：</font>free from imperfection free or relatively; free from mixture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]absolute alcohol 无水酒精（纯酒精）</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]plain, refined, unadulterated, unalloyed, undiluted, unmixed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adulterated, alloyed, diluted, impure, mixed 掺杂的，不纯的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不容置疑的，确凿的：</font>positive, unquestionable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]absolute proof 确凿的证据</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clear, deciding, decisive, definitive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconclusive, indecisive, unclear 不明确的</div>
<h2>absolve[sound:absolve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使无罪，解除责任：</font>to set free from an obligation or the consequences of guilt, exculpate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]absolve somebody from blame 使某人免受责备</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquit, exonerate, vindicate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blame, criminate, incriminate 定罪</div>
<h2>abstain[sound:abstain.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">自我克制，主动戒绝：</font>to refrain from something by one's own choice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abstain from smoking/voting 戒烟，弃权</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forgo, keep from, refrain from, withhold (from)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bow to, give in to, submit to, succumb to, surrender to, yield to  屈服于</div>
<h2>abstemious[sound:abstemious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（吃喝等）有节制的，节俭的：</font>marked by  restraint especially in the consumption of food oralcohol, sparring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an abstemious diet 有节制的饮食，  abstemious meals  节俭的晚餐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]continent, temperate, self-abnegating, self-denying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]indulgent  放纵的</div>
<h2>abstract[sound:abstract.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">做总结，概括：</font>to make an abstract of ，summarize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abstracted the 135-page report in three short paragraphs 将一份 135 页的报告概括为三段话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]digest, recapitulate, synopsize, sum up, boil down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elaborate  详细描述</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使分心：</font>to draw away the attention of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]personal problems abstracted him 私人问题让他分心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]detract, divert, call off, throw off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]abstraction n. 心不在焉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]attention 关注</div>
<h2>abstruse[sound:abstruse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难以理解的：</font>difficult to comprehend : recondite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the abstruse calculations 复杂深奥的计算</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arcane, esoteric, hermetic (also hermetical), recondite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accessible, patent, shallow, superficial 可了解的，肤浅的</div>
<h2>absurd[sound:absurd.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不合理的：</font>ridiculously unreasonable, unsound, or incongruous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an absurd argument 无稽之谈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]wild, bizarre, ludicrous, insane, nonsensical, preposterous, half-baked</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rational, sensible, realistic, reasonable 理性的，合理的</div>
<h2>abundant[sound:abundant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大量的：</font>marked by great plenty (as of resources)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a abundant land 一片富饶的土地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ample, cornucopian, teeming, replete, abounding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]infrequent, rare, uncommon, inadequate, scanty, scarce 稀少的，罕见的</div>
<h2>abuse[sound:abuse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">辱骂抨击：</font>language that condemns or vilifies usually unjustly, intemperately, and angrily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He alleged that he was verbally abused by his colleagues. 他声称受到了同事的言语攻击。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assail, bash, castigate, excoriate, lambaste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]abusive 辱骂的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">不正当不合理使用：to put to a wrong or improper use;  过分过量使用：</font>to use excessively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abuse a privilege 滥用特权；  abuse alcohol  酗酒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]misemploy, misuse</div>
<h2>abut[sound:abut.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">邻接，毗邻：</font>to touch at one end or side; lie adjacent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Our land abuts a wildlife preserve. 我们的土地靠近一片野生动物保护区。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]skirt, verge on, border on, butt on, march with</div>
<h2>abysmal[sound:abysmal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极低的或极可怜的：</font>immeasurably low or wretched</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abysmal living conditions 极可怜的生活条件</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bottomless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]shallow shoal</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（程度）很深的、极端的：</font>immeasurably great</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]abysmal ignorance 极端的无知；an abysmal cliff 深不见底的悬崖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]profound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]skin-deep, superficial 肤浅的</div>
<h2>accede[sound:accede.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">赞成：</font>to express approval or give consent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]acceded to their pleas 同意了他们的请愿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquiesce, assent, consent, subscribe, come round</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demur, dissent 反对</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">就任，就职：</font>To arrive at or come into an office or dignity:</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accede to the throne 就任国王</div>
<h2>accelerate[sound:accelerate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">加速：</font>to cause to move faster</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accelerate his steps 加快脚步</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balloon, escalate, snowball, mushroom, proliferate, burgeon, build up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]retard 减速</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使提前发生：</font>to bring about at an earlier time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accelerate their departure 提前离开</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">变大，变多：</font>to become greater in size, extent, volume, amount, or number</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]toy purchases accelerate dramatically during the Christmas season  玩具销售量在圣诞期间暴涨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accumulate, balloon, enlarge, escalate, mushroom, proliferate, snowball, roll up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contract, decrease, diminish, dwindle, lessen, recede, wane</div>
<h2>accessible[sound:accessible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可以到达的：</font>situated within easy reach</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the town accessible by rail 有铁路通达的城镇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]handy, reachable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconvenient, unhandy, unreachable, untouchable</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可理解的：</font>capable of being understood or appreciated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The information ought to be made more accessible. 信息应该更清晰易懂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprehensible, fathomable, legible, scrutable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abstruse, incoherent, incomprehensible, inscrutable, insensible  深奥的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">能够获得的：</font>possible to get</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The data is not currently accessible.  数据目前还不可用。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]available, attainable, obtainable, procurable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unattainable, unavailable, unobtainable</div>
<h2>accessory[sound:accessory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">辅助的，附属的：</font>having a secondary, supplementary, or subordinate function.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accessory features such as call-waiting 类似呼叫等待的附属功能</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accessory, peripheral, supplementary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]of primarily importance, chief, main, principal 主要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">帮凶：</font>one associated with another in wrongdoing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]two accessories, the driver of the getaway car and the dishonest bank teller, were charged in the robberycase 两个帮凶，逃逸车辆的司机和不诚信的银行出纳，在抢劫案中被控告</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abettor, confederate</div>
<h2>accidental[sound:accidental.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">意外发生的，偶然的：</font>occurring unexpectedly or by chance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The discovery of gold was entirely accidental.  黄金的发现纯属偶然。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incidental, fortuitous, unintended, unintentional, unpremeditated, unwitting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calculated, deliberate, intended, planned, premeditated  预先计划好的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">附带的，不重要的：</font>not being a vital part of or belonging to something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Its commercial value was accidental. 它的商业价值微乎其微。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alien, extraneous, external, adventitious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inherent, innate, intrinsic  内在的，固有的</div>
<h2>acclimate[sound:acclimate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使适应：</font>to change (something) so as to make it suitable for a new use or situation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]acclimate oneself to a nine-to-five office job 适应朝九晚五的坐班生活</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjust, accommodate, shape, suit, tailor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]make unfamiliar with 使不熟悉</div>
<h2>accolade[sound:accolade.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">同意，赞赏：</font>an expression of approval</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disapprobation 不赞成</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]won virtually every accolade that the film world has to offer  赢得了电影界几乎一致的赞赏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]applause, credit, distinction</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">赞扬：</font>to praise or honor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]excoriation, criticism, reprobation, castigation, cutting remark, derogation, reproof. denigration, denunciation, swearword 批评，谴责</div>
<h2>accommodate[sound:accommodate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">提供所需（例如服务、借贷、寄宿）：</font>to  provide with something desired, needed, or suited (as ahelpful service, a loan, or lodgings)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This cruise ship was big enough to accommodate over 600 people. 该游轮可以为超过 600 人提供食宿。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fit, hold, take</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">改变以适应新情况、新场景：</font>to change (something) so as to make it suitable for a new use orsituation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accommodated the lectern to the height of the guest speaker 将讲台的高度调节得适合讲演者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acclimate, adjust, condition, conform, doctor, edit, shape, suit, tailor</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使和谐：</font>to bring to a state free of conflicts, inconsistencies, or differences</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The idea that the United States could harmoniously accommodate all was a fiction. 认为美国能够和谐一切就是幻想。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attune, conciliate, conform, coordinate, reconcile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disharmonize  使不和谐</div>
<h2>accost[sound:accost.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">以挑衅的形式搭讪：</font>to approach and speak to often in a challenging or aggressive way</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accosted by three gang members 被三个混混搭讪</div>
<h2>accrete[sound:accrete.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">逐渐增长：</font>to grow or increase gradually, as by addition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]silt accreting at the mouth of the river 泥沙在河口淤积</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accumulate, build up, pile (up), stack (up)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]wear away, reduction in substance caused by erosion 侵蚀，减少</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]accretion n. 慢慢增加</div>
<h2>accumulate[sound:accumulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. 逐渐增长：to increase gradually in quantity or number</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accumulate a fortune 积攒了一笔财富</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mount, swell, garner, snowball, build up, bulk (up)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dissipate, diminish, dwindle, recede, wane 消散，减少</div>
<h2>acerbic[sound:acerbic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">酸涩的心情、心境或者语调：</font>marked by the use of wit that is intended to cause hurt feelings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]acerbic commentary 尖酸的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]pungent, sardonic, satiric, scalding, scathing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sweet, saccharin 甜的，糖精（甜）</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]acerbity n. 酸</div>
<h2>acme[sound:acme.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">顶点，极点：</font>the highest point or stage, as of achievement or development</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the acme of his career  他事业的巅峰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]culmination, pinnacle, tip-top, high-water mark</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bottom, nadir, rock bottom 最低点</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">最佳典范：</font>the most perfect type or example</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a movie that has come to be regarded as the acme of the Hollywood musical  这部影片被认为是好莱坞音乐剧的最佳典范</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apotheosis, epitome, exemplar</div>
<h2>acquiesce[sound:acquiesce.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">勉强同意；默许：</font>to accept, comply, or submit tacitly or passively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]acquiesce to my own fleecing 默许我的敲竹杠行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assent, consent, subscribe, come round</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resist, defy, dissent 抵制，不同意</div>
<h2>acrid[sound:acrid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">辛辣的，刺鼻的：</font>sharp and harsh or unpleasantly pungent in taste or odor : irritating</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]acrid smell of tobacco 烟草刺鼻的味道</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. 刻薄的：marked by the use of wit that is intended to cause hurt feelings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]acrid temper 刻薄的性情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gentle 温和的</div>
<h2>acrimonious[sound:acrimonious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">刻薄的，充满仇恨的：</font>having or showing deep-seated resentment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the acrimonious debate between the two candidates 候选人之间言辞激烈的辩论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]embittered, hard, rancorous, resentful, sore</div>
<h2>acumen[sound:acumen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不同寻常的洞察力和鉴别力：</font>exceptional  discernment  and  judgment  especially  in  practicalmatters</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the business acumen 商业方面的洞察力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]keenness, shrewdness, canniness, clear-sightedness, hardheadedness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unable to discerning 不能辨别的</div>
<h2>acute[sound:acute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">敏锐的：</font>marked by keen discernment or intellectual perception especially of subtle distinctions，penetrating</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an acute thinker 思维敏锐的思想者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delicate, fine, keen, perceptive, sensitive</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严重的，急性的：</font>needing immediate attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]acute appendicitis  急性阑尾炎</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exigent, imperative, compelling, urgent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mild, noncritical, nonurgent  轻微的，不严重的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（程度、影响）极强：</font>extreme in degree, or effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]experiencing acute distress over the misunderstanding with her best friend 因误会她的死党陷入了深深的痛苦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dreadful, excruciating, profound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]light, moderate, soft 程度温和的</div>
<h2>adamant[sound:adamant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固执的，不可动摇的：</font>unshakable or insistent especially in maintaining a position or opinion,unyielding; inflexible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]adamant about staying here 执意留下来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hardheaded, headstrong, intransigent, pertinacious, obdurate, uncompromising</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vacillatory, incline to yield, amenable, compliant, relenting, yielding 动摇的，易屈从的</div>
<h2>adapt[sound:adapt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">修改，使适应：</font>to modify according with the changing circumstances</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]adapt to the change  适应变化；  adapt the novel for the screen  改编小说为影视作品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjust, conform, edit, accommodate, shape, suit, tailor</div>
<h2>addict[sound:addict.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">沉溺，上瘾：</font>to devote or surrender (oneself) to something habitually or obsessively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be addicted to drug/ alcohol 沉溺于毒品、酒</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">对某事上瘾的人：</font>a person with a strong and habitual liking for something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]science-fiction addicts who eagerly await each new installment in the series 科幻小说爱好者，等待着系列的每一次更新</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]devotee, enthusiast, fanatic, maniac</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nonfan 非粉丝</div>
<h2>adhere[sound:adhere.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">依附，粘着：</font>to cause to stick fast</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]adhere to the surface 附着在表面</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cleave, cling, hew</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]detach 分离</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">服从命令：</font>to act according to the commands of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]adhere to the rules 遵守规定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cling to, hew to, stand by, stick to, comply with</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defy, disobey, rebel against  不服从，反抗</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">坚定地支持：</font>to give steadfast support to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]our coach adheres to the belief that we can win this game if we just have a positive attitude 我们的教练坚定地相信，只有我们有积极的态度，我们就能拿下比赛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]keep to, stand by, stick to or with</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defect from 叛变</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]adherent n. 追随者：a follower of a leader, party, or profession</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forerunner 先行者</div>
<h2>adjourn[sound:adjourn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">延期，休会：</font>to suspend a session indefinitely or to another time or place</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The meeting adjourned for a week. 会议延期一周。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]prorogate, prorogue, recess, suspend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]convoke 召集，召开会议</div>
<h2>adjunct[sound:adjunct.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">附属物，非必须部分：</font>something joined or added to another thing but not essentially a part of it</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Massage therapy can be used as an adjunct along with the medication. 按摩治疗可以作为药物治疗的补充疗法。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appendage, appliance, attachment, add-on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]essential element 重要部分</div>
<h2>ad-lib[sound:ad-lib.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">即兴的：</font>made or done without previous thought or preparation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]not bad for an ad-lib comedy routine  对即兴喜剧表演来说已经不错了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extemporary, impromptu, improvisational, offhanded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]considered, planned, premeditated, rehearsed</div>
<h2>admonish[sound:admonish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">建议：</font>to give advice to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]admonished the patient to eat more healthy foods  建议患者多吃健康食品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]counsel</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">责备：</font>to reprove gently but earnestly.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]admonished her for littering  责备她乱扔垃圾</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chide, reprimand, reproach, reprove, tick off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]admonishment n. 责备</div>
<h2>adore[sound:adore.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">喜爱，感到愉悦：</font>to take pleasure in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I adore those earrings.  我相中那对耳环了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fancy, relish, savor, delight in, rejoice in</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">宠爱：</font>to feel passion, devotion, or tenderness for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]adored his wife 宠爱他的妻子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cherish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abhor, abominate, despise, detest, execrate, loathe 讨厌，嫌弃</div>
<h2>adulate[sound:adulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">极度谄媚：</font>to praise too much</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]incompetent assistants who spend all their time adulating her 成天恭维她的不称职的下属</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]overpraise, belaud, soft-soap, butter up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]scorn, disdain, vituperate, disparage  鄙视</div>
<h2>adulterate[sound:adulterate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">掺杂，加入低等成分：</font>to corrupt, debase, or make impure by the addition of a foreign or inferiorsubstance or element</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]adulterate its products with cheap additives 在产品中掺杂廉价的添加剂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alloy, contaminate, pollute, taint, water down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enrich, fortify, strengthen  加入养分</div>
<h2>adumbrate[sound:adumbrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">部分地或有保留地揭露：</font>to disclose partially or guardedly.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]adumbrate a plan 透露计划</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]revelation 完全显示</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">预示着：</font>to give a slight indication of beforehand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The strife in Bloody Kansas adumbrated the civil war that would follow. 发生在堪萨斯州的流血冲突预示了之后的南北内战的爆发。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forerun, harbinger, herald, prefigure</div>
<h2>adventitious[sound:adventitious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">外来的，后天的：</font>coming from another source and not inherent or innate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Moral considerations are adventitious to the study of art. 道德的考量对于艺术研究来说是不必要的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alien, extraneous, external, foreign, supervenient</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]constitutional, essential, intrinsic, inborn, inbred, innate, inherent 天生的</div>

<h2>affable[sound:affable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">和蔼的，温和的：</font>characterized by ease and friendliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an affable manner  随和的举止</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cordial, genial, hospitable, sociable, good-natured, good-tempered, well-disposed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]irascible, testy, ill-tempered, unamiable, ungenial 易怒的，不随和的</div>
<h2>affinity[sound:affinity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">喜欢，亲切感：</font>a habitual attraction to some activity or thing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]always had an affinity for nurturing living things 喜欢培养活物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bent, penchant, predilection, predisposition, proclivity, propensity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aversion, repugnance, antipathy 厌恶</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">相似：</font>the fact or state of having something in common</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a study showing an affinity between obesity and socioeconomic status 一项表现了肥胖程度和社会经济水平之间相似性的研究</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]association, bearing, kinship</div>
<h2>affluent[sound:affluent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">富裕的：</font>having a generously sufficient and typically increasing supply of material possessions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]affluent society 富裕的社会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]opulent, loaded, deep-pocketed, silk-stocking, well-endowed, well-off, well-to-do</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]needy, impecunious, impoverished, indigent, penurious 贫困的</div>
<h2>aggrandize[sound:aggrandize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">增加、提高力量、财富、地位、声誉等：</font>to enhance the power, wealth, position, or reputation of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]exploited the situation to aggrandize himself 借势而上使得自己地位提升、财富增长</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]augment, boost , expand, magnify, add (to),pump up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]relegate, disparage, efface, abase, demean 降级，贬低</div>
<h2>aggravate[sound:aggravate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">加重，恶化：</font>to make worse, more serious, or more severe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Stress and lack of sleep could aggravate the situation. 压力和睡眠不足使情况恶化。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]complicate, worsen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alleviate, succor, console, assuage, mitigate, relieve 减轻，安慰</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使不爽：</font>to disturb the peace of mind of (someone) especially by repeated disagreeable acts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]it really aggravates me when I arrive 10 minutes  before the stated closing time, and the store's closedalready 我在号称的打烊时间前 10 分钟到达，但发现商店已经关门了，让我很不爽</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annoy, bother, nettle, vex</div>
<h2>aggregate[sound:aggregate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">集合体：</font>a mass or body of units or parts somewhat loosely associated with one another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]An empire is the aggregate of many states under one common head. 帝国是以一个共同领袖领导的若干国家的集合体。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sum, summation, totality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]isolated units 隔离的单位</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">集合，聚集：</font>to collect or gather into a mass or whole</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]aggregates content from many other sites 搜罗集合了其他网站的内容</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coalesce, join together  结合，连接</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]disaggregate v. 分解</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disperse 分散</div>
<h2>aggressive[sound:aggressive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">好斗的：</font>having a quality of anger and determination that makes it ready to attack others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]aggressive behavior 具有攻击性的行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fierce, assaultive, combative, militant, confrontational, go-getting, self-assertive, truculent, pugnacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]even-tempered, nonbelligerent, pacific, uncombative, uncontentious  心平气和的，不好斗的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">强有力的，强烈的：</font>marked by or uttered with forcefulness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an aggressive campaign to win the African-American vote 一次能够获得非裔美国人选票的强有力的竞选</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dynamic, energetic, full-blooded, vigorous</div>
<h2>aggrieve[sound:aggrieve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使苦恼,悲痛：</font>to give pain or trouble to, distress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gratify 使高兴，满足</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]aggrieved adj. 苦恼的，怨念的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a line of aggrieved ticket-holders, demanding a refund for the cancelled play 一队怨念的购票者，为取消的话剧要求退款</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discontent, disgruntled, displeased, dissatisfied, malcontent</div>
<h2>agitate[sound:agitate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">煽动，激起：</font>to attempt to arouse public feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]agitate for better conditions  为得到更好的工作条件而煽动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debate, dispute, bat (around or back and forth), hash (over or out), talk over</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使不安：</font>to excite and often trouble the mind or feelings of  : disturb</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There's no need to agitate the patient about little things. 没必要因为鸡毛蒜皮的事让患者烦躁。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bother, discomfort, discompose, perturb</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, compose, soothe, tranquilize 平息抚慰，淡定</div>
<h2>agog[sound:agog.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极度感兴趣的：</font>showing urgent desire or interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Children were agog over new toys. 孩子们见到了新玩具极其兴奋。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avid, ardent, enthusiastic, solicitous, voracious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathetic, indifferent, uneager, unenthusiastic  漠不关心的，无情的</div>
<h2>agonize[sound:agonize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使非常痛苦：</font>to feel deep sadness or mental pain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]agonizes over every decision 做每一个决定都非常痛苦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anguish, suffer</div>
<h2>airtight[sound:airtight.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无瑕疵的：</font>having no noticeable weakness, flaw , or loophole</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an airtight argument 滴水不漏、无懈可击的论断</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">密封的，不透气的：</font>impermeable to air or nearly so</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an airtight seal 不透气的封口</div>
<h2>alacrity[sound:alacrity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">反应迅速，乐意：</font>promptness in response : cheerful readiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accepted the invitation with alacrity 欣喜地接受了邀请</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amenability, gameness, obligingness, willingness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dilatoriness, hesitance and reluctance 拖延，犹豫和不情愿</div>
<h2>alibi[sound:alibi.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不在场的证明；托辞，借口：</font>an excuse usually intended to avert blame or punishment (as for failureor negligence)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He always has a very creative alibi for undone homework. 他对于不完成作业总是有各种新奇的借口。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defense, justification, plea, reason</div>
<h2>alienate[sound:alienate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">疏远，离间：</font>to make unfriendly, or indifferent especially where attachment formerly existed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]alienated most of his colleagues with his bad temper 因为他的坏脾气，很多同事都和他疏远了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disaffect, disgruntle, sour</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unite, reunite, reconcile 联合，重新联合，和好</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">转移、变卖（财产或权利）：</font>to convey or transfer (as property or a right) usually by a specific actrather than the due course of law</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A landowner has a right to alienate his right of ownership. 地主有权利变卖自己的地产。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assign, cede, deed, make over</div>
<h2>align[sound:align.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">排成一行：</font>to bring into line or alignment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]align the cars with the curb  使车与路缘对齐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]askew, awry, warped 歪斜的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">调准，校准：</font>to adjust to produce a proper relationship or orientation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]align the wheels of the truck 调整卡车的轮子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]improperly adjusted, irregular 调整不当的，不规则的</div>
<h2>allay[sound:allay.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">减轻：</font>to subdue or reduce in intensity or severity, alleviate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]allay one’s fears or doubts 减轻某人的恐惧或怀疑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assuage, ease, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soothe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]excite, aggravate, foment, increase the intensity of, exacerbate 激起，加重</div>
<h2>allegiance[sound:allegiance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">忠诚：</font>devotion or loyalty to a person, group, or cause</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They swore their allegiance to the USA. 他们宣誓效忠美国。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commitment, dedication, piety, faithfulness, steadfastness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconstancy, infidelity, perfidiousness, treachery</div>

<h2>allude[sound:allude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">间接提到：</font>to convey an idea indirectly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He also alluded to his rival's past marital troubles.  他间接提到了对手过去的婚姻问题。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]imply, indicate, infer, insinuate, intimate, suggest</div>
<h2>allure[sound:allure.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">吸引：</font>to attract or delight as if by magic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]entice, seduce, solicit, tempt, captivate, enchant, lead on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]alluring 诱惑的，有吸引力的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an alluring smile 迷人的微笑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unattractive 无吸引力的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">诱惑做某事：</font>to lead away from a usual or proper course by offering some pleasure or advantage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]allured by the promise of big  bucks, he decided to have a go at a job on the trading floor of the stockmarket 被赚大钱的许诺所引诱，他决定投身股票市场工作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bait, beguile, decoy, entice, seduce, lead on</div>
<h2>ally[sound:ally.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n.<font color="#aa00ff">盟友，支持者：</font>one in helpful association with another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]enter the war as an ally of America  以美国的同盟者身份加入战争</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]supporter, confederate, sympathizer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adversary, rival 对手</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">加入联盟：</font>to enter into an alliance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]several tribes allied to fend off the invaders 几个部落联合起来抵抗侵略者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disband 解散</div>
<h2>aloft[sound:aloft.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adv. <font color="#aa00ff">在空中：</font>in the air especially : in flight (as in an airplane)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The balloon stayed aloft for days 气球在空中停留了很多天。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]overhead</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]grounded 着陆地</div>
<h2>aloof[sound:aloof.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">孤高的，不合群的：</font>removed or distant either physically or emotionally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an aloof church  一座孤零零的教堂；  stood apart with aloof dignity 带着超然的尊严站在一旁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]detached, offish, unsociable, withdrawn, standoffish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sociable  好社交的</div>
<h2>altruism[sound:altruism.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">利他主义：</font>unselfish regard for or devotion to the welfare of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Ambition that is masked as altruism. 在利他主义掩盖下的野心。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]egoism 利己主义</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]altruistic adj.利他的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]egotistic, self-centered, self-concerned, selfish  自私的</div>
<h2>amalgamate[sound:amalgamate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">合并，混合：</font>to combine into a unified or integrated whole; unite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to amalgamate with an American company  与一家美国公司合并</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mix, fuse, intermix, compound, meld, comingle, integrate, intermingle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]separate, isolate 分开，隔离</div>
<h2>ambiguous[sound:ambiguous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">有多种理解方式的；不确定的：</font>open to more than one interpretation ；doubtful or uncertain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Students have ambiguous feelings about their role in the world.  学生们为他们在世界中的角色感到迷茫。Frustrated by ambiguous instructions 因为不明确的指示而受挫</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doubtful, equivocal, unclear, uncertain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]distinct, pellucid, patent, blatant, explicit, lucid, perspicuous  清楚的，明显的</div>
<h2>amble[sound:amble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. / n. 漫步，闲逛：to walk slowly or leisurely; stroll</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Every evening, they ambled along the bank.  他们每晚沿河边散步。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ramble, saunter, stroll, wander, dally, dawdle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]step quickly 快走</div>
<h2>ambrosial[sound:ambrosial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（食物或者气味）特别美味的：</font>something extremely pleasing to taste or smell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The ambrosial aroma of the roast stimulated our appetites.  烤肉的美味香气刺激了我们的食欲。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]savory, aromal, aromatic, perfumed, redolent, odorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fetid, noisome, stenchy, malodorous, rancid 恶臭的</div>
<h2>ameliorate[sound:ameliorate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">改善，改进：</font>to make or become better; improve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to ameliorate the suffering of people who have lost their jobs 改善失业人员的痛苦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]improve, convalesce, recuperate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggravate, worsen, deteriorate 恶化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ameliorator n. 改良物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]damper n. 抑制因素</div>
<h2>amenable[sound:amenable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顺从的，服从的：</font>readily brought to yield, submit, or cooperate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a high-spirited and rebellious girl not at all amenable to persuasion. 一个泼辣而反叛的女孩根本不听从劝告。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compliant, docile, submissive, tractable, obedient</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]intransigent,  contumacious 不妥协的；intractable,  recalcitrant,  refractory  倔强的；uncontrollable, ungovernable, unruly  难管束的</div>
<h2>amenity[sound:amenity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（环境，设备等的）舒适，人性化：</font>something that conduces to comfort, convenience, or enjoyment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the amenity of the new surroundings  新环境的宜人之处</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comfort, convenience, affability</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">融洽，和谐：</font>the quality of being pleasant or agreeable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a discussion conducted in perfect amenity  在和谐融洽的气氛中进行的讨论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agreeability, cordiality, harmony, accord, concord, consonance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discordance, inharmony  不和谐</div>
<h2>amiable[sound:amiable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">好脾气的，友好易相处的：</font>being friendly, sociable, and congenial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an amiable teacher not easily annoyed 一个不易惹恼易相处的老师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]friendly, affable, amicable, genial, easy to get along with</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disagreeable, ill-natured, ill-tempered,  unamiable, ungenial, ungracious, unpleasant  坏脾气的，令人不愉快的</div>
<h2>amicable[sound:amicable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">友善的：</font>characterized by friendly goodwill; amiable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]maintain amicable relations 保持友好关系；an amicable divorce  和平离婚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]friendly, affable, amicable, genial, easy to get along with</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]antagonistic, hostile, unfriendly 有敌意的</div>
<h2>amity[sound:amity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n.<font color="#aa00ff">友好,  亲善和睦关系：</font>friendship; especially: friendly relations between nations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]live in amity with his neighbors  与邻居和谐相处；They parted in amity.  他们很友好地分别了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]friendship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enmity, hostility 敌意</div>
<h2>amorphous[sound:amorphous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. 无固定形状的 having no definite form: shapeless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an amorphous cloud mass 一团无定形的云</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]shapeless, unformed, unshaped</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. 不可归类的 being without definite character or nature : unclassifiable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an amorphous segment of society 不可归类的社会阶段</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unclassifiable</div>
<h2>analgesic[sound:analgesic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">镇痛剂：</font>a medication that reduces or eliminates pain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Aspirin is a kind of analgesic. 阿司匹林是一种止痛剂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[同]anesthetic, anodyne</div>
<h2>anarchist[sound:anarchist.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">反抗权威的人：</font>a person who rebels against any authority, established order, or ruling power</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[同]rebel, insurgent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]anarchy n. 混乱  ：a state of lawlessness or political disorder due to the absence of governmental authority</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chaos, disarray, topsy-turviness, commotion, turmoil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]order 有序</div>
<h2>anathema[sound:anathema.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">诅咒：</font>a ban or curse solemnly pronounced by ecclesiastical authority and accompanied byexcommunication</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]curse, execration, imprecation, malediction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benediction, benison, blessing 祝福</div>
<h2>ancillary[sound:ancillary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">次要的：</font>of secondary importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The company hopes to boost its sales through ancillary products. 公司想通过辅助产品来增加销量。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]subordinate, subsidiary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]main  主要的；paramount  最主要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. 辅助的，补充的  : auxiliary, supplementary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the need for ancillary evidence 对补充证据的需要</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some practice in the deft use of words may well be ancillary to the study of natural science. 熟练使用文字的练习对于自然科学的研究也是有帮助的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]auxiliary, supplementary</div>
<h2>anecdote[sound:anecdote.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">短小有趣的故事：</font>a usually short narrative of an interesting, amusing, or biographical incident</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He told us all sorts of humorous anecdotes about his childhood.  他告诉了我们所有关于他童年的奇闻趣事。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is a master raconteur with endless anecdotes. 他是讲故事的超级高手，总有讲不完的奇闻趣事。</div>
<h2>anemic[sound:anemic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏力量、活力、精神的：</font>lacking force, vitality, or spirit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an anemic economic recovery.  毫无活力的经济复苏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Investors are worried about the stock's anemic performance. 投资者担心股市低迷的表现。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sapless, infirm, feeble, decrepit, wan, pale, pallid, effete, lethargic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vigorous, spirited  精力充沛的；forceful 有力量的</div>
<h2>anesthetic[sound:anesthetic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. 止痛剂  : something (as a drug) that relieves pain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The dentist waited until the anesthetic took effect. 牙医等止痛药生效。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]analgesic, anodyne</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无感觉的，麻木的：</font>lacking awareness or sensitivity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be anesthetic to their feelings  对他们的感受麻木不仁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sensate 有感觉的</div>
<h2>animate[sound:animate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">活的：</font>having or showing life</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The lecture was about ancient worship of animate and inanimate objects. 演讲是关于对生命体和非生命体的古代崇拜。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breathing, live, living</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dead, expired, deceased, lifeless, nonliving  无生命的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有活力的：</font>having much high-spirited energy and movement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Animate dance will get the blood pumping. 有活力的舞蹈会让人热血沸腾。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bouncing, brisk, energetic, sprightly, vivacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inactive, lackadaisical, languid, listless, leaden 没有活力的，无精打采的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使有活力，支持：</font>to give spirit and support to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The writer's humor animates the novel. 作者的幽默使小说富有生命力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brace, energize, enliven, invigorate, ginger (up), pep up, vitalize  使有活力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]damp, dampen, deaden 使没活力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]animation  生命力，活力：the quality or condition of being alive, active, spirited, or vigorous.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lassitude, lethargy 疲倦,疲乏</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使行动，驱使：</font>to move to action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a criminal animated by greed  一个受贪婪驱使的罪犯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]goad, prod, spur, galvanize, stimulate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法5】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使活灵活现，使栩栩如生：</font>to make or design in such a way as to create apparently spontaneouslifelike movement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Kongfu Panda's very realistic panda was animated by CG.                                 《功夫熊猫》电影里面的熊猫是通过CG 技术使熊猫变得活灵活现的。</div>
<h2>animus[sound:animus.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">敌意：</font>a usually prejudiced and often spiteful or malevolent ill will, enmity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She felt no animus toward those who had wronged her. 她对那些冤枉了她的人没有敌意。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animosity, antagonism, antipathy, hostility, rancor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]friendliness, amity, amenity 友好</div>
<h2>annoy[sound:annoy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">不断烦扰：</font>to disturb or irritate especially by repeated acts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Mosquitoes annoy us in the summer. 夏天蚊子总是不断烦扰我们。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sound of footsteps on the bare floor annoyed the downstairs neighbors.  楼上地板的脚步声吵得楼下住户心烦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, bother, chafe, gall, grate, irk, nettle, peeve, pique, rile, ruffle, spite, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]soothe, defuse, allay, conciliate, propitiate, mitigate, assuage, appease, pacify, placate, calm, settle, subdue, solace, mollify 平息，抚慰</div>
<h2>annul[sound:annul.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">宣告无效，取消：</font>to declare or make legally invalid or void</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The marriage was annulled last month.  婚约上个月取消了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disannul, cancel, invalidate, abrogate, nullify, repeal, rescind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]make legal 使合法；enact  制定</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. 抵消  to balance with an equal force so as to make ineffective</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Unfortunately, his arrogant attitude annuls the many generous favors he does for people.  不幸的是，他傲慢的态度抵消了他之前对人民的慷慨恩惠。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]counterbalance, neutralize</div>
<h2>anomalous[sound:anomalous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. 不普通的，不平常的  being out of the ordinary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is in an anomalous position as the only part-time teacher in XDF.  他和别人不一样的是，他是 XDF 唯一的兼职老师。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aberrant, abnormal, atypical, phenomenal, singular, uncustomary, unwonted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unexceptional, unextraordinary  普通的，平常的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]anomaly n. 反常  deviation or departure from the normal or common order, form, or rule.</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. 反常的，不正常的 departing from some accepted standard of what is normal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an anomalous burst of anger from this usually easygoing person 一个随和的人的一反常态的暴怒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]natural  自然的；standard  标准的</div>
<h2>anonymous[sound:anonymous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">匿名的：</font>not named or identified</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He made an anonymous phone call to the police. 他给警察打了一个匿名电话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The donor wishes to remain anonymous. 捐赠者希望保持匿名身份。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incognito, innominate, unnamed, unidentified, untitled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dubbed, named, termed  有名字的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. 无特色的  lacking individuality, distinction, or recognizability</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the anonymous faces in the crowd 大众脸</div>
<h2>antagonize[sound:antagonize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">敌对,反对：</font>to act in opposition to : counteract</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He did not mean to antagonize you. 他并没有要反对你。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]antagonize a bill  反对一项议案</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]counteract, disagree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agree, concede, grant  同意；win over  使某人同意</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激起敌意：</font>to incur or provoke the hostility of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His remark antagonized his friends.  他的评述激怒了他的朋友。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, exasperate, gall, inflame, nettle, provoke, peeve, pique, irritate, rile, roil, chafe, grate, ruffle,vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]soothe, defuse, allay, conciliate, propitiate, mitigate, assuage, appease, pacify, placate, calm, settle, subdue, solace, mollify 平息，抚慰</div>
<h2>antediluvian[sound:antediluvian.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常古老的，过时的：</font>extremely old and antiquated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He has antediluvian notions about the role of women in the workplace.  他对职场女性抱有老掉牙的看法。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an antediluvian automobile  古董级的汽车</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aged, age-old, prehistoric, antique, aged, immemorial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]modern, new, recent  新的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">保守的人：</font>a person with old-fashioned ideas</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an antediluvian who thought a woman without talent is virtuous  一个认为“女子无才便是德”的保守的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reactionary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]modern, trendy  潮人</div>
<h2>anterior[sound:anterior.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">前面的：</font>coming before in time or development</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]finish the work anterior to the schedule  提早完成任务</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tests anterior to the college entrance examination 高考前的考试</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antecedent, foregoing, former, forward, precedent, preceding, prior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]after, ensuing, following, posterior, subsequent, succeeding  后面的，后来的</div>
<h2>antic[sound:antic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">滑稽可笑的：</font>characterized by clownish extravagance or absurdity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The clown came on with many antic gestures. 小丑上场表演许多滑稽动作。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chucklesome, comedic, comic, droll, farcical, laughable, ludicrous, hilarious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humorless, unamusing, uncomic, unfunny, unhumorous  不好笑的 grave  庄重的；serious, solemn, somber严肃的</div>
<h2>apathy[sound:apathy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">冷漠，缺乏情感：</font>lack of feeling or emotion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]People have shown surprising apathy toward these important social problems. 人们对于这些重要的社会问题显示出了令人惊讶的冷漠。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectlessness, emotionlessness, impassiveness, impassivity, insensibility, numbness, phlegm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]emotion, feeling, sensibility 有感情</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏兴趣，不关心：</font>lack of interest or concern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She heard the story with apathy. 她毫无兴趣的听完了这个故事。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her poor grades are proof enough of her apathy concerning all matters academic.  她可怜的分数足以证明他对所有学术问题都没兴趣。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disinterestedness, disregard, incuriosity, insouciance, nonchalance, unconcern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concern, interest, regard  关心，有兴趣，在意</div>
<h2>aphorism[sound:aphorism.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">短小有智慧的格言：</font>a short witty sentence which expresses a general truth or comment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]When decorating, remember the familiar aphorism, “less is more.”  装修时需要记住的一句格言是“少即是多”。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adage, epigram, maxim, proverb</div>
<h2>apocalyptic[sound:apocalyptic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">预言的，启示的：</font>of a revelatory or prophetic nature</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]No one listened to her apocalyptic predictions. 没有人听她的预言。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]prophetic, predictive, prognostic, farsighted</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. 重要的，转折点的  of, relating to, or being a major turning point</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the apocalyptic Battle of Stalingrad leading to the ultimate defeat of Nazi Germany  具有转折点意义的斯大林格勒战役导致了最后纳粹德国的战败</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]trivial, petty, minor, immaterial, inconsequential, insignificant 不重要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. 夸大的  wildly unrestrained : grandiose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]apocalyptic tone 夸大的语气</div>
<h2>apocryphal[sound:apocryphal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">假的：</font>of doubtful authenticity : spurious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an apocryphal story about the president's childhood 一个假的关于总统童年的故事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]spurious, unauthentic, ungenuine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]factual, true, truthful, authentic 真的</div>
<h2>apoplectic[sound:apoplectic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极度愤怒的：</font>extremely angry; furious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He became apoplectic about wasteful government spending. 他对于政府的浪费开销变得怒不可遏。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The coach was so apoplectic when the  player missed the free throw that he threw his clipboard onto thecourt. 教练对球员罚篮不进非常气愤以至于把战术板扔到了球场上。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choleric, enraged, furious, incensed, indignant, infuriated, irate, ireful, outraged</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]angerless, delighted, pleased  不生气的，高兴的</div>
<h2>apostasy[sound:apostasy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">放弃宗教信仰：</font>renunciation of a religious faith</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some people completely abandon the faith after apostasy. 有些人在放弃自己的宗教信仰后就再也不相信任何其他宗教信仰了。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">变节，背叛：</font>abandonment of a previous loyalty : defection</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was looked down upon for apostasy. 他因为背叛而受到鄙视。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defection, perfidy, treacherousness, recreancy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fidelity, allegiance, loyalty, piety  忠诚，虔诚</div>
<h2>appall[sound:appall.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使惊恐：</font>to overcome with consternation, shock, or dismay</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He felt appalled by the whole idea of marriage so we broke up.  结婚使他恐惧，因此我们分手了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dismay, terrify, intimidate, frighten, horrify, daunt, deter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]embolden, encourage, nerve 使大胆，鼓起勇气</div>
