<h2>appeal[sound:appeal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">申请：</font>an application (as to a recognized authority) for corroboration, vindication, or decision</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A piteous appeal for help. 虔诚的请求帮助。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to make an appeal to the public to donate needed blood 向公众提出献血请求</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjuration, conjuration, entreaty, petition, pleading, supplication</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. 起诉 to charge with a crime : accuse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My lawyer said the court's decision wasn't correct and that we should file for an appeal.  我的律师说法庭的判决不对我们应该起诉。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charge, accuse, incriminate, inculpate, indict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absolve  赦免；exonerate, exculpate  开脱免罪；vindicate  辩护</div>
<h2>appealing[sound:appealing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. 吸引人的  attractive, inviting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The large salary made Goldman Sachs’s offer more appealing to him. 高薪使高盛的工作对他更有吸引力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alluring, captivating, charismatic, charming, enchanting, engaging, entrancing, luring, seductive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]repellent, repelling, repugnant, repulsive, unalluring 令人厌恶的，不吸引人的</div>
<h2>applause[sound:applause.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">鼓掌，认可：</font>approval publicly expressed (as by clapping the hands)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her appearance was greeted with applause. 她的表现赢得了认可。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acclamation, cheer, cheering, ovation, plaudit, rave</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hissing, booing  发出嘘声</div>
<h2>apposite[sound:apposite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. 相关的，合适的 highly pertinent or appropriate: apt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to enrich his essay with some very apposite quotations from famous people  用名人名言来丰富他的文章</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appliacable, apropos, germane, pointed, relative, relevant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extraneous, irrelevant, impertinent, irrelative, pointless 无关的</div>
<h2>appreciable[sound:appreciable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可感知的,明显的：</font>capable of being perceived or measured; perceptible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the appreciable changes in temperature  气温明显的变化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There doesn't seem to be any appreciable difference between this piece and that one. 这个和那个看上去没什么差别。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprehensible, perceptible, detectable, discernible, palpable, distinguishable, sensible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impalpable, imperceptible, inappreciable, indistinguishable, insensible, undetectable  不能感知的</div>
<h2>apprehension[sound:apprehension.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">忧虑，恐惧：</font>suspicion or fear especially of future evil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She had a strong apprehension about her sister's health  她非常担心她姐姐的健康。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dread, foreboding, misgiving, anxiousness, unease, uneasiness, worry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]composure, equanimity  镇定；unconcern  冷漠</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">逮捕：</font>seizure by legal process : arrestment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]apprehension of the thief  逮捕小偷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arrest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discharge  释放</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">理解：</font>the knowledge gained from the process of coming to know or understand something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a good apprehension of how computer systems work 对计算机是如何工作的有很好的理解</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]understanding, comprehension</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]incomprehension</div>
<h2>apprise[sound:apprise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">通知，告知：</font>to give notice to; inform</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]apprise him of the danger that may be involved  告知他可能涉及的危险</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inform, acquaint, make known to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]withhold information 隐瞒信息</div>
<h2>approbation[sound:approbation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">同意：</font>an expression of warm approval</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The proposal met his approbation. 这项建议得到了他的同意。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]approval, favor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disapproval, disapprobation, disfavor 不同意</div>
<h2>appropriate[sound:appropriate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. 私自挪用 to take possession of or make use of exclusively for oneself, often without permission</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to appropriate private property  盗用私人财产</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The economy has been weakened by corrupt officials who have appropriated the country's resources fortheir own use.  经济因为腐败的官员们私自挪用国家资源而被削弱了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]purloin, pirate, embezzle, peculate, usurp</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">适当的：</font>especially suitable or compatible: fitting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Red wine is a more appropriate choice with the meal. 红酒更适合这顿饭。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I don't think jeans and a T-shirt are appropriate attire for a wedding.  我觉得穿牛仔和 T 恤去婚礼不太得体。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apt, becoming, felicitous, fitting, proper, meet, suitable, apposite, apropos</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]improper, inapposite, inappropriate, inapt, unmeet, unseemly, unsuitable 不合适的</div>
<h2>apropos[sound:apropos.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">相关的：</font>being both relevant and opportune</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The actor announced to reporters that he would only answer to apropos questions about the movie.  演员向记者表示，他只回答那些和电影有关的问题。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appliacable, apropos, germane, pointed, relative, relevant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extraneous, irrelevant, impertinent, irrelative, pointless 无关的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】prep.  <font color="#aa00ff">关于，有关：</font>having to do with</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to make a number of telling observations apropos the current political situation  做了很多关于当前政治形势有力的观察</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apropos, apropos of, as far as, as for, as regards (also as respects), as to, concerning, of, on, regarding, respecting, touching, toward (or towards)</div>
<h2>apt[sound:apt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">恰当的,合适的：</font>exactly suitable; appropriate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]apt remark/ choice/ description  恰当的评述、选择、描述</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apropos, germane, relative, relevant, appropirate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extraneous, irrelevant, impertinent, irrelative 无关的；inappropriate, improper, unseemly  不恰当的，不合时宜的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有…倾向的，可能的：</font>having a tendency : likely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is apt to fly out in rage.  他容易发脾气。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]likely, inclined, tending, given</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unlikely  不可能的；disinclined  没有…倾向的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. 聪明的 keenly intelligent and responsive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an apt pupil  一个聪明的小学生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is apt at mathematics.  他擅长数学。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brilliant, clever, quick-witted, ready-witted, smart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]foolish, dull, dumb, stupid, unintelligent  傻的</div>
<h2>archaic[sound:archaic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过时的，久远的：</font>no longer current or applicable; antiquated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]archaic laws  过时的法律</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antiquated, outdated, outmoded, prehistoric, superannuated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fashionable  流行的；up-to-date, fresh, modern, new, novel  新的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]archaism  古语：the use of archaic diction or style</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]modern diction 新语</div>
<h2>archetype[sound:archetype.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n.<font color="#aa00ff">典范，榜样：</font>an ideal example of a type</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an archetype of the successful entrepreneur  成功企业家的典范</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ideal, a perfect example, quintessence</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n.<font color="#aa00ff">先驱，鼻祖：</font>something belonging to an earlier time from which something else was later developed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The abacus is sometimes cited as the archetype of the modern digital calculator 算盘是现代计算器的鼻祖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antecedent, foregoer, forerunner, precursor, predecessor, prototype</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">原型：</font>something from which copies are made</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]“‘Frankenstein’ . . . ‘Dracula’ . . . ‘Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde’ . . . the archetypes that have influenced allsubsequent horror stories”(New York Times)“‘弗兰肯斯坦’…‘德秋拉’…‘杰基尔博士和海德先生’影响了所有继之而来的恐怖故事的原型”(纽约时报)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]archetype, prototype</div>
<h2>ardor[sound:ardor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">狂热：</font>strong enthusiasm or devotion; zeal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His ardor was damped. 他的热情被泼了冷水。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avidity, zeal, fervor, fervency, fervidness, passion, passionateness, vehemence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathy, torpor, impassivity, insensitivity  冷漠，麻木</div>
<h2>arduous[sound:arduous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难以做到，费劲的：</font>hard to accomplish or achieve: difficult</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a long and arduous undertaking  一项长期艰苦的任务</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an arduous journey across miles of desert  艰苦的沙漠之旅</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grueling, laborious, taxing, onerous, burdensome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easy, simple, unchallenging, undemanding, facile, effortless 不费劲的</div>
<h2>argot[sound:argot.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">隐语，黑话，行话：</font>a specialized vocabulary or set of idioms used by a particular group</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]groups communicating in their own secret argots  用他们秘密的行话交流的团体</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]argot, cant, jargon, shoptalk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]standard language  标准的语言；common verbalism 大众的言语</div>
<h2>arrest[sound:arrest.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使不活跃：</font>to make inactive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]arrest the growth of the tumor  抑制肿瘤生长</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]check, rein, curb, contain, hamper, thwart, bring to a halt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vitalize, activate, animate, invigorate  使有生气；prod, goad, spur, galvanize, provoke, stimulate  刺激</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n/v. 停止：the stopping of a process or activity; to bring to a standstill</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Science cannot yet arrest the process of aging. 科学不能阻止衰老。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cease,  cessation,  closure,  conclusion,  discontinuance,  discontinuation,  ending,  halt,  stop,  termination;check, stop</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continuance, continuation  继续</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">逮捕：</font>to take or keep under one's control by authority of law</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was charged with resisting arrest.  她因为拘捕受到起诉。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprehend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discharge  释放</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">吸引注意力：</font>to hold the attention of as if by a spell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The behavior of the daredevil arrested pedestrians.  冒失鬼的行为吸引了行人们的注意力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enchant, fascinate, bedazzle, grip, hypnotize, mesmerize</div>
<h2>arresting[sound:arresting.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">吸引人的：</font>attracting and holding the attention; striking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an arresting spectacle 吸引人的奇观</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, enthralling, fascinating, gripping, immersing, intriguing, riveting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]boring, drab, tedious, monotonous, uninteresting  乏味的，单调的</div>
<h2>arrhythmic[sound:arrhythmic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不规律的：</font>lacking rhythm or regularity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]arrhythmic pulse  不规律的脉搏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]irregular, disorderly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]regular, orderly 规律的</div>
<h2>arrogance[sound:arrogance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n ．傲慢，自大：overbearing pride</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her arrogance has earned her a lot of enemies. 她的傲慢给她带来了很多敌人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assumption, bumptiousness, haughtiness, hauteur, imperiousness, loftiness, peremptoriness, pomposity,pompousness, presumptuousness, superciliousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humility, modesty, humbleness, unassumingness  谦虚</div>
<h2>articulate[sound:articulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">清晰地表达：</font>to utter clearly and distinctly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He cannot articulate his thoughts.  他不能清楚地表达他的想法。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a theory first articulated by ancient philosophers 被古时哲学家阐明的理论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enunciate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]murmur, mumble, mutter, slur  模糊地说</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">表达清晰的：</font>able to express oneself clearly and well</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The television crew covering the science fair were looking for photogenic and articulate students to explaintheir projects on the air</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]eloquent, fluent, silver-tongued, well-spoken</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inarticulate, ineloquent, unvocal  表达不清楚的</div>
<h2>ascendant[sound:ascendant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有影响力的，主宰的：</font>dominant in position or influence; superior.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This idea was in the ascendant. 这种思想处于主导地位。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]superior, dominant, sovereign</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]having no influence/ power  没有影响力的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">上升的：</font>moving upward : rising</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The teacher told the students to write even numbers in ascendant order. 老师让学生们按升序写出偶数。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]declining 下降的</div>
<h2>ascetic[sound:ascetic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">禁欲的：</font>practicing strict self-denial as a measure of personal and especially spiritual discipline</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This is an ascetic diet of rice and beans. 这是一顿禁欲的隐私，只有米饭和豌豆。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstemious, abstinent, self-denying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sumptuous, luxurious  奢侈的；licentious, sybaritic, voluptuous  放荡的，沉溺于酒色的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">禁欲者：</font>a person who renounces material comforts and leads a life of austere self-discipline,especially as an act of religious devotion.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We normally see an ascetic meditating in a Yogic pose.  我们通常会看见一个苦行者以瑜伽的姿势来冥想。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]stoic, spartan</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sybarite, hedonist, voluptuary 奢侈逸乐的，人享乐主义者，酒色之徒</div>
<h2>aseptic[sound:aseptic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">消毒的，无菌的：</font>preventing infection</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Surgery must be in aseptic environments. 手术必须处在无菌环境下</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sterile, germfree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]germy, unsterile  有细菌的；contaminated, tainted  被污染的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏活力的：</font>lacking vitality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inactive, lackadaisical, languid, listless, spiritless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]active, animated, energetic, energetic, vivacious  有活力的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冷漠的：</font>emotion, or warmth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]aseptic essays  没有感情的文章；an aseptic smile  漠然的微笑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectlessness, emotionlessness, impassiveness, impassivity, insensibility, numbness, phlegm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]emotion, feeling, sensibility 有感情</div>
<h2>askew[sound:askew.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不成直线，歪的：</font>out of line, awry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The picture hung askew.  画挂歪了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His tie was askew.  他的领带歪了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crooked, cockeyed, oblique, lopsided, skewed, aslant, slanted, slanting, listing, tilted, awry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aligned  列成一行的；straight, erect  直的</div>
<h2>aspect[sound:aspect.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">外表，容貌：</font>appearance to the eye or mind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His face had a frightening aspect.  他的脸很吓人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appearance, look, figure, presence, mien</div>
<h2>asperity[sound:asperity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（举止、性情）粗暴：</font>roughness of manner or of temper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She responded with such asperity that we knew she was offended by the question. 她如此粗鲁的回答问题以至于我们知道这个问题冒犯到了她。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]roughness, crudity, rudeness, poignancy, harshness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]softness, mildness 脾气好</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（环境）艰苦：</font>rigor, severity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He has encountered more than his share of asperities on the road to success.  在成功的道路上他已经遇到过比他应该承受的更多的艰辛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]severity, hardness, hardship, rigor</div>
<h2>aspersion[sound:aspersion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">诽谤，中伤：</font>a false or misleading charge meant to harm someone's reputation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cast aspersions on my loyalty  诽谤我的忠诚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defamation, besmirchment, calumny, calumniation, maligning, obloquy, vilification</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]glowing tribute, eulogy, extolling, laudation, praise, commendation, compliment  热情赞赏，表扬；flattery, adulation 拍马屁</div>
<h2>aspirant[sound:aspirant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">有抱负者,  有野心者：</font>one who aspires, as to advancement, honors, or a high position</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a bevy of ever-smiling aspirants for the Miss America title  一群想当美国小姐的少女</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Envy can make oneself backward, self-confidence can tells him to be a aspirant. 妒忌能使自己落后，自信能使自己上进。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]seeker</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]noncandidate  非候选人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">想成为…的：</font>seeking to attain a desired position or status</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The pilot was an aspirant astronaut. 这个飞行员想成为航天员。</div>
<h2>assent[sound:assent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">同意：</font>to agree to something especially after thoughtful consideration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The general proposed a detailed plan and the president assented. 将军提出了一个细节化的计划，总统同意了该计划。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accede, agree, assent, consent, subscribe, come round</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dissent, disagree  不同意</div>
<h2>assert[sound:assert.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">断言，肯定地说出：</font>to state or declare positively and often forcefully or aggressively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]asserted one’s innocence.坚称自己无罪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He asserted that there were corrupt officials in the government.  他断言道政府里面一定存在腐败的官员。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aver, allege, avow, avouch, insist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deny, gainsay  否认</div>
<h2>assertive[sound:assertive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">武断的，强烈自信的：</font>inclined to bold or confident assertion; aggressively self-assured.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You will have to make many personal judgments when being assertive. 当武断的时候你不得不做出很多个人选择。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assertory, self-assured, self-assertive, peremptory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diffident  不自信的</div>
<h2>assess[sound:assess.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">评估重要性、尺寸、价值等：</font>to determine the importance, size, or value of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We need to assess whether or not the system is working. 我们需要评估这个系统是否工作。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Damage to the boat was assessed at $5,000. 船的损失是$5,000 。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]evaluate, appraise, guesstimate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">征收费用（如罚款）：</font>to establish or apply as a charge or penalty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The utility company will assess a fee if your payment is late.  如果你付款晚了，公共事业公司会罚款。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assess, charge, exact, fine, lay, levy, put</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]remit  免除（债务）</div>
<h2>assiduous[sound:assiduous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">勤勉的，专心仔细的：</font>marked by careful unremitting attention or persistent application; busy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tended his garden with assiduous attention  专心仔细地照看他的花园</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The project required some assiduous planning. 项目需要细心的规划。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diligent, industrious, sedulous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]idle, inactive, unbusy, unemployed, unoccupied  空闲的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]assiduity n. 勤勉：persistent application or diligence; unflagging effort.</div>
<h2>assuage[sound:assuage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">缓和，减轻：</font>to lessen the intensity of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He couldn't assuage his guilt over the divorce. 他无法减轻自己在离婚中的罪行。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggravate, exacerbate 加强，恶化</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">平息，抚慰：</font>to pacify or calm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Life contains sorrows that cannot be assuaged, and it is important to be honest in acknowledging this. 生活中存在着无法平息的悲伤，诚实地承认这个事实才是重要的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compose,  soothe,  calm,  pacify,  placate,  appease,  lighten,  relieve,  alleviate,  assuage,  allay,  mitigate,moderate, conciliate, propitiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggravate, annoy, enrage, exasperate, incense, infuriate, ire, irk, irritate, madden, nettle, peeve, provoke, rile, roil, vex  煽动，激起</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使满足：</font>to put an end to by satisfying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]assuage his thirst  消渴</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That meal certainly assuaged my hunger. 那顿大餐满足了我的口腹之欲。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]satisfy, sate, satiate, quench</div>
<h2>astounding[sound:astounding.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人吃惊的，出乎意料的：</font>causing astonishment or amazement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The richness and variety of the undersea environment are astounding．富饶而多样的海底环境是令人惊奇的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amazing, astonishing, blindsiding, dumbfounding, shocking, startling, stunning, stupefying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unsurprising  平常的</div>
<h2>astute[sound:astute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">机敏的，有洞察力的：</font>having or showing shrewdness and perspicacity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Astute salesmen know how to invest emotionally. 精明的推销员知道如何进行感情投资。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]canny, smart, shrewd, perspicacious, clear-eyed, clear-sighted, savvy, hardheaded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unknowing  无知的</div>
<h2>asunder[sound:asunder.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adv. <font color="#aa00ff">分离成多部分或多片：</font>into separate parts or pieces</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]broken asunder  打碎</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Buildings were burst asunder. 建筑物已经被炸成碎片了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]piecemeal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]in a piece  完整一片；together  在一起</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adv. <font color="#aa00ff">分离：</font>apart from each other in position</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A quite conscience sleeps in thunder,  but rest and guilt live far asunder. 平静的良心能在雷声中入睡，而安宁和负罪则无法毗邻。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Our opinions are wide as the poles asunder.  我们的意见完全相反。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]together  在一起</div>
<h2>asylum[sound:asylum.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">收容所/  保护所：</font>an inviolable place of refuge and protection giving shelter to criminals and debtors/something (as a building) that offers cover from the weather or protection from danger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an insane asylum 疯人院</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The embassy serves as an asylum for that country's nationals in need of help.  大使馆作为那国需要帮助的公民的保护所。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]harbor, haven, refuge, sanctuary, sanctum</div>
<h2>asymmetrical[sound:asymmetrical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不平衡的,不对称的：</font>having no balance or symmetry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the asymmetrical construction  非对称的建筑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asymmetric, nonsymmetrical, unsymmetrical, unbalanced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]symmetrical  对称的；balanced  平衡的</div>
<h2>atone[sound:atone.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">赎罪，弥补：</font>to make amends, as for a sin or fault</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Blood must atone for blood. 以命抵命。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Even death cannot atone for the offence. 罪不容诛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]redeem</div>
<h2>atrocious[sound:atrocious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极坏的,  极其残忍的：</font>extremely wicked, brutal, or cruel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Murder is an atrocious crime. 犯罪是一种极其恶劣的犯罪活动。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]heinous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benign, kind, kindhearted, benignant, good-hearted, humane, sympathetic, tenderhearted  善良的，好的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. 让人极为不满意的  extremely unsatisfactory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The service on plane was atrocious.  飞机上的服务让人极为不满意。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]satisfactory  令人满意的；  wonderful  精彩的，极好的</div>
<h2>attenuate[sound:attenuate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使降低（数量，力量，价值）：</font>to lessen the amount, force, magnitude, or value of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an investment attenuated by inflation 一份因通货膨胀而贬值的投资.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheapen, devalue, downgrade, reduce, write down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appreciate, enhance, upgrade, mark up 升值，提升</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]attenuation n. 弱化，贬值</div>
<h2>audacious[sound:audacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大胆的，（但往往）愚勇的：</font>fearlessly, often recklessly daring; bold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an audacious plan  一个冒进的计划</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bold, adventurous, brash, brassy, brazen, rash, reckless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cautious, circumspect, guarded, wary 小心谨慎的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">蔑视（法律、礼节）的，无礼的：</font>contemptuous of law, religion, or decorum</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impertinent, impudent, insolent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]timid, meek 温顺的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">乐于冒险的：</font>inclined or willing to take risks</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]audacious adventurers risking everything they had for a shot at glory 为了荣誉而孤注一掷的冒险家们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]daring, emboldened, enterprising, nervy, venturesome</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大胆创新的：</font>marked by originality and verve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an audacious interpretation of two dramas 对两部戏剧的创造性阐述</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]audacity n. 胆量，不敬</div>
<h2>augur[sound:augur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">预言家：</font>one who predicts future events or developments</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The ancient Roman augurs predicted the future by reading the flight of birds. 古罗马的预言家们通过鸟类的航线来预测未来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forecaster, foreseer, diviner, foreteller, prophesier, visionary</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">出现好兆头：</font>to show signs of a favorable or successful outcome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This augurs well for us. 这是一个好兆头</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forebode, promise</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">预言：</font>to tell of or describe beforehand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The fortune-teller augured nothing but a series of calamities for me. 占卜人预言在我身上将会有一系列大灾难发生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forecast, predict, presage, prognosticate, prophesy</div>
<h2>authentic[sound:authentic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">真实的，非仿造的：</font>being exactly as appears or as claimed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]found an authentic Native American arrowhead 发现了一支美洲土著的箭头</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bona fide, certified, genuine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bogus, counterfeit, fake, mock, phony, spurious 伪造的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">准确的，相符合的：</font>following an original exactly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an authentic reconstruction of the Parthenon 帕台农神殿的准确复刻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accurate, exact, precise, right, veracious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]corrupt, false 错误的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]authenticity n. 真实，真实性</div>
<h2>authority[sound:authority.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（某领域的）权威人士：</font>a person with a high level of knowledge or skill in a field</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a leading authority on neural anatomy 一名神经解剖学领域的权威人士</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]expert, connoisseur, maestro, master, virtuoso</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amateur 业余爱好者 inexpert 非专家</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">管辖权，控制：</font>lawful control over the affairs of a political unit (as a nation)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sheriff had authority over the whole county. 郡守对于整个郡都有管辖权</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]administration, governance, regime, regimen</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">影响力：</font>the power to direct the thinking or behavior of others usually indirectly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He speaks with a persuasive authority on matters of public health. 他就公共健康事务发表了带有影响力的、令人信服的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clout, credit, leverage, weight</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（管束他人的）权力：</font>the right or means to command or control others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]By the authority vested in me, I now pronounce you married. 依我所拥有的权力，我宣布你们成为夫妻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arm, command, control, dominion, reign</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impotence, powerlessness 无权力</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法5】n. <font color="#aa00ff">根据，理由：</font>a warrant for action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]On what authority do you make such a claim  你的指控有何理由？</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grounds, justification</div>
<h2>autocracy[sound:autocracy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】n. <font color="#aa00ff">独裁政府：</font>government in which a person possesses unlimited power</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It signified the British rejection of autocracy by constituting the first formal restraining of the power of themonarch 英国对于独裁体制的反抗表现在它对君王权力进行的正式约束</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absolutism, dictatorship, totalitarianism, tyranny</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]democracy 民主，民主制度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]autocratic adj. 独裁的</div>
<h2>autonomy[sound:autonomy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">政治上的独立：</font>the quality or state of being self-governing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The province has been granted autonomy. 这个省份被授予了自治权</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]self-governance, sovereignty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dependence, subjection 附属，依赖</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">自我主导的自由，尤其是精神独立：</font>self-directing freedom and especially moral independence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a teacher who encourages individual autonomy 一个鼓励精神独立的老师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]independence, liberty, free will</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]constraint, duress 限制</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]autonomous adj. 自治的</div>
<h2>avarice[sound:avarice.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】n. <font color="#aa00ff">贪财，贪婪：</font>excessive or insatiable desire for wealth or gain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The bank official's embezzlement was motivated by pure avarice. 银行官员盗用公款纯粹是出于贪婪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquisitiveness, avidity, covetousness, cupidity, greediness, rapacity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]generosity, magnanimity 慷慨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]avaricious adj. 贪婪的</div>
<h2>aver[sound:aver.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">声称为真：</font>to state as a fact usually forcefully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]was tearfully averring his innocence 涕泪俱下地声明他的清白</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allege, assert, avouch, avow, declare, purport, warrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deny, gainsay  否认</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（态度强硬而明确地）声明：</font>to state clearly and strongly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She averred that she didn't need any help choosing her own clothes. 她态度强硬地声明：在买衣服的问题上不需要别人指手画脚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affirm, insist, maintain, profess</div>
<h2>aversion[sound:aversion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">非常讨厌，极厌恶：</font>a dislike so strong as to cause stomach upset or queasiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a natural aversion toward insects 天生对昆虫的反感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]distaste, horror, loathing, nausea, repugnance, repulsion, revulsion</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">令人厌恶的事物：</font>something or someone that is hated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Clichés should be the aversion of every good writer. 陈词滥调应该是让每个优秀的作家都感到厌恶的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abhorrence, abomination, antipathy, detestation, execration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]love 令人喜爱的事物</div>
<h2>avid[sound:avid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">急切渴望的：</font>marked by keen interest and enthusiasm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]avid movie fans 急切的影迷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agog, ardent, eager, keen, impatient, thirsty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathetic, indifferent 不在乎的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贪婪（钱财）的：</font>having or marked by an eager and often selfish desire especially for materialpossessions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She stared at the jewels with an avid glint in his eye. 她带着贪婪的目光注视着那些珠宝</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquisitive, avaricious, covetous, greedy, rapacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]avidity n. 贪婪</div>
<h2>awash[sound:awash.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">被淹没的：</font>containing, covered with, or thoroughly penetrated by water</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The streets were awash from the heavy rains. 街道因为大雨被水淹没了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doused, drenched, saturated, sodden, soggy, soaked, afloat</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dry, arid, dehydrated, drained 干燥的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（如洪水般）泛滥的：</font>filled, covered, or completely overrun as if by a flood</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The program is currently awash in submissions and will not be accepting any more until next term. 该项目的申请人数过多，因此下一轮之前不会再接受任何申请</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abounding, abundant, flush, fraught, replete, swarming, teeming, thronging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dearth, insufficient, scant 匮乏的</div>
<h2>awe[sound:awe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】n./v. 敬畏：an emotion variously combining dread, veneration, and wonder that is inspired by authorityor by the sacred or sublime</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She gazed in awe at the great stone. 她敬畏地凝视着那块巨石</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]admiration, reverence, respect, veneration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]irreverence, insolence, scorn, superciliousness 蔑视，不敬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]awesome adj. 令人敬畏的</div>
<h2>awkward[sound:awkward.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏灵活性和技巧的：</font>lacking dexterity or skill</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]awkward with a needle and thread 缺乏灵巧的针线活技术</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]handless, maladroit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adroit, deft, dexterous, proficient, skilled 灵巧的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（处理问题）缺乏手段和智谋的：</font>showing or marked by a lack of skill and tact (as in dealing witha situation)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her awkward handling of the seating arrangements resulted in many hurt feelings. 她那缺乏智谋的座次安排伤害了许多人的感情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]botched, bungling, fumbled, inept, inexpert, maladroit</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">臃肿笨拙的，不优雅的：</font>lacking ease or grace (as of movement or expression)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an awkward design 一份粗劣的设计</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clumsy, gauche, graceless, gawkish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elegant, graceful, polished, lithe, coordinated  优雅的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人尴尬的：</font>causing embarrassment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the awkward situation of having to listen as your host and hostess quarrel loudly in the next room 不得不听着你的主人和她太太在隔壁大声争吵的尴尬境地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discomfiting, disturbing, disconcerting, embarrassing, flustering</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法5】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（因过大过重或设计问题）难以操作的：</font>difficult to use or operate especially because of size,weight, or design</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The manual can opener is too awkward to hold. 那个手动启瓶器太难握了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ponderous, ungainly, unhandy, unwieldy, bunglesome, cranky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]handy 容易操纵的</div>
<h2>awning[sound:awning.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】n. <font color="#aa00ff">雨篷，遮阳篷：</font>a piece of material attached to a caravan or building which provides shelter from therain or sun</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]stayed under the awning outside the Starbucks during the rainstorm  在星巴克外面的遮阳棚里躲雨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]awning, ceiling, cover, roof, tent</div>
<h2>awry[sound:awry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">弯曲或扭曲的：</font>in a turned or twisted position or direction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her sunglass is awry. 她墨镜戴歪了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]askew, aslant, lopsided, slanted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aligned, direct, even, straight 成行的，笔直的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj./adv. 走样的（地），出差错的（地）：off the correct or expected course</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Operation Redwing was initially launched by US special-operation troops in hopes of capturing or killing a Taliban leader but went awry. 由美军特种部队发起、代号为“红翼”的军事行动的起初目的是捕获或击杀一名塔利班头目，然而行动在执行过程中出现了差错</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amiss, aside, astray, erroneous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]right, well 无差错的</div>
<h2>axiomatic[sound:axiomatic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">公理的：</font>based on or involving an axiom or system of axioms</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Euclidean geometry is based on five axiomatic principles. 欧几里得几何学是在五条公理的基础上建立的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dictum, fundamental, maxim</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不言自明的：</font>taken for granted, self-evident</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an axiomatic truth  一个不言而明的真理</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]self-evident, prima facie</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]controversial 有争议的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]axiom n. 公理</div>
<h2>babble[sound:babble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">发出含糊无意义的嘟囔声，胡乱说：</font>to utter a meaningless confusion of words or sounds</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Babies babble before they can talk. 婴儿在会说话以前含糊不清地发音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drivel, gabble, gibber, jabber, prattle, abracadabra</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]articulate  清晰地说出</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">闲聊：</font>to engage in casual or rambling conversation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The little girls babbled contentedly for the whole ride home.  两个小姑娘在回家的路上高兴地闲聊</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chatter, prate</div>
<h2>backhanded[sound:backhanded.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">间接的，含沙射影的,  虚情假意的：</font>indirect, devious, especially sarcastic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a backhanded compliment 虚情假意的恭维话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]feigned, roundabout, sarcastic, hypocritical, two-faced, double-faced, left-handed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forthright  直截了当的; artless, candid, genuine, honest, sincere 真挚的，真诚的</div>
<h2>badger[sound:badger.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">不断纠缠或骚扰：</font>to harass or annoy persistently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]badger him into purchasing  不断地骚扰劝说他购买</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bait, plague</div>
<h2>badinage[sound:badinage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】n. <font color="#aa00ff">打趣，善意的玩笑：</font>playful repartee, banter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the sophisticated badinage of the characters in plays by Oscar Wilde 奥斯卡·王尔德作品中意味深长的玩笑话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banter, persiflage, repartee</div>
<h2>bait[sound:bait.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">逗弄，激怒：</font>to persecute or exasperate with unjust, malicious, or persistent attacks</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]bait him with gibes about his humble origin 取笑他的平凡出身以烦扰他</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]badger, annoy, harass, heckle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, pacify, mollify, disarm 平息，使缓和</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">引诱：</font>to lead away from a usual or proper course by offering some pleasure or advantage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the investment scheme baits the greedy and the unscrupulous 这份投资计划吸引贪婪者和轻信者上钩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allure, decoy, entice, seduce</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">诱饵：</font>something (as food) used in luring especially to a hook or trap</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The squad leader has finally realized that his team was a bait. 队长终于意识到他的队伍是一个诱饵</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allurement, snare, trap, temptation</div>
<h2>bale[sound:bale.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】n. <font color="#aa00ff">痛苦，悲哀：</font>woe, sorrow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]relieve spirit from the bale 从悲痛中解脱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]misery, suffering, anguish, grief</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]joy 快乐</div>
<h2>baleful[sound:baleful.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有害的：</font>harmful or malignant in intent or effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a policy with baleful effects  一个带来不良后果的政策</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]harmful, pernicious, detrimental</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beneficent 有益的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凶兆的：</font>foreboding or threatening evil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a baleful look  面露凶色</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]direful, doomy, ominous, ill-boding, minatory, portentous, sinister</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unthreatening  不构成威胁的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">致命的：</font>likely to cause or capable of causing death</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a medicine that is beneficial in small doses but baleful in large 是药三分毒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deadly, fatal, lethal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]healthy, wholesome 有益健康的</div>
<h2>balk[sound:balk.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">阻碍：</font>to check or stop by or as if by an obstacle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circumvent, frustrate, foil, thwart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advance, forward, foster, nurture, promote  推进</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">不愿接受，拒绝：</font>to show unwillingness to accept, do, engage in, or agree to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She balked at the very idea of compromise. 她固执地拒绝妥协的想法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decline, refuse, spurn, repudiate, turn down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accept, approve  同意</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]balky adj. 倔强的</div>
<h2>balky[sound:balky.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不服管束的，倔强的：</font>refusing or likely to refuse to proceed, act, or function as directed or expected</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a balky mule 犟骡子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contumacious, defiant, perverse, intractable, obstreperous, refractory, unruly, untoward, wayward. willful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]compliant, docile, subdued, submissive, tractable 顺从的</div>
<h2>ballad[sound:ballad.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】n. <font color="#aa00ff">由简单诗节和叠句组成的民歌：</font>a  narrative  poem,  often  of  folk  origin  and  intended  to  be  sung,consisting of simple stanzas and usually having a refrain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a haunting ballad about loneliness 一段有关寂寞的缭绕于心的民谣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ditty, jingle, lyric, vocal</div>
<h2>balloon[sound:balloon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">迅速增加：</font>to increase rapidly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The use of computers has ballooned. 电脑的使用量迅速增长</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inflate, escalate, expand, burgeon, mushroom, snowball</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decrease, taper, dwindle, diminish, recede, wane 减少</div>
<h2>balm[sound:balm.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">香油，止痛膏，安慰物：</font>a sweet-smelling oil that heals wounds or reduce pain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Friendship is the finest balm in need. 危难关头，友情是最好的安慰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]irritant 刺激物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]balmy adj. 柔和的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">香气：</font>a sweet or pleasant smell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The balm of the restaurant's backyard garden enhances the aura of romance. 餐馆后院传来的阵阵芳香增加了浪漫的情调</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aroma, fragrance, incense, perfume, redolence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fetor, malodor, stench, stink 恶臭</div>
<h2>banal[sound:banal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非原创的，陈腐的：</font>lacking originality, freshness, or novelty; trite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The slogan is too banal. 这口号已是陈词滥调了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cliché, hackneyed, stereotyped, threadbare, trite, timeworn, shopworn, stale, moth-eaten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]novel, innovative, arresting  新颖的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]banality n. 陈腐</div>
<h2>bane[sound:bane.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">祸根：</font>a source of harm or ruin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Drinking was the bane of his life. 饮酒是他一生的祸根</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affliction, curse, nemesis, scourge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blessing, boon, felicity, windfall 福根</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">有害的物质：</font>a substance that by chemical action can kill or injure a living thing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a plant that is believed to be the bane of the wolf 一种被认为对狼有毒害作用的植物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]toxic, toxin, venom</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]baneful adj. 有害的</div>
<h2>banish[sound:banish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">驱逐出境：</font>to require by authority to leave a country</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Since the diplomatic relation between the two nations has been broken, diplomats were all banished.  随着两国外交关系的断裂，所有的外交人员都被驱逐出境</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deport, exile, expatriate, expel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]repatriate 遣返</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">赶出：</font>to drive or force out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]permanently banished the troublemakers from the youth recreational center 永久剥夺肇事者进入青年娱乐中心的权力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]banishment n. 驱逐</div>
<h2>banter[sound:banter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】n./v. 幽默、打趣的（地）谈话：good-humored, playful conversation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]banter with someone 和某人调侃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]badinage, persiflage, repartee</div>
<h2>barb[sound:barb.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">尖锐而严厉的批评：</font>a biting or pointedly critical remark or comment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]delivered one last barb to his ex-girlfriend as he stalked away 在他转身离去之前，给他前女友留下了最后一句尖锐的批评</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affront, criticism, offense, outrage, sarcasm, slight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]praise, applause, compliment 称赞</div>
<h2>barbarous[sound:barbarous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">野蛮的，凶残的：</font>mercilessly harsh or cruel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]insulted by barbarous language  被粗暴的语言侵犯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brutal, atrocious, fiendish, heartless, savage, truculent, vicious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]merciful, benevolent , humane, sympathetic 仁慈的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">未开化的：</font>uncivilized</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]some barbarous behaviors such as eating with your fingers  一些没有教养的举止，比如直接用手拿东西吃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]wild, uncultivated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]civilized, decent, decorous 举止得体的</div>
<h2>barefaced[sound:barefaced.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">公然的，厚颜无耻的：</font>undisguisedly bold; brazen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a barefaced lie 一个公然的谎言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apparent, plain, bald, evident, manifest, obvious, perspicuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]secret, furtive, clandestine, surreptitious 秘密的</div>
<h2>bargain[sound:bargain.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">协议：</font>an agreement between parties settling what each gives or receives in a transaction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They made a bargain that one would help the other next week. 他们达成了一项协议：下周其中一人将帮助另外一人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accord, compact, contract, covenant, deal, pact, settlement</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">讨价还价：</font>to negotiate over the terms of a purchase</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]bargain over the price 讨价还价</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]haggle, negotiate</div>
<h2>baroque[sound:baroque.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">华丽装饰的，过分雕琢，复杂的：</font>characterized by extravagance, complexity, or flamboyance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a baroque prose 一篇辞藻华丽的散文</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]byzantine, complicated, convoluted, elaborate, fancy, intricate, knotty, labyrinthine, lavish, tangled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]austere, plain, simple 朴实无华的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（程度）过分的：</font>going beyond a normal or acceptable limit in degree or amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Eventually even the movie seems bored by its baroque violence. 到最后这电影也因为其中过度的暴力元素而显得让人厌烦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exorbitant, extravagant, lavish, overdue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]moderate, modest, temperate 适度的</div>
<h2>barrage[sound:barrage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">弹幕：</font>a heavy curtain of artillery fire directed in front of friendly troops to protect them</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Troops are advancing under the shield of barrage.  部队在弹幕的掩护下前进</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bombardment, fusillade</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">有压倒之势的、集中的倾泻（如言语）：</font>an overwhelming, concentrated outpouring, as of words</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The announcement was met with a barrage of criticism and protests. 此公告一出，批评和抗议的声音四起</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]salvo, hail, cannonade, shower, storm, volley</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（同时）袭来：</font>to attack with a rapid or overwhelming outpouring of many things at once</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The athlete was barraged with requests for an autograph. 请求运动员签名的呼声如排山倒海般袭来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bomb</div>
<h2>barren[sound:barren.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不育的：</font>incapable of producing offspring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a poor, barren woman 一名可怜的不孕女子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fruitless, impotent, infertile, effete</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]prolific, fecund 多产的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不产生结果的，无效的：</font>producing no results; unproductive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That line of investigation proved barren, so the police tried other avenues. 那个方向的调查已经被证明是没有结果的了，所以警察开始尝试其他的途径</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bootless, ineffective, inefficacious, unavailing, vain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]effective, successful, productive, virtuous  有效的，成功的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贫瘠的：</font>deficient in production of vegetation and especially crops</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]barren deserts and wastelands 贫瘠的沙漠和荒野</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]desolate, impoverished, waste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arable, fruitful, luxuriant, verdant 富饶繁茂的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极度匮乏的：</font>utterly lacking in something needed, wanted, or expected</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their proposal for revitalizing the downtown business district is utterly barren of practical methods. 他们意图重振中心商业区的计划缺乏能够起效的方法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bare, bereft, destitute, void</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]filled, flush, fraught, full, replete, rife 充沛的</div>
<h2>barricade[sound:barricade.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">障碍物：</font>an obstruction or rampart thrown up across a way or passage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The police put up barricades to block off the parade route. 警察设立了路障来阻挡游行的队伍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fence, hedge, wall, barrier, obstacle, blockade, obstruction</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">用障碍物阻止通过：</font>to prevent access to by means of a barricade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]streets have been barricaded by authorities 街道被当局封锁了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bar, check, hinder, impede, obstruct, wall off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]permit 允许</div>
<h2>barter[sound:barter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">以物换物：</font>to trade (goods or services) without the exchange of money</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]barter wheat for cotton  以小麦换棉花</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]swap, trade</div>
<h2>batch[sound:batch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">一批次的量：</font>a number of things considered as a unit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a batch of cookies  一批次烘烤的饼干</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]array, collection, package, parcel, group</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">一小群人：</font>a usually small number of persons considered as a unit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Show the next batch of applicants in, please. 请带下一批申请人进来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]band, body, cluster, party</div>
<h2>bathetic[sound:bathetic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平凡的，陈腐的：</font>characterized by exceptional commonplaceness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a bathetic funeral scene 平凡的葬礼场面</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]trite, cliché, commonplace, hackneyed, stale, stereotyped</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]offbeat 离奇的exceptional 不平常的，非凡的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]bathos n. 平凡的事物</div>
<h2>bawdy[sound:bawdy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">下流的，猥亵的：</font>boisterously or humorously indecent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a bawdy joke  黄色笑话 || bawdy house  妓院</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]obscene, lewd, ribald, vulgar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decent, decorous 得体的chaste, noble  纯洁的，高贵的</div>
<h2>bedeck[sound:bedeck.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">装饰，点缀：</font>to make more attractive by adding something that is beautiful or becoming</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]flag bedecking the balcony  在阳台上用以装饰的旗子 || bedeck with jewels  用珠宝装饰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adorn, beautify, decorate, dress, embellish, emblaze</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]strip  剥去blemish, deface, mar, spoil 损害，破坏</div>
<h2>belabor[sound:belabor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（当众）严厉批评：</font>to criticize harshly and usually publicly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It’s not wise to belabor other people's flaws when you're hardly perfect yourself. 如果你自己还做不到完美，去指责他人是不明智的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beat, baste, batter, excoriate, lambaste, abuse, assail, vituperate, scathe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]applaud, extol, eulogize, endorse, acclaim 赞扬</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">就…作过度的说明，喋喋不休：</font>to explain or insist on excessively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]belabor the obvious 就显而易见的问题喋喋不休</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dwell on, harp on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disregard, omit, ignore, neglect, slight, slur over 忽略</div>
<h2>beleaguer[sound:beleaguer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">包围，围攻：</font>to surround (as a fortified place) with armed forces for the purpose of capturing orpreventing commerce and communication</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]beleaguered the castle for months 围攻堡垒长达数月</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]siege, besiege, invest, blockade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]retreat, withdraw 撤退</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使困扰，使烦恼，使消沉：</font>trouble, harass, beset</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We are still beleaguered by the very problem.  我们仍然就为这一个问题而感到困扰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annoy, harass, pester, plague, tease</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delight 使愉悦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]beleaguering adj. 扰人的</div>
