<h2>belie[sound:belie.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">错误地描述；误述：</font>to picture falsely; misrepresent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The report belied the real severity of the aftermath.  这个报道错误地评价了后果的严重性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]misrepresent, falsify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]betray, reveal  表明，暴露，揭露（伪装）</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">证明…为假：</font>to show (something) to be false or wrong</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Practical experience belies this theory. 实践证明这个理论是错误的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debunk, discredit, refute, shoot down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]attest, confirm, validate, verify 证实</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">掩饰：</font>to keep secret or shut off from view</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Security Council issued false assurances that belied the true gravity of the situation. 安理会发布了不真实的承诺，掩盖了局势的严重性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conceal, curtain, disguise, mask</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disclose, expose 揭露</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">与…相对立；与…相矛盾：</font>to be counter to; contradict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]At first glance, life at the boarding school seemed to belie all the bad things I had heard about it. 乍看之下，寄宿学校的生活似乎不同于我所听说的有关它的糟糕情形</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contradict, contravene</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agree 与…相一致</div>
<h2>bellwether[sound:bellwether.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">领导者，带头人：</font>one that takes the lead or initiative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Paris is a bellwether of the fashion industry. 巴黎是一座引领时尚潮流的都市</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]leader, pacemaker, pilot, trendsetter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]follower, disciple, imitator 跟随者，弟子，模仿者</div>
<h2>beneficent[sound:beneficent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">仁慈的，好慈善的：</font>characterized by or performing acts of kindness or charity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]beneficent couple who are regular volunteers at an orphan 一对在孤儿院做义工的慈善的夫妇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]kind, altruistic, benevolent, philanthropic, benign, compassionate, sympathetic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]atrocious, barbarous, truculent, vicious 残忍的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（对个人或社会）有益的：</font>promoting or contributing to personal or social well-being</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the beneficent effect of sunshine 日光浴的益处</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]helpful, advantageous, favorable, kindly, profitable, salutary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]detrimental, harmful, noxious, toxic 有害的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]beneficently adv. 仁慈地</div>
<h2>benign[sound:benign.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">好心的，仁慈的：</font>showing kindness and gentleness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a benign coach 一名仁慈的教练</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beneficent, gentle, kind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abrasive, caustic, coarse, hard, harsh, rough, scathing, stern 粗暴的，严厉的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无害的：</font>not causing or being capable of causing injury or hurt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Don’t worry; his eccentricities are entirely benign. 别担心，他那些古怪行为不会给人带来伤害</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]harmless, innocent, innocuous, inoffensive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]baleful, deleterious, detrimental, harmful, injurious, pernicious 有害的</div>
<h2>berate[sound:berate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（长时间）严厉指责：</font>to scold or condemn vehemently and at length</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He berated them in public. 他公开谴责他们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]castigate, flay, lambaste, scold, rail, upbraid, reproach, reprimand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commend, compliment, praise 表扬，赞颂</div>
<h2>beseech[sound:beseech.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（急切地）恳求：</font>to beg for urgently or anxiously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They besought the military to act immediately. 他们恳求军方立即采取行动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appeal, conjure, entreat, implore, petition, plead, supplicate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demand （依据权力等）要求</div>
<h2>besmirch[sound:besmirch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">弄脏，弄污：</font>to make dirty; soil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]besmirched the white bed sheets with their dirty hands  用他们的脏手把白床单弄脏了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]foul, smirch, smudge, taint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clean, cleanse 清洁</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">诽谤，玷污：</font>to detract from the honor or luster of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]besmirch your reputation by fabricating scandals 通过捏造丑闻来玷污你的名声</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defile, smear, soil, stain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]honor 授予荣誉</div>
<h2>bifurcate[sound:bifurcate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi./vt. （使）分成两支：(to cause) to divide into two branches or parts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their visions of the company’s future slowly began to bifurcate. 我们关于公司未来的构想慢慢出现分歧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]divide, diverge, fork</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coalesce  联合 converge  汇合</div>
<h2>bigot[sound:bigot.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">固执己见者，有偏见的人：</font>a person obstinately devoted to his own opinions and prejudices</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is a bigot, or “a slave of dogma”. 一个固执己见的人，换而言之就是——教条主义的奴隶</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dogmatist, partisan</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]depreciator, disparager 贬低他人的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]bigoted 固执己见的</div>
<h2>bland[sound:bland.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">味道平淡的：</font>not irritating or stimulating; soothing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]stick to bland diet to lose weight  坚持清淡的饮食以减肥</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mild, light, soft, soothing, tender</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pungent, tangy, zesty 味道刺激的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无趣的：</font>dull, insipid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a bland story with naive plot 一个情节幼稚的无聊故事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banal, sapless, insipid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]riveting, enchanting 诱人的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">温和的，和蔼的：</font>not harsh or stern especially in nature or effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]bland food that was good for babies and invalids 对婴儿和病患有益的温和的食物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balmy, benign, bland, delicate, mellow, nonabrasive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abrasive, caustic, coarse, hard, harsh, rough, scathing, stern 刺激性的</div>

<h2>blast[sound:blast.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">爆炸：</font>an explosion or violent detonation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]blast wave of a nuclear bomb 原子弹的冲击波</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burst, detonation, eruption, outburst</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]implosion  向内爆裂</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">一阵猛烈的强风：</font>a violent gust of wind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]blasts of bleak air  阵阵阴风</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blow, flurry</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">巨响：</font>a loud explosive sound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sharp blast of the horn startled the other driver 一声尖锐刺耳的喇叭声惊吓到了另一名司机</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bang, boom, thunderclap</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]murmur, whisper 轻言轻语</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">炸裂，爆破：</font>to cause to break open or into pieces by or as if by an explosive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The highway engineers will have to blast that hill in order to put a road through here. 为了建设一条公路，道路工程师们必须对那座山进行爆破</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demolish, explode, smash, blow up</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法5】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">斥责，抨击：</font>to criticize harshly and usually publicly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]blasted the new governor for every little misstep 就每一个小的失误都要抨击新的执政官</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abuse, assail, belabor, castigate, lambaste, scathe, vituperate</div>

<h2>blithe[sound:blithe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">愉快高兴的：</font>of a happy lighthearted character or disposition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Everyone loved her for her blithe spirit. 所有人都喜欢她开朗的性格</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bright, buoyant, gay, jocular, jocund, jovial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dour, gloomy, morose, saturnine, sulky, sullen  忧郁的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无忧无虑的：</font>having or showing freedom from worries or troubles</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He has a blithe attitude about ever having to earn a living because he knows there's a trust fund in hisfuture. 他对生活无忧无虑，因为他知道他的未来有信托基金可以倚靠</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debonair, insouciant, lighthearted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careworn  焦虑的</div>

<h2>blunder[sound:blunder.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">过失：</font>a gross error or mistake resulting usually from stupidity, ignorance, or carelessness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That's your second blunder today. 这是你今天犯的第二个低级错误了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mistake, gaffe, lapse, error</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">在…方面犯了很愚蠢且通常很严重的错误；糟蹋：</font>to make a stupid, usually serious error in; botch</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]screw up, mess up</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">蹒跚：</font>to move unsteadily or confusedly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Without my glasses I blundered into the wrong room. 因为没戴眼镜，所以我蹒跚地走入了错误的房间</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]stumble, falter, limp, plod</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]blundering adj. 蹒跚行走的</div>
<h2>blunt[sound:blunt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使变钝：</font>to make less sharp or definite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dull, deaden, hebetate, benumb, enfeeble, attenuate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]whet, sharpen 磨尖</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">减弱（力度等）：</font>to reduce or weaken in strength or feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The abrupt music blunted the effect of the movie's final tragic scene.  突兀的音乐让电影结束时悲剧场景的氛围大打折扣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dampen, deaden</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">直率的：</font>being or characterized by direct, brief, and potentially rude speech or manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He values honesty and is quite blunt about telling people what he doesn't like about them. 他重视诚实，经常直率地告诉别人他们何处使他不满</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrupt, bluff, brusque, curt, gruff</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circuitous, mealy-mouthed 拐弯抹角的</div>
<h2>blur[sound:blur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（使）变得朦胧，（使）变得不清楚：</font>to (cause sth. to) become vague or indistinct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Sorrowful tears blurred her eyes. 悲伤的眼泪模糊了她的双眼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]shroud, becloud, befog, obscure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear  使清晰</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使不易理解：</font>to make (something) unclear to the understanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]An article for the layman that blurs the distinction between the two kinds of cholesterol. 一篇针对业余读者的文章把两种胆固醇的区别弄得模糊不清</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]obfuscate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarify, illuminate 阐明，说清楚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]blurring adj. 朦胧的</div>
<h2>blurt[sound:blurt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">突然说出，冲动地说：</font>to utter abruptly and impulsively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]blurt out the secret  脱口说出了秘密</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burst, bolt, ejaculate, cry out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]muffle, mute 使缄默</div>
<h2>bluster[sound:bluster.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">狂妄自大地大声说：</font>to speak in a loudly arrogant or bullying manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was blustering alone in the meeting, which triggered wide dissatisfaction. 他一人在会议上夸夸其谈，引得众人不满。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]roar, clamor, bluster, rattle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]whisper 小声嘀咕</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大声吹嘘或恐吓：</font>loudly boastful or threatening speech</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grandiloquence, braggadocio</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">喧闹的状态：</font>a state of noisy, confused activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mayor who got things done without a lot of bluster 一个能把事情低调解决的市长</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disturbance, pandemonium, tumult, turmoil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]blustering adj. 大吵大闹的</div>
<h2>boggle[sound:boggle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">因为怀疑、恐惧而犹豫：</font>to hesitate because of doubt, fear, or scruples</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]boggle at the dilemma 身处困境而犹豫不决</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hesitate, falter, waver</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">笨拙地做：</font>to make or do (something) in a clumsy or unskillful way</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She boggled her first effort to make Christmas cookies. 她第一次尝试圣诞蛋糕做得笨手笨脚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]botch, bungle.</div>
<h2>boisterous[sound:boisterous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">喧嚷的，吵闹的：</font>noisily turbulent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a boisterous queue in front of the pavilion 场馆前喧闹的队伍 || boisterous mirth. 喧闹的欢笑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rowdy, vociferous, blatant, clamorous, raucous, rambunctious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]quiet, sedate 安静的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]boisterousness n. 喧闹</div>
<h2>bolster[sound:bolster.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 支持：a structural part designed to eliminate friction or provide support or bearing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pillows that bolster the building 支撑房屋的柱子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brace, buttress, bear, sustain, undergird, underpin, uphold, prop up</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">鼓励，使有精力：</font>to give a boost to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]news that bolsters the morale of the troops 鼓舞军队士气的消息</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]buoy, reinforce</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dampen 泼冷水</div>
<h2>bombast[sound:bombast.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">夸大的言辞：</font>grandiloquent, pompous speech or writing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]“Their eloquence is all bombast”, said Charles Kingsley. “他们的雄辩是虚张声势”，查理斯·金斯利如此说道</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]braggadocio, grandiloquence, exaggeration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]understatement 保守的观点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]bombastic adj. 夸大的</div>
<h2>bonhomie[sound:bonhomie.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">温和，和蔼：</font>a pleasant and affable disposition; geniality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affability, amiability, geniality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]bonhomous adj. 和蔼的</div>
<h2>boo[sound:boo.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 嘘（以表示不满或嘲笑）：a sound uttered to show contempt, scorn, or disapproval</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]boo the actor off the stage 把演员嘘下舞台</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]jeer, scorn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]applaud 鼓掌</div>
<h2>boon[sound:boon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">恩惠，福利：</font>benefit, favor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new solar battery booster is a boon for photographers.  这个光伏充电器是摄影家的福音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gift, benevolence, present, windfall</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]misfortune, scourge 灾祸</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">喜欢集体行动的：</font>likely to seek or enjoy the company of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]convivial, extroverted, gregarious, social, outgoing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reclusive  隐居</div>
<h2>boor[sound:boor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">粗鲁的人，不敏感的人：</font>a rude or insensitive person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]acting like boor 表现得很粗鲁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]peasant, barbarian, buffoon</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sentimentalist  多愁善感的人</div>
<h2>bootless[sound:bootless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无用的：</font>useless, unprofitable, futile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The meeting turns out to be a bootless attempt. 这个会议被证明是一次徒劳的尝试</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]barren, ineffective, futile, abortive, fruitless, vain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]worthy, virtuous 有价值的</div>
<h2>bound[sound:bound.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">界限：</font>a real or imaginary point beyond which a person or thing cannot go</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The language in the novel really is beyond the bounds of decency. 这本小说的语言实在太不得体了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]environs, limits, confines, perimeter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unrestrainedness 无边无际</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">给…设置限制：</font>to set limits or bounds to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The country is bounded by river. 这个国家的领土以河水为界</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]limit, demarcate, delimit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enfranchise, free, liberate 释放</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">投入的，坚定的：</font>fully committed to achieving a goal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I am bound and determined to write a novel before I turn 30. 我下定决心在30 岁之前要写本小说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]resolute, determined, single-minded, bent on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]faltering, hesitant, vacillating, wavering, weak-kneed 动摇的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]boundless adj. 无边无际、无约束的</div>
<h2>boycott[sound:boycott.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">联合抵制，拒绝参与：</font>to engage in a concerted refusal to have dealings with (as a person, store,or organization) usually to express disapproval or to force acceptance of certain conditions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This brand is being boycotted for damaging environment. 因为破坏环境，这个品牌正在被抵制</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]refuse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]patronize  经常光顾</div>
<h2>bracing[sound:bracing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人振奋的，给人带来活力的：</font>giving strength, vigor, or freshness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a bracing news from the frontline 来自前线的振奋人心的消息</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]invigorating, rejuvenating, reviving, stimulating</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vapid 乏味的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]brace    v. 支持，使充满活力</div>
<h2>brake[sound:brake.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">刹车：</font>to cause to move or proceed at a less rapid pace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A seagull swooped down in front of her car, causing her to slam on the brakes. 一只海鸥飞到车窗前，她猛踩刹车。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decelerate, retard, slacken</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accelerate, hasten, rush, speed up 加速</div>
<h2>brash[sound:brash.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">愚勇的，鲁莽的：</font>foolishly adventurous or bold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that brash motorcyclist likes to show off by riding on only one wheel 那个鲁莽的摩托车手喜欢炫耀单轮骑车</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, brassy, daredevil, madcap, reckless, temerarious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circumspect, guarded, heedful, prudent, wary</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏判断力的，不明智的：</font>showing poor judgment especially in personal relationships or socialsituations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was reprimanded for his brash comments to the media about the team's coaching staff.  他因对媒体说了一些有关教练组的不明智的评论被指责。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]imprudent, injudicious, tactless, undiplomatic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advisable, discreet, tactful 明智的</div>
<h2>brassy[sound:brassy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">厚脸皮的，不知羞耻的：</font>displaying or marked by rude boldness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]brassy reporters  厚颜无耻的记者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, bold-faced, brazen, impertinent, impudent, insolent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diffident, unassertive, retiring, timid 羞怯的，谦逊的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">华而不实地炫耀的：</font>cheap and showy; flashy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]furtive 隐秘的</div>
<h2>bravado[sound:bravado.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">假装勇敢：</font>a pretense of bravery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I remembered his youthful bravado. 我还记得他的年少鲁莽。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">虚张声势：</font>blustering swaggering conduct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]strove to prevent our courage from turning into bravado 努力阻止我们的勇气蜕变成虚张声势</div>
<h2>bravura[sound:bravura.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj/n. 优秀演技：brilliant technique or style in performance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a truly bravura performance of the ballet 一场极其精彩的芭蕾舞演出</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adroit, artful, dexterous, masterful, virtuoso</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amateur, artless, unprofessional, unskillful</div>
<h2>brazen[sound:brazen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">蛮横大胆的，厚颜无耻的：</font>marked by contemptuous boldness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a brazen disregard for the rules  蛮横大胆的对规则漠视</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bold-faced, impertinent, impudent, insolent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]modest, self-effacing, diffident, retiring, timid 谦虚的，胆小的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">大胆自信地去面对或从事：</font>to face or undergo with bold self-assurance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]brazened out the crisis  沉着面对危机 ||  Some  people  prefer  to  brazen  a  thing  out  rather  than  admitdefeat. 有的人不愿承认失败，而是宁肯厚着脸皮干下去。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]confront, outface, defy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dodge, duck, shirk, sidestep 躲开，避谈</div>
<h2>breach[sound:breach.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">对伦理、法律准则的破坏：</font>a breaking of a moral or legal code</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cheating on the exam was a serious breach of the military academy's honor code 考试作弊是对军校的荣誉准则的严重破坏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]malefaction, transgression, trespass, violation, wrongdoing</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">违背：</font>to fail to keep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a builder being sued by a homeowner for breaching a contract 建筑商因违约被房主起诉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contravene, fracture, infringe, transgress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obey, observe, comply with, conform to 遵守</div>
<h2>brevity[sound:brevity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">简短，简洁：</font>shortness of duration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the best quality a graduation speech can have is brevity 好的毕业演讲必须简洁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]briefness, conciseness, shortness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lengthiness 冗长</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">精炼：</font>the quality or state of being marked by or using only few words to convey much meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]if brevity is the soul of wit, then that speech wasn't at all witty 如果说精炼是智慧的灵魂，那么演讲毫无智慧可言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conciseness, pithiness, sententiousness, terseness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diffuseness, long-windedness, prolixity, verbosity, wordiness 冗长啰嗦</div>
<h2>bribe[sound:bribe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">贿赂，收买：</font>to give something, such as money or a favor, offered or given to a person in a positionof trust to influence that person's views or conduct.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They bribed him to keep quiet about the incident. 他们收买他，希望其保持缄默。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]corrupt, pay off, square</div>
<h2>bridle[sound:bridle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">限制：</font>to keep from exceeding a desirable degree or level (as of expression)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]try to bridle your criticism next time so that it is helpful and not hurtful 下回控制好批评的语气，让其既顺耳又有益</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]check, contain, curb, constrain, inhibit, regulate, restrain, tame, rein in</div>
<h2>brisk[sound:brisk.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">充满生机，有活力的：</font>marked by much life, movement, or activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]brisk and concise response  轻快而简洁的回答</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animated, bouncing, bustling, frisky, kinetic, sprightly, vibrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lackadaisical, languid, leaden, dead, inactive, lifeless 没有生机的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">刻薄的，言辞或方式尖刻辛辣的：</font>keen or sharp in speech or manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a brisk greeting 尖刻的祝贺</div>
<h2>bristle[sound:bristle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">怒不可遏，咆哮：</font>to express one's anger usually violently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]bristle at the suggestion of gay marriage 对基情怒不可遏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bluster, fulminate, rampage, fume, storm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cower 畏缩</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">供应充足：</font>to be copiously supplied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]starting a new life in New York city bristling with possibilities 在有着无限机会的纽约开始新生活</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brim, overflow, swarm, teem</div>
<h2>brittle[sound:brittle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易碎的，脆弱的，易坏的：</font>easily broken, cracked, or snapped</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]as brittle as glass 像玻璃一样脆弱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crispy, crumbly, flaky, friable</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不热心的，不真心的：</font>lacking in friendliness or warmth of feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a brittle apology that was anything but heartfelt 一个毫不真诚的道歉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chilly, frigid, frosty, glacial, unfriendly, unsympathetic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cordial, genial, warmhearted 热心的</div>
<h2>broach[sound:broach.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">开启，启封：</font>to open for the first time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]broach a keg of beer 开一小桶酒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]break</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]close off 关闭</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">提出讨论：</font>to present or bring forward for discussion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]broached the topic of plans for next year's parade  将明年的游行活动计划摆上讨论日程</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]moot, place, raise, bring up</div>
<h2>bromide[sound:bromide.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">陈词滥调：</font>a commonplace or hackneyed statement or notion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a newspaper editorial offering the timeworn bromide that people should settle their differences peacefully报纸编辑又拿出那一套呼吁和平解决纷争的陈词滥调</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banality, cliché, platitude, homily, truism, chestnut, shibboleth</div>
<h2>brook[sound:brook.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">忍受，容许：</font>to stand for, tolerate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]brook no inference with his plans  不能容忍别人对于他计划的干涉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abide, countenance, endure, stomach</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">小溪流：</font>a natural stream of water normally smaller than and often tributary to a river: creek</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]there are tiny fish and frogs in that brook  那条小溪里有小鱼还有小青蛙</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]creek, rivulet</div>

<h2>buck[sound:buck.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">阻止，反对：</font>to refuse assent, to refuse to give in to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]buck the system  不遵守制度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defy, fight, oppose, repel, withstand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assent to, bow to, submit to, succumb to, surrender to, yield to 赞成，服从</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">转移，交接：</font>to shift possession of (something) from one person to another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]buck each box to the next person in line 将每一个盒子传给队伍中的后一人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]transfer, hand over</div>
<h2>budge[sound:budge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">改变立场或态度：</font>to alter a position or attitude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Nothing would budge him. 没有什么可以改变他的主意。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">停止抵抗，屈服：</font>to cease resistance (as to another’s arguments, demands, or control)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]despite hours of intense pressure, she refused to budge from her position 尽管被连续施压几小时，她仍旧不肯改变立场</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]concede, relent, submit, succumb, surrender</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resist 拒绝，抵抗</div>
<h2>bulge[sound:bulge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">凸起：</font>a protuberant or swollen part or place</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]bulging eyes 暴鱼眼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]convexity, projection, protrusion, protuberance, swell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]depressed region, cavity, dent, indent, recess, pit 凹陷，坑</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">比赛中的优势地位：</font>the more favorable condition or position in a competition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]somehow she got the bulge on him in the race for the statehouse 她在州议员竞选中领先了他</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]high ground, inside track, upper hand, whip hand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disadvantage, drawback, handicap, liability 劣势</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">暴涨，突增，在数目或数量上突然而且是临时性的增加：</font>a sudden, usually temporary increasein number or quantity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The baby boom created a bulge in school enrollment. 生育高峰造成学校入学人数的暴涨。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">充满：</font>to be copiously supplied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]this guidebook to San Francisco positively bulges with useful information  这本对旧金山的指南包含了很多有用信息</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brim, bristle, overflow, swarm, teem</div>
<h2>bully[sound:bully.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">欺凌弱小者：</font>a person who habitually treats others in an overbearing or intimidating manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]they had to deal with the local bullies  他们要对付当地恶霸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bullyboy, hector, intimidator</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]underdog 被欺负的人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">最好的，最棒的：</font>of the very best kind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that's a bully idea for reviving the town's retail center 真是个重整镇上零售中心的好主意</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]awesome, fabulous, fantastic, superb, marvelous, unsurpassed, excellent</div>

<h2>cache[sound:cache.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">囤货，藏货：</font>a supply stored up and often hidden away</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]maintain a cache of food in case of emergencies 保存着食物的隐藏处以防万一</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]stash, stockpile, store, deposit, hoard, reserve</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">隐藏：</font>to put into a hiding place</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cached the fugitive slaves in their cellar until they could make their way to Canada 将奴隶们藏匿在房间的地下室直到他们能够顺利逃去加拿大</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conceal, ensconce, secrete, squirrel away</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]display, exhibit 展示</div>
<h2>cachet[sound:cachet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">同意：</font>an indication of approval carrying great prestige</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A Mercedes carries a certain cachet. 每一辆奔驰都有认证标志。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">声望：</font>prestige</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]being rich…doesn’t have the cachet it used to 富甲一方再也不像过去拥有那么高的声望了</div>
<h2>cacophony[sound:cacophony.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">刺耳的声音：</font>loud, confused, and usually inharmonious sound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the cacophony of a pet store full of animals 宠物商店里各种动物叽叽呱呱的声音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blare, bluster, clamor, decibel, din, discordance, racket</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]quiet, silence, still, stillness  安静</div>
<h2>cadge[sound:cadge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">乞讨，乞求：</font>beg, sponge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cadge a free cup of coffee 讨到一杯免费的咖啡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]earn  赚钱</div>
<h2>cajole[sound:cajole.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">哄骗：</font>to urge with gentle and repeated appeals, teasing, or flattery; wheedle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cajoled her into doing his laundry for him  哄骗她帮他洗衣服</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blandish, blarney, palaver, wheedle, soft-soap, sweet-talk</div>
<h2>calcify[sound:calcify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使僵化：</font>to make inflexible or unchangeable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a leg that calcified  一条麻木僵直的腿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]harden, obdurate, ossify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]make malleable, make pliant, make more flexible 使灵活</div>
<h2>calibrate[sound:calibrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">调整，标准化：</font>to standardize (as a measuring instrument) by determining the deviation from astandard so as to ascertain the proper correction factors</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]calibrate the polling procedures to ensure objectivity 为保证客观性而使投票过程标准化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unstandardize 不标准</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（根据标准）精确测量：</font>to measure precisely especially: to measure against a standard</div>
<h2>calligraphy[sound:calligraphy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（优美的）书法：</font>artistic, stylized, or elegant handwriting or lettering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]she specializes in scrollwork with beautiful calligraphy 她很擅长花体字</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]longhand, manuscript, penmanship, script</div>
<h2>callous[sound:callous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无同情心的,  冷漠的：</font>emotionally hardened; unfeeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a callous indifference to the suffering of others  对他人的痛苦的漠不关心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectless, uncharitable, unsparing, remorseless, indurate, ruthless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sympathetic, compassionate, merciful, tender, warmhearted  有同情心的</div>
<h2>callow[sound:callow.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏老练、不成熟的：</font>lacking in adult experience or maturity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]callow young man  未经世事的年轻人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]green, immature, inexperienced, juvenile, unfledged, unripened, puerile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adult, experienced, grown-up, mature, ripe 成熟的</div>
<h2>calumniate[sound:calumniate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">诽谤，造谣，中伤：</font>to utter maliciously false statements, charges, or imputations about</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asperse, blacken, defame, libel, malign, smear, traduce, vilify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vindicate  辩护</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]calumnious 造谣的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flattering  谄媚的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]calumny n. 诽谤、中伤：a false statement maliciously made to injure another's reputation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]approbation 嘉许</div>
<h2>camaraderie[sound:camaraderie.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">友情：</font>a spirit of friendly good-fellowship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There is great camaraderie among the teammates. 组员之间有着深厚的情谊。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brotherhood, comradeship, fellowship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enmity 敌意</div>
<h2>cameo[sound:cameo.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">栩栩如生的描绘：一种简洁的、生动的描述或刻画：</font>a brief, vivid portrayal or depiction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a literary cameo 文学描写</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">客串：</font>to make a brief but dramatic appearance, as in a film</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She cameoed as Anne Boleyn in A Man for All Seasons. 在所有季节的人中她客串安妮·波列思。</div>
<h2>camouflage[sound:camouflage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">伪装：</font>behavior or artifice designed to deceive or hide</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the soldiers must wear protective jungle camouflage while on patrol 士兵们在巡逻的时候必须穿上迷彩服来保护自身安全</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]costume, guise, cloak, dress up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unmask 揭露</div>
<h2>canard[sound:canard.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">谣传，误传：</font>an unfounded or false, deliberately misleading story.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]it's a popular canard that the actress died under scandalous circumstances 有一种广泛的说法声称女演员死于绯闻的压力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]story, whisper</div>
<h2>candor[sound:candor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">坦白，直率，诚挚：</font>unreserved, honest, or sincere expression</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the members of the rock band speak with candor about their recent squabbling 摇滚乐队成员对于他们最近的内讧直言不讳</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bluntness, forthrightness, frankness, unreservedness, straightforwardness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artifice, mendacity, dissembling, dissimulation, indirection 谎言，不直接</div>
<h2>canon[sound:canon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">正教，标准：</font>a basis for judgment; a standard or criterion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the canons of polite society  文明社会的法规</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dogma</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">真经，真典：</font>the authentic works of a writer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apocrypha 伪经</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]canonical adj. 正教的：conforming to a general rule or acceptable procedure : orthodox</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heterodox, nontraditional 非正统的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]canonize v. 作为神圣的来对待，使神圣化：to treat as sacred; glorify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adore, adulate, idolize, deify, worship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abase, degrade, demean, humiliate 贬低</div>
<h2>canvass[sound:canvass.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">仔细检查或详尽地讨论；审查：</font>to examine carefully or discuss thoroughly; scrutinize:</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]“The evidence had been repeatedly canvassed in American courts” 证据已在美国的法庭中反复被审查过。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">游说：去（一个地区）的各处或找到（个人）来拉选票或定单：</font>to go through (a region) or go to (persons)to solicit votes or orders</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]canvass voters 拉选票</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]interview, poll, solicit, survey</div>
<h2>capitulate[sound:capitulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">投降，默许：</font>to give up all resistance; acquiesce; yield</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]one side finally capitulated when it became clear that they couldn’t win the argument 意识到他们不能拿下这场辩论后，该方投降了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]budge, concede, relent, submit, succumb, surrender, knuckle under</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resist, oppose 抵抗</div>
<h2>caprice[sound:caprice.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">一时冲动的决定：</font>an impulsive change of mind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an out-of-character caprice led him to take the day off from work and go to the beach 一时冲动让他决定休假一天，去海滩度假</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crank, fancy, vagary, vagrancy, whimsy</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">反复无常，善变：</font>an inclination to change one's mind impulsively.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his  knack  for  picking  racetrack  winners  appears  to  owe  as  much  to  caprice  as  it  does  to  a  cannyassessment of horseflesh 他赌马屡赌虑赢，要归功于自己的反复无常而不是对于赛马本身独到精明的评估。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]freakishness, impulsiveness, whimsicalness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confirmation 确认</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]capricious adj. 反复无常的，善变</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]steadfast, resolute, constant, pertinacious 坚定不变的</div>
<h2>captivate[sound:captivate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">吸引：</font>to attract and hold by charm, beauty, or excellence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I was captivated by her brilliant mind. 我被她的才华横溢所吸引。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allure, beguile, bewitch, enchant, fascinate, magnetize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]repulse 使烦感</div>

<h2>caricature[sound:caricature.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">用讽刺歪曲等手法的夸张，漫画，讽刺画：</font>exaggeration by means of often ludicrous distortion ofparts or characteristics</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]caricaturist n.漫画家</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">嘲笑性模仿或夸张：</font>to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]caricatured the supervisor's distinctive walk 模仿督导员独特的走路方式</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burlesque, imitate, mock, parody, spoof, travesty</div>
<h2>carnal[sound:carnal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">肉体的，物质的：</font>relating to the physical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]seen with carnal eyes 用肉眼看 || carnal remains 遗体</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]corporal, corporeal, fleshly, material, somatic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]spiritual 精神的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">世俗的：</font>worldly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a carnal mind  凡心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]earthborn, mundane, temporal, terrestrial, worldly</div>
<h2>carouse[sound:carouse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">畅饮，狂饮作乐：</font>to drink liquor freely or excessively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]stay at home instead of going out and carousing with friends 呆在家里而不是出去和朋友们狂饮作乐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]binge, jamboree , revel, roister, wassail</div>
<h2>carp[sound:carp.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">对小事吹毛求疵，挑剔：</font>to make often peevish criticisms or objections about matters that areminor, unimportant, or irrelevant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]carped about the order of names on the wedding invitations 对于婚礼请柬上的名单顺序吹毛求疵</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cavil, fuss, niggle, nitpick</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">没完没了地表现不满意：</font>to express dissatisfaction, pain, or resentment usually tiresomely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gripe, grizzle, grouch, grouse, grumble, wail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crow, delight, rejoice</div>
<h2>carve[sound:carve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">雕刻：</font>to create a three-dimensional representation of (something) using solid material</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]carved a statue out of rare marble 用纯的大理石雕刻了一尊雕像</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sculpture</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（通过长期不懈努力）产生或导致：</font>to produce or bring about especially by long or repeated effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]finally carved out a niche for the sport in the school's athletic program 在学校运动计划中寻找到了自己的定位 || carve out a way through the enemy  从敌营中杀出一条血路</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forge, grind out, thrash out, work out, work up</div>
<h2>cast[sound:cast.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">演员，演员阵容：</font>a set of characters or persons</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">选派（演员）：</font>to assign (as an actor) to a role or part</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]He was cast in the leading role.  他是男一号。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">提出：</font>to put forth, give off, to place as if by throwing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cast doubt on their reliability 对它们的可靠性提出质疑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discharge, emanate, irradiate, issue, shoot, throw out, give out</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">抛弃：</font>to get rid of as useless or unwanted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]once she became rich and didn't need them anymore, she cast off all her old friends like so much junk当她有钱了不再需要朋友了，她把老友像糟粕一样抛弃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ditch, dump, jettison, toss</div>
<h2>castigate[sound:castigate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">强烈 （公开）指责：</font>to criticize harshly and usually publicly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The author castigated the prime minister as an ineffective leader.  作者谴责首相行政无作为。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]berate, chastise, lambaste, reprimand, reproach, rebuke, vituperate, excoriate, rail (at or against)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]approbate, accolade, extol 认可，赞美</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">惩罚：</font>to inflict a penalty on for a fault or crime</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a judge who believes in castigating criminals to the full extent of the law 法官认为应该最大程度地惩罚罪犯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chasten, chastise, correct, discipline, penalize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]excuse, pardon, spare  宽恕</div>
<h2>catalyze[sound:catalyze.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">成为导火索，导致：</font>to be the cause of (a situation, action, or state of mind)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a reinstitution of the draft would catalyze protests around the country 草案的提出会激发全国范围的抗议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breed, beget, effectuate, engender, generate, prompt, spawn, yield, result in , bring (about</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]retard, prevent, inhibit 阻挠，抑制</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]catalyst n. 催化剂：an agent that provokes or speeds significant change or action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a catalyst for change of lifestyle  生活方式变化的催化剂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inhibitor 抑制剂</div>
<h2>catastrophe[sound:catastrophe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大灾难：</font>the final event of the dramatic action especially of a tragedy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apocalypse, calamity, cataclysm, debacle, tragedy</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">彻底的失败：</font>utter failure : fiasco</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the party was a catastrophe  该派对就是一个杯具</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bummer, debacle, disaster, fiasco, fizzle, washout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blockbuster, hit, smash, success, winner 大胜</div>
<h2>categorical[sound:categorical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">没有例外的，无条件限制的，绝对的：</font>being without exception or qualification; absolute</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a categorical denial 完全的否认</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]definite, downright, fair, utter, thorough, unalloyed, unconditional, unqualified</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conditional, qualified 有条件的</div>
<h2>catholic[sound:catholic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">普遍的，包容的：</font>not limited or specialized in application or purpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a catholic taste in music 对于音乐的兼容并包的品味</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unlimited, unqualified, unrestricted, unspecialized, all-around (also all-round)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]narrow, limited, restricted, specialized 狭隘的</div>
<h2>caustic[sound:caustic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">腐蚀性的：</font>capable of destroying or eating away by chemical action : corrosive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The chemical was so caustic that it ate through the pipes. 化学性质如此具有腐蚀性，以至于把管道都腐蚀了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]palliating  减缓的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">挖苦讽刺的，刻薄的：</font>marked by incisive sarcasm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]caustic movie reviews 尖酸刻薄的影评</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acerbic, acrid, barbed, mordant, pungent, sardonic, satiric, scathing, sharp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]genial, smooth, kind, innocuous  和蔼的，（言论，行为等）无害的</div>
