<h2>cherubic[sound:cherubic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">天使般可爱的：</font>innocent-looking usually chubby and rosy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A representation of Cupid as a naked, cherubic boy usually is used as a symbol of love.  丘比特作为小天使般的少年裸体画像被用作爱的象征</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fiendish, devilish 恶魔般的</div>
<h2>chicanery[sound:chicanery.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n．诡计多端，欺骗 ：deception by artful subterfuge or sophistry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Well-doer never does chicanery and person who is good at chicanery does not belong well-doer.  善者不辩，辩者不善。|| He wasn't above using chicanery to win votes.  他不是用欺骗来赢得选票的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deception, artifice, legerdemain, wile, subterfuge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aboveboard action  光明正大的行为；honest dealing 诚实的行为；forthrightness 坦白</div>
<h2>chide[sound:chide.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">责备：</font>to scold mildly so as to correct or improve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My wife chided me for forgetting to offer our guests some refreshments.  我妻子责备我忘记给客人们点心。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reprove, reprimand, reproach, tick off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]praise, commend 称赞</div>
<h2>choleric[sound:choleric.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易怒的，暴躁的：</font>easily angered; bad-tempered.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]choleric disposition  易怒的性情 || men of the choleric type take to kicking and smashing 易怒的人喜欢踢和打碎东西</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crabby, cranky, irascible, peevish, petulant, bad-tempered, hot-tempered, short-tempered, testy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]difficult to provoke, pacific, placid, calm, serene, tranquil, composed, nonchalant 难以被激怒的，平静的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]choler n. 易怒：ready disposition to irritation : irascibility also : anger</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">生气的：</font>feeling or showing anger: angry, irate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I absolutely get choleric when a salesman calls during the dinner hour.  当一个推销员午休时间打来电话的时候我彻底愤怒了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]angered,  apoplectic,  ballistic,  enraged,  furious,  incensed,  inflamed,  enflamed,  infuriated,  irate,  ireful,outraged, rankled, riled, wrathful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]angerless, delighted, pleased</div>
<h2>chord[sound:chord.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">和谐一致；符合：</font>to be in accord; agree.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The revised system chords perfectly with the original goals. 新版的系统非常符合最初的目标。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accord, agree, conform, consist, correspond, dovetail, fit, harmonize, jibe, rhyme, square, tally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]differ from, disagree with</div>
<h2>chromatic[sound:chromatic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">彩色的：</font>relating to colors or color</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the chromatic paintings of Matisse and the other Fauvists 马蒂斯和其他野兽派画家的彩色画</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]colored , colorful, motley, multicolored, multihued, varicolored, variegated, kaleidoscopic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]colorless, pallid, blanched 无色的；monochromatic, monochromic, monotone, self-colored  单色的</div>
<h2>chronic[sound:chronic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">经常发生的，复发的：</font>marked by long duration or frequent recurrence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]chronic disease 慢性病</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]frequent, usual, routine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sporadic  偶然发生的；infrequent  不经常的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">习惯性的，不可能改变的：</font>being such by habit and not likely to change</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a chronic smoker who has quit many times  一个戒了很多次烟的老烟民</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inveterate</div>
<h2>churl[sound:churl.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. 粗野的人; a rude, boorish personth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]By the 19 century, ‘churl’ had a new and pejorative meaning, “one inclined to uncivil or loutish behavior”. 19世纪的时候，churl 有了一个新的贬义含义的意思，“一个粗鲁没有教养的人”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boor, lout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]churlish adj. 粗野的，暴躁的：of, like, or befitting a churl; boorish or vulgar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crude, coarse, boorish, loutish, uncultured, unpolished</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]genteel, complaisance, courtly, polished 文雅的，彬彬有礼的；sophisticated 机智圆滑的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">吝啬鬼：</font>a mean grasping person who is usually stingy with money</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Don't bother asking a churl for donations.  别自找麻烦向一个吝啬鬼要捐款。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]miser, niggard, skinflint, penny-pincher</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]generous/ liberal/ munificent person  慷慨的人；waster, wastrel, spendthrift, prodigal, profligate, dissipater败家子</div>
<h2>cipher[sound:cipher.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">无影响或无价值的人：</font>a person of no importance or influence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The intern is a mere cipher in the company.  这个实习生在公司里是个无足轻重的小人物。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dwarf,  half-pint,  insect,  insignificancy,  lightweight,  morsel,  nonentity,  nothing,  nullity,  snippersnapper,whippersnapper, zero</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]big shot, big wheel, bigwig, eminence, figure, personage</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">计算（价值）：</font>to determine (a value) by doing the necessary mathematical operations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We were surprised by how much we had spent on the cruise after we had ciphered out the grand total. 当我们算出我们沉船游览的总花费时，我们都惊呆了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compute, work out</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">密码：</font>a method of transforming a text in order to conceal its meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]convert their messages into cipher  把他们的信息转换成密码</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]code, secret message</div>
<h2>circuitous[sound:circuitous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不直接的：</font>not being forthright or direct in language or action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We took a circuitous route to the airport so as to avoid the massive traffic jam. 我们走了一条迂回的路线去机场来躲避堵车。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indirect, circular, roundabout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]direct, straight, straightforward 直接的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]circuity n. 不直接：lack of straightforwardness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]straightforwardness, direction 直接</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冗长的：</font>using or containing more words than necessary to express an idea</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a circuitous explanation for what seems like a fairly basic concept 对一个非常基本的概念的冗长的解释</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circumlocutory, diffuse, long-winded, prolix, rambling, verbose, windy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]compact, concise, pithy, succinct, terse 简洁的</div>
<h2>circumlocution[sound:circumlocution.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">绕圈子的说话：</font>the use of unnecessarily wordy and indirect language, evasion in speech</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The other son of your parents’ is a circumlocution for your brother. 你父母的其他儿子是你兄弟的绕圈子的说法。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]equivocation, shuffle, tergiversation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pithy utters, straightforward utter , express succinctly 简洁地表达；direct encounter  直接面对</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]circumlocutory a. 绕圈子的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]direct 直接的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">冗长：</font>the use of too many words to express an idea</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]your papers have to be five pages long, but that's five pages of substance, not circumlocution. 你的论文要求是5 页，但是那5 页都是实质内容，不是废话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diffuseness, diffusion, long-windedness, prolixity, redundancy, verbalism, verboseness, verbosity, windiness,wordage, wordiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conciseness, concision, pithiness, succinctness, terseness  简洁</div>
<h2>circumscribe[sound:circumscribe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">限制：</font>to limit narrowly; restrict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Teammates circumscribed his enthusiasm so as not to make the losing side feel worse.  队友们抑制了他的热情为了不让失败者更难过。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cap, limit, confine, delimit, restrict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exceed  超过，超越</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">包围，围绕：</font>to surround by or as if by a boundary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fields circumscribed by tall trees  被高树包围的地方 || Circumscribe a circle around a square.  画正方形的外接圆。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]surround, encompass</div>
<h2>circumspect[sound:circumspect.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">谨慎的；小心的：</font>careful to consider all circumstances and possible consequences: prudent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The banks should have been more circumspect in their dealings.  银行本应该在它们的交易当中更加谨慎。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alert, careful, gingerly, guarded, heedful, prudent, cautious, chary, wary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careless, incautious, unmindful, unwary  不小心，不谨慎的；audacious, reckless  大胆的，鲁莽的</div>
<h2>circumvent[sound:circumvent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">躲避（不遵从）：</font>to avoid having to comply with (something) especially through cleverness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]circumvent all the red tape  绕过所有官方程序繁文缛节 || He found a way to circumvent the law.  他发现了一个逃避法律的方法。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avoid, bypass, dodge, sidestep, skirt, get around</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comply with, follow, obey, observe  遵从；confront, direct encounter  直接面对</div>
<h2>civility[sound:civility.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">彬彬有礼：</font>courteous behavior; politeness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They greeted us with civility.  他们有礼貌地招呼我们。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]politeness, courtesy, politeness, genteelness, gentility, graciousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discourteousness, discourtesy, impoliteness, incivility, rudeness, surliness, ungraciousness 无礼，粗鲁</div>
<h2>claim[sound:claim.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">要求 （权利）：</font>to ask for especially as a right</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fragile claim to fame  对名誉不切实际的要求 || After many years had passed, he suddenly appeared toclaim his inheritance.  很多年已经过去，他突然出现要求继承遗产。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]call for, command, quest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]renounce  放弃</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">断言：</font>to state as a fact usually forcefully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]People claim that they have been kidnapped by aliens. 人们断言称他们被外星人绑架了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allege, assert</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deny, gainsay  否认</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">剥夺生命：</font>to deprive of life</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Cancer claims hundreds of thousands of Americans each year. 癌症每年要剥夺成千上万美国人的生命。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]animate 使有生命</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】n. <font color="#aa00ff">权利：</font>a legal right to participation in the advantages, profits, and responsibility of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A shareholder has a claim in the business.  股东在企业有权利（收益权、选举权等）。</div>
<h2>clandestine[sound:clandestine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">隐藏的，秘密的：</font>kept or done in secret, often in order to conceal an illicit or improper purpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]their clandestine love affair 他们的秘密恋情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]secret, covert, furtive, surreptitious, sneaky, stealthy, undercover, underground, underhand, underhanded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]open, overt, public  公开的；  aboveboard 光明正大的</div>
<h2>clarion[sound:clarion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">清楚响亮的：</font>loud and clear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]clarion call for democracy 对民主的高声呼吁 || The Internationale is a clarion call to the labouring peopleof the world.     《国际歌》是唤起全世界劳动人民的响亮号角。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]soft and indistinct 柔和模糊的</div>
<h2>clarity[sound:clarity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n.<font color="#aa00ff">清晰、清楚：</font>the quality or state of being clear: lucidity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Clarity of diction is vital for a XDF teacher. 发音清楚对新东方老师来说是至关重要的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clarity, explicitness, lucidity, lucidness, perspicuity, perspicuousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obscureness, obscurity, unclarity 模糊，不清晰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]clarify v. 澄清，使清晰：to free of confusion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]clarify his mind  理清思路；clarify a subject  澄清某一问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]purify, clear, elucidate, explain, illuminate, illustrate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obfuscate, obscure</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">清澈透明：</font>the state or quality of being easily seen through</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mountain streams with water of incredible clarity 难以置信般清澈透明的山涧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clearness, limpidity, limpidness, translucence, translucency, transparency</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cloudiness, opacity, opaqueness, turbidity, turbidness 浑浊，不透明</div>
<h2>clasp[sound:clasp.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 紧握：the act or manner of holding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Be careful that your clasp on the cat isn't too tight, or she could get hurt.  注意别抓那只猫太紧，否则她会受伤的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clench, grapple, grasp, grip, handgrip, handhold</div>
<h2>clement[sound:clement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">宽容的，善良的：</font>tolerant and kind in the judgment of and expectations for others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Clement judge  reduced the sentence. 仁慈的法官减轻了刑罚。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charitable, lenient, merciful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]harsh, severe, stern, strict  严厉的,严格的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]clemency n. 仁慈</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">气候温和的：</font>marked by temperatures that are neither too high nor too low</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Hawaii is known for its delightfully clement climate. 夏威夷以它宜人的温和气候著称。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mild, genial, gentle, balmy, equable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]harsh, inclement, severe 严酷的</div>
<h2>cliché[sound:cliché.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./ adj. 陈词滥调（的）：a hackneyed theme, characterization, or situation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Cliché is a feature of bad news. 拙劣的新闻的特征是使用陈词滥调。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banality, bromide, platitude, trite, bathetic, hackneyed, stereotypical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fresh, new, original, creative 新的，创造性的</div>
<h2>clog[sound:clog.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">阻碍物：</font>something that makes movement or progress difficult</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]impede with a clog  用障碍物阻止</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balk,  bar,  block,  deterrent,  drag,  fetter,  holdback,  hurdle,  impediment,  inhibition,  interference,  obstacle, obstruction, shackles, stop, stumbling block, trammel</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">阻碍：</font>to create difficulty for the work or activity of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They always clog the courts. 他们一直阻挠法庭工作。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]encumber, fetter, hinder, hold back, hold up, impede, inhibit, interfere with, obstruct, shackle, stymie, tie up,trammel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aid, assist, help  帮助；facilitate  促进</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">堵塞：</font>to prevent passage through by filling with something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Within a few years the pipe began to clog up. 没有几年，管子就开始堵塞了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]block, choke, clot, gum up, jam, obstruct, occlude, stop up, stuff</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear, free, open up, unblock, unclog, unstop</div>
<h2>clot[sound:clot.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">密集的一群：</font>a number of things considered as a unit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A clot of daisies occupied one corner of the flower bed. 一簇雏菊占据了花床的一角。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]array, assemblage, band, block, bunch, cluster, clutch, collection, constellation, grouping, huddle, knot, lot, muster, package</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">堵塞：</font>to prevent passage through by filling with something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Within a few years the pipe began to clog up. 没有几年，管子就开始堵塞了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]block, choke, clog, gum up, jam, obstruct, occlude, stop up, stuff</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear, free, open up, unblock, unclog, unstop</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">凝结：</font>to turn from a liquid into a substance resembling jelly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Scabs form over cuts when your blood starts to clot.  当血液开始凝结的时候，伤口处会形成血痂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]congeal, jell, jelly</div>
<h2>cloudburst[sound:cloudburst.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">突然一场暴雨：</font>a sudden copious rainfall</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The weatherman warned of possible cloudbursts in the afternoon. 天气预报员警告到下午可能有暴雨。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]downfall, downpour</div>

<h2>clumsy[sound:clumsy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">笨拙的：</font>lacking or showing a lack of nimbleness in using one's hands；a lack of skill and tact</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]turn out to be a clumsy sleight of hand 弄巧成拙</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]awkward, ham-handed, heavy-handed, maladroit, unhandy, bungling, inept, maladroit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adroit, deft, dexterous, dexterous, handy 熟练的，灵巧的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不文雅的：</font>lacking  social  grace  and assurance；showing an  inability  to move in a  gracefulmanner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be clumsy on the dance floor 在舞池表现不优雅的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]awkward, graceless, ungainly, gauche, inelegant, rustic, ungraceful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]graceful, urbane, refined</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. 不精致的hastily or roughly constructed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A clumsy mock-up of the real thing  一个粗糙的实物模型</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rough, unrefined</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]refined 精致的</div>

<h2>coeval[sound:coeval.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">同时代的，同龄的：</font>of the same or equal age, antiquity, or duration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Two stars thought to be coeval because they have nearly the same mass and brightness.  两个星星同龄因为他们的质量和亮度几乎相同。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coetaneous, coexisting, concurrent, contemporaneous, simultaneous, synchronic, synchronous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]asynchronous, noncontemporary, nonsimultaneous  不同时的</div>
<h2>cogent[sound:cogent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人信服的：</font>appealing forcibly to the mind or reason: convincing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Six Sigma is  one of the  most cogent methods  for modern enterprises to control quality and optimizingprocess. “六西格玛”方法是现代企业进行质量控制和工艺优化最令人信服的方法之一。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]convincing, compelling, conclusive, telling, persuasive, satisfying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unconvincing, unpersuasive 不令人信服的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">相关的：</font>pertinent, relevant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a cogent analysis  一项相关的研究</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apropos, germane, relative, relevant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extraneous, irrelevant, impertinent, irrelative 无关的</div>

<h2>collapse[sound:collapse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">突然倒塌或收缩：</font>to fall or shrink together abruptly and completely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]President Bush is vowing to rebuild bridge which collapsed last year. 布什总统发誓要重建这座去年坍塌的桥梁。|| One ant-hole may cause the collapse of a thousand-li dyke. 千里之堤，毁于蚁穴。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compact, condense, constrict, constringe, contract , implode, squeeze</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decompress, expand, open, outspread, outstretch 展开，扩张</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">完全耗尽体力：</font>a complete depletion of energy or strength</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He suffered a mental collapse under the strain of studying for his bar exam. 他在紧张的律师考试的复习下脑力消耗殆尽。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exhaustion, tiredness, lassitude, weariness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]refreshment, rejuvenation, revitalization  重新充满活力</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v./n. 失败  to be unsuccessful/ a falling short of one's goals</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the legal case collapsed in the face of the opposition's evidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defeat, nonachievement, nonsuccess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accomplishment, achievement, success</div>
<h2>collude[sound:collude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">串通，共谋（做坏事）：</font>to act together secretly to achieve a fraudulent, illegal, or deceitful purpose;conspire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]collude with competitors to control the price  与竞争者合谋以控制价格</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]connive, conspire, contrive, intrigue, machinate, put up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]act independently 单独行动</div>

<h2>coltish[sound:coltish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不守纪律的：</font>not subjected to discipline</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disciplined 遵守纪律的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">爱开玩笑的：</font>given to good-natured joking or teasing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Off camera the actor is high-spiritedly coltish, but turns serious once the camera starts rolling.  镜头下这个演员是很喜欢开玩笑，但是当镜头开启，他就马上变得严肃了起来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antic, frisky, frolicsome, larky, spotftul</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]earnest, serious-minded, sober  严肃的</div>
<h2>coma[sound:coma.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">昏迷，深度无知觉：</font>a state of profound unconsciousness caused by disease, injury, or poison</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The girl lay in a coma for three days after the accident.  那个女孩在事故之后已经昏迷了三天了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]insensibility, blackout, knockout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consciousness, awareness 有知觉</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">迟钝，冷漠：</font>a state of mental or physical sluggishness : torpor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sluggish, torpor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]activity, animation  有活力；alacrity  敏捷</div>
<h2>combustible[sound:combustible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可燃的：</font>capable of igniting and burning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]release a combustible gas  释放出可燃性气体</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burnable, combustive, flammable, ignitable, inflammable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]incombustible,  nonburnable,  noncombustible,  nonflammable,  noninflammable,  unburnable  不可燃的； fireproof  防火的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">容易激动的：</font>easily excited</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a high-strung combustible temper 一碰就火的性格</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excitable, agitable, touchy</div>
<h2>comely[sound:comely.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">漂亮的，吸引人的：</font>pleasing and wholesome in appearance; attractive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a comely young woman  年轻美丽的女人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attractive,  cute, fair,  good-looking,  gorgeous,  handsome,  lovely,  pretty,  ravishing, well-favored,  seemly.stunning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]homely, ill-favored, ugly unattractive, unbeautiful, uncomely, uncute, unhandsome, unlovely, unpleasing, unpretty 不好看的</div>

<h2>commencement[sound:commencement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">开始：</font>a beginning; a start.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There  was  a  large  turnout  at  the  commencement  of  the  conference,  but  the  numbers  dwindled  as  itprogressed.  在会议开始的时候，有很多人出席。但是随着会议的发展，人慢慢变少了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]birth, onset, outset, start, genesis, inception, nascence, threshold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]close, conclusion, end, ending 结束</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. 毕业典礼the ceremonies or the day for conferring degrees or diplomas</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The purpose of a commencement speaker is to dispense wisdom. 毕业典礼的演讲者的目的是传播智慧。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]matriculation 录取入学</div>
<h2>commend[sound:commend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">赞扬：</font>to mention with approbation: praise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Jason commended his students' studious attitude. Jason 表扬了他的学生的用功的态度。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]approbate, praise, acclaim, applaud, compliment, eulogize, extol</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blame, criticize,  reprehend,  reprobate, chide,  rebuke,  reprimand,  reproach,  reprove, censure, admonish berate, deplore, execrate 责备，批评，谴责诅咒，憎恶，痛骂</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">委托保管：</font>to entrust for care or preservation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I commend my fate into your hands. 我的命运就拜托给你了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commit, delegate, deliver, entrust, confide, consign, hand over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hold, keep, retain</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">推荐：</font>to recommend as worthy of confidence or notice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I commend this book to anyone interested in learning more about American history. 我把这本书推荐给所有对美国历史感兴趣的人。</div>
<h2>commensurate[sound:commensurate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">同样大小的：</font>equal in measure or extent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Five yards is commensurate with fifteen feet. 5码等于15 英尺。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]equal, tantamount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unequal, disparate, preponderant 不相同的，（重量，重要性，数量上）超过的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">相称的，相当的：</font>corresponding in size or degree; proportionate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a job commensurate with her abilities  一份与她能力相称的工作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commensurable, commensurate, proportionate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disproportionate 不相称的</div>
