<h2>comply[sound:comply.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">遵从：</font>to  conform, submit, or adapt (as to a regulation or to another's wishes) as required orrequested</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the  devices  comply  with  industry  standards  设备要遵循工业标准 ||  There  will  be  penalties  againstindividuals who fail to comply. 谁不遵从谁就会受到惩罚。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conform, submit, observe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defy, disobey, rebel against, violate, breach, transgress  违背</div>
<h2>compose[sound:compose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使镇定：</font>to free from agitation: calm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She took a deep breath and composed herself. 她做了一个深呼吸，控制住了自己的情绪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contain, settle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitate, discompose, disquiet, disturb, perturb, upset, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]composed adj. 镇静的，安定的：free from agitation: calm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]distraught, restless 发狂的，不平静的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]composure n. 镇定：a calmness or repose especially of mind, bearing, or appearance</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">组成，构成：</font>to form the substance of : constitute</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]composed of many ingredients 有很多配料组成</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constitute, comprise, make up</div>
<h2>compound[sound:compound.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">混和物：</font>composed of or resulting from union of separate elements, ingredients, or parts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mixed the chemicals together to form a new compound 将化学试剂混合形成新的化合物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]admixture, alloy, amalgam, amalgamation, cocktail, combination, composite, fusion, intermixture, meld, mix, conflation, synthesis</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">混合的：</font>consisting of two or more substances, ingredients, elements, or parts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a compound word  复合词 || “Steamboat” is a compound noun. “汽船”是一个复合名词。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amalgamated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]noncompound  非混合的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">混合：</font>to put or bring together so as to form a new and longer whole</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the German language's propensity for compounding words 德语喜欢复合单词</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chain, conjugate, couple, hook, interconnect, interlink, join, link, yoke</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disconnect, disjoin, disjoint, dissever, disunite, separate, unchain, uncouple, unhitch, unyoke 分开</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">扩大，增多：</font>to make greater in size, amount, or number</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We compounded our error by waiting too long to call for help.  我们等着不寻求帮助会增大我们的错误。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]Aggrandize, amplify, augment, boost, enlarge, escalate, expand, extend, raise, swell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abate, decrease, diminish, dwindle, lessen, lower, minify, reduce 缩小，减少</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法5】v. <font color="#aa00ff">和解：</font>to agree for a consideration not to prosecute (an offense)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]compound a felony 私了案件</div>
<h2>compress[sound:compress.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">压缩 （体积）：</font>to reduce in size or volume as if by squeezing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]compress a computer file  压缩电脑文档 || The science textbook compresses a lot of information abouthuman reproduction into a few short chapters. 科学教科书将人类的生殖知识压缩成了几个短章节。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capsule, collapse, compact, condense, constrict, constringe, contract, shrink, telescope</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]increase in volume, decompress, expand, outspread, outstretch 体积增大，扩张；balloon  膨胀</div>
<h2>compromise[sound:compromise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">妥协：</font>to adjust or settle by mutual concessions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Eventually we reached a compromise on the number of hours per week that would be devoted to pianopractice. 最后我们在每周练琴的时间上妥协了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accommodation, negotiation</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使危险：</font>to place in danger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Officials were concerned that his statements would compromise  national security.  官员们认为他的言论会危害国家安全。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hazard, imperil, jeopardy, jeopardize, menace, peril, venture</div>
<h2>compunction[sound:compunction.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">焦虑：</font>anxiety arising from awareness of guilt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]compunction of conscience  良心不安 || a brutal murderer who killed without compunction  一个野蛮没有良心的杀人犯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anxiety, misgiving, scruple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absence of misgiving 不担忧</div>
<h2>concatenate[sound:concatenate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">连结，混合：</font>to put or bring together so as to form a new and longer whole</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The movie actually concatenates several episodes from various books into one extended narrative.  这部电影把很多书中的片段混合成了一个故事。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catenate, chain, couple, hook, interconnect, interlink, join, link, yoke</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disconnect, disjoin, disjoint, dissever, disunite, separate, unchain, uncouple, unhitch, unyoke  分开</div>
<h2>concave[sound:concave.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凹的：</font>curved like the inner surface of a sphere</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a concave lens 凹透镜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dented, depressed, dished, indented, recessed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bulging, convex, protuberant 凸的</div>
<h2>conceal[sound:conceal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">隐藏，隐瞒：</font>to prevent disclosure or recognition of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Drunkenness reveal what soberness conceal. 酒后吐真言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cache, secrete, disguise, mask, occult, ensconce</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]display, exhibit  展示；bare, disclose, expose, reveal, uncover, unmask  揭露</div>
<h2>concede[sound:concede.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">承认：</font>to grant as a right or privilege</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She grudgingly conceded his point. 她不情愿的承认了他的观点。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acknowledge, grant, confess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]refuse to grant  , deny 拒绝承认，否认</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]concession n. 让步: the act of yielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggression 侵犯</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">停止抵抗：</font>to cease resistance (as to another's arguments, demands, or control)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He conceded as soon as it became clear that he could not win. 当他明显赢不了的时候他就停止了抵抗。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capitulate, give in, quit, submit, succumb, surrender</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resist 抵抗</div>
<h2>concentrate[sound:concentrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">集中：</font>to bring or direct toward a common center or objective : focus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]concentrate one’s efforts  集中精力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]center, focus, rivet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deploy, dispel, disperse, dissipate 散开，驱散</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">浓缩：</font>to make less dilute</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]prolonged boiling is required to concentrate the sap when making maple syrup</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]condense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dilute, water down  稀释</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">聚集：</font>to come together in one body or place</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]recent immigrants tend to concentrate in port cities. 进来的移民倾向于聚集在海港城市。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accumulate, amass, assemble, collect, congregate, garner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dispel, disperse, dissipate, scatter, break up, disband 驱散，解散</div>
<h2>concerted[sound:concerted.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">共同完成的：</font>planned or accomplished together</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The ITER project, commendable though it is, should be merely a component of a concerted effort. “国际热核聚变实验堆”计划虽然是值得称赞的，但是它仅仅是（人类）齐心协力的一部分。|| A victory results from theconcerted effort of the entire team. 一项成功来自于整个团队的齐心协力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collaborative, combined, cooperative, united</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]separate  分开的；individual, single, sole, solitary  单独的</div>
<h2>conciliate[sound:conciliate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">平息，抚慰：</font>to lessen the anger or agitation of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A principal trying to conciliate the parents who did not receive their tickets to the graduation ceremonies.  校长试着平息这对没有收到他们的毕业晚会门票的家长的气愤情绪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appease, pacify, assuage, conciliate, mollify, placate, propitiate, calm (down), ease, soothe, palliate, disarm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]annoy, enrage, vex, nettle, rile, incense, inflame, exasperate, infuriate, discompose, disturb, perturb, upset烦扰，激怒，打扰</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">调解：</font>to make compatible : reconcile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It will be hard to conciliate the views of labor and management regarding health benefits. 调解劳资双方对于健康保险金的观点很难。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attune, reconcile, coordinate, accommodate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discontent  不满；disharmonize  使不和谐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conciliatory adj. 调和的，安抚的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contentious  好争吵的；belligerent 好战的</div>
<h2>concise[sound:concise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">简洁的：</font>marked by brevity of expression or statement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a clear and concise account of the accident 一个清楚间断的事故描述 || Concise Design of SpacecraftAutomatic System 航天器自动控制系统简要设计</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aphoristic, compendious, curt, laconic, pithy, succinct, terse, elliptical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circuitous, circumlocutory, diffuse, long-winded, prolix, verbose, windy, wordy  冗长的</div>
<h2>concord[sound:concord.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n．一致，和睦：harmony or agreement of interests or feelings; accord</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]No discord, no concord.  不打不成交</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comity, compatibility, peace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conflict, discord, dissension, variance 冲突，不和</div>
<h2>concur[sound:concur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">同意：</font>to express agreement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]concur with an excellent opinion 同意一个好的想法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agree, coincide</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]differ, disagree 不同意</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">同一时间发生、存在：</font>to occur or exist at the same time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The race to the moon, the Vietnam War, and the civil rights movement all concurred in the  1960s.  登月，越战和人权运动都发生在二十世纪六十年代。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coexist, synchronize, co-occur</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">团结合作：</font>to participate or assist in a joint effort to accomplish an end</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]All people concurred to pass the reform legislation 所有人都联合起来使改革的法案通过。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]band together, collaborate, concert, conjoin, league, team up, unite</div>
<h2>condescending[sound:condescending.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">摆出高人一等的姿态的：</font>displaying a patronizingly superior attitude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]treat sb. in a condescending manner 以屈尊俯就的态度对待某人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]patronizing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]condescension n. 屈尊俯就：patronizing attitude or behavior</div>
<h2>condign[sound:condign.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">应得的，恰当的：</font>deserved, appropriate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]condign  punishment  应得的惩罚 ||  A  suspension  without  pay  is  condign  punishment  for  breaking  thecompany's code of business ethics  停职是违反公司商业道德准则应得的惩罚。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]due, deserved, merited, justified, warranted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undeserved, undue, unmerited 不应得的</div>
<h2>condole[sound:condole.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">表达同情：</font>to express sympathetic sorrow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We condole with him on the death of his father. 我们对他父亲的死向他深表同情。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compassionate, sympathize with, yearn over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]condolence n. 同情; sympathy with another in sorrow</div>
<h2>condone[sound:condone.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">宽恕，忽视：</font>to overlook, forgive, or disregard (an offense) without protest or censure.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]By his silence, he seemed to condone their behavior. 他的沉默流露出了他对他们行为的宽恕。||  He  istoo quick to condone his friend's faults.  她太快了以至于忽视了他朋友的过错。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disregard, ignore, overlook, remit, shrug off, gloss over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]denounce  谴责；exact  强求</div>
<h2>conducive[sound:conducive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有益的，有促进的：</font>tending to promote or assist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be conducive to education  于教育有利的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The state's long-standing low tax is conducive to entrepreneurship.  政府长期的低税率有利于创业者。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]facilitative, useful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unhelpful, useless 无用的</div>
<h2>confident[sound:confident.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有信心的，自信的：</font>having or showing assurance and self-reliance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Thicker and fuller hair would make a man more confident at work. 越来越浓密的头发让男人在工作中更加自信。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assured, self-assured, self-confident</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diffident  不自信的</div>
<h2>confine[sound:confine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">禁闭，监禁：</font>to shut or keep in, especially to imprison</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The thief was confined in a prison. 小偷被关在监狱里。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]imprison, commit, confine, immure, incarcerate, jail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discharge, free, liberate, release 释放</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">限制：</font>to keep within limits</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Please confine yourself to the subject  请不要离题。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]limit, circumscribe, restrict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exceed 超越，超过</div>
<h2>confluence[sound:confluence.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">汇合，混合：</font>the coming together of two or more things to the same point</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a happy confluence of beautiful weather and spectacular scenery during our vacation 旅途中美好的天气和壮丽的景色令人欣喜的汇合</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conjunction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]divergence 分叉</div>
<h2>confront[sound:confront.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">直接对抗，直面：</font>to come face to face with, especially with defiance or hostility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You must confront your fear in order to conquer it.  要战胜你的恐惧，就必须首先敢于面对</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affront, brazen, encounter, face, meet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dodge, duck, parry, shirk, sidestep 躲避</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]confrontation n. 对抗，冲突</div>
<h2>confound[sound:confound.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使困惑：</font>to throw into a state of mental uncertainty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We are all confounded by his self-contradictory claims. 我们都对他自相矛盾的言论感到困惑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baffle, bewilder, confuse, muddle, perplex, puzzle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarify  使清醒</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">无法区分，混淆：</font>to fail to differentiate (a thing) from something similar or related</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I think you must have confounded astrology with astronomy.  我想你一定是把占星术和天文学搞混了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]misidentify, mistake, mix up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discriminate, distinguish 区分</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">证明为假，证伪：</font>to prove to be false</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]new discoveries that confounded much of what archaeologists thought they have known about the ancientMayan civilization 一些新的发现，它们颠覆了考古学家们长期以来对于古代玛雅文明的认识</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belie, debunk, falsify, disprove, rebut, refute</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confirm, validate, verify 证实，证明为真</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]confounding adj. 使人困惑的</div>
<h2>congeal[sound:congeal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v.<font color="#aa00ff">凝固，固化：</font>to change from a fluid to a solid state by or as if by cold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The blood had started to congeal. 血液开始凝结了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coagulate, solidify, indurate, clot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]melt, liquefy 熔化，液化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]congealment n. 凝固</div>
<h2>congenial[sound:congenial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">和善的，友好的：</font>having or marked by agreement in feeling or action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a congenial host who invited us for a feast 一位邀请我们美餐一顿的和善主人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agreeable, amicable, compatible, unanimous, united</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discordant, incompatible 不和睦的，不和谐的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人愉悦的：</font>giving pleasure or contentment to the mind or senses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a couple relaxing in the congenial atmosphere of a luxury health SPA 一对沉浸在奢华水疗寓所中令人愉快气氛里的夫妻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delightful, dulcet, felicitous, palatable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unpleasant 令人不悦的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]congeniality n. 友善</div>
<h2>congruent[sound:congruent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">和谐一致的：</font>being in agreement, harmony, or correspondence; congruous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a theory congruent with the known facts 一个与已知事实相一致的理论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consonant, compatible, consistent, harmonious, accordant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disagreeable 不一致的；conflicting, incompatible  冲突的，不可协调的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">全等的：</font>coinciding exactly when superimposed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]These two triangles are congruent. 这两个三角形是全等的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]identical, exact</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disparate 迥异的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]congruity n. 和谐一致</div>
<h2>conjecture[sound:conjecture.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">揣测的结果：</font>a conclusion deduced by surmise or guesswork</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That was only a conjecture, not a fact. 那只是猜测而非事实</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]speculation, supposition, surmise, theory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fact 事实；axiom  公理</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">猜测，估计（大小、数量等）：</font>to decide the size, amount, number, or distance of (something) withoutactual measurement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]calculate, estimate, guess, gauge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]prove 证明</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（没有依据地）认为：</font>to form an opinion from little or no evidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]conjecture that this disease is caused by a defective gene 揣测这种疾病是由基因缺陷导致的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assume, imagine, presume, speculate, suppose</div>
<h2>connive[sound:connive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">暗中合作：</font>to cooperate secretly or have a secret understanding; collude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They connived to take over the throne. 他们密谋篡位</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conspire, intrigue, plot, collude, intrigue, machinate ,put up</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">纵容：假装忽视或并未采取措施阻止错误：</font>to  pretend ignorance of or fail to take action againstsomething one ought to oppose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The guards were suspected of conniving at the prisoner's escape. 警卫人员有纵容犯人越狱的嫌疑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blink, disregard, overlook, wink</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disapprove 反对</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conniver n. 共谋者</div>
<h2>connoisseur[sound:connoisseur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">鉴赏家（尤其艺术领域）：</font>a person who enjoys with discrimination and appreciation of subtletiesand details especially in matters of culture or art</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a connoisseur of wine and cigarette 烟酒鉴赏的行家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aesthete, cognoscente</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">专家：</font>a person with a high level of knowledge or skill in a field</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]works that are highly prized by connoisseurs of art glass 被玻璃艺术制品专家高度赞誉的作品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adept, artist, authority, maestro, master, maven, proficient, virtuoso</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amateur, inexpert, nonexpert 业余者，非专业者；tyro, neophyte 新手</div>
<h2>conscientious[sound:conscientious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">仔细的，一丝不苟的：</font>taking, showing, or involving great care and effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a conscientious researcher  一丝不苟的研究者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careful, exact, heedful, meticulous, painstaking, scrupulous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careless, remiss 粗心大意的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有良心的，正直的：</font>governed by or conforming to the dictates of conscience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a conscientious police officer 一名有良心的警察</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conscionable, ethical, honest, moral, upright, principled, scrupulous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unscrupulous  不正直的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conscience n. 良心</div>
<h2>consensus[sound:consensus.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">一致同意：</font>general agreement; unanimity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The board has finally reached a consensus. 董事会最终达成了一致</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accord, assent, agreement, harmony, unanimity, unison</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disagreement  不同意见</div>
<h2>consequence[sound:consequence.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">结果：</font>something produced by a cause or necessarily following from a set of conditions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]negative consequences of the war 战争带来的负面后果</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aftermath, effect, outcome, result</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]source, origin, cause, antecedent 根源、原因</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">重要性，价值：</font>significance; importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mistake of no consequence  不重要的错误</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]moment, magnitude, weight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]triviality 琐碎的事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]consequential adj. 重要的</div>
<h2>conservative[sound:conservative.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">守旧的，不愿改变的：</font>favoring traditional views and values; tending to oppose change</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a conservative political stance 一个守旧的政治立场</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hidebound, reactionary, die-hard</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]radical, aggressive 激进的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不招摇的，低调的：</font>not excessively showy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dressing in conservative outfits so as to make a good impression at job interviews  身着低调得体的套装以期待在面试时留下一个好印象</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]muted, repressed, low-key, understated, unpretentious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flamboyant, ostentatious, splashy 浮夸的，张扬的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">谨慎小心的：</font>having or showing a close attentiveness to avoiding danger or trouble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He made conservative investments, and so he wasn't ruined when the market went into a free fall. 他只做了一份谨慎保守的投资，以防市场崩盘时不至于破产</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alert, heedful, cautious, circumspect, gingerly, guarded, wary, vigilant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heedless  不谨慎的，莽撞的</div>
<h2>conservatory[sound:conservatory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">温室：</font>a greenhouse for growing or displaying plants</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The college's conservatory is entirely devoted to cultivating and displaying orchids.学校的温室几乎全部用于兰花的种植和观赏了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]greenhouse, hothouse</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">艺术学院：</font>a school specializing in one of the fine arts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an opera conservatory  歌剧学院</div>
<h2>conserve[sound:conserve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">保存，避免浪费：</font>to keep in a safe or sound state, especially to avoid wasteful or destructive use</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]conserve natural resources  保护自然资源</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]husband, preserve, save</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dissipate, lavish, waste, squander 浪费</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conservation n. 保护</div>
<h2>considerable[sound:considerable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（数量上）可观（而值得注意）的：</font>sufficiently large in size, amount, or number to merit attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a considerable amount of fortune 一笔可观的财富</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extensive, substantial, large-scale</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">值得考虑的，重要的：</font>worth consideration; significant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a considerable artist 一位举足轻重的艺术家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]important, significant, consequential, momentous, weighty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]trivial 不值一提的；insubstantial, negligible, nominal, trifling  不要重的，可忽视的</div>
<h2>console[sound:console.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">安慰，藉慰：</font>to alleviate the grief, sense of loss, or trouble of; comfort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Only her children could console her when her husband died. 只有她的孩子们才能安抚她失去丈夫的悲痛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comfort, solace, soothe, calm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]distress, torment, torture 使痛苦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]consolation n. 安慰</div>
<h2>consolidate[sound:consolidate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使联合，统一：</font>to join together into one whole; unite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]consolidate several small school districts  合并了几个小的校区</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unify, combine, amalgamate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dissolve, sunder, fragment 解散</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">加固，使安全：</font>to make firm or secure; strengthen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]consolidate the defense line 加固防线</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enhance, strengthen, fortify, reinforce</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abate, attenuate, undermine, weaken 削弱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]consolidation n. 合并；加固</div>
<h2>consonant[sound:consonant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">和谐一致的：</font>being in agreement or harmony; free from elements making for discord</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His performance was rarely consonant with his reputation. 他的表现与名气大不相符</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]harmonious, compatible, congenial, consistent, congruous, correspondent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conflicting, dissonant, discrepant, inconsistent 不和谐的，不一致的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]consonance n. 和谐，一致</div>
<h2>conspicuous[sound:conspicuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">显而易见的，吸引人的：</font>obvious to the eye or mind, attracting attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a conspicuous change in her appearance  她外貌的明显改变</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apparent, clear, distinct, evident, manifest, plain, patent, noticeable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hidden, concealed  隐藏的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conspicuousness n. 显然性</div>
<h2>conspire[sound:conspire.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">合谋，秘谋：</font>to plan together secretly to commit an illegal or wrongful act or accomplish a legalpurpose through illegal action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A group of POWs conspired to abscond. 一批战俘密谋潜逃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]plot, contrive, connive, cogitate, intrigue, put up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conspiracy n. 密谋</div>
<h2>constitute[sound:constitute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">指派，任命：</font>to appoint to an office, function, or dignity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was constituted manager. 他被任命为经理</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]nominate, designate, authorize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discharge, dismiss 撤除职务；abdicate, resign 退位，辞职</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">构成：</font>make up, form, compose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Water constitutes the greater part of the human body. 人体中包含着大量的水分</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compose, comprise, form</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]constitution n. 构成；宪法；体格</div>
<h2>constrain[sound:constrain.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">限制：</font>to force by imposed stricture, restriction, or limitation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Low temperature constrains the chemical reactivity. 低温降低了化学反应活性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bridle, check, confine, imprison, restrain, trammel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]release 释放</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使人屈服于（压力、感情等）：</font>to cause (a person) to give in to pressure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]constrained by his conscience to tell the truth  受他良心的驱使而说实话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coerce, compel, oblige, sandbag</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]constrained adj. 受限的</div>
<h2>constringe[sound:constringe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使紧缩：</font>to make narrow or draw together</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A styptic pencil stopped the bleeding by constringing the small blood vessels at the site of cut. 止血笔通过挤压伤口处的血管阻止了出血</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capsule, constrict, narrow, compress, squeeze, telescope</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]broaden, expand, outstretch 扩展，扩宽</div>
<h2>construct[sound:construct.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">建造，建立：</font>to form by assembling or combining parts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]construct a new library  建一座新图书馆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assemble, build, fabricate, make, produce, rear, set up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demolish, destroy, raze 摧毁</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">创造，想出：</font>to create or think of by clever use of the imagination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He managed to construct a theory that fits all the facts. 他成功提出了一个与所有事实相吻合的理论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contrive, devise, excogitate, fabricate, vamp up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]construction n. 建设，建造</div>
<h2>consummate[sound:consummate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">专业的，有造诣的：</font>extremely skilled and accomplished</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a consummate liar  一个老练的骗子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accomplished, finished, virtuosic, versed, veteran</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amateur 业余的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无纰漏的，完美的：</font>complete in every detail; perfect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The difficult aria displayed her consummate skill. 高难度的咏叹调展示了她完美的技巧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flawless, impeccable, perfect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defective  有漏洞的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">最高档次的，最大规模的：</font>of the greatest or highest degree or quantity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]maximum, paramount, supreme, top, utmost</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]minimal 最少量的</div>
<h2>contagious[sound:contagious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">传染的：</font>communicable by contact; catching</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]contagious diseases 传染病</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]infectious, pestilent, transmissible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]incommunicable 不传染的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（情绪等）唤起共鸣的：</font>exciting a similar feeling or reaction in others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The enthusiasm of the new club members was contagious.  新成员的热情具有很强的感染力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catching, epidemic, spreading</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contagiousness n. 可传染性</div>
<h2>contaminate[sound:contaminate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">染污，掺杂：</font>to soil, stain, corrupt, or infect by contact or association</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Bacteria contaminated the wound. 细菌感染了伤口</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]pollute, defile, taint, infect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]purify, sanitize 净化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contamination n. 污染；contaminant n. 污染物</div>
<h2>content[sound:content.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使满足：</font>to appease the desires of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]One glass of beer every day could content him.  每天一杯啤酒就能满足他</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]satisfy, gratify, rejoice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discontent 不满足</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">主题：</font>a major object of interest or concern (as in a discussion or artistic composition)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Although I appreciate the poem's lyrical qualities, I don't understand its content.  虽然我很欣赏这首诗歌的节奏美，但我无法理解其主题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]motive, subject, theme, topic</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">内容，内涵：</font>the  idea that is conveyed  or intended to be conveyed to the mind by language,symbol, or action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The speech was filled with fancy words but devoid of any real content. 这篇演讲辞藻华丽，但是没什么实质性内容</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]intention, purport, sense, significance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contented adj. 满足的</div>
<h2>contentious[sound:contentious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">引起争论的：</font>likely to cause contention; argumentative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]contentious contents in a movie  电影中引发争论的内容</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]controversial, disputatious, polemical, scrappy</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">好争论的，好战的：</font>exhibiting an often perverse and wearisome tendency to quarrels and disputes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Tartars were a contentious people who terrorized much of Asia and eastern Europe during the MiddleAges. 鞑靼是一个好斗的民族，他在中世纪时期统治了大片亚洲和东欧的土地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belligerent, bellicose, combative, truculent, litigious, pugnacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dovish, peace-loving 爱好和平的</div>
<h2>contiguous[sound:contiguous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">接壤，相邻的：</font>sharing an edge or boundary; touching</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]contiguous nations at war 交战中的邻国</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjacent, abutting, neighboring, juxtaposed, verging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apart, separate 分开的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contiguity 接壤</div>
<h2>contort[sound:contort.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">扭曲：</font>to twist, wrench, or bend severely out of shape</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a contorted version of the truth 被歪曲的真相</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deform, distort, warp, misshape</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contortion n. 扭曲</div>
<h2>contract[sound:contract.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">契约，合同：</font>a binding agreement between two or more persons or parties, especially one that iswritten and enforceable by law</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a billion-dollar contract from Department of Defense 来自国防部的巨额合同</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agreement, compact, convention, treaty</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">收缩：</font>to reduce in size by drawing together; shrink</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]contract muscle 收缩肌肉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compress, condense, concentrate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]expand 扩展；inflate 膨胀</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">感染疾病：</font>to become affected by a disease or disorder</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]contracted a severe cold that later turned into pneumonia 染上了重感冒，最终发展成肺炎</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catch, get, sicken</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heal  痊愈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contractor n. 承包商</div>
<h2>contravene[sound:contravene.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">违反，反对：</font>to violate, to oppose in argument: contradict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]contravene the proposal with no reservation 毫无保留地反对这一提案</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breach, infringe, transgress, fracture, deny, contradict, gainsay, reject</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]uphold, support, buttress 支持；comply, conform, observe 顺从</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contravention n. 反对；违反，触犯</div>
<h2>contrite[sound:contrite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（因为有罪孽或过错而感到）后悔悲痛的：</font>feeling or  showing  sorrow and  remorse  for a sin orshortcoming</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]too late to feel contrite 现在后悔已为时已晚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compunctious, regrettable, remorseful, apologetic, penitent, repentant, rueful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impenitent, unrepentant 不知悔改的</div>
<h2>contumacious[sound:contumacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不服从的，倔强的：</font>stubbornly disobedient; rebellious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Contumacious insurgents refuse to talk. 不愿服从命令的叛军拒绝对话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balky, contumacious, defiant, insubordinate, intractable, obstreperous, rebellious, recalcitrant,  refractory,restive, ungovernable, unruly, untoward, wayward, willful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obedient, docile, ruly 顺从的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contumacy n. 不服从，反抗</div>
<h2>conundrum[sound:conundrum.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n.<font color="#aa00ff">无法解决的问题，迷：</font>a paradoxical, insoluble, or difficult problem; a dilemma</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a difficult conundrum even for the experts 一道即便是专家也束手无策的难题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enigma, mystery, puzzlement, riddle, secret</div>
<h2>convalesce[sound:convalesce.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">渐渐康复，渐愈：</font>to recover health and strength gradually after sickness or weakness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the time needed to convalesce after an operation 手术后需要用来康复的时间</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]heal, recover, recuperate, recoup, snap back</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggravate, deteriorate, intensify  恶化，加剧</div>
<h2>convenience[sound:convenience.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">便利，方便：</font>fitness or suitability for performing an action or fulfilling a requirement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the convenience of living in megacity 住在大城市的便利</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accommodation, amenity, ease, facility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]burden, millstone 负担</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]convenient adj. 方便的，便捷的</div>
<h2>convention[sound:convention.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">常规，习俗：</font>general agreement on or acceptance of certain practices or attitudes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]By convention, north is at the top of most maps. 按照常规，北方在大多数地图上指向上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]custom, ritual, manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deviation  背离习俗</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">公约，协议：</font>a general agreement about basic principles or procedures</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Under this circumstance Geneva convention does not comply. 此情形下《日内瓦公约》无效</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]treaty, agreement, compact, contract</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大会，集会：</font>a coming together of a number of persons for a specified purpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]attended a convention of mathematicians in California 参加了加州数学家的一次集会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assembly, congress, council, gathering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conventional adj. 传统习俗上的</div>
<h2>converge[sound:converge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v.<font color="#aa00ff">汇集，交汇于一点：</font>tending to move toward one point or one another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the main streets converge on a central square 众主干道在中央广场交汇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]meet, focus, concentrate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diverge, deviate, digress 分离，分岔</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]convergent adj. 汇集的；convergence n. 汇集</div>
<h2>conversant[sound:conversant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">熟悉的：</font>having frequent or familiar association</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]conversant with the accounting system 熟知会计系统</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquaint, aware, familiar, informed, versed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ignorant, unfamiliar 无知的，不熟悉的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conversance n. 熟知，造诣</div>
<h2>convert[sound:convert.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">被改变宗教信仰的人：</font>one that is converted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]proselyte</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt.<font color="#aa00ff">使改变信仰：</font>to bring over from one belief, view, or party to another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]European missionaries converted thousands to Christianity. 欧洲传教士使成百上千的人改信了基督教</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]persuade, proselytize, bring, lead</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">改变，转化：</font>to alter the physical or chemical nature or properties of especially in manufacturing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]convert water into ice 将水转化成冰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alter, change, transform, transfigure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]converter n. 转换器；convertible adj. 可转变的; n. 敞篷跑车</div>
<h2>convex[sound:convex.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凸起的：</font>having a surface or boundary that curves or bulges outward, as the exterior of a sphere</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A convex function has the property that a line joining any two points on its graph lies on or above the graph.凸函数具有如下的性质：其图像上任何两点连线的任何部分都不低于连结两点的函数曲线</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bulging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dent, concave  凹陷的</div>
<h2>convey[sound:convey.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">运输：</font>to take or carry from one place to another; transport</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]goods conveyed by sea 海路运输的货物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carry, transfer, ferry, transmit</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">传递，交流：</font>to impart or communicate by statement, suggestion, gesture, or appearance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]struggling to convey his feelings 挣扎着表达他的情感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conduct, communicate, impart, pass on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]withhold 隐瞒</div>
<h2>conviction[sound:conviction.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">深信，确信：</font>the state of being convinced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a warrior of strong conviction 一名信念坚定的战士</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assurance, certainty, certitude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dubiety, incredulity; uncertainty, incertitude 怀疑；不确定性</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">证明有罪：</font>state of being found or proved guilty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]evidence that led to the suspect's conviction 证明嫌疑犯有罪的证据</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sentence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquittal 宣告无罪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]convict    v. 宣判有罪</div>
<h2>convoke[sound:convoke.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">召集开会：</font>to bring together by or as if by summons</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to convoke Parliament  召开国会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assemble, convene, summon, muster</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adjourn 休会</div>
<h2>convoluted[sound:convoluted.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">复杂的，费解的：</font>complicated; intricate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a convoluted way of describing a simple mechanism 用令人费解的方法解释一个简单的原理</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]complex, knotty, involved, sophisticated, twisted, tangled, labyrinthine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]straightforward 直截了当的</div>
<h2>convulsion[sound:convulsion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">痉挛（强烈的、无法控制的肌肉收缩）：</font>an abnormal violent and involuntary contraction of themuscles</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Convulsions are usually accompanied by loss of consciousness.  痉挛常常伴随着失去意识</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">骚乱：</font>a violent disturbance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a regime in convulsion  动荡中的政权</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commotion, ferment, tumult, upheaval, clamor, tempest, uproar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]serenity, tranquility 宁静</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]convulse    v. 剧烈震动；痉挛</div>
<h2>coop[sound:coop.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">监禁，困于…之中：</font>to confine in a restricted and often crowded area</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Those restless kids were cooped up in the house on a rainy. 雨天那些好动的孩子们被困在房子里</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]box, cage, corral, encage, enclose, envelop, fence, hedge, immure, include, pen, wall</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]free, liberate, release 释放</div>
<h2>copious[sound:copious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">丰富的，大量的：</font>large in quantity; abundant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a copious harvest 大丰收</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]plentiful, abundant, ample, gushing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sparse, dearth, scant 稀少的，缺乏的</div>
<h2>coquette[sound:coquette.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">调情的女子：</font>a woman who makes teasing sexual or romantic overtures; a flirt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A coquette though she might appear to be at first, Violetta from Verdi’s La Traviata is actually yearning fortrue love. 乍看之下，威尔第歌剧《茶花女》中的薇奥莱塔是一个轻浮的女子，但实际上她渴望真爱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]vamp, flirt</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">不认真对待：</font>to deal with something playfully rather than seriously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]interested only in coquetting with her, not marrying her  只想与她保持暧昧关系，而不结婚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]trifle, dally, flirt, mess around</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]coquet    v. 不认真对待，调情；coquettish adj. 调情的</div>
<h2>cordon[sound:cordon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">警戒线：</font>a line or ring of police, soldiers, or vehicles preventing people from entering an area</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a cordon of police  警察围成的警戒线</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]perimeter</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">围城一道防线：</font>to form a protective or restrictive cordon around</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cordoned off the area around the explosion scene  在爆炸现场周边设置警戒线</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]close, obstruct, block</div>

<h2>coronation[sound:coronation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">加冕，加冕礼：</font>the act or ceremony of crowning a sovereign or the sovereign's consort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Two different musical pieces by Mozart (a piano concerto and a mass) are both titled “Coronation”. 莫扎特两部不同的音乐作品（一部钢琴协奏曲和一部弥撒）都被称作“加冕”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enthronement, crowning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abdication  退位</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]coronate    v. 加冕</div>
<h2>corporeal[sound:corporeal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">肉体的：</font>not spiritual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]corporeal suffering 肉体上的折磨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bodily, carnal, corporal, somatic, physical, fleshly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]spiritual 精神上的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有形的，实体的：</font>not immaterial or intangible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]material, physical, substantial, sensible, tangible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]intangible, disembodied, immaterial 无形的，无实体的</div>
<h2>corroborate[sound:corroborate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">用证据或权威证实：</font>to support with evidence or authority; make more certain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]new evidence to corroborate the defendant's story  能证实被告的故事的新证据</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]confirm, authenticate, justify, substantiate, validate, verify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]controvert, contradict, deny  反驳，否认</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">提供证据，支持：</font>to provide evidence or information for (as a claim or idea)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My personal experience does not corroborate your faith in the essential goodness of people . 我的经历可不赞同你关于“人性本善”的信念</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]back, bolster, buttress, reinforce, support</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]corroboration n. 证实</div>
<h2>corrosive[sound:corrosive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">腐蚀性的：</font>tending to destroy slowly by chemical action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Concentrated sulfur acid is highly corrosive. 浓硫酸有极强的腐蚀性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]erosive, caustic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]noncorrosive 无腐蚀性的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">讽刺性的：</font>bitingly sarcastic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]corrosive satire 讽刺性的作品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sarcastic, barbed, acerbic, satiric, acrid, barbed, mordant, tart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]corrosion n. 侵蚀</div>
<h2>corrugated[sound:corrugated.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">褶皱的：</font>shaped into a series of regular folds that look like waves</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]corrugated paper 褶皱的纸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]wrinkled, creased, folded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]smooth 光滑的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]corrugation n. 褶皱，折痕</div>
<h2>cosmopolitan[sound:cosmopolitan.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有世界性眼光的，包容的：</font>having worldwide rather than limited or provincial scope or bearing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a cosmopolitan traveler 云游四海的旅行者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]universal, catholic, global, worldwide</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insular, provincial 狭隘的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]cosmopolitism n. 世界主义，天下主义</div>
<h2>cosset[sound:cosset.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">宠爱：</font>to treat as a pet; pamper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]caress, cuddle, dote, pet, mollycoddle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]slight 怠慢；abuse 虐待</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]cosseted adj. 被宠坏的</div>
<h2>countenance[sound:countenance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">容忍：</font>to put up with (something painful or difficult)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The college administration will not countenance cheating.  大学管理部门决不容忍作弊的存在</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abide, endure, stand, stomach, wear</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">赞成，推崇：</font>to have a favorable opinion of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I don't countenance such behavior in children of any age.  对于任何年龄的孩子，我都不推崇那种行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accept, favor, subscribe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disapprove, frown  表示反对</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">沉着，冷静：</font>evenness of emotions or temper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The doctor’s purposeful countenance was in stark contrast to everyone else's hysteria. 医生带有目的性的沉着与他人的歇斯底里形成了巨大的反差</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aplomb, calmness, composure, sangfroid, serenity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitation, discomposure, perturbation 急躁，焦虑</div>
<h2>counterfeit[sound:counterfeit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">仿制的，假冒的：</font>made in imitation of something else with intent to deceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]counterfeit money  假币</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forged, bogus, spurious, pseudo, feigned, artificial, phony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]authentic, genuine  真实的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">仿制：</font>to make a fraudulent replica of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]counterfeit the signature 仿造签名</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]copy, forge, imitate, simulate, mimic</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">伪装成：</font>to present a false appearance of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to counterfeit a happy expression while visiting a sick friend 在看望患病的朋友时装出一副高兴的样子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affect, assume, fake, pretend</div>
<h2>countermand[sound:countermand.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">取消，撤销：</font>to revoke (a command) by a contrary order</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]countermand an order  撤销命令</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annul, repeal, rescind, revoke, cancel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]approve, permit, sanction 批准</div>
<h2>court[sound:court.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt./n. 追求，献殷勤：to seek the affections of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]court the young lady by bring her flowers every day 通过每天给年轻女孩送花追求女孩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]woo, pursue, invite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]spurn, snub 摒弃，怠慢</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]courteous adj. 彬彬有礼的</div>
<h2>covert[sound:covert.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">隐蔽的，秘密的：</font>not openly shown, engaged in, or avowed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]covert alliance 秘密联盟</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cloistered, hidden, secret, sheltered</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]open, overt, aboveboard 公开的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">隐秘掩护所：</font>a place where a person goes to hide or to avoid others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]set up a covert from which to watch wildlife without being detected 设立了一个隐蔽的野生动物观测点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]concealment, hermitage, hideaway, nest, lair</div>
<h2>covetous[sound:covetous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贪婪的，渴求财富的：</font>marked by  inordinate desire  for wealth or possessions or for another'spossessions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cast covetous eyes on their neighbors’ fields 对他邻居的土地垂涎</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquisitive, avaricious, avid, rapacious, grasping</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easily-satiated  容易满足的；unenvious 不艳羡的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]covet    v. 觊觎，贪婪</div>
<h2>cow[sound:cow.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">恐吓，威胁：</font>to frighten with threats or a show of force</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cow sb. into doing sth. 威吓某人做某事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]intimidate, browbeat, bully, hector, awe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]embolden, encourage, inspirit 鼓励</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]cowed adj. 被吓倒的</div>
<h2>cowardice[sound:cowardice.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">懦弱，不坚定：</font>lack of courage or resolution</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cowardice in the face of danger  面对危险时的懦弱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cravenness, dastardliness, gutlessness, poltroonery, pusillanimity, spinelessness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]courage, guts, pluck               , intrepidness, nerve, stoutness, valiance, valor 勇气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]coward n. 懦夫</div>
