<h2>crux[sound:crux.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">中心，关键点：</font>the basic, central, or critical point or feature</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the crux of the problem  问题的核心所在</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]core, substance, kernel, gist, pivot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]trifle, triviality 无价值之物</div>
<h2>cryptic[sound:cryptic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">秘密的：</font>secret or occult</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cryptic message 秘密的信息</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]covert, furtive, secret, stealthy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]public, open 公开的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">含义模糊的：</font>having or seeming to have a hidden or ambiguous meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The senator made some cryptic explanations about the military operations. 参议员就军事行动给出了含糊其辞的解释</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambiguous, equivocal, nebulous, obscure, unclear, vague</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear, explicit, obvious, plain 清晰的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">超出理解能力的：</font>being beyond one's powers to know, understand, or explain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]puzzled by the cryptic e-mail message left on his computer  被他电脑里让人费解的电子邮件而迷惑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arcane, enigmatic, impenetrable, inscrutable, mystic, occult, uncanny</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comprehendible, understandable 可以理解的</div>
<h2>culpable[sound:culpable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">该受谴责的，有罪的：</font>deserving of blame or censure as being wrong, evil, improper, or injurious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]culpable behaviors 值得谴责的行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blameworthy, censurable, guilty, reprehensible, sinful, reproachable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inculpable, innocent 无罪的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]culpability n. 有罪</div>
<h2>cultivate[sound:cultivate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">提升：</font>to improve by labor, care, or study</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cultivate the mind 开化心智</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]educate, instruct, illuminate, nurse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]degrade, deteriorate, impair 损坏，降低品质</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">促进成长，培养：</font>to promote the growth of (a biological culture)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cultivate vegetables 种植蔬菜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grow, breed, produce, raise, develop, nurture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]balk, frustrate, thwart 阻碍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]cultivation n. 栽培</div>
<h2>cumbersome[sound:cumbersome.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">笨重的，难处理的：</font>difficult to handle because of weight or bulk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a cumbersome piece of machinery 一件笨重的机器</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unhandy, ponderous, heavy, unwieldy, onerous ,thorny</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]light, weightless 轻的；handy  容易处理的</div>
<h2>cunning[sound:cunning.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">狡猾的：</font>marked by or given to artful subtlety and deceptiveness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cunning tactics  狡猾的战术</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artful, crafty, devious, foxy, sly, tricky, wily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artless, naive, unsophisticated 天真无邪的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（手工）灵巧的：</font>skillful with the hands</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Only the most cunning cabinetmaker could have crafted such a beautifully proportioned chest of drawers.只有手工超凡的家具工才能打造出如此精致协调的衣柜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clever, deft, handy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heavy-handed, ham-handed 笨拙的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">欺诈，欺骗：</font>the inclination or practice of misleading others through lies or trickery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]used cunning and subterfuge to work her way up the corporate ladder 通过欺骗在公司中步步攀升</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artifice, deception, fraud</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ingenuousness, sincerity 真诚</div>
<h2>curmudgeon[sound:curmudgeon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">脾气坏的爱抱怨的人：</font>an irritable and complaining person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a terrible old curmudgeon 一个坏脾气老头</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crosspatch, fusser, griper, grouser, growler, grumbler, whiner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agreeable person 令人愉快的人</div>
<h2>cursory[sound:cursory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">匆忙的，不注意细节的：</font>acting or done with excessive or careless speed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a cursory glance at the headline  匆匆地瞥了一眼标题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]headlong, overhasty, pell-mell, precipitate, precipitous, rash</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fastidious, thorough, deliberate, unhurried, unrushed 极关注细节的，彻底的，不匆忙的</div>
<h2>curt[sound:curt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">言词简略、直接（以至显得粗鲁）的：</font>being or characterized by direct, brief, and potentially rudespeech or manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his curt reply 他简略而略显粗鲁的回答</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrupt, bluff, brusque, downright, unceremonious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circuitous, mealymouthed 迂回的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">言简意赅的：</font>marked by the use of few words to convey much information or meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]on a daily basis she e-mailed to her commanders curt reports on the situation 她每天向长官做简短汇报</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aphoristic, compendious, elliptical, laconic, pithy, sententious, succinct, terse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diffuse, long-winded, prolix, verbose  冗长啰嗦的</div>
<h2>curtail[sound:curtail.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">缩短，削减：</font>to make less in extent or duration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]curtail your holiday  缩短你的假期</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abbreviate, abridge, syncopate, truncate, cut back</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elongate, protract, prolong, extend, lengthen 延长</div>
<h2>cynic[sound:cynic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">愤世嫉俗者：</font>a person who believes all people are motivated by selfishness.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A cynic might think that the governor visited the hospital just to gain votes. 一个愤青认为州长去医院探视仅仅是为了拉票。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]misanthrope, naysayer, pessimist</div>
<h2>dabble[sound:dabble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">浅尝辄止：</font>to work or involve oneself  superficially  or intermittently especially in a secondaryinterest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dabble in arts  对艺术稍有涉猎</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dedicate, specialize 投入，专门研究</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dabbler    vi. 涉猎者，浅尝辙止者：one not deeply engaged in or concerned with something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He's not a dedicated musician, just a dabbler.  他并不是专门的音乐家,  只不过是个业馀爱好者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]specialist  专家</div>
<h2>daft[sound:daft.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">神经错乱的：</font>having or showing a very abnormal or sick state of mind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The king was clearly daft, talking to trees and rocks. 国王俨然已经疯了，对着树和石头说话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bedlam, demented, deranged, lunatic, psychotic, unbalanced, unsound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]balanced, sane 头脑正常的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不明智的：</font>showing or marked by a lack of good sense or judgment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a daft plan, doomed to wretched failure and merciless ridicule 一个不明智的决定，最终难逃悲催的结局和无情的嘲讽的下场</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fatuous, featherheaded, nonsensical, preposterous, senseless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]judicious, prudent, sagacious, sapient, wise 明智的</div>
<h2>dais[sound:dais.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">主席台，  嘉宾席：</font>a raised platform, as in a lecture hall, for speakers or honored guests.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the speaker took his place at the front of the dais 演讲者在主席台就坐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]podium, rostrum, tribune</div>
<h2>dally[sound:dally.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">虚度时光：</font>to spend time doing nothing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I kept dallying at my desk until I couldn't put off doing my work any longer. 我一直浪费时间直到作业不能再拖了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dawdle, loll, lounge, hang around</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">玩乐：</font>to engage in activity for amusement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he spent his college years dallying, seemingly determined to acquire as little knowledge as possible  他在大学里面尽情玩乐，不学习</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disport, frolic, recreate, rollick, sport</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">慢吞吞，磨磨蹭蹭：</font>to move or act slowly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]don't dally on the way to the interview 别在去面试的路上磨磨蹭蹭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crawl, creep, dillydally, drag, lag, linger, loiter, tarry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dash, hasten, scoot, scurry</div>

<h2>daredevil[sound:daredevil.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj./n. 大胆鲁莽的(人)：foolishly adventurous or bold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His daredevil stunts are sure to end in disaster someday. 玩火者必自焚。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, brash, madcap, overbold, reckless, temerarious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circumspect, guarded, heedful, prudent, wary  小心谨慎的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不考虑后果的：</font>having or showing a lack of concern for the consequences of one’s actions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a daredevil driver who thinks that racing on city streets is a harmless game 不计后果的司机认为在大街上飙车对人无害</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]foolhardy, irresponsible, harum-scarum</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]responsible 负责任的</div>
<h2>dart[sound:dart.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">突然移动：</font>to move suddenly and rapidly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The dog darted across the street. 狗飞奔过马路。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flicker, flitter, flutter</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">公开侮辱：</font>an act or expression showing scorn and usually intended to hurt another's feelings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The darts flew fast and furiously when the two former lovers bumped into each other at the party. 旧情人在party 上偶遇，立马开始激烈的人身攻击。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affront, barb, offense, sarcasm, slight, slur</div>
<h2>daunt[sound:daunt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使胆怯，吓倒：</font>to lessen the courage or confidence of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was not at all daunted by the size of the problem. 她根本没有被问题的大小给吓倒。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demoralize, dishearten, dismay, dispirit, frustrate, unnerve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]embolden, make resolute, hearten 使大胆，鼓舞</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dauntless undaunted a. 无畏的，大胆的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pusillanimous, trepid, craven, easily discouraged, meek, timorous 胆怯的</div>
<h2>dawdle[sound:dawdle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">闲荡，虚度光阴：</font>to spend time idly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dawdle the day away 闲荡一天</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bum, dally, loll, loaf, lounge, hang about, kick around</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hie 匆忙，抓紧</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">拖拖拉拉：</font>to move or act slowly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]If you continue to dawdle, we'll be late for sure. 你要是再拖拉，我们铁定要迟到了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crawl, creep, dally, dillydally, lag, linger, loiter, tarry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bolt, hasten, course, dash, speed, scurry</div>
<h2>deadpan[sound:deadpan.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不动情的言行举止，无动于衷：</font>impassively matter-of-fact, as in style, behavior, or expression</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a deadpan comedy 一个没有笑点的喜剧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catatonic, expressionless, impassive, inexpressive, stolid, vacant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demonstrative, expressive 有表现力的</div>
<h2>dearth[sound:dearth.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">供应不足：</font>an inadequate supply</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dearth of evidence 证据不足</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]want, deficit, insufficiency, paucity, pinch, scantiness, scarcity, undersupply</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plethora, spate, copiousness, abundance, adequacy, amplitude, opulence 过剩，丰富</div>

<h2>defile[sound:defile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（山间）小道：</font>a narrow passage or gorge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They climbed up the mountain through a defile. 他们通过一条小路爬到山上。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">亵渎：</font>to treat (a sacred place or object) shamefully or with great disrespect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]art conservators were careful not to do anything that might defile the holy relic 公物管理员要防止任何玷污圣迹的行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]profane, violate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">不能被使用：</font>to make unfit for use by the addition of something harmful or undesirable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]supplies of meat that had been defiled by maggots 肉已经生蛆了，不能再食用了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]befoul, foul, pollute, taint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decontaminate, purify 使纯净</div>

<h2>defy[sound:defy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">反抗，违抗：</font>to go against the commands, prohibitions, or rules of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]defy the court  蔑视法庭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mock, rebel, oppose, confront</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquiesce, obey, comply with, conform to 默默接受，遵守</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]capitulate to, submit to, succumb to, surrender to, yield to  屈服</div>
<h2>dehydrate[sound:dehydrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">去除水分，（使）干燥：</font>to remove water from; make anhydrous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]bought a dehumidifier in order to dehydrate the damp basement 买了一个减湿器来给地下室除湿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dampen, desiccate, parch, scorch, sear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hydrate, saturate with water, reconstitute  用水浸润</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使失去活力或者味道：</font>to deprive of vitality or savor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]years of being trapped in a loveless marriage had dehydrated his spirit 多年不幸的婚姻消磨了他的活力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deaden, devitalize, enervate, petrify, sap</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brace, energize, enliven, invigorate, vitalize, vivify  使生机勃勃</div>
<h2>deify[sound:deify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">把…当作神来崇拜：</font>to offer honor or respect to (someone) as a divine power</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]some ancient pagans deified such objects of nature as trees and rivers 很多古代的异教徒拿一些自然事物比如树木，河流来崇拜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]glorify, revere, venerate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">过分喜爱：</font>to love or admire too much</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]materialistic people who deify money 那些眼里只有钱的物质之人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adore, adulate, canonize, dote</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">尊敬尊崇：</font>to assign a high status or value to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Valentino was virtually deified by legions of female fans. 瓦伦蒂诺被大批女粉丝崇拜。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggrandize, canonize, dignify, ennoble, glorify, magnify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abase, degrade, demean, humble, humiliate 贬低，羞辱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]deification n. 崇拜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]debasement 贬低</div>
<h2>deject[sound:deject.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使沮丧：</font>to lower the spirits of; dishearten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]nothing dejects a TV pundit more than the reality check that nobody cares what he thinks 没有什么比大家都漠不关心更让电视节目专家沮丧了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]oppress, sadden, weigh down, bum out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brighten, buoy, lighten, rejoice, cheer up 使高兴</div>
<h2>deleterious[sound:deleterious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有害的：</font>harmful often in a subtle or unexpected way</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]deleterious to health 对健康有害的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adverse, baleful, baneful, detrimental, mischievous, nocuous, noxious, pernicious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beneficial, salutary, salubrious, wholesome, benign, harmless, innocuous 有益的，安全无害的</div>
<h2>deliberate[sound:deliberate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">深思熟虑的：</font>characterized by or resulting from careful and thorough consideration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a deliberate decision 一个慎重的决定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]calculated, considered, reasoned, thoughtful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impetuous, haste, casual, unadvised, uncalculated, unconsidered, unstudied 随意的，未经过深思的</div>
<h2>delicacy[sound:delicacy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（外貌、建筑、表演）精致：</font>fineness of appearance, construction, or execution; elegance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lace of great delicacy 精致的蕾丝</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dainty, delectable, kickshaw, tidbit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crudity, husk, coarseness, roughness 粗糙</div>
<h2>delirium[sound:delirium.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">精神错乱：</font>an  acute  mental  disturbance  characterized  by  confused  thinking  and  disruptedattention usually accompanied by disordered speech and hallucinations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shoppers running around in a delirium the day before Christmas 购物者在圣诞节前夕疯狂扫货</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agitation, distraction, hysteria, rage, rampage, uproar</div>
<h2>delusion[sound:delusion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">错觉：</font>a false idea</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This was not optimism, it was delusion. 那不是乐观主义，那是错觉。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hallucination, illusion, unreality, falsehood, misconception</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]truth, verity 真实</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]delusive adj. 欺骗的：false, deceptive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]transparent 坦诚的</div>
<h2>deluge[sound:deluge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大暴雨：</font>a drenching rain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]drizzle 毛毛雨</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大量：</font>a great flow of water or of something that overwhelms</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]received a deluge of offers 收到了一大堆offer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inundation, overflow, spate, torrent</div>
<h2>delve[sound:delve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. vi. 探究，钻研：to make a careful or detailed search for information</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The book delves into the latest research.  这本书深入探究了最近的研究。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]probe, investigate, inquire into, look into, dig into</div>
<h2>demagogue[sound:demagogue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">蛊惑民心的政客：</font>a leader who makes use of popular prejudices and false claims and promisesin order to gain power</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that politician is just a demagogue who preys upon people's fears and prejudices 那就是一个蛊惑民心的政客，利用民众的害怕和偏见来欺骗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]firebrand, fomenter, incendiary, instigator, kindler, provocateur</div>
<h2>demanding[sound:demanding.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难取悦的，难满足的：</font>not easily satisfied or pleased</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His mother could be demanding at times. 他母亲有时候很难取悦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exacting, fastidious, finical, finicking, fussy, picky</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">费时间花心思的：</font>requiring much time, effort, or careful attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the demanding assignment kept them working all night long 那项劳神的任务使得他们熬夜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arduous,  burdensome,  challenging,  exacting,  grueling,  killing,  laborious,  onerous,  persnickety,  taxing,toilsome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]light, unchallenging, undemanding 不费劲的，轻而易举的</div>
<h2>demolition[sound:demolition.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">破坏，毁坏：</font>the act or process of wrecking or destroying, especially destruction by explosives.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the demolition of dangerous buildings 危楼的拆毁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annihilation, decimation, devastation, havoc, wreckage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]building, construction, erection, raising 建造</div>
<h2>demonstrate[sound:demonstrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（通过证据）证明，表明：</font>to show or make clear by using examples</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the  paleontologist hopes to demonstrate that dinosaurs once existed in central Peru by unearthing thefossil evidence 通过发掘化石，古生物学家试图证明恐龙曾经在秘鲁中部生活过</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exemplify, instance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unable to prove 不能证明的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使明白易懂：</font>to make plain or understandable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a few striking facts should demonstrate the complex nature of our topic 一些显著的事实可以使我们话题的复杂本质变得好懂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clarify, construe, demystify, elucidate, explicate, illuminate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obscure 使模糊</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">表现，表露：</font>to make known (something abstract) through outward signs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the babysitter's actions during the emergency demonstrate beyond doubt her general dependability 保姆在紧急情况下的表现毋庸置疑地展示了她一贯的可靠性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bespeak, betray, display, evince, manifest, reveal</div>
<h2>demoralize[sound:demoralize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使士气低落：</font>to undermine the confidence or morale of; dishearten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]demoralize the staff 使员工士气低落</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]daunt, dishearten, dismay, dispirit, unnerve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]invigorate, cheer 鼓舞</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">贬低，堕落：</font>to lower in character, dignity, or quality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]we refused to be demoralized by our humiliating defeat 我们拒绝由于这场屈辱的战败而被贬低</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abase, corrupt, debauch, degrade, demean</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elevate, ennoble, uplift  使崇高</div>
<h2>demotic[sound:demotic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">通俗的，大众化的：</font>popular, common</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]demotic entertainments 大众化的娱乐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]profound  深奥的</div>
<h2>demur[sound:demur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">表示异议，反对：</font>to voice opposition; object</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]demur at the suggestion 反对提议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]challenge, exception, expostulation, fuss, kick, protest, remonstrance, stink</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accept, accede 接受</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">犹豫：</font>hesitation  (as  in  doing  or  accepting)  usually  based  on  doubt  of  the  acceptability  ofsomething offered or proposed; qualm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]we accepted his offer to pay for our dinners without demur 我们毫不犹豫地同意了他买单</div>
<h2>denigrate[sound:denigrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">诋毁，污蔑：</font>to express scornfully one's low opinion of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]denigrate one's opponents  诋毁某人的对手</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belittle, depreciate, derogate, dismiss, disparage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]honor, acclaim, applaud, exalt, extol, glorify, magnify 给以……荣誉，赞扬</div>
<h2>denouement[sound:denouement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（小说的）结局：</font>the final resolution or clarification of a dramatic or narrative plot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a surprising/ unexpected denouement 令人惊奇的、出人意料的结局</div>
<h2>denounce[sound:denounce.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">公开指责：</font>to express public or formal disapproval of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the governor has denounced the court's decision and vows to press for a constitutional amendment 州长公开指责法庭决定不公，准备投票进行修宪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]condemn, objurgate, rebuke, reprimand, reproach, reprove</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cite, commend, endorse 支持，称赞</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">道德上错误、可耻的：</font>to declare to be morally wrong or evil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the church council denounced the bishop's teachings, officially declaring them to be heresy  该教理事会指责主教的布道可耻，声称它们是异端学说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anathematize, censure, execrate, reprehend, reprobate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]denunciation n. 谴责：an act of denouncing especially : a public condemnation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]panegyric, accolade, eulogy 颂词</div>
<h2>dent[sound:dent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">凹陷，凹痕：</font>a depression in a surface made by pressure or a blow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dent in the side of a car 汽车侧面一处凹陷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cavity, depression, hollow, indenture, recess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bulge, convexity, projection, protrusion, protuberance 凸起</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（数量、程度上）变小，变弱：</font>to make smaller in amount, volume, or extent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]hopefully this vacation won't dent our bank account too much 但愿这次旅行不会让我们银行存款缩水太多</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abate, downscale, downsize, dwindle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggrandize, amplify, augment, boost, enlarge, escalate 增大，增强</div>
<h2>denude[sound:denude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">脱去，使赤裸：</font>to divest of covering; make bare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Drought has completely denuded the hills of grass. 干旱脱去了山上的草使山变得光秃秃的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cover 遮盖</div>
<h2>deplete[sound:deplete.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">耗尽，使衰竭：</font>to decrease the fullness of; to make complete use of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]miners depleted the vein of copper ore after only a few months 矿工们在短短几个月内就把一整片铜矿开采完了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consume, devour, drain, exhaust, draw down, play out, use up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enrich, renew, replace 使富有，更新</div>
<h2>deplore[sound:deplore.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">哀悼：</font>to feel or express sorrow for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a statement from the bishops deploring the loss of life in the war overseas 一份来自大主教的声明，对海外战争中遇难的生命表示沉痛哀悼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mourn, bewail, grieve for, wail for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delight, exult in, glory in, rejoice in 高兴</div>
<h2>deploy[sound:deploy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（有目的地）展开；调度：</font>to spread out, utilize, or arrange for a deliberate purpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]deploy a sales force 展开部署销售力量</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concentrate 集中</div>
<h2>deportation[sound:deportation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">放逐：</font>the removal from a country of an alien whose presence is unlawful or prejudicial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]deport all illegal immigrants  驱逐所有非法移民</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banishment, displacement, expatriation, expulsion, relegation</div>
<h2>depose[sound:depose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">发誓作证：</font>to testify to under oath or by affidavit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he was nervous when the time to depose before the jury finally arrived 他很紧张，在陪审团面前作证的时刻终于到来了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attest, swear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]perjure 作伪证</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">废黜，罢免：</font>to remove from a throne or other high position</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a military junta deposed the dictator after he had bankrupted the country  军阀罢黜了将国家分崩离析的独裁者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defrock, deprive, oust, uncrown</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crown, enthrone 授予王权</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">摆放：</font>to arrange something in a certain spot or position</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]deposed her fan and gloves on the dressing table  把她的扇子和手套放在梳妆台上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deposit, dispose, emplace, situate</div>
<h2>deposit[sound:deposit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">自然积累，沉积：</font>a natural accumulation (as of iron ore, coal, or gas)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]rich deposits of oil and natural gas 丰富的石油、天然气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dregs, precipitate, sediment, settlings, hoard, reserve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]process of eroding 腐蚀过程</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">存钱：</font>to put in an account</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]we quickly deposited the check in a bank account  我们火速把支票存入银行账户</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]withdraw  取款</div>
<h2>depravity[sound:depravity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">道德败坏：</font>immoral conduct or practices harmful or offensive to society</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was sinking into a life of utter depravity. 他自甘堕落。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debauchery, iniquitousness, licentiousness, perversion, turpitude, dissoluteness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]morality, virtue 美德</div>
<h2>deprecate[sound:deprecate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">表达不喜欢：</font>to hold an unfavorable opinion of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]deprecates TV sitcoms as childish and simpleminded 批评电视情景喜剧既幼稚又脑残</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deprecate, discountenance, disesteem, disfavor, frown (on or upon)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]approve, favor 喜欢</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">贬低，轻视：</font>to express scornfully one's low opinion of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]deprecate the comedy as the stupidest movie of the year 认为这部喜剧是年度最傻逼电影</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belittle, denigrate, dismiss, disparage, cry down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acclaim, applaud, exalt, extol, glorify  赞扬</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">降低重要性，低调：</font>play down, to make little of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She deprecated her facility for languages 她不炫耀自己对于语言的天赋。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vaunt 自夸</div>
<h2>depreciate[sound:depreciate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">贬低价值：</font>to lower the price or estimated value of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]New cars start to depreciate as soon as they are on the road. 新车一上路便开始贬值。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheapen, depress, devalue, downgrade, mark down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appreciate, enhance, upgrade, mark up 提价，升值</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">轻视：</font>to lower in estimation or esteem</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dared to depreciate Shakespeare, saying his works have no relevance for modern audiences 胆敢贬低莎大人，说他的作品对于现代观众来说没有意义</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]denigrate, disparage, play down, talk down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acclaim, exalt, extol, glorify, magnify  赞扬</div>
<h2>depressed[sound:depressed.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不开心，情绪不高的：</font>feeling unhappiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I was depressed and didn't feel much like going to the party</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crestfallen, dejected, despondent, gloomy, low-spirited, wretched</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blissful, buoyant, gleeful, joyous, jubilant  情绪高的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">生活境况悲催的：</font>kept from having the necessities of life or a healthful environment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a depressed class of people whose living conditions are abominable even by third world standards 境况悲惨的一群人，即使用第三世界标准来看他们的生存条件也是很糟的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disadvantaged, underprivileged</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advantaged, privileged  具有优势的、特权的</div>
<h2>deprivation[sound:deprivation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">匮乏：</font>the condition of being deprived; privation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]serious sleep deprivation caused by long work hours 由长时间工作导致的严重睡眠不足</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fecundity  丰饶</div>
<h2>deracinate[sound:deracinate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">根除：</font>to pull out by the roots; uproot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plant 种植</div>
<h2>derelict[sound:derelict.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">玩忽职守的,  不认真的：</font>lacking a sense of duty; marked by a carelessly easy manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the guards were judged derelict in their duty 守卫们被判玩忽职守罪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disregardful, lax, neglectful, neglecting, remiss, slack</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extremely careful, attentive, conscientious, nonnegligent 特别仔细的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">被社会遗弃的人：</font>a destitute homeless social misfit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a section of the city that seemed to be frequented mostly by derelicts 流浪汉的集中区</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deserted, desolate, disused, forgotten, forsaken, rejected</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pillar of society 社会的栋梁</div>
<h2>deride[sound:deride.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">嘲弄，嘲笑：</font>to speak of or treat with contemptuous mirth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]my brothers derided our efforts, but were forced to eat their words when we won first place  我的兄弟嘲笑我们的努力，但是当我们得了第一名以后不得不收回那些话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gibe, jeer, mock, scout, shoot down, laugh at</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]praise 赞美</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]derision n. 嘲弄：contemptuous or jeering laughter; ridicule</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]veneration 尊敬</div>
<h2>derivative[sound:derivative.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非原创的：</font>lacking originality: banal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]their dull, derivative debut album 他们毫无新义的首张专辑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]secondhand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]original, innovative, precursory 原创的，先驱的</div>
<h2>descend[sound:descend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">下降：</font>to lead or extend downward</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the pathway descends to the river bank 通道一直向下延伸到河岸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dip, fall, plunge, sinkarise, ascend, climb, mount, upsweep, upturn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">世代相传：</font>to originate or come from an ancestral stock or source, to pass by inheritance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The house has descended through four generations. 这座房子已经传了四代。a  tradition  descending from colonial days  殖民时期传递下来的一项传统</div>
<h2>descendant[sound:descendant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">后代：</font>one deriving directly from a precursor or prototype</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They are descendants of the original English and Scottish settlers. 他们是最早一批英格兰和苏格兰定居者的后裔。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forbears 祖先</div>
<h2>desecrate[sound:desecrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">亵渎，玷污：</font>to treat (a sacred place or object) shamefully or with great disrespect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]desecrate the shrine 亵渎圣地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defile, profane, violate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sanctify, revere, hallow  尊敬，视为神圣</div>
<h2>desiccate[sound:desiccate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使（食物）脱水以保存，使干燥：</font>to preserve (a food) by drying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]add a cup of desiccated coconut to the mix 加一杯椰蓉进行搅拌</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dehydrate, parch, scorch, sear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]add water to, hydrate, drench 加水，浸透</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]desiccant n. 干燥剂：a drying agent (as calcium chloride)</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏活力：</font>to deprive of emotional or intellectual vitality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that historian's dryasdust prose desiccates what is actually an exciting period in European history 那位历史学家枯燥无味的散文让欧洲一段扣人心弦的历史变得乏味单调</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brace, castrate, dampen, deaden, devitalize, enervate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]energize, enliven, invigorate, stimulate, vitalize 使生机勃勃</div>
<h2>designate[sound:designate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">任命：</font>to pick (someone) by one's authority for a specific position or duty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he has yet to designate his successor as head of the firm 他还没有给公司选定接班人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assign, commission, constitute, nominate, place</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discharge, dismiss, expel, fire 解雇，开除</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">命名：</font>to give a name to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he was designated Air Jordan by his fans 他被粉丝们称为飞人乔丹</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]denominate, dub, entitle, label, style, term, title</div>
<h2>descend[sound:descend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">下降：</font>to lead or extend downward</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the pathway descends to the river bank 通道一直向下延伸到河岸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dip, fall, plunge, sink</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">世代相传：</font>to originate or come from an ancestral stock or source, to pass by inheritance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The house has descended through four generations. 这座房子已经传了四代。a  tradition  descending from colonial days  殖民时期传递下来的一项传统</div>
<h2>descendant[sound:descendant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">后代：</font>one deriving directly from a precursor or prototype</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They are descendants of the original English and Scottish settlers. 他们是最早一批英格兰和苏格兰定居者的后裔。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forbears 祖先</div>
<h2>desecrate[sound:desecrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">亵渎，玷污：</font>to treat (a sacred place or object) shamefully or with great disrespect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]desecrate the shrine 亵渎圣地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defile, profane, violate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sanctify, revere, hallow  尊敬，视为神圣</div>
<h2>desiccate[sound:desiccate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使（食物）脱水以保存，使干燥：</font>to preserve (a food) by drying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]add a cup of desiccated coconut to the mix 加一杯椰蓉进行搅拌</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]damp, dampen, deaden, devitalize, enervate, dehydrate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]add water to, hydrate, drench 加水，浸透</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]desiccant n. 干燥剂：a drying agent (as calcium chloride)</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏活力：</font>to deprive of emotional or intellectual vitality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that historian's dryasdust prose desiccates what is actually an exciting period in European history 那位历史学家枯燥无味的散文让欧洲一段扣人心弦的历史变得乏味单调</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]castrate, dampen, deaden, devitalize, enervate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]energize, enliven, invigorate, stimulate, vitalize 使生机勃勃</div>
<h2>designate[sound:designate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">任命的，指定的：</font>to pick (someone) by one's authority for a specific position or duty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]ambassador designate  即将上任的大使</div>
<h2>despicable[sound:despicable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人鄙视的：</font>arousing or deserving of one's loathing and disgust</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]even within the prison population, pedophiles are regarded as particularly despicable  即使在囚犯内部，恋童癖者也被认为极其让人鄙视的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contemptible, detestable, dishonorable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]admirable, commendable, creditable, meritorious, praiseworthy  值得赞扬的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不荣耀的，不得体的：</font>not following or in accordance with standards of honor and decency</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the cad's despicable behavior toward women  公车售票员对女性不得体的举动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]currish, dirty, execrable, ignominious, sordid, wretched</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]honorable, lofty, noble, upright, venerable, virtuous 崇高的</div>
<h2>despise[sound:despise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">极其不喜欢：</font>to dislike strongly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I despise anchovies on pizza, and I refuse to eat them. 我鄙视在披萨上的凤尾鱼，所以从来不吃。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abhor, abominate, detest, execrate, loathe, disregard, flout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]love 喜欢</div>
<h2>despotic[sound:despotic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">专制的，暴虐的：</font>arbitrary, autocratic, monocratic, tyrannical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a despotic tyrant 专制的暴君</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]authoritative, dictatorial, imperious, overbearing, peremptory, tyrannous</div>
<h2>desultory[sound:desultory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无计划、无目的的：</font>lacking a definite plan, purpose, or pattern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a desultory search for something of interest on TV  漫无目的的换台</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]digressive, excursive, meandering, rambling, wandering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]carefully planned, strictly methodical, assiduous 精心计划的，有系统的，勤勉的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人失望的：</font>disappointing in progress, performance, or quality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a desultory fifth place finish  让人失望的第五名</div>
<h2>detach[sound:detach.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">分离：</font>to separate or unfasten; disconnect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Detach the white part of the application form and keep it. 撕下申请表的白色部分并予以保留。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]tether 束缚</div>
<h2>detain[sound:detain.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">拘留：</font>to hold or keep in or as if in custody</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]detained by the police for questioning 被警察扣留下问讯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]manumit  释放</div>
<h2>deter[sound:deter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">吓住，威慑：</font>to prevent or discourage from acting, as by means of fear or doubt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wouldn’t be deterred by threats 不被威胁吓住</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dissuade, inhibit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]spur, courage, persuade 激励</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]deterrent adj/ n. 威慑力量，威慑的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]deterrent weapons  威慑性武器; a deterrent to theft  对偷窃的威慑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inducement, incentive 引诱，刺激</div>
<h2>deterioration[sound:deterioration.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">恶化；堕落：</font>a gradual sinking and wasting away of mind or body</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a continuing deterioration in relations between the two countries 两国关系的持续恶化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decadence, degeneration, deterioration, devolution, downfall, downgrade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]improvement, recovery, recuperation, rehabilitation, revitalization 改进，改善</div>
<h2>detour[sound:detour.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">偏离正常标准：</font>a turning away from a course or standard</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]we'll regard this relapse as just a brief detour on your road to recovery from substance abuse 我们把这次旧病复发看成你戒瘾道路上的一个小偏离</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deflection, departure, deviation, divergency</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">改变方向或者路线：</font>to change one's course or direction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]we had to detour for a few miles around the section of highway under construction 我们不得不绕远几公里为了避开正在维修的高速公路路段</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deviate, diverge, sheer, swerve, veer</div>
<h2>detract[sound:detract.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">贬低：</font>to diminish the importance, value, or effectiveness of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It is wrong to detract from the achievements of other people in the same field. 贬低同行是不对的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belittle, depreciate, derogate, disparage, dispraise, write off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extol, praise, eulogize, laud, panegyrize 赞美</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使分心：</font>to draw the attention or mind to something else</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Numerous typos in the text detract the reader's attention from the novel's intricate plot.  许多打印错误把读者分心，不关注复杂的情节了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]divert, abstract, call off</div>
<h2>detritus[sound:detritus.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">废品，碎屑，遗骸：</font>a product of disintegration, destruction, or wearing away: debris</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the detritus of war  战争的遗骸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debris, residue, wreck</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]valuable product 有用的物品</div>
<h2>devoted[sound:devoted.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">投入的，忠诚的：</font>characterized by loyalty and devotion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Good teachers are devoted to learning. 好老师会专心学习。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constant, loyal, allegiant, dedicated, devout, loyal, pious, staunch, steadfast</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disloyal, faithless, perfidious, unfaithful 不忠诚的；recreant, traitorous, treacherous 背叛的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">示爱的，恩爱的：</font>feeling or showing love</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a devoted couple will enjoy sharing their lives with one another.  一对恩爱的情侣喜欢和对方一起度过自己的人生。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adoring, affectionate, fond, tender, tenderhearted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unloving 无爱心的，冷漠的</div>
<h2>devout[sound:devout.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（对于宗教）虔诚的：</font>devoted to religion or to religious duties or exercises</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a devout Buddhist  虔诚的佛教徒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]pious, religious, sainted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]antireligious, impious 不虔诚的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">忠诚的：</font>firm in one's allegiance to someone or something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Devout Mavericks fans never lost faith in Nowitzki. 忠诚的小牛队球迷从来没有对诺维斯基失去信心。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constant, loyal, allegiant, dedicated, devout, loyal, pious, staunch, steadfast</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disloyal, faithless, perfidious, unfaithful 不忠诚的；recreant, traitorous, treacherous 背叛的</div>
<h2>dexterous[sound:dexterous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">动作灵活的：</font>ready and skilled in physical movements</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dexterous surgeon 技术娴熟的外科医生 || The dexterous watchmaker was able to repair the antiquewatch's delicate gears and parts. 手巧的手表匠能够修理古董手表的精密的齿轮和部件。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deft, handy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ham-fisted, ham-handed, handless, heavy-handed, unhandy 手笨的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">头脑灵活的：</font>mentally adroit and skillful: clever</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adroit, clever, cunning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dull, foolish, silly, fatuous, unwise 傻的</div>
<h2>diabolic[sound:diabolic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">恶魔一般的：</font>of, relating to, or characteristic of the devil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The police quickly mobilized to track down the diabolical serial killer.  警察迅速调动起来来追查出这个恶魔般的连环杀人狂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demoniac, demonian, demonic, devilish, satanic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]angelic, seraphic 天使般的</div>
<h2>diaphanous[sound:diaphanous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">模糊的，非实在的：</font>vague or insubstantial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]only a diaphanous hope of success 只有一丝成功的希望</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]vague, obscure, unexplicit, insubstantial, immaterial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]substantial 实在的；clear, distinct 清晰的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（质地精致得）几乎透明的：</font>of such fine texture as to be transparent or translucent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The bride wore a diaphanous veil. 新娘戴着透明的面纱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]transparent, translucent, transpicuous, gossamer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]opaque, impermeable of light 不透明的,  不透光的</div>
<h2>diatribe[sound:diatribe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">长篇抨击性演讲：</font>a long angry speech or scolding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was forced to sit through a long diatribe. 他被迫耐着性子听完一个长篇抨击性演讲。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]tirade, harangue, jeremiad, philippic, rant</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">挖苦，讽刺的指责：</font>ironic or satirical criticism</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The movie reviewer wrote a diatribe of the movie describing it as having excessive sex and violence.那个影评人指责这个电影还有过多的色情和暴力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]irony, satire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]encomium, eulogy, panegyric, tribute, laudatory piece of writing  颂词，赞赏作品</div>
<h2>didactic[sound:didactic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">喜欢说教的：</font>designed or intended to teach</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Parents’ speech to their kids often seems to be painfully didactic. 父母对他们孩子的话都是让人痛苦的说教。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]homiletic, preachy, moralistic, sententious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undidactic 不喜欢说教的</div>
<h2>diehard[sound:diehard.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顽固的，保守的/ n. 顽固的人，保守的人：</font>strongly or fanatically determined or devoted/ someonewho opposes change and refuses to accept new ideas</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some diehard smokers belied the doctors’ suggestion. 一些顽固的烟民违背了医生们的建议。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conservative, hidebound, old-fashioned, reactionary, ultraconservative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]liberal, nonconservative, open-minded, liberal  自由的，开放的</div>
<h2>diffident[sound:diffident.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不自信的：</font>hesitant in acting or speaking through lack of self-confidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is diffident to express his opinions in public. 他在公共场合表达自己的观点时有点害羞</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unassured, bashful, retiring, self-effacing, withdrawn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confident, assured, self-assured, self-confident 自信的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">内向的：</font>reserved in manner; unassertive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was diffident about stating her opinion. 她很内向，表达自己的观点的时候有点害羞。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]introverted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extroverted, outgoing 外向的</div>
<h2>diffuse[sound:diffuse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">罗嗦的：</font>being at once verbose and ill-organized</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a diffuse report 冗长的报告</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circuitous, circumlocutory, long-winded, prolix, verbose, windy, rambling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concise, pithy, succinct, terse, laconic 简洁的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不集中的，扩散的：</font>not concentrated or localized</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]diffuse lighting 散射光</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concentrated 集中的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">扩展，散开：</font>extend, scatter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The photographer uses a screen to diffuse the light. 摄影师用一个屏幕来分散光线。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]spread, extend, disperse, disseminate, scatter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concentrate, center, centralize, focus 集中</div>
<h2>digress[sound:digress.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">脱离主题：</font>to turn aside especially from the main subject of attention or course of argument</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]digress from her prepared subject 脱离她准备好的主题 ||  He  digressed  so  often  that  it  was  hard  tofollow what he was saying. 他经常跑题，以至于我们很难跟上他说的内容。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excurse, ramble, diverge, get off the subject</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]digressive adj.偏离的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discursive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]digression n. 题外话：the act or an instance of digressing in a discourse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aside</div>
<h2>dilapidate[sound:dilapidate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使荒废：</font>to bring into a condition of decay or partial ruin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The house has been dilapidated by neglect. 由于没人照看，这个房子已经要荒废了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ruin, wreck</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]be in use  还在使用；restore 恢复使用；mend, repair 修理；rejuvenate, renew, renovate  翻新</div>
<h2>dilate[sound:dilate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使膨胀，扩大：</font>to enlarge or expand in bulk or extent；to become wide</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The cat dilated its eyes in the darkness. 猫在黑暗中睁大眼睛。||  The  drug  dilates  the  blood  vessels.药使血管膨胀。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]expand, amplify, enlarge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contract 收缩；narrow 使变窄</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">详细表达：</font>to express more fully and in greater detail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He refused to dilate upon his plan for improving the economy in the event that he won the election. 他拒绝在他赢得选举的情况下透露更多关于振兴经济计划的细节。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amplify, develop, elaborate on, flesh out, dilate on, enlarge on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abbreviate, abridge, condense, shorten 删减，缩短</div>
<h2>dilatory[sound:dilatory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">拖延的，磨蹭的：</font>tending or intended to cause delay, characterized by procrastination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dilatory tactics 拖延战术 || The homeowner is claiming that local firefighters were dilatory in responding tothe call.  业主声称本地的消防队员对（火警）电话的有拖延。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delaying, procrastinating, dragging, lagging, tardy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rapid, fast, fleet, precipitate, rocketing, swift hasty, hurrying, scurrying 快速的</div>
<h2>dilettante[sound:dilettante.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./ adj. 业余爱好者（对艺术或知识领域涉猎浅薄者）/  缺乏专业技术的：a person having a superficialinterest in an art/ lacking or showing a lack of expert skill</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Dilettante watch the scene of bustle, adept guard the entrance. 外行看热闹，内行看门道。||  Manydilettante efforts could be seen at the sidewalk art show. 街边艺术展上可以看到很多技术业余的作品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dabbler, amateur, nonexpert, nonprofessional, cognoscente</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]authority, expert, pro, professional, specialist 专家</div>
<h2>diligent[sound:diligent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">勤勉的，辛勤的：</font>characterized by steady, earnest, and energetic effort: painstaking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A new bride is diligent for three days. 新娶媳妇三日勤。|| a student who has been unceasingly diligentin pursuit of a degree in mathematics. 一个不断勤奋追求数学学位的学生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assiduous, industrious, sedulous, engaged, hopping, tied-up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]idle, inactive, unbusy, unemployed, unoccupied 空闲的</div>
<h2>dilute[sound:dilute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">稀释：</font>to make thinner or less concentrated  by adding a liquid such as water/  of relatively  lowstrength or concentration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dilute a color 稀释色彩 || a dilute acid that's safe to handle in the classroom  稀释了的可以安全在教室处理的酸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]thin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]condense, densify, concentrate, thicken 使浓缩</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">削弱：</font>to diminish the strength, flavor, or brilliance of by admixture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The hiring of the new CEO diluted the power of the company's president. 新的 CEO 削弱了董事长的权力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]weaken</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fortify, strengthen 增强</div>
<h2>diminish[sound:diminish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">变小，减少：</font>to become smaller or less</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]diminish an army's strength  削弱军队力量 || The sound of the train diminished as our distance from itincreased.  当我们距离火车的越远时，火车的声音就越小。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abate, dwindle, lessen, lower, reduce, decline</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggrandize, amplify, augment, boost, enlarge, escalate, expand, increase, raise, balloon 增加，增大</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">轻视，贬低：</font>to lessen the authority, dignity, or reputation of : belittle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]diminish a rival's accomplishments  贬低对手的成就</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belittle, deprecate, depreciate, disparage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acclaim, applaud, exalt, extol, glorify, laud, praise 赞美</div>
<h2>din[sound:din.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">喧闹声，嘈杂声：</font>a loud continued noise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The din of the engines was deafening. 引擎的嘈杂声震耳欲聋。|| There's always a great din from thecafeteria during lunch. 午餐时间经常从咖啡店里传来很大的喧闹声。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blare, bluster, cacophony, chatter, clamor, discordance, racket, rattle, roar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]quiet, silence, still 安静</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">重复：</font>to say or state again</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Safety lessons dinned into us over and over. 我们一遍又一遍的进行安全教育。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]iterate, rehearse, reiterate</div>
<h2>dingy[sound:dingy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">昏暗的，肮脏的：</font>darkened with smoke and grime; dirty or discolored.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A dingy room is always Dickensian image of the poor. 一个肮脏而昏暗的房间经常作为狄更斯时代的穷人形象。|| The bed sheets were pretty dingy so we threw them in the laundry pile. 床单太脏了以至于我们把它扔进了脏衣服堆。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]darkened, dirty, bedraggled, bemired, besmirched, dusty, mucky, muddy, nasty, smudged, soiled, sordid,stained, sullied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clean, cleanly, immaculate, spotless, stainless, unsoiled, unstained, unsullied  干净的</div>
