<h2>dire[sound:dire.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不吉利的，不祥的：</font>being or showing a sign of evil or calamity to come</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dire forecast of a plunge in stock prices 股市大跌不祥的预测</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baleful, direful, foreboding, ill-boding, inauspicious, menacing, minatory, portentous, sinister, threatening</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]propitious , unthreatening 吉利的，吉祥的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可怕的，恐怖的：</font>causing fear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a series of dire tremors that hinted at a volcanic eruption 一系列暗示火山爆发的恐怖的震动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alarming,  dire,  direful,  dread,  dreadful,  fearsome,  forbidding,  formidable,  frightening,  frightful,  ghastly, hair-raising, horrendous, horrible, horrifying, intimidating, redoubtable, scary, shocking, terrible, terrifying</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迫切的：</font>needing immediate attention; urgent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There is a dire need for food and medicine in the famine-stricken country. 在闹饥荒的国家迫切需要食物和药品。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]immediate, burning, compelling, critical, crying, emergent, exigent, imperative, imperious, importunate,instant, necessitous, pressing, urgent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nonurgent, noncritical 不迫切的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">悲惨的：</font>causing or marked by an atmosphere lacking in cheer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With stock prices steadily falling, these are dire days on the trading floor.  股价稳步走低，交易大厅一片悲惨的景象。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheerless,  chill,  depressing,  depressive,  desolate,  disconsolate,  dismal,  drear,  dreary,  funereal,  glum,lugubrious, miserable, morose, saturnine, somber, sullen, sunless, wretched</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bright, cheerful, cheering, cheery, festive, gay, sunshiny 愉快的</div>

<h2>disarm[sound:disarm.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">解除武装：</font>to give up or reduce armed forces</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]disarm the captured soldiers 解除被捕士兵的武装 ||  The  defeated  nation  was  disarmed  so  that  it would never again be a threat to international order. 战败国被解除武装，这样一来它就不会再对国际秩序造成威胁了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demilitarize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arm, militarize, put on guard 装备武器</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使息怒，平息抚慰：</font>to lessen the anger or agitation of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her future father-in-law was totally disarmed by her words. 她未来的继父听了她的话彻底没脾气了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appease, assuage, conciliate, gentle, mollify, placate, propitiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]anger, enrage, incense, inflame, enflame, infuriate, ire, madden, outrage  煽动激起</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使无害：</font>to make harmless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]disarm a bomb 拆除炸弹</div>
<h2>disarray[sound:disarray.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">混乱，无秩序：</font>a lack of order or sequence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The room was in disarray. 房间一片混乱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]confusion, disarrangement, disorder, disorderliness, disorganization, havoc, mess, messiness, misorder,muddle, muss, shambles, jumble, welter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]order, orderliness 有序</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使混乱：</font>to undo the proper order or arrangement of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Changing offices disarrayed my papers completely. 办公室搬迁，使我的文件全部乱套了.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]confuse, disarrange, discompose, dishevel, dislocate, disorganize, disrupt, disturb, hash, jumble, muddle,muss, rumple, scramble, upset, mess up, mix up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arrange, array, dispose, order, organize, range, regulate, straighten up 使有序</div>
<h2>disavow[sound:disavow.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">拒绝承认，否认：</font>to disclaim knowledge of, responsibility for, or association with；to declare notto be true</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]disavow the rumor  否认谣言 || She disavowed the testimony that she had given earlier in the trial.  她在审判中否认了自己之前的证词。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deny, repudiate, disaffirm, disclaim, disconfirm, gainsay, negate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acknowledge, avow, concede 承认</div>
<h2>discern[sound:discern.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">识别，辨别差异：</font>to perceive with the eyes or intellect; detect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]discern the motives 辨识出动机 || too young to discern between right and wrong 太年轻了而辨别不了是非</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]behold, descry, distinguish, espy, perceive, regard, differentiate, discriminate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confuse, mix up 混淆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]discerning adj. 有洞察力的，洞悉的：showing insight and understanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a very discerning art critic  眼光敏锐有洞察力的艺术评论家 || She has a discerning palate. 她的味觉很敏锐。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]insightful, incisive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]myopic, shortsighted 目光短浅的；undiscerning  无辨别能力的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]discernible/ discernable adj. 可辨识的，可辨别的：perceptible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a discernible mark  可辨别的痕迹</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]perceptible, detectable, distinguishable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]indiscernible, imperceptible  不可辨识的</div>
<h2>discharge[sound:discharge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">解雇：</font>to dismiss from employment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]discharge a worker/soldier 开除员工/军籍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fire, dismiss</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]employ, engage, hire, take on, sign up or on 雇佣</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不承担责任：</font>a freeing from an obligation or responsibility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a full discharge from responsibility for the accident 对事故完全不负有责任</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delivery, quietus, quittance</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">释放：</font>to set free (as from slavery or confinement)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]discharged the prisoners upon the signing of the peace treaty 根据和约释放罪犯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disenthrall, emancipate, enfranchise, liberate, loose, manumit, release, spring, unbind, uncage, unchain,unfetter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bind, confine, enchain, fetter 监禁，束缚</div>
<h2>disciple[sound:disciple.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">信徒，追随者：</font>one who accepts and assists in spreading the doctrines of another, follower</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A circle of dedicated disciples who conscientiously wrote down everything the prophet said. 一圈忠实的信徒认真的记下了先知所说的话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acolyte, adherent, convert, epigone, partisan, votary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]leader, coryphaeus 领导者</div>
<h2>discombobulate[sound:discombobulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使不安，使混乱：</font>upset, confuse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]invent cool new ways to discombobulate the old order  发明新的好方法打乱了旧秩序</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]upset,  addle,  baffle,  bamboozle,  befog,  befuddle,  confound,  fuddle,  gravel,  muddle,  muddy,  mystify,perplex, puzzle, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]compose, soothe, calm, pacify 使安定</div>
<h2>discomfit[sound:discomfit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使尴尬：</font>to put into a state of perplexity and embarrassment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was discomfited by the awkward situation of having his ex-girlfriend meet his current one.  他的前女友看到他现任女友的情况让他很尴尬。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]embarrass, abash, faze, fluster, mortify, nonplus, rattle</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">阻碍：</font>to prevent from achieving a goal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Constant interruptions discomfited her in her attempt to finish the speech.  经常的打断她讲话使她无法完成演讲。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balk, foil, thwart, baffle, checkmate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advance, forward, foster, further, promote  推进，促进；encourage  鼓励</div>
<h2>discommode[sound:discommode.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">打扰，使不便：</font>to cause inconvenience to: trouble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The breakdown of her car didn't discommode her seriously.  车的故障没有给他带来很大麻烦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disturb, trouble, incommode, put out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accommodate, assist, oblige, favor 帮忙</div>
<h2>discompose[sound:discompose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使不安：</font>to disturb the composure or calm of; perturb</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]GRE does not seem to discompose Jason; on the contrary, he looked rather relaxed. GRE 没 有 使Jason 感到慌乱，正相反，他看上去很轻松。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agitate, bother, discomfort, disquiet, distemper, disconcert, disturb, perturb, upset, weird out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, compose, quiet, settle, soothe, tranquilize 平息抚慰</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使混乱：</font>to undo the proper order or arrangement of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The wind ruffled her hair and discomposed her carefully arranged papers. 风凌乱了她的头发，吹乱了她细心整理的纸张。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disarrange, disarray, disorganize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arrange, array, order, organize, range 使有序</div>
<h2>disconcert[sound:disconcert.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使不安：</font>to disturb the composure of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We were disconcerted by the unexpected changes to the program.  我们对项目未预料到的变化感到不安。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abash, discomfit, disconcert, discountenance, mortify, rattle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, compose, quiet, settle, soothe, tranquilize 平息抚慰</div>
<h2>discord[sound:discord.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">意见不一致，不和谐：</font>lack of agreement or harmony (as between persons, things, or ideas)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]No discord, no concord. 不打不成交。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conflict,  disaccord,  discordance,  disharmony,  dissension,  dissidence,  dissonance,  disunion,  disunity,division, friction, inharmony, schism, strife</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accord, agreement, concord, harmony, peace  和谐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]discordant adj. 不和谐的，刺耳的：disagreeable in sound; harsh or dissonant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dissonant, cacophonous, disharmonic, disharmonious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concordant, harmonious 和谐的</div>
<h2>discredit[sound:discredit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">羞辱，使丧失名誉：</font>to damage in reputation; disgrace.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]discredit his opponents 羞辱他的对手</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abase, debase, degrade, demean, disgrace, dishonor, humiliate, shame, sink, smirch, take down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggrandize 提高名誉；canonize, deify 神化；elevate 提升；exalt 赞扬</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">怀疑，不相信：</font>to think not to be true or real</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I discredit the story that the old house is haunted.  我怀疑那个房子闹鬼不是真的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]negate, doubt, distrust</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accept, believe, credit 接受，相信；confirm, prove, validate, verify 证实</div>
<h2>discrepancy[sound:discrepancy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（在事实和宣称之间的）差异或矛盾：</font>divergence or disagreement, as between facts or claims</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a large discrepancy between the ideal image and the reality 理想与现实之间的巨大差距</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contrast, disagreement, disparity, dissimilarity, distance, distinction, diversity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]converge concord consonant 一致，和谐；analogousness, community, resemblance, similarity 相似</div>
<h2>discrete[sound:discrete.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">离散的，不连续的：</font>constituting a separate entity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a discrete variable  离散变量</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]detached, disconnected, unattached, unconnected, separate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continuous 连续的；attached, connected, joined, linked  连接的</div>
<h2>discretion[sound:discretion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">谨慎：</font>the quality of being discreet; circumspection</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You must show discretion in choosing your teammates. 你选择队友时必须慎重。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discreetness, prudence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]imprudence, indiscretion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]indiscretion n. 不谨慎，不符合社会道德规范：an act at variance with the accepted morality of a society</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]resign because of financial indiscretions 因为财政方面的不检点而辞职</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">自制，节制：</font>the checking of one's true feelings and impulses when dealing with others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In that job you'll be expected to show discretion and act like a professional at all times.  那项工作要求你时刻自制节制，表现得像一个专业人士。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]continence, discipline, inhibition, refrainment, restraint, self-control, self-restraint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disinhibition, incontinence, unconstraint 不自制，不节制</div>
<h2>discretionary[sound:discretionary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">自主决定的：</font>left to discretion : exercised at one's own discretion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In many restaurants, discretionary tipping is being replaced by a standard service charge. 在很多饭店，标准的服务价格取代了随意支付的小费。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elective, voluntary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]compulsory, mandatory, nonelective, nonvoluntary, obligatory, required 强制性的，非自愿的</div>
<h2>discriminate[sound:discriminate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">区分：</font>to perceive the distinguishing features of; recognize as distinct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]discriminate different kinds of animals 区分不同的动物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]differentiate, discern, distinguish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confuse, mistake, mix up 混淆</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">歧视：</font>to make a difference in treatment or favor on a basis other than individual merit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new law discriminated against lower-paid workers. 这条新法律歧视低工资的工人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]discriminatory adj. 差别对待的：marked by or showing prejudice; biased</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]prejudiced, biased</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]equitable, impartial, unbiased, impersonal, unprejudiced 公平的</div>
<h2>discursive[sound:discursive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（谈话内容）杂乱的：</font>moving from topic to topic without order</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a long, discursive article 冗长杂乱的文章 ||  The  speaker's  discursive  style  made  it  difficult  tounderstand his point.  演讲者讲话杂乱，很难让人理解他的观点。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]desultory, digressional, excursive, meandering, rambling, wandering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]keen on title, concentrated 关注主题的，集中的</div>
<h2>disdain[sound:disdain.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">轻视，鄙视：</font>to look on with scorn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]disdain that man for snobbishness 鄙视那个势利小人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contemn, disrespect, slight, sniff, snub, look down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]honor, respect 尊敬；treat favorably 亲切地对待</div>
<h2>disengage[sound:disengage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">分开：</font>to set free from entanglement or difficulty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Disengage the gears when you park the car. 当你停车的时候要把（传动）齿轮分开。|| seek to disengagemyself from the embarrassing situation 试图把我自己从尴尬的气氛中解救出来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disengage, disentangle, untangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]embroil, entangle 卷入；mesh  啮合</div>
<h2>disgorge[sound:disgorge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">呕吐出：</font>to discharge by the throat and mouth; vomit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He cannot disgorge a fish bone without the doctor’s assistant. 没有医生的帮助他吐不出鱼刺来。||  Thevolcano disgorged lava. 火山喷出岩浆。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belch, disgorge, eject, eruct, expel, jet, spew, spout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]swallow, ingest 吞下，咽下</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">放弃：</font>to give up on request or under pressure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The corrupt officials refused to disgorge his ill-gotten gains.  贪官们拒绝放弃赃款。</div>
<h2>disgruntle[sound:disgruntle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使发怒，使不满意：</font>to make ill-humored or discontented</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be disgruntled with sb 对某人不满</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disaffect, displease, dissatisfy, disgruntle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]content, gratify, please, satisfy 使满意</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使疏远，使不友好：</font>to cause to change from friendly or loving to unfriendly or uncaring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alien, alienate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reconcile  调解，使和谐</div>
<h2>disguise[sound:disguise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">伪装（防止被认出）：</font>to modify the manner or appearance of in order to prevent recognition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He always disguises his true feelings. 他经常掩饰自己的真实感受。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]camouflage, costume, mask</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unmask 使露出真相</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">隐藏：</font>to keep secret or shut off from view</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That investigative reporter usually does a good job of disguising her true motives for interviewing a person.当采访时，那个调查记者经常很好地隐藏自己的真实目的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belie, blanket, conceal, cover, curtain, occult, veil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bare, disclose, display, divulge, expose, reveal, show, uncover, unmask, unveil  暴露，展现</div>
<h2>disinclination[sound:disinclination.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不喜欢，厌恶，不情愿：</font>a  lack  of willingness  or  desire  to do or accept something ；a  lack  ofwillingness or desire to do or accept something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]showing a marked disinclination  表现出明显的不情愿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aversion, disfavor, disliking, disrelish, mislike, unwillingness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appetite, favor, fondness, liking, partiality, preference, relish, inclination 喜欢；willingness 情愿</div>
<h2>disinfect[sound:disinfect.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">消毒，使无菌：</font>to free from infection especially by destroying harmful microorganisms</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]disinfect with bleaching powder 用漂白粉消毒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sterilize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]infect, pollute, contaminate, taint 感染，污染</div>
<h2>disjointed[sound:disjointed.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">机能失调的：</font>being thrown out of orderly function</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a disjointed society 混乱的社会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chaotic, disorderly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]orderly, regular, systematic  有序的，规律的，系统的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不连贯的：</font>not clearly or logically connected</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a disjointed speech about a hodgepodge of things  关于一大堆杂事的不连贯的演讲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disconnected, unconnected</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coherent, connected 连贯的</div>
<h2>disinter[sound:disinter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（从墓地里）掘出  ：</font>to take out of the grave or tomb</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Egyptian mummy was carefully disinterred in hopes that it would yield secrets about the Old Kingdom.那个埃及木乃伊被小心地挖掘出来，人们希望它可以告诉我们关于这个古老王国的一些秘密。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unbury, unearth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bury, inter, tomb, inhume 埋葬</div>
<h2>disinterested[sound:disinterested.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">公正的，无偏见的：</font>free from selfish motive or interest: unbiased</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a disinterested decision 公正的决定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]equal, evenhanded, impartial, just, nonpartisan, dispassionate, objective, square, unbiased, unprejudiced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]biased, inequitable, nonobjective, one-sided, partial, partisan, prejudiced, unjust 不公正的，有偏见的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">没有兴趣的：</font>having or showing a lack of interest or concern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The city's philistines, naturally disinterested in art, voted to cut the museum's budget. 城市里对艺术本来就不感兴趣的俗人们，投票表决要缩进博物馆的预算。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apathetic, incurious, insouciant, nonchalant, perfunctory, unconcerned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concerned, interested 关心的，感兴趣的</div>
<h2>disjunctive[sound:disjunctive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">分离的：</font>marked by breaks or disunity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a disjunctive narrative sequence 分散的叙述顺序</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discrete, separate, disconnected, disunited</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]combined, connected, jointed, mixed, united 连接的，混合的</div>

<h2>dismay[sound:dismay.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使失去勇气：</font>to cause to lose courage or resolution</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The excessive homework dismayed ourselves. 过量的作业让我们失去了信心。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chill, daunt, dishearten, dispirit, frustrate, unnerve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]embolden, encourage, hearten, nerve 鼓励，使勇敢</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使不安，使焦虑：</font>to trouble the mind of; to make uneasy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Parents became increasingly dismayed by their son's GPA.  父母对他们儿子的平均成绩非常焦虑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agitate, bother, discomfort, discompose, disquiet, distemper, distress, perturb, unsettle, upset</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, compose, quiet, soothe, tranquilize  平息抚慰</div>
<h2>disparage[sound:disparage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">贬低，轻蔑地说：</font>to lower in rank or reputation; to speak of in a slighting or disrespectful way;belittle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]use the past to disparage the present 借古讽今 || Voters don't like political advertisements in whichopponents disparage one another.选民不喜欢看到贬低竞争对手的政治广告。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belittle, denigrate, deprecate, depreciate, derogate, degrade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acclaim, applaud, exalt, extol, glorify, laud 赞扬</div>
<h2>disparate[sound:disparate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迥然不同的：</font>fundamentally distinct or different in kind; entirely dissimilar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This couple of seemingly disparate topics have something in common. 这两个看似无关的主题其实有些相同之处。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dissimilar, distinct, distinguishable, diverse, nonidentical, unalike</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alike, identical, indistinguishable, kindred, like, parallel, same, similar 相似的，相同的</div>
<h2>dispassionate[sound:dispassionate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">客观公正的，不易被情绪或偏见影响的：</font>devoid of or unaffected by passion, emotion, or bias</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Journalists should aim to be dispassionate observers.  记者们应该朝着成为一个公正的观察者努力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disinterested, equal, equitable, evenhanded, impartial, just, nonpartisan, objective, unbiased, unprejudiced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]biased, inequitable, nonobjective, one-sided, partial, partisan, prejudiced, unjust 有偏见的，不公正的</div>
<h2>dispatch[sound:dispatch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">迅速：</font>promptness and efficiency in performance or transmission</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]do sth. with dispatch 迅速的做某事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alacrity, haste, swiftness, expedition, promptitude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]leisureliness, delay, procrastination 悠然，拖延</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">发送，运输：</font>to cause to go or be taken from one place to another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to dispatch a messenger with urgent news 发送一个紧急消息</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]transfer, transmit, transport, pack off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accept, receive 接收</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使死亡：</font>to deprive of life</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dispatch a criminal 处决罪犯 || The man dispatched the termites with professional efficiency. 那个男人技术纯熟地杀死了白蚁。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]animate 使有生命</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">获胜：</font>to achieve a victory over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They dispatched the other team with breaking a sweat.  他们险胜其他的队。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conquer, defeat, subdue, triumph over, prevail over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lose to 输</div>
<h2>dispose[sound:dispose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使倾向：</font>to give a tendency to: incline</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]faulty diet disposes one to sickness 营养不全面导致疾病</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]disposed adj. 喜欢的：willing or likely，inclined</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]not feel disposed to argue with her 不喜欢与她争执</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]willing, inclined, predisposed, prone</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disinclined, indisposed  不喜欢的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">处理掉（与of 连用，dispose of ）：</font>to get rid of; throw out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]disposal n. 处理，不再利用：the act of getting rid of something that is no longer wanted or needed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the permanent disposal of radioactive wastes  对放射性废物的永久处理</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">布置有序：</font>to place, distribute, or arrange especially in an orderly way</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Dispose the surgical instruments in the exact order in which they would be needed. 把手术仪器按他们被需要的顺序放置。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]array, arrange</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disarrange, disarray, disorder, upset, mess up, muss up 使混乱</div>
<h2>disregard[sound:disregard.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">漠视，不关注：</font>to pay no attention to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]disregard the advice of his executives 漠视执行管理者的建议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ignore, overlook, slight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heed, mind, regard, attend to 关注</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏兴趣，缺乏关心：</font>lack of interest or concern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Revelers fired guns in the air with complete disregard for the possible consequences. 饮酒狂欢者一点也不关心后果的开枪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apathy, disinterestedness, incuriosity, nonchalance, torpor, unconcern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concern, interest, regard 关心，感兴趣</div>
<h2>dissect[sound:dissect.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">仔细分析：</font>to examine, analyze, or criticize in minute detail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dissect some basic problems in mathematics analysis 仔细分析一些数学分析的基本问题 ||  let's  dissectthe plot of this thriller to see what makes it thrilling. 让我们来仔细分析一下这个恐怖电影为什么恐怖。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]analyze</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">切成片(尤其是为了解剖研究)：</font>to cut apart or separate (tissue), especially for anatomical study</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dissect the brain of Einstein 解剖爱因斯坦的大脑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anatomize, assay, break down</div>
<h2>dissemble[sound:dissemble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">用假象隐藏真相，掩饰：</font>to put on a false appearance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dissemble fear with a smile  用微笑来掩饰恐惧 ||  He  dissembled  happiness  at  the  news  that  hisex-girlfriend was getting married to someone else. 他对其他人假装高兴听到前女友结婚的消息。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dissimulate, affect, assume, bluff, counterfeit, fake, sham</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]behave honestly 表现诚恳</div>
<h2>disseminate[sound:disseminate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">散播，传播：</font>to spread abroad; promulgate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]disseminate Marxism-Leninism 传播马列主义 || The Internet allows us to disseminate information faster.互联网允许我们更快的传播信息。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]broadcast, circulate, propagate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gather, amass, garner 收集</div>
<h2>dissension[sound:dissension.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">意见不合：</font>difference of opinion; disagreement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Although we have dissension, we are friend all the same. 虽然我们意见不和，但我们还是朋友。|| There is a continued dissension among historians on the exact spot of Columbus's first landing. 关于哥伦布第一次的准确登陆地点这个问题，总是存在分歧。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conflict,  disaccord,  discordance,  discordancy,  disharmony,  dissent,  dissidence,  dissonance,  disunion,disunity, division, friction, inharmony, schism, strife</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accord, agreement, concord, concordance, harmony, consensus, unanimity 不和谐，不一致</div>
<h2>dissent[sound:dissent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">持异议，不同意：</font>to differ in opinion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I dissent from what you said. 我不同意你说的话。|| Anyone who dissented was encouraged to speakout while they had the chance.  谁有异议得到机会都可以发言。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]differ, disagree, nonconcur</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agree, assent, concur 同意</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">反对正统：</font>departure from a generally accepted theory, opinion, or practice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The church reacted to any form of dissent by promptly excommunicating its proponents. 教堂会立即开除任何反对正统教义的人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]heterodoxy, nonconformity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conformity 遵从；orthodoxy  正统</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不和谐：</font>a lack of agreement or harmony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conflict,  disaccord,  discordance,  discordancy,  disharmony,  dissent,  dissidence,  dissonance,  disunion,disunity, division, friction, inharmony, schism, strife</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accord, agreement, concord, concordance, harmony, consensus, unanimity 不和谐，不一致</div>
<h2>dissipate[sound:dissipate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">驱散：</font>to drive away; disperse.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The wind finally dissipated the smoke.  风终于吹散了雾气。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disband, dispel, disperse, scatter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accumulate, gather, amass, cluster, assemble, concentrate, congregate  积聚</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">浪费：</font>to spend or expend intemperately or wastefully: squander</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dissipate too much time and effort 挥霍了太多的时间与精力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]waste, squander, lavish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conserve  节省</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">放纵：</font>to indulge in the intemperate pursuit of pleasure, especially : to drink to excess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indulge</div>
<h2>dissolute[sound:dissolute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">放荡的，无节制的：</font>lacking moral restraint; indulging in sensual pleasures or vices.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lead a dissolute life 过着放荡无节制的生活</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dissipated, libertine, rakish, reprobate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abstinent, abstemious, temperate, ascetic, stoic, spartan, self-denying 自制节制的；pure,  uncorrupt, uncorrupted 纯洁的，未堕落的</div>
<h2>dissolve[sound:dissolve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">溶解，融化：</font>to cause to pass into solution; to reduce (solid matter) to liquid form; melt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Sugar dissolves in the water. 糖在水中溶解</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]liquefy, melt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coagulate, solidify, freeze 凝结，凝固，结冰</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">解散：</font>to break into component parts; disintegrate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disintegrate, disband, break up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consolidate, unify 使联合</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">消失：</font>to cease to be visible; to cease to exist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The mist dissolved in the morning sun. 雾消失在朝阳中。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dematerialize, vanish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appear 出现；materialize 使实物化</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">废除，撤销：</font>to put an end to by formal action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The king dissolved parliament. 国王废除了议会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]terminate, abrogate, annul, cancel, disannul, invalidate, negate, null, nullify, repeal, rescind</div>
<h2>dissonance[sound:dissonance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n．不和谐，刺耳：a harsh, disagreeable combination of sounds; discord</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cognitive dissonance 认识上的分歧 || Dissonance among the three partners doomed the project. 三个股东间的不调和注定了那计划的失败。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conflict,  disaccord,  discordance,  discordancy,  disharmony,  dissent,  dissidence,  dissonance,  disunion,disunity, division, friction, inharmony, schism, strife</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accord, agreement, concord, concordance, harmony, consensus, unanimity 不和谐，不一致</div>
<h2>dissuade[sound:dissuade.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">劝阻,反对：</font>to deter (a person) from a course of action or a purpose by persuasion or exhortation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dissuade sb. from (doing) sth 劝阻/反对某人做某事 ||  Her  parents  tried  to  dissuade  her  from  herintention to drop out of college. 她的父母劝她不要退学。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deter, dissuade, inhibit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]encourage 鼓励；persuade 说服</div>
<h2>distain[sound:distain.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">贬损，伤害名誉：</font>loss of honor, respect, or reputation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dishonor, belittle, denigrate, deprecate, depreciate, degrade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]praise, acclaim, applaud, exalt, extol, glorify, laud 赞扬</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">弄脏：</font>to make dirty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]hands distained with blood 被血弄脏的手</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bemire, besmirch, daub, muddy, smirch, smudge, soil, stain, sully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clean 使干净</div>
<h2>distal[sound:distal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">远离中心的，（神经）末梢的：</font>situated away from the point of attachment or origin or a centralpoint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the distal end of nerve  神经末梢</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]proximal 接近中心的</div>
<h2>distend[sound:distend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">膨胀：</font>to swell out or expand from or as if from internal pressure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The stomachs of starving people often distend. 饥民的肚子经常涨起来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]expand, dilate, inflate, swell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]constrict, compress 收缩压缩</div>
<h2>distill[sound:distill.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">用蒸馏法提高纯度：</font>to increase the concentration of, separate, or purify by or as if by distillation.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]distill the water before pouring it in the steam iron 在把水倒到熨斗里前蒸馏一下</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]purify, filter, refine, fine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]distillate n. 蒸馏物，纯化物，本质：a purified form; an essence</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">渗出；滴下：</font>to fall or let fall in or as if in drops</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The basement walls distill water every time it rains heavily. 地下室的墙壁每次下大雨都渗出水来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]distill, dribble, drop, trickle</div>
<h2>distort[sound:distort.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">扭曲，歪曲：</font>to twist out of the true meaning or proportion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A painter may exaggerate or distort shapes and forms.  画家可能夸张或扭曲形状。|| The coach's message was so distorted after passing through so many people that it was unintelligible.  教练的信息在经过许多人传递后已经被歪曲的很难看懂了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deform, misshape, torture, falsify, misinterpret, misrepresent, pervert, twist</div>
<h2>distract[sound:distract.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">转移兴趣，使分心：</font>to draw or direct (as one's attention) to a different object</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be distracted by a sudden noise  被突然的噪音分心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstract, divert, detract, call off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]distracted adj. 精力分散的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rapt 全心投入的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使焦虑，使不安：</font>to trouble the mind of; to make uneasy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The students are easily distracted before the exam. 学生们在考试前很容易焦虑不安。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agitate, bother, discomfort, discompose, dismay, disquiet, distress, perturb, upset</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, compose, quiet, soothe, tranquilize  平息抚慰</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">疯狂的：</font>insane, mad</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]insane, delirious, hysterical</div>
<h2>distraught[sound:distraught.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精神狂乱的，极疯狂的：</font>deeply agitated, as from emotional conflict; insane</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her distraught mother had spent all night waiting by the phone. 她母亲忧心如焚，在电话旁守了一个晚上。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agitated, delirious, distracted, frenzied, hysterical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]collected, composed, recollected, self-collected, self-composed, self-possessed 镇静的，平静的</div>
<h2>diurnal[sound:diurnal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">白天发生或行动的：</font>occurring or active during the daytime rather than at night </div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]diurnal animals 昼行性动物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nocturnal  夜晚的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">每天的：</font>occurring, done, produced, or appearing every day</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a love as constant and certain as the diurnal tides  像每天潮汐一样始终如一的爱情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]daily, day-to-day,</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">期刊：</font>a publication that appears at regular intervals</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A microfilm contains a collection of diurnals. 一个微缩胶片里包含很多期刊的合集。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bulletin, magazine, periodical, review, serial, journal</div>
<h2>diverge[sound:diverge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">改变方向：</font>to change one's course or direction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The deer abruptly diverged from its intended path the moment it spied the waiting lion. 当那只鹿发现潜伏的狮子的时候就突然改变了自己原来的路线。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]detour, deviate, diverge, sheer, swerve, turn off</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">散开：</font>to go or move in different directions from a central point</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]At that point the road and the railroad tracks diverge. 公路和铁路在那个点分叉了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]branch out, divide, spread</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]converge, join 会合</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">分歧：</font>to become or be different in character or form: differ in opinion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]differ, disagree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conform 遵从</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">离题：</font>to depart from a set course or norm; deviate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excurse, ramble, diverge, get off the subject</div>
<h2>diversity[sound:diversity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">多样性：</font>variety or multiformity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the diversity of species  物种的多样性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diverseness, multifariousness, multiplicity, variousness , miscellaneousness</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">分歧，不同点：</font>the quality or state of being different</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There is no fundamental diversity between the two ideologies. 这两种思想意识之间并没有根本的分歧。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contrast,  disagreement,  discrepancy,  disparateness,  disparity,  dissimilarity,  dissimilitude,  distinction,otherness, unlikeness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alikeness, analogy, likeness, resemblance, sameness, similarity 相同，相似</div>
<h2>divert[sound:divert.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使转向：</font>to turn from one course or use to another: deflect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]divert traffic to a side street  使交通转至辅路</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deflect, redirect, swing, veer, wheel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fix, set, settle 固定</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使消遣：</font>to cause (someone) to pass the time agreeably occupied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A light comedy divert the tired business executive 一个轻松的喜剧让疲惫的企业主管人员得到了放松。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disport, entertain, regale, solace</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使分心：</font>to draw the attention or mind to something else</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]divert one’s attention 转移某人注意力 || The parents tried to divert the child with a toy while the doctorwas giving her a shot.  当医生要给那个孩子打针的时候，孩子父母试图用玩具转移孩子的注意力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例][近]abstract, detract, call off</div>
<h2>divestiture[sound:divestiture.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">剥夺：</font>the act of taking away from a person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Melodramas were popular because they offered the audience a divestiture of neutrality. 情节剧之所有受到欢迎是因为他们给观众一个缺乏中立的（世界）。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deprivation, dispossession</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquisition  获得；endowment  捐赠</div>
<h2>divulge[sound:divulge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">泄漏（秘密）：</font>to make known (as a confidence or secret)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]refuse to divulge details of the negotiations 拒绝透露谈判的细节内容 || We tried to make him divulgethe name of the winner, but he wouldn't budge. 我们试图让他透露胜利者的名字，但是他没有那样做。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bare, disclose, discover, expose, uncover, unmask, unveil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conceal, cover up, hide, mask, shroud, veil 保密，隐藏</div>
<h2>dodder[sound:dodder.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">蹒跚，颤巍巍地行进：</font>to progress feebly and unsteadily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He could only dodder along after the operation. 他手术后只能步履蹒跚的走。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careen, lurch, teeter, totter, waddle</div>
<h2>dodge[sound:dodge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">躲避：</font>to avoid (a blow, for example) by moving or shifting quickly aside</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dodge a storm of bullets 躲避枪林弹雨 || He dodged the first punch but was hit by the second. 他躲过了第一次打击但是没有躲过第二次。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avoid, escape, shirk, malinger, goldbrick, evade, parry, sidestep, circumvent, fence, hedge, avert, elude, shun, skirt, bilk, eschew, weasel</div>
<h2>doff[sound:doff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">脱下：</font>to take off; remove</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The blazing sun soon had the men doffing their jackets. 炙热的太阳很快就让男人们脱掉了夹克。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]put off, take off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]don, put on 穿上</div>
<h2>dogged[sound:dogged.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">坚持的，坚决的：</font>continuing despite difficulties, opposition, or discouragement；showing no signsof slackening or yielding in one's purpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gain respect through sheer dogged determination 凭借单纯的坚决赢得了尊重 ||  A  madman  who  spenthis life in dogged pursuit of power 一个一生都坚持追求权力的疯子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]insistent, persevering, pertinacious, tenacious, determined</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easily discouraged 容易气馁的；yielded 屈服的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固执的，任性的：</font>sticking  to  an  opinion,  purpose,  or  course  of  action  in  spite  of  reason,arguments, or persuasion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Your dogged adherence to a really lame argument is embarrassing.  你固执的坚持一个站不住脚的观点令人很尴尬。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant,  hardheaded,  headstrong,  inflexible,  intransigent,  mulish,  obdurate  opinionated,  ossified,pertinacious, self-opinionated, self-willed stubborn, unbending, uncompromising, unrelenting, unyielding, willful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquiescent, amenable, compliant, complying, flexible, pliable, pliant, relenting, yielding 顺从的</div>
<h2>dogma[sound:dogma.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">教条，信条：</font>a  doctrine  or  body  of  doctrines  concerning  faith  or  morals  formally  stated  andauthoritatively proclaimed by a church</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]People are beginning to question the old dogmas.  人们开始质疑旧的信条。|| The newspaper seeks to beindependent of political dogma. 这份报纸力求不受政治信条影响。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]credo, doctrine, gospel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heresy, heterodoxy 异端学说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dogmatic  独断的，武断的：characterized by an authoritative, arrogant assertion of unproved principles</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dogmatic critic  独断的评论家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dictatorial, dictative, authoritarian, authoritative, magisterial</div>
<h2>doldrums[sound:doldrums.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">低迷，中断：</font>a state or period of inactivity, stagnation, or slump</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]August is a time of doldrums for many enterprises. 对于许多企业来说八月是一个低迷期‖The  economyis in the doldrums.  经济低迷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abeyance, dormancy, latency, quiescence, moratorium</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continuation 持续</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">情绪不佳：</font>a state or spell of low spirits</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The team had been in the doldrums ever since losing the championship.  整个队伍自从输了锦标赛以来一直情绪不佳</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dejection, depression, desolation, despondence, dolefulness, gloom, melancholy, unhappiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bliss, ecstasy, elation, exhilaration, exuberance, exultation, jubilation, rapture, felicity</div>
<h2>dolorous[sound:dolorous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">忧伤的：</font>causing, marked by, or expressing misery or grief</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He lifted a pair of sapphire, dolorous eyes. 他抬起了一双忧郁的蓝宝石般的眼睛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agonized, bemoaning, bewailing, deplorable, grievous ,miserable, plaintive, rueful, sorrowful, woeful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]happy, joyful, jovial, jubilant  高兴的</div>
<h2>dolt[sound:dolt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">笨蛋：</font>a stupid person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]What a dolt I have been! 我是多么的愚蠢啊！</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]idiot, fool, moron, simpleton, dullard</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]illuminati, intellectual 智者；genius 天才</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]doltish adj. 愚笨的</div>

<h2>dormant[sound:dormant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">静止的，不活跃的：</font>in a state of rest or inactivity; inoperative; in abeyance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]volcanoes which have been dormant for thousand years 休眠了上千年的火山</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dead, latent, lurking, abeyant, quiescent, inert</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]active, busy, operating  活跃的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（动物）冬眠的：</font>having biological activity suspended</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The bears lay dormant in their den during the winter. 在冬季，熊在他们的穴里冬眠</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asleep, resting, napping, slumbering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]awake 清醒的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dormancy n. 不活跃；冬眠</div>
<h2>dour[sound:dour.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">闷闷不乐的,死气沉沉的：</font>sullen, gloomy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The captain’s dour look depressed us all.  船长闷闷不乐的脸色使我们倍感低落</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]morose, sulky, surly, moody</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gay 欢快的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严厉的：</font>harsh and threatening in manner or appearance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His dour criticism made us regret having undertaken the job. 他严厉的批评让我们后悔接下这活儿了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]strict, sharp, austere, exacting, fierce, gruff, intimidating, rough, stark, stern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benign, gentle, mild, tender  温和的</div>
