<h2>dreary[sound:dreary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">单调乏味的：</font>having nothing likely to provide cheer, comfort, or interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The day is cold, rainy, and dreary. 天气寒冷，阴暗而沉闷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]desolate, gloomy, sullen, dull, monotone, pedestrian, somber</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]jocund 令人欢乐的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">令人不悦的：</font>causing unhappiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]decided to see a professional counselor in order to save their dreary marriage 决定咨询专业人士以拯救他们悲剧式的婚姻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]depressing, dismal, heartbreaking, mournful, pathetic, melancholy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cheering 令人激动高兴的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]drearily adv. 令人厌烦地</div>
<h2>drench[sound:drench.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">湿透，浸透：</font>to wet thoroughly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The thunderstorm drenched us to the skin. 雷雨把我们浇了个透</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deluge, douse, soak, saturate, sodden, sop, wet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dehydrate, desiccate, dry, parch, scorch, sear  干燥</div>
<h2>drivel[sound:drivel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">胡言乱语：</font>unintelligible or meaningless talk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My roommate talks in her sleep, but it's just drivel.  我的室友会说梦话，但都是些没有意义的呓语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abracadabra, nonsense, prattle, gabble, prattle</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">胡言乱语，说傻话：</font>to talk stupidly and carelessly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He always drivel on about his “distinguished” family. 他总是痴痴地说着他所谓的“名门”出身</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]babble, gabble, gibber, jabber</div>
<h2>drizzle[sound:drizzle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi./n. （下）细小、轻柔、似雾的雨，毛毛雨：a fine misty rain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The intermittent drizzle was just heavy enough to spoil all of our outdoor activities.  断断续续的小雨恰好大岛让我们所有的户外活动都泡汤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mist, sprinkle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deluge, downpour  倾盆大雨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]drizzling adj. （雨）细小的</div>
<h2>droll[sound:droll.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">古怪有趣的，离奇可笑的：</font>amusingly odd or whimsically comical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a droll man with a strong dialect  带着浓郁口音的有意思的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antic, comic, farcical, funny, hilarious, laughable, humorous, ridiculous, ludicrous, uproarious, whimsical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lame, unamusing, uncomic, unfunny, unhumorous, unhysterical  不幽默的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]drollness n. 古怪</div>
<h2>drone[sound:drone.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">单调地说：</font>to talk in a persistently dull or monotonous tone</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]droning bees 嗡嗡作响的蜜蜂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hum, buzz, bumble</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（昆虫振翅般）单调的声音：</font>a monotonous sound like that of an insect in motion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]heard the drone of an helicopter overhead  听到了头顶直升机单调的声音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burr, whir</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">混日子：</font>to spend time doing nothing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Instead of getting a job, he preferred to drone and live off his parents. 相对于找个工作来说，他更喜欢什么也不做，依靠他的父母过日子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dally, dawdle, hang, laze, loll, lounge</div>
<h2>drudgery[sound:drudgery.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">苦工；单调、卑贱或无趣的工作：</font>tedious, menial, or unpleasant work</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]get away from the drudgery of their everyday lives  摆脱每日的单调无聊</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]labor, slavery, toil, travail, grind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sinecure 闲职，美差；fun, play 玩耍，娱乐</div>
<h2>dubious[sound:dubious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">充满不定性的，值得怀疑的：</font>giving rise to uncertainty; questionable or suspect as to true natureor quality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dubious assertion 一个值得怀疑的论调</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debatable, doubtful, disputable, equivocal, problematic, questionable, shaky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]certain, incontestable, undeniable 确定的，毋庸置疑的；reliable 可靠的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（对事实等）持怀疑态度的：</font>not feeling sure  about the truth, wisdom, or trustworthiness ofsomeone or something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dubious about a diet that claims I can eat all I want and still lose weight 对于一份声称可以一边随心所欲地吃和一边减肥的节食方案表示怀疑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]distrustful, skeptical, suspicious, unsure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]convinced, positive, sure 表示肯定态度的，确信的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迟疑不决的，不愿行动的：</font>slow to begin or proceed with a course of action because of doubtsor uncertainty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I'm dubious about our plan to go hang gliding without having had any training. 我对于不做任何训练就去玩滑翔感到很迟疑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]undecided, disinclined, loath, reluctant, reticent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disposed, inclined  倾向于……的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dubiety n. 可疑，怀疑</div>
<h2>ductile[sound:ductile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可塑的，有延展性的：</font>easily molded or shaped, malleable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Gold is a kind of ductile metal. 金是一种有延展性的金属</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]malleable, moldable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inflexible  僵硬的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易受影响的：</font>easily led or influenced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a ductile personality 易受他人影响的性格</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]pliant, yielding, supple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adamant, intractable, refractory, obdurate 倔强的，不易改变立场的</div>
<h2>dulcet[sound:dulcet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">悦耳的，令人愉悦的：</font>pleasing to the ear; melodious; generally pleasing or agreeable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dulcet tones from harps and flutes 竖琴和长笛发出的悦耳音调</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sweet, agreeable, delightful, euphonic, mellifluous, tuneful, winsome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cacophonous, grating 刺耳的</div>
<h2>dullard[sound:dullard.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">笨蛋：</font>a stupid or unimaginative person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]moron, simpleton, idiot, fool</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]wit 机智的人；genius 天才</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dull adj. 愚笨的</div>
<h2>dupe[sound:dupe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">复制品，复刻：</font>something that is made to look exactly like something else</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He built a dupe of the original model, which is locked in a vault.  他做了个保险柜里模型的复刻品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clone, duplicate, facsimile, imitation, mock, replica</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]archetype, original, prototype 原型</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">易受骗的人：</font>one that is easily deceived or cheated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The swindler was able to escape with all of the dupe's money. 骗子成功带着受骗人的财产逃跑了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fool, victim, gull</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]connoisseur 行家，鉴赏家</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">欺骗：</font>to deceive (an unwary person)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The public is easily duped by extravagant claims in advertising.  大众极易被广告中夸大的介绍误导</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bamboozle, beguile, cheat, cozen, delude, gull, hoax, hoodwink</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dupable adj. 易受骗的</div>
<h2>duplicity[sound:duplicity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">欺骗，口是心非：</font>deliberate deceptiveness in behavior or speech</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accidentally reveal their duplicity 不经意间暴露了他们的口是心非</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artifice, deceit, craft, cunning, fraudulence, guile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]honesty, artlessness, forthrightness, guilelessness, ingenuousness, sincerity 诚实，坦诚</div>
<h2>dwindle[sound:dwindle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">逐渐减少：</font>to become gradually less until little remains</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His vast fortune is dwindling away. 他的巨额财富正慢慢缩水</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abate, decrease, drop, diminish, reduce, shrink, taper, wane, knock down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggrandize, balloon, burgeon, increase 增加；accumulate 累积</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dwindling adj. 减少的</div>
<h2>dyspeptic[sound:dyspeptic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">脾气坏的：</font>bad-tempered</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sultry day makes us dyspeptic. 闷热潮湿的天气让我们变得脾气暴躁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cantankerous, disagreeable, irritable, fretful, irascible, peevish, splenetic, surly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amiable, easygoing, genial, good-humored, good-natured, good-tempered 随和的，和蔼的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">消化不良的：</font>pertaining to, subject to, or suffering from dyspepsia</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dyspepsia n. 消化不良</div>
<h2>earnest[sound:earnest.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严肃认真的：</font>characterized by or proceeding from an intense and serious state of mind, grave</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an earnest machine operator 一丝不苟的机器操作员</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grave, serious, solemn, staid, sober</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]facetious, frivolous, flip, flippant, playful 轻浮的</div>
<h2>earshot[sound:earshot.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">听力所及的范围：</font>the range within which one may hear a person's unaided voice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wait until he was out of earshot 等到他听不见的时候</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hail, hearing, sound</div>
<h2>earsplitting[sound:earsplitting.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">震耳欲聋的：</font>distressingly loud or shrill</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]earsplitting noise of airplane engines 飞机引擎的巨大噪音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blaring, blasting, deafening, loud, piercing, plangent, resounding, roaring, stentorian, thunderous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gentle, soft （音乐）轻柔的</div>
<h2>eavesdrop[sound:eavesdrop.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">偷听：</font>to listen secretly to the private conversation of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]eavesdropping on the conversation 偷听谈话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]overhear, wiretap</div>
<h2>ebullient[sound:ebullient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">热情奔放的：</font>zestfully enthusiastic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The ebullient dancers left an enduring impression on us. 热情洋溢的舞者给我们留下了难以磨灭的印象</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boiling, exuberant, effervescent, vivacious, brash</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]tepid, torpid 无精打采的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ebullience n. 热情洋溢</div>
<h2>eccentric[sound:eccentric.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">行为出格的，不循规蹈矩的：</font>deviating from conventional or accepted usage or conduct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an eccentric millionaire  行为怪异的百万富翁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]strange, bizarre, erratic, idiosyncratic, odd, offbeat, outlandish, quaint, weird</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ordinary, regular 常规的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]eccentricity n. 离心率；古怪</div>
<h2>éclat[sound:éclat.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">辉煌成就：</font>brilliant or conspicuous success</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The premier of Mozart’s Le Nozze di Figaro enjoyed a great éclat in 1786. 莫扎特歌剧《费加罗的婚礼》于1786 年的首演获得了极大的成功</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fame, renown, brilliance, triumph</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]debacle, fiasco 惨败</div>
<h2>eclipse[sound:eclipse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">下降，衰退：</font>a change to a lower state or level</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the eclipse of the town from a grand seaside resort to a tacky tourist trap  从壮丽辉煌的海边旅游圣地退化成了俗气的坑人景点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decadence, degeneration, degradation, deterioration, ebb, fall</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ascent, rise, upswing 上升，崛起</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使声望下降，使黯然失色：</font>to obscure or diminish in importance, fame, or reputation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her score eclipsed the old record. 她的分数使旧的纪录黯然失色</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adumbrate, obscure, overshadow</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（在数量、品质上）超越：</font>to be greater, better, or stronger than</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The brilliant young pianist now eclipsed even his own mentor in musical artistry. 极富天赋的小钢琴家如今甚至已超越了他的音乐导师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beat, exceed, excel, outshine, outstrip, surpass, transcend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fall behind 落后</div>
<h2>ecstasy[sound:ecstasy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">无法自控的情绪：</font>a state of being beyond reason and self-control</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an ecstasy of rage  无法自控的愤怒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mania, rhapsody</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]self-control 自控，自制；composure, sangfroid  镇定</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">狂喜：</font>intense joy or delight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be in ecstasy over the offer from Harvard University 因被哈佛的录取而欣喜如狂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delight, elation, euphoria, exhilaration, rapture, transport</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]depression, melancholy 沮丧</div>
<h2>ecumenical[sound:ecumenical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">全球基督教会的：</font>of, relating to, or representing the whole of a body of churches</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catholic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diocesan  主教管辖特定小教区的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">世界范围的，普遍性的：</font>worldwide or general in extent, influence, or application</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an ecumenical scope 国际视野</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]universal, cosmopolitan, global, planetary, worldwide</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]provincial, insular 狭隘的</div>
<h2>edible[sound:edible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可食用的：</font>fit to be eaten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]No chemicals in the laboratory is edible. 实验室中的任何化学试剂都不能食用</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]eatable, comestible, consumable, digestible, esculent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inedible 不可食用的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]edibility n. 可食用</div>
<h2>edifice[sound:edifice.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大厦；大建筑物：</font>a large or massive structure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Capitol is one of the most impressive edifices in the United States. 国会山是美国最令人印象深刻的建筑之一</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]building, erection, palace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cottage 小棚舍</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">基础，基本构架：</font>the arrangement of parts that gives something its basic form</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The edifice of the argument is quite simple, once you get past the fancy language. 只要你看透了表面花哨的语言，你会发现这段论证的基本构架是非常简单的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]architecture, configuration, framework, skeleton, structure</div>
<h2>efface[sound:efface.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v t.  擦掉，抹去；使不明显：to eliminate or make indistinct by or as if by wearing away a surface</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]efface those unpleasant memories 抹去那些不快的记忆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]eradicate, erase, expunge, exterminate, extirpate, liquidate, eclipse, obliterate, wipe, root out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blazon, decorate 装饰；emboss 使凸起，使显现</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]self-effacing adj. 谦卑、低调的</div>
<h2>effervesce[sound:effervesce.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">冒泡：</font>to bubble, hiss, and foam as gas escapes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]effervescing with bubbles 冒气泡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bubble, foam, froth</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">兴奋，热情洋溢：</font>to show high spirits or animation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]effervescing over the news of victory  因胜利的消息而兴奋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rejoice, exult, jubilate, triumph</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]grieve 感到极度悲伤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]effervescent adj. 热情洋溢的；effervescence n. 热情洋溢</div>
<h2>effete[sound:effete.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">衰弱的：</font>depleted of vitality, force, or effectiveness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an effete monarchy 奄奄一息的君主制</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consumed, debilitated, decadent, degenerate, depleted, drained, exhausted, feeble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hale, sound, robust 强健的，充满活力的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏信念的，懦弱的：</font>lacking strength of will or character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The government is too effete to take out the powerful special interests that really ruin this state.  政府过于懦弱，不敢去摧毁那些祸害这个国家的特殊利益集团</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]frail, invertebrate, nerveless, spineless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]backboned, firm, hard, strong, tough  刚毅的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]effetely adv. 衰弱地</div>
<h2>effluvium[sound:effluvium.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">难闻的气味：</font>an offensive exhalation or smell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Repulsive effluvia made us vomit. 这恶臭让我们作呕</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]malodor, stink, stench</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fragrance, aroma 芳香</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">没用的副产品，废品：</font>a by-product especially in the form of waste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With nothing but effluvia obtained, researchers decided to abandon this method. 由于得不到目标产物，研究者们决定放弃这种手段</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dross, refuse, rubbish, trash, waste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]effluvial adj. 恶臭的</div>
<h2>effrontery[sound:effrontery.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">厚颜无耻，放肆大胆：</font>flagrant disregard of courtesy or propriety and an arrogant assumption ofprivilege</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]had the effrontery to insult her father  胆敢辱骂她的父亲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacity, brashness, brazenness, insolence, nerve, presumption, temerity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decorum, propriety, courtesy, grace 得体；timidity 胆小</div>
<h2>effulgent[sound:effulgent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">光辉灿烂的：</font>shining brilliantly; resplendent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an effulgent sunset on the Atlantic 大西洋上壮丽辉煌的日落</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bright, beaming, glorious, luminous, radiant, splendid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dim, murky, dull 模糊的，黯淡的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]effulgence n. 光辉</div>
<h2>effusive[sound:effusive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">感情泛滥溢于言表的；感情表达不节制和过度的；过分多情的：</font>unrestrained  or  excessive  inemotional expression</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The principal delivered an effusive address at the commencement ceremony.  校长在毕业典礼上做了充满感情的演讲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]emotional, expansive, demonstrative, gushy, passionate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inhibited, reserved, restrained 节制的；undemonstrative, unemotional  不易动情的；numb, torpid  麻木不仁的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]effusion n. 流出，溢出</div>
<h2>egalitarian[sound:egalitarian.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平等主义的：</font>affirming, promoting, or characterized by belief in equal political, economic, social,and civil rights for all people</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the egalitarian principle guiding his endeavor 引导他奋斗的平等主义原则</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disinterested, impartial, unprejudiced, unbiased, objective</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inequitable, discriminating, unfair 有偏见的，不公平的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]egalitarianism n. 平等主义</div>
<h2>egoistic[sound:egoistic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">利己的，以自我为中心的：</font>being centered in or preoccupied with oneself and the gratification ofone's own desires</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]egoistic behaviors others detest 令他人厌恶的利己行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]egocentric, self-centered, individualistic, navel-gazing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]altruistic, selfless 利他的，无私的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ego n. 自大，自我；egoism n. 利己主义；egoist n. 以自我为中心的人</div>
<h2>elaborate[sound:elaborate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">详细的，复杂的：</font>marked by complexity, fullness of detail, or ornament</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an elaborate manual 内容详尽的使用手册</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circumstantial, complex, complicated, intricate, knotty, minute, particular, particularized, sophisticated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sketchy, brief, compendious, summary 概要性的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">详细阐述：</font>to expand something in detail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The defense committee asked the PhD candidate to elaborate one critical assumption in his thesis. 答辩委员会要求答辩的博士进一步说明他毕业论文中的一个关键假设</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]develop, expand, amplify, explain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abstract, abbreviate, condense, simplify 简化；downplay, ignore, neglect, overlook 忽视，忽略</div>
<h2>elastic[sound:elastic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有弹性的：</font>easily resuming original shape after being stretched or expanded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]elastic rubber band 弹性橡胶圈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bouncy, flexible, malleable, resilient, stretchable, supple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rigid, stiff  僵化的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">能（迅速从伤痛中）恢复的：</font>capable  of  recovering  quickly  especially  from  depression  ordisappointment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]owe her success to an elastic optimistic nature 将她的成功归因于能迅速走出悲伤的乐观品质</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adaptable, adjustable, buoyant, pliable, volatile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]established, fixed, immutable 不变的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inelastic adj. 无弹性的，非弹性的</div>
<h2>elate[sound:elate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使开心，使自豪：</font>to fill with joy or pride</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The phenomenal sales record elated him. 卓越的业绩让他高兴不已</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheer, excite, exhilarate, inspire, stimulate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]depress, dishearten, sadden 使沮丧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]elated adj. 高兴的；elation n. 高兴</div>
<h2>eleemosynary[sound:eleemosynary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">慈善的：</font>of, relating to, or supported by charity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an eleemosynary foundation funded by the Bill Gates 由比尔·盖茨夫妇资助的慈善基金</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]benevolent, charitable, humane, humanitarian, philanthropic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]parsimonious  吝啬的</div>
<h2>elegy[sound:elegy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">哀歌（诗），挽歌（诗）：</font>a song or poem expressing sorrow or lamentation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an moving elegy played at the funeral 葬礼上演奏的催人泪下的挽歌</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dirge, lamentation, requiem</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ode 颂歌，颂词</div>
<h2>elephantine[sound:elephantine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">巨大的：</font>having enormous size or strength</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an elephantine meteor crate 巨大的陨石坑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]huge, colossal, enormous, gargantuan, gigantic, massive, prodigious, tremendous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]microscopic, minute, tiny            , infinitesimal 细微的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">笨拙的：</font>clumsy, ponderous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]elephantine movements 笨拙的行动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]awkward, graceless, maladroit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]graceful 优雅的</div>
<h2>elevate[sound:elevate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">道德、智力、文化水平的提升：</font>to improve morally, intellectually, or culturally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a novel that both entertains and elevates readers 一本寓教于乐的小说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advance, boost, enhance, ennoble, raise, upgrade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abase, debase, demote, degrade 贬低</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使兴奋：</font>to raise the spirits of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]one of the most elevating moments in their lives 生命中最让人兴奋的时刻之一</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elate, enrapture, exhilarate, intoxicate, transport</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]depress 使沮丧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]elevation n. 提升；喜悦</div>
<h2>elicit[sound:elicit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激起，唤起：</font>to draw forth or bring out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The king’s speech elicited lasting cheer and applause.  国王的演讲激起了持续的欢呼和掌声</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arouse, evoke, excite, inspire, provoke, raise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, placate, mollify, pacify  平息</div>
<h2>elliptical[sound:elliptical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">含糊不清的：</font>of or relating to deliberate obscurity (as of literary or conversational style)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]give an elliptical response to the inquiry 就问题给出一个含糊其辞的回答</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambiguous, arcane, cryptic, enigmatic, equivocal, inscrutable, murky, nebulous, occult, opaque, vague</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear, explicit, unambiguous, unequivocal 清晰明确的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">椭圆的：</font>of, relating to, or shaped like an ellipse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]oval, ovate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circular, round 圆形的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ellipse n. 椭圆</div>
<h2>elucidate[sound:elucidate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">阐明：</font>to make lucid especially by explanation or analysis</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]elucidate an abstruse equation in quantum mechanics  阐明一个深奥难懂的量子力学方程</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clarify, clear, construe, explain, explicate, expound, illustrate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confuse, obfuscate, obscure 使困惑；garble 曲解</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]elucidation n. 阐释，阐明</div>
<h2>emaciate[sound:emaciate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使变瘦：</font>to cause to lose flesh so as to become very thin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]become emaciated by long illness 因长年累月的病痛而消瘦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fatten 变胖</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使虚弱：</font>to make feeble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His hesitation emaciated the force of his argument. 他的迟疑削弱了他论证的力度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]droop, flag, sag, decay, enfeeble, enervate, languish, wane, wither</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]invigorate 使充满活力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]emaciation n. 虚弱</div>
<h2>emancipate[sound:emancipate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">解放，解除束缚：</font>to free from bondage, oppression, or restraint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]emancipate students from excessive assignments  将学生从题海中解放出来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discharge, enfranchise, free, liberate, loose, manumit, release</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bind, shackle 束缚；enslave, enthrall 奴役</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]emancipation n. 解放，获得自由</div>
<h2>embargo[sound:embargo.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">贸易禁止令：</font>a legal prohibition on commerce</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a trade embargo on luxuries 对奢侈品的禁运令</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ban, interdiction, proscription, sanction, veto</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]approval, license, permission, prescription 许可</div>
<h2>embark[sound:embark.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">上船：</font>to go aboard a vessel or aircraft, as at the start of a journey</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With all cargos embarked, the ship weighed the anchor. 所有货物都上船了，货船拔锚起航</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]board</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disembark 下车，下船</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">开始从事：</font>to make a start</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]embark on a world tour 开始了环游世界的旅程</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]begin, commence, launch, initiate, start,</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conclude, end, finish, terminate 结束</div>
<h2>embarrass[sound:embarrass.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使尴尬：</font>to cause to experience a state of self-conscious distress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]bawdy jokes that embarrassed her 让她尴尬的荤段子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abash, discomfit, disconcert, faze, fluster, mortify, nonplus</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">阻挠，制造障碍：</font>to create difficulty for the work or activity of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A lot of this paperwork is unnecessary and just embarrasses the organization. 这些文案工作很多都是多余的，只会妨碍组织的工作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]encumber, handicap, hinder, impede, inhibit, obstruct, shackle, stymie, trammel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aid, facilitate 促进</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]embarrassing adj. 令人窘迫的；embarrassment n. 尴尬</div>
<h2>embed[sound:embed.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">嵌入：</font>to enclose closely in or as if in a matrix</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The thorn was embedded in her thumb. 刺扎入了她的拇指</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]entrench, fix, ingrain, root</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extract 取出；dislodge, uproot 移出</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]embedded adj. 嵌入式的</div>
<h2>embezzle[sound:embezzle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">盗用：</font>to appropriate (as property entrusted to one's care) fraudulently to one's own use</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]limitations on the right of the state to embezzle private property 限制政府挪用私人财产的权利</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appropriate, peculate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confiscate 没收充公</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]embezzlement n. 挪用，盗用</div>
<h2>embolden[sound:embolden.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">鼓励，使大胆：</font>to instill with boldness or courage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be emboldened by the wine 借酒壮胆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]encourage, animate, cheer, hearten, strengthen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]daunt, discourage, dishearten, dispirit 使沮丧，使丧失信心</div>
<h2>emboss[sound:emboss.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">以浮雕效果妆点，装饰：</font>to raise the surface of into bosses; especially to ornament with raisedwork</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]embossed with a design of Shanghai skyline 刻有上海城市轮廓的浮雕图案</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adorn, beautify, bedeck, blazon, ornament, garnish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flatten, efface  抹平，抹去</div>
