<h2>embroider[sound:embroider.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（时常伴有夸张和想象内容）详细说明：</font>to give an elaborate account of, often with florid languageand fictitious details</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]embroider the story of his adventures in the army 细说他服役时惊险的经历</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elaborate, embellish, exaggerate, magnify, overstate, hyperbolize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]downplay, de-emphasize 轻描淡写</div>
<h2>emigrate[sound:emigrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">移民，移居海外：</font>to leave one's place of residence or country to live elsewhere</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]have to emigrate to the United States due to political persecution 不得不因政治迫害而移民美国</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]migrate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]immigrate 移入，入境；repatriate 遣返</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]emigrant n. （向外的）移民；emigration n. （向外）迁徙</div>
<h2>eminent[sound:eminent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">杰出的：</font>exhibiting eminence especially in standing above others in some quality or position</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an eminent young scientist 一名杰出的青年科学家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]famous, celebrated, distinguished, famed, notable, prominent, renowned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mediocre, undistinguished 中庸的，平凡的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]eminence n. 杰出，显赫</div>
<h2>emollient[sound:emollient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">起缓和作用的：</font>making less intense or harsh</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]soothe us in our grieves with emollient words  用安慰的话语抚平我们的悲伤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appeasing, assuaging, mollifying, mitigating, relieving</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggravating, intensifying 使（局势、情况）加剧恶化的</div>
<h2>emulate[sound:emulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">仿效并努力超越：</font>to strive to equal or excel, especially through imitation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a role model worthy emulating 值得效仿的榜样</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]copy, imitate, mimic, mime</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]emulation n. 模仿</div>
<h2>enact[sound:enact.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt.<font color="#aa00ff">制定颁布法律：</font>to establish by legal and authoritative act</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Congress enacted the tax reform bill. 国会颁布了税法改革案</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constitute, establish, legislate, pass, ratify, ordain, lay down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abolish, repeal, rescind, revoke  废除</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]enactment n. 颁布</div>
<h2>enamel[sound:enamel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">涂亮漆；使具有光滑或亮泽的表面：</font>to give a glossy or brilliant surface to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]glaze, varnish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]efface 抹去</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">用亮丽的表面装饰：</font>to adorn with a brightly colored surface</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adorn, beautify, bedeck, decorate, , embellish, garnish, ornament</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disfigure 毁容</div>
<h2>encomium[sound:encomium.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">赞颂之词：</font>glowing and warmly enthusiastic praise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]received encomiums from literary critics 受到文学评论家的好评</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accolade, applause, compliment, eulogy, laud, panegyric, salutation, tribute</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]criticism 批评；abuse, invective, vituperation 辱骂</div>
<h2>encompass[sound:encompass.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">组成，包含：</font>to constitute or include</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a plan that encompasses multiple aims  一项包含了多个目标的计划</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contain, comprehend, embody, entail, involve, subsume</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exclude 排除</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">包围：</font>envelop</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Berlin had already been encompassed by the Red Army and all Soviet soldiers were patiently waiting for the order to put a final nail in Nazi Germany’s coffin. 柏林已被红军包围，苏联士兵们静静地等待着最后的命令，彻底消灭纳粹德国</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circle, embrace, enclose, environ, surround</div>
<h2>encumber[sound:encumber.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">阻碍；妨碍：</font>to impede or hamper the function or activity of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Negotiation between the two parties were encumbered by a lack of trust  两党间的谈判因缺乏信任而受到阻碍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hamper, hinder, impede, obstruct, retard, stymie</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]promote, further 推动；aid, assist, facilitate, help 帮助</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">增添负担：</font>to place a weight or burden on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Don't encumber your pack animal so much that it can hardly move. 别让你的牲畜驮这么多东西，它都走不动了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burden, laden, lumber, saddle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unload 卸下</div>
<h2>endemic[sound:endemic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">地方性的：</font>prevalent in or peculiar to a particular locality, region, or people</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an endemic disease 地方性疾病</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aboriginal, indigenous, native, domestic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exotic, foreign, nonindigenous, nonnative  国外的，外来的</div>
<h2>endorse[sound:endorse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">公开支持，推崇：</font>to express support or approval of publicly and definitely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]endorse a presidential candidate 公开支持一名总统候选人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advocate, back, approve, certify, champion, sanction, support, uphold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deprecate, impugn, oppose  反对</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]endorsement n. 支持；补充条款</div>
<h2>enervate[sound:enervate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使衰弱：</font>to weaken or destroy the strength or vitality of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His constitution was enervated by lustful lifestyle. 他荒淫无度的生活习惯已使他身体虚弱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debilitate, disable, enfeeble, fatigue, sap</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fortify, strengthen 强化；energize, invigorate, vitalize  注入活力</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使麻木：</font>to deprive of emotional or intellectual vitality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A lifetime of working in dreary jobs had enervated his very soul.  一生忙于无聊的工作让他变得无比麻木</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dampen, deaden, petrify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brace, energize, enliven, invigorate, vitalize, vivify  使充满活力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]enervation n. 虚弱</div>
<h2>enfranchise[sound:enfranchise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">给予权利（例如选举权）：</font>to endow with the rights of citizenship, especially the right to vote</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Slaves in US were emancipated in 1863 but were not enfranchised until the Fifteenth Amendment went into effect in 1870. 尽管在美国奴隶于 1863 年就获得了解放，但他们直到 1870 年《第五修正案》正式生效才获得选举权</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disenfranchise, disempower 剥夺权利</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">解放：</font>to set free (as from slavery)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In a way, modern labor-saving appliances enfranchised people, giving them much more leisure time. 从某种意义上来说，那些节省劳动力的现代设备将人们解放出来，给予更多的休闲时间</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discharge, emancipate, free, liberate, manumit, rescue, unfetter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bind, confine, enfetter 束缚；subjugate, subdue; enthrall 使臣服；使成为奴隶</div>
<h2>engender[sound:engender.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">引起，使发展：</font>to cause to exist or to develop</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her latest book has engendered a lot of controversy. 她的新书引发了很多争议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beget, cause, catalyze, generate, induce, invoke, produce, spawn</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">产生，出现：</font>to come into existence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Feelings of confidence and independence that were only just beginning to engender within her.  她的自信和独立的感觉才刚刚产生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]actualize, appear, arise, form, materialize, spring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cease 停止；disappear, perish 消逝，死亡；eradicate; quash; terminate 根除；平息；终止</div>
<h2>engross[sound:engross.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使全神贯注：</font>to occupy exclusively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]was completely engrossed in his work 全神贯注于他的工作之中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absorb, engage, enthrall, fascinate, grip, immerse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]engrossed adj. 全神贯注的</div>
<h2>enigma[sound:enigma.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">难以理解或解释的事物，谜：</font>something hard to understand or explain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The smile on Da Vinci’s masterpiece Mona Lisa has been an enigma for hundred years. 数百年来，达芬奇名作《蒙娜丽莎》上的微笑一直是个不解之谜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mystery, conundrum, puzzle, riddle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]enigmatic adj. 谜一般的</div>
<h2>enlighten[sound:enlighten.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使知道：</font>to give information to; inform or instruct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]enlightened us about the thorny problem  启发我们思考这个棘手的问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprise, instruct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bewilder, confuse, confound, perplex 使疑惑</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（在道德上）进行教育：</font>to provide (someone) with moral or spiritual understanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Many people around the world have been enlightened by the teachings of Gautama Buddha. 释迦摩尼的说教启迪了世界上许许多多的人的灵魂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]edify, educate, illuminate, nurture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]enlightening adj. 具有启发性的</div>
<h2>enmity[sound:enmity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">敌意：</font>positive, active, and typically mutual hatred or ill will</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unspoken enmity between two factions 两个派系间心照不宣的仇恨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animosity, animus, antagonism, antipathy, feud, gall, hostility, rancor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amity, comity 友好；concord 和睦</div>
<h2>entangle[sound:entangle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">卷入，纠缠：</font>to twist together into a usually confused mass</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]we managed to entangle the string of lights into a hopeless mess of wires 我们将小灯泡的线纠缠成了一堆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]interlace, intertwist, knot, snarl, tangle</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使变复杂或困难：</font>to make complex or difficult</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the history of Alexander the Great is entangled by variant accounts of his exploits 亚历山大大帝的生平历史被不同版本的记录搞得很纠结</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]complexify, perplex, sophisticate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]simplify, streamline 简化</div>
<h2>enthusiasm[sound:enthusiasm.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">热情，兴趣：</font>urgent desire or interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]in my enthusiasm to get going, I forgot to pack any foul-weather clothing  在强烈的出游热情下，我忘记带上防备坏天气的衣服了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardor, avidity, desirousness, impatience, keenness, lust, thirst</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathy, indifference 无动于衷，漠不关心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]enthusiastic adj. 热情的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]halfhearted 心不在焉的</div>
<h2>entice[sound:entice.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">诱使：</font>to attract artfully or adroitly or by arousing hope or desire: tempt; lure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]entice sb into doing sth 诱使某人做某事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allure, bait, beguile, decoy, seduce, solicit, tempt, lead on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]enticing adj. 诱人的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]formidable 可怕的</div>
<h2>entrance[sound:entrance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">进入权，进入许可：</font>the means or right of entering or participating in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]entrance to the club is by invitation only 该俱乐部只接受受邀入会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]access, admission, admittance, gateway, ingress, passport, ticket</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使入迷：</font>to fill with delight, wonder, or enchantment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be entranced by the view 陶醉于景色</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enrapture, enthrall, ravish, transport, carry away</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bore, disappoint, disgust, repel, repulse 使厌烦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]entrancing adj. 使人欣喜的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unprepossessing 不讨人喜欢的</div>
<h2>entrap[sound:entrap.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">诱骗：</font>to lure into a compromising statement or act</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a string of inconsistent statements finally entrapped the witness  一系列不一致的陈述最终蒙骗了目击者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ensnare, ensnarl, entoil, mesh, net, snare, catch up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disentangle, untangle</div>
<h2>entreat[sound:entreat.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">恳求：</font>to plead with especially in order to persuade, ask urgently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]entreated his boss for another chance 恳求老板再给一次机会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beseech, besiege, conjure, implore, importune, solicit, supplicate, plead to, appeal to</div>
<h2>enunciate[sound:enunciate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">清晰地说：</font>to utter articulate sounds</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]enunciate your words, and then you won't have to repeat them so often 把话说清楚，你就不用经常重复了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]articulate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">公开宣布，宣称：</font>to make known openly or publicly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]today the President enunciated a new foreign policy 总统在今天宣布了一项新的对外政策</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annunciate, broadcast, declare, herald, proclaim, promulgate, publicize, release, give out</div>
<h2>ephemeral[sound:ephemeral.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">短暂的：</font>lasting a very short time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]ephemeral pleasures 暂时的压力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]evanescent, fleeting, impermanent, temporary, transient, transitory, fugacious, fugitive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eternal, permanent, perpetual, enduring, everlasting, ceaseless, immortal, undying 永久的</div>
<h2>epic[sound:epic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">宏大的，超凡脱俗的：</font>surpassing the usual or ordinary, particularly in scope or size</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his genius was epic 他聪明过人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]august, grandiose, imposing, magnificent, majestic, monumental</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humble, unheroic, unimpressive, modest  适度的，印象不深的</div>
<h2>epicure[sound:epicure.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">美食家：</font>one with sensitive and discriminating tastes especially in food or wine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Thomas Jefferson was one of America's first great epicures 托马斯·杰斐逊算得上是美国早期美食家一枚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bon vivant, gastronomist, gourmand, gourmet</div>
<h2>epigram[sound:epigram.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">机智的短诗，警句：</font>a short, witty poem expressing a single thought or observation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Benjamin Franklin's most famous epigram, “Remember that time is money”  本杰明·富兰克林最著名的警句就是，时间就是金钱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adage, aphorism, apothegm, byword, maxim, proverb</div>
<h2>epilogue[sound:epilogue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">文学作品的结局：</font>a concluding section that rounds out the design of a literary work</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]preface 序文</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">戏剧的收场白：</font>the final scene of a play that comments on or summarizes the main action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coda</div>
<h2>epithet[sound:epithet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">外号，绰号：</font>a descriptive or familiar name given instead of or in addition to the one belonging toan individual  ；a disparaging or abusive word or phrase</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]King Richard I of England was given the very laudatory epithet “the Lion-Hearted”  英王理查一世因英勇大胆被赞誉为“狮心理查”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alias, cognomen, sobriquet</div>
<h2>epitomize[sound:epitomize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">摘要：</font>to make into a short statement of the main points (as of a report)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his personal code of behavior on the playing field is epitomized by his favorite saying, Nice guys finish last.他在赛场上的座右铭是：好男坚持到底。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstract, digest, encapsulate, outline, recapitulate, synopsize, sum up</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">代表，体现，是…的典型范例：</font>to represent in visible form, to be a typical example of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the Parthenon in Athens epitomizes the ancient Greek ideal of architectural beauty 雅典的巴特农神庙体现了古希腊对于建筑美感的理念 || behavior that epitomizes selfishness 典型的自私行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]body, express, externalize, incarnate, incorporate, instantiate, manifest, materialize, substantiate</div>
<h2>equable[sound:equable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（脾气、性情）温和的：</font>not easily disturbed; serene</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]equable temperament 温和的性情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balmy, genial, gentle, moderate, temperate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]harsh, inclement, intemperate, severe 严厉的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]equanimity n.温和</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitation, excitability 激动</div>
<h2>equity[sound:equity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不偏不倚，公平：</font>lack of favoritism toward one side or another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the lower wages paid to women for equal work violated the notion of equity  同等工作付给女性更低的报酬违背了公平的理念</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disinterestedness, equity, evenhandedness, fairness, impartiality, neutrality, nonpartisanship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bias, favoritism, nonobjectivity, one-sidedness, partiality, partisanship, prejudice 歧视，偏见</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]equitable a.公平的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]biased, discriminatory 偏袒的，差别对待的</div>
<h2>equivalent[sound:equivalent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj./n. 等价的，相等的：equal in force, amount, or value</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that huge mansion is the equivalent of five ordinary houses  那栋巨大的公馆有五套一般户型的房子那么大</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coequal, coordinate, counterpart, peer, rival, parallel</div>
<h2>equivocate[sound:equivocate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（带有欺骗目的地）模棱两可地说，说谎话：</font>to use equivocal language especially with intent todeceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]When asked about his tax plan, the candidate didn't equivocate.  当被问到税收方案时，候选人直言不讳。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fudge, hedge, weasel, prevaricate, palter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]communicate straightforwardly 直率地说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]equivocal  adj. 模棱两可的：open  to  two  or  more  interpretations  and  often  intended  to  mislead;ambiguous.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]equivocation n. 模棱两可的话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarity 清楚</div>
<h2>erode[sound:erode.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">侵蚀，慢慢减少：</font>to consume or wear away gradually</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]flooding eroded the hillside  洪水冲刷着山岭 || inflation eroding buying power  通货膨胀导致购买力下降</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]corrode, fret, gnaw, nibble, bite at</div>
<h2>errant[sound:errant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">居无定所的：</font>traveling from place to place</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the errant gunslinger as a standard character in western novels  在西部题材小说中，叛逆的持枪歹徒是经典形象</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambulant, fugitive, nomadic, perambulatory, roaming, roving, vagabond, vagrant, wandering</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">误入歧途的，犯错误的：</font>straying from the proper course or standards</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]errant youngsters  误入歧途的青少年 [近]misbehaving, mischievous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]behaved, behaving, nice, orderly 行为规矩的</div>
<h2>erratic[sound:erratic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">善变的：</font>not staying constant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]business at the fast-food restaurant has been so erratic lately that the manager never knows how muchstaff to have on hand 快餐店的生意最近非常起伏以至于经理也不清楚需要多少人手</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]changing, fluctuating, irregular, unequal, unstable, unsteady, varying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]changeless, constant, stable, steady, unchanging, unvarying 不变的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">异常的，不同寻常的：</font>different from the ordinary in a way that causes curiosity or suspicion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the key to the code was the erratic punctuation the killer used 解开密码的关键是杀手使用的不同寻常的标点符号</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bizarre,  eccentric,  offbeat,  outlandish,  out-of-the-way,  peculiar,  quaint,  queer,  remarkable,  screwy, spaced-out, way-out, weird</div>
<h2>erudite[sound:erudite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">博学的：</font>characterized by erudition; learned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an erudite scholar  渊博的学者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]knowledgeable, learned, lettered, literate, scholarly, well-read</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ignorant, unlettered, benighted, illiterate, uneducated, unscholarly 无知的</div>
<h2>escalate[sound:escalate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（战争等）升级，扩大：</font>to increase in extent, volume, number, amount, intensity, or scope</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We don’t want to escalate the war. 我们不想使战争扩大。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggrandize, amplify, augment, boost, expand, pump up, build up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]wane, diminish 减弱</div>
<h2>eschew[sound:eschew.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">刻意避开；戒绝：</font>to avoid habitually especially on moral or practical grounds</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the minister eschews involvement in local politics, since he doesn't want to diminish his moral authority inthe community 首相回避参与当地政治，因为他不想降低其道德权威</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dodge, elude, evade, shirk, shun, weasel out of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]embrace, greet, welcome, habitually indulge in, seek 乐于接受，寻觅</div>
<h2>esoteric[sound:esoteric.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">深奥难懂的：</font>difficult for one of ordinary knowledge or intelligence to understand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]esoteric terminology 少数人知道的专业术语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstruse, arcane, hermetic, recondite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]shallow, superficial 肤浅的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">少数人知道的：</font>not known or meant to be known by the general populace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The actor must have had some esoteric motive for leaving stage. 该演员淡出舞台肯定有不为人知的原因。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]confidential, inside, intimate, nonpublic, privy, secret</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]common accepted, generally known, open, public  公开的，普遍接受的</div>
<h2>espouse[sound:espouse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">支持；拥护：</font>to take up and support as a cause</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the revolutionary cause 支持革命事业</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]embrace, take on, take up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abjure, repudiate 誓绝</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">结婚：</font>to take in marriage; marry</div>
<h2>esteem[sound:esteem.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 尊重：to regard with respect; prize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be held in high esteem  被高度敬仰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appreciation, estimation, favor, regard, respect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disfavor, odium 不喜欢，憎恶</div>
<h2>estimable[sound:estimable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">值得尊敬的：</font>deserving of esteem; admirable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an estimable adversary 一位值得尊敬的对手</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]prestigious, reputable, applaudable, commendable, creditable, meritorious, praiseworthy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contemptible, infamous, censurable, discreditable, illaudable, reprehensible 令人鄙视的</div>
<h2>estrange[sound:estrange.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使疏远，离间，使感情失和：</font>to arouse especially mutual enmity or indifference in where there hadformerly been love, affection, or friendliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he estranged several of his coworkers 他和好多同事疏远了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alienate, disaffect, disgruntle, sour</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reconcile  和好</div>
<h2>etch[sound:etch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">蚀刻：</font>to produce (as a pattern or design) on a hard material by eating into the material's surface(as by acid or laser beam)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the artist etched his landscape on a copper plate 艺术家将风景画刻在铜盘上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grave, incise, inscribe</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">留下深刻印象，铭记：</font>to produce a vivid impression of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]in just a few pages the writer etched an unforgettable portrait of one of the more remarkable First Ladies仅用数页，作者刻画出了一位杰出的第一夫人令人难忘的形象</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impress, imprint, infix, ingrain</div>
<h2>eternal[sound:eternal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">永恒的：</font>having infinite duration; everlasting; perpetual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]eternal love 永恒的爱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ageless, everlasting, immortal, imperishable, perennial, perpetual, undying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ephemeral 短暂的</div>
<h2>ethereal[sound:ethereal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">轻巧精致的：</font>resembling air in lightness, highly refined; delicate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the bakery's scrumptious pastries have a wonderfully ethereal consistency 面包师可口的糕点有着一种奇妙的蓬松轻巧的质感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fluffy, gossamer, light</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heavy, leaden, ponderous 沉重的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">天国的：</font>of, relating to, or suggesting heaven</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a land of ethereal beauty and tranquility 具有缥缈的美感和宁静的一片土地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elysian, empyreal, heavenly, supernal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]chthonic, hellish, infernal, Tartarean 地狱的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非物质的，精神（上）的：</font>not of this world; spiritual; not composed of matter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that ethereal attribute that every performer should have—charisma 每位演奏者都应该具有一种精神上的特质——那就是个人魅力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bodiless, formless, incorporeal, insubstantial, nonmaterial, nonphysical, spiritual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bodily, corporeal, material, physical, substantial 物质的，有实体的</div>
<h2>ethics[sound:ethics.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">道德规范：</font>rules or standards governing the conduct of a person or the members of a profession</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an old-fashioned work ethic 传统的工作行为规范</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ethos, morality, morals, norms, principles, standards</div>
<h2>eulogize[sound:eulogize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">称赞；颂扬：</font>to speak or write in high praise of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was eulogized at his funeral as a caring husband and a good father. 他在悼词中被称赞为一个好丈夫、一个好爸爸。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defame, pan, stricture 诬蔑，指责</div>
<h2>euphemism[sound:euphemism.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">婉言，委婉的说法：</font>the substitution of an agreeable or inoffensive expression for one that mayoffend or suggest something unpleasant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]using “eliminate” as a euphemism for “kill” “杀死”的委婉说法是“灭掉”</div>
<h2>euphonious[sound:euphonious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">悦耳的：</font>pleasing or agreeable to the ear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mellifluous, melodious, canorous, harmonizing, symphonious, tuneful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cacophonous, discordant, disharmonious, dissonant, tuneless, unmelodious 刺耳的</div>
<h2>euphoria[sound:euphoria.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">感觉极其愉快：</font>a state of overwhelming usually pleasurable emotion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The initial euphoria following her victory in the election has now subsided. 选举成功带来的最初的欢愉感现在已经消失。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elation, exhilaration, intoxication, transport, rapture, rhapsody</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]depression 沮丧</div>
<h2>evacuate[sound:evacuate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">撤空：</font>to empty or remove the contents of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]were ordered to evacuate the building 被命令搬出大楼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clear, vacate, void</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fill up, occupy, load 填满</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">撤退：</font>to remove especially from a military zone or dangerous area</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]During World War II, children were evacuated from London to the country. 二战期间，伦敦市的儿童被撤离到郊区。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conquer 占领</div>
<h2>evanescent[sound:evanescent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">逐渐消失的，短暂的：</font>tending to vanish like vapor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Beauty is as evanescent as a rainbow. 容颜易老，年华易逝。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ephemeral, fleeting, impermanent, temporary, transient, transitory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ceaseless,  endless,  enduring,  eternal,  everlasting,  immortal,  permanent,  perpetual,  timeless,  undying, unending, abiding, lasting, perpetual 持久的</div>
<h2>evasive[sound:evasive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难以发现、捕捉、分离的；含糊其词的：</font>hard to find, capture, or isolate; equivocal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an evasive statement 模棱两可的陈述</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fugitive, slippery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unequivocal 明确的</div>
<h2>everlasting[sound:everlasting.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">永恒的，持久的：</font>lasting forever; eternal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]To his everlasting credit, he never once gave in to temptation. 他人品非常好，从来没有受到诱惑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ageless, enduring, eternal, immortal, imperishable, perennial, perpetual, undying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impermanent, mortal, temporary, transient, ephemeral 短暂的</div>
<h2>evict[sound:evict.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">赶出，逐出：</font>to put out (a tenant, for example) by legal process; expel.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her landlord has threatened to evict her if she doesn't pay the rent soon. 她的房东威胁说如果再不交房租就要把她赶出去。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]harbor 收容</div>
<h2>evince[sound:evince.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">表明：</font>to make known (something abstract) through outward signs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]evince a strong desire 明显地表现出强烈的欲望</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bespeak, betray, declare, demonstrate, expose, manifest, reveal, give away,</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conceal, keep hidden 隐藏</div>
<h2>evoke[sound:evoke.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">唤起，引发：</font>to call forth or up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]evoke memories 唤起回忆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elicit, inspire, raise</div>
<h2>exacerbate[sound:exacerbate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使加剧,  使恶化：</font>to make more violent, bitter, or severe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a heavy rainfall that exacerbated the flood problems 大雨恶化了洪水问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, complicate, worsen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allay, alleviate, assuage, mitigate, relieve, palliate 缓和</div>
<h2>exacting[sound:exacting.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严格的，苛求的：</font>making severe demands; rigorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an exacting instructor 一位严苛的导师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choosy, demanding, fastidious, finical, fussy, pernickety, persnickety, picky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]exact v. 强求，索取：to force the payment or yielding of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]exact tribute from a conquered people 从征服的人民手中强取贡品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]condone, forgive 赦免免除债务</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">费时间花心思的：</font>requiring much time, effort, or careful attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]editing and proofreading will always be an exacting task 编辑和校对是花时间花心思的工作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arduous, burdensome, challenging, grueling, killing, laborious, onerous, taxing, toilsome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]light, unchallenging, undemanding 要求不高的</div>
<h2>exalt[sound:exalt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">提升，提拔：</font>to raise in rank, character, or status; elevate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]popular support and media hype have exalted Super Bowl Sunday to the level of a national holiday  大众广泛的支持和媒体的大肆宣传已然将超级碗杯星期天变成了一个全民狂欢的大节日</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggrandize, canonize, deify, dignify, elevate, ennoble, magnify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abase, degrade, demean ,humble, lower in status  贬抑，降低身份</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">赞扬：</font>to glorify, praise, or honor.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]emblazon, extol, glorify, laud, magnify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]condemn  谴责</div>
<h2>exasperate[sound:exasperate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激怒：</font>to excite the anger of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I was exasperated by the flight delays. 我被飞机延误激怒了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, gall, nettle, peeve, rile, ruffle, vex, burn up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mitigate, mollify 平息</div>

<h2>exemplary[sound:exemplary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">榜样的，值得效仿的：</font>constituting, serving as, or worthy of being a pattern to be imitated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]as a hospital volunteer he has given exemplary service to his community  他作为医疗志愿者为社区起到了模范的作用</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]monitory, archetypal, imitable, paradigmatic, quintessential</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]exemplify v. （通过榜样）示范，显示：to show or illustrate by example</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">作为警告的：</font>serving as or offering a warning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]armies have traditionally used public execution as an exemplary punishment for the crime of desertion军队通常将公开处决作为玩忽职守罪的惩罚，以儆效尤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]admonishing, admonitory, monitory, premonitory, warning</div>

<h2>expiate[sound:expiate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">赎罪，纠正：</font>to extinguish the guilt incurred by</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]expiate one’s sin  赎罪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mend, redeem, atone for</div>
<h2>expire[sound:expire.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">断气，死亡：</font>to breathe one's last breath; die</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The patient expired early this morning. 病人今早逝世了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conclude, elapse, terminate, decease, leave off, let up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]come to life 出生</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">到期：</font>to come to an end</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My membership in the club has expired. 我的会员资格到期了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discontinue, elapse, end, finish, terminate, wind up, wink out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continue, persist, hang on 续期</div>
<h2>explicit[sound:explicit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">表达清晰的：</font>fully revealed or expressed without vagueness, implication, or ambiguity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]explicit instructions 表达清晰的指示说明</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clear-cut, definite, specific, unambiguous, unequivocal, univocal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obscure, implicit, implied, inferred, ambiguous, circuitous, equivocal, indefinite, unspecific, vague 模糊的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">成熟的，完全形成的：</font>fully developed or formulated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]explicit plan 成熟的计划</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inchoate 未完成形成的</div>
<h2>exploit[sound:exploit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">英雄行为：</font>a notable or heroic act</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his wartime exploits  他在战争期间的英勇行为</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">最大程度地利用：</font>to employ to the greatest possible advantage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]exploit your opponent's weakness  利用你对手的弱点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abuse, leverage, milk, play on, capitalize on impose on</div>
<h2>exponent[sound:exponent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">倡导者，支持者：</font>one that speaks for, represents, or advocates</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Exponents of space exploration earnestly called for more missions to the outer reaches of the solar system.太空探险的支持者强烈要求对太阳系的外边缘进行探索。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advocator, backer, booster, champion, espouser, friend, promoter, proponent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adversary, antagonist, opponent 反对者</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">实践者：</font>one who brings an art or science to full realization</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]has long reigned as the nation's leading exponent of modern dance 被认为是该国现代舞的集大成者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]expounder, guru, interpreter, practitioner, high priest</div>
<h2>expurgate[sound:expurgate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">净化，删去不当处：</font>to remove erroneous, vulgar, obscene, or otherwise objectionable material from(a book, for example) before publication</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an expurgated edition of the letters  信件的删减版</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bowdlerize, obliterate, launder, red-pencil, clean up</div>
<h2>exquisite[sound:exquisite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">程度强烈的：</font>extreme in degree, power, or effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]suffered exquisite pain  遭受强烈的痛感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acute,  dreadful,  excruciating,  explosive,  ferocious,  fierce,  furious,  intensive,  keen,  profound,  terrible,vehement, vicious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]light, moderate, soft 适当的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精致精巧的：</font>having qualities that appeal to a refined taste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]exquisite pen-and-ink drawings of city scenes  精巧的城市钢笔画</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dainty, delicate, elegant, recherché, select</div>
<h2>extant[sound:extant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">现存的：</font>still in existence; not destroyed, lost, or extinct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the most charming writer extant 目前活着的作家中最有魅力的一位 || extant manuscripts  未毁坏的手稿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]current, immediate, ongoing, present-day, existent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]destroyed, extinct ,lost, missing, dead, extinct, nonextant 丢失的，不存在的</div>
<h2>extemporize[sound:extemporize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">即席表现：</font>to do or perform (something) without prior preparation or practice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a good talk show host has to be able to extemporize the interviews when things don't go as planned  一个好的脱口秀主持人要能够在计划之外即兴表现</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]follow a script  参考草稿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]extemporaneous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]planned 有计划的</div>
<h2>extenuate[sound:extenuate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">减轻罪过：</font>to lessen or to try to lessen the seriousness or extent of by making partial excuses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]try to extenuate their vandalism with the old refrain of “Boys will be boys”  企图用“江山易改本性难移”的俗语为他们的暴行开脱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deodorize, excuse, explain away, gloss over, gloze over</div>
<h2>extinct[sound:extinct.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">灭绝的：</font>no longer existing or living</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]extinct species 灭绝的物种</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bygone, bypast, defunct, expired, nonextant, vanished</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alive, extant, existing, living, resuscitated  现存的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]extinction n. 灭绝</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]perpetuation 永存</div>
<h2>extinguish[sound:extinguish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">熄灭：</font>to put out (a fire, for example); quench</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the fire in the skillet was quickly extinguished by slamming the lid on  平底锅的火苗很快被水浇灭了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blanket, douse, quench, put out, snuff out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ignite, rekindle 点燃</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">终止：</font>to bring to a complete end the physical soundness, existence, or usefulness of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fatal blunder that extinguished all hope that the team would actually win the play-offs  一个致命的失误使得队伍赢得季后赛的希望完全破灭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annihilate, decimate, demolish, desolate, devastate, pulverize, ruin, shatter, smash, tear down, pull down,rub out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]build, construct, erect, raise, rear, set up, put up 建立</div>
