<h2>extraneous[sound:extraneous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无关的：</font>having no relevance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an extraneous digression 无关的跑题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impertinent, inapplicable, irrelative, accidental, adventitious, external</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]applicable, apposite, apropos, germane, pertinent, relative, relevant  相关的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非主要因素的：</font>not forming an essential or vital part</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the architect's streamlined modern style shuns any sort of extraneous ornamentation 建筑师流线型的现代设计避免了一切多余的装饰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accidental, adventitious, alien, external, foreign</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]essential, inherent, innate, intrinsic 本质的，核心的</div>
<h2>extravagant[sound:extravagant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">挥霍的：</font>given to spending money freely or foolishly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]has always been extravagant with her money 挥金如土</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]profligate, spendthrift, squandering, thriftless, unthrifty, wasteful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]frugal, conserving, economical, penny-pinching, scrimping, skimping, thrifty 节省的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过度的，不必要的：</font>going beyond a normal or acceptable limit in degree or amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the book doesn't quite merit the extravagant praise that it has received 这本书被盛赞过度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baroque,  exorbitant,  immoderate,  inordinate,  lavish,  overdue,  overmuch,  overweening,  plethoric,unconscionable, unmerciful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]middling, moderate, modest, reasonable, temperate 适当适度的</div>
<h2>extricate[sound:extricate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使解脱，救出：</font>to free or remove from an entanglement or difficulty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]extricate himself from financial difficulties  使他摆脱财政困境</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disengage, disentangle, free, liberate, release, untangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enmesh, entangle, embroil 卷入</div>
<h2>exuberant[sound:exuberant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常高兴的，热情洋溢的：</font>joyously unrestrained and enthusiastic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Exuberant crowds rushed to greet the returning national champions .  激动的人群争先恐后地向凯旋归来的全国冠军表示问候</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ebullient, effervescent, frolic, buoyant, bouncy, vivacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]austere 克制的；sullen 闷闷不乐的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大量的，充分的：</font>produced in extreme abundance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an exuberant imagination 丰富的想象力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ample, lavish, lush, luxuriant, opulent, plentiful, prodigal, profuse, riotous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]meager, scant, sparse  匮乏的</div>
<h2>exude[sound:exude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">分泌，流出：</font>to flow forth slowly through small openings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sticky resin exuded from the bark 从树皮中分泌出来的带有恶臭的树脂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bleed, ooze, seep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorb 吸收</div>
<h2>exult[sound:exult.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">感到欢喜：</font>to rejoice especially with feelings or display of triumph or self-satisfaction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]exult in a triumph 沉浸在胜利的喜欢当中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delight, glory, jubilate, joy, rejoice, triumph</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lament, mourn 哀悼；bemoan 叹息，悲伤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]exultant adj. 狂喜的</div>
<h2>fable[sound:fable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">寓言故事：</font>a story intended to teach a basic truth or moral about life</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This classic Christmas film is essentially a fableshowing how every person's life has meaning. 这部经典的基督教电影本质上来说是一个寓言，它告诉我们每个人的生命都是有意义的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apologue, parable</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">神话，传说：</font>a legendary story of supernatural happenings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]According to an ancient fable, the waters of the mountain spring are the tears of a woman weeping for herlost children. 根据一个古老的传说，这条山中的泉水是一名失去孩子的母亲所流下的眼泪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]legend, mythos, tale</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">谎言：</font>a statement known by its maker to be untrue and made in order to deceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The stories of lost cities of gold may have been fables deliberately concocted by Native Americans to dupethe Spanish.  所谓的 “失落的黄金之都”的故事也许只是美洲土著们杜撰出来忽悠西班牙人的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fabrication, falsehood, lie, mendacity, prevarication, story</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fact 事实；truth 真相</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fabulous adj. 寓言般的，难以置信的</div>
<h2>fabricate[sound:fabricate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">捏造：</font>to make up for the purpose of deception</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be accused of fabricating evidence 被指控有捏造证据的行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]concoct, coin, devise, forge, fake, feign, invent</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">搭建，组建；打造：</font>to bring into being by combining, shaping, or transforming materials</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The house was essentially fabricated at the factory and then shipped to the site for assembly. 这间房屋的核心主体在工厂内建好之后，它被运往目的地直接进行组装 ‖All the key parts are fabricated from high qualitytitanium alloy. 所有的关键零件都是由上好的钛合金打造的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assemble, construct, erect, frame, fashion, manufacture, produce, rear, set up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demount, disassemble, dismantle, dismember 拆解，拆毁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fabrication n. 组建；虚构的事物</div>
<h2>facetious[sound:facetious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">喜欢开玩笑的，轻浮的：</font>joking or jesting often inappropriately</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Stop being facetious! This is the life-and-death moment. 别开玩笑了！这可是生死攸关的时刻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]humorous, jocose, jocular, waggish, witty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]earnest, sincere 真挚的，真诚的；lugubrious 哀怨的</div>
<h2>facile[sound:facile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">表面的，浅尝辄止的：</font>having or showing a lack of depth of understanding or character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]propose a facile solution to a complex problem 给一个复杂的问题提议一个肤浅的解决方案</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cursory, shallow, simplistic, superficial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deep, profound 深刻的；comprehensive, exhaustive 全面的，详尽的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">容易的，唾手可得的：</font>easily accomplished or attained</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a facile victory 一场轻松易得的胜利</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheap, easy, effortless, painless, royal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arduous, demanding, difficult, formidable, hard, laborious, toilsome, tough 费力的，困难的</div>
<h2>facilitate[sound:facilitate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使变容易，促进：</font>to make easy or easier</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new airport will facilitate the development of tourism.  新建机场促进了旅游业的发展。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ease, expedite, forward, further, help</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]check, hamper, handicap, hinder, impede, obstruct, thwart, retard 阻碍，阻止；complicate 复杂化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]facility n. 设施；容易，方便</div>
<h2>faction[sound:faction.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">派系：</font>a party or group (as within a government) that is often contentious or self-seeking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]affiliated with one faction 附属于某个党派‖North-Ocean Faction 北洋派</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bloc, body, clique, coalition, sect, wing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]factional adj.派系的，派别的</div>
<h2>fallacious[sound:fallacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">谬误的，不合逻辑的：</font>containing or based on a fallacy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the once-common fallacious claim that girls just weren't any good at math 曾经广为流传的一个谬论：女孩子无论如何就是学不好数学</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]illogical, invalid, irrational, mad, reasonless, sophistic, unreasonable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sound 论证有力的；valid 合乎逻辑的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">欺骗性的：</font>tending to deceive or mislead</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fallacious testimony 不真实的证词</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beguiling, deceiving, deceptive, deluding, delusive, delusory, false, fraudulent, misleading</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]authentic, veritable 真实的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fallacy n.逻辑谬误</div>
<h2>fallow[sound:fallow.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">休耕的：</font>left untilled or unsown after plowing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The field was lying fallow. 那田地正在休耕中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]untilled, uncultivated</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">闲置的：</font>not being in a state of use, activity, or employment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The coal mine has been lying fallow since the drop in prices made it unprofitable. 自从煤价下跌造成亏损，这个煤矿就一直处于停工状态</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dead, dormant, inert, inoperative, latent, unused, vacant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]functioning, occupied, operative, running, working 使用中的；active 活跃的</div>
<h2>fail-safe[sound:fail-safe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">保险措施：</font>a measure taken to preclude loss or injury</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There are so many fail-safes built into the system that a highly unlikely series of mistakes would have to be made before failure could occur. 系统中嵌入了大量的保险措施，因此在系统崩溃之前，必须要发生一系列几乎不可能出现的错误</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]caution, palladium, preventive, safeguard</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">万无一失的：</font>having no chance of failure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fail-safe device 自动防故障装置‖Men  have  traditionally  regarded  flowers  as  the  fail-safe  gift  forValentine's Day. 男士们长期以来认为鲜花是情人节永远不会错的礼物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]certain, foolproof, sure, unfailing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fallible 容易犯错的</div>
<h2>falsehood[sound:falsehood.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">谎言：</font>a statement known by its maker to be untrue and made in order to deceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Truth always rise above falsehood, as oil rise above water.  油脂水面浮，真理胜谎言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deception, fable, lie, mendacity, prevarication, untruth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]truth, verity 真相，实话</div>
<h2>falter[sound:falter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">蹒跚：</font>to walk unsteadily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lurch, stagger, stumble, teeter, totter, wobble</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">犹豫，踌躇：</font>to be unsteady in purpose or action, as from loss of courage or confidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Mr. Garrison never once faltered in his demand that slavery be unconditionally abolished. 盖瑞森先生从不对他废除奴隶的要求存有任何的犹豫</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balance, halt, hesitate, vacillate, waver</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]faltering adj. 犹豫的</div>
<h2>fanatic[sound:fanatic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">狂热者：</font>a person marked or motivated by an extreme, unreasoning enthusiasm, as for a cause.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a soccer fanatic 一个足球迷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bigot, devotee, enthusiast, fiend, freak, maniac, partisan, zealot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nonfan 非爱好者</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">狂热的；盲信的：</font>marked by excessive enthusiasm and often intense uncritical devotion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They are fanatic about sadomasochism. 他们对SM 十分狂热</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extreme, rabid, radical, revolutionary, ultra</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conservative 保守的；rational 理性的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fanatical adj. 狂热的；盲信的</div>
<h2>fantasy[sound:fantasy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">幻想：</font>imaginative fiction featuring especially strange settings and grotesque characters</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]indulge in a fantasy 沉迷于幻想</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chimera, conceit, daydream, delusion, dream, hallucination, illusion, vision</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]actuality, fact, reality, truth 事实，现实</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">产生幻想：</font>to form a mental picture of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He regularly fantasies romantic encounters that he knows will never happen. 他会定期意淫一些永远不可能发生的浪漫邂逅</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dream, envisage, envision, fantasize, imagine, picture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fantastic adj. 梦幻般的，极好的</div>
<h2>farce[sound:farce.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（带有嘲讽元素的）滑稽戏：</font>a light dramatic composition marked by broadly satirical comedy andimprobable plot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burlesque, caricature, parody, sham, travesty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]serious play 正剧</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">闹剧：</font>ridiculous or empty show</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The enforcement of this law became a farce. 这条法律的执行过程成了一场闹剧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]joke, mockery, nonsense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]farcical adj. 荒谬的</div>
<h2>fascinate[sound:fascinate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">强列吸引，使入迷：</font>to hold an intense interest or attraction for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]toys that fascinate infants 吸引婴儿们的玩具</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allure, arrest ,attract, bewitch, captivate, charm, enchant, enthrall, grip</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disgust, repel 使厌恶，使反感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fascinating adj. 引人入胜的</div>
<h2>fast[sound:fast.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">绝食；斋戒：</font>an act of abstaining from food</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fast to death 绝食而死</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hunger strike</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">快速的：</font>characterized by quick motion, operation, or effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The fast pace of construction resulted in our new house being done ahead of schedule. 极快的施工使得我们的新房提前竣工</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brisk, expeditious, fleeting, hasty, quick, rapid, speedy, swift</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]slow  慢的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">忠诚的：</font>firm in one's allegiance to someone or something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The two girls soon became fast and inseparable friends. 这两个女孩子很快成为了忠于彼此的形影不离的好伙伴</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constant, dedicated, devoted, devout, loyal, pious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disloyal, perfidious 不忠诚的；treacherous 背叛的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">稳固的，难以拆卸的：</font>firmly positioned in place and difficult to dislodge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The rusty, old screws are so fast in the fitting that there's no hope of getting them out. 这颗生锈的老铁钉已经钉得太死了，根本不可能将其取出</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]firm, frozen, lodged, secure, stable, staunch, strong, stuck</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]loose, shaky 松动的；insecure 不稳定的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fasten    v. 系紧</div>
<h2>fastidious[sound:fastidious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">挑剔的，极仔细的，追求完美的：</font>possessing or displaying careful, meticulous attention to detail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be fastidious about personal hygiene and appearance 极其注意个人卫生和外表</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demanding, exacting, fussy, hypercritical, squeamish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undemanding  不挑剔的；cursory 粗略的，敷衍的；indiscriminate, uncritical 不加区分的</div>
<h2>fateful[sound:fateful.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">意义重大的：</font>involving momentous consequences</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]make a fateful decision to declare war 做出了宣战的重大决定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]critical, crucial, important, momentous, significant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconsequential, insignificant, petty, paltry, trivial, unimportant 不重要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">带来灾难的，毁灭性的：</font>bringing death or disaster</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fateful journey 一趟致命的旅行</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]calamitous, cataclysmic, catastrophic, deadly, destructive, disastrous, fatal, ruinous</div>
<h2>fathom[sound:fathom.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">测量 （深度）：</font>to measure the depth of (as a body of water) typically with a weighted line</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The pilot had to  continually fathom  the river, which drought conditions had lowered to unprecedentedlevels. 舵手不得不时刻注意河水深度，因为干旱已经使水深下降到了前所未有的程度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]plumb</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">彻底理解，弄懂：</font>to penetrate and come to understand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]unable to fathom the what he was talking about 无法弄懂他在说什么</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprehend, cognize, comprehend, grasp, know, understand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]misunderstand 误解</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fathomable adj. 可测量的；可知晓的</div>
<h2>fatigue[sound:fatigue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">疲惫：</font>weariness or exhaustion from labor, exertion, or stress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The day-long battle against the blaze left firefighters in a state of utter fatigue. 与大火一整天的斗争使得消防员们处于极度疲惫的状态</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collapse, exhaustion, lassitude, tiredness, weariness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]refreshment, rejuvenation, revitalization 恢复活力</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（让人厌倦的）苦差事：</font>something, such as tiring effort or activity, that causes weariness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Although  he  had joined the army for action and adventure, much of  his  day seemed to be devoted tomindless fatigues. 尽管当初参军是为了上战场冒险的，但我生活的大部分时间似乎都耗费在了没意思的苦差上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drudge, drudgery, grind, labor, sweat, toil, travail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fun, play 玩耍；sinecure 美差，闲职</div>
<h2>fatuous[sound:fatuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">愚笨的：</font>complacently or inanely foolish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Emperor Yang in the Sui Dynasty is not only a rare fatuous tyrant but also an outstanding poet.  隋炀帝不仅仅是少有的昏暴之君，在文学上还是一位杰出的诗人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asinine, brainless, foolish, obtuse, silly, simple, stupid, unwitty, witless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sagacious, sapient 聪明的，睿智的；judicious, prudent, sensible, wise 谨慎的，明智的</div>
<h2>faultfinder[sound:faultfinder.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">吹毛求疵的人：</font>one who is given to petty criticism and constant complaint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]No sooner had we finished decorating the church than the parish faultfinder decided that she didn't like it.我们一完成教堂的装修工作，教区里挑剔的人就说她不喜欢</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carper, castigator, caviler, censurer, critic, disparager, hypercritic, nitpicker</div>
<h2>favorable[sound:favorable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">赞许的：</font>expressing approval</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Favorable reviews for the movie were few . 关于电影的正面评价极少</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]admiring, applauding, commendatory, complimentary, positive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adverse, disapproving, negative  否定的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有利的：</font>tending to promote or facilitate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mild climate favorable to his health 有利于他健康的温和气候</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advantageous, benefic, beneficial, favoring, good, helpful, salutary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unfavorable, disadvantageous, untoward, unpropitious  不利的</div>
<h2>fawn[sound:fawn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">阿谀奉承：</font>to seek favor or attention by flattery and obsequious behavior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fawn on one's superior  向上司谄媚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cower, cringe, flatter, grovel, toady, truckle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]domineer  统治；专横跋扈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fawning adj. 阿谀奉承的，讨好的</div>
<h2>faze[sound:faze.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">打扰，使尴尬：</font>to disturb the composure of: disconcert, dismay</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Nothing can faze her. 没有什么可以使她气馁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abash, annoy, bother, disconcert, dismay, disturb, discomfit, embarrass, fluster, rattle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, lull  使平静，使镇定</div>
<h2>feckless[sound:feckless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无成果的，没有价值的：</font>having no real worth or purpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]years of feckless negotiations 长达数年的毫无成果的谈判</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bootless, fruitless, futile, meaningless, purposeless, useless, worthless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]effective, effectual, efficacious 有成效的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗心不负责任的：</font>careless and irresponsible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The young man was feckless and irresponsible. 这个年轻人既粗心又没有责任感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careless, heedless, inadvertent, irresponsible, slipshod, sloppy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careful, cautious, circumspect, discreet, wary  谨慎小心的</div>
<h2>fecund[sound:fecund.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多产的，肥沃的：</font>fruitful in offspring or vegetation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fecund black soil 肥沃的黑土地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cornucopian, fertile, fruitful, lush, luxuriant, productive, prolific, rich</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]barren, infertile, sterile  贫瘠的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fecundity n. 多产</div>
<h2>feeble[sound:feeble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">衰弱的：</font>markedly lacking in strength</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The heartbeat was feeble and irregular. 心跳虚弱而不规则</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debilitated, effete, enervated, faint, fragile, frail, infirm, languid, sapped</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mighty, powerful, robust, stalwart, stout, strong 强壮的，强健的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]enfeeble    vt. 使衰弱</div>
<h2>feign[sound:feign.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">制造假象，装出…的样子：</font>to give a false appearance of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I would never feign illness just to postpone a test. 我绝不会为了缓考而装病</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affect, assume, counterfeit, dissemble, pretend, profess, sham, simulate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]unfeigned adj. 没有伪装的，真诚的</div>
<h2>fender[sound:fender.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">缓冲装置：</font>a cushioning device, such as a bundle of rope or a piece of timber, used on the sideof a vessel or dock to absorb impact or friction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fender on the SUV 运动越野车的一个防护板</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]buffer, bumper, cocoon, cushioning, pad</div>
<h2>feral[sound:feral.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">野生的：</font>not domesticated or cultivated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Animal experts discourage homeowners from trying to adopt feral animals as pets. 动物专家们不建议户主们将野生动物收养为宠物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]undomesticated, untamed, wild</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cultivated 人工培养的；domestic, tame 家养的，被驯化的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">动物性的：</font>having or showing the nature and appetites of a lower animal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The movie reveals just how thin the veneer of civilization is and how feral we are at bottom. 这部电影展示了所谓文明只不过是薄薄的一层纱，而内心深处我们仍然是野兽</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animalistic, beastly, brutal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rational 理性的</div>

<h2>fervid[sound:fervid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">酷热的：</font>having a notably high temperature</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]set out when the fervid heat subsides 当酷热消散之后才出发</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boiling, hot, scorching, searing, sultry, sweltering, torrid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arctic, chilling, cold, freezing, frigid, frozen, glacial, icy 冰冷的，寒冷的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">热情的：</font>marked by great passion or zeal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fervid patriot 热情洋溢的爱国者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardent, fervent, impassioned, passionate, perfervid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cold, cool, dispassionate, emotionless, impassive, unemotional 淡定的，不为所动的</div>

<h2>fictitious[sound:fictitious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">虚构的：</font>not real and existing only in the imagination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His wartime exploits turned out to be entirely fictitious, as he had never even been in the military. 他吹嘘的战时英勇行为是彻底虚构的，因为他根本就没有参过军</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chimerical, fabricated, fabulous, fictional, imagined, invented</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]actual, existing, real 事实的</div>
