<h2>filibuster[sound:filibuster.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 拖延议事：the use of obstructionist tactics, especially prolonged speechmaking, for the purposeof delaying legislative action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Senator used a filibuster to stop the bill. 参议员拖延了草案的实施</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delay, hindrance, impediment, obstruction, postponement ,procrastination</div>
<h2>filter[sound:filter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">过滤：</font>to pass through a filter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]steep the tea and then filter it to get rid of the leaves 浸泡茶叶，再将其过滤以去除废渣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]screen</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">去除杂质：</font>to remove(usually visible) impurities from</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After frying the chicken, we filtered the oil and kept it in the refrigerator to use again. 在炸完鸡肉之后，我们将滤去了杂质的油保存起来以供日后使用</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clear, distill, garble, purify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adulterate 掺杂；contaminate 污染</div>
<h2>finale[sound:finale.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">终场，结局：</font>the closing part, scene, or number in a public performance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Didier Drogba pulled one back for Chelsea in a finale. 德罗巴在终场结束时为切尔西扳回一球。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]close, coda, conclusion, end</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]prologue  开场白；  overture 序曲</div>
<h2>finesse[sound:finesse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">娴熟技巧：</font>mental skill or quickness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The musician shows wonderful finesse. 那位音乐家展现出了非凡的技艺</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adeptness, adroitness, cleverness, dexterity, proficiency</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]awkwardness, ineptitude, gaucherie, ungainliness  笨拙</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">精心策划：</font>to plan out usually with subtle skill or care</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]finesse the schedule 精心安排日程</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contrive, frame, machinate, maneuver, manipulate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（巧妙地）躲避：</font>to get or keep away from (as a responsibility) through cleverness or trickery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He tried to finesse the blame for the foreign policy fiasco, even though he was secretary of state at the time.他竭尽所能躲避因失败的对外政策而可能遭到的指责，尽管他是时任国务卿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avoid, dodge, eschew, evade, shun</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confront 直面</div>
<h2>finicky[sound:finicky.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过分讲究的，挑剔的：</font>extremely or excessively particular, exacting, or meticulous  in taste orstandards</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]have a reputation for being finicky eater 有着挑食的名声</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demanding, exacting, fastidious, fussy, nice, particular</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undemanding, unfussy  不挑剔的</div>
<h2>flaccid[sound:flaccid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不结实的，松弛的：</font>not firm or stiff; lacking normal or youthful firmness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]flaccid muscles 松弛的肌肉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]droopy, floppy, lank, loose, slack, yielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stiff, sturdy 结实的，坚硬的；resilient  有弹性的</div>
<h2>flag[sound:flag.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">旗帜，象征：</font>a piece of fabric that is used as a symbol (as of a nation) or as a signaling device</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We respect the flag of our fathers. 我们尊敬父辈们的旗帜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banner, ensign, pendant, pennant</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">变得衰弱：</font>to become unsteady, feeble, or spiritless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We flagged as we neared the end of the long mountain trail. 当我们终于快到达漫长山路的终点时，已经筋疲力尽</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decay, decline, deteriorate, emaciate, fade, fail, languish, sag, waste, wilt, wither</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]thrive 繁荣；revitalize, revive 恢复活力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]unflagging adj. 坚持不懈的</div>
<h2>flamboyant[sound:flamboyant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">艳丽夺目的，炫耀的，充满装饰的：</font>marked by or given to strikingly elaborate or colorful displayor behavior; ornate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Las Vegas showgirls wearing flamboyant headdresses  打扮花哨的拉斯维加斯舞女</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flaring, florid, garish, ornate, ostentatious, showy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]natural 自然的；conservative, quiet, understated 低调的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]flamboyance n. 炫目，炫耀</div>
<h2>flatter[sound:flatter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">拍马屁，奉承，讨好：</font>to praise excessively especially from motives of self-interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Friends who flatter you to your face are not true friends. 当面拍你马屁的朋友都不是真正的朋友</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adulate, blandish, compliment, court, massage, overpraise, stroke, wheedle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abuse 辱骂；censure, criticize 批评</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">自我感觉良好：</font>to think highly of (oneself)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Don't flatter yourself that no one has ever thought of that idea before.不要自欺欺人地认为别人没有考虑过那个想法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]pique, plume</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使显得更漂亮：</font>to show off becomingly or advantageously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Orange flatters those with golden skin tones. 橙色让黄肤色的人显得更漂亮</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]become, enhance, suit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mar, spoil 破坏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]flattering adj.令人满足的，令人迷恋的</div>
<h2>flaw[sound:flaw.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">瑕疵，缺点：</font>an imperfection, often concealed, that impairs soundness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The absence of flaw in beauty is itself a flaw. 完美无瑕本身就是瑕疵</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blight, blotch, defect, fault, imperfection, mar, scar, spot</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">降低，破坏，使不完美：</font>to reduce the soundness, effectiveness, or perfection of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That crack has flawed the vase to the extent that its value in the antiques market is greatly reduced.  那道裂缝让这个花瓶在古董市场上大大地掉价</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blemish, break, compromise, cripple, harm, hurt, impair, injure, spoil, vitiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fix, mend, repair, revamp 修复，改造</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]flawed adj. 有瑕疵的；flawless adj. 完美无瑕的</div>
<h2>fledgling[sound:fledgling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">新手：</font>a person who is just starting out in a field of activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]At hockey he's still a fledgling and needs to work on his basic skating skills. 在冰球场上他还是一个菜鸟，还需要在基本的滑冰技术上加强练习</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprentice, beginner, freshman, neophyte, novice, tyro, recruit, rookie</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]veteran 老兵，身经百战的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fledge    v. 鸟类长羽毛</div>
<h2>fleet[sound:fleet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">舰队，车队：</font>a group of vehicles traveling together or under one management</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fleet of the Royal Navy  皇家海军的舰队</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]armada, caravan, cavalcade, motorcade</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迅速的：</font>moving, proceeding, or acting with great speed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was fleet as a deer. 他如小鹿般敏捷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brisk, expeditious, fast, hasty, nimble, quick, rapid, rattling, speedy, swift</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]slow  缓慢的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">快速通过：</font>to move or pass swiftly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dart, flit, hurry, hustle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plod  沉重而缓慢地走</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fleeting adj. 稍纵即逝的</div>
<h2>flexible[sound:flexible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">灵活的，可变的：</font>capable of being readily changed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Our schedules are highly flexible. 我们的计划是非常灵活的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adaptable, adjustable, alterable, changeable, elastic, fluid, malleable, modifiable, pliable, variable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fixed, immutable, inflexible, invariable 确定的，不可变的；stiff, rigid 僵化的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易受影响的：</font>susceptible to influence or persuasion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their boss was flexible and lenient. 他们的老板既好说话，又很仁慈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]docile, manageable, tractable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adamant, headstrong, intractable, mulish, recalcitrant, refractory, stubborn, obstinate 倔强的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]flexibility n. 灵活性</div>
<h2>flinch[sound:flinch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">畏缩；退缩：</font>to draw back in fear, pain, or disgust</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He met my gaze without flinching. 他毫不畏缩地与我对视</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cringe, quail, recoil, shrink, wince</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]face, meet 面对；confront 直面</div>
<h2>flippancy[sound:flippancy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">轻率，无礼：</font>unbecoming levity or pertness especially in respect to grave or sacred matters</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The flippancy of your answer annoyed me. 你轻率的回答让我很恼火</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]facetiousness, flightiness, frivolousness, frothiness, levity, silliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]earnestness, gravity, seriousness, soberness, solemnity, solemnness 严肃，认真</div>
<h2>flirt[sound:flirt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">调情：</font>to behave amorously without serious intent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The waitress at that restaurant flirts with all single male customers. 这家餐厅的女服务员对所有的男性单身顾客都暗送秋波</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coquet, dally, frivol, toy, trifle</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">无规则地快速运动：</font>to make an irregular series of quick, sudden movements</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lazily watched the butterflies flirting among the wildflowers 慵懒地看着蝴蝶在野花丛中乱舞</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dance, dart, fleet, flick, flit, flutter, hurry, rush, zip</div>
<h2>flit[sound:flit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">快速或突然地经过：</font>to pass quickly or abruptly from one place or condition to another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Memories of the evening flitted through her mind.  关于那一晚的记忆在她脑海中一掠而过。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dance, dart, fleet, flick, flirt, flutter, hurry, rush, zip</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plod 沉重缓慢地走</div>
<h2>flock[sound:flock.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">人群，兽群：</font>a great number of persons or creatures massed together</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a flock of ill-disposed reporters at the press conference 新闻发布会上一群不怀好意的记者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]army, drove, herd, legion</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">聚集，集体行动：</font>to congregate or travel in a flock or crowd</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Vacationers flocked to the towns along the shore in order to escape the August heat. 度假的人们一起涌向海岸，以躲避八月里的热浪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mob, swarm, throng</div>
<h2>florid[sound:florid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">辞藻华丽的，花哨的：</font>full of fine words and fancy expressions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gave a florid speech to attract attention 做了个辞藻华丽的演说以吸引眼球</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bombastic, flowery, grandiloquent, magniloquent, rhetorical</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">装饰华丽的：</font>elaborately and often excessively decorated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a florid architectural style 华丽的建筑风格</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baroque, bedizened, flamboyant, fussy, luscious, ornate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]austere, plain, severe, stark, unadorned 朴素的，简单的</div>
<h2>flounder[sound:flounder.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">笨拙地行动，挣扎：</font>to proceed or act clumsily or ineffectually</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]flounder through the desert 步履蹒跚地穿越沙漠</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blunder, fumble, lumber, plod, struggle, trudge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]glide, slide 滑行；breeze, waltz 轻松地行动</div>
<h2>flourish[sound:flourish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">茂盛；繁荣：</font>to grow luxuriantly; to achieve success</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The program will flourish once it receives adequate funding. 这个项目只要有足够的资金就能大获成功</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bloom, burgeon, prosper, thrive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]languish, wane 变得衰弱，衰败；fail 失败</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">装饰：</font>an embellishment or ornamentation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a bedroom with cute little flourishes 一间带有可爱小装饰的卧室‖Her  writing  style  is  simple  and  clear,without unnecessary flourishes. 她的文风很简单清新，没有那些不必要的修饰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adornment, decoration, embellishment, ornamentation</div>
<h2>flout[sound:flout.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 嘲弄性不理会，蔑视：to treat with contemptuous disregard</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]flout the academic norm by  plagiarizing 通过抄袭来蔑视学术规范</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]despise, disregard, gibe, sneer, taunt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]respect, revere, venerate 尊敬</div>
<h2>fluctuate[sound:fluctuate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">波动，无规则地变动：</font>to shift back and forth uncertainly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Stock prices fluctuate wildly.股票价格大幅波动 ‖Samples of ice cores collected from Antarctica suggested that the atmospheric concentration of carbon dioxide has been fluctuating periodically. 南极冰芯样本表明，大气中的二氧化碳浓度存在周期性的涨落</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mutate, shift, swing, oscillate, vacillate, vary, waver</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stabilize 保持稳定；plateau 到达稳定状态</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fluctuation n. 涨落，波动</div>
<h2>fluent[sound:fluent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">表达流利的：</font>able to express oneself clearly and well</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a very fluent speaker who always communicates his points well  一个总能明确指出要点的流利演说家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]eloquent, silver-tongued, well-spoken</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inarticulate, ineloquent, unvocal  说话不清的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不费力的：</font>involving minimal difficulty or effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fluent performance of one of the oldest magic tricks in the book 一场毫不费力的魔术，表演的是书本上最老的魔术之一</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]effortless, facile, fluid, painless, ready, simple, smooth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arduous, demanding, exacting, formidable, grueling, hard, laborious, murderous, rough, toilsome, tough</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fluency n. 流畅，流利</div>
<h2>fluky[sound:fluky.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">侥幸的：</font>coming or happening by good luck especially unexpectedly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fluky coincidence that kept me safely at home when the blizzard hit 一个偶然的巧合让我在暴风雪来袭时安全地待在家里</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fortuitous, lucky, providential</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hapless, unfortunate, unlucky, ill-fated 不幸的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">偶然的：</font>happening by or depending on chance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]casual, chance, inadvertent, incidental, unintended, unintentional</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calculated, deliberate, intended, intentional, planned, premeditated 蓄意的，有预谋的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fluke n. 侥幸，偶然</div>
<h2>flush[sound:flush.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（肤色）健康红润的：</font>having a healthy reddish skin tone</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blooming, florid, glowing, red, rosy, rubicund, sanguine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ashen, doughy, livid, pale, pallid, wan 苍白的，病态的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">富有的：</font>having goods, property, or money in abundance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She's very flush now that she has her inheritance.  自从继承了那份遗产，她变得十分富有</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affluent, loaded, opulent, wealthy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]destitute, impoverished, indigent, needy, impecunious 贫穷的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大量的：</font>marked by abundance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a field flush with flowers 充满了鲜花的原野</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abounding, abundant, awash, fraught, lousy, replete, swarming, teeming, thronging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inadequate, insufficient, scant, scarce, short 匮乏的，不足的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">冲洗：</font>to pour liquid over or through in order to cleanse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]flush a wound with iodine 用碘酒冲洗伤口</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]irrigate, rinse, sluice, wash</div>
<h2>fluster[sound:fluster.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使慌乱：</font>to put into a state of agitated confusion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A GPA of 1.0 flusters him. 1.0 的绩点让他很慌乱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abash, confound, confuse, discomfit, disconcert, discountenance, faze, mortify, nonplus, rattle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, quiet, settle, soothe, tranquilize 安抚，使情绪镇定</div>
<h2>foible[sound:foible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">小缺点：</font>a minor flaw or shortcoming in character or behavior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]admired their teacher despite his foibles 尽管有些小缺点，但还是很敬佩他们的老师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demerit, dereliction, failing, fault, frailty, shortcoming, sin, vice, want, weakness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]merit, virtue 优点，美德</div>
<h2>foil[sound:foil.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">挫败：</font>to prevent from being successful; defeat</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]foil her enemy by pulling some strings 通过一些关系和手段挫败了她的对手</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baffle, balk, beat, checkmate, discomfit, frustrate, thwart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forward, foster, further, promote  帮助，促进</div>
<h2>foment[sound:foment.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">助长，煽动：</font>to promote the growth or development of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was accused of fomenting violence. 他被指控煽动暴力行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abet, brew, ferment, incite, instigate, provoke, raise, stir</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]quash, quell, quench, squash 平息，镇压</div>
<h2>foolproof[sound:foolproof.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">十分简单以至于不会失败的：</font>so simple, plain, or reliable as to leave no opportunity for error,misuse, or failure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Anything foolproof is impossible and what truly counts is probability.  没有万无一失的事情，真正的问题在于概率</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]guaranteed, infallible, safe, unfailing, fail-safe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fallible 容易出错的</div>
<h2>footloose[sound:footloose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无拘无束的，自由的：</font>having no attachments or ties; free to do as one pleases</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After having been chained for so long, the suddenly footloose dog ran about the yard tirelessly.  这只长期被锁链束缚的小狗因为突然之间获得了自由，在院子里不知疲倦地奔跑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]loose, unbound, unconfined, unfettered, unrestrained, untrammeled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bound, confined, restrained, tied 有束缚的</div>
<h2>forbearance[sound:forbearance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">克制；忍耐：</font>tolerance and restraint in the face of provocation; patience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]reach the end of my forbearance 到了让我忍无可忍的地步</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]patience, temperance, tolerance, toleration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impatience 不耐烦</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">友好仁慈的态度：</font>kind, gentle, or compassionate treatment especially towards someone who isundeserving of it</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The judge showed forbearance, and gave the teenaged first offender a suspended sentence. 法官网开一面，给了初犯的少年犯一个缓刑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charity, clemency, leniency, mercifulness, quarter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vindictiveness 恶意</div>
<h2>forebear[sound:forebear.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">祖先：</font>a person from whom one is descended; an ancestor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The son of Abrahamis traditionally considered to be the forebear of the Arabs. 亚伯拉罕之子传统上被认为是阿拉伯人的祖先</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ancestor, antecedent, asendant,father, grandfather, primogenitor, progenitor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]descendant, offspring 后代</div>
<h2>forestall[sound:forestall.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">预先阻止：</font>to delay, hinder, or prevent by taking precautionary measures beforehand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You can often forestall skidding on the ice simply by driving more slowly.  通常你只需慢点开车就可以防止车辆在冰面上失控打滑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avert, deter, obviate, preclude, prevent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abet, assist, facilitate, further, precipitate, promote  帮助，促进</div>
<h2>foreword[sound:foreword.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">前言：</font>a preface or an introductory note, as for a book, especially by a person other than the author</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The foreword of this book is co-written by Jason and Franklin. 这本书的序由Jason 和Franklin 共同写成</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beginning, introduction, overture, preamble, preface, prelude, prologue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]epilogue, coda 尾声；finale  终场</div>
<h2>forge[sound:forge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">伪造：</font>to make or imitate falsely especially with intent to defraud</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The boy forged his father’s signature on his transcript. 小男孩在他的成绩单上伪造了父亲的签名</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coin, counterfeit, fabricate, fake</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">锻造，铸就：</font>to form (as metal) by or as if by heating and hammering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a real man forged by adversity 一个经磨难考验而成的纯爷们‖They  agreed  to  forge  closer  economicand political ties.  他们就打造双边的紧密政治经济联系达成了共识</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]build, construct, form, make, manufacture, mold, shape</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]forger n. 打铁匠</div>
<h2>formidable[sound:formidable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人害怕的：</font>causing fear, dread, or apprehension</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a nation that possesses formidable nuclear deterrence  一个拥有可怕核威慑力量的国家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]direful, dreadful, fearsome, forbidding, ghastly, horrible, intimidating, redoubtable, terrifying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comforting 给人安慰的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">艰难的：</font>requiring considerable physical or mental effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]running a marathon is a formidable undertaking 跑马拉松是个困难的任务‖They  have  recently  madea formidable decision. 他们最近做出了一个艰难的决定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arduous, challenging, demanding, exacting, grueling, heavy, laborious, sweaty, toilsome, tough, strenuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easy, effortless, facile, mindless, simple 轻松的，简单的</div>
<h2>forthright[sound:forthright.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">直率的，说话率真的：</font>free in expressing one's true feelings and opinions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]her forthright way of dealing with people 她率真的为人处事方式</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]candid, forthcoming, frank, honest, open, outspoken, straightforward</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dissembling 虚伪的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">直接的，不绕弯子的：</font>free from ambiguity or evasiveness: going straight to the point</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]was forthright in appraising the problem 直截了当地评价这个问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]direct, plain, straight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circuitous, indirect, roundabout 不直接的，绕弯子的</div>
<h2>fortify[sound:fortify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">加固，鼓励：</font>to give physical strength, courage, or endurance to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This country will fortify the coastal areas.  这个国家要加强沿海地区的防御</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]energize, harden, invigorate, reinforce, strengthen, toughen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]debilitate, enervate, enfeeble, vitiate, weaken  使衰弱，削弱</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">做好心理准备：</font>to prepare (oneself) mentally or emotionally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She fortified  herself for the  incoming tennis  tournament with a series of confidence-boosting exercises.她通过一系列练习赛来找自信，为即将到来的网球锦标赛做好心理准备</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brace, forearm, gird, nerve, poise, ready, steel</div>
<h2>foster[sound:foster.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">促进，鼓励：</font>to help the growth or development of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]detect and foster artistic talent  发现并培养艺术天分</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advance, encourage, forward, further, incubate, promote</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discourage, frustrate, inhibit 阻碍，妨碍</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">培养：</font>to bring to maturity through care and education</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a greathearted couple fostering two adopted children as well as their own 对两个养子像自己的孩子一样培养的好心夫妇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breed, cultivate, nourish, nurse, nurture, raise, rear</div>
<h2>founder[sound:founder.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">建立者：</font>one that founds or establishes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]founders of the nation 国父们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]architect, author, creator, father, generator, initiator, originator, sire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]terminator 终结者</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">完败：</font>to fail utterly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The theater company foundered after its corporate funding dried up.  在其基金告罄之后，这个戏剧公司彻底失败了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collapse, flunk, miss, strike out, wash out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]succeed, work out  成功</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">沉没：</font>to become submerged</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The ship struck a reef and foundered.  船因触礁而沉没</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sink, submerge, submerse, go down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]float 漂浮</div>
<h2>fracas[sound:fracas.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">争吵，吵闹：</font>a physical dispute between opposing individuals or groups; a rough and often noisyfight usually involving several people</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The police were called in to break up the fracas.警察奉命去制止骚乱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]battle, clash, combat, conflict, contest, hassle, skirmish, struggle, tussle</div>
<h2>fracture[sound:fracture.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">破裂：</font>the act or process of breaking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sudden fracture of the established order 已建立起的秩序被突然打破</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breach, break, rupture, schism, split</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unity  统一</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">打碎，破坏：</font>to cause to separate into pieces usually suddenly or forcibly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their happiness was fractured by an unforeseen tragedy. 他们的幸福生活被突如其来的悲剧打破了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disrupt, fragment, rive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cement 接合</div>
<h2>fragile[sound:fragile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易碎的：</font>easily broken or destroyed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fragile piece of glass  一块易碎的玻璃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breakable, feeble, frail, friable, frangible, infirm, unsound, weak</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]tough, durable 抗打击的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易受伤的，脆弱的：</font>easily injured without careful handling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Babies are extremely fragile, so remember to care for them gently. 小孩子特别容易受伤，所以要记得温柔地对待他们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delicate, sensitive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fragility n. 脆弱</div>
<h2>frail[sound:frail.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">虚弱的：</font>physically weak</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Working for three days without any sleep made him extremely frail. 连续三天的彻夜工作使他极为虚弱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]weak, effete, enervated, feeble, fragile, infirm, languid, unsubstantial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]robust 充满活力的 hale, sturdy 健壮的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（意志）薄弱的：</font>easily led astray; morally weak</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]frail and pathetic humanity 容易误入歧途的可悲人性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]characterless, invertebrate, nerveless, spineless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]faithful, resolute 意志坚定的，有坚定信念的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（希望）渺茫的：</font>slight, unsubstantial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a frail hope of success  成功的机会渺茫</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fragile, negligible, slight, small</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]good 很有希望的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]frailty n. 虚弱，（意志）脆弱</div>
<h2>fraudulent[sound:fraudulent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">欺诈的：</font>characterized by, based on, or done by fraud</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fraudulent interpretation of experimental data 对实验数据的欺骗性解释</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deceitful, deceptive, dishonest, duplicitous, guileful, underhanded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reliable, trustworthy 可信的；authentic 真实的；  honest, straight 诚实的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fraudulence n. 欺骗</div>
<h2>fraught[sound:fraught.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">充满的：</font>full of or accompanied by something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an experience fraught with peril  充满危险的经历</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abounding, abundant, awash, flush, replete, thronging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]scarce 稀缺的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人忧虑的：</font>causing or characterized by emotional distress or tension</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fraught relationship between the two neighboring countries 两邻国间令人担忧的关系</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]uneasy, agitating, anxious, distressful, disturbing, restless, tense, unsettling, nail-biting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calming, relaxing 使人镇静的，使人放松的</div>
<h2>frenzy[sound:frenzy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">疯狂，狂怒：</font>a violent mental or emotional agitation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She is subject to these frenzies several times a year. 她每年都要暴怒几次</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delirium, fever, furor, fury, hysteria, insanity, rage, rampage, uproar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sanity 理智</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]frenetic adj. 疯狂的</div>
<h2>frequent[sound:frequent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">时常拜访：</font>to pay frequent visits to; be in or at often</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to frequent opera houses 时常造访歌剧院</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]haunt, resort, visit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]avoid, shun 躲避</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">时常发生的，重复再现的：</font>happening at short intervals; often repeated or occurring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He used to make frequent trips to Los Angeles 他从前经常前往洛杉矶旅行</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]common, constant, everyday, habitual, periodical, repeated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rare 稀有的，少见的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]frequency n. 频率；频繁</div>
<h2>fretful[sound:fretful.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易怒的，烦躁的：</font>inclined to be vexed or troubled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Adolescence is the most fretful stages of human development. 青春期是人类发展过程中最恼人的阶段</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]irritable, fractious, peevish, pettish, petulant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easygoing 随和的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fret    v. 使烦躁</div>
<h2>friable[sound:friable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易碎的：</font>easily crumbled or pulverized</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]friable mineral rock 易碎的矿石</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crumbly, delicate, feeble, fragile, frail, infirm, weak</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sturdy, substantial  坚固的</div>
<h2>friction[sound:friction.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">摩擦：</font>the rubbing of one object or surface against another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lubricant that significantly reduces friction 能显著减少摩擦的润滑剂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrasion</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">冲突，不和：</font>the clashing between two persons or parties of opposed views</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There is a friction between the professor and students.  教授和学生之间存在不和</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disagreement, conflict, contention, dissidence, schism, war</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accord, harmony, peace, concord 和谐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]frictional adj. 产生摩擦的</div>
<h2>frigid[sound:frigid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严寒的：</font>extremely cold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unusually frigid winter of Wuhan 武汉一个反常的寒冬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cold, arctic, chilling, freezing, frosty, glacial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]roasting, scalding, scorching, searing, seething, sizzling, sultry, sweltering, torrid 炎热的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冷漠的：</font>lacking warmth or ardor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a formal but frigid welcome  一个正式但冷漠的招呼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indifferent, cold, emotionless, passionless, unresponsive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ardent, amorous, cordial 饱含感情的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]frigidity n. 严寒；冷漠</div>
<h2>fringe[sound:fringe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">边缘：</font>something that resembles such a border or edging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]“Don’t act on the fringes of the law,” warns the customs officer. 海关人员警告说：“不要打法律的擦边球”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]border, boundary, circumference, edge, margin, perimeter, periphery, skirt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]center, core 中心，核心</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">接壤：</font>to be adjacent to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abut, border, neighbor, skirt, verge</div>
<h2>frivolous[sound:frivolous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">轻浮的：</font>marked by unbecoming levity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a frivolous young woman 一个举止轻浮的年轻女子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]giddy, shallow, superficial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]earnest, sober, serious  严肃的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不重要的：</font>of little weight or importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The frivolous comment was soon forgotten. 那个不值一提的评论很快就被遗忘了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]trivial, flimsy, light, petty, trifling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consequential, eventful, meaningful, momentous, weighty 重要的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]frivolity n. 轻浮，轻佻</div>
<h2>frothy[sound:frothy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">用轻薄材料制作的：</font>made of light thin material</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a frothy laptop made of carbon fiber and alloys 碳纤维以及合金制造的轻薄型笔记本电脑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delicate, gossamer, light</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]weighty 重的；sturdy 结实的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（内容等）欢乐轻佻、不严肃的：</font>gaily frivolous or light in content or treatment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a frothy movie 一部有喜感的电影</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flighty, frivolous, puerile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]earnest, serious, sober 严肃的</div>
<h2>frowsy[sound:frowsy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">邋遢的：</font>having a slovenly or uncared-for appearance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]frowsy hair 邋遢的头发</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]slovenly, unkempt, untidy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dapper, neat, tidy, spruce 整洁的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">味道难闻的：</font>having an unpleasant smell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The abandoned house was dank and frowsy and barely fit for human habitation. 这座废房子光线又暗，气味又难闻，几乎无法供人居住</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fetid, noisome, smelly, stinky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ambrosial, aromatic, fragrant, redolent 芳香的</div>
<h2>frugal[sound:frugal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">节约的：</font>characterized by or reflecting economy in the use of resources</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be frugal in her expenditures 节约她的开销</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sparing, economical, provident, stingy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extravagant, prodigal, sumptuous 奢侈浪费的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]frugality n. 节俭</div>
<h2>frustrate[sound:frustrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">挫败，阻挠：</font>to prevent from accomplishing a purpose or fulfilling a desire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]frustrated their scheme in time 及时挫败了他们的阴谋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ruin, baffle, balk, circumvent, foil, thwart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abet 帮助，鼓舞，教唆 accomplish, fulfill 实现</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使沮丧：</font>to lessen the courage or confidence of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]frustrated by his failure  为他的失败感到沮丧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chill, daunt, dishearten, dismay, dispirit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]embolden, encourage, nerve, steel 鼓舞</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]frustration n. 沮丧；阻挠；frustrated adj. 沮丧的</div>
<h2>full-bodied[sound:full-bodied.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">重要的：</font>having importance, significance, or meaningfulness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a full-bodied study of genetic engineering 一项基因工程的重要研究</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]important, consequential, momentous, significant, weighty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]trivial 不重要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">味道浓烈的：</font>having richness and intensity of flavor or aroma</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]full-bodied perfume in the cabin  车厢内浓郁的香水味</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]strong, concentrated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insipid 平淡无奇的</div>
<h2>fulminate[sound:fulminate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">大声斥责：</font>to issue a thunderous verbal attack or denunciation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fulminate the so-called curricular reform 痛斥所谓的课程改革</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]criticize, blame, censure, condemn, denounce, denunciate, lambaste, reprehend, reprobate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]applaud, compliment, praise 赞美</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fulmination n. 训斥</div>
<h2>fumble[sound:fumble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">笨拙地做：</font>to make awkward attempts to do or find something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fumbled in his pocket for a coin 从口袋里笨拙地摸出一枚硬币</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]botch, flounder, mess, stumble</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（无意识的）失误：</font>an unintentional departure from truth or accuracy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]played the entire piano piece without a single fumble 完美地演绎了整首钢琴曲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blunder, fault, gaffe, lapse, misstep, mistake</div>
<h2>furor[sound:furor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">喧闹，激动，狂热：</font>a state of intense excitement or ecstasy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The decision to raise tax has caused a great furor among the working class. 提高税收的决定引起了工人阶级的强烈反响</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delirium, frenzy, fever, fury, hysteria, outrage, rage, uproar, wrath</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]serenity, tranquility 平静，宁静</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delight, pleasure 愉悦</div>
<h2>furtive[sound:furtive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">鬼鬼祟祟的；秘密的：</font>done by stealth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a furtive glance at her 朝她投去的隐秘一瞥</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]secret, clandestine, covert, stealthy, surreptitious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aboveboard 光明正大的；candid, forthright  坦率的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]furtively adv. 秘密地</div>
<h2>fury[sound:fury.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">暴怒：</font>intense, disordered, and often destructive rage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The gods unleashed their fury on the offending mortal.  诸神将怒火降在了对那些对神明不敬的凡人身上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anger, indignation, ire, mad, rage, wrath</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forbearance 容忍；delight, pleasure 快乐，愉悦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]furious adj. 狂暴的，暴怒的</div>
<h2>fussy[sound:fussy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">谨慎的：</font>taking, showing, or involving great care and effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fussy actuarial problem 需要谨慎处理的保险计算问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careful, exact, meticulous, punctilious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careless 粗心大意的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">过分雕琢的：</font>elaborately and often excessively decorated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The room, with its rococo furniture and its overabundance of knickknacks, is just too fussy for my taste.这房间里洛可可式的家具和过量的小饰品，让我觉得装修得有点过分以至于无法接受</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bedizened, florid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]austere, plain, stark 朴素的，朴实无华的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">挑剔的：</font>hard to please</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It is widely known that cats are fussy eaters. 众所周知猫对食物很挑剔</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choosy, delicate, demanding, exacting, fastidious, nice, particular, persnickety, picky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undemanding, unfussy  不挑剔的</div>
<h2>fusty[sound:fusty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过时的：</font>rigidly old-fashioned or reactionary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fusty old carpets 过时的旧地毯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antiquated, archaic, bygone, moldy, outdated</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">腐臭的：</font>saturated with dust and stale odors</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the fusty odor of a damp cellar 潮湿的地下室里的腐臭味道</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]malodorous, fetid, musty, noisome, smelly, stale</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ambrosial, aromatic, fragrant, perfumed, redolent, savory, scented, sweet 有香味的，芳香的</div>
<h2>futile[sound:futile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无效的，无用的：</font>serving no useful purpose; completely ineffective</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It would be an undoubtedly futile effort to persuade him. 想说服他毫无疑问是徒劳的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abortive, bootless, fruitless, ineffective, useless, vain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]effectual, efficacious 有效的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不严肃的：</font>lacking in seriousness or maturity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the futile chatter of gossip columnists about the comings and goings of Hollywood celebrities 八卦的专栏作家们对于好莱坞名人来来往往的随意闲谈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flighty, frivolous, frothy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]earnest, serious 严肃认真的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]futility n. 徒劳，无益</div>
<h2>gadfly[sound:gadfly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激物：</font>one that acts as a provocative stimulus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]goad, impetus, impulse, incentive, irritant, spur, stimulus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]balm  安抚，慰藉</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">令人反感的人：</font>a person who stimulates or annoys especially by persistent criticism</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tactless gadfly during post-game interviews with the losing team 在赛后采访败北方时一个令人讨厌的不懂人情世故的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annoyer, bother, persecutor, teaser, pest</div>
<h2>gaffe[sound:gaffe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（社交上）失礼，失态：</font>a social or diplomatic blunder</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A gaffe is when a politician tells the truth.  ——  Michael Kinsley  所谓出丑，就是政治家说真话的时候（迈克·金斯利）</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impropriety, indecorum, indiscretion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decency, decorum, propriety 举止得体</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">明显的错误，错误判断：</font>a blatant mistake or misjudgment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]so-called debates, which were mainly about seeing which candidate made the most gaffes  所谓的辩论，其实主要就是看哪个选手犯了最多的错误</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blunder, lapse, misstep, oversight</div>
<h2>gainsay[sound:gainsay.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">否认：</font>to declare false</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deny, contradict, contravene, naysay</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acknowledge, admit, avow, concede  承认；affirm  证实</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">反对：</font>to oppose, especially by contradiction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]No one dare to gainsay him.  没人敢反驳他</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disagree, refute, reject, repudiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concur 同意</div>
<h2>gall[sound:gall.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（使）焦躁，激怒：</font>irritate, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sarcastic applause from the audience galled her. 观众反讽的掌声激怒了她</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, exasperate, grate, inflame, provoke, pique, roil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, assuage, calm, lull, pacify, placate 使平静，使平息</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n.<font color="#aa00ff">深深的敌意：</font>a deep-seated ill will</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her kindly feelings turned to gall when she found out her nephew only wanted her money. 当她发现她的侄子只想要钱时，她之前友好的感情变成了憎恨与厌恶</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animosity, animus, antagonism, antipathy, hostility, rancor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amity 友好</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n.<font color="#aa00ff">大胆，无耻：</font>shameless boldness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I can't believe he had the gall to ask me how much I weigh.  我不敢相信他居然胆敢问我有多重</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacity, brass, nerve, presumptuousness, temerity</div>
<h2>gallant[sound:gallant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">英勇的：</font>brave, spirited; nobly chivalrous and often self-sacrificing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Gallant paratroopers jumped out of the plane without hesitation. 英勇的伞兵们毫不犹豫地跳出了飞机</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bold, courageous, dauntless, heroic, stouthearted, valorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]craven, pusillanimous 胆小的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">高贵的，慷慨的：</font>having, characterized by, or arising from a dignified and generous nature</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The members of that service club are known for their gallant service to the community.  那个服务社的成员因为他们对社区的慷慨贡献而为人所知</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chivalrous, elevated, loft, magnanimous, sublime</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]base, debased, degenerate, ignoble  卑鄙的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]gallantly adv. 英勇地</div>
<h2>galvanize[sound:galvanize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（好似被用电击）刺激：</font>to stimulate or excite as if by an electric shock</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an issue that would galvanize public opinion 激起大众评论的问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]provoke, agitate, excite, intoxicate, motivate, stimulate, pump up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allay, lull, pacify 使平静</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]galvanizing adj. 刺激的</div>
<h2>gamble[sound:gamble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">赌博，孤注一掷：</font>to bet on an uncertain outcome, as of a contest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gambled on the train being late 赌火车晚点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bet, adventure, chance, risk, stake, venture</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">使受到威胁：</font>to place in danger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You don't want to gamble with your life, so buckle up. 你不会想拿命来开玩笑的，所以系好安全带</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compromise, hazard, imperil, jeopardize , threaten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]gambling n. 赌博</div>
<h2>gambol[sound:gambol.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">欢跳，雀跃：</font>to leap about playfully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]young lambs gamboling in the meadow 小羊羔在原野里欢快地跳跃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]frolic, caper, cavort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plod, trudge 沉重缓慢地走</div>
<h2>gangly[sound:gangly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">身材瘦长的：</font>awkwardly tall or long-limbed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The suspect is a gangly high school boy.  嫌犯是一个瘦高的中学生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gangling, lanky, rangy, spindling, spindly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stalwart 壮实的</div>
<h2>garble[sound:garble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">曲解，篡改，混淆（以至使无法理解）：</font>to mix up or distort to such an extent as to make misleadingor incomprehensible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The summary totally garbles the results of the investigation. 这份摘要完全曲解了调查的结果</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]misrepresent, belie, color, distort, falsify, twist, warp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarify, elucidate 阐明</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">筛选，除杂：</font>to remove usually visible impurities from</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Garbled spices are less likely to contaminate a recipe.  经过筛选的香料应该就不会影响食谱了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clear, distill, filter, purify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adulterate, contaminate 掺杂，污染</div>
<h2>gargantuan[sound:gargantuan.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">巨大的：</font>tremendous in size, volume, or degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a gargantuan waterfall in the rainforest 热带雨林中的巨大瀑布</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]huge, astronomical, colossal, elephantine, enormous, gigantic, immense, mammoth, monstrous, titanic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]infinitesimal, minuscule 微小的</div>
<h2>garish[sound:garish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过于鲜艳的，过于张扬的：</font>marked by strident color or excessive ornamentation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With garish makeup on, she looks exceedingly frivolous. 浓妆艳抹之下的她显得格外轻佻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gaudy, blatant, brazen, flamboyant, glaring, ostentatious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dim, gloomy, murky, somber 黯淡的；conservative, quiet 不张扬的</div>

<h2>garrulous[sound:garrulous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">啰嗦的，话多得令人厌烦的：</font>given  to excessive and often trivial or rambling talk;  tiresomelytalkative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]garrulous traveling companions  多话的旅伴</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]talkative, chatty, loquacious, verbose, voluble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]laconic, reserved, reticent, taciturn 缄默的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]garrulity n. 啰嗦</div>
<h2>gash[sound:gash.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">砍得很深的伤口：</font>a long deep cut</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]got a gash in his knee that required four stitches 膝盖伤得很深，需要缝针</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incision, laceration, rent, rip, tear</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">砍：</font>to make a gash in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her face had been gashed by the rocks as she tumbled down the embankment. 当她从堤岸上摔下来时脸上被刮了一道口</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cut, incision, piercing, slash, slice, slit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sew 缝合</div>
<h2>gasification[sound:gasification.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">气化：</font>conversion into gas</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gasification of coals 煤的气化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]evaporation, sublimation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]solidification 固化；liquefaction 液化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]gasify v. 气化</div>
<h2>gauche[sound:gauche.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">笨拙的，缺乏社交经验的：</font>lacking social experience or grace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It would be gauche to mention the subject. 提到这个话题是很无礼的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]awkward, clumsy, crude, inept, maladroit, rustic, tactless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]graceful 优雅的；polished, refined, urbane 有教养的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]gaucheness n. 笨拙</div>
<h2>gaudy[sound:gaudy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">俗丽的：</font>ostentatiously or tastelessly ornamented, excessively showy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gaudy movie posters 俗丽的电影海报</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blatant, brazen, flashy, garish, glaring, meretricious, tawdry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]austere, homely, plain 朴素的；conservative, understated, unflamboyant, unflashy 不张扬的</div>
<h2>gauge[sound:gauge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">测量标准：</font>a measurement (as of linear dimension) according to some standard or system</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]polls as a gauge of voter satisfaction 用以衡量选民满意度的选票结果</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]standard, benchmark, criterion, measure, touchstone, yardstick</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">判定：</font>to determine the capacity or contents of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It is hard to gauge his mood. 要判断他的情绪很困难</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assess, determine, evaluate, figure, measure, scale</div>

<h2>genial[sound:genial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">和蔼亲切的：</font>having an easygoing and pleasing manner especially in social situations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a genial host who makes a point of speaking personally to each and every guest 一个强调与每个客人私下交流的亲切的主人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affable, agreeable, gracious, mellow, nice, pleasant, sweet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]caustic, mordant 尖酸刻薄的；truculent 凶残的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">友好的，热心的：</font>having or showing kindly feeling and sincere interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amicable, companionable, cordial, warmhearted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]antagonistic, hostile 有敌意的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">温暖的：</font>marked by temperatures that are neither too high nor too low</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]genial sunshine in winter 冬日的暖阳</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balmy, equable, gentle, mild, moderate, soft, temperate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]harsh, inclement, intemperate, severe 严峻的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]geniality n. 和蔼</div>

<h2>gloss[sound:gloss.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">简短解释：</font>a brief explanation of a difficult or obscure word or expression</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstract, annotation, brief, epitome, synopsis</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amplification 详解</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（欺骗性的）光鲜外表：</font>a deceptively attractive external appearance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]used a computer to give her astrological predictions the gloss of real science  用计算机来给他的占星预测结果套上科学的外衣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fa ade, mask, veneer</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">敷衍潦草做事（甚至忽略）：</font>to deal with (a subject or problem) too lightly or not at all</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gloss over the problems 不怎么理会这些问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disregard, ignore, neglect, overlook</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]scrutinize 仔细研究</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">开脱 （罪名）：</font>to make (something) seem less bad by offering excuses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I don't want to gloss over  her misbehavior, but keep in mind that she's been under a lot of stress lately.我不想为她的行为辩护，但是别忘了她最近压力很大</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excuse, extenuate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]glossary n. 术语表</div>

<h2>goad[sound:goad.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激驱使，激发：</font>to incite or rouse as if with a goad</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]goad someone to do something  激励某人做某事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]urge, abet, exhort, instigate, prod, prompt, propel, spur, stimulate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]check, curb 阻止；lull 使安静</div>
<h2>gobble[sound:gobble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">狼吞虎咽：</font>to swallow or eat greedily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Lions gobble their prey. 狮子狼吞虎咽地啃食它们的猎物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]devour, gorge, guzzle, quaff, raven, swill</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nibble 小口咬</div>
<h2>goggle[sound:goggle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">凝视：</font>to look long and hard in wonder or surprise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]goggled at the characters on the stele 凝视碑文的字眼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blink, gawk, gaze, peer, stare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]glance, glimpse 瞥视</div>
<h2>goldbrick[sound:goldbrick.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">逃避工作和责任：</font>to shirk one's assigned duties or responsibilities</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]goldbrick his duty as a citizen 逃避他作为公民的义务</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]idle, parry, parry, shirk, sidestep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dedicate, devote 致力于</div>
<h2>gorge[sound:gorge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">峡谷：</font>a narrow steep-walled canyon or part of a canyon</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Wenchuan earthquake is said to have no detrimental effect on Three-Gorge dam.  汶川地震据称对三峡大坝没有破坏性影响</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gap, gulch, notch, ravine</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">狼吞虎咽：</font>to eat greedily or to repletion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gorge himself at the party 在聚会上狼吞虎咽</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cram, devour, gobble, guzzle, loaf, quaff, sate, swill</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nibble 小口咬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]gorgeous adj. 壮观的</div>
<h2>gossamer[sound:gossamer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">虚无飘渺的东西：</font>something light, delicate, or insubstantial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the gossamer of youth's dreams 年少时飘渺的梦想</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ether, delicacy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]substance, entity 实体</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">轻薄的：</font>extremely light, delicate, or tenuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a gossamer explanation 站不住脚的解释</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diaphanous ,ethereal, filmy, light, insubstantial, tenuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heavy, leaden, ponderous 沉重的</div>
