<h2>gourmet[sound:gourmet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】n. <font color="#aa00ff">美食家：</font>a connoisseur of food and drink</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a gourmet of Chinese food 中餐美食家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bon vivant ,connoisseur, epicure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]layman 门外汉</div>
<h2>grandeur[sound:grandeur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">高尚，重要：</font>nobility or greatness of character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the glory that was Greece and the grandeur that was Rome 希腊的荣耀和罗马的辉煌</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]magnificence, augustness, brilliance, glory, majesty, nobility, resplendence, splendor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]frivolousness 无关紧要</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]grand adj. 宏伟壮观的</div>
<h2>grandiloquent[sound:grandiloquent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（语言等）浮夸的：</font>a lofty, extravagantly  colorful, pompous, or  bombastic  style, manner, orquality especially in language</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]feel disgusted with his grandiloquent speech 对他浮夸的演讲表示厌恶</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rhetorical, bombastic, inflated, magniloquent, pretentious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]secretive  低调的，隐秘的；simple 简单的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]grandiloquence n. 夸张的话语</div>
<h2>grandiose[sound:grandiose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">自命不凡的：</font>characterized by feigned or affected grandeur</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]grandiose words 自命不凡的话语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extravagant, flamboyant, pompous, pretentious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humble 谦逊的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">宏大的：</font>characterized by greatness of scope or intent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a grandiose hydroelectric project 宏伟的水利工程</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]august, glorious, grand, imposing, magnificent, monumental, splendid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]trivial 微不足道的；humble, unimposing, unimpressive  平凡的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]grandiosity n. 自命不凡</div>

<h2>grate[sound:grate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">刮擦（以发出刺耳的声音）：</font>to make a rasping sound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sled grated along the bare pavement. 雪橇与裸露的路面刮擦发出刺耳声</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrade, rasp, scratch, scrape</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">骚扰，惹恼：</font>to irritate or annoy persistently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a noise that grates on one's nerves 使人烦躁的噪音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]irritate, aggravate, gall, nettle, peeve, plague, provoke, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]soothe 使平静，安抚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]grating adj. 刺耳的</div>
<h2>gratify[sound:gratify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使满足：</font>to give what is desired to, to please or satisfy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gratify her curiosity 满足她的好奇心‖Her praise will gratify all who worked so hard to earn it. 他的表扬会使所有辛勤工作的人们高兴</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appease, cater, content, satisfy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]displease 使不满；grieve 使悲痛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]gratification n. 满意</div>
<h2>gratuitous[sound:gratuitous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无根据的，无理由的：</font>unnecessary or unwarranted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dubious request based on a gratuitous assumption 基于无根据假设的可疑要求</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unfounded, unjustified, unreasonable, baseless, groundless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]justified, warranted 有理有据的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无报酬的，免费的：</font>given or granted without return or recompense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a gratuitous ticket 免费的门票</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]free, complimentary, unearned, voluntary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]merited 应得的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多余的：</font>not needed by the circumstances or to accomplish an end</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dispensable, inessential, needless, redundant, superfluous, surplus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]critical, essential, pivotal, vital 关键的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]gratuity n.报酬，小费</div>
<h2>green[sound:green.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无经验的：</font>deficient in training, knowledge, or experience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lead a squad of green recruits 带领一队没有经验的新兵</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inexperienced, callow, fresh, raw, unfledged, young</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]experienced, versed 经验丰富的</div>

<h2>gripe[sound:gripe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">抱怨：</font>to express dissatisfaction, pain, or resentment usually tiresomely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]All workers were griping about the new regulations.  所有的工人都在抱怨新规章。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carp, fuss, grouch, grouse, grumble, wail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crow, delight, rejoice 欢快，喜悦</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">通过连续让人讨厌的举动激怒，惹怒：</font>to  disturb  the peace of mind of (someone) especially byrepeated disagreeable acts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]constant complaints from the customers griped her to the point where she started snapping back 顾客持续的抱怨让她也到了爆点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, annoy, bother, chafe, exasperate, nettle, peeve, pique, rile, ruffle, vex</div>
<h2>grisly[sound:grisly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人反感的，令人恐惧的：</font>inspiring repugnance; gruesome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a series grisly murders  一系列令人恐惧的谋杀</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appalling, dreadful, ghastly, gruesome, hideous, horrifying, macabre</div>
<h2>groove[sound:groove.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">享受，极其满意，过得快活：</font>to take pleasure in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]thrill-seekers who groove on skiing will love snowboarding 那些乐在滑雪中的追求刺激的人们也会喜欢滑雪板的 || just sitting around, grooving on the music 随便坐坐，在音乐中享受一下</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adore, fancy, savor, relish, get off on, rejoice in, revel in, delight in</div>
<h2>grotesque[sound:grotesque.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难看的：</font>unpleasant to look at</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that bloody Halloween mask is grotesque 那个血腥的万圣节面具丑死了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hideous, homely, ill-favored, monstrous, unappealing, unattractive, uncomely, unsightly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aesthetic, attractive, beautiful, bonny, comely, fetching, gorgeous, knockout, ravishing,  seemly, sightly, stunning, taking, well-favored 悦目的，吸引人的</div>
<h2>grovel[sound:grovel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">卑躬屈膝：</font>to draw back or crouch down in fearful submission</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He made a groveling apology to the girl. 他放下身段，给那姑娘道歉。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cringe, creep, slither, wriggle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]groveler n. 卑躬屈膝者：the one who lies with the body prostrate in token of subservience or abasement</div>
<h2>grueling[sound:grueling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">费时间花心思的：</font>requiring much time, effort, or careful attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cutting diamonds can be grueling work 切割钻石是项劳神的活儿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arduous, burdensome, laborious, onerous, taxing, toilsome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]effortless, light, unchallenging, undemanding, undemanding, facile 不费力气的</div>
<h2>guile[sound:guile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">狡猾，狡诈：</font>the inclination or practice of misleading others through lies or trickery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a person so full of guile he can't even be trusted to give you the correct time of day 他这个人狡诈成性，说的话都不足为信</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artfulness, canniness, craft, cunningness, deviousness, slyness, subtleness, wiliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artlessness, forthrightness, ingenuousness, sincerity 朴实</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]guileless adj. 朴实的：free of guile; artless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]manipulative 操纵的</div>
<h2>guilt[sound:guilt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">自责，悔恨：</font>a feeling of responsibility for wrongdoing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he was wracked with guilt after he accidentally broke his sister's antique grandfather clock</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contrition, penitence, remorse, repentance, self-reproach, shame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impenitence, remorselessness 无罪</div>
<h2>gull[sound:gull.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">欺骗：</font>to cause to believe what is untrue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]we were gulled into believing that if we answered the e-mail, we'd somehow become millionaires, but instead we just got put on a list for junk mail 我们误以为只要回复了那封邮件，就能变身百万富翁，后来发现我们只不过是群发的垃圾邮件名单上的一员而已</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bamboozle, beguile, cozen, delude, dupe, fake out, gaff, hoax, hoodwink, snooker, string along, take in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undeceive 使醒悟</div>
<h2>gullible[sound:gullible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易受骗的，易被利用的：</font>easily duped or cheated, readily taken advantage of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They sell overpriced souvenirs to gullible tourists. 他们卖高价纪念品给易上当的旅客们。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dewy-eyed, exploitable, naive, susceptible, unwary, wide-eyed</div>
<h2>gush[sound:gush.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">大量涌出：</font>to flow forth suddenly in great volume</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]water gushing from the hydrant 水从消防栓中喷出</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exodus, outpour, outpouring, spout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dribble, drip, drop, trickle 涓涓细流，滴</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">感情强烈外溢：</font>to make an exaggerated display of affection or enthusiasm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an aunt gushing over the baby 对着婴儿母爱泛滥的姑姑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drool, effuse, enthuse, fuss, rave, slobber</div>
<h2>gust[sound:gust.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">情感爆发：</font>a sudden intense expression of strong feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the stressed-out coworker cried out with a gust of emotion 压力巨大的同事开始嚎啕大哭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burst, ebullition, eruption, explosion, flush, gush</div>
<h2>guzzle[sound:guzzle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">狂饮：</font>to drink especially liquor greedily, continually, or habitually</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]guzzle beer 狂饮啤酒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gulp, quaff, swig, booze, soak, tipple</div>
<h2>hack[sound:hack.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">雇佣文人：</font>a writer who aims solely for commercial success</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">乱砍：</font>to cut or chop with repeated and irregular blows</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]hacking out new election districts 划分新的选区</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">成功完成：</font>to deal with (something) usually skillfully or efficiently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]just couldn't hack the new job 无法搞定新工作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]address, contend with, cope with, manage, maneuver, manipulate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">忍受：</font>to put up with (something painful or difficult)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]she's not sure she can hack that miserable job much longer 她不知道还能忍受那项苦逼的工作多久</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abide, bide, brook, countenance, endure, handle, stand, stomach, sustain, tolerate</div>

<h2>hard-bitten[sound:hard-bitten.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顽强的，经受的住困境、压力的：</font>able to withstand hardship, strain, or exposure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]hard-bitten Chinese people could endure both the scorching heat and the freezing cold 坚强勇敢的中国人民既能受得住酷暑，又能受得住严寒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hardened, sturdy, tough, cast-iron, inured, rugged, stout, vigorous, hardy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delicate, nonhardy, soft, tender, weak 柔弱的</div>
<h2>hardy[sound:hardy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顽强的：</font>able to withstand hardship, strain, or exposure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]chrysanthemums are hardy enough to survive a light frost 菊花能够经受霜打</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hardened, sturdy, tough, cast-iron, inured, rugged, stout, vigorous, hard-bitten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delicate, nonhardy, soft, tender, weak 柔弱的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">愿意冒风险的：</font>inclined or willing to take risks</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]hardy souls who pioneered new paths into outer space 那些愿意冒险探索外太空的先驱们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adventurous, audacious, daring, dashing, emboldened, enterprising, gutsy, venturous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unadventurous, unenterprising 没有冒险精神的</div>
<h2>harmonious[sound:harmonious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">和谐一致的：</font>having the parts agreeably related</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a harmonious arrangement of archways and doorways in the palace courtyard 宫殿的庭院，拱门和门廊排列有序协调</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balanced,  congruous,  consonant,  eurythmic,  harmonic,  accordant,  coherent,  compatible,  concordant,conformable, congruent, consonant, correspondent, nonconflicting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disharmonic, disharmonious, incongruous, unbalanced 不协调的；conflicting, incompatible, incongruous, inconsistent 冲突的</div>
<h2>harness[sound:harness.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">利用：</font>utilize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]harness the sun's rays as a source of energy  利用阳光作为一种能源</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apply, employ, exercise, exploit, operate, utilize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fail to utilize 没能够利用</div>
<h2>harrow[sound:harrow.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">折磨，使苦恼：</font>to inflict great distress or torment on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the villagers were gaunt and sickly, harrowed by years of disease and starvation 村民们枯瘦如柴，体弱多病，都是被多年的疾病和饥饿折磨的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agonize, beset, besiege, torment, torture, excruciate, plague</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assuage 减轻苦恼</div>
<h2>harry[sound:harry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">不断烦扰，骚扰：</font>to disturb or distress by or as if by repeated attacks; harass</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comfort, mollify 安慰</div>
<h2>harsh[sound:harsh.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗糙的，不具有美感的：</font>unpleasantly coarse  and  rough  to the touch,  disagreeable  to one'saesthetic or artistic sense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the harsh lighting in the cafeteria makes the food look slightly off-color 咖啡厅劣质刺眼的灯光让食物看起来卖相不佳</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grating, grotesque, jarring, unaesthetic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]soft, aesthetic  柔和的，有美感的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严厉的：</font>unduly exacting, given to exacting standards of discipline and self-restraint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a harsh judge when it comes to drug users and especially drug dealers 对于瘾君子特别是毒贩处罚格外严厉的法官</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]afflicting, agonizing, cruel, excruciating, galling, grievous, harrowing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clement, forbearing, gentle, indulgent, lax, lenient, tolerant  温和的，宽松的</div>
<h2>hasten[sound:hasten.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">促进：</font>to speed up; accelerate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The man’s death was hastened by alcohol abuse.  酗酒加速了老人的死亡。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accelerate, bundle, fast-track, rush, speed up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]slow the progress of, check, retard, brake, decelerate, retard, slow down  阻碍，放慢</div>
<h2>hasty[sound:hasty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">轻率的：</font>fast and typically superficial; acting or done with excessive or careless speed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a hasty decision 轻率的决定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cursory, headlong, precipitate, rash, rushed, pell-mell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deliberate, well considered, unhurried, unrushed 深思熟虑的，不慌不忙的</div>
<h2>haunt[sound:haunt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">常去拜访：</font>to visit often; frequent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]haunt the movie theater 常去影院</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affect, habituate, visit, hang at, resort to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]avoid, shun 避开</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">不断地想起，萦绕心头：</font>to come to mind continually; obsess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a riddle that haunted me all morning  整个早上萦绕在我心头的谜</div>
<h2>hauteur[sound:hauteur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n．傲慢，自大：haughtiness in bearing and attitude; arrogance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he looked at her with the hauteur of someone who is accustomed to being instantly obeyed 他看着她，带着向来被顺从惯了的傲慢。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bumptiousness, imperiousness, peremptoriness, pomposity, presumptuousness, pretentiousness,superciliousness, superiority</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humility, humbleness, modesty, unassumingness, unpretentiousness 谦虚</div>
<h2>haven[sound:haven.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">安全的地方：</font>a place of safety</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a haven for artists  艺术家们的圣地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asylum, harbor, refuge, retreat, sanctuary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unsafe place, dangerous place 不安全的地方</div>
<h2>havoc[sound:havoc.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大混乱：</font>a state in which everything is out of order</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the blackout caused havoc in the city 断电造成了城市一片混乱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disarrangement, disarray, dishevelment, muddle, muss, tumble, welter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]order, orderliness 有序</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大范围破坏：</font>the state or fact of being rendered nonexistent, physically unsound, or useless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the powerful hurricane wreaked havoc all along the coast 威力巨大的飓风摧毁着沿岸的一切</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annihilation, decimation, demolishment, desolation, devastation, extermination, extinction, obliteration, ruin,wreckage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]building, construction, erection, raising 建设</div>
<h2>headlong[sound:headlong.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">鲁莽的：</font>without deliberation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]terrified forest creatures in a headlong retreat from the rapidly spreading fire 受惊的动物们惊慌失措地从不断蔓延的森林大火中逃离出来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cursory, overhasty, precipitate, precipitous, rash, pell-mell, helter-skelter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deliberate, unhurried, unrushed  深思熟虑的</div>

<h2>hearten[sound:hearten.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">给予鼓励，鼓舞：</font>to give strength, courage, or hope to; encourage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]thinking we were hopelessly lost, we were heartened by the sight of a familiar farmhouse 悲催地以为我们完全迷路了，前方一座熟悉的农场给了我们新的希望</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]embolden, inspire, inspirit, buck up, buoy up, cheer up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]daunt, dismay, discourage, dishearten, dispirit 使胆怯</div>
<h2>heartrending[sound:heartrending.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人心碎的：</font>causing intense sorrow or distress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a heartrending choice between saving his mother or his wife 先救老妈还是先救老婆的纠结选择</div>
<h2>hedonism[sound:hedonism.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">享乐主义：</font>the doctrine that pleasure or happiness is the sole or chief good in life</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]their spring break trip to Mexico became an exercise in heedless hedonism  他们春季的墨西哥之行成为了一次未加注意的享乐之旅</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carnality, debauchery, sybaritism, voluptuousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abstinence, asceticism, sobriety, temperance  禁欲，节制</div>
<h2>hegemony[sound:hegemony.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">霸权，统治权：</font>preponderant influence or authority over others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]battled for hegemony in Asia 争夺在亚洲地区的霸权地位</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ascendancy, dominance, dominion, predominance, preeminence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lack of authority 缺少权利</div>
<h2>heinous[sound:heinous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可憎的，十恶不赦的：</font>hatefully or shockingly evil, abominable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a heinous crime 十恶不赦的罪行</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commendable 值得赞美的</div>
<h2>hew[sound:hew.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">遵守：</font>confirm, adhere, to hold to something firmly as if by adhesion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]hew to tradition 遵守传统</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adhere, cling, conform</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">支持：</font>to give steadfast support to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]no longer was able to hew to the party line and so he switched political parties 不再赞同该党的纲领，他投奔了另一个党</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cling to, keep to, stand by, stick to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defect from 脱离，叛变</div>
<h2>herald[sound:herald.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">告知：</font>to make known openly or publicly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]herald the great tidings to all the world 将重大消息告知全世界</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annunciate, broadcast, declare, enunciate, proclaim, promulgate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">预示，预兆：</font>to give a slight indication of beforehand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the reshuffle of the company's management heralded the sweeping changes to come 公司管理层的重新洗牌预示着即将到来的巨大变革</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adumbrate, forerun, harbinger, prefigure</div>
<h2>heresy[sound:heresy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">异教，和普遍观点相悖：</font>a controversial or unorthodox opinion or doctrine, departure from agenerally accepted theory, opinion, or practice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the heresy of asserting that Shakespeare was not a great writer  声称莎士比亚不是伟大作家的非主流观点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dissent, dissidence, heterodoxy, nonconformity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dogma, conformity, orthodoxy 正教</div>
<h2>heretical[sound:heretical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">异教的，异端的：</font>departure from established beliefs or standards</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the belief that women should be allowed to have careers outside the home was once considered heretical女人应该拥有自己的事业这一观点一度被认为是异端想法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]heterodox, nonconformist, unconventional, unorthodox</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conforming, conformist, conventional, orthodox 正统的</div>
<h2>hermetic[sound:hermetic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">深奥的：</font>relating to or characterized by occultism or abstruseness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wrote hermetic poetry 写晦涩难懂的诗歌</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstruse, arcane, esoteric, recondite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easily comprehended, shallow, superficial 容易理解的，肤浅的</div>
<h2>hesitance[sound:hesitance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">犹豫，不情愿：</font>the quality or state of being hesitant, reluctance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]sales figures for the month were up, as consumers began to overcome their hesitance about purchasingbig-ticket items 月销售额有所上涨，因为消费者对于大件商品的购买由观望转向消费</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]faltering, indecision, irresolution, vacillation, wavering, wobbling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alacrity, impetuosity, inclination, willingness 冲动，乐意</div>
<h2>heterodox[sound:heterodox.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非正统的，异端的：</font>holding unorthodox opinions or doctrines, not rigidly following establishedform, custom, or rules</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]her heterodox approach to teaching science initially met with some resistance from her peers 她对于教学的一些非正统方法最开始受到了同辈的抵触</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dissenting, out-there, unconventional, unorthodox</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conforming, conventional, orthodox, regular, routine 正常的，正统的</div>
<h2>hidebound[sound:hidebound.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">死板的，极度保守的：</font>tending to favor established ideas, conditions, or institutions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the hidebound innkeeper refused to see the need for a Web site 死板的酒馆老板坚决不肯装宽带</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]archconservative, brassbound, die-hard, old-fashioned, standpat, ultraconservative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]broad-minded,  large-minded,  liberal,  nonconservative,  nonconventional,  nonorthodox,  nontraditional, open-minded, progressive  进步的，开放包容的</div>
<h2>hideous[sound:hideous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常丑陋的：</font>exceedingly ugly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wearing a hideous Halloween mask that made the kids all jump with fright 戴着一个丑陋的万圣节面具把小孩子全都吓跑了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]homely, ill-favored, monstrous, uncomely, unsightly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pulchritudinous, aesthetic, attractive, comely, gorgeous, handsome, knockout, ravishing, seemly, stunning,taking, well-favored 美丽的，有吸引力的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]hideousness  丑陋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]affinity 吸引力</div>
<h2>hie[sound:hie.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">匆匆忙忙：</font>to go quickly, hasten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]we had best hie home before the rain gets worse 我们最好在雨下大之前赶快回家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bustle, dash, hustle, scoot, scurry, scuttle, shoot, trot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dawdle, crawl, creep, poke 闲荡，爬行</div>

<h2>hilarious[sound:hilarious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常好笑的：</font>marked by or causing hilarity: extremely funny</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]hilarious cartoons that the whole family can enjoy 适合全家观看的搞笑动画片</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hysterical, ludicrous, ridiculous, screaming, sidesplitting, uproarious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humorless, lame, unamusing, uncomic, unfunny 不好笑的</div>
<h2>histrionic[sound:histrionic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">戏剧的，演员的：</font>of or relating to actors, acting, or the theater</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a penchant for dish throwing, door slamming, and other histrionic displays of temper 有倾向做出一些砸盘子、摔门和其他一些电视剧里的经典生气动作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]melodramatic, operatic, stagy, theatrical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undramatic</div>
<h2>hive[sound:hive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">忙碌之地：</font>a place swarming with activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The house was a hive of activity as we prepared for the party. 我们筹备派对时，房子里很是熙熙攘攘。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">储备，积累：</font>to store up; accumulate</div>
<h2>hoard[sound:hoard.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">贮藏，秘藏：</font>to keep hidden or private</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he's been hoarding empty yogurt containers all winter 他整个冬天都在攒空酸奶瓶</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cache, stash, stockpile, store, squirrel, stockpile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lavish 挥霍</div>
<h2>hoary[sound:hoary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极老的：</font>extremely old</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]hoary legends 上古的传说故事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aged, antique, dateless, immemorial, antediluvian</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]modern, new, recent 新的</div>
<h2>hoax[sound:hoax.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 欺骗：to cause to believe what is untrue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a skilled forger who hoaxed the art world into believing that the paintings were long-lost Vermeers 一个老道的骗子成功让艺术界相信那些画作是遗失多年的维米尔的真迹</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bamboozle, beguile, bluff, con, cozen, delude, dupe, fake out, gull, hoodwink, take in</div>
<h2>hodgepodge[sound:hodgepodge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大杂烩：</font>a mixture of dissimilar ingredients; a jumble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a hodgepodge of styles 混搭风格 || the exhibit was a hodgepodge of mediocre art, bad art, and really badart 整场展览就是中庸、烂和非常烂的艺术作品的大杂烩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agglomeration, assortment, collage, medley, mishmash, pastiche, potpourri</div>
<h2>homage[sound:homage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">尊敬，敬意：</font>expression of high regard: respect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Homage to Catalonia 向加泰罗尼亚致敬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commendation, eulogy, hymn, paean, panegyric, salutation, tribute, dithyramb</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disrespect 不尊敬</div>
<h2>homely[sound:homely.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">其貌不扬的，朴素简单的：</font>not attractive or good-looking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]homely truth 朴素的真理</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hideous, unappealing, unattractive, uncomely, unsightly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pulchritudinous,  aesthetic,  attractive,  beautiful,  comely,  gorgeous,  handsome,  knockout,  lovely,  pretty, ravishing, seemly, sightly, stunning, taking, well-favored 美丽的</div>
<h2>homily[sound:homily.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">冗长乏味的道德讲演或训诫：</font>an idea or expression that has been used by many people</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a TV movie filled with the usual hokey homilies about people triumphing over life's adversities 一档说教性质的、充满了介绍逆境中的人们如何成就自我的电视节目</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banality, bromide, chestnut, cliché, groaner, platitude, shibboleth</div>
<h2>homogenize[sound:homogenize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使统一化：</font>to make agree with a single established standard or model</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]plans to homogenize the science curriculum in public high schools throughout the state 计划将全州的公立高中的课程安排统一化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]formalize, homogenize, normalize, regularize</div>
<h2>hone[sound:hone.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">磨快：</font>to sharpen or smooth with a whetstone</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]honed the knife's blade to razor-like sharpness 把小刀磨得像剃刀一样锋利 ||  honed hiscrossword-puzzle skills by reading the dictionary  通过背字典把填词游戏的水平练得炉火纯青</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]edge, grind, strop, whet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blunt, dull 弄钝</div>
<h2>hoodwink[sound:hoodwink.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">欺骗：</font>to take in by deceptive means; deceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Don't let yourself be hoodwinked into buying things you don't need. 别被忽悠着去买用不着的东西。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beguile, con, delude, dupe, fool, hoax, humbug</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disabuse  消除错误念头</div>
<h2>hortative[sound:hortative.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">鼓励的：</font>giving exhortation</div>
<h2>hovel[sound:hovel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">茅屋：</font>a small, wretched, and often dirty house</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cabin, camp, hooch, hut, hutch, hutment, shanty</div>
<h2>hubris[sound:hubris.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">狂妄自大：</font>exaggerated pride or self-confidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His failure was brought on by his hubris. 就是他的狂妄自大才导致了失败。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humility 谦逊</div>
<h2>humble[sound:humble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">谦逊的：</font>marked by meekness or modesty in behavior, attitude, or spirit; not arrogant or prideful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a medical scientist who remained remarkably humble even after winning the Nobel Prize 获得诺贝尔奖之后仍然保持谦逊的医学家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]modest, unassuming, unpretentious, demure, down-to-earth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arrogant,  bumptious,  conceited,  egotistic,  haughty,  high-and-mighty,  imperious,  lordly,  overweening, peremptory,  pompous,  presuming,  presumptuous,  pretentious,  self-assertive,  supercilious,  superior,  toplofty, uppish, uppity 傲慢的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顺从的，谦卑的：</font>showing,  expressing,  or  offered  in  a  spirit  of  humility  or  unseemlysubmissiveness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]please accept my humble thanks 请接受我的卑微的感谢</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]base, humble, menial, servile, slavish</div>
<h2>humility[sound:humility.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">谦卑，谦逊：</font>the absence of any feelings of being better than others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Haughtiness invites disaster; humility receives benefit. 满招损，谦受益</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demureness, humbleness, lowliness, meekness, modesty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arrogance, assumption, bumptiousness, hauteur, pomposity, presumption, superciliousness 傲慢，自大</div>
<h2>humor[sound:humor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">幽默，令人发笑的事物：</font>something that is or is designed to be comical or amusing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The speech is full of wit and humor. 演讲妙趣横生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comedy, comic, drollery, drollness, funniness, hilariousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pathos 令人伤感的事物</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">迎合，迁就：</font>to comply with the wishes or ideas of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Parents need to know how to humor kids when they are upset. 父母需要知道当孩子烦躁的时候怎么哄孩子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cater, gratify, indulge</div>
<h2>hurricane[sound:hurricane.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">飓风：</font>a violent rotating storm or system of winds</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The hurricane struck the coast early today. 飓风今晨袭击了海岸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]storm, typhoon</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm  风平浪静</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">飓风般的事物，引起动荡的事物：</font>something resembling a hurricane especially in its turmoil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]economic news that unleashed a hurricane on the trading floor 在交易大厅掀起轩然大波的经济新闻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disturbance, furor, pandemonium, tumult, turmoil, uproar</div>
<h2>husband[sound:husband.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">节俭，勤俭持家：</font>to use sparingly or economically</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Husbanding precious resources was part of rural life. 节俭使用珍贵的资源就是农村生活的一部分</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]budget, conserve, economize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dissipate, lavish, prodigalize, squander, waste 挥霍，浪费</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]husbandly adj. 节俭的；husbandry n. 节俭</div>
<h2>husk[sound:husk.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（果类或谷物的）外壳：</font>a usually dry or membranous outer covering (as a pod or one composedof bracts) of various seeds and fruits (as barley and corn)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a grey squirrel nibbling on a peanut husk  一个啃着花生壳的灰松鼠</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bark, chaff, hull, shell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]core, kernel 核</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">剥去：</font>to remove the natural covering of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the tedious task of husking coconuts  无聊的任务——剥花生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bark, flay, hull, shell, shuck, skin</div>
<h2>husky[sound:husky.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（尤指声音）沙哑的，粗糙的：</font>hoarse or rough in quality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a voice husky with emotion  富有感情的沙哑声音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coarse, grating, gravelly, harsh, rasping, rusty, scratchy, throaty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mellifluous （声音）甜蜜的，甜美的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">高大威猛的：</font>big and muscular</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a very husky young man, built like a football player 一个体格像橄榄球运动员一样的高大的男孩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beefy, burly, hefty, muscular, powerful, strapping, rugged</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dwarf 矮小的</div>
<h2>hybrid[sound:hybrid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">杂交品种，混合品种：</font>something of mixed origin or composition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a hybrid of medieval and Renaissance styles 中世纪和文艺复兴的混搭风</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amalgam, bastard, compound, mixture, mule</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">杂交的：</font>being offspring produced by parents of different races, breeds, species, or genera</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a hybrid rose called “American Beauty” 一种被称为“美国丽人”的杂交玫瑰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crossbred, mongrel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]purebred  纯种的</div>
<h2>hymn[sound:hymn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">赞歌，赞美诗：</font>a song of praise or joy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They sang a hymn of praise to God.  他们唱赞歌赞美上帝</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]eulogy, homage, hymn, ode, paean, panegyric, psalm, salutation, tribute</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dirge, elegy 哀诗，挽歌</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">赞美：</font>to proclaim the glory of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]During the honeymoon following the inauguration, newspaper articles seemed to hymn  the president'severy move.  在上任后的“蜜月期”之中，报纸新闻似乎在赞美总统的每一项措施</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bless, carol, celebrate, emblazon, exalt, extol, glorify, laud, magnify, resound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blame, censure, reprehend, reprobate 责难，职责</div>
<h2>hyperbole[sound:hyperbole.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">夸张：</font>a figure of speech in which exaggeration is used for emphasis or effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The debate was carried on with increasing rhetorical hyperbole.  随着辩论的进行，双方修辞当中的夸张越来越多</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coloring, embellishment, embroidering, exaggeration, magnification, overstatement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]understatement 有节制的陈述</div>
<h2>hypnotic[sound:hypnotic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">催眠的：</font>tending to cause sleep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her eyes soon grew heavy from the hypnotic rhythm of the train's wheels. 伴随着催眠的铁轨声，她很快就有了睡意</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drowsy, narcotic, opiate, sleepy, slumberous, soporific</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stimulating 刺激性的；refreshing  使人精神焕发的</div>
<h2>hypocritical[sound:hypocritical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">虚伪的：</font>not being or expressing what one appears to be or express</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It's hypocritical to say mean things behind someone's back, and then to act nice when you want somethingfrom her. 这种在背后说别人坏话、而有求于人时又装出另一副样子的人就是虚伪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artificial, backhanded, feigned, mealy-mouthed, phony, pretended, unctuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artless, candid, genuine, honest, sincere, undesigning, unfeigned 真诚的，诚实的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]hypocrite n. 虚伪的人，伪君子</div>
<h2>iconoclast[sound:iconoclast.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">特立独行的人：</font>a person who does not conform to generally accepted standards or customs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was an iconoclast who refused to be bound by tradition. 他是个不愿被传统所束缚的叛逆者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bohemian, deviant, heretic, maverick, non-conformer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conformer, conformist 循规蹈矩的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]iconoclastic adj. 特立独行的</div>
<h2>idolatrize[sound:idolatrize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（通常盲目）崇拜：</font>admires intensely and often blindly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some teenagers idolatrized Hitler more than their own parents. 曾经有一些青少年崇拜希特勒超过自己的父母</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adore, adulate, canonize, deify, dote, worship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abhor, abominate, detest, dislike, hate, loathe 痛恨，憎恶</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]idolatry n. 崇拜</div>
<h2>idyll[sound:idyll.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">无忧无虑的生活：</font>a carefree episode or experience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a summer idyll on the coast of the Mediterranean 地中海岸的悠闲夏日</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]frisk, frolic, gambol, revel, lark</div>
<h2>ignite[sound:ignite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt.<font color="#aa00ff">点燃：</font>to cause to burn; to set fire to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.  炸弹引发的大火摧毁了大约60 间房屋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enkindle, fire, inflame, kindle, light, torch</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]douse, extinguish, quench, put out 熄灭</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激起，唤起（感情等）：</font>to arouse the passions of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The insults ignited my anger. 那些侮辱让我倍感愤怒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arouse, incite, instigate, pique, spark, stimulate, stir</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, assuage, calm, conciliate, mollify, pacify, placate, propitiate, soothe  平息怒火，安抚</div>
<h2>ignominy[sound:ignominy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">耻辱：</font>the state of having lost the esteem of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He spent the remainder of his life in ignominy after being involved in a bribery scandal.  因为卷入了受贿丑闻当中，他在耻辱中度过余生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discredit, disesteem, dishonor, disrepute, infamy, obloquy, odium, opprobrium, reproach, shame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]glory, honor 荣耀；esteem, respect 敬意</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ignominious adj. 可鄙的</div>
<h2>illiteracy[sound:illiteracy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">文盲：</font>the condition of being unable to read and write</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a nationwide campaign against illiteracy 全国扫盲运动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ignorance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]learning, literacy 受过教育</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]illiterate adj. 不识字的</div>
<h2>illuminati[sound:illuminati.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">智者：</font>persons who claim to be unusually enlightened</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clerisy, intellectual, intelligentsia, literati</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fool, dolt, dullard, idiot, simpleton 傻子</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">精英：</font>individuals carefully selected as being the best of a class</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a book launching party to which only New York's cultural illuminati were invited 一个只邀请了纽约上层文化精英的新书发布会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aristocracy, elite, upper crust</div>
<h2>illuminate[sound:illuminate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">照明：</font>to make luminous or shining</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to illuminate with a spotlight 用聚光灯照亮</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bathe, beacon, emblaze, illume, illumine, irradiate, lighten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blacken, darken, obfuscate  使黯淡，使昏暗</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">阐明：</font>to make plain or understandable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Roosevelt′s New Deal illuminates what the role of government is in Keynesian Economics.  罗斯福新政阐明了在凯恩斯主义中政府的作用</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clarify, clear, construe, demonstrate, demystify, elucidate, explicate, expound, illustrate, interpret</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obscure 使费解</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">启迪，启发：</font>to provide (someone) with moral or spiritual understanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]how man is illuminated by a higher spirit 人们是如何被更高境界的思想开化的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]edify, educate, enlighten, inspire, nurture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confuse, perplex, puzzle 使困惑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]illumination n. 照明；启迪</div>
<h2>illusory[sound:illusory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">幻觉的，虚幻的：</font>produced by, based on, or having the nature of an illusion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the illusory definition of nationhood 国家的虚幻定义</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chimerical, fanciful, fantastic, fictional, fictitious, imaginary, suppositious, supposititious, unreal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]factual 事实的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]illusion n. 幻觉</div>
<h2>imbibe[sound:imbibe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">喝水，摄取水分：</font>to take in (something liquid) through small openings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Plants can imbibe water through their roots. 植物可以通过它们的根摄取水分</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drink, guzzle, hoist, quaff, sip, sponge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]urinate 排尿</div>
<h2>imbroglio[sound:imbroglio.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">困境，复杂的局面：</font>an intricate or complicated situation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]What investor would willingly become involved in this imbroglio  怎样的投资者才会像这样明知山有虎，偏向虎山行呢？</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]complexity, complication, embarrassment, entanglement, involvement, misunderstanding, quandary</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">纷争：</font>an often noisy or angry expression of differing opinions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an imbroglio involving some big names in the entertainment industry  一场涉及娱乐圈数位明星的纷争</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]altercation, controversy, disagreement, dispute, fight, quarrel, squabble, wrangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]harmony  和谐</div>
<h2>imitation[sound:imitation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">仿制品：</font>something that is made to look exactly like something else</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]usually wore imitations of her costly jewels 通常只戴她那些贵重珠宝的复刻品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clone, copy, dupe, duplication, facsimile, mock, reduplication, replica, replication, reproduction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]archetype, original, prototype 原型</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]imitating adj. 仿制的</div>
<h2>immaculate[sound:immaculate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">干净的，纯净的：</font>free from dirt or stain; free from any trace of the coarse or indecent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an immaculate soul 一个纯净的灵魂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antiseptic, chaste, clean, decent, modest, pristine, pure, spotless, stainless, virgin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coarse, indecent, obscene, vulgar 粗俗的,下流的；besmirched,  dirty,  filthy,  foul,  spotted,  stained, sullied 有污点的，不干净的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">完美的，没有任何错误的：</font>being entirely without fault or flaw</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an immaculate rendering of the Queen of the Night ’s aria （《魔笛》中）夜后咏叹调的完美演绎</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absolute, faultless, flawless, impeccable, indefectible, irreproachable, perfect, seamless, unblemished</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amiss, defective, faulty, flawed, imperfect 有错误的，有误差的</div>
<h2>immanent[sound:immanent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">内在的：</font>being a part of the innermost nature of a person or thing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Beauty is not something imposed but something immanent. 美丽是内在的品格而非外加的东西</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constitutional, essential, inborn, inbred, indigenous, ingrained, innate, integral, intrinsic, natural</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adventitious, extrinsic, extraneous 外在的，非本源的</div>
<h2>immaterial[sound:immaterial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非实体的：</font>not composed of matter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It is only possible to study immaterial forces like gravity by observing their effects on the physical world.要研究那些非实体的作用力——例如万有引力，只能观察它们对于现实世界的影响</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ethereal, formless, incorporeal, insubstantial, nonmaterial, spiritual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bodily, corporeal, material, physical, substantial 实体的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无关的，不重要的：</font>of no importance or relevance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]While undoubtedly upsetting, that story is immaterial to the question of why you are late. 尽管那个故事的确很让人遗憾，但是和你为什么迟到没有半点关系</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extraneous, impertinent, inapplicable, inapposite, irrelevant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]applicable, apposite, apropos, germane, pertinent, relevant  相关的；crucial, important, significant 重要的</div>
<h2>immature[sound:immature.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">未完全发展的，未发育成熟的：</font>lacking complete growth, differentiation, or development</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]immature frogs are called “tadpoles”  为发育成熟的青蛙被称为“蝌蚪”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adolescent, juvenile, youngish, youthful</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（思维、举止）不够成熟的：</font>lacking in adult experience or maturity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Many high school students are still too immature to foresee the consequences of their actions. 很多高中生还是不够成熟，不能意识到他们的行为所带来的后果</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]green, inexperienced, puerile, raw, unfledged, unripe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adult, experienced, mature, ripe  成年的，成熟的</div>
<h2>immemorial[sound:immemorial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">古老的：</font>dating or surviving from the distant past</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a modern version of an immemorial myth  一个远古传说的现代版本</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aged, age-old, antediluvian, antique, dateless, hoary, old, venerable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contemporary, modern  当代的，现代的；recent 近来的</div>
<h2>immune[sound:immune.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不易被感染的，有免疫力的：</font>of, relating to, or having resistance to infection</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The blood test will tell whether you are immune to the disease. 验血可以判断你是否对这种疾病免疫</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]resistant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]susceptible, vulnerable  易感染的，易受攻击的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不受影响的：</font>not affected by a given influence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]immune to persuasion 不听劝</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]insusceptible, unaffected, unresponsive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ductile, pliable, pliant, yielding 易受影响的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不受约束的：</font>not subject to an obligation imposed on others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]immune from taxation 免税</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exempt, free</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]liable, responsible  负有责任的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]immunity n. 免疫性</div>
<h2>immure[sound:immure.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">监禁，禁闭：</font>to confine within or as if within walls</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]immure oneself for GRE 闭门苦读GRE</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bastille, confine, constrain, incarcerate, intern, jail, imprison</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discharge, release 释放；enfranchise, free, liberate 解放</div>
<h2>immutable[sound:immutable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不可变的：</font>not capable of changing or being changed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]One of the immutable laws of television is that low ratings inevitably lead to cancellation. 电视行业中一个不变的原则就是：低收视率的节目必然会被撤掉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constant, fixed, inalterable, inflexible, invariable, unalterable, unchangeable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alterable, changeable, elastic, flexible, mutable, variable 可变的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]immutability n. 不变性</div>
<h2>impassive[sound:impassive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冷漠的，无感情的：</font>giving no sign of feeling or emotion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She remained impassive as the officers informed her of her son's death. 她面不改色地听着警官宣读她儿子的死讯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectless, apathetic, cold-blooded, deadpan, emotionless, numb, phlegmatic, stoic, undemonstrative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demonstrative, emotional, fervent, fervid, impassioned, passionate, vehement 充满感情的</div>
<h2>impeccable[sound:impeccable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无罪的：</font>free from sin, guilt or blame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the belief that there can be no such thing as an impeccable soul 不相信存在无罪的灵魂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blameless, clear, guiltless, inculpable, pure, sinless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]guilty, sinful 有罪的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无瑕的，无可挑剔的：</font>free from fault or blame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She had impeccable taste in clothes. 她有着无可挑剔的穿衣品味</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absolute, faultless, flawless, immaculate, indefectible, irreproachable, perfect, seamless, unblemished</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amiss, defective, faulty, flawed, imperfect 有错误的，有误差的</div>
<h2>impecunious[sound:impecunious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贫穷的：</font>having very little or no money</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They were so impecunious that they couldn't afford to give one another even token Christmas gifts. 他们穷到了连象征性的圣诞礼物都互送不起的地步</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beggared, destitute, impoverished, indigent, necessitous, needy, penniless, penurious, threadbare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]affluent, flush, opulent, rich, wealthy  富有的</div>
<h2>impede[sound:impede.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">妨碍，阻碍：</font>to interfere with or slow the progress of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Storms at sea impeded our expedition. 海上的风暴阻碍了我们的远征</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clog, embarrass, encumber, fetter, hinder, inhibit, obstruct, retard, shackle, stymie, trammel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aid, assist, facilitate, help 促进，帮助</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]impediment n. 障碍，阻碍</div>
<h2>impending[sound:impending.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">即将发生的：</font>being soon to appear or take place</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an impending celebration of the 100th anniversary of the college's founding 即将来临的百年校庆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]approaching, coming, imminent, nearing, pending, proximate, upcoming, around the corner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]late, recent 最近发生的；distant, remote 遥远的</div>
<h2>impenetrable[sound:impenetrable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不可渗透的，不可穿透的：</font>impossible to get through or into</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The ancient temple was surrounded by vast stretches of impenetrable jungle .  包围着古老的神庙的是密不透风的灌木丛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impassable, impermeable, impervious, impregnable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]passable, penetrable, permeable, pervious 可通过的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难以理解的：</font>incapable of being comprehended</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The textbook's language is completely impenetrable, at least to me. 至少在我看来，这个教材就是天书</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arcane, cryptic, enigmatic, incomprehensible, inscrutable, unfathomable, ungraspable, unintelligible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fathomable, intelligible, understandable 可以理解的</div>
<h2>impenitent[sound:impenitent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不悔悟的：</font>not feeling or expressing humble or regretful pain or sorrow for sins or offenses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]remain impenitent about her criminal past 对她过去所犯罪行执迷不悟</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]remorseless, regretless, shameless, unashamed, unrepentant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contrite, regretful, remorseful, rueful, penitent  感到悔恨的</div>
<h2>imperative[sound:imperative.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">命令：</font>a statement of what to do that must be obeyed by those concerned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a secretary of defense who was fond of issuing harshly worded imperatives 一个很喜欢发布措辞严厉的命令的国防部长</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]command, decree, dictate, direction, directive, instruction, order, word</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">命令的，强制性的：</font>forcing one's compliance or participation by or as if by law</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]requests that grew more and more imperative 命令性越来越强的请求</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compulsory, forced, involuntary, obligatory, peremptory, required</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]optional 可选择的；voluntary 志愿性的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迫切的：</font>needing immediate attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an imperative need for medical supplies in the earthquake-ravaged country 地震灾区国家对于医疗物资的迫切需求</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clamant, compelling, critical, crying, emergent, exigent, imperious, importunate, pressing, urgent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]noncritical, unimportant 不重要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">必要的：</font>impossible to do without</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Proper equipment is imperative for the success of this chemical experiment. 合适的仪器是这个化学实验成功必不可少的条件</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indispensable, necessary, necessitous, requisite, vital</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dispensable, inessential, needless, unnecessary 非必须的</div>
<h2>imperial[sound:imperial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">帝国的，帝王的：</font>of, relating to, or suggestive of an empire or a sovereign, especially an emperoror empress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Imperial College London 帝国理工学院</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]kingly, queenly, regal, royal</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">巨大的，令人惊叹的：</font>large and impressive in size, grandeur, extent, or conception</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]envisioned an imperial city that would rival the capitals of Europe for beauty and magnificence 幻想着一个比欧洲各国首都更为动人和壮丽的巨大城市</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]august, epic, glorious, grand, imposing, magnificent, monumental, noble, splendid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]common, humble, inferior, low 低下的，平凡的</div>
<h2>imperious[sound:imperious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">爱发号施令的：</font>fond of ordering people around</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an imperious little boy who liked to tell the other scouts what to do 一个爱发号施令的小男孩，总是喜欢指挥别的童子军做事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]authoritarian, autocratic, despotic, dictatorial, domineering, masterful, tyrannical</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">傲慢的，专横的：</font>arrogantly domineering or overbearing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an imperious movie star who thinks she's some sort of goddess  一个把自己当成某种女神的傲慢的影星</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arrogant, bumptious, haughty, lofty, lordly, peremptory, pompous, presumptuous, supercilious, superior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humble, lowly, modest  谦逊的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迫切的：</font>intensely compelling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As war casualties mounted, the need for trained nurses became imperious. 随着战争伤亡人数的攀升，对于受训护士的需求变得愈发迫切</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clamant, compelling, critical, crying, dire, emergent, exigent, imperative, importunate, pressing, urgent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]noncritical, unimportant 不重要的</div>
