<h2>impertinent[sound:impertinent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无关紧要的：</font>not having a clear decisive relevance to the matter in hand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Your résumé needlessly lists extracurricular experiences that are impertinent to the PhD program for whichyou are applying.  你的简历里列出的一些课外活动和你申请的博士项目是毫不相关的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extraneous, immaterial, inapplicable, inapposite, irrelevant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]germane, pertinent, relevant 相关的；crucial, important, significant 重要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗鲁无礼的，大胆的：</font>given to or characterized by insolent rudeness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I don't like strangers who ask impertinent questions. 我很讨厌那些问无礼问题的陌生人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, bold, brash, brassbound, brassy, brazen, impudent, insolent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]meek, mousy, retiring, shy, timid 内敛的，胆小的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不守礼节的，不为他人着想的：</font>showing a lack of manners or consideration for others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]impertinent salesmen who telephone people during the dinner hour 在就餐时间打电话骚扰别人的无礼销售员</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discourteous, disrespectful, inconsiderate, rude, thoughtless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]civil, courteous, genteel, gracious, mannerly, polite 有礼貌的；considerate 为他人着想的</div>
<h2>imperturbable[sound:imperturbable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">沉着冷静的，淡定的：</font>marked by extreme calm, impassivity, and steadiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The chef was absolutely imperturbable—even when the kitchen caught on fire. 这个厨师可谓淡定到了极致——他连厨房着火的时候都依然沉着</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collected, composed, cool, disimpassioned, nonchalant, unflappable, unruffled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]choleric, touchy 暴躁的，易怒的</div>
<h2>impervious[sound:impervious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不可渗透的，不可穿透的：</font>not allowing entrance or passage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The material for this coat is supposed to be impervious to rain. 这件大衣的材料应该是能防雨的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impassable, impenetrable, impermeable, impregnable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]passable, penetrable, permeable, pervious 可渗透的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不能被破坏的：</font>not capable of being damaged or harmed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a carpet impervious to rough treatment 耐用的地毯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bulletproof, imperishable, indestructible, inextinguishable, invulnerable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delicate, sensitive, vulnerable 脆弱的，敏感的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不为所动的：</font>not capable of being affected or disturbed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]These sailors are impervious to fear.  这些水手无所畏惧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]immune, insusceptible, unaffected, unresponsive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ductile, pliable, pliant, yielding 易受影响的</div>
<h2>impetuous[sound:impetuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冲动的，性急的，轻率的：</font>marked by impulsive vehemence or passion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is young and impetuous. 他年轻易冲动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardent, hasty, headlong, impassioned, impulsive, passionate, rash, vehement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cautious, circumspect, wary 谨慎的，小心的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">剧烈的，猛烈的：</font>marked by force and violence of movement or action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an impetuous wind 猛烈的风</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrupt, hasty, hurried, precipitate, precipitous, rushing, sudden, violent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, halcyon, placid, quiet  风平浪静的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]impetus n. 推动力</div>
<h2>impious[sound:impious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">不敬神的：</font>lacking reverence for holy or sacred matters</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]made impious remarks about the church  对教会做出不敬的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blasphemous, irreverent, profane, sacrilegious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pious 虔诚的；reverent 敬神的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]impiety n. （对神的）不敬</div>
<h2>implacable[sound:implacable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固执的：</font>sticking to an opinion, purpose, or course of action in spite of reason, arguments, orpersuasion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant, dogged, headstrong, intransigent, mulish, obdurate, pertinacious, stubborn, unyielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquiescent 倾向于默认的；compliant, flexible, pliable, pliant, yielding 易受影响的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无法平息的：</font>not capable of being appeased, significantly changed, or mitigated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an implacable enemy 无法与之和解的敌人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]determined, grim, relentless, unappeasable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]placable 可平息的，可缓和的</div>
<h2>implement[sound:implement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">工具：</font>a device used in the performance of a task</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gardening implements such as hoes, spades, and pruners 诸如锄头、铲子和修枝剪一类的园艺工具</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apparatus, device, instrument, tool, utensil</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">执行，实施：</font>to put into practical effect; carry out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]implement the new online application procedures 实行新的网申程序</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]administer, apply, effect, enforce, execute, invoke, perform</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cancel, repeal, rescind, revoke 撤销</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]implementation n. 执行，履行</div>
<h2>implode[sound:implode.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">剧烈收缩，坍缩，内爆：</font>to collapse inward violently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The flask imploded during the vacuum distilling. 做低压蒸馏的时候烧瓶发生了内爆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]buckle, founder, tumble, yield</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]explode 外爆，爆炸</div>
<h2>imposing[sound:imposing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">宏伟壮丽的：</font>impressive in size, bearing, dignity, or grandeur</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The corporation's imposing  headquarters were designed by one of the nation's cutting-edge architects.这家公司宏伟壮丽的总部是由该国最优秀的建筑师设计的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]august, epic, glorious, grand, imperial, magnificent, monumental, noble, splendid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]common, humble, inferior, low 低下的，平凡的</div>
<h2>importune[sound:importune.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">恳求，迫切请求：</font>to make a request to (someone) in an earnest or urgent manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]beggars importuning passers-by 在恳求着过路人的乞丐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appeal,beseech, besiege, conjure, entreat, impetrate, implore, petition, plead, pray, solicit, supplicate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demand 要求，强求</div>
<h2>impostor[sound:impostor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">冒充者：</font>one that assumes false identity or title for the purpose of deception</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The man who claimed to be a prince turned out to be an impostor. 那个自称是王子的人原来是冒充的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charlatan, fake, fraud, hoaxer, mountebank, phony, pretender, quack, sham</div>
<h2>impotent[sound:impotent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无生育能力的：</font>unable to produce fruit or offspring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Most mules are impotent. 绝大多数的骡子都无法生育</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]barren, fruitless, infertile, unfruitful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fecund, fertile, fruitful, productive 高产的，硕果累累的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无力的，无能的：</font>lacking in power, strength, or vigor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an impotent ruler who was just a figurehead 一个无能的傀儡统治者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hamstrung, handcuffed, helpless, impuissant, paralyzed, weak</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mighty, potent, powerful, puissant, strong 强大的，有能力的</div>
<h2>imprecise[sound:imprecise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不精确的：</font>not precise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]incomplete and imprecise satellite data 既不完整又不精确的卫星数据</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]approximate, inaccurate, loose, squishy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accurate, exact, precise, veracious 精确的，准确的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]imprecision n. 不准确，不精确</div>
<h2>impromptu[sound:impromptu.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">即席的表演：</font>something, such as a speech, that is made or done extemporaneously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]improvisation, extemporization</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">即席的，即兴的：</font>composedwithout previous preparation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Our dinner guest thanked us with an impromptu song. 客人们即兴高歌一首以表达谢意</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ad-lib, extemporary, improvised, offhand, unplanned, unpremeditated, unprepared, unrehearsed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]considered, planned, premeditated, prepared, rehearsed 事先有所准备的</div>
<h2>improvise[sound:improvise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">即兴而作：</font>to invent, compose, or perform with little or no preparation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Since the award was a complete surprise, I improvised an acceptance speech. 因为那个奖项完全是个惊喜，所以我即兴发表了一个获奖演说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ad-lib, extemporize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plan, premeditate  计划，预先考虑</div>
<h2>imprudent[sound:imprudent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不明智的：</font>lacking discretion, wisdom, or good judgment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an imprudent investment ha made many years ago 他许多年前做的一笔不明智的投资</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impolitic, inadvisable, indelicate, injudicious, tactless, undiplomatic, unwise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advisable, politic, prudent, tactical, wise 明智的</div>
<h2>impudent[sound:impudent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">放肆大胆的，无礼的：</font>marked by contemptuous or cocky boldness or disregard of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some children were well behaved, while others were impudent.  一些孩子表现得很得体，另一些则很无礼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, barefaced, bold, brash, brazen, impertinent, insolent, shameless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]courteous, genteel, mannerly, polite, proper 举止得体的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]impudencen. 放肆无礼</div>
<h2>impugn[sound:impugn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">责难，攻击抨击：</font>to attack as false or questionable; challenge in argument</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]impugn a political opponent's character 就政治对手的人品发难</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attack, assail, contradict, contravene, cross, disaffirm, deny, gainsay, negate, negative, traverse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advocate, back, support, uphold 支持；authenticate 证实，证明</div>
<h2>impuissance[sound:impuissance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">无权，虚弱：</font>lack of power or effectivenes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In spite of their impuissance the group remains highly active. 尽管手中无权，但这个组织仍然十分活跃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impotence, powerlessness, weakness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clout, potency, power, puissance 权势</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]impuissant adj. 无权无势的，无能的</div>
<h2>inadvertent[sound:inadvertent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">偶然发生的：</font>happening by chance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an inadvertent encounter with a rattlesnake 偶遇响尾蛇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]casual, fluky, incidental, unintentional, unplanned, unpremeditated, unwitting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calculated, deliberate, intended, intentional, planned, premeditated 有计划的，有预谋的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">疏忽的，不留意的：</font>marked by unintentional lack of care</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The military has said it was an inadvertent error. 军方表示这是个疏忽大意的错误</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careless, feckless, heedless, irreflective, thoughtless, uncaring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advertent, careful, heedful, mindful 留意的，小心的</div>
<h2>inalienable[sound:inalienable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">不可剥夺的，不能让与的：</font>cannot be transferred to another or others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inalienable rights of the citizen 公民不可予夺的权利</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]untransferable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alienable  可与让的</div>
<h2>inane[sound:inane.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">空洞的：</font>lacking significance, meaning, or point</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inane comments 空洞的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]empty, insubstantial, pointless, senseless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]meaningful, significant  有意义的；deep, profound 深刻的</div>
<h2>inanimate[sound:inanimate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无生命的：</font>not having the qualities associated with active, living organisms</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He thinks that inanimate objects have a life of their own. 他认为无生命的事物其实也是有生命的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dead, lifeless, insensible, insentient, senseless, unfeeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]animate, living 有生命的</div>
<h2>inaugurate[sound:inaugurate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使就职：</font>to induct into an office by a formal ceremony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A new leader will be inaugurated soon. 新的领导即将就职</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]induct, initiate, install, instate, invest, seat</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abdicate, resign 辞职，退位</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">开始：</font>to cause to begin, especially officially or formally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inaugurate a new immigration policy  实施新的移民政策</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]begin, commence, establish, institute, introduce, launch, open, plant, start</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cease, close, end, terminate 结束</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inauguration n. 就职，开始</div>
<h2>incandescent[sound:incandescent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">明亮灿烂的：</font>strikingly bright, radiant, or clear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]incandescent light bulbs 明亮的灯泡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beaming, brilliant, dazzling, effulgent, glowing, lucent, luminous, lustrous, radiant, refulgent, shining</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dim, dull, lackluster 黯淡的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">热情饱满的：</font>characterized by glowing zeal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It makes me incandescent with fury.  它让我愤怒不已</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardent, demonstrative, emotional, fervid, impassioned, passionate, torrid, vehement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cold, cool, dispassionate, emotionless, impassive, unemotional 无感情的，漠然的</div>
<h2>incantation[sound:incantation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">咒语：</font>a spoken word or set of words believed to have magic power</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Hovering over the sick child, the witch doctor muttered mysterious incantations. 巫医在生病的小孩子身边走来走去，嘴里念着神秘的咒语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abracadabra, bewitchment, charm, conjuration, enchantment, glamour, hex, invocation</div>
<h2>incarnate[sound:incarnate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">化身的，人体化的：</font>invested with bodily nature and form</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He referred to her as devil incarnate. 他把她视作恶魔的化身</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]embodied, materialized, personified, typified</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（思想、理论的）具化，体现：</font>to constitute an embodiment or type of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the general view that Hitler incarnated extreme egotism 通常认为希特勒代表了极端的以自我为中心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]epitomize, incorporate, manifest, materialize, personalize, personify, substantiate, symbolize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disembody 使（灵魂等）脱离躯体</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]incarnation n. 化身</div>
<h2>incendiary[sound:incendiary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">煽动者：</font>a person who stirs up public feelings especially of discontent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]behind-the-scenes incendiaries who were intending to overthrow the government 企图推翻政府的幕后煽动者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demagogue, exciter, firebrand, fomenter, inciter, instigator, kindler, provocateur</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">煽动性的：</font>tending to inflame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an incendiary speech 煽动性的演说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agitational, instigative, provocative, seditious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conciliatory, pacific 安抚性的</div>
<h2>incense[sound:incense.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">芳香：</font>a sweet or pleasant smell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the heavenly incense of spring flowers 春天花朵发出的美妙芳香</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aroma, balm, bouquet, fragrancy, perfume, redolence, scent, spice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fetor, malodor, reek, stench, stink 恶臭</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激怒：</font>to cause to be extremely angry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This proposal will certainly incense female activists. 这个提案肯定会激怒女权主义者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, enrage, exasperate,inflame, infuriate, ire, madden, outrage, rankle, rile, roil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delight, gratify, please 取悦；appease, conciliate, mollify, pacify, placate, propitiate, soothe 缓和</div>
<h2>inception[sound:inception.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">开端，开始：</font>an act, process, or instance of beginning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This seemed like a good program at its inception, but it isn't working out as planned. 一开始这像是个不错的项目，但是它没有按照我们的预期发展</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beginning, birth, commencement, dawn, genesis, kickoff, launch, nascence, onset, outset, start, threshold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]close, conclusion, end, termination,omega 结束，终止</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inceptive adj. 开端的，初生的</div>
<h2>incessant[sound:incessant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无间断的：</font>continuing or following without interruption</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The incessant noise from an outside repair crew was a real distraction during the test. 窗外维修工发出的持续不断的噪音着实让人在考试里分心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ceaseless, continual, nonstop, perpetual, running, unbroken, unceasing, uninterrupted, unremitting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]interrupted 中断的；discontinuous, intermittent 有间断的</div>
<h2>inch[sound:inch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">少量，很短的距离：</font>a very small distance or degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]give them aninch, and they'll take a mile 得寸进尺‖Inch  by  inch,  we're  making  progress  toward  ourfund-raising goal.  我们在慢慢地接近筹款的目标</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ace, hairbreadth, skip, neck, step</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">慢慢移动：</font>to move or cause to move slowly or by small degrees</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The car inched carefully across the snow-covered bridge. 汽车慢慢地通过被大雪覆盖的桥梁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crawl, creak, creep, limp, plod, slouch, snail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dart, fleet, flit, scurry 飞奔，疾行</div>
<h2>inchoate[sound:inchoate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">新生的：</font>in an initial or early stage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inchoate feelings of affection for a man 刚刚产生的好感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aborning, beginning, inceptive, incipient, initial, nascent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adult, full-blown, full-fledged, mature, ripe 成熟的，成型的；moribund 将死的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">未完全成型的：</font>imperfectly formed or developed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a vague, inchoate notion 模糊而不成形的想法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amorphous, formless, shapeless, undeveloped, unformed, unshaped</div>
<h2>incinerate[sound:incinerate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">烧成灰烬：</font>to cause to burn to ashes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The government is trying to stop farmers incinerating their own waste. 政府开始阻止农民们焚烧垃圾的行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burn, carbonize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]douse, extinguish, quench, put out 扑灭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]incineration n. 焚化</div>
<h2>incipient[sound:incipient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">起初的，初现的：</font>beginning to come into being or to become apparent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an incipient economic recovery 刚刚出现的经济复苏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aborning, beginning, inceptive, inchoate,initial, nascent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adult, full-blown, full-fledged, mature, ripe 成熟的，成型的；moribund 将死的</div>
<h2>incite[sound:incite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">煽动，激起：</font>to provoke and urge on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inciting workers to strike 煽动工人罢工</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arouse, abet, foment, instigate, pick, provoke, raise, stir</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dampen, deter, discourage, dishearten, dissuade 劝阻</div>
<h2>inclement[sound:inclement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（天气等）恶劣的：</font>lacking mildness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inclement weather conditions 恶劣的气象条件</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bleak, harsh, severe, stormy, tempestuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bright, clear, cloudless, fair, sunny, sunshiny, unclouded 天气晴好的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无情的，严酷的：</font>showing no clemency; unmerciful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bitter, brutal, intemperate, rigorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]charitable, clement, lenient, merciful  仁慈的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inclemency n. 严酷无情</div>
<h2>incogitant[sound:incogitant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">考虑不周的，不体谅的：</font>thoughtless; inconsiderate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an incogitant litterbug 不体谅人的乱扔垃圾者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discourteous, disrespectful, ill-mannered, impertinent, inconsiderate, rude, thoughtless, ungracious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]civil, considerate, courteous, genteel, gracious, thoughtful 体谅他人的，举止得体的</div>
<h2>incongruent[sound:incongruent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不一致的：</font>not conforming to the circumstances or requirements of a situation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Two triangles are incongruent. 两个三角形不全等。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conflicting, discordant, discrepant, dissonant, incompatible, incongruous, inconsonant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]congruent, congruous, consistent 一致的</div>
<h2>inconsequential[sound:inconsequential.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不合逻辑的：</font>not using or following good reasoning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an inconsequential line of argument 不合逻辑的论述</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fallacious, illogical, invalid, irrational, unreasonable, unsound, weak</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]logical, rational, reasonable, sound, valid, well-founded, well-grounded 有理的，论证有力的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不重要的：</font>of no significance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That's an inconsequential problem compared to the other issues. 和其他问题相比，这就是个无关痛痒的小事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fiddling, frivolous, inconsiderable, insignificant, minor, minute, negligible, nugatory, petty, slight, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consequential, eventful, important, meaningful, momentous, significant, substantial, weighty 重要的</div>
<h2>incontrovertible[sound:incontrovertible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无可争议的：</font>not open to question</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]incontrovertible facts 无可非议的事实</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]certain, inarguable, incontestable, indisputable, indubitable, positive, sure, undeniable, unquestionable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arguable, controversial, debatable, disputable, problematic, questionable, refutable 有争议的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]incontrovertibility n. 无可争议</div>
<h2>incorrigible[sound:incorrigible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不可救药的，积习难改的：</font>incapable of being corrected or amended</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an incorrigible criminal deserving death penalty 一个应该被判死刑的恶习难改的罪犯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incurable, irrecoverable, irredeemable, irremediable, irretrievable, unrecoverable, unredeemable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]curable, reclaimable, recoverable, redeemable, remediable, retrievable, savable 可以拯救的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无法管制的：</font>difficult or impossible to control or manage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an incorrigible, spoiled child 被宠坏了的难管的孩子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]headstrong, intractable, obstinate, refractory, stubborn, unmanageable, unruly, willful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]compliant, docile, manageable, obedient, submissive, tractable 顺从的</div>
<h2>incriminate[sound:incriminate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">归罪于：</font>to accuse of a crime or other wrongful act</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]incriminate innocent people 诬陷好人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charge, criminate ,impeach, indict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absolve, acquit, exculpate, exonerate, vindicate 免罪</div>
<h2>incubate[sound:incubate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">孵化：</font>to cover and warm eggs as the young inside develop</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The hen incubated her eggs for two weeks. 母鸡孵蛋两周</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brood, hatch, sit</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">帮助，培养，促进：</font>to cause or aid the development of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Hopefully, these youthful visits to the museum will incubate an enduring love of art. 我们希望年轻时参观博物馆能够培养他们对于艺术的持久热爱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advance, cultivate, encourage, forward, further, nourish, nurse, nurture, promote</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]check, discourage, frustrate, hinder, impede, inhibit, obstruct, retard, shackle  妨碍，阻碍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]incubator n. 恒温箱；incubation n. 孵化，孵卵</div>
<h2>inculpate[sound:inculpate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt.<font color="#aa00ff">归罪于：</font>incriminate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charge, criminate, inculpate, indict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absolve, acquit, exculpate, exonerate, vindicate 免罪</div>
<h2>incursion[sound:incursion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n.<font color="#aa00ff">入侵：</font>a hostile entrance into a territory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]homes damaged by the incursion of floodwater 被洪水入侵破坏的房屋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]foray, inroad, invasion, irruption, raid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]retreat, withdrawal 撤退</div>
<h2>indelible[sound:indelible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（印记等）无法擦除的：</font>impossible to remove, erase, or wash away</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]indelible ink 难以擦拭的墨水</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ineffaceable, ineradicable, inerasable, ingrained</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eradicable, erasable, removable, washable 可抹去的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无法忘怀的：</font>not easily forgotten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]most indelible experiences 最难以磨灭的经历</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impressive, memorable, unforgettable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forgettable 容易被忘记的</div>
<h2>indemnity[sound:indemnity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（损害、伤害等的）保险补偿：</font>compensation for damage, loss, or injury suffered</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The widow now lives on a pension and an indemnity from her late husband's company. 这个寡妇如今依靠社保和前夫公司的保险赔偿过日</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compensation, indemnification, quittance, recompense, redress, remuneration, reparation, requital</div>
<h2>indict[sound:indict.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">起诉，控告：</font>to accuse of wrongdoing; charge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]indict the mayor for fraud and embezzlement.  起诉市长受贿和挪用公款</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charge, criminate, impeach, incriminate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absolve, acquit, exculpate, exonerate, vindicate 免罪</div>
<h2>indifferent[sound:indifferent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">公平的：</font>marked by impartiality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They believed their art teacher could offer an indifferent judgment on their works' merits . 他们相信艺术老师会对他们作品的价值做出公正的评价</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disinterested, equal, impartial, just, nonpartisan, objective, unbiased, unprejudiced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]biased, one-sided, partial, prejudiced 有偏好的；unjust  不公平的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（质量、档次等）中规中矩的，一般的：</font>of average to below average quality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an indifferent but drinkable cup of coffee 一杯尚可入口的咖啡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]average, common, fair, intermediate, mediocre, medium, moderate, ordinary, passable, so-so</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exceptional, extraordinary 极好的；inferior, poor  低档次的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不感兴趣的，冷漠的：</font>marked by a lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern for something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]indifferent about the result of CET-4  对四级成绩不感兴趣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aloof, apathetic, detached, incurious, nonchalant, numb, pococurante, remote, unconcerned, uninterested</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]attentive, concerned, interested  关切的，有兴趣的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]indifference n. 漠然</div>
<h2>indigenous[sound:indigenous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">土产的，本地的：</font>originating and living or occurring naturally in an area or environment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the culture of the indigenous people of that country 那个国家原著民的文化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aboriginal, endemic, native</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exotic, extraneous, foreign 外来的；nonnative 非本地的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">与生俱来的，先天的：</font>being a part of the innermost nature of a person or thing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The drive to create is indigenous to humanity. 人类创造的动力是与生俱来的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constitutional, essential, immanent, inborn, inbred, ingrained, innate, integral, intrinsic, natural</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adventitious, extrinsic 外在的；acquired, studied  后天习得的</div>
<h2>indigent[sound:indigent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贫穷的：</font>lacking money or material possessions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]indigent people who require some outside assistance 需要外来援助的贫苦人民</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beggared, destitute, impecunious, impoverished, necessitous, needy, penniless, penurious, threadbare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]affluent, opulent, rich, wealthy 富裕的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]indigence n. 贫穷</div>
<h2>indispensable[sound:indispensable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">必不可少的，不可或缺的：</font>impossible to do without</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was becoming indispensible to him. 对他而言她逐渐变得不可替代</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]critical, crucial, imperative, necessary, necessitous, needed, required, requisite, vital</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dispensable 可替代的；redundant, superfluous, surplus 多余的</div>
<h2>indoctrinate[sound:indoctrinate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">教育，灌输思想：</font>to instruct especially in fundamentals or rudiments</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]indoctrinate students with the notion of egalitarianism 向学生灌输平等主义的思想</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]educate, instruct, lesson, teach, train, tutor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]learn, study 学习</div>
<h2>indolent[sound:indolent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">懒惰的：</font>averse to activity, effort, or movement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sweltering afternoon made us indolent. 炎热的午后使我们懒散不愿行动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lazy, idle, shiftless, slothful, sluggish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diligent, industrious 勤奋的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]indolence n. 懒惰</div>
<h2>inducement[sound:inducement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">动机，刺激源：</font>a motive or consideration that leads one to action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]offered an expensive watch as an inducement to ratify the proposal 赠送名贵手表以求计划得到批准</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]goad, impulse, incentive, motive, spur, stimulus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deterrent  抑制物</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n.<font color="#aa00ff">劝说，游说：</font>the act of reasoning or pleading with someone to accept a belief or course of action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He gave up smoking only after a prolonged inducement by all the other family members. 在所有家庭成员坚持不懈的劝说之下，他终于愿意戒烟了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conversion, convincing, persuading, suasion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]induce    v. 导致，产生</div>
<h2>indulgent[sound:indulgent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（对己）放纵的，（对他人）纵容的：</font>showing, characterized by, or given to indulgence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]indulgent aristocrats 生活放纵的贵族</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decadent, forbearing, lenient, luxurious, tolerant, sybaritic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ascetic 禁欲的；draconian 严酷的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]indulgence n. 放纵</div>
<h2>indurate[sound:indurate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">铁石心肠的，冷酷无情的：</font>having or showing a lack of sympathy or tender feelings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an indurate heart that admits no love or mercy 一颗不认可爱或仁慈的冷酷心灵</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectless, callous, heartless, inhumane, merciless, obdurate, pitiless, ruthless, unsparing, cold-blooded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]charitable, compassionate, humane, kindhearted, merciful, tender 仁慈的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使变硬：</font>to become physically firm or solid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Great heat indurates clay. 高温使黏土变硬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]concrete, congeal, firm, freeze, set, solidify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]liquefy 液化；soften 柔化</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使习惯于：使习惯于，如艰苦或尴尬之境况：</font>to make able to withstand physical hardship, strain,or exposure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Such a brutal upbringing could only callous his soul and indurate his heart to the suffering of others.  这样一种残暴的培养方式只会让他的灵魂变得麻木，让他的心灵对于他人所受的折磨无动于衷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fortify, inure, season, steel, strengthen, toughen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enfeeble, weaken, undermine 弱化，使虚弱</div>
<h2>industrious[sound:industrious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">勤勉的：</font>constantly, regularly, or habitually occupied, diligent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The industrious PhD spends all his summer holiday in the laboratory. 勤奋的博士整个暑假都在做实验</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assiduous, busy, diligent, sedulous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]indolent, lazy, slothful 懒惰的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]industriousness n. 勤奋</div>
<h2>ineffable[sound:ineffable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难以表达的：</font>incapable of being expressed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]ineffable ecstasy 无法用语言表达的狂喜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indefinable, indescribable, inexpressible, unspeakable, unutterable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]communicable 可传达的；expressible 可描述的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ineffability n. 不可描述性</div>
<h2>ineluctable[sound:ineluctable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">无法逃避的，必然的：</font>not to be avoided, changed, or resisted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Although death is an ineluctable fate for any and every individual organism, it lays the foundation of the metabolism that perpetuates the planetary ecosystem. 尽管死亡对于任何单个的有机体而言是不可避免的宿命，但它奠定了能使整个行星生态系统永不衰竭的新陈代谢的基础</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]certain, inescapable, inevasible, inevitable, unavoidable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]avoidable, evadable 可避免的；uncertain, unsure （结果等）不确定的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ineluctability n. 不可避免</div>
<h2>inept[sound:inept.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">愚笨的，荒谬的：</font>displaying a lack of judgment, sense, or reason</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an inept and irresponsible remark on his paper 对他文章的荒谬而不负责任的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absurd, foolish, fatuous, preposterous, stupid, witless, unwise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]judicious, prudent sagacious, sapient, smart, wise  聪明的，明智的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">不恰当的，不合时宜的：</font>not appropriate for a particular occasion or situation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amiss, graceless, improper, inapposite, infelicitous, malapropos, perverse, unseemly, unsuitable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appropriate, becoming, felicitous, fitting, genteel, proper, seemly, suitable 恰当的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不称职的，无能力的：</font>generally incompetent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a hopelessly inept defense attorney 严重不靠谱的辩护律师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incapable, inexpert, unfitted, unskillful, unqualified</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]capable, competent 有能力的；proficient, masterful 精通的，技艺精湛的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ineptitude n. 不合适</div>
<h2>inert[sound:inert.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（人）懒惰缺乏活力的；（物品）惰性的：</font>sluggish in action or motion; deficient in active properties</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inert ingredients in drugs 药品中的惰性成分</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dead, dormant, lethargic, idle, inactive, passive, torpid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]active, dynamic 充满活力的；passionate 饱含激情的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inertia n. 惰性</div>
<h2>inevitable[sound:inevitable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不可避免的，必然的：</font>incapable of being avoided or evaded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The impact of the scandal on the election was inevitable. 丑闻对于选举的冲击是不可避免的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]certain, ineluctable, inescapable, inevasible, sure, unalterable, unavoidable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]evitable, avoidable 可避免的；uncertain, unsure 不确定的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inevitability n. 必然性</div>
<h2>inexorable[sound:inexorable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无法劝阻的，不为所动的：</font>not to be persuaded, moved, or stopped</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the seemingly inexorable rise in unemployment 看起来无法阻止其高攀的失业率</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inflexible, adamant, obdurate, relentless, rigid, unyielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flexible 易受影响的；yielding  屈服的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inexorably adv. 势不可挡地</div>
<h2>infamous[sound:infamous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">臭名昭著的：</font>having an extremely and deservedly bad reputation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an infamous city for smuggling and prostitution 因走私而和卖淫而臭名昭著的城市</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]notorious, opprobrious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]distinguished, esteemed, prestigious, reputable 声名显赫的，受尊敬的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]infamy n. 声名狼藉</div>
<h2>infatuate[sound:infatuate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使迷恋：</font>to inspire with unreasoning love or attachment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a naive girl infatuated by cajolery 被甜言蜜语冲昏头脑的天真女孩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allure, captivate, bewitch, enchant, fascinate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disgust 使反感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]infatuation n. 迷恋</div>
<h2>inferno[sound:inferno.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大火：</font>an intense fire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A raging inferno posed a serious threat to the downwind villages. 肆虐的大火给下风向的村庄带来了严重的威胁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conflagration, holocaust</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">地狱：</font>a place or a state that resembles or suggests hell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the inferno of war 地狱般的战场</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hell, underworld</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]paradise, heaven, nirvana 天堂，乐土</div>
<h2>infiltrate[sound:infiltrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">秘密潜入：</font>to  enter  or  take  up  positions  in  gradually  or  surreptitiously,  as  for  purposes  ofespionage or takeover</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The intelligence staff had been infiltrated by spies. 情报工作人员已经被间谍渗透了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]creep, insinuate, penetrate, sneak, slip</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abscond 潜逃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]infiltration n. 潜入，渗透</div>
<h2>infinite[sound:infinite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无尽的，无限的：</font>having no boundaries or limits</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the idea of an infinite universe 无限宇宙的概念</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]endless, boundless, limitless, immeasurable, unfathomable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]finite  有限的；bounded, circumscribed, confined, definite, limited, restricted 有界限的，受限的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]infinity n. 无限</div>
<h2>infirm[sound:infirm.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">虚弱的：</font>weak in body, especially from old age or disease</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]her aging, infirm husband 她上了年纪、身体虚弱的丈夫</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debilitated, effete, enervated, feeble, frail, languid, sapped, unsubstantial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hale, mighty, powerful, rugged, stalwart, stout, strong 强壮的，有力的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不果断的，优柔寡断的：</font>lacking firmness of will, character, or purpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She has little patience with the “infirm of purpose”. 她对那些优柔寡断的人没什么耐心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]faltering, irresolute, vacillating, wavering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resolute 果断的</div>
<h2>inflame[sound:inflame.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">点燃：</font>to set on fire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A carelessly tossed cigarette inflamed the papers in the trash can. 一只被随意丢弃的香烟点燃了垃圾桶中的纸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enflame, enkindle, fire, ignite, kindle, light, torch</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]douse, extinguish, quench, put out 熄灭，扑灭</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使加剧：</font>to make more violent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Retaliation served only to inflame the feud. 冤冤相报何时了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, enrage, exacerbate, intensify, ire, irritate, provoke, rile, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assuage, mitigate, mollify, pacify, placate, subdue  平息</div>
<h2>infelicitous[sound:infelicitous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不愉快的，不幸的：</font>not happy; unfortunate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an infelicitous moment  不幸的时刻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hapless, ill-fated, luckless, unfortunate, unhappy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]happy 幸运的，令人高兴的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不适当的，不合时宜的：</font>not appropriate or well-timed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]made a very infelicitous remark 做出极不恰当的评价</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inappropriate, indecorous, inept, malapropos, unfit, unseemly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apt, appropriate, becoming, proper 合适的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]infelicity n. 不恰当</div>
<h2>influx[sound:influx.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">涌入：</font>a coming in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They anticipated an influx of tourists next month. 他们预期下个月会有大批游客涌入</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affluence, flux, income, inflow, inpouring, inrush</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exodus 大批离去；outflow, outpouring  流出</div>
<h2>infuse[sound:infuse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">灌输，使…充满：</font>to fill or cause to be filled with something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]New members infused enthusiasm into the club. 新队员为俱乐部注入了激情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]endue, imbue, implant, ingrain, instill, permeate, suffuse, steep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extract 提取</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">鼓舞：</font>inspire, animate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sense of purpose that infuses scientific researchers 给科学研究者打鸡血一般的使命感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animate, exalt, motivate, stimulate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]infusion n. 注入</div>
<h2>infuriate[sound:infuriate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激怒：</font>to make furious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be infuriated by the deliberate insults 被蓄意的中伤激怒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, enrage, exasperate, incense, ire, madden, umbrage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, assuage, pacify, placate, propitiate 平息，安抚；delight, gratify, please  取悦，讨好</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]infuriated adj. 被激怒的</div>
<h2>ingenious[sound:ingenious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">聪明的，有创造才能的：</font>marked by originality, resourcefulness, and cleverness in conceptionor execution</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Ingenious designers soon came up with a solution to the battery problem. 聪明的设计者们很快便提出了电池问题的解决方案</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artful, clever, imaginative, innovative, inventive, original</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]awkward  笨拙的；uncreative, unimaginative 无创造力或想象力的</div>
<h2>ingenuity[sound:ingenuity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">独创性，创新性：</font>inventive skill or imagination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There is little ingenuity in his articles. 他的文章鲜有独创性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]creativeness, innovativeness, inventiveness, originality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]banality, cliché 陈词滥调</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ingenuous 真挚的</div>
<h2>ingenuous[sound:ingenuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">天真淳朴的：</font>lacking in cunning, guile, or worldliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Photographs captured the ingenuous smiles of young children at play. 摄影家捕捉到了演出中孩子们天真无邪的笑脸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artless, innocent, guileless, naive, simple, unaffected, unpretending, unsophisticated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artful, cunning, sly  狡猾的；assuming, hypocritical 虚伪做作的；sophisticated, worldly  世故的，老练的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">坦白的：</font>openly straightforward or frank</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]her ingenuous thirst for knowledge 她对知识毫不掩饰的渴望</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]candid, frank, open, plain, unconcealed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ambiguous, equivocal, evasive 含糊其辞的</div>
<h2>ingest[sound:ingest.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">摄入，咽下：</font>to take into the body by the mouth for digestion or absorption</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]claims that the average person ingests considerably more calories than is necessary or desirable 宣称每个人平均摄取的卡路里大大超出了所需或者适当的范围</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]eat, consume, devour, intake</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]evacuate, expel 排出；vomit  呕吐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ingestion n. 摄取</div>
<h2>ingrained[sound:ingrained.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">本质的，根深蒂固的：</font>forming a part of the essence or inmost being; firmly established</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]ingrained prejudice against foreigners 对外国人根深蒂固的偏见</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constitutional, immanent, inborn, indigenous, inherent, innate, intrinsic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adventitious 外来的，偶然的；extraneous, extrinsic 非本质的，外在的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ingrain 灌输，使根深蒂固</div>
<h2>ingratiating[sound:ingratiating.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">讨人喜欢的：</font>capable of winning favor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They adopted the orphan who had a most ingratiating smile. 他们收养了那名有着最惹人喜欢的笑容的孤儿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disarming, endearing, insinuating, winsome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disagreeable 令人厌恶的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">逢迎的，意在奉承的：</font>intended or adopted in order to gain favor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an repulsive ingratiating smile 令人反感的阿谀奉承的微笑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adulatory, deferential, fawning, flattering, toady</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ingratiate    v. 讨好</div>
<h2>inherent[sound:inherent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">内在的，本质的：</font>involved in the constitution or essential character of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a disposition inherent in human nature 人性内在的倾向</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constitutional, elemental, essential, inborn, ingrained, innate, intrinsic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adventitious 外来的，偶然的；extraneous, extrinsic 外在的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inherently adv. 内在地</div>
<h2>inimical[sound:inimical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">带有敌意的：</font>reflecting or indicating hostility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a cold, inimical voice 冰冷而不友好的声音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antagonistic, hostile, opposing, unfriendly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amiable, amicable, friendly, hospitable 友好的；amenable 服从的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">危及某人利益的，不利的：</font>opposed to one's interests</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Laws were  designed to enhance national security  but  some regard as inimical to cherished freedoms.法律旨在维护国家安全，但有人认为它危及了人们最为珍贵的权力——自由</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]counter, disadvantageous, negative, prejudicial, unfavorable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advantageous, favorable, positive, supportive, well-disposed 有利的，利好的</div>
<h2>inimitable[sound:inimitable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无法仿效的，独特的：</font>not capable of being imitated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]her own inimitable style 她特立独行的作风</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incomparable, matchless, peerless, unique, unparalleled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commonplace, ordinary 平凡的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inimitability n. 独特性</div>
<h2>iniquity[sound:iniquity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">邪恶，不公正：</font>gross immorality or injustice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The use of illegal narcotics is not only a destroyer of personal health but also an iniquity that underminesour society. 非法的毒品不仅仅摧残着个人健康，还是一颗危害社会的毒瘤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]corruption, depravity, debauchery, evil, infamy, sin, unfairness, wickedness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]integrity, rectitude 正直；virtue  美德；disinterestedness 公正</div>
<h2>initiate[sound:initiate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">创始，发动促进：</font>to cause or facilitate the beginning of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a chain reaction initiated by UV irradiation 紫外光激发引起的连锁反应</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]begin, start, commence, inaugurate, introduce, launch</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]terminate  终止</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">刚入门的新手：</font>a person who is undergoing or has undergone an initiation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprentice, beginner, novice, rookie, tyro</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]veteran 身经百战的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]initiative 主动性，首创精神</div>
<h2>inkling[sound:inkling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">轻微暗示，小提示：</font>a slight indication or suggestion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They hadn't given us an inkling of what was going to happen. 他们不给我们任何暗示将会发生什么</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clue, cue, hint</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">略知：</font>a slight knowledge or vague notion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]not have even the faintest inkling of what the project was all about  对这个项目与什么有关毫不知情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]glimmer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insight 深刻理解</div>
<h2>innocuous[sound:innocuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无害的：</font>producing no injury</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The government enacted a more strict regulation on innocuous preservatives. 政府对无害防腐剂制定了更为严格的规定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anodyne, benign, harmless, inoffensive, nontoxic, safe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]damaging, detrimental, harmful, injurious, noxious, pernicious 有害的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">乏味的，不会引起敌意的：</font>not likely to give offense or to arouse strong feelings or hostility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He made an innocuous remark to avoid conflict. 为了避免冲突，他做了一个中庸的评价</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bland, inoffensive, insipid, neutral, sapless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]provoking 刺激性的</div>
<h2>innovative[sound:innovative.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">创新性的：</font>characterized by, tending to, or introducing innovations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an innovative macro-economic strategy 创新性的宏观经济战略</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]creative, ingenious, inventive, original</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conservative, hidebound 保守的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]innovation n. 创新</div>
<h2>inquisitive[sound:inquisitive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过分好奇的：</font>inordinately or improperly curious about the affairs of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]big sunglasses to frustrate inquisitive journalists 让狗仔队企图无法得逞的大墨镜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]curious, inquiring, investigative, prying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]indifferent , unconcerned, uninterested 不感兴趣的；incurious 无好奇心的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inquisitiveness n. 好奇</div>
<h2>insensible[sound:insensible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无知觉的：</font>having lost consciousness, especially temporarily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The security guard was knocked insensible by a sudden blow. 保安被突如其来的一击敲晕了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anesthetic, insensate, senseless, unfeeling, unconscious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conscious 神志清醒的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">漠不关心的：</font>not emotionally responsive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]insensible to workers’ requests 对工人的要求无动于衷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apathetic, bloodless, callous, dull, impassive, indifferent, nonchalant, phlegmatic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concerned 关切的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗俗的，没品味的：</font>lacking in refinement or good taste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She married an insensible brute upon whom the niceties of life were completely lost.她嫁给了一个毫无品味的凡夫俗子，从此她的生活再无任何情趣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crass, crude, incult, lowbred, tasteless, uncouth, uncultivated, uncultured, unpolished, unrefined, vulgar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]civilized, cultivated, cultured, genteel, polished, refined, smooth, tasteful 有品位的</div>
<h2>insensitive[sound:insensitive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏机智圆滑的，缺乏社交技巧的：</font>lacking tact</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]so insensitive as to laugh at someone in pain  如此缺乏社交技巧以至于嘲笑处于悲痛中的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gauche, impolite, insensible, tactless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]considerate 为他人着想的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不敏感的，麻木的：</font>not responsive or susceptible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]insensitive to either criticism or commendation 对批评和表扬都不在乎</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anesthetized, dead, numb, senseless, unfeeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sensitive, tender 敏感的</div>
<h2>insentient[sound:insentient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无感觉，无知觉的：</font>lacking perception, consciousness, or animation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He refused to believe that the universe as we know it evolved from the random interactions of insentientparticles of matter. 他拒绝相信我们所知的宇宙是经由无生命的粒子间的相互作用演化而来的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impassive, insensate, insensible, senseless, unresponsive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]perceiving, sensible, sensitive 有知觉的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">一知半解的，略懂的：</font>not having or showing a deep understanding of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an insentient therapist who failed to see what the teenager's real problem was 一个对这名青少年的真正问题所在一知半解的医生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impercipient, unwise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discerning, insightful 深邃的，有洞察力的；  sagacious, sage, sapient  睿智的</div>
<h2>insight[sound:insight.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">深刻的理解：</font>an instance of apprehending the true nature of a thing, especially through intuitiveunderstanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an insight into the global-scale environmental problems 对于全球性环境问题的深刻理解</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discernment, insight, perception, sagacity, sapience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]glimmer, inkling 略懂，略知一二</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]insightful adj. 有洞察力的</div>
<h2>insipid[sound:insipid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（食品）清淡无味的：</font>lacking flavor or zest; not tasty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a rather insipid soup 味道清淡的汤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flat, flavorless, mild, sapless, savorless, tasteless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]piquant 辛辣的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平淡的，无聊的：</font>lacking in qualities that interest, stimulate, or challenge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an insipid story of the prince and the princess 一个关于王子和公主的无聊故事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banal, bland, driveling, prosaic, tedious, uninteresting, vapid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enchanting 引人入胜的</div>
<h2>insolent[sound:insolent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗野的，无礼的：</font>audaciously rude or disrespectful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an insolent child with no respect or regard for anyone 对他人不敬的无礼的小孩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arrogant, audacious, bold, haughty, supercilious, impertinent, impudent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]courteous, polite 有礼貌的；respectful 恭敬的；meek, mousy, timid 胆小的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]insolence n. 无礼</div>
<h2>insouciant[sound:insouciant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无忧虑的，不在乎的：</font>free from concern, worry, or anxiety</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an insouciant shrug 无所谓地耸耸肩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carefree, casual, indifferent, nonchalant, unconcerned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]anxious, careworn  焦虑的；concerned, worried 关注的，担心的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]insouciance n. 不在乎</div>
<h2>instate[sound:instate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">任命：</font>to set or establish in a rank or office</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new Secretary of the Treasury was instated on Monday. 新的财政部长于星期一被任命</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appoint, designate, inaugurate, induct, install, nominate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dismiss, oust 罢免</div>
