<h2>instigate[sound:instigate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">煽动，激起：</font>to goad or urge forward; to stir up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This incident is instigated by a small group of people with ulterior motives. 此次事件是被少数别有用心的人煽动起来的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abet, arouse, excite, foment, goad, incite, inflame, provoke, stir</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assuage, allay, mitigate, mollify, pacify, soothe 平息，缓和</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]instigation n. 煽动</div>
<h2>instill[sound:instill.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">慢慢滴入：</font>to cause to enter drop by drop</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]instill medication into the infected eye 将药物滴入患者受感染的眼中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inject</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extract 抽取</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">灌输：</font>to impart gradually</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]instill a sense of responsibility to the young 向年轻人灌输一种责任感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breed, enroot, implant, inculcate, infix, infuse, ingrain, plant, sow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]remove 移除</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]instillation n. 滴入</div>
<h2>institute[sound:institute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">创立，制定：</font>to establish, organize, and set in operation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]institute a new department 创建一个新的部门</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]begin, constitute, create, found, inaugurate, launch, start, set up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abrogate, efface, rescind 废除；close, shut 关闭；phase out  淘汰</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">机构：</font>an organization for the promotion of a cause</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a research institute 研究机构</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]association, institution, society</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]institution n. 习俗，制度</div>
<h2>insubordinate[sound:insubordinate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不服从权威的：</font>not submissiveto authority</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Insubordinate soldiers are court-martialed. 抗命的士兵被送上了军事法庭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balky, contumacious, intractable, mutinous, recalcitrant, rebellious, refractory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amenable, docile, obedient, ruly, submissive, tractable  顺从的</div>
<h2>insular[sound:insular.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（观念、想法等）孤立狭隘的：</font>being, having, or reflecting a narrow provincial viewpoint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the insular thinking of peasant communities 农民阶级的狭隘思想</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]confined, local, narrow, parochial, provincial, regional, restricted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cosmopolitan, ecumenical 有国际视野的；catholic （兴趣等）广泛的；receptive 善于接受的</div>
<h2>insulate[sound:insulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使绝缘，使隔离：</font>to place in a detached situation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]greenhouse gas that insulates ground infrared radiation 能阻碍地表红外辐射的温室气体</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]block, insolate, quarantine, seclude, segregate, separate, sequester</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]connect, link, unite 连结；integrate  使成一体</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]insulation n. 隔绝，绝热</div>
<h2>insurgent[sound:insurgent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">叛乱分子：</font>one who breaks with or opposes constituted authority or the established order</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Insurgents armed with assault rifles and grenades ambushed a US convoy, resulting in heavy casualties.持有突击步枪和手榴弹的叛乱分子偷袭了美军车队，造成重大伤亡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rebel, anarchist, antagonist, malcontent, mutineer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]insurgency n. 叛乱</div>
<h2>intangible[sound:intangible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无法感知的，无形的：</font>incapable of being perceived by the senses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]intangible value of a good reputation  良好声誉的无形价值</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impalpable, imperceptible, imponderable, inappreciable, indiscernible, insensible, invisible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]corporeal  肉体的，有形的；palpable, tactile, tangible, touchable 可感知的</div>
<h2>integral[sound:integral.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">构成整体所必需的：</font>essential to completeness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an integral part of the undergraduate curriculum 本科生课程的必修部分</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]critical, essential, indispensable, necessary, requisite, vital</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]redundant, superfluous, surplus  多余的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">完整的：</font>not lacking any part or member that properly belongs to it</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the belief that athletics are essential to an integral life 坚信运动是完整的人生所不可或缺的一部分</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comprehensive, entire, full, grand, intact, perfect, plenary, total, whole</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]imperfect, incomplete 不完美的，不完整的；partial 部分的</div>
<h2>integrity[sound:integrity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">正直：</font>steadfast adherence to a strict moral or ethical code, devotion to telling the truth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After  a  thorough  investigation  into  “Climategate”,  the  panel  concluded  that  the  integrity  of  scientificcommunity is still sound. 经过对“气候门事件”的彻底调查，专家组认为学术界的信誉和道德仍然是值得信赖的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conscience, honesty, incorruptibility, rectitude, righteousness, scrupulousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]baseness 卑鄙；deceit, deceitfulness, dishonesty, lying, mendacity, untruthfulness 欺骗</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">完整性：</font>the quality or condition of being whole or undivided</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]trying to maintain the integrity of the falling empire  尽力维持日趋西山的帝国的统一</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]completeness, entireness, perfection, wholeness</div>
<h2>intelligible[sound:intelligible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可理解的：</font>capable of being understood</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]military codenames intelligible only to those high-rank commanding officers 只有高级指挥官才能理解的军事暗号</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accessible, apprehensible, comprehensible, fathomable, lucid, understandable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abstruse, recondite, inscrutable, insensible 难以理解的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]intelligibility n. 可理解性</div>
<h2>intemperate[sound:intemperate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无节制的，极端的，不温和的：</font>not temperate or moderate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The tone of the article is very intemperate. 文章的论调很极端</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excessive, extreme, immoderate, inordinate, overindulgent, unrestrained</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]equable 温和的；bridled,  checked,  constrained,  controlled,  curbed,  governed,  hampered,  hindered, trammeled 受限制的，节制的</div>
<h2>intensify[sound:intensify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">加强，激化：</font>to make intense or more intensive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Both companies intensified their efforts to win the contract.  为了获得这份合同，两家公司都加大了投入</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accentuate, aggravate, amplify, deepen, enhance, magnify, redouble, strengthen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abate, assuage, attenuate, mitigate, moderate 减缓，减低（程度）</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]intensity n. 强度</div>
<h2>inter[sound:inter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">埋葬：</font>to place in a grave or tomb</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The infamous terrorist leader Bin Laden was interred at sea. 臭名昭著的恐怖分子本拉登被葬于海中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bury, entomb, inhume</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dig, disinter, excavate, exhume, unearth 掘出</div>
<h2>intercessor[sound:intercessor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">调停者：</font>one that mediates</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]attend the meeting as the intercessor 作为调停人出席会议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]broker, buffer, conciliator, intermediate, mediator, peacemaker</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flame-fanner 煽风点火的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]intercession n. 调停，斡旋</div>
<h2>interdict[sound:interdict.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">禁止：</font>to forbid in a usually formal or authoritative manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Though not interdicted by law, such an action is morally wrong. 尽管这种行为不被法律所禁止，但是道德上来说是不对的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ban, forbid, prohibit, proscribe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]authorize  授权；allow, permit, suffer  允许；approve, endorse, ratify, sanction 批准</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">阻止：</font>to stop, seize, or interrupt while in progress or on course</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Federal agents are able to interdict only a small percentage of the narcotic shipments into the country.联邦调查员们只能阻止一小部分流入国内的毒品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bar, block, check, hinder, intercept, impede, obstruct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]expedite 促进，加速</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]interdiction n. 禁止，封锁</div>
<h2>interim[sound:interim.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">中间过渡时期，间隔：</font>an interval of time between one event, process, or period and another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Richard Wagner’s operas usually require an interim of more than 30 minutes for performers to have abreak. 理查德·瓦格纳的歌剧通常需要长达30 多分钟的幕间休息时间以供演员调整</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breach, break, gap, interruption, interval, interlude, parenthesis</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continuation, continuity 持续</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">暂时的：</font>serving in a position for the time being</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an interim government to maintain social stability 维持社会稳定的临时政府</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acting, provisional, temporary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eternal, permanent 永恒的</div>
<h2>interlock[sound:interlock.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">连锁：</font>to become united or joined closely , as by hooking or dovetailing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The branches of the trees interlock to form a natural archway. 树枝相互缠绕在一起，形成了天然的拱门</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]associate, connect, join, link, unite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sunder 拆散</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]interlocking adj. 连锁的</div>
<h2>interminable[sound:interminable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无尽头的：</font>having or seeming to have no end</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A large audience fell asleep during the interminable sermon. 许多观众都在冗长的布道演说上睡着了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]continual, ceaseless, endless, everlasting, perpetual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]completed 完成的</div>
<h2>intermittent[sound:intermittent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">间歇的，断断续续的：</font>coming and going at intervals, not continuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]intermittent rain in June 六月里断断续续的梅雨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]episodic, erratic, occasional, periodical, recurrent, recurring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]constant, continuous, incessant, unceasing 持续不断的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不定期的：</font>lacking in steadiness or regularity of occurrence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The husband’s intermittent employment put the family in a difficult position financially. 丈夫不稳定的工作使得全家陷入了经济上的困境</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aperiodic, casual, catchy, discontinuous, irregular, occasional, spasmodic, sporadic, unsteady</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]habitual 习惯的，惯常的；periodic, regular, repeated  定期的，有规律的，重复的</div>
<h2>interregnum[sound:interregnum.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">过渡期：</font>break in continuity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The democratic regime proved to be a short-lived interregnum between dictatorships. 这个民主政权被证明只不过是两个独裁政权之间的短暂过渡罢了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breach, break, gap, interim, interruption, interval, interlude, parenthesis</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continuation, continuity  持续</div>
<h2>interrogate[sound:interrogate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">质问，审问：</font>to question formally and systematically</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]interrogate the prisoner of war for valuable intelligence  审问战俘以获取有价值的情报</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ask, grill, inquire, milk, question</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]answer, reply, respond  回答，回复</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]interrogation n. 审讯</div>
<h2>intimate[sound:intimate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有紧密联系的，亲密无间的：</font>marked by very close association, contact, or familiarity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]intimate friends since childhood  孩童时期以来的密友</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]familiar, close, confidential</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]distant, remote 疏远的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不为人知的：</font>not known or meant to be known by the general populace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They broke up after she shared intimate information with all 500 of her closest friends.  在她把那些不为人知的消息告诉了她500 个朋友之后，他们分手了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]confidential, esoteric, nonpublic, secret</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]open, public 公开的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">密友：</font>a person who has a strong liking for and trust in another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Usually quite aloof in public, he's actually quite relaxed with his intimates. 通常他在大众面前显得比较孤傲，但和好朋友在一起时他却是个很放松的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquaintance, amigo, comrade, confidant, friend, insider, mate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stranger 陌生人；enemy, foe 敌人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">迂回地交流，间接地沟通：</font>to communicate delicately and indirectly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]intimate a wish to leave 暗示想离开</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allude, connote, hint, imply, indicate, infer, suggest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]articulate  清晰明确地说</div>
<h2>intimidate[sound:intimidate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">威吓：</font>to make timid or fearful, frighten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]refused to be intimidated by the manager 对经理的恐吓不为所动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]browbeat, bully, coerce, cow, frighten, hector, terrify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blandish, cajole, coax 用花言巧语讨好</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]intimidation n. 恐吓</div>
<h2>intoxicant[sound:intoxicant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">使人陶醉的东西（尤指酒精饮料）：</font>an agent that intoxicates, especially an alcoholic beverage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alcohol, liquor, stimulant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]refresher  使人清醒的东西</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]intoxicating adj. 使人陶醉的</div>
<h2>intransigent[sound:intransigent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不妥协的，固执的：</font>characterized by refusal to compromise or to abandon an extreme position</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an intransigent attitude  不妥协的态度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant, headstrong, intractable, obstinate, pertinacious, stubborn, uncompromising, unyielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]compliant, pliable 易受影响的；tractable, yielding 容易驾驭的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]intransigence n. 顽固</div>
<h2>intrepid[sound:intrepid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无畏的：</font>characterized by resolute fearlessness, fortitude, and endurance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an intrepid explorer 无畏的探险家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, brave, bold, courageous, dauntless, fearless, gallant, valiant, valorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apprehensive  恐惧的；cowardly, craven, gutless, pusillanimous, timorous 怯懦的，胆小的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]intrepidity n. 无所畏惧</div>
<h2>intrigue[sound:intrigue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">阴谋：</font>a secret plan for accomplishing evil or unlawful ends</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The intrigue was quickly discovered, and the would-be assassins were arrested. 随着阴谋的迅速识破，未得手的刺客被逮捕了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conspiracy, design, intrigue, machination, scheme</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激起…的兴趣：</font>to arouse the interest, desire, or curiosity of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The children are apparently intrigued by the tale. 孩子们很明显被这个传奇故事吸引了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appeal, attract, enthrall, entice, excite, fascinate, interest, occupy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ennui, pall 使厌倦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]intriguing adj. 有趣的</div>
<h2>intrinsic[sound:intrinsic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固有的，内在的：</font>of or relating to the essential nature of a thing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the intrinsic worth of a gem  宝石的内在价值</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]congenial, constitutional, immanent, inborn, inherent, innate, native, natural</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adventitious, extraneous, extrinsic 外在的</div>
<h2>intuitive[sound:intuitive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">直觉的：</font>knowing or perceiving by intuition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The twins have an intuitive awareness of each other's feelings. 这对双胞胎天生就能感知彼此的感受</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]instinctive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquired 后天习得的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]intuition n. 直觉</div>
<h2>inundate[sound:inundate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">淹没：</font>to cover with or as if with flood</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inundated with trash e-mails 被垃圾邮件所淹没</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avalanche, deluge, drown, engulf, overflow, overwhelm, submerge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]drain 排空</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inundation n. 淹没</div>
<h2>inure[sound:inure.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使习惯接受不好的东西：</font>to accustom to accept something undesirable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]children inured to violence 习惯了暴力的孩子们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accustom, familiarize, habituate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inured adj. 习惯的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使坚强：</font>to make able to withstand physical hardship, strain, or exposure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The hardship of army training inured her to the rigors of desert warfare. 军营里的艰苦训练把她打造成了能适应沙漠艰苦战事的女兵</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fortify, indurate, season, steel, strengthen, toughen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enfeeble, soften, weaken, undermine 弱化，使虚弱</div>
<h2>invective[sound:invective.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">侮辱性的：</font>of, relating to, or characterized by insult or abuse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]invective comments on female activists 对女权主义者的侮辱性评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abusive, opprobrious, scurrile, scurrilous, truculent, vitriolic, vituperative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adulatory, flattery 阿谀奉承的；complimentary 称赞的</div>
<h2>inveigh[sound:inveigh.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">激烈抗议，表示强烈不满：</font>to protest or complain bitterly or vehemently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inveighed against the bank industry 对银行业表示强烈不满</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gripe, grouse, object, protest, remonstrate, repine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]support 支持；delight, rejoice  感到高兴</div>
<h2>inveigle[sound:inveigle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">诱骗：</font>to win over by coaxing, flattery, or artful talk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]inveigle consumers into buying the item 诱骗顾客购买商品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allure, bait, decoy, entice, entrap, seduce, tempt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demand 强求</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]inveigling adj. 诱骗性的</div>
<h2>inventory[sound:inventory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">存货清单：</font>a detailed, itemized  list, report, or record of things in one's possession, especially aperiodic survey of all goods and materials in stock</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The dealership has an unusually large inventory of pre-owned vehicles. 销售商手中有着一份巨大的二手车库存单</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]budget, pool, repertoire, reservoir, stock</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（写有要点的）简介：</font>a short statement of the main points</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They decided to offer the public an informative inventory of everything that is known about the virus at thistime. 他们决定向公众提供一份极富价值的报告，它涵盖了目前为止关于这种病毒的所有认识</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstract, brief, epitome, outline, résumé, summarization, synopsis</div>
<h2>inveterate[sound:inveterate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">积习的：</font>firmly established by long persistence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the inveterate tendency to overlook the obvious 总是忽视显而易见事物的习惯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chronic, entrenched, ingrained, rooted, settled, hard-cored</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adventitious 偶然的</div>
<h2>invidious[sound:invidious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">惹人反感的：</font>tending to cause discontent, animosity, or envy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the invidious task of arbitration 令人反感的仲裁任务</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abhorrent, detestable, obnoxious, odious, repugnant, repellent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agreeable, gratifying, pleasant 令人高兴的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">羡慕嫉妒恨的：</font>having or showing mean resentment of another's possessions or advantages</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Inevitably,  his  remarkable  success  attracted  the  invidious  attention  of  the  other  sales  representatives.不可避免地，他巨大的成功引来了其他销售代表羡慕嫉妒恨的眼光</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]covetous, envious, jaundiced, jealous, resentful , green-eyed</div>
<h2>invigorate[sound:invigorate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使精神，使强壮，鼓舞激励：</font>to impart vigor, strength, or vitality to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]news that invigorates the public  给大众打鸡血的新闻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animate, energize, fortify, reinforce, strengthen, vitalize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dampen, deaden, debilitate, emaciate, sap 使衰弱；demoralize 使士气衰落</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]invigorated adj. 精力充沛的</div>
<h2>invincible[sound:invincible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不可战胜的，不可超越的：</font>incapable of being conquered, overcome, or subdued</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The soccer team proved to be invincible.  这支球队证明了自己是不可战胜的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bulletproof, impregnable, invulnerable, unbeatable, unconquerable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conquerable 可被征服的；surmountable 可超越的；vulnerable  脆弱的，敏感的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]invincibility n. 无敌</div>
<h2>invoke[sound:invoke.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">实施：</font>to put into effect or operation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]New train timetable has been invoked. 新的火车时刻表已经生效</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enforce, effect, execute, implement, perform</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]suspend 暂停，搁置</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">产生，造成：</font>to be the cause of (a situation, action, or state of mind)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We should be prepared for the possibility that any solution may invoke another set of problems.  我们必须要为这样一种可能做好心理准备：任何解决方案都可能带来一系列新的问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beget, bring, catalyze, cause, create, engender, generate, induce, produce, result</div>
<h2>irascible[sound:irascible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易怒的：</font>marked by hot temper and easily provoked anger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new boss is so irascible that several employees have resigned. 由于新老板太容易发飙，许多员工已经递交了辞呈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choleric, irritable, peevish, petulant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]affable 和蔼的</div>
<h2>irate[sound:irate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极其愤怒的：</font>extremely angry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an irate taxpayer 极为愤怒的纳税人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravated, apoplectic, choleric, enraged, exasperated, infuriated, ireful, mad, wrathful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, halcyon  平静的；delighted, pleased 高兴的，满意的</div>
<h2>iridescent[sound:iridescent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">五颜六色的：</font>displaying a play of lustrous colors like those of the rainbow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an iridescent soap bubble 一个五颜六色的肥皂泡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]nacreous, opalescent, pearlescent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]monochromatic 单色的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]iridescence n. 五彩斑斓</div>
<h2>irk[sound:irk.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">令人烦恼的事物：</font>something that is a source of irritation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]One of the prof's major irks is a cell phone that rings during a lecture. 课堂上突然响起的手机铃声是最让教授火大的事情之一</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravation, bother, exasperation, frustration, headache, irritant, nuisance, vexation</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使烦恼，使厌倦：</font>to be irritating, wearisome, or vexing to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She irked her friends by chewing her gum loudly during the movie. 她因为看电影时嚼口香糖弄出声响而惹怒了她的朋友们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annoy, bother, fret, gall, provoke, ruffle, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, assuage, pacify, placate, propitiate, soothe 安抚，平息</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]irksome adj. 令人厌烦的</div>
<h2>ironclad[sound:ironclad.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常坚固的，坚不可摧的：</font>so firm or secure as to be unbreakable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pride on their ironclad fleet 对他们坚不可摧的舰队感到自豪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]firm, invulnerable, secure, sound, tenacious, tough</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fragile 脆弱的</div>
<h2>irradicable[sound:irradicable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不能根除的：</font>impossible to uproot or destroy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Smoking has become an irradicable bad habit for him.  吸烟已成了他不能根除的恶习</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]entrenched, ineradicable, ingrained, inveterate, rooted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eradicable 可根除的</div>
<h2>irreducible[sound:irreducible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（数）不可约分的：</font>incapable of being factored into polynomials of lower degree with coefficientsin some given field (as the rational numbers) or integral domain (as the integers)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]irreducible integrals 质数</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]factorable 可约分的</div>
<h2>irrigate[sound:irrigate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">灌溉：</font>to supply (dry land) with water by means of ditches, pipes, or streams; water artificially</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]irrigate crops periodically 定期灌溉农作物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]water</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">冲洗：</font>to flush (a body part) with a stream of liquid (as in removing a foreign body or medicating)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]irrigate the wound  冲洗伤口</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flush, rinse, wash</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]irrigation n. 灌溉</div>
<h2>irritate[sound:irritate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激，惹恼：</font>to provoke impatience, anger, or displeasure in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His rude interruptions really irritated her. 他粗鲁的打断激怒了她</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, annoy, exasperate, gall, inflame, nettle, peeve, provoke, rile, roil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, assuage, pacify, placate, propitiate, soothe 安抚，平息</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]irritant n. 刺激物</div>
<h2>issue[sound:issue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（有争议的）话题，议题：</font>a matter that is in dispute between two or more parties</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]focused on economic and political issues  重点关注经济和政治话题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]nut, problem, question</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">发布（期刊等）：</font>to produce and release for distribution in printed form</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]plans to issue a monthly newsletter 计划发布新闻月刊</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]print</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">流出：</font>to go, come, or flow out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]strange sound issued from the abandoned house 废弃房中传来的奇怪声音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discharge, emit, exude, release, vent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]withdraw  撤回</div>
<h2>jabber[sound:jabber.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">快而不清楚地说：</font>to talk rapidly, indistinctly, or unintelligibly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]monkeys jabbering at each other in their cages 在笼子里唧唧歪歪的猴子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]babble, blabber, drivel, gabble, gibber, jabber, mumbo jumbo</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]speak slowly 慢慢地说</div>
<h2>jaded[sound:jaded.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">疲惫的：</font>depleted in strength, energy, or freshness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After that long bar exam, I'm too jaded for anything but a nap. 律师资格考试结束后，我累得只想睡觉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drained, exhausted, fatigued, prostrate, spent, wearied, worn-out</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">厌倦的，没兴趣没热情的：</font>having one's patience, interest, or pleasure exhausted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Even jaded sci-fi fans are finding this new space adventure fresh and exciting. 即使是见多识广、口味很挑的科幻小说忠粉也觉得这次的太空探险非常新鲜有趣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bored, tired, wearied, fed up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbed, engaged, engrossed, interested, intrigued, rapt 有兴趣的</div>

<h2>jarring[sound:jarring.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">刺耳的：</font>harsh or discordant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the final chord of that song is too jarring for me 那首歌最后的合声部分太刺耳了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]astounding, blindsiding, jolting, startling, stunning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]melodious 音调优美的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">震惊的：</font>causing a strong emotional reaction because of unexpectedness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the jarring news that major financial institutions were on the verge of collapse  有消息称主要的几个金融机构处于倒闭的边缘，真是让人震惊</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amazing,  astonishing,  astounding,  blindsiding,  dumbfounding,  flabbergasting,  jaw-dropping,  jolting, shocking, startling, stunning</div>

<h2>jolt[sound:jolt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">突然移动：</font>to move or dislodge with a sudden, hard blow</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">惊吓：</font>to cause an unpleasant surprise for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sneak terrorist attack jolted the country out of its indolence and indifference. 偷偷摸摸的恐怖分子将该国从懒惰和冷漠无情中惊醒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appall, floor, shake up</div>
<h2>jot[sound:jot.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt .简要记录：to write briefly or hurriedly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]jot down an address 简要地记下地址</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]log, mark, put down, register, report, set down, take down, write down</div>
<h2>jovial[sound:jovial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">愉快的：</font>markedly good-humored especially as evidenced by jollity and conviviality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a jovial host 快活的主人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blithesome, festive, gay, gleeful, jocular, jocund, jolly, mirthful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lachrymose, saturnine 悲哀的；dour, dreary, morose, serious 阴郁的</div>
<h2>jubilant[sound:jubilant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">喜悦的：</font>exultingly joyful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The nominee delivered a jubilant speech before the cheering crowd.  在欢呼的人群面前，被提名人发表了充满喜悦的演说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exulting, glorying, rejoicing, triumphant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lachrymose, saturnine 悲哀的；dour, dreary, morose, serious 阴郁的</div>

<h2>knit[sound:knit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">编织（纱线）：</font>to form by interlacing yarn or thread in a series of connected loops with needles</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She knitted him a sweater for Christmas.  圣诞节她为他缝了一件毛衣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]braid, plait, weave</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ravel 解开</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">连接，联系：</font>to join closely ; unite securely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Sport knits the whole family close together. 体育将整个家庭紧紧地联系在一起</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bind, bond, combine, connect, fasten, join, link, meld, merge, tie, secure, unite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disassociate, disconnect, disjoin, divide, sever, split, sunder 分开</div>
<h2>knotty[sound:knotty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多结的，复杂的，困难的：</font>marked  by  or  full  of  knots  especially:  so  full  of  difficulties  andcomplications as to be likely to defy solution</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The candidates cautiously gave their views on an array of knotty issues. 候选人就一系列的困难问题谨慎地给出了自己的看法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baroque, byzantine, complicated, convoluted, intricate, involved, labyrinthine, sophisticated, tangled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easy, effortless, plain, simple 容易的，明显的</div>
<h2>kudos[sound:kudos.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">名望，名声：</font>fame and renown resulting from an act or achievement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Employees enjoy the kudos that the job brings as much as the financial rewards. 正如同喜欢工作带来的经济回报一样，雇员们也很享受工作所带来的名声和荣誉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]credit, distinction, homage, honor, laurels</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]infamy, notoriety 不好的名声</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">夸奖，赞扬：</font>acclaim or praise for exceptional achievement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The attorney did pro bono work because it was the right thing to do, and not for any future kudos that it might bring. 这名律师之所以为慈善机构和穷人所提供免费服务，是因为他觉得这是正确的事情，而非为了任何可能因此而产生的赞扬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acclaim, accolade, applause, credit, distinction, homage, honor, laud, laurels</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]belittlement, denigration, deprecation, derogation, diminishment, disparagement 贬损</div>
<h2>labile[sound:labile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易变的，不稳定的：</font>continually undergoing chemical, physical, or biological change; unstable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]labile mineral  不稳定的矿物质‖an emotionally labile person 一个多愁善感的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capricious, fluctuating, fluid, inconstant, mercurial, temperamental, unsettled, unsteady, variable, volatile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]constant, immutable, invariable, stable, stationary, steady 稳定的</div>
<h2>laborious[sound:laborious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">勤奋的：</font>hard-working; industrious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The volunteers have been commendably laborious in their cleanup of the beach. 清理海滩的志愿者们的勤奋努力值得赞扬‖He was gentle and kindly, living a laborious life in his Paris flat. 他是一个温柔、好心的人，住在巴黎的公寓里过着勤奋的生活</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]active, assiduous, bustling, diligent, engaged, industrious, occupied, sedulous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]idle, inactive, indolent, inert, slothful 懒散的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">费力的：</font>marked by or requiring long, hard work</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the laborious task of cleaning up the oil spill 清除泄露石油的艰苦工作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arduous, challenging, demanding, difficult, exacting, formidable, grueling, heavy, labored, rigorous, rough,rugged, severe, strenuous, sweaty, toilsome, tough</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easy, effortless, facile, light, mindless, simple, undemanding 轻松的，容易的</div>
<h2>labyrinthine[sound:labyrinthine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迷宫似的，复杂曲折的：</font>of, relating to, resembling, or constituting a labyrinth; extremely complexor tortuous in structure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The labyrinthine political situation of Middle East left us totally befuddled.  中东地区复杂迷离的政治局势让我们彻底迷惑了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baroque, byzantine, complicate, complicated, convoluted, intricate, involved, knotty, sophisticated, tangled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easy, effortless, plain, simple 容易的，明显的</div>

<h2>laconic[sound:laconic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">简洁（以至于显得粗鲁或难以理解）的：</font>using  or involving the use of a  minimum of words:concise to the point of seeming rude or mysterious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His mentor’s comment tends to be laconic but very much to the point. 他导师的点评很简短，但是却总能说到点子上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apothegmatic, brief, capsule, compact, compendious, curt, pithy, succinct, summary, telegraphic, terse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circuitous, circumlocutory, diffuse, prolix, rambling, verbose, windy, wordy 冗长的</div>
<h2>lachrymose[sound:lachrymose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">催人泪下的，悲伤的：</font>tending to cause tears, mournful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The lachrymose mourners at the funeral required a steady supply of tissues. 葬礼上多愁善感的哀悼者对纸巾提出了巨大的需求</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doleful, lamentable, lugubrious, melancholy, mournful, tearful, teary, weepy, woeful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cheerful, delighted, jocund, jovial  欢乐的，快乐的</div>
