<h2>lament[sound:lament.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">悼词：</font>a composition expressing one's grief over a loss</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]her lament for her grandmother 她为她祖母写的悼词</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dirge, elegy, requiem</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">抱怨：</font>an expression of dissatisfaction, pain, or resentment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the career woman's lament that there aren't any good men left 职场女性的抱怨：好男人都死光了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carp, complaint, fuss, grievance, gripe, grouch, grouse, grumble, moan, murmur</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">哀悼，表达痛苦或遗憾：</font>to express sorrow or regret; mourn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lament an innocent death 为无辜的死者而悲痛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bemoan, deplore, grieve, moan, mourn, wail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delight, exult, joy, rejoice 感到高兴</div>
<h2>lamentable[sound:lamentable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">值得惋惜的，悲哀的：</font>inspiring or deserving of lament or regret; deplorable or pitiable; mournful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The lamentable cries of the women for their lost sons were heard throughout the village. 女人们由于丧子之痛的哀嚎响彻整个山谷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deplorable, distressful, grievous, heartbreaking,, lugubrious, plaintive, plangent, sorrowful, woeful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cheerful, delighted, jocund, jovial  欢乐的，快乐的</div>
<h2>lampoon[sound:lampoon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n 讽刺：a harsh satire usually directed against an individual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a lampoon of the movie business at the time 对当时电影产业的一种讽刺</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burlesque, caricature, farce, mockery, parody, ridicule, spoof, travesty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eulogy, ode, paean 颂歌</div>
<h2>languid[sound:languid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">没精打采的，虚弱的：</font>lacking energy or vitality; weak</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be languid for weeks after surgery  术后的几周都无精打采的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debilitated, effete, enervated, feeble, frail, infirm, lackadaisical, spiritless, debilitated, sapped, enfeebled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]animated, energetic, vehement, vivacious 有精力的；mighty, powerful, stalwart, stout, strong  强壮的</div>
<h2>languish[sound:languish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">变得衰弱：</font>to be or become feeble, weak, or enervated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]languishing during the prolonged heat wave 在持续的热浪下变得虚弱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decay, droop, emaciate, fade, fail, flag, sag, wither</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]burgeon, flourish, thrive, prosper 旺盛生长</div>
<h2>languor[sound:languor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">懒惰：</font>physical or mental inertness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He enjoyed the languor brought on by a hot summer afternoon. 他很享受夏日午后的慵懒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collapse, exhaustion, frazzle, lassitude, listlessness, stupor, torpor, prostration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]verve, vim,animation,vitality 有活力</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">衰弱：</font>weakness or weariness of body or mind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The tropical heat sapped our strength, leaving us in a state of unaccustomed languor. 热带的炎热气候消磨着我们的力量，让我们感到一阵虚弱的不适</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debilitation, enervation, enfeeblement, fragility, infirmity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]robustness, strength, vivacity 强壮，有力</div>
<h2>lank[sound:lank.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">细长瘦弱的：</font>long, straight, and limp; not stiff in structure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a woman with long, lank hair 有着长而稀疏头发的女子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]emaciated, lean, slender, svelte, tenuous, thin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fat, fleshy, gross, obese 肥胖的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不僵硬的，柔软松弛的：</font>not stiff in structure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Right after a shower, her lank hair hung down to her shoulders. 刚出浴的她柔软的头发搭在她的肩上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]droopy, flaccid, floppy, lank, yielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inflexible, rigid, stiff, sturdy, tense 僵硬的；resilient  有弹性的</div>
<h2>lapse[sound:lapse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">小过失：</font>a slight error typically due to forgetfulness or inattention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a lapse in table manner 餐桌礼仪的小过错</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blunder, fumble, gaffe, miscue, oversight, peccadillo</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">结束，终止：</font>to come to an end</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The contract will lapse at the end of the year.  合同将于年底到期</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cease, conclude, die, end, expire, finish, stop, terminate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continue, persist, hang on 持续</div>
<h2>largesse[sound:largesse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">捐赠物：</font>something given to someone without expectation of a return</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The alumna's huge bequest was an unexpected largess. 校友们的巨额遗赠是一笔意料之外的财富</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bestowal, donation, giveaway, present</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">慷慨：</font>liberality in giving or willingness to give</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be noted for his largesse 因慷慨而闻名</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bountifulness, generosity, munificence, openhandedness, philanthropy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]miserliness, parsimony, penury, stinginess 小气</div>
<h2>lash[sound:lash.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">击打：</font>a hard strike with a part of the body or an instrument</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]suddenly felt the lash of her drunken husband's hand on her cheek 突然感觉到脸颊被醉酒的丈夫扇了一耳光</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bang, bash, bat, beat, clap, hit, knock, punch, slam, slap, smash, stinger, stroke, swat</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">猛击，撞击：</font>to strike against with force or violence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]All night long a barrage of rain lashed the windows. 倾盆大雨整夜敲击着窗户</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baste, hammer, lace, lambaste, punch</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">捆扎：</font>to bind with or as if with a line</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Secure the anchor by lashing it to the rail. 通过将锚绑在栏杆上使其稳固。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unbind 解开</div>
<h2>lassitude[sound:lassitude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">乏力，没精打采：</font>a state or feeling of weariness, diminished energy, or listlessness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Symptoms of anaemia include general fatigue and lassitude. 贫血的通常症状包括体虚和乏力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collapse, exhaustion, frazzle, languor, listlessness, stupor, torpor, prostration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]verve, vim,animation,vitality 有活力</div>
<h2>latent[sound:latent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">潜在的，不活跃的：</font>present or potential but not evident or active</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a latent infection 潜伏性传染病 ‖He  has  a  latent  talent  for  acting  that  he  hasn't  had  a  chance  toexpress yet.  他有着表演的天赋，只不过他还没有机会来表现这一才能</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dormant, fallow, inert, inoperative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apparent, evident, manifest, obvious, plain 明显的；active 活跃的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]latency n. 潜伏期</div>
<h2>latitude[sound:latitude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（行动或言论）自由：</font>freedom from normal restraints, limitations, or regulations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Students are allowed considerable latitude in choosing courses.  学生在选课时被给予相当大的自由度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]authorization, license, freedom, leeway, free hand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]limitation  限制；custody 监护，拘留</div>
<h2>laudatory[sound:laudatory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">表示赞扬的：</font>of, relating to, or expressing praise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a laudatory review of the new play 对新剧目的赞扬性的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adulatory, commendatory, complimentary, extolling, eulogistic, panegyric</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]derogatory, depreciatory, disparaging, pejorative 贬低的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]laudable adj. 值得赞扬的</div>
<h2>lavish[sound:lavish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">奢侈大量的：</font>characterized by or produced with extravagance and profusion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lavish buffet 奢侈的自助餐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]copious, exuberant, gushing, lush, luxuriant, opulent, profuse, riotous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]moderate, modest, reasonable, temperate 适度的，合理的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">挥霍，浪费：</font>to give readily and in large quantities; to use up carelessly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a great actor who lavished his talent in lousy movies 将才华浪费在低劣电影上的影星</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blow, dissipate, fritter, misspend, squander, waste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conserve  节约</div>
<h2>leaven[sound:leaven.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">用轻松、活泼或变更的影响力来充斥：</font>to mingle or permeate with some modifying, alleviating, orvivifying element</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He needs to leaven his speeches with more humor. 他需要在演讲中再加入点幽默元素。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]imbue, infuse, ingrain, inoculate, inspire, permeate, steep, suffuse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extract 抽取</div>
<h2>leer[sound:leer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">一瞥，斜眼看：</font>to cast a sidelong glance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He gave her a leering look.  他瞥了她一眼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]squint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gape, gaze, glare, goggle, stare  盯着看</div>
<h2>leery[sound:leery.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">怀疑的，不信任的：</font>suspicious or distrustful; wary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be leery of strangers 对陌生人的怀疑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dubious, distrustful, skeptical, suspicious, wary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]credulous 轻信的</div>
<h2>legacy[sound:legacy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">遗产：</font>something handed down from an ancestor or a predecessor or from the past</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the legacy of the ancient philosophers 古代哲学家们的思想遗产</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bequest, heritage, patrimony</div>
<h2>legend[sound:legend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">传奇，传说：</font>a popular myth of recent origin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some ancient civilizations had legends about spirits that inhabited trees and rocks. 许多古老的文明都有着关于寄居于树木、岩石之中的灵魂的传说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fable, myth, mythos</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">图例：</font>an explanatory list of the symbols on a map or chart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The legend in the science textbook indicated that the accompanying picture had been enlarged by 1000%.科学课本上彩图的图例告诉我们这幅图片被放大了十倍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cutline</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]legendary adj. 如传奇般闻名的</div>
<h2>legion[sound:legion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大量的人，（尤指）军团：</font>a large body of men and women organized for land warfare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]joined the French Foreign Legion 加入了法国外籍军团</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]army, battalion, flock, herd, horde, mob, swarm, throng</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大量的：</font>many, numerous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The problems are legion. 问题不计其数</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beaucoup, multifold, multitudinous, numerous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]few, lack in number 少量的</div>
<h2>lenient[sound:lenient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">宽大仁慈的：</font>inclined not to be harsh or strict; merciful, generous, or indulgent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the lenient sentences 仁慈的审判</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clement, gentle, merciful, mild, sparing, tender, tolerant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]harsh, merciless, severe, strict 残酷的，严厉的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]lenience n. 仁慈</div>
<h2>lethal[sound:lethal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常有害的，致命的：</font>extremely harmful; devastating</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This dagger is lethal. 这把匕首是致命的武器‖launched a lethal attack  发动了致命的进攻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baleful, deadly, deathly, fatal, mortal, murderous, pestilent, terminal, vital</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]innocuous 无害的；  healthy, salubrious, wholesome 有益健康的</div>
<h2>lethargic[sound:lethargic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">没精打采的，行动迟缓的：</font>of, relating to, or characterized by lethargy, sluggish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a big nice meal always makes me feel lethargic and sleepy  一顿大餐吃完总是让我既慵懒又想睡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dull, inert, quiescent, sluggish, torpid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dynamic, energetic, robust, vigorous  有精力的；active  活跃的</div>
<h2>levelheaded[sound:levelheaded.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">明智的：</font>characteristically self-composed and sensible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a levelheaded assessment of the problem 对于问题的一个明智的评估</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]informed, justified,  logical, rational, reasonable, sensible, sober, valid, well-founded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]foolish 愚蠢的；groundless, invalid, unfounded, unjustified, unsound 没有根据的，理由不充分的</div>
<h2>levity[sound:levity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">轻浮：</font>excessive or unseemly frivolity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The teachers disapprove of any displays of levity during school assemblies. 老师们不允许学生在学校聚会过程中表现出任何轻浮的态度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]facetiousness, flightiness, flippancy, frivolousness, frothiness, silliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]earnestness, gravity, seriousness, soberness, solemnity 严肃</div>
<h2>liability[sound:liability.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">责任：</font>the quality or state of being liable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The company is trying to reduce its liability in this case. 在这个案件中，公司试图减少他们的责任</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accountability, answerability, responsibility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]immunity  豁免权</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">障碍，不利条件：</font>a feature of someone or something that creates difficulty for achieving success</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their chief asset has now become a considerable liability. 他们最大的优点如今已成了不可小觑的负担</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burden, debit, drawback, handicap, hurdle, incommodity, manacle, saddle, trammel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advantage, asset, edge, plus 优点，优势</div>
<h2>liberal[sound:liberal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">思想前卫的：</font>not bound by traditional ways or beliefs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]parents who take a very liberal attitude toward letting their children stay out late 思想开放，同意让他们的小孩晚归的家长们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]nonconventional, nonorthodox, nontraditional, open-minded, progressive, radical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conservative, conventional, hidebound, old-fashioned, stodgy, traditional  守旧的，传统的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">慷慨的，大方的：</font>marked by generosity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a doctor who has been very liberal in dispensing low-cost care to patients who could not otherwise afford it一个慷慨的医生，愿意帮助无法支付低额药费的病人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charitable, munificent, unselfish, unsparing, unstinting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]closefisted, miserly, niggardly, parsimonious, stingy, tightfisted 吝啬的</div>
<h2>libertine[sound:libertine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">放荡不羁者：</font>one who acts without moral restraint; a dissolute person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The legend of Don Juan depicts him as a playboy and libertine.  有关唐璜的传说把他描绘成一个放荡不羁的花花公子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backslider, debaucher, decadent, deviate, pervert, profligate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ascetic 禁欲者</div>
<h2>licentious[sound:licentious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">放荡的，性欲强的：</font>lacking legal or moral restraints ; having a strong sexual desire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a  moralist  who  decried  what  she  regarded  as  the  licentious  and  corrupt  culture  of  the  entertainmentindustry  一个公开谴责在她看来无比堕落和放荡的娱乐圈文化的道德家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]concupiscent, horny, lascivious, lecherous, libidinous, lubricious, salacious, wanton</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]frigid, undersex 性冷淡的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]licentiousness n. 放荡</div>
<h2>liken[sound:liken.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">显示相似，比较：</font>to see, mention, or show as similar; compare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Life is often likened to a journey. 生活经常被比作一次旅行</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]analogize, bracket, equate, equalize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contrast 对比，对照以产生反差</div>
<h2>limber[sound:limber.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可塑的，柔软的：</font>capable of being shaped: flexible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She shaped the basket out of limber branches. 她用柔软的树枝编了一个筐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flexible, lissome, lithesome, pliable, pliant, supple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inflexible, rigid, stiff, stiffened 僵硬的</div>
<h2>limp[sound:limp.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">柔软的，松散的：</font>lacking firm texture, substance, or structure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her hair hung limp about her shoulders. 她的头发软沓沓地垂在肩上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]droopy, flaccid, floppy, lank, yielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]firm, stiff, sturdy, tense  坚硬的；resilient  有弹性的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">软弱的，没有精神的：</font>lacking strength or firmness; weak or spiritless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The team's limp performance has many people calling for the head coach's resignation. 队伍不给力的表现让许多人呼吁教练下课</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enervated, lackadaisical, languid, languishing, languorous, spiritless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ambitious, enterprising  有雄心壮志的；  animated, energetic, motivated 精力充沛的，有积极性的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">跛行，艰难地行走：</font>to move or proceed haltingly or unsteadily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]The project limped along with half its previous funding. 项目靠着之前一半的资金艰难地进展</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blunder, bumble, lumber, plod, struggle, stumble, trudge</div>
<h2>limpid[sound:limpid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">透明清澈的：</font>characterized by transparent clearness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]limpid streams 清澈的小溪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crystal, clear, lucent, pellucid, transparent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cloudy, murky, opaque, unclear, turbid 模糊不清的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">镇定的，淡定的：</font>free from emotional or mental agitation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the limpid outlook of a man who is at peace with himself as he awaits death 一个人在平静等待死亡的过程当中所体现出来的淡然的世界观</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collected, composed, cool, level, peaceful, placid, possessed, sedate, serene, smooth, tranquil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitated, discomposed, disturbed, flustered, perturbed  焦躁的</div>
<h2>linger[sound:linger.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">磨蹭，闲荡：</font>to proceed slowly; saunter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fans lingered outside the door 粉丝们在门外徘徊</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crawl, creep, dally, dawdle, lag, loiter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hurry, run, rush 飞奔</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]lingering adj. 闲荡的</div>
<h2>lissome[sound:lissome.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">柔软的：</font>easily bent; supple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Rattan is such a lissome material that it can be used for all manner of furniture and baskets. 藤是一种非常柔软而有韧性的材料，因此可以被用于形形色色的家具和篮子之中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flexible, limber, lithe, pliable, pliant, supple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]solid  坚硬的；inflexible, rigid, stiff, stiffened 僵硬的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">敏捷的，轻盈的：</font>having the ability to move with ease; limber</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a lissome ballerina 身姿矫捷的女芭蕾舞演员</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agile, featly, feline, gracile, lithesome, nimble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]awkward, clumsy, graceless, ungainly 笨拙的</div>
<h2>list[sound:list.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">倾斜：</font>to set or cause to be at an angle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sudden lift of the load on the deck listed the ship badly.  甲板上货物被突然提起，船陡然倾斜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]angle, cant, heel, incline, pitch, slant, slope, tilt, tip</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]erect 竖立</div>
<h2>lithe[sound:lithe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">敏捷的，轻盈的：</font>characterized by easy flexibility and grace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lithe dancers 灵活优雅的舞者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agile, featly, feline, gracile, lightsome, nimble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]awkward, clumsy, graceless, ungainly 笨拙的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">柔软的：</font>easily bent or flexed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lithe branches 柔软的枝条</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flexible, limber, lithe, pliable, pliant, supple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]solid  坚硬的；inflexible, rigid, stiff, stiffened 僵硬的</div>
<h2>loath[sound:loath.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不情愿的，讨厌的：</font>unwilling or reluctant; disinclined</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I was loath to accept the fact that he had been killed in a terrorist attack. 我很不情愿地接受了他在一场恐怖袭击中丧生的事实</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disinclined, indisposed, reluctant, reticent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eager 渴望的；disposed, inclined 有意向的</div>
<h2>loathe[sound:loathe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">厌恶：</font>to dislike someone or something greatly; abhor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I loathe having to do this. 我鄙视不得不这样做。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abhor, abominate, despise, detest, execrate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adore, love 热爱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]loathsome adj. 令人讨厌的</div>
<h2>lofty[sound:lofty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">崇高的：</font>elevated in character and spirit, noble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lofty ideals 崇高的理想</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chivalrous, elevated, greathearted, high-minded, magnanimous, sublime</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]base, debased, ignominious, mean 可耻的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">高的：</font>rising to a great height</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lofty mountains  高耸的山峰‖the ever-increasing lofty heights of the world's skyscrapers 不断攀升的摩天大楼的高度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]altitudinous, tall, towering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]low 低的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">自大的：</font>having a feeling of superiority that shows itself in an overbearing attitude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She acts all lofty and superior just because she went to Stanford University. 她之所以表现得这么自大和不可一世，只因为她考进了斯坦福</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assumptive, bumptious, haughty, lordly, peremptory, pompous, presumptuous, supercilious, superior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humble, lowly, modest 谦逊的，低调的</div>
<h2>loll[sound:loll.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">懒洋洋地行动：</font>to act or move in a lax, lazy, or indolent manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He lolled back in his comfortable chair. 他懒洋洋地倚在他舒适的椅子上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]slouch, lounge</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">偷懒，打发时间：</font>to spend time doing nothing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some members of the decorating committee were hard at work, and others were just lolling about. 装修队的一部分人在很努力的工作，另一些则在偷懒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dally, dawdle, drone, laze</div>
<h2>lopsided[sound:lopsided.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">歪的，倾斜的：</font>leaning to one side</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The portrait in the foyer was lopsided. 门厅里的画像挂歪了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]askew, aslant, crazy, listing, oblique, pitched, skewed, slanted, tipping, uneven</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]even, level, straight 平的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">不平衡的，不协调的：</font>lacking in balance, symmetry, or proportion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The arrangement of the furniture was lopsided. 家具的摆放太不协调了‖a lopsided score of 4-0 四比零的压倒比分</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asymmetric, disproportional, irregular, off-balance, unbalanced, unequal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]balanced  平衡的；symmetrical 对称的</div>
<h2>loquacious[sound:loquacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">话多的：</font>given to fluent or excessive talk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Sometimes the loquacious talk show host barely lets her guests get a word in. 有时候多话的脱口秀主持人让她的客人一句话都插不进来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chatty, conservational, gabby, garrulous, talkative, voluble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]laconic, reserved, reticent, taciturn, uncommunicative 话少的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]loquaciousness, loquacity n.话多</div>
<h2>loutish[sound:loutish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗鲁的：</font>having the characteristics of a lout; awkward, stupid, and boorish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a boy with a loutish air  一个举止粗鲁的男孩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boorish, churlish, clumsy, crude, discourteous, uncouth, uncivilized, uncultured, unrefined</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]courteous, civilized, genteel, graceful, polished, refined, urbane 有教养的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]lout n. 举止粗鲁的人</div>
<h2>lubricate[sound:lubricate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使润滑：</font>to coat (something) with a slippery substance in order to reduce friction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lubricate the gears 给齿轮打润滑油</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grease, oil, slick, smooth, wax</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]lubricant n.润滑剂</div>
<h2>lucid[sound:lucid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有光亮的：</font>suffused with light</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Those lucid bands that spread across the arctic sky are known as aurora borealis, or the northern lights.那些蔓延在北极的天空中光带就是北极光</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beaming, brilliant, dazzling, glowing, incandescent, lucent, luminous, lustrous, radiant, refulgent, splendid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dim, dull, lackluster 黯淡无光的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">神志清醒的：</font>having full use of one's mind and control over one's actions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]decided to make out her will while she was still lucid 决定趁着她神志还清醒，列出她的遗愿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balanced, clearheaded, normal, right, sane, stable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brainsick, crazy, insane, lunatic, mad, maniac  疯狂的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">表达清晰的,  简单易懂的：</font>easily understood</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The  teaching  assistant  tried  to  make  his  instructions  as  lucid  as  possible  so  that  everyone  wouldunderstand what to do. 助教努力使自己的指令容易理解，从而让所有人都知道应该要干什么</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprehensible, clear, comprehensible, intelligible, palpable, patent, pellucid, plain, understandable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ambiguous, enigmatic, equivocal, indistinct, obfuscated, obscure, unclear 模糊不明确的</div>
<h2>lug[sound:lug.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">拖动，拉动：</font>to cause to follow by applying steady force on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lugged the lawn mower out into the backyard  把割草机拖进院子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drag, draw, hale, pull, tow, tug</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]drive, propel, push 推动</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">费力搬运：</font>to carry laboriously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I don't understand why he's always lugging  all of his books around when his locker is right over there.我真搞不懂为什么他总是明明在有锁柜的情况下还随身扛着所有的书</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bear, cart, convey, ferry, haul, lug, pack, tote, transport</div>
<h2>lugubrious[sound:lugubrious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（故作夸张的）悲哀的：</font>mournful, dismal, or gloomy, especially to an exaggerated or ludicrousdegree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his lugubrious tear-stained face 他忧郁而带着泪痕的脸庞</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deploring, doleful, dolorous, lamentable, melancholy, morose, plaintive, rueful, saturnine, sullen, woeful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cheerful, delighted, jocund, jovia l  快乐的</div>
<h2>lull[sound:lull.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">相对平静时期，间隙：</font>a momentary halt in an activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the lull before the storm 暴风雨前的平静</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]break, breath, interruption, recess</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使镇静，使安心：</font>to free from distress or disturbance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The absence of attacks for such an extended period had lulled the nation into a false sense of security.长期以来没有遭受攻击让这个国家产生了一种错误的安全感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allay, balm, becalm, compose, lullaby, quiet, salve, settle, soothe, still, tranquilize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitate, discompose, disquiet, disturb, perturb, upset, vex 打扰，扰乱</div>
<h2>lullaby[sound:lullaby.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">催眠曲：</font>a song to quiet children or lull them to sleep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]sang a lullaby to the baby every night 每晚都给孩子唱摇篮曲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]berceuse, cradlesong</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使镇静，使安心：</font>to free from distress or disturbance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]reclining peacefully on the deck, lullabied by the gentle motion of the ship 躺卧在甲板上，随着船轻轻的颠簸放松下来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allay, balm, becalm, compose, lull, quiet, salve, settle, soothe, still, tranquilize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitate, discompose, disquiet, disturb, perturb, upset, vex 打扰，扰乱</div>
<h2>lumber[sound:lumber.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">木材：</font>tree logs as prepared for human use</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A huge amount of lumber will be needed to build the house. 建这栋房子需要大量的木材</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]timber, wood</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">笨拙地行动：</font>to walk or move with heavy clumsiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The elephant lumbered through the jungle. 大象缓缓地穿越丛林</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flounder, plod, stumble, trudge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]glide, slide 轻松地滑动</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">使负担（从而拖累）：</font>to place a weight or burden on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lumber the expedition with unnecessary equipment and supplies 不必要的仪器和补给品给此次远征徒增了许多负担</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burden, encumber, freight, lade, laden, saddle, weight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disburden, discharge, disencumber, unlade, unload 卸下，解脱</div>

<h2>lush[sound:lush.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">茂盛的：</font>growing vigorously especially with luxuriant foliage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lush grass 茂盛的草</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]booming, exuberant, flourishing, lively, luxuriant, rampant, thriving, verdant, vivacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blighted, faded, sere, withered 干枯的，凋谢的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多产的：</font>producing abundantly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His lush fields were the envy of neighboring farmers. 他富饶多产的土地让邻居羡慕嫉妒恨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cornucopian, fecund, fruitful, productive, prolific, rich</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]barren, dead, infertile, sterile, unproductive 贫瘠的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（声音、味道）优美的，令人愉悦的：</font>appealing to the senses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the lush sounds of the orchestra 管弦乐队奏出的悦耳声音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambrosial, luscious, palatable, savory, sensuous, tasteful, tasty, voluptuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flat, flavorless, insipid, stale, tasteless 乏味的</div>

<h2>luxurious[sound:luxurious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">豪华的：</font>showing obvious signs of wealth and comfort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The luxurious apartment was filled with the latest electronic gadgets and fine works of art . 豪华的公寓里充斥着最新式的电子产品和精美的艺术作品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deluxe, lavish, luxuriant, luxury, opulent, palatial, plushy, silken, sumptuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ascetic, austere, spartan 简朴的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">奢侈的：</font>given to or marked by excessive gratification of one's desires</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]squandered his family fortune in the relentless satisfaction of his luxurious tastes 为满足他奢侈的品味而挥霍家族的财产</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decadent, indulgent, overindulgent, self-indulgent, sybaritic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abstemious, abstinent 克制的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]luxury n. 豪华；奢侈，奢侈品</div>
<h2>lyric[sound:lyric.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（可以哼唱的）小曲：</font>a short musical composition for the human voice often with instrumentalaccompaniment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The guitarist improvised and sang a gentle lyric while playing. 吉他手在弹奏的过程中即兴创作并哼唱了一首小曲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ballad, ditty, jingle, vocal</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">如诗歌般流畅甜美的：</font>having a pleasantly flowing quality suggestive of poetry or music</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The film's lyric photography really enhanced its romantic mood. 电影中如诗歌般的图像效果着实增强了浪漫的氛围</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]euphonious, lyrical, mellifluous, mellow, melodious, musical, poetical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]prosaic, prose 无聊乏味的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]lyrics n. 歌词</div>
<h2>macabre[sound:macabre.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">恐怖的：</font>suggesting the horror of death and decay; gruesome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Impressively, Plants vs. Zombies presented a supposedly macabre themeinsuch anenjoyableway. 令人难忘的是，《植物大战僵尸》将一个本应该十分恐怖的主题用一种如此欢乐的方式呈现出来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appalling, atrocious, dreadful, ghastly, gruesome, hideous, horrific, nightmarish, terrific</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agreeable, delightful, enjoyable, pleasant 令人愉悦的</div>

<h2>maelstrom[sound:maelstrom.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">漩涡：</font>a powerful often violent whirlpool sucking in objects within a given radius</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their raft got caught in a maelstrom.  他们的筏被一个漩涡卷住了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gulf, vortex, whirlpool</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">混乱、动荡的局势：</font>a violent or turbulent situation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the maelstrom of war 战争带来的乱世</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chaos, disorder, pandemonium, tulmult, turmoil, upheaval, uproar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm  风平浪静</div>

<h2>malaise[sound:malaise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不舒服：</font>a vague feeling of bodily discomfort, as at the beginning of an illness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He complained of depression, headaches and malaise. 他抱怨说感到沮丧、头痛和身体不适</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debility, decrepitude, disease, feebleness, infirmity, infirmness, sickliness, unhealthiness</div>
<h2>malcontent[sound:malcontent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不满分子：</font>one who is in active opposition to an established order or government</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The chaos was caused by a handful of malcontents. 混乱是由一小撮不满分子引起的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]complainer, faultfinder, grouch, rebel</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不满的：</font>dissatisfied with the existing state of affairs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The film follows three malcontent teenagers around Paris. 电影围绕着三个不满现实的青少年在巴黎展开</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discontented, discontent, disgruntled, displeased, dissatisfied, ungratified</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contented, fulfilled, gratified, pleased, satisfied 满意的</div>
<h2>malicious[sound:malicious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">恶意的：</font>given to, marked by, or arising from malice; deliberately harmful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]spread malicious gossips 散播恶意的流言蜚语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bad, cruel, despiteful, evil, malevolent, malign, mean, nasty, spiteful, vicious, virulent, wicked</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benevolent, benign, benignant, charitable, kind, kindly 善良的，仁慈的</div>
<h2>malign[sound:malign.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">恶意的：</font>having or showing a desire to cause someone pain or suffering for the sheer enjoymentof it</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Both parties to the divorce showed a malign desire to make each other's future life utterly miserable. 离婚双方都表露出了恶毒的愿望，希望对方未来的生活陷入彻底的悲剧之中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bad, cruel, despiteful, evil, malevolent, malicious, mean, nasty, spiteful, vicious, virulent, wicked</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benevolent, benign, benignant, charitable, kind, kindly 善良的，仁慈的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">诽谤：</font>to utter injuriously misleading or false reports about: speak evil of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the belief that it is possible to win an election without maligning anyone 一种信念，那就是要赢得一场选举就不得不诽谤他人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asperse, blacken, calumniate, defame, libel, smear, traduce, vilify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acclaim, applaud, eulogize, extol, laud, praise  赞美；defend, vindicate 辩护</div>
<h2>malinger[sound:malinger.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">装病以逃避工作：</font>to pretend or exaggerate incapacity or illness (as to avoid duty or work)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He claims he's ill, but I think he's just malingering.  他声称他病了，但我觉得他是装的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]goldbrick, shirk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confront, face, meet 面对</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]malingerer n. 装病以逃避工作的人</div>
<h2>malleable[sound:malleable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可塑的：</font>capable of being extended or shaped by beating with a hammer or by the pressure ofrollers</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a malleable metal 有延展性的金属</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]moldable, waxy</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易控制的：</font>capable of being altered or controlled by outside forces or influences</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The cult leader took advantage of the malleable, compliant personalities of his followers. 这个头目利用了他的信徒们容易被控制和顺从的特征</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ductile, elastic, fluid, modifiable, plastic, pliable, pliant, supple, variable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adamant, intractable, recalcitrant, refractory, ungovernable, unmanageable, unruly 难管制的</div>
<h2>malodorous[sound:malodorous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">恶臭的：</font>having an unpleasant smell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]American musteline will eject amalodorous fluid when startled. 美洲鼬科动物受惊吓时会喷出有恶臭味的液体</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fetid, foul, frowsy, funky, fusty, musty, noisome, rank, reeky, smelly, stinking, stinky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ambrosial, aromatic, fragrant, perfumed, redolent, savory, scented, sweet 芳香的，有香味的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]malodorn. 恶臭</div>
<h2>mandatory[sound:mandatory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">强制的：</font>forcing one's compliance or participation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]GRE test is  mandatory for all students, regardless of their nationality, who wish  to  apply for  graduateschools in the United States. GRE 是每个申请美国研究生院的学生（无论国籍）所必须参加的考试</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compulsory, forced, imperative, incumbent, involuntary, necessary, obligatory, peremptory, required</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elective, optional, voluntary  可自由选择的，选修的</div>
<h2>mangle[sound:mangle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">损毁，使伤残：</font>to injure with deep disfiguring wounds by cutting, tearing, or crushing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His body was mangled beyond recognition. 他的尸体已经被损毁到无法辨认的程度了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]batter, deform, disfigure, distort, lacerate, mutilate, rend, wreck</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cure, heal, rehabilitate 治愈，康复</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">弄砸：</font>to ruin or spoil through ineptitude or ignorance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The orchestra had completely mangled Bach’s music. 乐队彻底演砸了巴赫的音乐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blow, bumble, bungle, butcher, fumble , mar, mess, ruin, foul up, screw up</div>
<h2>mangy[sound:mangy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">卑劣的：</font>mean; contemptible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mangy trick  卑鄙的手段</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]base, contemptible, debased, despicable, detestable, execrable, mean, sordid, squalid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lofty, noble, upright, venerable, virtuous 正直的，有道德的</div>
<h2>mania[sound:mania.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">热衷，狂热：</font>an excessively intense enthusiasm, interest, or desire; a craze</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mania for neatness 强烈的洁癖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardor, craze, enthusiasm, fervor, obsession, passion, preoccupation, prepossession, zeal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathy, indifference, nonchalance, torpor  冷漠，麻木</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]manic adj.疯狂的</div>
<h2>manifest[sound:manifest.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">显然的，明显易懂的：</font>clearly apparent to the sight or understanding; obvious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is a manifest poseur. 他显然是个装模作样的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apparent, clear, distinct, evident, lucid, obvious, palpable, patent, perspicuous, plain, transparent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cryptic, enigmatic, indistinct, mysterious, obfuscated, obscure, unclear 晦涩的，难懂的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">显现，显露：</font>to make evident or certain by showing or displaying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His frustration is often manifested by a minor facial tic.  他的沮丧通常会从脸部的细微抽搐中表现出来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bespeak, betray, demonstrate, display, evince, expose, reveal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conceal, hide 隐藏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]manifesto n. 宣言，声明</div>
<h2>manipulate[sound:manipulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">巧妙操作：</font>to move, arrange, operate, or control by the hands or by mechanical means, especiallyin a skillful manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]manipulate a foreign language 熟练地掌握外语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]handle, finesse, manage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bungle, fumble 笨拙地做</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">暗中操控：</font>to influence or manage shrewdly or deviously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He manipulated public opinion in his favor. 他巧妙地将大众观点导向了有利于他的一边</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]machinate, maneuver</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]manipulation n.操纵，控制</div>
<h2>mannered[sound:mannered.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不自然的，做作的：</font>having an artificial or stilted character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mannered speech  做作的演讲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affected, artificial, assumed, factitious, fake, feigned, pretended, pseudo, sham, spurious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]natural 自然的；artless, genuine, unfeigned 真诚的</div>
<h2>manumit[sound:manumit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">解放（奴隶）：</font>to release from slavery or bondage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Though he was an outspoken defender of liberty, this son of Virginia did not manumit his own slaves untilhe was on his deathbed. 尽管这位维吉尼亚之子公开地支持自由，但他直到临死才释放自己的奴隶</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]free, emancipate, enfranchise, liberate, loose, release, unbind, unchain, unshackle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]detain 拘留；enchain, enfetter, enslave 奴役</div>
<h2>manuscript[sound:manuscript.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">手稿：</font>a book, document, or other composition written by hand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]beautiful Latin manuscript on the school's diplomas 学校毕业证书上美丽的手写拉丁文</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]calligraphy, penmanship, script</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]print, type, typewriting 打字稿</div>
<h2>mar[sound:mar.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n.<font color="#aa00ff">污点，坏点：</font>something that spoils the appearance or completeness of a thing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mars on the furniture 家具上的污点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blight, blotch, defect, deformity, disfigurement, fault, flaw, imperfection, mark, pockmark, scar</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">破坏，削弱：</font>to impair the soundness, perfection, or integrity of; spoil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The once flatroad surface is now marred by numerous potholes.  曾经平整的路面如今被坑洞所破坏‖anelection marred by sexual scandal 被性丑闻蒙上阴影的选举</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blemish, compromise, cripple, damage, deface, disfigure, harm, hurt, impair, injure, spoil, vitiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doctor, fix, mend, patch, renovate, repair  修补；adorn, beautify, bedeck, embellish, garnish 装饰</div>
<h2>marsh[sound:marsh.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">沼泽，湿地：</font>an area of soft, wet, low-lying land</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The marshes along the coast support a remarkable profusion of plants and animals. 沿着海岸线一带的沼泽为大量的动植物提供了栖息所</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bog, fen, marshland, mire, moor, morass, quagmire, slough, swamp, wetland</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]marshy adj.潮湿的</div>

<h2>marvel[sound:marvel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">令人惊奇的事物：</font>one that evokes surprise, admiration, or wonder</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]The robot is a marvel of modern engineering.  机器人是工程领域的奇迹</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flash, miracle, phenomenon, prodigy, splendor</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（因为壮观、美丽等而）表示惊讶：</font>to feel amazement or bewilderment at or about</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]marvel at the tranquility of Chopin’s nocturne 惊叹于肖邦夜曲中体现出来的宁静和祥</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gape, gaze, goggle, wonder</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]marvelous adj.令人惊奇的</div>
<h2>masquerade[sound:masquerade.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">面具，伪装：</font>a display of emotion or behavior that is insincere or intended to deceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Although she was deeply bored, she maintained a masquerade of polite interest as her guest droned on.尽管她早已对客人滔滔不绝的话感到厌倦，但她还是装出了一幅饶有兴致的样子以示礼貌</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]facade, guise, mask, pretense, semblance, show, veil</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">伪装，掩饰：</font>to disguise oneself</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]masquerade as a policeman 化装成警察</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]act, disguise, pose, pretend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]betray, disclose, reveal, unmask 揭露</div>
