<h2>matriculate[sound:matriculate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">入学，录取：</font>to admit or be admitted into a group, especially a college or university.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]matriculate at Princeton 在普林斯顿入学</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]admit, enroll, inscribe, recruit, register</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commence, graduate 毕业；delist 除名</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]matriculation n. 录取</div>
<h2>maudlin[sound:maudlin.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过于感伤的：</font>effusively or tearfully sentimental</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some naive students display an almost maudlin concern for the welfare of animals while ignoring basicsocial inequity. 一些幼稚的学生忽视根本的社会不公平问题，而对动物的权益表现出一种多愁善感的忧虑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lachrymose, mawkish, mushy, overemotional, sentimental, tearful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blithe,cheerful, jocund , jovial, jubilant 高兴的；apathetic,impassive, indifferent 冷漠的</div>
<h2>maven[sound:maven.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">专家：</font>one who is experienced or knowledgeable: expert</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As an investment maven, he was doing well even when the market was doing poorly. 作为一名投资高手，他在市场不景气的时候也能赚钱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ace, adept, connoisseur, expert, maestro, master, professional, proficient, virtuoso</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amateur, dabbler, dilettante  业余爱好者</div>
<h2>maverick[sound:maverick.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">特立独行之人：</font>a person who does not conform to generally accepted standards or customs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some mavericks believe that both gravity and light are electromagnetic forces. 一些特立独行的人认为，重力和光都是电磁力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bohemian, deviant, heretic, iconoclast, nonconformist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conformer, conformist, conventionalist 遵从传统的人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">标新立异的，不合常规的：</font>deviating from commonly accepted beliefs or practices</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a maverick view on marriage 关于婚姻的非传统看法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dissentient, dissenting, dissident, heterodox, iconoclastic, unorthodox</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conforming, conventional, orthodox 遵从传统的</div>
<h2>mawkish[sound:mawkish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过度伤感的：</font>excessively and objectionably sentimental</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mawkish love story 令人伤感的爱情故事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lachrymose, maudlin, mushy, overemotional, sentimental, tearful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blithe,cheerful, jocund , jovial, jubilant  高兴的；apathetic, impassive, indifferent 冷漠的</div>
<h2>meager[sound:meager.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贫乏的：</font>deficient in quantity, fullness, or extent; scanty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]meager cultural resources 贫乏的文化资源</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exiguous, niggardly, poor, scanty, scarce, skimpy, slender, slim, sparing, sparse, stingy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abundant, ample, bountiful, copious, generous, liberal, plenteous, plentiful 大量的，富足的</div>
<h2>mean[sound:mean.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">卑贱的：</font>ignoble; base</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mean trick to play on a credulous person 耍在一个轻信别人的人身上的卑劣诡计</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]base, contemptible, despicable, detestable, dirty, dishonorable, execrable, ignominious, sordid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lofty, noble, venerable, virtuous 高尚的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">吝啬的：</font>giving or sharing as little as possible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mean child who hoarded all her toys 一个把她所有的玩具都藏了起来的小气孩子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]closefisted, mingy, miserly, niggardly, parsimonious, penurious, tightfisted, ungenerous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]generous, liberal, munificent 慷慨的；extravagant, lavish, prodigal, profligate, spendthrift 浪费的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">打算，怀有目的：</font>to have in mind as a purpose or goal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I mean to win this race. 我一定要赢这场比赛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aim, aspire, calculate, contemplate, design, intend, meditate, plan</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">意味着：</font>to serve or intend to convey, show, or indicate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The national anthem means various things to various people. 对于不同的人来说，国歌的意义不尽相同</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]connote, denote, express, import, signify, spell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]meaningful adj. 有意义的</div>
<h2>meander[sound:meander.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">闲逛，漫步：</font>to move aimlessly and idly without fixed direction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]meander along the river 沿着河闲逛 ‖vagabonds meandering through life 漂泊一生的浪子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amble, cruise, drift, float, ramble, roam, saunter,stroll, wander</div>
<h2>measly[sound:measly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">少得可怜的，微不足道的：</font>so small or unimportant as to warrant little or no attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gave the parking attendant a measly tip 给了停车保安少得可怜的小费</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, minute, paltry, peanut, petty, slight, trifling, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]big, consequential, considerable, significant 大量的，重要的</div>
<h2>measured[sound:measured.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">深思熟虑的，审慎的：</font>deliberated, calculated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a measured response to the terrorist attack 就恐怖袭击做出的深思熟虑的反应</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advised, calculated, considered, knowing, reasoned, studied, thoughtful, weighed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]casual 随意的  ；uncalculated, unconsidered, unstudied  没仔细考虑过的</div>
<h2>meddle[sound:meddle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">干涉，管闲事：</font>to intrude into other people's affairs or business; interfere</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Please stop meddling in my marriage. 请不要来干涉我的婚姻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]interfere, interlope, intermeddle, intrude, obtrude, poke, pry, snoop</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disregard, ignore, neglect, omit, overlook  忽略，不理会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]meddlesome adj. 爱管闲事的</div>
<h2>mediate[sound:mediate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">调解，调停：</font>to intervene between two or more disputants in order to bring about an agreement,a settlement, or a compromise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mediate a labor-management dispute 调解劳工纠纷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conciliate, intercede, intermediate, interpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arouse, encourage, excite, foment, incite, inflame, instigate, pique, spark, stimulate, stir 煽动激起</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mediator n. 调停人</div>
<h2>mediocre[sound:mediocre.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平庸的，质量中等偏下的：</font>moderate to inferior in quality; ordinary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Without a desire for success, life is at best mediocre. 没有对成功的强烈渴望，人生最多也就是碌碌无为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]average, common, commonplace, fair, indifferent, medium, ordinary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]outstanding, excellent, exceptional, extraordinary, impressive, superior 优秀的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mediocrity n. 平庸者；平庸</div>
<h2>medley[sound:medley.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大杂烩，混合物：</font>an unorganized collection or mixture of various things</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a medley of snack foods available on the buffet table 自助餐桌上供应着各式各样的小吃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agglomerate, collage, hodgepodge, jumble, montage, motley, muddle, salad, shuffle, variety, welter</div>
<h2>meek[sound:meek.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">谦恭的：</font>showing patience and humility; gentle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was a meek, mild-mannered fellow. 他是个谦逊、温文尔雅的的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]humble, modest, unassuming, unpretentious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arrogant, bumptious, haughty, imperious, pompous, presumptuous, supercilious 自大的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顺从的：</font>easily imposed on; submissive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He may be self-effacing, but he certainly isn't meek. 他可能是个很低调的人，但他绝非软骨头</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compliant, docile, manageable, obedient, submissive, tractable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adamant, headstrong, intractable, obstinate, refractory, stubborn, unruly, unyielding 倔强的，不顺从的</div>
<h2>meet[sound:meet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">合适的：</font>precisely adapted to a particular situation, need, or circumstance: very proper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In this case, splitting the winnings of the contested lottery ticket seems like a meetsolution. 在这种情况下，平分有争议的彩票奖金或许是个合适的解决方案</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]applicable, appropriate, apt, becoming, befitting, felicitous, fitting, proper, right, suitable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]improper, inapplicable, inapposite, inappropriate, inapt, infelicitous, malapropos 不合适的</div>
<h2>mellifluous[sound:mellifluous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（曲调）优美的：</font>smooth and sweet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mellifluous voice  甜美的嗓音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dulcet, euphonious, mellifluent, mellow, melodious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cacophonous, raspy 刺耳的</div>
<h2>melodramatic[sound:melodramatic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">感情夸张的，伤感的：</font>exaggeratedly emotional or sentimental; histrionic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Our office drama queen yet again made the melodramatic declaration that she was contemplating suicide.我们办公室的“影后”又一次在危言耸听了：这回她说她准备自杀</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dramatic, hammy, histrionic, mannered, pretentious, stagy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nondramatic, nontheatrical 平淡无奇的，非戏剧性的</div>
<h2>menace[sound:menace.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">威胁，使处于危险：</font>to make a show of intention to harm; to place in danger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Stockpiles of nuclear weapons that continue to menace the inhabitants of this planet. 大量的核武器持续地威胁着这个行星上的居民</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compromise, hazard, imperil, jeopardize, peril, risk, threaten</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rescue, save 救出</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]menacing adj. 带有威胁的</div>
<h2>mendacious[sound:mendacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">撒谎的，虚假的：</font>telling or containing lies</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mendacious tales about his adventures 关于他冒险的虚假传说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dishonest, deceitful, fallacious, lying, spurious, untruthful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]authentic, honest, truthful, veracious  真实的，诚实的</div>
<h2>mentor[sound:mentor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">导师：</font>a trusted counselor or guide</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]not only an lecturer but also a spirit mentor 不仅是授课者，还是精神导师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advisor, coach, counselor, guide, instructor, teacher</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disciple, pupil  弟子；apprentice  学徒</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">教导，指导：</font>to give advice and instruction regarding the course or process to be followed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We're looking for volunteers to mentor students in career planning. 我们在寻找能指导学生职业规划的志愿者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coach, counsel, lead, pilot, shepherd, show, tutor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comply, follow, observe 遵从</div>
<h2>mercenary[sound:mercenary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">雇佣军：</font>a professional soldier hired for service in a foreign army</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]hire a mercenary army to protect the VIP  雇佣了一支佣兵来保护重要人物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hack</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">唯利是图的，贪婪的：</font>motivated solely by a desire for monetary or material gain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Virtue flies from the heart of a mercenary man. 唯利是图的人没有美德可言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquisitive, avaricious, avid, covetous, grasping, greedy, moneygrubbing, rapacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benevolent, generous, liberal, philanthropic, munificent 慷慨的</div>
<h2>mercurial[sound:mercurial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（情绪）善变的：</font>characterized by rapid and unpredictable changeableness of mood</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his mercurial temperament 他善变的脾气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capricious, changeful, fluctuating, fluid, mutable, temperamental, uncertain, variable, volatile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]certain, constant, immutable, invariable, settled, stable, steady, unvarying 稳定的，不变的</div>
<h2>merited[sound:merited.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">应得的，理所当然的：</font>being what is called for by accepted standards of right and wrong</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a merited bonus 应得的奖金 ‖The punishment, although harsh, was entirely merited. 虽然惩罚很严厉，但的确是应得的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]condign, deserved, due, fair, justified, right, warranted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undeserved, undue 不应得的；gratuitous, unjustified, unwarranted 没有根据的，无正当理由的</div>
<h2>mesh[sound:mesh.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">诱捕：</font>to catch or hold as if in a net</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Dolphins sometimes become meshed in fishnets. 有时海豚也会被渔网缠住</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enmesh, ensnare, ensnarl, entoil, entrap, net, snare, tangle, trap</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disentangle, untangle 解开，使解脱</div>
<h2>mesmeric[sound:mesmeric.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">催眠的，催眠术的：</font>of, relating to, or induced by mesmerism</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hynoptic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]awaking 觉醒的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人着迷的，难以抗拒的：</font>attracting and holding interest as if by a spell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the mesmeric recital 迷人的独奏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attractive, alluring, captivating, charming, drawing, enchanting, riveting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disgusting, loathesome, repellent, repulsive 令人厌恶的；unappealing, unattractive 没有吸引力的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mesmerism n. 催眠术，难以抗拒的魅力；mesmerize    v. 催眠</div>
<h2>metamorphose[sound:metamorphose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">变形：</font>to change into a different physical form especially by supernatural means</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a science fiction story in which radiation metamorphoses people into giant bugs 一个描绘辐射将人变成了巨大虫子的科幻小说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alchemize, transfigure, transform, transmute, transpose, transubstantiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]remain 保持</div>
<h2>metaphysical[sound:metaphysical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">哲学上的，理论上的：</font>dealing with or expressing a quality or idea</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a work that deals with such metaphysical questions as the very nature of knowledge 一部探讨诸如“知识的本性是什么”的理论问题的著作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conceptual, ideal, ideational, notional, theoretical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concrete 具体的，实实在在的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非尘世的：</font>of, relating to, or being part of a reality beyond the observable physical universe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a metaphysical world beyond the one in which we live 在我们居住的世界之上的“超然世界”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ethereal, heavenly, otherworldly, paranormal, preternatural, transcendental, unearthly, unworldly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mundane 世俗的；natural 自然界的</div>
<h2>meteoric[sound:meteoric.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">流星般迅速而短暂的：</font>similar to a meteor in speed, brilliance, or brevity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a meteoric rise to fame  一夜成名</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ephemeral, evanescent, fleeting, momentary, rapid, transient, transitory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enduring, lasting, permanent, prolonged 持久的</div>
<h2>methodical[sound:methodical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">井然有序的，有条理的：</font>arranged or proceeding in regular, systematic order</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a methodical summary that included lists of points to memorize 一份包含了记忆重点的有条理的总结</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]neat, orderly, organized, regular, systematic, systematized</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disorganized, haphazard, irregular, unsystematic 杂乱的，混乱无序的</div>
<h2>meticulous[sound:meticulous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极为谨慎的：</font>marked by extreme or excessive care in the consideration or treatment of details</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was so meticulous about everything. 他对所有事都一丝不苟</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careful, conscientious, exact, fussy, heedful, painstaking, punctilious, scrupulous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careless, feckless, heedless, thoughtless  疏忽大意的</div>
<h2>mettle[sound:mettle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">勇气：</font>vigor and strength of spirit or temperament</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]troops who showed their mettle in combat 在战场上表现出坚强勇气的部队</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bravery, courage, dauntlessness, fortitude, guts, nerve, pluck, spirit, spunk, valor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cowardice, cravenness, gutlessness, pusillanimity, spinelessness 胆小，怯懦</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">毅力，耐力：</font>staying quality: stamina</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Those trucks had proved their mettle in army transport. 那些卡车通过在军队运输中的表现证明了它们的耐用性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]durability, endurance, stamina, persistence, resolution</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mettlesome adj. 有毅力的</div>
<h2>miff[sound:miff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使恼怒：</font>to cause to become offended or annoyed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be miffed by her son’s disobedience  被她儿子的叛逆惹恼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, annoy, enrage, exasperate, incense, infuriate, ire, madden, nettle, peeve, umbrage, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, assuage, mollify, placate, propitiate  平息，安抚；delight, gratify, please  取悦，讨好</div>

<h2>milk[sound:milk.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">榨取 （财富、信息等）：</font>to draw or coerce profit or advantage from illicitly or to an extreme degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]milk the workers 从工人身上榨取好处 ‖The interrogators milked the arrested spy, but he was dry.  审问者想尽办法套被捕间谍的话，但是无功而返</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drain, exploit</div>

<h2>mimic[sound:mimic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">仿真的，仿造的：</font>being such in appearance only and made with or manufactured from usuallycheaper materia</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Police were concerned that the mimic gun, although intended only as a toy, might be confused with the realthing in certain situations. 尽管仿真枪只是玩具，但警方担忧在某些情况下它会被误认为是真枪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artificial, bogus, factitious, fake, false, imitative, mock, sham, simulated, substitute, synthetic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]genuine, natural, real 真实的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">做滑稽的模仿 （以取笑）：</font>to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The comedian was famous for mimicking the President's distinctive lisp. 这个演员因能滑稽地模仿总统特有的口齿不清而闻名</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burlesque, caricature, do, imitate, mock, parody, send up, spoof, travesty</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">模仿：</font>to use (someone or something) as the model for one's speech, mannerisms, or behavior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]began to learn their language by mimicking the sounds they made 通过模仿发音来学习语言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ape, copy, copycat, emulate, mimic, simulate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mimicry n. 模仿</div>
<h2>minatory[sound:minatory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">带来威胁的，有凶兆的：</font>being or showing a sign of evil or calamity to come</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The novel's protagonist is haunted by a minatory black specter.  小说的主人公被不详的黑色幽灵所骚扰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baleful, direful, doomy, foreboding, ill-boding, inauspicious, menacing, portentous, sinister, threatening</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unthreatening  不威胁的；reassuring  令人安心的</div>

<h2>mingle[sound:mingle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">参加社交活动：</font>to take part in social activities</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mingling at a cocktail party 在鸡尾酒会上与他人交往</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]associate, fraternize, socialize</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">混合，结合：</font>to mix so that the components become united</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mingle the ingredients 将调料混合‖mingle fact and fiction 糅杂了现实与幻想</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mix, amalgamate, blend, commingle, immingle, intermix, merge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]divide, separate, sunder 分开</div>
<h2>minimize[sound:minimize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">将…减到最少：</font>to reduce to the smallest possible amount, extent, size, or degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]All striking forces are told to minimize civilian casualties. 所有攻击部队被要求尽可能减少平民伤亡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deprecate, diminish, discount, reduce</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inflate, magnify 膨胀，扩大；maximize 最大化</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">刻意低估：</font>to underestimate intentionally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]minimize losses in our own company while maximize those of the rival 低估我方损失而高估对手损失</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]underestimate, underrate, undervalue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]overestimate 高估；exaggerate 夸张，夸大</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">表示鄙夷：</font>to express scornfully one's low opinion of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Sore losers minimized the other team's victory. 愤愤不平的失败者对获胜方的胜利表现出鄙夷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belittle, denigrate, deprecate, depreciate, derogate, diminish, disparage, trash, vilipend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acclaim, applaud, exalt, extol, glorify, laud, magnify, praise 欢呼，赞扬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]minimum adj. 最小的</div>
<h2>mint[sound:mint.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">巨额：</font>an abundant amount, especially of money</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]worth a mint 价值连城</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bomb, boodle, bundle, fortune, pile, wad</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mite, modicum 少量</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无损坏的：</font>unmarred as if fresh from a mint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a second-handed laptop in mint condition 一台几乎全新的二手笔记本电脑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]intact, original, perfect, pristine, unmarred, virginal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impaired, damaged 有损坏的；stale 陈腐的</div>

<h2>minute[sound:minute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">仔细的，谨小慎微的：</font>characterized by careful scrutiny and close examination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a minute description of the setting of the story  故事背景的详细介绍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circumstantial, elaborate, full, particular, particularized, thorough</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brief, compendious, concise, succinct, summary, terse  摘要性的，简述的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">小的，不重要的：</font>very small or of small importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It is not sagacious to invest excessively in minute details. 过分投入于不重要的细枝末节上是不明智的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]frivolous, incidental, inconsiderable, insignificant, little, minor, negligible, nugatory, slight, trifling, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consequential, critical, crucial, momentous, significant, vital, weighty  关键的，重要的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]minutes n. 会议记录</div>

<h2>mirage[sound:mirage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">海市蜃楼，幻想：</font>something illusory and unattainable like a mirage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Reunion with her husband has become a mirage. 与他丈夫重逢已是可望而不可及的幻象‖A  peacefulsolution proved to be a mirage. 和平解决问题是不可能的了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chimera, delusion, hallucination, illusion, phantom, vision</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reality 现实</div>
<h2>mire[sound:mire.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">困境：</font>a difficult, puzzling, or embarrassing situation from which there is no easy escape</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]stuck in a mire of emotional dependency  陷于感情依赖的困境中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dilemma, hole, impasse, jam, pickle, quagmire, rattrap, swamp</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使陷入困境，拖后腿：</font>to hamper or hold back as if by mire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be mired in the past 陷于过去的回忆不能自拔</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bog, broil, delay, detain, entangle, entrap, retard</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enfranchise, extricate, free, liberate, rescue 使解脱</div>
<h2>mirth[sound:mirth.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">欢乐，欢笑：</font>gladness or gaiety as shown by or accompanied with laughter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a man of little mirth 不苟言笑之人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheer, festivity, gaiety, glee, happiness, hilarity, jocundity, joviality,  lightheartedness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dejection, depression, desolation, despondence, doldrums, melancholy, oppression 沮丧，忧伤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mirthful adj. 高兴的</div>
<h2>misanthropic[sound:misanthropic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">反人类的：</font>having or showing a deep distrust of human beings and their motives</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a solitary and misanthropic artist 一个孤立的反人类艺术家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antisocial, cynical, pessimistic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]philanthropic 博爱的；uncynical 不愤世嫉俗的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]misanthrope n. 反人类份子</div>
<h2>misbehaving[sound:misbehaving.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">调皮的，行为不端的：</font>engaging in or marked by childish misbehavior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a new approach for disciplining a chronically misbehaving child 一个教育调皮小孩的新方法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annoying, devious, errant, impish, mischievous, naughty, playful, wicked</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decorous, urbane 举止得体的</div>
<h2>mischievous[sound:mischievous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">调皮的，调皮的：</font>playful in a naughty or teasing way</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The mischievous child broke the vase. 调皮的孩子打碎了花瓶</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annoying, devious, errant, impish, misbehaving, naughty, playful, wicked</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decorous, urbane 举止得体的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有害的：</font>causing harm or trouble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mischievous rumors that defame him 恶意中伤他的谣言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adverse, baleful, baneful, deleterious, detrimental, evil, hurtful, injurious, nocuous, noxious, pernicious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beneficial 有益的；anodyne, benign, harmless, innocent, innocuous, inoffensive, safe 无害的</div>
<h2>misconstrue[sound:misconstrue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">误解，曲解：</font>to mistake the meaning of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]An outsider might misconstrue the nature of the phenomenon. 局外者可能会曲解这个现象的本质</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]garble, misapprehend, misinterpret, misperceive, misread, misrepresent, mistake</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appreciate, apprehend, catch, comprehend, fathom, grasp, perceive, savvy, seize, understand 获知</div>
<h2>miscreant[sound:miscreant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">恶棍，罪犯：</font>one who behaves criminally or viciously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]robbed by a bunch of miscreants 遭到了一伙歹徒的抢劫</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brute, culprit, devil, felon, fiend, offender, rascal, reprobate, villain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cavalier, chevalier （尤指对女士）彬彬有礼的绅士</div>
<h2>misdemeanor[sound:misdemeanor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">轻罪：</font>a crime less serious than a felony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]charged with several misdemeanors  被指控几项轻罪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]infraction, infringement, offense, peccadillo, violation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]felony 重罪</div>
<h2>miserly[sound:miserly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">吝啬的：</font>marked by grasping meanness and penuriousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a miserly couple devoid of social conscience and responsibility 一对没有社会良心和责任感的吝啬夫妻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]closefisted, mean, niggard, parsimonious, penurious, stingy, tightfisted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lavish, prodigal, spendthrift, squandering  浪费的；generous, liberal, munificent, openhanded 慷慨的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]miser n. 守财奴</div>
<h2>misfortune[sound:misfortune.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不幸：</font>bad fortune or ill luck</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]unable to grasp why he had been struck by such a misfortune 无法理解他为何会遇上如此不幸之事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adversity, calamity, cataclysm, catastrophe, disaster, ill, mischance, mishap, tragedy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fortune, luck, serendipity 幸事</div>
<h2>misgiving[sound:misgiving.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">担忧，疑虑：</font>a feeling of doubt or suspicion especially concerning a future event</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]No one can dispel his misgiving. 没有人能打消他的疑虑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprehension, distrust, doubt, dread, fear, foreboding, incertitude, skepticism, suspicion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assurance, belief, certainty, certitude, confidence, conviction, sureness, surety, trust 信心</div>
<h2>mishap[sound:mishap.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不幸之事：</font>an unfortunate accident</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Mishap followed wherever he went. 不论他走到哪里，厄运总是形影相随</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adversity, calamity, cataclysm, catastrophe, disaster, ill, mischance, misfortune, tragedy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fortune, luck, serendipity 幸事</div>
<h2>misrepresent[sound:misrepresent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">误传，篡改：</font>to give an incorrect or misleading representation of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]misrepresent the facts  篡改事实真相</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belie, color, distort, falsify, garble, misinterpret, misrelate, misstate, pervert</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarify, explain, illuminate, illustrate 澄清，阐明</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]misrepresentation n. 篡改</div>
<h2>mite[sound:mite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">微小的东西，很少的钱：</font>a very small object, creature, or particle, a very small sum of money</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I have only a mite left to buy lunch for the rest of the week. 我只剩下一点钱来买剩下一周几天的午饭了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]atom, bit, hint, iota, molecule, particle, pittance, trace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]boodle, bundle, fortune 大笔（金钱）；colossus 巨大的事物</div>
<h2>mitigate[sound:mitigate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">减轻痛苦，使缓和：</font>to make less severe or painful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]powerful drugs that mitigate pains 强力的镇痛剂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allay, alleviate, assuage, ease, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soothe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggravate, exacerbate, intensify 加剧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mitigation n. 缓和</div>
<h2>mobile[sound:mobile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可移动的：</font>capable of moving or being moved</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mobile missile launcher 可移动导弹发射装置</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]motile, movable, portable, transportable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]immobile, immovable 不可移动的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可变的：</font>changeable in appearance, mood, or purpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a highly mobile face 善变的面孔</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adaptable, fluid, inconstant, mercurial, mutable, protean, unstable, unsteady, variable, versatile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fixed, steadfast, stable  稳定的，不变的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mobility n. 可移动性；mobilize    v. 动员</div>
<h2>mockery[sound:mockery.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">鄙视，嘲弄：</font>scornfully contemptuous ridicule</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her deliberate mockery triggered a fierce fight. 她的蓄意嘲弄引起了一场激烈的打斗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]derision, joke, mock, ridicule, scoffing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]respect, reverence, veneration 尊敬</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">以嘲笑为目的的模仿：</font>a false, derisive, or impudent imitation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]arbitrary methods that make a mockery of justice 嘲讽司法公正的仲裁体系</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burlesque, caricature, farce, parody, sham, travesty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mock    v. 愚弄，嘲弄</div>
<h2>moderate[sound:moderate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使缓和：</font>to lessen the intensity or extremeness of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Sopranos and tenors moderates their voices to fit the size of the theater.  女高音和男高音们根据剧场的大小调节他们的声音以创造合适的效果</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abate, diminish, dwindle, ease, lessen, lower, modulate, subside, taper, temper, wane</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]escalate, enhance, expand, heighten, intensify 扩大，升级，增强</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">适度的，中庸的：</font>being within reasonable limits; not excessive or extreme</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new proposals regarding defense budget were met with only moderate enthusiasm. 关于国防预算的新提案只得到了平淡的回应</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]average, conservative, fair, intermediate, mediocre, modest, reasonable, temperate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exorbitant, excessive 过分的；extreme, radical 极端的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]immoderate adj. 不适度的</div>
<h2>modicum[sound:modicum.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">少量：</font>a small portion; a limited quantity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a modicum of food quota 极少量的食物配额</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]atom, iota, mite, molecule, particle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abundance, affluence 大量</div>
<h2>mollify[sound:mollify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">平息抚慰，缓和：</font>to calm in temper or feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mollify the angry customer 平息消费者的怒气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allay, alleviate, appease, assuage, conciliate, mitigate, placate, propitiate, soothe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggravate, enrage, exasperate, incense, inflame, infuriate, ire, rankle, vex 激怒；antagonize 使敌对</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mollification n. 安抚</div>
<h2>mollycoddle[sound:mollycoddle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">溺爱：</font>to treat with an excessive or absurd degree of indulgence and attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mollycoddle his only grandson 溺爱他唯一的孙子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coddle, cosset, indulge, pamper, spoil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abuse, ill-treat 虐待</div>
<h2>molt[sound:molt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">脱（羽、皮等）：</font>to shed hair, feathers, shell, horns, or an outer layer periodically</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Snakes molt as they grow, shedding the old skin and growing a larger new skin. 随着年龄的增长，蛇会脱去老皮，长出新皮</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exfoliate, exuviate, shed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fledge 长羽毛</div>
<h2>momentous[sound:momentous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极重要的：</font>of utmost importance; of outstanding significance or consequence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Battle of Stalingrad is a momentous campaign in World War 2. 斯大林格勒之战是第二次世界大战中具有重大意义的一次战役</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consequential, considerable, crucial, eventful, important, monumental, pivotal, significant, vital, weighty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconsequential, negligible, slight, trifling, trivial 无关紧要的</div>
<h2>momentum[sound:momentum.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">动力：</font>impetus of a physical object in motion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their luck began to pick up momentum. 他们的运气开始转旺</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boost, encouragement, goad, impetus, incentive, incitation, instigation, motivation, spur, stimulus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deterrent  阻碍物；obstruction, resistance 阻力</div>
<h2>mongrel[sound:mongrel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">杂种的，混血儿的：</font>of mixed origin or character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]homeless mongrel dogs on the streets 街上的流浪杂种狗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crossbred, hybrid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]purebred  纯种的</div>
<h2>monochromatic[sound:monochromatic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">单色的：</font>having or consisting of one color or hue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]monochromatic filter 单色滤光片</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]colorless, monochrome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]chromatic, colorful, iridescent, motley, rainbow, variegated 五光十色的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">单调无聊的：</font>lacking variety, creativity, or excitement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a monochromatic article eulogizing a hero 一个无聊的赞颂英雄的文章</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arid, dreary, drudging, dull, jejune, monotonous, pedestrian, ponderous, stale, stodgy, tiresome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 吸引人的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]monochromatism n. 全色盲</div>
<h2>monologue[sound:monologue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">独白：</font>a dramatic sketch performed by one actor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]deliver a tedious monologue  做了一个冗长的独白</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]soliloquy, solo, speech</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dialogue 对话</div>
<h2>monotonous[sound:monotonous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（声音）单调的：</font>uttered or sounded in one unvarying tone</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a monotonous apathetic voice 单调而冷漠的声音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vociferous 嘈杂的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">清一色的，无聊的：</font>tediously uniform or unvarying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sparkle in the monotonous background  单调背景中的一个亮点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arid, dreary, drudging, dull, jejune, monochromatic, pedestrian, ponderous, stale, stodgy, tiresome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 吸引人的</div>
<h2>montage[sound:montage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大杂烩：</font>an unorganized collection or mixture of various things</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My memories of the childhood trip are a montage of the sights of two rivers, smells of hotpots, and soundsof light railway of Chongqing. 我孩提时代旅行的记忆就是由两江风光、火锅的香味以及重庆的轻轨声杂糅而成的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agglomerate, collage, hodgepodge, medley, motley, salad, variety</div>
<h2>moratorium[sound:moratorium.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">延期，暂缓施行：</font>a suspension of activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a moratorium on nuclear tests 暂缓核试验</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abeyance, delay, doldrums, dormancy, latency, quiescence, postponement, suspension</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resumption （从中断处）继续进行</div>
<h2>morbid[sound:morbid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">病态的：</font>affected with or induced by disease</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]exhibit a morbid fascination  展现出一种病态的迷恋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diseased, pathological</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]verdant 青翠的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">思想性格变态的：</font>characterized by preoccupation with unwholesome thoughts or feelings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]read the account of the murder with a morbid interest 怀着病态的心态读谋杀报告</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brainsick, crazy, deranged, lunatic, psychotic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hale, salubrious, wholesome 健康的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]morbidity n. 病态</div>
<h2>mordant[sound:mordant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">尖酸刻薄的：</font>biting and caustic in thought, manner, or style</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]feel embarrassed about the mordant satire of the critics 对评论家刻薄的讽刺感到尴尬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acerbic, acid, acrid, barbed, caustic, corrosive, pungent, sardonic, satiric, scalding, scathing, tart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]congenial, genial 和蔼的</div>
<h2>moribund[sound:moribund.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">即将结束的，垂死的：</font>approaching death; about to die</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The nation’s banking industry was moribund. 这个国家的银行业危在旦夕</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decadent, deteriorating, dying, expiring, fading</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beginning, nascent 初生的，刚开始的；lively, thriving, vigorous, vital  有活力的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">即将过时的：</font>on the verge of becoming obsolete</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some social conventions have been rendered moribund in face of modernization. 不少传统习俗在现代化的影响下变得岌岌可危</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antiquated, archaic, dated, fossilized, moth-eaten, outdated, outworn, rusty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fresh, new 崭新的；promising 充满希望的</div>
<h2>morose[sound:morose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">忧郁的：</font>having a sullen and gloomy disposition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]morose job seekers who are inured to rejection 习惯了被拒的郁郁寡欢的求职者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bleak, chill, dark, depressed, dire, dour, gloomy, lugubrious, saturnine, solemn, sulky, sullen, surly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bright, cheerful, festive, jovial , jocund , sanguine, lighthearted, rejoiced 高兴的，欢快的</div>
<h2>mosaic[sound:mosaic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">综合物，马赛克般的东西：</font>an unorganized collection or mixture of various things</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mosaic of testimony from various witnesses  从不同证人中得来的综合证词</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agglomerate, collage, hodgepodge, jumble, montage, motley, muddle, salad, shuffle, variety, welter</div>
<h2>mosque[sound:mosque.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">清真寺：</font>a building used for public worship by Muslim</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a deadly suicide attack at the mosque 在清真寺发生的致命自杀性袭击</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cathedral, chapel, church, temple</div>
<h2>moth-eaten[sound:moth-eaten.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过时的：</font>having passed its time of use or usefulness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dressed in a moth-eaten style 过时的衣着</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antiquated, archaic, dated, fossilized, moribund, outdated, outworn, rusty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fresh, new  崭新的；promising 充满希望的</div>
<h2>motile[sound:motile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">能动的：</font>exhibiting or capable of movement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Aircraft carriers are recognized as a motile combat platform.  航空母舰是一种移动作战平台</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mobile, movable, portable, transportable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]immobile 不可移动的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]motility n. 可运动性</div>
<h2>motivate[sound:motivate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激，激发：</font>to provide with an incentive; move to action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]questions that excite and motivate youth  激发青年人的问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excite, galvanize, impel, innervate, provoke, rouse, stimulate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discourage, dishearten  使泄气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]motivation n. 动机；motivated adj. 被激励的</div>
<h2>motley[sound:motley.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">混杂的，富于变化的：</font>(especially of colors) having elements of great variety or incongruity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an arrangement of motley flowers 多种不同花束的组合</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assorted, chromatic, kaleidoscopic, heterogeneous, indiscriminate, magpie, piebald, variegated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]homogeneous, monochromatic, monotonous, unvaried 单一的，同一性的</div>
<h2>mottle[sound:mottle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">标记上杂色斑点：</font>to mark with spots or blotches of different shades or colors</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a black horse mottled with white  身上带有白色斑点的黑马</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blotch, dapple, dot, marble, splotch, spot, stain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blanch 漂白</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mottled adj. 斑驳的</div>
<h2>motto[sound:motto.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">座右铭：</font>a short expression of a guiding principle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]“Semper fidelis” is the motto of US Marine Corps. “永远忠诚”是美国海军陆战队的格言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catchword, doctrine, dogma, idiom, slogan</div>
<h2>mournful[sound:mournful.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">悲伤的：</font>feeling or expressing sorrow or grief</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The mournful survivors of the disaster were faced with the grim task of burying the dead. 悲伤的幸存者面临着掩埋灾难中死者尸体的可怕任务‖Mrs. Murphy fainted at the mournful news of her son’s death. Murphy太太听到她儿子的死讯后晕了过去</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aching, agonized, anguished, doleful, dolorous, grievous, lamentable, lugubrious, melancholy, sad, woeful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cheerful, delighted, jocund, jovial, jubilant 快活的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mournfulness n. 悲伤</div>
<h2>movement[sound:movement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">运动：</font>the act or process of moving</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There appears to be some movement in the bush.  树丛中似乎有动静</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]action, motion, operation, shifting, stir</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]motionlessness, stasis  静止</div>
<h2>muddy[sound:muddy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不干净的：</font>not clean</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]got muddy after playing outside  在外面玩弄得很脏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]besmirched, dingy, draggled, dusty, filthy, foul, nasty, smudged, smutty, soiled, sordid, stained, sullied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clean, immaculate, spotless, stainless, unsoiled, unstained, unsullied 干净的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">浑浊的，不清晰的：</font>lacking in clarity or brightness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a muddy recording 嘈杂不清的纪录</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cloudy, foul, murky, obscure, turbid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear 清晰的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使难以理解：</font>to make (something) unclear to the understanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That point is irrelevant and will just muddy the issue we're trying to resolve. 那个观点和讨论我们的问题毫不相干，它只会妨碍我们对于问题的理解</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]becloud, befog, blur, cloud, fog, obfuscate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarify, illuminate 阐明</div>
<h2>muffle[sound:muffle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使消声：</font>to wrap or pad in order to deaden the sound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]close the window to muffle the outside noises  关上窗户以减少外界的噪音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attenuate, dampen, deaden, mute, soften, stifle, suppress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amplify, enhance, magnify 放大，增强</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]muffler n. 围巾；消音器</div>
<h2>mulish[sound:mulish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固执的：</font>unreasonably and inflexibly obstinate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a mulish determination to act on his own  铁了心要单打独斗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant, headstrong, immovable, intractable, obstinate, pertinacious, perverse, refractory, stubborn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flexible, pliable, pliant, yielding 易改变立场的，易受影响的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mulishly adv. 固执地</div>
<h2>mumble[sound:mumble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">说话含糊：</font>to utter words in a low confused indistinct manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He mumbled an apology reluctantly.  他不情愿地咕哝了句抱歉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grunt, murmur, mutter, whisper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]articulate, enunciate 清楚地表达</div>
<h2>mundane[sound:mundane.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">尘世的，世俗化的：</font>of, relating to, or typical of this world</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As for opera, I prefer mundane to religious themes. 与宗教主题相比，我更喜欢世俗主题的歌剧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carnal, earthly, materialistic, secular, sensual, worldly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]spiritual 精神上的；ethereal 虚无缥缈的，非尘世的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平凡的：</font>relating to, characteristic of, or concerned with commonplaces</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mundane concerns of day-to-day life  关于日常生活的一般顾虑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]common, ordinary, prosaic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extraordinary 非凡的</div>
<h2>munificent[sound:munificent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">慷慨的：</font>very liberal in giving</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The university received a munificent foundation grant. 大学收到了一笔慷慨的基金资助</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bountiful, charitable, generous, liberal, openhanded, unsparing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]closefisted, mean, miserly, niggardly, parsimonious, penurious, stingy, tightfisted 小气的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]munificence n. 慷慨</div>
<h2>murky[sound:murky.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">黯淡的，昏暗的：</font>being without light or without much light</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I didn't like walking around the murky campground without a flashlight. 我不喜欢在没有手电的情况下在营地里走动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]black, caliginous, darkened, dim, gloomy, stygian</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bright, brightened, brilliant, illuminated, illumined, lucent, lucid, luminous 明亮的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">模糊的，晦涩的：</font>lacking clarity or distinctness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He felt lost in the murky bureaucratic rhetoric.  他感觉自己被官僚主义的晦涩说辞弄晕了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambiguous, arcane, cloudy, equivocal, muddy, nebulous, obscure, occult, vague</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear, limpid, pellucid, plain  清晰的</div>
<h2>murmur[sound:murmur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">小声的话语：</font>a low, indistinct, continuous sound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We could hear the murmur of the audience throughout the entire performance. 我们在整个演出当中都能听到观众的窃窃私语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grunt, mumble, mutter, undertone, whisper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]roar 怒吼</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">低声抱怨，发牢骚：</font>to complain in low mumbling tones; grumble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We could hear the murmur of the audience throughout the entire performance. 我们在整个演出当中都能听到观众的窃窃私语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carp, fuss, gripe, grizzle, grouch, grouse, grumble, moan, repine, whine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crow, delight, rejoice 欢呼，高兴</div>
<h2>mutate[sound:mutate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（使）改变，（使）变异：</font>to undergo or cause to undergo mutation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some chromosomes started to mutate after exposure to X-Ray.  经X 光照射之后部分染色体发生了变异</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alter, change, fluctuate, modify, shift, transfigure, transform, vary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]remain 保持不变；plateau, stabilize 使稳定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]mutation n. 改变；变异</div>
<h2>mute[sound:mute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不说话的，缄默的：</font>deliberately refraining from speech</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He always remained mute no matter how much we pleaded for an answer 不论我们怎么恳求回答，他总是保持沉默</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dumb, inarticulate, speechless, uncommunicative, voiceless, wordless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]communicative, expansive, loquacious, talkative 爱说话的，话多的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使颜色、音调等柔和：</font>to soften the tone, color, shade, or hue of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mute a color 对颜色进行柔化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attenuate, soften, subdue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sharpen 锐化</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">减弱声音：</font>to soften or muffle the sound of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dampen, deaden, muffle, stifle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amplify, magnify 增强，放大</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]muted adj. 消声的，静音的</div>
<h2>mutter[sound:mutter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">低声抱怨：</font>to murmur complainingly or angrily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]mutter about the difficult assignment  抱怨作业太难</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carp, fuss, gripe, grizzle, grouch, grouse, grumble, moan, murmur, repine, whine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crow, delight, rejoice 欢呼，高兴</div>
<h2>myopic[sound:myopic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏远见的，缺乏辨别能力的：</font>a lack of foresight or discernment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a myopic view on climate change 关于气候变化缺乏远见的观点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]shortsighted, narrow-minded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]far-sighted, foreseeing, improvident 有远见的；discerning  有辨别能力的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]myopia n. 近视；鼠目寸光</div>
<h2>myriad[sound:myriad.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无限的，大量的：</font>constituting a very large, indefinite number</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the myriad stars of a summer night 夏日夜空中的无尽繁星</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]innumerable, numerous, uncountable, untold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]few, scarce, scanty 少的，缺乏的；countable, enumerable 可数清的</div>
<h2>nadir[sound:nadir.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">最低点：</font>the lowest point</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the nadir on the curve 曲线上的最低点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]base, bottom, foot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acme, apex, climax, meridian, peak, pinnacle, summit, top, zenith 最高点</div>
<h2>naive[sound:naive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">天真纯朴的：</font>lacking worldly experience and understanding, simple and guileless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a child with a naive charm 天真无邪的孩子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artless, guileless, ingenuous, innocent, natural, simple, unaffected, unsophisticated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sophisticated, worldly 世故的；affected, artful, assuming, dishonest, dissembling, guileful  虚伪、做作的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]naivety n. 天真</div>
<h2>narcissism[sound:narcissism.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">自恋：</font>excessive love or admiration of oneself</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In his narcissism, he just assumed that everyone else wanted to hear the tiny details of his day.  在他自恋的眼中，所有人仿佛都想要听他日常生活里的细枝末节</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]egocentricity, egotism, self-absorption</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]self-hatred 自我憎恨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]narcissistic adj. 自恋的</div>
<h2>nascent[sound:nascent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">新生的：</font>coming or having recently come into existence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The rise of the nascent middle class catalyzed a new economic boom. 新生中产阶级的崛起催生了一场新的经济繁荣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beginning, emerging, inceptive, inchoate, incipient, initial, introductory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]full-blown, full-fledged, mature, ripe 成熟的；moribund 将死的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]nascence n. 新生的状态</div>
