<h2>negation[sound:negation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">否定：</font>the opposite or absence of something regarded as actual, positive, or affirmative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]issued specific negations of all of the charges against her 发表了明确的声明，否定了所有对她的指控</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contradiction, denegation, denial, gainsaying, rejection, repudiation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acknowledgement, affirmation, avowal 肯定，同意</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]negative adj. 否定的；负面的</div>
<h2>negligent[sound:negligent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">疏忽大意的：</font>failing to give proper attention or care</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]negligent in taking care of the children 粗心大意地照顾孩子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careless, derelict, heedless, neglectful, remiss</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]attentive, careful, cautious, heedful 专心的，谨慎的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]negligence n. 疏忽</div>
<h2>negotiate[sound:negotiate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">商量，谈判：</font>to arrange or settle by discussion and mutual agreement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]negotiate the term of truce 共商停战事宜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arrange, bargain, concert, settle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]break down （谈判等）失败，破产</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">谋划：</font>plan out usually with subtle skill or care</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The prisoners negotiated their escape by using Morse code to tap messages to each other through thewalls. 犯人们通过敲击墙壁来传达莫尔斯电码，从而密谋了他们的逃跑计划</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contrive, finesse, frame, machinate, maneuver, manipulate, mastermind, wangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]negotiable adj. 可商量的；negotiation n. 谈判</div>
<h2>neophyte[sound:neophyte.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">初学者，新手：</font>a beginner or novice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a novice in the theater who had never even had a walk-on role 一个连龙套都没跑过的新演员</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abecedarian, apprentice, fledgling, freshman, novice, recruit, rookie, tyro</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]veteran 老兵，身经百战的人</div>
<h2>nerve[sound:nerve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（坚强的）意志，勇气：</font>power of endurance or control; strength of mind to carry on in spite ofdanger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]nerves of steel 钢铁般的意志</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bravery, fortitude, guts, intrepidity, resolution, stamina</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cowardice, pusillanimity 怯懦</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">给予勇气，鼓励：</font>to give strength or courage to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]needs to nerve himself for the big game tomorrow  需要为明天的大赛给自己加油鼓劲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animate, brace, cheer, embolden, encourage, inspirit, steel, strengthen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appall 使胆寒；discourage, dishearten 使沮丧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]nervy adj. 有勇气的</div>
<h2>nettle[sound:nettle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">惹怒：</font>to arouse to sharp but transitory annoyance or anger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His pompous attitude nettled several people. 他自大的性格得罪了不少人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, annoy, exasperate, inflame, infuriate, irritate, peeve, pique, provoke, roil, ruffle, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, assuage, conciliate, mollify, placate, propitiate 安抚</div>
<h2>neutralize[sound:neutralize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">中和：</font>to cause (an acid or base) to undergo neutralization</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]industrial exhaust neutralized by lime 被石灰中和的工业废气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acidify 酸化</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">破坏，使无效：</font>to make inoperative or ineffective usually by means of an opposite force, influence,or effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]influenced by the kind of propaganda that is difficult to neutralize 被一种难以消除的宣传攻势所影响</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annul, cancel, counteract, frustrate, negate, nullify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]activate, vitalize 激活</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]neutralization n. 中和；消除</div>
<h2>nicety[sound:nicety.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">准确，精确：</font>careful attention to details; delicate exactness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There's a nicety of detail in his meticulously painted landscapes. 在他精心绘制的景观图中，有着十分精准翔实的细节</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accuracy, delicacy, exactness, fineness, precision, veracity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coarseness, imprecision, inaccuracy, roughness 不准确，粗糙</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">细微之处：</font>a fine point or distinction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the niceties of table manner 餐桌礼仪的细微之处‖niceties of diplomatic protocol 外交礼节中的细节</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]detail, particular, nuance, subtlety</div>
<h2>nexus[sound:nexus.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">连结：</font>a means of connection</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Correlativity does not sufficiently lead to causal nexus.  相关性不是因果关联的充分条件</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bond, connection, link, tie</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">核心，最重要的地带：</font>a thing or place that is of greatest importance to an activity or interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As the nexus for three great religions, Jerusalem has had a troubled as well as illustrious history. 作为三大宗教的圣城，耶路撒冷有着动荡而辉煌的历史</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]base, capital, center, core, focus, kernel, heart, hub, nucleus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]margin, periphery 边缘</div>
<h2>nibble[sound:nibble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">小口咬：</font>to eat with small, quick bites or in small morsels</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]waves nibbling the shore 缓慢侵蚀海岸的浪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bite, nip, peck, sip, tipple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gobble 狼吞虎咽</div>
<h2>nil[sound:nil.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不存在，零：</font>nothing; zero</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]reduced to nil  消逝殆尽</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]nothing, nonentity, nullity, zip</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]existence 存在</div>
<h2>nip[sound:nip.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">少量：</font>a very small amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I'll have just a nip of your sandwich. 我只吃一点点你的三明治</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bit, hint, little, mite, ounce, snap, trace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abundance, affluence, avalanche 大量</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">小口吃喝：</font>to sip (alcoholic liquor) in small amounts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]nibble, sip, tipple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]guzzle, quaff, swill  大口吃喝</div>
<h2>nitpick[sound:nitpick.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">吹毛求疵：</font>to criticize by nit-picking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a peevish critic always ready to quibble 一个总是吹毛求疵的古怪评论家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carp, cavil, fuss, niggle, quibble, pick nits</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]nitpicker n. 吹毛求疵的人</div>
<h2>nocturnal[sound:nocturnal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">夜间的：</font>of, relating to, or occurring in the night</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a nocturnal raid 夜间突袭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]nightly, nighttime</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]daily, diurnal 白昼的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">夜间活动的：</font>active at night</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a nocturnal predator 夜间活动的捕食者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]nocturne n. 夜曲</div>
<h2>noisome[sound:noisome.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有害的，有毒的：</font>noxious, harmful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]noisome chemical fumes 有害的化学烟雾</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deleterious, detrimental, insalubrious, noxious, unhealthy, unwholesome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beneficial 有益的；healthy, salubrious, wholesome 有益健康的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">恶臭的：</font>offensive to the senses and especially to the sense of smell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]noisome garbage 恶臭的垃圾</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fetid, foul, malodorous, smelly, stinky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ambrosial, aromatic, fragrant, perfumed, redolent, savory, scented, sweet 有香味的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常令人厌恶的：</font>highly obnoxious or objectionable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]noisome habits of littering 让人反感的随地乱扔垃圾的坏习惯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abhorrent, appalling, disgusting, hideous, loathsome, nauseating, offensive, repugnant, repulsive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appealing, captivating, enchanting, fascinating 有吸引力的；agreeable, pleasant 令人愉悦的</div>
<h2>nomad[sound:nomad.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj./n. 游牧的；居无定所的人：a member of a people who have no fixed residence but move fromplace to place usually seasonally and within a well-defined territory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]after college she became quite the nomad, backpacking through Europe with no particular destination大学毕业后她开始漂泊，漫无目的地游遍欧洲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambulant,  fugitive,  gallivanting,  perambulatory,  peripatetic,  ranging,  roaming,  vagabond,  vagrant,wandering, wayfaring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]settled 定居的</div>
<h2>nominal[sound:nominal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不重要的：</font>so small or unimportant as to warrant little or no attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His involvement was nominal. 他的参与不太重要。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inconsequential, inconsiderable, paltry, trifling, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]big, consequential, considerable, important, material, significant  重要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">名义上的：</font>existing or being something in name or form only</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]nominal head of the party 党派的名义首领</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]formal, paper, titular</div>
<h2>nonchalant[sound:nonchalant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冷漠的：</font>having an air of easy unconcern or indifference</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was surprisingly nonchalant about winning the award. 她竟然对得奖很淡然。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apathetic, disinterested, insensible, insouciant, perfunctory, unconcerned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concerned, interested 忧虑的，有兴趣的</div>
<h2>nondescript[sound:nondescript.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平凡的，不吸引人的：</font>lacking distinctive or interesting qualities</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their performance was disappointingly nondescript. 他们的演出令人失望，味同嚼蜡。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beige, characterless, featureless, indistinctive, vanilla</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conspicuous, remarkable, striking 明显的，惊人的</div>
<h2>nonentity[sound:nonentity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不重要的人：</font>a person or thing of little consequence or significance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]she was so quiet she was almost a nonentity at the meeting 她非常沉默，在会议上是个边缘人物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cipher, half-pint, insignificancy, lightweight, nullity, snippersnapper, twerp, whippersnapper, zero, zilch</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mogul, big shot, big wheel, bigwig, eminence, figure, magnate, personage, somebody 显要人物</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">虚构的东西：</font>a conception or image created by the imagination and having no objective reality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the arctic circle is a nonentity—you won't see it on the way to the north pole 北极圈是虚构的概念，去北极的路上你不会见到那么一个圈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chimera, conceit, daydream, delusion, fancy, figment, hallucination, illusion, phantasm, unreality, vision</div>
<h2>nonplus[sound:nonplus.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt.<font color="#aa00ff">迷惑，困惑：</font>use to be at a loss as to what to say, think, or do: perplex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I was nonplussed by his openly expressed admiration of me. 我被她公开表现的仰慕弄得很窘迫。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]confound, confuse, discomfit, disconcert, discountenance, mortify, abash, faze, fluster</div>
<h2>nonsense[sound:nonsense.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">无意义的话，废话：</font>words or language having no meaning or conveying no intelligible ideas</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Many of the words in the poem are nonsense. 这首诗歌当中很多词都是废话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]babble, blabber, drivel, prattle, mumbo jumbo</div>

Such a cut used for keeping a record</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unserrated 没有刻痕的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">通过努力获得：</font>to obtain (as a goal) through effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a stunning performance that notched up a second Academy Award for the actor 出色的表演为该演员拿到了第二座小金人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attain, bag, chalk up, clock up, gain, hit, log, make, rack up, ring up, score, win</div>
<h2>novel[sound:novel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">新奇的：</font>strikingly new, unusual, or different</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a novel scheme to collect money 一种新颖的筹钱手段</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]original, unaccustomed, unfamiliar, unheard-of, unknown, unprecedented</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]banal, timeworn, familiar, hackneyed, time-honored, tired, warmed-over 陈腐的</div>
<h2>noxious[sound:noxious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有害的，有毒的：</font>harmful to living things; injurious to health</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]noxious waste 有害的废弃物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unwholesome, baneful, deleterious, detrimental, nocuous, pernicious, wicked</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beneficial, salubrious, anodyne, benign, harmless, hurtless, innocent, innocuous, inoffensive, safe 有益的，无害的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">产生强烈厌恶的：</font>causing intense displeasure, disgust, or resentment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a noxious new breed of horror movie in which graphic depictions of torture are presented as entertainment在一部新的恐怖电影中，对于酷刑生动的描述被当做是娱乐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abhorrent, abominable, appalling, awful, disgusting, distasteful, dreadful, foul, fulsome, gross, hideous, horrid,  loathsome,  nasty,  nauseating,  noisome,  obnoxious,  odious,  repellent,  repugnant,  repulsive,  revolting, scandalous</div>
<h2>nuance[sound:nuance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">细微的差异：</font>a subtle distinction or variation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a poem of little depth and nuance 一首没有什么深度、没有什么辨识度的诗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]patent difference, lack of subtlety, sharp distinction, patency 明显的差别</div>
<h2>nudge[sound:nudge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">用肘推以引起注意：</font>to seek the attention of by a push of the elbow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]accidentally nudged me as he squeezed past  他过去的时候不小心用肘碰到了我</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">说服某人做某事：</font>to try to  persuade (someone) through earnest appeals to follow a course ofaction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the car salesman nudged me into taking a test-drive 汽车销售员说服我进行试驾</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]encourage, exhort, goad, press, prod, prompt</div>
<h2>nugatory[sound:nugatory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无关紧要的：</font>of little or no consequence; inconsequential</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the book is entertaining, but its contributions to Shakespearean scholarship are nugatory 这本书娱乐性不错，但是对于莎士比亚研究的贡献微不足道</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incidental, inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, negligible, trifling, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consequential,  eventful,  important, major, meaningful, momentous,  significant,  substantial, unfrivolous, weighty  重要的</div>
<h2>nurture[sound:nurture.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">提供营养：</font>to supply with nourishment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]nurtured her children through the winters with home-cooked soup 一整个冬天都给孩子们喂自制的汤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]withhold sustenance from 停止提供营养物</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">培育，培养：</font>to provide (someone) with moral or spiritual understanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he feels that his  lifelong practice of reading the Bible daily has nurtured  him  in ways he cannot describe一生中每天都阅读圣经在潜移默化中影响了他</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]edify, illuminate, inspire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impede, stunt, disregard 阻碍，漠视</div>
<h2>oath[sound:oath.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">誓言：</font>a solemn, formal declaration or promise to fulfill a pledge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an oath to defend the nation 保卫祖国的誓言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]pledge, troth, vow, word</div>
<h2>obdurate[sound:obdurate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固执的：</font>resistant to persuasion or softening influences</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She is known for her obdurate determination. 她以坚定不移著称。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant, hard-nosed, headstrong, inflexible, intransigent, pertinacious, stubborn, unbending,uncompromising, unrelenting, unyielding, willful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquiescent, agreeable, amenable, compliant, complying, flexible, pliable, pliant, relenting, yielding 温顺的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冷酷无情的：</font>having or showing a lack of sympathy or tender feelings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the obdurate refusal of the crotchety old man to let the neighborhood kids retrieve their ball from hisbackyard 那个怪老头冷酷无情地拒绝了孩子们进他后院找球的请求</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectless, callous, compassionless, hard-hearted, heartless, indurate, inhuman, insensate, ironhearted,merciless, remorseless, ruthless, unsparing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]charitable,  compassionate,  humane,  kindhearted,  kindly,  merciful,  softhearted,  sympathetic,  tender, warmhearted 同情的，有爱的</div>
<h2>obedient[sound:obedient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">服从的，顺从的：</font>submissive to the restraint or command of authority</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that girl is so obedient that she does everything the first time she is asked 这个妹子如此顺从，叫她做事随叫随到</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amenable, compliant, submissive, tractable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contumacious, imperial,  balky,  contrary,  contumacious,  defiant,  disobedient,  froward,  incompliant, insubordinate, intractable, noncompliant, obstreperous, rebel, rebellious, recalcitrant, refractory, restive, unamenable, ungovernable, unruly, untoward, wayward, willful  顽固的，不服从的</div>
<h2>obeisance[sound:obeisance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">敬礼，尊重：</font>a movement of the body made in token of respect or submission</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]makes obeisance to her mentors 向她的导师们致敬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]obeisant  恭敬的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impertinent, impudent, imperious 不敬的，无礼的</div>
<h2>obfuscate[sound:obfuscate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使困惑，使模糊：</font>to make so confused or opaque as to be difficult to perceive or understand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]obfuscate the reader 让读者困惑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]becloud, befog, blur, cloud, fog, muddy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demystify, elucidate, illuminate, clarify, explain clearly 澄清，阐明</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]obfuscated 模糊的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lucid  清晰的</div>
<h2>obligatory[sound:obligatory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">强制性的：</font>of the nature of an obligation; compulsory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]obligatory military service 强制性的服军役</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compulsory, imperative, involuntary, peremptory, required</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discretionary, selective, elective, optional, voluntary 自由选择的，志愿的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（见得多以至于）无聊的：</font>used or heard so often as to be dull</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the obligatory cliff-hanger endings for season finales of TV shows 电视剧总是以恶俗的惊心动魄的结局作为完季</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banal, cliché, commonplace, hack, hackneyed, moth-eaten, musty, shopworn, stereotyped, threadbare,timeworn, trite, well-worn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fresh, new, novel, original, unclichéd, unhackneyed 新奇的</div>
<h2>obliging[sound:obliging.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">乐于助人的：</font>willing to do favors</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an obliging concierge used his pull to get us reservations at the town's hottest restaurant 一个好心的看房人利用他的影响力帮我们在镇上最火爆的餐厅订到了座</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accommodative, friendly, indulgent</div>
<h2>oblique[sound:oblique.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">斜的：</font>inclined or twisted to one side</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gave the eavesdropper an oblique glance 给了偷听者一个白眼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]askew, cant, inclined, leaning, listing, slanted, sloping, tilted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]direct, even, level, straight 笔直的</div>
<h2>obliterate[sound:obliterate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">除去：</font>to remove from existence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the March snowstorm obliterated our hopes for an early spring 三月的暴风雪摧毁了我们对于一个早春的念想</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]efface, eradicate, expunge, expurgate, exterminate, extirpate, wipe out</div>
<h2>oblivious[sound:oblivious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不知道的，不知情的：</font>lacking conscious awareness; not informed about or aware of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He seemed oblivious to the fact that he had hurt her. 他似乎并不在意他伤害了她.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incognizant, insensible, unaware, unconscious, uninformed, unwitting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mindful,  vigilant, acquainted, cognizant, conscious, conversant, grounded, informed, knowing, mindful, witting 留意的，机警的</div>
<h2>obloquy[sound:obloquy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">谩骂，诽谤：</font>abusively detractive language or utterance; calumny</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]she unleashed a torrent of obloquy on her opponent 她滔滔不绝地辱骂了对手一顿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]billingsgate, fulmination, invective, scurrility, vitriol, vituperation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adulation  极度谄媚</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">恶名，耻辱：</font>the state of having lost the esteem of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the accused murderer was condemned to live out his days in perpetual obloquy 凶手终将在骂名中度过余生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discredit, disesteem, dishonor, disrepute, ignominy, infamy, odium, opprobrium, reproach, shame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]esteem, honor, respect 敬重，好名声</div>
<h2>obscure[sound:obscure.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">含义模糊的：</font>not  clearly  understood  or  expressed;  having  an  often  intentionally  veiled  oruncertain meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fantasy writer who likes to put lots of obscure references in her tales of wizards and warlocks 一个喜欢在巫师故事中添加很多含义模糊的引用的魔幻小说作家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambiguous, arcane, enigmatic, equivocal, fuliginous, inscrutable, opaque</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]explicit,  manifest, clear, certain, accessible, nonambiguous, obvious, plain, unambiguous, unequivocal明晰的，没有歧义的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平凡的，不知名的：</font>not prominent or famous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an obscure poet 无名的诗人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]noteless, uncelebrated, unfamous, unknown, unrecognized, unsung</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]legendary, celebrated, famed, famous, noted, notorious, prominent, renowned, well-known  有名的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]obscurity  无名之辈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]celebrity 名人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使模糊：</font>to make dark, dim, or indistinct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]when it isn't obscured by smog, the view of the city from the observatory can be spectacular 如果在晴朗的天气，从天文台看出去的城市全景非常赞</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blear, blur, darken, dim, overshadow, shroud</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elucidate, brighten, illuminate, light up, lighten 阐明</div>
<h2>obsequious[sound:obsequious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">谄媚的，奴性的：</font>marked by or exhibiting a fawning attentiveness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She's constantly followed by obsequious assistants who will do anything.  她总是有一群谄媚的跟班，原意为她赴汤蹈火。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]supercilious 目中无人的</div>
<h2>obsess[sound:obsess.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">迷住，使困扰：</font>to haunt or excessively preoccupy the mind of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The war obsesses her—she talks about nothing else. 她被战争彻底迷住了，张口闭口都谈这个。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]intense disgust 极度厌恶</div>
<h2>obstinate[sound:obstinate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固执的：</font>perversely adhering to an opinion, purpose, or course in spite of reason, arguments, orpersuasion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]obstinate resistance to change 坚决抵制改变</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant, headstrong, intransigent, stubborn, uncompromising, unyielding, willful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquiescent, agreeable, amenable, compliant, complying, flexible, pliable, pliant, relenting, yielding 顺从服从的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难于减轻或治愈的：</font>not easily subdued, remedied, or removed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]obstinate fever  高烧不退 || an obstinate headache 难以治愈的头痛</div>
<h2>obstreperous[sound:obstreperous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难驾驭的，任性的：</font>stubbornly resistant to control; unruly; given to resisting authority or another'scontrol</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the club's president was at his wits' end with obstreperous members who refused to cooperate 俱乐部主席拿那些不合作的会员一点办法都没有</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balky, defiant, incompliant, insubordinate, intractable, rebellious, recalcitrant, refractory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disciplined, amenable, biddable, compliant, conformable, docile, obedient, ruly, submissive, tractable 守纪律的，顺从的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">吵闹的：</font>engaging in or marked by loud and insistent cries especially of protest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an obstreperous crowd protesting the government's immigration policy 一堆吵闹的民众游行抗议政府的移民政策</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blatant, clamant, clamorous, squawking, vociferant</div>
<h2>obstruct[sound:obstruct.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">妨碍，制造困难：</font>to impede, retard, or interfere with; hinder; to create difficulty for the work oractivity of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was charged with obstructing justice by lying to investigators. 他被指控向检察官说谎，妨碍司法。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]encumber, fetter, handicap, hinder, impede, inhibit, stymie, interfere with</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]facilitate, abet, aid, assist 促进，帮助</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">阻挡：</font>to prevent passage through by filling with something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unobstructed view 无阻碍的视野</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]occlude 堵塞</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear, free, open up, unblock, unclog, unplug, unstop</div>
<h2>obtuse[sound:obtuse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">愚钝的：</font>not having or showing an ability to absorb ideas readily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Are you being deliberately obtuse  你是故意装笨吗 </div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dumb, fatuous, mindless, oafish, opaque, senseless, unintelligent, vacuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insightful,  apt,  brainy,  bright,  brilliant,  clever,  fast,  intelligent,  keen,  nimble,  quick,  quick-witted,  sharp, sharp-witted, smart 有洞察力的，智慧的</div>
<h2>obviate[sound:obviate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">排除，使不必要：</font>to anticipate and prevent (as a situation) or make unnecessary (as an action)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new treatment obviates the need for surgery. 新的疗法使手术不再是必须的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avert, forestall, preclude, stave off, head off</div>
<h2>occult[sound:occult.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难以理解的：</font>not easily apprehended or understood : abstruse, mysterious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an occult reference in the text that has puzzled scholars 文章中一处晦涩的难倒了学者们的引注</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambiguous, arcane, equivocal, inscrutable, opaque, impenetrable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bare, manifest, patent, readily fathomable 暴露的，可理解的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使隐藏或神秘：</font>to keep secret or shut off from view</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]occulted their house from prying eyes by planting large trees around it 在住所周围种满大树防止别人偷窥 || the actor's private life had long been occulted by a contrived public persona 演员的私人生活被一个精心打造的公众形象所遮掩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belie, blanket, cloak, conceal, cover, curtain, disguise, enshroud, mask, obscure, screen, shroud, suppress,veil, blot out, paper over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bare, disclose, display, divulge, expose, reveal, show, uncloak, uncover, unmask, unveil 暴露</div>
<h2>odium[sound:odium.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">憎恶，讨厌：</font>strong dislike, contempt, or aversion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]time did nothing to diminish the odium in which the traitor lived out his days 时间也没有减少大家对这个叛徒的唾弃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ignominy, infamy, obloquy, opprobrium</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]esteem, honor, respect, hankering, infatuation 尊敬，渴望，着迷</div>
<h2>offbeat[sound:offbeat.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不平常的：</font>noticeably different from what is generally found or experienced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]this writer has an enjoyably offbeat sense of humor 这个作者笑点很奇特</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extraordinary, peculiar, queer, unaccustomed, uncommon, uncustomary, out-of-the-way</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conventional, bathetic, hackneyed, common, ordinary, plain, usual 传统陈腐的，平常普通的</div>
<h2>offhand[sound:offhand.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">即兴的，没有准备的：</font>without premeditation or preparation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]couldn't give the figures offhand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ad-lib, extemporary, impromptu, improvised, unplanned, unpremeditated, unrehearsed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]considered, planned, premeditated, prepared, rehearsed 事先谋划的</div>
<h2>officious[sound:officious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多管闲事的：</font>thrusting oneself where one is not welcome or invited</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an officious little man who was always telling everyone else how to do their jobs 一个多管闲事的人，总喜欢对他人的事情指手画脚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]interfering, intruding, meddlesome, obtrusive, presuming, prying, snoopy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unobtrusive 不引人注目的</div>
<h2>offish[sound:offish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冷淡的：</font>Inclined to be distant and reserved; aloof</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]consistently surly and offish with the would-be suitors who came calling 对于追求者总是阴沉并且冷淡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aloof, detached, distant, remote, unbending, unsociable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sociable, cordial, friendly, social, warm 热情的</div>
<h2>off-key[sound:off-key.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不寻常的，不合适的：</font>being out of accord with what is considered normal or appropriate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a high-flown, off-key speech by a newcomer 来自于新手的颇有野心、不寻常的一次演讲</div>
<h2>ominous[sound:ominous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凶兆的：</font>of or being an omen, especially an evil one</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an ominous threat of war 战争来临的凶兆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baleful, foreboding, inauspicious, portentous, sinister, threatening, minatory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]auspicious, unthreatening 吉兆的，不具有威胁的</div>
<h2>omniscient[sound:omniscient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无所不知的：</font>possessed of universal or complete knowledge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an omniscient deity 无所不知的神</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vacuous 无知的</div>
<h2>onerous[sound:onerous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">费时间花心思的：</font>requiring much time, effort, or careful attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]building the scale model of the frigate was an onerous task  建造军舰的小模型非常花时间</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arduous, burdensome, challenging, exacting, grueling, taxing, toilsome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]requiring little effort, light, nondemanding, unchallenging, undemanding 轻松的，不费劲的</div>
<h2>opaque[sound:opaque.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不透光的：</font>impenetrable by light; neither transparent nor translucent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blurry, dim, misty, murky, obscure, shadowy, unclear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diaphanous, transparent  精致透明的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">晦涩的：</font>so obscure as to be unintelligible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]opaque prose  晦涩的诗歌</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambiguous, arcane, enigmatic, equivocal, inscrutable, occult</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear, accessible, obvious, plain, unambiguous, unequivocal 清晰易懂的</div>
<h2>opine[sound:opine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">表达观点：</font>to express opinions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You can opine about any subject you like. 你可以畅所欲言。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comment, editorialize, note, observe, reflect, weigh in</div>
<h2>opportune[sound:opportune.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">合适的，适当的：</font>suitable or convenient for a particular occurrence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an opportune moment 方便的时机</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]seasonable, well-timed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconvenient, untimely, inappropriate, unseasonable 不合适的</div>
<h2>opprobrious[sound:opprobrious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. 辱骂的: expressing contemptuous reproach; scornful or abusive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]opprobrious language  脏话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]scurrilous, vitriolic, vituperative, contumelious</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. 臭名昭著的，令人鄙视的: bringing disgrace; shameful or infamous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]opprobrious conduct 令人鄙视的行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discreditable, disgraceful, dishonorable, ignominious, infamous, notorious, shameful, unrespectable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]irreproachable, honorable, reputable, respectable  无可指责的，受人尊敬的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]opprobrium 恶名</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]good repute 好名声</div>
<h2>oration[sound:oration.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（颇有野心、自高自大的）演说：</font>a speech delivered in a high-flown or pompous manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]address, declamation, harangue, peroration</div>
<h2>orient[sound:orient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">确定方向，使熟悉或适应：</font>to set or arrange in any determinate position especially in relation tothe points of the compass; to make familiar with or adjusted to facts, principles, or a situation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]orient students toward a career in medicine 指导学生从事医学的职业道路</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accustom, familiarize, initiate, introduce, orientate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confuse 使迷惑</div>
<h2>original[sound:original.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">创新的：</font>independent and creative in thought or action :inventive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The car has a highly original design. 这车的设计很新颖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ingenious, innovative, inventive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commonplace, banal, trite, familiar, hackneyed, time-honored, tired, warmed-over 陈腐的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">最初的，最早的：</font>coming before all others in time or order</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the original plan had to be discarded when the situation changed drastically 当环境发生剧烈变化时，最初的计划就该被放弃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]earliest, foremost, headmost, inaugural, initial, leadoff, maiden, pioneer, premier, virgin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]final, last, latter, terminal, ultimate 最终的</div>
<h2>orthodox[sound:orthodox.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">传统的：</font>following or agreeing with established form, custom, or rules</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He believes in the benefits of both orthodox medicine and alternative medicine. 他既相信传统药物又相信替代药物的效用。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ceremonial, conventional, regular, routine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]casual, freewheeling, informal, irregular, unceremonious, unconventional, unorthodox 不常见的</div>
<h2>oscillate[sound:oscillate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">振动，摇晃：</font>to swing backward and forward like a pendulum</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]remain static 静止</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">犹豫，变化：</font>vary between opposing beliefs, feelings, or theories</div>
<h2>ossify[sound:ossify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">硬化，僵化：</font>to become hardened or conventional and opposed to change</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a disease that ossifies the joints  一种会使关节僵化的疾病</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]make pliant, transcend conventions, amenable to change 使柔软，超越传统</div>
<h2>ostentatious[sound:ostentatious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">炫耀卖弄的：</font>marked by or fond of conspicuous  or vainglorious and sometimes  pretentiousdisplay</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wears an ostentatious diamond ring on her finger 她手指上戴着一枚巨大的钻戒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flamboyant, flaring, flashy, splashy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]modest, artless, austere, unpretentious, conservative, quiet, understated, unflamboyant, unflashy  谦让的，朴素的，保守地</div>
<h2>ostracize[sound:ostracize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">驱逐：</font>to exclude from a group</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was ostracized from the scientific community for many years because of his  radical political beliefs.他因激进的政治理想被驱逐出了科学界很多年。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banish, bounce, chase, dismiss, expel, extrude, oust, boot out, cast out, run off, drum out, kick out, throwout, turf out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]take in, include, embrace, welcome 接纳</div>
<h2>oust[sound:oust.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">免职：</font>to remove from a position of prominence or power (as a throne)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be ousted from power 被赶下台</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deprive, displace, uncrown, unthrone</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]instate, crown, enthrone, throne  任命</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">驱逐：</font>to drive or force out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]she was ousted from her job after it was proven she'd been pilfering company supplies 她贪污公司财物这事被证实后，她被驱逐了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banish, boot out, cast out, chase, dismiss, drum out, expel, extrude, kick out, throw out, turf out, turn out</div>
<h2>outgoing[sound:outgoing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">友好的，外向的：</font>openly friendly and responsive: extroverted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a salesman whose aggressively outgoing personality could sometimes be overbearing  一个销售员如果过于热情会让人不能忍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]companionable, extroverted, gregarious, sociable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]antisocial, introverted, nongregarious, reclusive, unsociable, unsocial 不合群的，不善交际的</div>

<h2>outmaneuver[sound:outmaneuver.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">以策略取胜：</font>to overcome (an opponent) by artful, clever maneuvering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]outmaneuvered his congressional opponent 以计谋战胜了国会的对手</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]outfox, outslick, outsmart, outthink, outwit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]yield  屈服</div>
<h2>outset[sound:outset.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">开端，开始：</font>beginning, start</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I wish you'd mentioned this problem at the outset.  我希望你开门见山就提到这个问题。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alpha, commencement, genesis, inception, incipience, nascence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]termination, close, conclusion, end, ending, omega 终止</div>

<h2>overbearing[sound:overbearing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">专横傲慢的：</font>domineering in manner; arrogant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her husband's overbearing manner made her miserable. 她的丈夫专横傲慢，让她痛不欲生。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]authoritative, despotic, dictatorial, imperious, masterful, peremptory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]meek, unassuming 谦逊的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">压倒一切的，在力量或重要性上势不可挡的；支配的，显著的：</font>overwhelming  in  power  orsignificance; predominant, coming before all others in importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the overbearing problem in our nation's schools 我国中小学教育的最突出的问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capital, cardinal, central, chief, dominant, key, leading, master, number one,  overmastering, overriding, paramount, predominant, preeminent, premier, primary, prior, sovereign, supreme</div>
<h2>overlap[sound:overlap.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">重叠，重复：</font>to occupy the same area in part</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Baseball season overlaps football season in September. 棒球赛季和橄榄球赛季在九月有时间重合。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lap, overlay, overlie, overspread</div>
<h2>overt[sound:overt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">明显的，公开的：</font>open and observable; not hidden, concealed, or secret</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]overt hostility 公然的敌意</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]shadowy  模糊的</div>
<h2>overture[sound:overture.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">前言：</font>an introductory section or part, as of a poem; a prelude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]preamble, preliminary, prologue, warm-up, curtain-raiser</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">序曲：</font>an instrumental composition intended especially as an introduction to an extended work,such as an opera or oratorio</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the parade down Main Street served as the overture for a weekend of fun and festivities 主干道上的游行活动拉开了一周节日活动的序幕</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coda  结尾</div>
<h2>oxymoron[sound:oxymoron.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">矛盾修饰法：</font>a combination of contradictory or incongruous words</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The phrase “cruel kindness” is an oxymoron. “残酷的仁慈”就是矛盾修饰法的一个例子。|| The  phrase“Broadway rock musical” is an oxymoron. Broadway doesn't have the nerve to let the really hard stuff in the house.“百老汇的摇滚音乐剧”是个反讽。百老汇才不会允许吵吵闹闹的东西在里面演出。</div>
<h2>pacify[sound:pacify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使平静，安慰：</font>to ease the anger or agitation of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pacify a crying child 安抚一个哭泣的孩子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appease, assuage, conciliate, mollify, placate, propitiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]incite, rankle, tantrum, vex, discompose, truculent  煽动激起</div>
<h2>padding[sound:padding.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">夸张，废话：</font>the representation of something in terms that go beyond the facts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that feature writer is sometimes guilty of padding, but he keeps it from getting out of hand 这作者有时候夸夸其谈，但是保持了适度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]caricature,  coloring,  elaboration,  embellishment,  embroidery,  hyperbole,  magnification,  overstatement,stretching</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]meiosis, understatement 轻描淡写</div>
<h2>paean[sound:paean.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">欢乐颂：</font>a joyous song or hymn of praise, tribute, thanksgiving, or triumph</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]her retirement party featured many paeans for her long years of service to the company 她的退休派对满是对她多年在公司辛勤工作的赞颂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accolade, citation, dithyramb, eulogium, eulogy, hymn, panegyric, tribute</div>
<h2>painstaking[sound:painstaking.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">煞费苦心的：</font>taking pains: expending, showing, or involving diligent care and effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It took months of painstaking research to write the book. 这本书的写作耗费了几个月的苦心研究。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careful, conscientious, fussy, meticulous, scrupulous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]slipshod, cursory, careless 漫不经心的，草率的</div>
<h2>palatable[sound:palatable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">感到愉悦满足的：</font>giving pleasure or contentment to the mind or senses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I always associate the palatable aroma of roasting turkey with Thanksgiving. 我总是把香喷喷的烤火鸡的味道和感恩节联系起来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agreeable, blessed, congenial, delectable, delightful, delightsome, dreamy, dulcet, enjoyable, felicitous,grateful, gratifying, heavenly, jolly, luscious, pleasurable, satisfying, savory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disagreeable, pleasureless, unpalatable, unpleasant, unwelcome 不愉悦的</div>
<h2>palatial[sound:palatial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">宫殿般奢华的：</font>of the nature of a palace, as in spaciousness or ornateness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a palatial penthouse apartment  一套豪华的顶层公寓</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deluxe, lavish, luxuriant, opulent, sumptuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ascetic, austere, humble, no-frills, spartan</div>
<h2>pall[sound:pall.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">失去兴趣：</font>to lose in interest or attraction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His humor began to pall on us. 他的幽默开始使我们生腻了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]interest, intrigue 激发兴趣</div>
<h2>palliate[sound:palliate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">平息，减轻：</font>to make less severe or intense; mitigate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]palliative drug  缓解剂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allay, alleviate, assuage, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soothe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggravate, exacerbate, worsen, increase intensity  加剧，恶化</div>
<h2>pallid[sound:pallid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无生气的，缺乏活力的：</font>lacking in radiance or vitality; dull</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The movie is a pallid version of the classic novel. 这部经典小说改编的电影很苍白无力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]piquant 兴奋的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">苍白无血色的：</font>having an abnormally pale or wan complexion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a pallid girl who looked as though she'd never seen the sun 一个面色苍白的姑娘，仿佛从来没有晒过太阳</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ashen, ashy, blanched, pasty, wan</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rubicund, blooming, florid, flush, full-blooded, glowing, ruddy, sanguine 红润的</div>
<h2>palmy[sound:palmy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">繁荣的：</font>marked by prosperity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the palmy days of the British drama 英国戏剧的繁荣时期</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flourishing, prosperous, thriving, booming, lush, roaring, halcyon</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]failed, depressed, unprosperous, unsuccessful 不成功，不繁荣的</div>
<h2>palpable[sound:palpable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">摸得到的：</font>capable of being touched or felt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a small but palpable lump in my neck 我脖子上有一块小但是能摸得到的肿块</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]touchable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impalpable, intangible</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">明显的，易觉察的：</font>easily perceived; obvious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a palpable difference 易觉察的差别</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprehensible, detectable, discernible, distinguishable, sensible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]imperceptible, inappreciable, indistinguishable, insensible, undetectable 隐晦的，细微的</div>
<h2>palter[sound:palter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">欺骗：</font>to act insincerely or deceitfully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]unwilling to palter over the price of the house  拒绝对房子漫天要价</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chaffer, deal, dicker, haggle, horse-trade, negotiate, equivocate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]candor 坦率</div>
<h2>paltry[sound:paltry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无价值的；微不足道的：</font>lacking in importance or worth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]used a paltry, underhanded scheme to get him fired 用一个微小卑鄙的手段炒了他鱿鱼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, niggling, piddling, piffling, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]significant, important, big, consequential, considerable, material  意义重大的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">让人厌恶，让人鄙视的：</font>arousing or deserving of one's loathing and disgust</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a paltry, underhanded scheme to get someone fired 一个卑鄙的炒掉某人的计谋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheap, cruddy, deplorable, despicable, grubby, lame, lousy, mean, scummy, scurvy, sneaking, wretched</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]admirable, commendable, creditable, laudable, meritorious, praiseworthy 令人尊敬的</div>
<h2>pan[sound:pan.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v./n. 严厉批评：a harsh criticism</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]almost all the movie critics have panned this latest sequel in a tired series 几乎所有的影评家都批评这部最新续集，认为是狗尾续貂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blame, censure, condemn, denounce, dispraise, reprehend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eulogize, extol, rave, laud, praise 称赞</div>
<h2>panache[sound:panache.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">炫耀：</font>dash or flamboyance in style and action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The BBC Symphony Orchestra played with great panache.  BBC 交响乐队</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humility, unremarkable behavior, dullness 谦逊，寻常举止，平庸乏味</div>
<h2>pandemic[sound:pandemic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大范围流行的：</font>widespread; general</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pandemic malaria  大规模的疟疾</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]limited 有限的</div>
<h2>pandemonium[sound:pandemonium.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">喧嚣，骚动：</font>wild uproar or noise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Christmas morning at our house is always marked by pandemonium  圣诞节的早上总是免不了一番吵吵闹闹</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bluster, bustle, disturbance, furor, fuss, hubbub, moil, pother, ruckus, ruction, tumult, turmoil, uproar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]serene 安静</div>
<h2>panegyric[sound:panegyric.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">赞颂之词：</font>a eulogistic oration or writing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wrote a panegyric on the centennial of the Nobel laureate's birth 为诺贝尔获得者百年诞辰纪念日写了一篇溢美之词</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accolade, citation, commendation, dithyramb, eulogium, eulogy, hymn, paean</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]anathema, denunciation, condemnation 诅咒，谴责</div>
<h2>panoramic[sound:panoramic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">全景的：</font>of an unobstructed or complete view of an area in every direction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a panorama of American history  美国历史总览</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compendious, complete, comprehensive, cyclopedic, embracive, exhaustive, thorough, in-depth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]narrow 狭窄的</div>
<h2>parable[sound:parable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">寓言：</font>a story intended to teach a basic truth or moral about life</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the parable in which the repentant sinner is compared to the returning prodigal son 这个寓言故事将不愿悔过的罪人和回头的浪子进行了比较</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apologue, fable</div>
<h2>paradigm[sound:paradigm.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">典范，模范：</font>one that serves as a pattern or model</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was the paradigm of the successful man. 他是成功人士的典范</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]archetype, example, exemplar, ideal, model, pattern, paragon</div>
<h2>paradise[sound:paradise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">天堂，极乐世界：</font>an often imaginary place or state of utter perfection and happiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an idealist who trotted the globe looking for paradise 一个奔波于全世界以寻找一片乐土的理想主义者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bliss, empyrean, heaven, nirvana, utopia</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hell, inferno 地狱</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">快乐，狂喜：</font>a state of overwhelming usually pleasurable emotion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]that early stage of a romance when lovers are in paradise 爱情初期，当恋人们都处于快乐兴奋的状态时</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elation, euphoria, exhilaration, intoxication, rapture, rhapsody, transport</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dejection, depression, gloominess, melancholy 沮丧，哀伤</div>
<h2>paradox[sound:paradox.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">表面矛盾实际可能正确的话，悖论：</font>a statement that is seemingly contradictory or  opposed tocommon sense and yet is perhaps true</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less. 存在的一个悖论就是：如果渔民减少捕鱼量的话，他们将会捕到更多的鱼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dichotomy, incongruity</div>
<h2>paragon[sound:paragon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">优秀模范：</font>a model of excellence or perfection of a kind; a peerless example</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a paragon of good husband 模范好丈夫</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]archetype, example, exemplar, ideal, model, pattern, paradigm</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">把…比作；显示相似：</font>to compare with; parallel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]paragon retreat with treachery 把撤退比作是背叛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assimilate, compare, equate, liken, match, parallel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contrast 对比，对照以产生反差</div>
<h2>paramount[sound:paramount.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">最重要的：</font>of chief concern or importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The paramount goal is to restore the colonial-era house with complete historical accuracy. 最重要的任务就是十分精确地依照历史重建殖民时期的建筑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cardinal, chief, key, leading, main, predominant, preeminent, primary, principal, supreme</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ancillary, secondary 次要的；paltry, petty, trifling, trivial 不重要的</div>
<h2>paranoid[sound:paranoid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多疑的，对他人极端恐惧和怀疑的：</font>exhibiting or characterized by extreme and irrational fear ordistrust of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a paranoid suspicion that the phone might be bugged 疑神疑鬼地担心电话被窃听了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]distrustful, nervous, suspicious, unbelieving, worried</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]credulous 轻信的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]paranoia n. 偏执狂</div>
<h2>paraphrase[sound:paraphrase.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">转述，意译，改写：</font>to express something (as a text or statement) in different words</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Could you please paraphrase your diagnosis of my health condition, using simpler language  您能否用更通俗的话语转述一下您对我健康状况的诊断呢</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rephrase, restate, reword, translate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]quote （不加以修改地）引用</div>
<h2>parch[sound:parch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">烤干：</font>to make extremely dry, especially by exposure to heat</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]parch a surface from exposure to sun 通过太阳照射烤干一个面</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dehydrate, desiccate, dry, scorch, sear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]douse, drench, hydrate, steep, wash, water, wet 弄湿</div>
<h2>parenthesis[sound:parenthesis.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">间断：</font>an interruption of continuity; an interval</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a parenthesis in an otherwise solid marriage 在本该是完满婚姻中的一个插曲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discontinuity, interim, interlude, intermission, interregnum, interruption, interstice, interval</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continuation, continuity 持续不断；resumption 继续</div>
<h2>pariah[sound:pariah.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">被排斥或鄙视的人：</font>one that is despised or rejected, outcast</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I felt like a pariah when I wore the wrong outfit to the dinner party. 当我穿着不恰当的礼服赴宴时，我感觉自己被别人狠狠地鄙视了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]castaway, castoff, leper, reject</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]respectable person 值得尊敬的人</div>
<h2>parity[sound:parity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">相称，同等，平等：</font>the quality or state of being equal or equivalent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to achieve parity with our commercial competitors  取得与我们的商业竞争对手同等的地位</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coequality, coordinateness, equality, equivalency, par, sameness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disparity, imparity, inequality 不公平；incommensurateness  不相称</div>
<h2>parody[sound:parody.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（以嘲笑原作作者的）模仿作品：</font>a literary or musical work in which the style of an author or workis closely imitated for comic effect or in ridicule</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Back Dormitory Boys specialize in parody of Backstreet Boys. 后舍男生擅长恶搞后街男孩。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burlesque, caricature, spoof, travesty</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">模仿（以嘲弄）：</font>to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]parodying a public figure's mannerisms 模仿嘲弄一个公共人物的举止</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]imitate, mock, mimic</div>
<h2>paroxysm[sound:paroxysm.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（感情、动作的）突发：</font>a sudden outburst of emotion or action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a paroxysm of coughing  突然一阵咳嗽</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burst, ebullition, eruption, explosion, flare, flash, flush, gush, outburst, storm</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（政治、社会领域的）大动荡：</font>a violent disturbance (as of the political or social order)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Darwin's introduction of the theory of evolution created paroxysms in both religion and science that are stillbeing felt today. 达尔文提出的进化论给宗教界和科学界都带来了巨大的冲击，时至今日我们仍然可以感觉到</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bouleversement, cataclysm, earthquake, hurricane, storm, tempest, tumult, upheaval, uproar</div>
<h2>parrot[sound:parrot.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（机械地）模仿，复制：</font>to repeat or imitate, especially without understanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]parrot others blindly 盲目地人云亦云</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]copy, ditto, duplicate, echo, quote</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coin, create, devise, invent  创造</div>
<h2>parry[sound:parry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">躲避（问题）：</font>to evade especially by an adroit answer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He parried the embarrassing question with a clever reply. 他以巧妙的回答躲避了这个令人尴尬的问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avoid, dodge, elude, eschew, evade, finesse, scape, shirk, shun</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confront, face, meet 面对；embrace 欣然接受</div>
<h2>parsimonious[sound:parsimonious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">过度节俭的，吝啬的：</font>frugal to the point of stinginess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the stereotype of the dour and parsimonious Scotsman 严肃而吝啬的苏格兰人的典型代表</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]closefisted, mean, mingy, miserly, niggardly, penurious, stinting, tight, tightfisted, uncharitable, ungenerous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]generous, liberal, munificent  慷慨的；dissolute, extravagant, prodigal, wasteful 浪费的，挥霍的</div>
