<h2>partial[sound:partial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">偏袒的，偏爱的：</font>inclined to favor one party more than the other: biased</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is partial to Maverick. 他偏爱小牛队</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]biased, one-sided, partisan, prejudiced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disinterested, equitable, evenhanded, fair, impartial, neutral, objective, unbiased, unprejudiced 公平的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">部分的，不完整的：</font>lacking some necessary part</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a partial answer to the problem 一部分的解答</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deficient, fragmental, fragmentary, half, halfway</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]complete, entire, full, intact, integral, perfect, whole 完整的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]partially adv. 部分地；partiality n. 偏袒，偏爱</div>
<h2>particularize[sound:particularize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">详述：</font>to go into or give details or particulars</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]particularize the rules you must observe 详述了你需要遵守的规定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]detail, specificate, specify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abbreviate, abridge, condense, shorten 删减内容</div>
<h2>partisan[sound:partisan.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">跟随者，信徒：</font>one who follows the opinions or teachings of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Partisans of the charismatic leader refuse to tolerate any criticism of him at all. 跟随者们不允许任何有关他们富有魅力的领导的负面言论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acolyte, adherent, disciple, pupil, votary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bellwether, leader 领导者</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（狂热、坚定的）拥护者，支持者：</font>one who is intensely or excessively devoted to a cause</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a partisan of the revolution who was even willing to give her life for it  一个愿意为了革命献出自己生命的坚定拥护者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crusader, fanatic, ideologue, zealot, true believer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adversary, antagonist, opponent 反对者</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">偏袒的：</font>inclined to favor one side over another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a shamelessly partisan news report 一篇无耻的、有倾向性的新闻报道</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]biased, one-sided, partial, prejudiced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disinterested, equitable, evenhanded, fair, impartial, neutral, objective, unbiased, unprejudiced 公平的</div>
<h2>pastiche[sound:pastiche.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（带嘲讽的）模仿：</font>a literary, artistic, musical, or architectural work that imitates the style of previouswork, often with satirical intent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a pastiche of Botticelli's Birth of Venus 波提且利画作《维纳斯的诞生》的仿品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burlesque, caricature, imitation, parody, spoof, travesty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]original work 原作</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大杂烩：</font>a pasticcio of incongruous parts; a hodgepodge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a pastiche of dishes from many countries  来自众多国家的饮食杂烩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agglomerate, collage, hodgepodge, jumble, jungle, medley, montage, motley, salad, variety, welter</div>
<h2>partition[sound:partition.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">分割，划分：</font>the act or process of dividing something into parts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the partition of Czechoslovakia into the Czech Republic and Slovakia 捷克斯洛伐克被分裂成捷克共和国和斯洛伐克</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bifurcation, breakup, cleavage, disunion, division, fractionalization, schism, scission, split, sundering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unification, union 联合</div>
<h2>patent[sound:patent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">显而易见的，明显的：</font>readily visible or intelligible: obvious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Unfortunately, the patent flaw  of the proposal did not deter the city council from putting it up for a vote.不幸的是，尽管提案中有着显而易见的缺陷，市议会依然将它拿出来进行投票</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apparent, blatant, conspicuous, evident, flagrant, manifest, obvious, plain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concealed, hidden, invisible 隐藏的，不可见的</div>
<h2>pathological[sound:pathological.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不正常的，病态的：</font>being such to a degree that is extreme, excessive, or markedly abnormal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She has a pathological fear of snakes. 她对蛇有一种病态的恐惧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abnormal, aberrant, anomalous, morbid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]normal  正常的；natural  自然的</div>
<h2>patina[sound:patina.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">外表：</font>a superficial covering or exterior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a superficial patina of knowledge  表面肤浅的知识</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fa ade, hull, skin, veneer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]essential quality 本质；core, kernel 核心</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（由内而外散发的）氛围，气场：</font>an appearance or aura that is derived from association, habit, orestablished character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Although the winery is brand-new, it has been constructed and decorated to give it a patina of old-worldquaintness. 尽管酿酒厂是全新建造的，但它的构造和装饰都刻意营造出一种古色古香的奇异氛围</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]air, ambience, aroma, atmosphere, climate, flavor, halo, odor, smell, temper, vibration</div>
<h2>patrician[sound:patrician.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">贵族，名门望族：</font>a man or woman of high birth or social position</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the rank of a patrician 贵族等级</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aristocrat, noble, blue blood</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plebeian 平民，庶民</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贵族的，地位高的：</font>of high birth, rank, or station</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]came from a patrician family 出身贵族世家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aristocratic, genteel, gentle, grand, great, highborn, highbred, upper-class, wellborn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]baseborn, common, humble, ignoble, low, lower-class, mean 地位低下的</div>
<h2>patriot[sound:patriot.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">爱国者：</font>one who loves his or her country and supports its authority and interests</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The USA PATRIOT Act has generated a great deal of controversy since its enactment.  自实施之日起，美国的《爱国者法案》就产生了大量的争议‖a fanatical patriot 狂热的爱国者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]loyalist, nationalist, partisan</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apostate, recreant, renegade, traitor, turncoat  叛徒；insurgent, mutineer, rebel 叛乱者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]patriotism n. 爱国主义</div>
<h2>patronize[sound:patronize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">赞助：</font>provide aid or support for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a company that loyally patronizes the arts 一个一直以来坚持赞助艺术界的公司</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advocate, back, champion, endorse, support, uphold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]baffle, foil, frustrate, sabotage 阻挠，从中破坏</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">以高人一等的态度对待：</font>to adopt an air of condescension toward : treat haughtily or coolly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a director with an unpleasant habit of patronizing even his most gifted actors 一个有着令人讨厌习惯的导演，他即便是对手下最有才华的演员也傲慢地对待</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]condescend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]patron n. 赞助人</div>
<h2>paucity[sound:paucity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">少量，缺乏：</font>smallness of number; dearth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an extreme paucity of natural resources 极度缺乏自然资源</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dearth, deficit, drought, inadequacy, insufficiency, lack, scantiness, scarcity, shortage, undersupply, want</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abundance, adequacy, amplitude, opulence, plenitude, sufficiency, wealth 大量，丰富</div>
<h2>paunchy[sound:paunchy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大腹便便，大肚子的：</font>having a potbelly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a paunchy middle-aged man 一个大腹便便的中年男子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]corpulent, fat, potbellied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]slender, slim, svelte, thin 瘦的，苗条的</div>
<h2>peck[sound:peck.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大量：</font>a considerable amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Now you're in a peck of trouble.  现在你有一堆麻烦了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundance, bunch, bundle, dozen, mass, mountain, much, multiplicity, myriad, pile, plenitude, profusion,ton, volume, wealth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bit, glimmer, handful, hint, little, mite, nip, ounce, peanuts, pittance, spot, sprinkle, trace 少量</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（不情愿地）小口咬：</font>to eat reluctantly and in small bites</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Fashion models never really eat: they just peck at small meals in expensive restaurants. 时装模特们几乎不吃东西——他们只是随便咬一口昂贵餐厅里的食物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bite, nibble, sip, tipple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]devour, gobble, gorge, guzzle, quaff, swill 贪婪地吃喝，大口吃喝</div>
<h2>pedagogue[sound:pedagogue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">教育者，老师：</font>a person whose occupation is to give formal instruction in a school</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a boring pedagogue who is called “PPT reader” 一个被戏称为“幻灯片朗读机”的无聊老师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]educator, instructor, preceptor, teacher</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disciple, pupil, student 弟子，学生</div>
<h2>pedant[sound:pedant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">书呆子，墨守成规之人：</font>one who pays undue attention to book learning and formal rules</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is a perfect type of pedant. 他是个十足的书呆子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doctrinaire, dogmatist</div>
<h2>predestine[sound:predestine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">预先注定：</font>to determine the fate of in advance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Our victory in the tournament was seemingly predestined. 我们在锦标赛中的胜利似乎是注定好了的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doom, fate, foredoom, foreordain, ordain, predestine, predetermine, preordain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]predestination n. 命中注定</div>
<h2>pedestrian[sound:pedestrian.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">行人：</font>a person traveling on foot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a lane reserved for pedestrians 行人专用道</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]footer, walker</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rider  骑手</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平庸无奇的，令人厌倦的：</font>causing weariness, restlessness, or lack of interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His style is so pedestrian that the book becomes a real bore. 他的风格是如此平庸以至于整本书显得非常无聊</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arid, dreary, dull, flat, jading, jejune, monochromatic, monotonous, stale, stodgy, tedious, wearisome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 吸引人的</div>
<h2>peep[sound:peep.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">一瞥：</font>a brief and sometimes furtive look</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]take a peep at the new neighbors 偷偷瞄了我们的新邻居一眼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gander, glance, glimpse, peek</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">轻声：</font>a slight sound or utterance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I haven't heard a peep out of the children for an hour.我已经一个小时没听到孩子们的声音了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mumble, murmur, mutter, twitter, whisper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clamor, noise, outcry, roar 喧哗，吵闹</div>
<h2>peer[sound:peer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">同等地位的人，同辈：</font>a person who has equal standing with others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]stand out among peers 在同辈当中很出众</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coequal, compeer, coordinate, counterpart, equivalent, fellow, match, parallel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inferior 地位更低的人；superior 地位更高的人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">好奇地凝视：</font>to look narrowly or curiously;</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]peer at the variety of marine life in the aquarium's huge tank 好奇地注视着巨大水族箱中丰富多样的海洋生物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blink, gape, gawk, gaze, goggle, rubberneck, stare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]glance, glimpse 投去一瞥</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]peerless adj. 无与伦比的，不可比拟的</div>
<h2>peeve[sound:peeve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">打扰，惹恼：</font>to disturb the peace of mind of (someone) especially by repeated disagreeable acts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be constantly peeved by his affected flattery 总是被他做作的谄媚所惹恼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, annoy, bother, exasperate, frost, gall, irk, nettle, pique, rile, ruffle, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]becalm, compose, lull, lullaby, quiet, salve, settle, soothe, still, tranquilize  使镇定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]peevish adj. 易怒的，脾气不好的</div>
<h2>pejorative[sound:pejorative.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">轻蔑的，贬低的：</font>disparaging; belittling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I agree that I am ambitious, and I don't see it as a pejorative term. 我承认我“雄心勃勃”，但我并不认为这是一个贬义词</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belittling, contemptuous, degrading, deprecatory, depreciative, derogative, disdainful, disparaging, scornful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commendatory, complimentary, laudatory 赞美的</div>
<h2>pellucid[sound:pellucid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">透明的：</font>admitting the passage of light</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pellucid spring water 清澈透明的泉水</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crystal, crystalline, limpid, liquid, lucent, transparent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]opaque 不透明的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">清晰明确的，易懂的：</font>transparently clear in style or meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her poetry has a pellucid simplicity that betrays none of the sweat that went into writing it. 她的诗歌风格十分清新简约，丝毫没有体现出她为此付出的汗水</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apparent, distinct, evident, lucid, manifest, obvious, palpable, patent, perspicuous, plain, straightforward</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clouded, cryptic, enigmatic, indistinct, mysterious, obfuscated, obscure 模糊难懂的</div>
<h2>pen[sound:pen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">监狱：</font>a place of confinement for persons held in lawful custody</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]spent six years in a federal pen  在联邦监狱中度过了六年</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bastille, coop, jail , prison, stockade</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">关押，监禁：</font>to close or shut in by or as if by barriers</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]remember to pen up the dogs when visitors come over  客人来的时候别忘了把狗给关起来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]box, encage, encase, envelop, fence, hedge, immure, include, wall</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]release 释放；enfranchise, free, liberate, set free 使自由</div>
<h2>penalty[sound:penalty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（对罪行的）处罚：</font>a punishment established by law or authority for a crime or offense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The maximum penalty is 7 years’ imprisonment. 最为严厉的惩罚是七年的有期徒刑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fine, forfeit, punishment, retribution</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]honor, reward  奖励</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]penalize    v. 处以惩罚</div>
<h2>penchant[sound:penchant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">强烈嗜好，迷恋：</font>a strong and continued inclination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a penchant for Champaign  非常喜爱香槟</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affection, bias, disposition, leaning, partiality, predilection, predisposition, proclivity, propensity, tendency</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aversion, disfavor, disinclination, dislike, distaste, loathing, repugnance, repulsion  反感</div>
<h2>penitent[sound:penitent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">悔过的：</font>feeling or expressing humble or regretful pain or sorrow for sins or offenses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a penitentbusinessman who had come to ask for forgiveness 一个来寻求宽恕的决定悔过自新的商人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apologetic, compunctious, regretful, remorseful, repentant, rueful, sorry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impenitent, remorseless, unapologetic, unrepentant 不知悔改的</div>
<h2>pensive[sound:pensive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">沉思的，（尤指）哀思的：</font>given to or marked by long, quiet and often musingly sadthinking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Rainy days often put her in a pensive mood. 雨天总是让她陷入深深的思考之中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]broody, cogitative, meditative, melancholy, musing, reflective, ruminant, ruminative, thoughtful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mindless, thoughtless, unreflective 不加思考的</div>
<h2>penury[sound:penury.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">贫穷：</font>extreme dearth; barrenness or insufficiency</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some have pessimistically regarded the higher education in China as an invisible and irresistible path topenury. 有人悲观地把中国的高等教育看作是一条通往贫穷的通道——无形但不可抗拒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]destitution, impecuniosity, impoverishment, indigence, neediness, poorness, poverty, want</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]affluence, opulence, richness, wealth 富裕</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">吝啬，节俭：</font>extreme and often niggardly frugality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They bitterly complained about their father's penury. 他们哀怨地抱怨父亲的节俭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]closeness, miserliness, niggardliness, parsimony, penuriousness, stinginess, tightfistedness, tightness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]generosity, largesse, munificence, openhandedness, philanthropy 慷慨的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]penurious adj. 贫穷的；吝啬的</div>
<h2>perambulate[sound:perambulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">徒步穿越，走过：</font>to travel over or through especially on foot for exercise or pleasure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We decided to lazily perambulate the entire length of the esplanade and enjoy the fresh air. 我们决定悠哉地徒步走过滨海大道，享受清新的空气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amble, cross, go, navigate, pass, peregrinate, proceed, ramble, transit, travel, traverse</div>
<h2>perceptible[sound:perceptible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可察觉的：</font>capable of being perceived especially by the senses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You should be able to note a perceptible temperature change when you add the second reagents. 当你加入第二种试剂的时候，你应该能够察觉到明显的温度变化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appreciable, apprehensible, detectable, discernible, distinguishable, palpable, sensible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impalpable, imperceptible, inappreciable, indistinguishable, insensible, undetectable 不能感知的</div>
<h2>peremptory[sound:peremptory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不容反抗的：</font>not allowing contradiction or refusal; imperative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a peremptory order from the general  将军下达的不容反抗的命令</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compulsory, forced, imperative, incumbent, involuntary, obligatory, required</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elective, optional, voluntary  可选择的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">爱发号施令的：</font>fond of ordering people around</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The peremptory secretary began telling the crowd of reporters and photographers exactly where they hadto stand. 爱发号施令的秘书开始部署记者和摄影师们应该站在哪里了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]authoritarian, despotic, dictatorial, domineering, imperious, masterful, overbearing, tyrannical, tyrannous</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">傲慢的：</font>having a feeling of superiority that shows itself in an overbearing attitude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She had such a peremptory approach to running the club that people started to avoid her. 她用一种如此傲慢自大的方式来管理俱乐部，以至于大家纷纷开始躲避她</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assumptive, bumptious, haughty, imperious, lofty, pompous, presumptuous, pretentious, supercilious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humble, lowly, modest 谦逊的</div>
<h2>perfervid[sound:perfervid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常热情的：</font>marked by overwrought or exaggerated emotion: excessively fervent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]perfervid love letter 热情洋溢的情书</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardent, demonstrative, emotional, fervid, feverish, impassioned, passionate, torrid, vehement, warm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cold, cool, detached, dispassionate, emotionless, impassive, unemotional 冷漠的</div>
<h2>perfidy[sound:perfidy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不忠，背信弃义：</font>an act or an instance of disloyalty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As loyalty unites lovers, so perfidy estranges friends. 忠诚是爱情的纽带，欺诈是友谊的敌人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backstabbing, disloyalty, infidelity, sellout, treachery, unfaithfulness, double cross</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allegiance, devotion, faithfulness, fidelity, loyalty, staunchness, steadfastness  忠诚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]perfidious adj. 不忠诚的</div>
<h2>perforate[sound:perforate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">打孔，穿透：</font>to make a hole through</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to perforate with a pin 用针穿孔</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bore, drill, hole, pierce, punch, puncture, riddle</div>
<h2>perfunctory[sound:perfunctory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">例行公事的，敷衍的：</font>characterized by routine or superficiality and often done merely as a duty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gave his usual perfunctory nod 例行公事地随便点了个头</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]automatic, cursory, mechanical, superficial</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不感兴趣的：</font>lacking in interest or enthusiasm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She gave the list only a perfunctory glance. 她无所谓地随便瞅了名单一眼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apathetic, casual, disinterested, incurious, indifferent, insouciant, nonchalant, pococurante, unconcerned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concerned, interested 感兴趣的</div>
<h2>perimeter[sound:perimeter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">边界，界限：</font>the line or relatively narrow space that marks the outer limit of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]soldiers guarding the perimeter of the camp 守卫者营地边界的士兵</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]borderline, bound, boundary, circumference, confines, edge, frame, fringe, margin, periphery, skirt, verge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]center, core, heart, kernel 核心</div>
<h2>periodical[sound:periodical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">期刊：</font>a publication that appears at regular intervals</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]subscribed to three new periodicals 订阅了三份新的期刊</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]book, magazine, newspaper, paper, review, serial</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">周期性的，有固定间隔的：</font>occurring or recurring at regular intervals</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]periodical announcements from airline personnel concerning the delay 航空公司工作人员关于延误所进行的一遍又一遍的广播</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]continual, periodic, recurrent, recurring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]constant, continuous, incessant, unceasing 持续不断的</div>
<h2>peripatetic[sound:peripatetic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">巡游的，四处游历的：</font>walking about or from place to place</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]peripatetic preachers 四处游历的传教士</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambulant, errant, nomadic, perambulatory, peregrine, vagabond, wandering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sedentary, settled 定居的</div>
<h2>peripheral[sound:peripheral.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">外围的：</font>related to, located in, or constituting an outer boundary or periphery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]development in the peripheral areas of megacities  大城市边缘地区的发展</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circumferential, marginal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]central 中心的；interior 内部的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">辅助性的：</font>available to supply something extra when needed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The IT consultant suggested that we update the drivers for all of the computer's peripheral devices. IT咨询师建议我们更新电脑所有外围辅助设备的驱动程序</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accessorial, accessory, appurtenant, supplemental, supplementary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]chief, main, principal 主要的</div>
<h2>perish[sound:perish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">死亡，消亡：</font>to become destroyed or ruined: cease to exist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]thrive in calamity and perish in soft living  生于忧患，死于安乐‖adapt or perish 适应或是消亡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decease, demise, die, end, expire, succumb, pass away</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]breathe, live, survive 活着，存活</div>
<h2>permanent[sound:permanent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">永恒的：</font>continuing or enduring without fundamental or marked change; lasting forever</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A temporary compromise has been accepted until a more permanent solution can be agreed upon. 在更为持久的决案被通过之前，一个暂时性的妥协方案被接受了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ceaseless, dateless, deathless, endless, eternal, immortal, perpetual, undying, unending</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ephemeral, evanescent, transient, transitory 稍瞬即逝的；provisional, temporary 暂时性的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]permanence n. 永恒</div>
<h2>permeable[sound:permeable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可渗透的：</font>capable of being permeated or penetrated, especially by liquids or gases</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a permeable fabric that allows your body heat to escape 一种能使身体热量耗散的透气纤维</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]passable, penetrable, pervious, porous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]waterproof 防水的；impassable, impenetrable, impervious, impermeable 不能渗透的</div>
<h2>pernicious[sound:pernicious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有害的：</font>highly injurious or destructive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Business may be troublesome but idleness is pernicious. 工作烦人，懒散害人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adverse, baleful, damaging, deleterious, detrimental, hurtful, injurious, mischievous, nocuous, noxious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]anodyne, benign, harmless, innocent, innocuous, inoffensive, safe 温和的，无害的</div>
<h2>peroration[sound:peroration.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（演讲的）结束语：</font>the concluding part of a discourse and especially an oration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He summarized his main points in his peroration. 他在结束语中总结了自己的主要观点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coda, conclusion, denouement, epilogue, finale</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]foreword, prelude, preface, prologue, overture 前言，序曲</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（正式的）演讲，致辞：</font>a usually formal discourse delivered to an audience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a peroration celebrating the nation's long tradition of religious tolerance and pluralism 为庆祝该国长期以来对于宗教的容忍态度和宗教多元化所做的一个演讲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]address, declamation, harangue, oration, speech, talk</div>
<h2>perpetual[sound:perpetual.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">永恒的，不断的：continuing forever：</font>everlasting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]perpetual motion machine 永动机</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ceaseless, dateless, deathless, endless, eternal, immortal, perpetual, undying, unending</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ephemeral, evanescent, transient, transitory 稍瞬即逝的；provisional, temporary 暂时性的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]perpetuate    v. 使永恒</div>
<h2>persecute[sound:persecute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">迫害，折磨：</font>to cause persistent suffering to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]people who were persecuted simply for practicing their religious faith 因为实践宗教信仰而惨遭迫害的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agonize, anguish, curse, excruciate, harrow, plague, rack, torment, torture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]persecution n. 迫害</div>
<h2>persevere[sound:persevere.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">坚持不懈，不屈不挠：</font>to persist  in or remain constant to a purpose, idea, or task in the face ofobstacles or discouragement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Although he was frustrated by the lack of financial resources and support, hepersevered in his scientificresearch. 尽管因为资金不足而受阻，但他仍坚持进行科学研究</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carry on, endure, persist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]renounce, succumb, surrender, yield 放弃，屈服</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]perseverance n. 坚持不懈</div>
<h2>persiflage[sound:persiflage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">打趣：</font>good-natured teasing or exchanging of clever remarks</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their tongue-in-cheek persiflage is sometimes mistaken for an exchange of insults by people who don'tknow them. 他们半开玩笑的打趣有时候被不认识他们的人误认为是在互相对骂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backchat, badinage, chaff, jesting, joshing, raillery, repartee</div>
<h2>persistence[sound:persistence.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">坚持，持续：</font>uninterrupted or lasting existence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]The persistenceof the fever for a week caused me great worry. 持续一周的发烧让我很不安</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ceaselessness, continuance, continuity, durability, endurance, subsistence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cessation, close, end, expiration, finish, stoppage, surcease, termination  停止</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]persistent adj. 持续不断的</div>
<h2>personable[sound:personable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">风度翩翩的，吸引人的：</font>pleasing in personality or appearance; attractive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]apparently be attracted by a personable young man 明显被一位风度翩翩的少年迷住了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alluring, appealing, attractive, captivating, charismatic, charming, comely, enchanting, handsome, pretty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]grotesque, hideous, ugly 丑陋的；homely 相貌平庸的</div>
<h2>perspicacious[sound:perspicacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极敏锐的，有洞察力的：</font>having or showing penetrating mental discernment; clear-sighted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an impartial and perspicacious judge 一个明镜高悬的法官</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]astute, savvy, sharp, sharp-witted, shrewd, smart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ignorant, oblivious, unknowing 未察觉的，无知的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]perspicacity n. 敏锐，洞察力</div>
<h2>perspicuity[sound:perspicuity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">清晰明了：</font>the quality of being perspicuous; clearness and lucidity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The key of modern enterprise system is the prespicuity of property right. 现代企业制度的核心是产权的明晰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clarity, clearness, explicitness, lucidity, lucidness, perspicuousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obscureness, obscurity, unclarity 模糊不清；ambiguity 模棱两可</div>
<h2>pertain[sound:pertain.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">有关联：</font>to have a relation or connection; relate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]new evidence that pertains to the accident 与事故相关的新证据</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appertain, bear, concern, refer, relate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]pertaining adj. 有关系的</div>
<h2>pertinacious[sound:pertinacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顽固的，固执地坚持的：</font>sticking to an opinion, purpose, or course of action in spite of reason,arguments, or persuasion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The pertinacious boy won’t stop crying unless his desire is satisfied.  这个固执的男孩在愿望没有满足的情况下是不会停止哭泣的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant, headstrong, implacable, inflexible, intransigent, mulish, obdurate, perverse, stubborn, willful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]compliant, flexible, pliable, pliant, yielding 容易受影响的，容易控制的</div>
<h2>pertinent[sound:pertinent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">相关的，恰当的：</font>having a clear decisive relevance to the matter in hand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He impressed the jury with his concise, pertinent answers to the attorney's questions. 他对律师提出的问题的简洁而恰当的回答给陪审团留下了深刻的印象</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]applicable, apposite, apropos, germane, material, pointed, relative, relevant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extraneous, immaterial, impertinent, inapplicable, inapposite, irrelevant, pointless 无关的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]pertinence n. 相关，恰当</div>
<h2>perturb[sound:perturb.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">扰乱，使烦躁不安：</font>to trouble the mind of; to make uneasy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]perturbed me enough to keep me awake that night 让我烦躁到当晚失眠</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agitate, ail, bother, discomfort, discompose, distress, unsettle, upset</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, compose, quiet, settle, soothe, tranquilize 使镇定</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]perturbation n. 打扰，扰乱</div>
<h2>peruse[sound:peruse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">细读：</font>to read or examine, typically with great care</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]perused the manuscript to check for grammatical errors 细读手稿以检查语法错误</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]examine, scrutinize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]glance, glimpse, scan, skim 一瞥，迅速浏览</div>
<h2>pervade[sound:pervade.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">弥漫，充满：</font>to be present throughout; permeate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The mixed smell of sawdust and glue pervaded the whole factory. 锯末与胶水的味道弥漫了整个工厂 ‖the corruption that pervades every stratum of society 充斥在社会每个阶层中的腐败</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]interpenetrate, percolate, riddle, suffuse, transfuse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]pervasive adj.弥漫的</div>
<h2>pessimistic[sound:pessimistic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">悲观的：</font>tending to stress the negative or unfavorable or to take the gloomiest possible view</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With that pessimistic attitude, it's no wonder you're depressed. 你的人生观如此悲观，难怪你会感到压抑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bearish, defeatist, despairing, downbeat, hopeless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]optimistic  乐观的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]pessimism n. 悲观主义</div>
<h2>petition[sound:petition.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">请愿，正式的申请：</font>a solemn supplication or request to a superior authority; an entreaty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a petition for divorce 离婚申请书</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appeal, cry, entreaty, pleading, solicitation, supplication</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（尤指正式地）请求：</font>to make a request, especially a formal written one</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She is petitioning to regain custody of the child. 为了重新获得孩子的监护权，她提出了正式申请</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjure, beseech, conjure, entreat, impetrate, implore, importune, plead, solicit, supplicate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]petitioner n. 申请人，请愿者</div>
<h2>petrify[sound:petrify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使僵化，失去活力：</font>to cause to become stiff or stone-like; deaden</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Pressure from family has petrified his once innovative mind. 家庭的压力使他的头脑失去了往日的创造力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]damp, dampen, deaden, devitalize, enervate, lobotomize, ossify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brace, energize, enliven, invigorate, quicken, stimulate, vitalize, vivify 使有活力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]petrification n. 石化，僵化</div>
<h2>petty[sound:petty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">细微的，不重要的：</font>of small importance; trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]play petty tricks 耍小聪明</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, measly, minute, paltry, peanut, slight, trifling, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consequential, considerable, important, material, momentous, significant  重大的，重要的</div>
<h2>phenomenal[sound:phenomenal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不寻常的，非凡的：</font>being out of the ordinary;extraordinary; outstanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the phenomenal growth that the suburb has experienced over the last decade 过去几十年间郊区所经历的令人称奇的快速发展</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]especial, exceptional, extraordinary, peculiar, preternatural, rare, singular, uncommon, unusual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]common, normal, ordinary, typical 普通的，典型的</div>
<h2>philanthropic[sound:philanthropic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">博爱的，为他人着想的：</font>having or showing a concern for the welfare of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the philanthropic aims of the organization 这个机构的博爱、利他的目标</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]altruistic, beneficent, benevolent, eleemosynary, good, humanitarian</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]misanthropic 反人类的；selfish 自私的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]philanthropist n. 博爱的人</div>
<h2>philistine[sound:philistine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">市侩（注重物质而鄙视智慧或艺术的人）：</font>a person who is guided by materialism and is usuallydisdainful of intellectual or artistic values</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The philistine's critics sometime limit artists’ imagine. 市侩之人的批评有时会限制艺术家的想象力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lowbrow, materialist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]highbrow  文化修养高的人</div>
<h2>phlegmatic[sound:phlegmatic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冷静的，无感情的，淡漠的：</font>having or suggesting a calm, sluggish temperament; unemotional</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a strangely phlegmatic response to what should have been happy news 对本该是一个让人开心的新闻的冷漠回复</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectless, apathetic, cold-blooded, emotionless, impassible, numb, stoic, stolid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demonstrative, emotional, fervent, fervid, impassioned, passionate, vehement 感情丰富的，热情的</div>
<h2>piddling[sound:piddling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">微不足道的：</font>so trifling or trivial as to be beneath one's consideration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]raised a piddling objection to the plan 对计划提出了一个微不足道的反对</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, measly, minute, paltry, peanut, slight, trifling, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consequential, considerable, important, material, momentous, significant  重大的，重要的</div>
<h2>piebald[sound:piebald.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">杂色的：</font>of different colors</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a piebald horse 一匹杂色马</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blotched, dappled, marbled, mottled, splotched, spotted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]monochromatic 单色的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">混合的，杂糅而成的：</font>consisting of many things of different sorts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his piebald ethnic background 他身为混血儿的背景</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assorted, eclectic, heterogeneous, hybrid, magpie, mixed, motley, promiscuous, varied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]homogeneous 由相同类型事物组成的</div>
<h2>pigment[sound:pigment.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">颜料：</font>a substance that imparts black or white or a color to other materials</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]natural red pigment 天然红色染料</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]colorant, dye, stain</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">给…上颜色：</font>to color with or as if with pigment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pigmented silk 染过色的丝绸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]paint, stain, tincture, tinge, tint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blanch 漂白；decolorize  脱色</div>
<h2>pilfer[sound:pilfer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">偷窃：</font>to steal stealthily in small amounts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pilfer the commercial document  偷窃商业文件</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appropriate, filch, hook, lift, pinch, purloin, steal, thieve</div>
<h2>pillar[sound:pillar.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">柱子：</font>a firm upright support for a superstructure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]stone pillars that supported the hall 支撑大厅的石柱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]column, pier, pilaster</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（物质、精神等方面的）支柱：</font>something or someone to which one looks for support</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My father has been my pillar throughout this crisis. 整场危机之中我父亲都是我的支柱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anchor, buttress, mainstay, reliance, standby</div>
<h2>pillory[sound:pillory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">被示众嘲弄：</font>to expose to public contempt, ridicule, or scorn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The candidate mercilessly pilloried his opponent. 候选人在大众面前无情地羞辱他的对手。‖Heresigned after being pilloried by the press. 在遭到媒体嘲弄之后他愤然辞职。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abase, debase, degrade, denounce, humiliate, ridicule</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]carol, eulogize, exalt, extol, laud 赞美</div>
<h2>pilot[sound:pilot.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">领航员，飞行员：</font>one employed to steer a ship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a jet pilot  喷气式飞机飞行员</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aviator, bellwether, captain, guide, helmsman, leader, navigator</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">初步的，试验性的：</font>serving as a tentative model for future experiment or development</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They carried out a pilot study before the larger, more expensive project was started 在更大规模、更为昂贵的项目开始之前，他们进行了初步研究。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]developmental, experimental, model, test, trial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eventual, final, ultimate 最终的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">带领通过：</font>lead or conduct over a usually difficult course</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The lobbyists piloted the bill through the Senate.  游说集团使法案得到参议院的批准。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conduct, direct, guide, lead, route, show, steer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]follow 跟随</div>
<h2>pine[sound:pine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">渴望，奢望：</font>to yearn intensely and persistently especially for something unattainable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pine for a lost love  渴望那段逝去的爱情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ache, crave, dream, hunger, itch, long, lust, repine, thirst, yearn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abhor, detest, loathe 厌恶，反感</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">因渴望而憔悴：</font>to lose vigor, health, or flesh (as through grief)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Separated by their families, the lovers pined away. 这对恋人因为被家人拆散而日益憔悴。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decline, dwindle, fade, flag, languish, waste</div>
<h2>pinnacle[sound:pinnacle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">顶峰：</font>the highest point of development or achievement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a singer who has reached the pinnacle of career 已到达事业巅峰的歌手</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acme, apex, climax, culmination, meridian, peak, summit, top, zenith</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bottom, nadir 最低点</div>
<h2>pinpoint[sound:pinpoint.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常精确的：</font>located, fixed, or directed with extreme precision</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The commander demanded the pinpoint location of artillery fire.  指挥官需要火炮攻击的精确位置。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accurate, close, delicate, exact, fine, hairline, mathematical, precise, refined, rigorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coarse, cursory, rough  粗略的；imprecise, inaccurate, inexact 不准确的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">精确定位或确认：</font>to locate, fix, determine, or identify with precision</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pinpoint the target by tracking calls from his cellphone 通过跟踪手机信号精确定位了目标‖pinpoint  thecause of failure 准确找出失败的原因</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]determine, distinguish, locate, identify, recognize, spot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]estimate 估计</div>
<h2>piquant[sound:piquant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">辛辣开胃的：</font>pleasantly pungent or tart in taste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a piquant sauce 开胃的酱汁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]peppery, poignant, salty, savory, spicy, zesty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insipid, vapid, zestless  索然无味的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人振奋的：</font>appealingly provocative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a piquant glance 充满挑逗的一瞥</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exciting, pungent, racy, stimulating</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flat, pallid 单调的，无聊的</div>
<h2>pique[sound:pique.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使愤怒：</font>to arouse anger or resentment in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was greatly piqued when they refused her invitation. 他们拒绝她的邀请让她很生气。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, annoy, exasperate, infuriate, irritate, peeve, provoke, rile, roil, ruffle, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delight, gratify, rejoice 使高兴</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激起，刺激：</font>to excite or arouse especially by a provocation, challenge, or rebuff</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]radical remarks that pique their curiosity 引起他们兴趣的激进评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arouse, encourage, excite, fire, impassion, incite, instigate, move, stimulate, stir</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allay, alleviate, assuage, ease, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soothe 平息，缓和</div>
<h2>pirate[sound:pirate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">盗版，盗用：</font>to take or make use of under a guise of authority but without actual right</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a pirated version of the software 盗版软件</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arrogate, commandeer, convert, expropriate, preempt, press, seize, usurp</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">海盗：</font>a robber on the high seas</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]little boys dreaming of sailing as pirates 梦想成为海盗的小男孩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]corsair, freebooter, rover</div>
<h2>pithy[sound:pithy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精练的，简洁的：</font>precisely meaningful; forceful and brief</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The professor gave a pithy introduction to this course. 教授就这门课程做了简短的介绍。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apothegmatic, brief, capsule, compact, compendious, concise, laconic, succinct, telegraphic, terse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circuitous, circumlocutory, diffuse, rambling, prolix, verbose, windy, wordy 冗长累赘的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]pithiness n. 简洁，犀利</div>
<h2>pitiless[sound:pitiless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">没有同情心的：</font>devoid of or unmoved by pity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a pitiless humiliation 毫不留情的羞辱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectless, callous, coldhearted, cruel, harsh, indurate, merciless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]charitable, clement, compassionate, humane, merciful, sympathetic, tender 有同情心的，仁慈的</div>
<h2>pittance[sound:pittance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">少量津贴：</font>a small portion, amount, or allowance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The internship offers only a pittance for a salary, but it is a great opportunity to gain experience.  实习所能挣到的报酬是很少的，但是它提供了获得经验的绝佳机会。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bit, mite, modicum, peanuts, trace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cornucopia, opulence 富饶；boodle, bundle, fortune 大笔财富</div>
<h2>placate[sound:placate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（通过让步以）平息抚慰：</font>to lessen the anger or agitation of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The colonists implemented a new policy to placate local opposition 殖民者采取新政策以缓和当地的反抗情绪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appease, assuage, conciliate, mollify, pacify, propitiate, tranquilize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]anger, enrage, foment, gall, incense, inflame, infuriate, peeve, rile 激怒，使气恼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]placation n. 安抚</div>
<h2>placebo[sound:placebo.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">安慰性的事物：</font>something of no intrinsic remedial value that is  used to appease or reassureanother</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Candies are often adopted as the placebo for the dying patients. 糖果通常作为安慰剂给重症患者服用。</div>
<h2>plagiarize[sound:plagiarize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">剽窃，抄袭：</font>to steal and pass off (the ideas or words of another) as one's own</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In scientific community, plagiarizing other’s paper is a felony. 在学术界，剽窃他人的论文是一项重罪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]steal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]plagiarism n. 剽窃</div>
<h2>plangent[sound:plangent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">轰鸣的：</font>having a loud reverberating sound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The camera man was stunned by the plangent roar of wild animals. 摄影师被野生动物发出的怒号吓得不知所措。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blaring, blasting, clamorous, deafening, earsplitting, resonant, resounding, sonorous, thunderous, vibrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]muffled, muted 声音被减弱的；gentle, low, soft 声音轻柔的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凄凉的，哀伤的：</font>having an expressive and especially plaintive quality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a plangent song about a long-ago love 一首关于往日爱情的凄凉歌曲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doleful, dolorous, funeral, grieving, lamentable, lugubrious, plaintive, rueful, sorrowful, woeful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agreeable, cheerful, delightful, enjoyable, jolly, pleasing 令人愉快的</div>
<h2>plastic[sound:plastic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可塑的：</font>susceptible of being modified in form or nature</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the plastic quality of modeling clay 模型泥的可塑性质</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adaptable, ductile, flexible, malleable, pliable, pliant, resilient, supple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inflexible, rigid, stiff 僵硬的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">虚假的，做作的：</font>lacking in natural or spontaneous quality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There's usually a plastic cordiality at these corporate events. 通常在公司的活动上都有一种虚假的热情和友好。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affected, assumed, bogus, factitious, fake, false, feigned, mock, phony, pretended, pseudo, spurious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artless, genuine, natural, spontaneous, unaffected, uncontrived, unfeigned 真诚的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]plasticity n. 可塑性</div>
<h2>plateau[sound:plateau.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">高原：</font>a usually extensive level land area raised sharply above adjacent land on at least one side</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau 青藏高原</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]highland, mesa, tableland, upland</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lowland 低谷；basin  盆地</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">稳定时期，平台期：</font>a relatively stable level, period, or state</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]reached a plateau of development 达到了发展的稳定期</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]equilibrium, stage, stasis</div>
<h2>platitude[sound:platitude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">陈词滥调：</font>a trite or banal remark or statement, especially one expressed as if it were original orsignificant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the platitude of most political oratory  政治说辞里的陈词滥调</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banality, bromide, cliché, commonplace, homily, shibboleth, truism</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏原创性：</font>lack of originality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]triteness, staleness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]novelty 新颖性；originality 原创新</div>
<h2>plausible[sound:plausible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">看似有理的：</font>superficially fair, reasonable, or valuable but often specious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a plausible argument 看起来头头是道的说理</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]believable, credible, likely, possible, presumable, probable 可信的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]paradoxical 看似矛盾的；implausible, improbable, incredible, unbelievable, unlikely  不太可能的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]plausibility n. 看似有理</div>
<h2>pleat[sound:pleat.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./vt. 打褶：fold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]corrugate, crease, furrow, ruffle, wrinkle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flatten, smooth 抹平</div>
<h2>plentitude[sound:plentitude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大量：</font>an ample amount or quantity; an abundance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a plentitude of lumber for the current housing market 充足的家具木材供给</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundance, affluence, cornucopia, myriad, plenty, profusion, stack, wealth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dearth, deficiency, inadequacy, insufficiency 缺乏，匮乏；mite, peanuts, pinch, pittance, trace 少量</div>
<h2>plethora[sound:plethora.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">过量，过剩：</font>excess, superfluity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a plethora of advice and a paucity of assistance 给出大量建议而鲜有实质性援助</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundance, cornucopia, feast, overabundance, overflow, plentitude, profusion, surfeit, surplus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dearth, inadequacy, insufficiency, paucity, scarcity, undersupply  缺乏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]plethoric adj. 过量的</div>
<h2>pliable[sound:pliable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易弯曲的，柔软的：</font>supple enough to bend freely or repeatedly without breaking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pliable optical fiber 柔软的光纤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adaptable, ductile, flexible, limber, plastic, supple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inflexible, rigid, stiff 不易弯曲的；unbending 难弯曲的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易受影响的，温顺的：</font>easily influenced, persuaded, or swayed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He took advantage of the pliable mind of youth. 他利用了年轻人容易受他人教唆的特点。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compliant, docile, obedient, pliant, tractable, subdued</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contumacious, insubordinate, intractable, obstreperous, recalcitrant, refractory, unruly 难控制的</div>
<h2>pliant[sound:pliant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易弯曲的：</font>easily bent or flexed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a pliant young tree 易弯曲的小树</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adaptable, ductile, flexible, limber, plastic, supple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inflexible, rigid, stiff 不易弯曲的；unbending 难弯曲的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顺从的：</font>yielding readily to influence or domination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She’s proud and stubborn, you know, under that pliant exterior.  你知道在温顺的外表下，她骄傲而固执。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compliant, docile, obedient, pliant, tractable, subdued</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contumacious, insubordinate, intractable, obstreperous, recalcitrant, refractory, unruly 难控制的</div>
<h2>plight[sound:plight.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">困境：</font>a situation, especially a bad or unfortunate one</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was in a plight, trying to decide whether or not to take the job. 他处在不知道是否应该接受这份工作的困境之中。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dilemma, jam, predicament, quandary</div>
<h2>plod[sound:plod.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法】v. <font color="#aa00ff">沉重缓慢地走：</font>to walk heavily or slowly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The soldiers slowly plodded across the marsh. 士兵们慢慢走过沼泽地。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]tramp, trudge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flit 迅速飞过；gambol 雀跃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]plodding adj. 走路沉重缓慢的</div>
<h2>pluck[sound:pluck.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">敢于面对困难的勇气：</font>resourceful courage and daring in the face of difficulties</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]full of pluck 充满了勇气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backbone, courage, dauntlessness, grit, guts, resolution, spirit, spunk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cowardice, coward, spinelessness 胆小，怯懦</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">弹奏（弦乐）：</font>to sound (the strings of an instrument) by pulling and releasing them with the fingersor a plectrum</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pluck the harp 弹奏竖琴</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]play</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]plucky adj. 勇敢的</div>
<h2>plumb[sound:plumb.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">测深度：</font>to measure the depth of (as a body of water) typically with a weighted line</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We will plumb the bay to make sure it was deep enough for the huge vessel. 为了确证水深足够容纳这艘巨轮，我们将会测量海湾的深度。‖questions that plumb the depths of stupidity 测量智商下限的问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fathom</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">垂直的：</font>exactly vertical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]perpendicular, upright, vertical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]horizontal 水平的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">完全的，绝对的：</font>having no exceptions or restrictions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]Such a movie is plumb trash and further evidence of the deterioration of popular culture. 这样的电影就是彻头彻尾的垃圾，它进一步证明了大众文化的堕落和腐化。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absolute, categorical, complete, consummate, definite, pure, sheer, thorough, utter, very</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doubtful, dubious, equivocal, questionable, uncertain 不确定的；qualified 有条件的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】v. <font color="#aa00ff">仔细深入地检查：</font>to examine closely or deeply</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]plumbing the book's complexities 审阅这本书的复杂度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]explore, delve, inquire, investigate, probe</div>
<h2>plummet[sound:plummet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">突然下降：</font>to decline suddenly and steeply</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Overall GPA plummeted 0.5 points. 平均学分绩骤降0.5 。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crash, decline, descend, dip, dive, fall, plunge, sink, tumble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]skyrocket, soar 飙升</div>
<h2>plump[sound:plump.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">丰满的：</font>well-rounded and full in form</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In Tang Dynasty, being plump was a sign of ultimate beauty. 在唐代，身材丰满是最美丽的象征。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chubby, fleshy, fat, gross, obese, rotund, round</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lean, slender, svelte, thin 纤瘦的，苗条的；angular 因消瘦而棱角分明的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">鼎力支持，赞口不绝：</font>to give full support or praise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We will plump for any candidate who supports stem cell research. 我们会鼎力支持那些拥护干细胞研究的候选人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advocate, back, champion, endorse, patronize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]baffle, foil, frustrate, sabotage 阻挠，从中破坏</div>
<h2>plunge[sound:plunge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">突然下降：</font>to descend or dip suddenly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]stock’s value plunged 股票价值骤然下降</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crash, decline, descend, dip, dive, fall, plummet, plunge, sink, tumble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]skyrocket, soar 飙升</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">插入，刺入：</font>to cause to penetrate or enter quickly and forcibly into something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]plunged the dagger into his chest 把匕首刺入他的胸膛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drive, stab, stick, thrust</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extract 拔出</div>
<h2>polarize[sound:polarize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使分开对立，两极分化：</font>to break up into opposing factions or groupings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The controversy has polarized voters into pro-abortion and anti-abortion groups. 这个问题使得选民分化成支持堕胎和反对堕胎两个群体。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bifurcate, diverge, divide</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coalesce, unite 合并，联合</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]polarization n. 两极分化；极化</div>
