<h2>polemic[sound:polemic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">争执：</font>a controversial argument</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The polemic between science and religion has never ceased. 科学和宗教之间的争论从未停息。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contention, controversy, disagreement, disputation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agreement 一致，协议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]polemical adj. 好争论的</div>
<h2>polished[sound:polished.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有教养的：</font>showing a high degree of refinement and the assurance that comes from wide socialexperience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He maintained a very polished tone in his correspondences. 他在通信中保持着一种极有教养的口吻。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cultivated, cultured, genteel, refined, urbane</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gauche, rustic, philistine 粗俗的；uncivilized, untutored  未开化的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">擦亮的：</font>having a shiny surface or finish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She could see her face reflected in the polished hood of the car. 她可以通过引擎盖光亮的表面看到自己的脸。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]buffed, burnished, glistening, lustrous, rubbed, satiny, sleek</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dim, dull, flat, lusterless 黯淡无光的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]polish    v. 擦亮</div>
<h2>politic[sound:politic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精明能干的：</font>characterized by shrewdness in managing, contriving, or dealing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a politic secretary 能干的秘书</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diplomatic, judicious, perspicacious, sagacious, tactful, wise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]tactless, unsophisticated 缺乏谋略的，头脑简单的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">合时宜的，明智的：</font>suitable for bringing about a desired result under the circumstances</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It probably would not be politic to tell your boss that his latest idea is the worst thing you've ever heard.不要现在去告诉你老板说他的想法是你听过的最糟的，这不是一个合时宜的做法。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advisable, desirable, prudent, tactical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]imprudent, inadvisable, injudicious, unwise 不明智的，不合时宜的</div>
<h2>pompous[sound:pompous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">浮夸的：</font>excessively elevated or ornate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The candidate was given to windy rhetorical speeches. 听众们听了一场冗长而浮夸的演讲。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affected, bombastic, flowery, grandiloquent, magniloquent, rhetorical, sonorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]homely 朴素的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">傲慢的：</font>having or exhibiting self-importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a pompous politician who insisted on boarding the plane first 一个坚持要求优先登机的傲慢政客</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arrogant, egocentric, haughty, pontifical, presumptuous, supercilious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humble, modest, unpretentious 谦逊的</div>
<h2>ponderable[sound:ponderable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有价值的，值得考虑的：</font>considerable enough to be weighed or assessed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Climate change has exerted a ponderable influence on world politics. 气候变化对世界政局有着不容忽视的影响。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appreciable, perceptible, sensible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inappreciable  微不足道的</div>
<h2>ponderous[sound:ponderous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">沉重的：</font>of very great weight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a ponderous machine 沉重的机器</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cumbersome, heavy, hefty, massive, onerous, weighty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ethereal, gossamer, light, weightless  轻飘飘的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">沉闷无聊的：</font>oppressively or unpleasantly dull</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a ponderous sermon no one really cares  实际上无人关心的沉闷无聊的布道</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dreary, dull, flat, elephantine, monotonous, insipid, vapid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 极吸引人的</div>
<h2>pontificate[sound:pontificate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">傲慢地做或说：</font>to speak or express opinions in a pompous or dogmatic way</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pontificate to show a sense of superiority  傲慢地说以显示高人一等的优越感</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]condescend 屈尊，俯就</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]pontification n. 傲慢的言行；pontifical adj. 傲慢的</div>
<h2>pore[sound:pore.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">仔细浏览，仔细研究：</font>to read or study attentively(usually used with over)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The committee will probably pore over the results of the study for a long time before making their decision.在正式做决定之前，委员会或需要花很长的时间来仔细研究调查结果。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cogitate, consider, contemplate, deliberate, meditate, perpend, ruminate, study, weigh, chew over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flip, glance, leaf, riffle, skim  粗略地看，迅速浏览</div>
<h2>porous[sound:porous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多孔可渗透的：</font>admitting the passage of gas or liquid through pores or interstices</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Lava rock has a porous structure which makes the material  lightweight and highly moisture-retentive.火山岩的多孔结构使得它密度很小，同时有很高的吸湿性。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]passable, penetrable, permeable, pervious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impassable, impenetrable, impermeable, impervious 无法穿透的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]porosity n. 多孔性</div>
<h2>portentous[sound:portentous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">预兆性的，凶兆的：</font>being or showing a sign of evil or calamity to come</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an eerie and portentous stillness 阴森神秘，充满凶兆的寂静</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baleful, direful, doomy, foreboding, inauspicious, menacing, minatory, ominous, sinister, ill-omened</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]auspicious, propitious 吉兆的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">勾起兴趣的，令人遐想的：</font>eliciting amazement or wonder</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The way in which he could bring together opposing forces was truly portentous. 他整合两股对抗势力的方法着实令人好奇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amazing, astonishing, astounding, fabulous, marvelous, miraculous, prodigious, wonderful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]common, commonplace, ordinary 普通的</div>
<h2>poseur[sound:poseur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">故作姿态、不真诚的人：</font>an affected or insincere person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She is such a poseur and you will never know if she is really crying or pretending.  她就是个爱装的人，你从不知道她是真的在哭还是只是假装而已。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grandstander, poser</div>
<h2>posit[sound:posit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt.<font color="#aa00ff">假定，断定：</font>to assume or affirm the existence of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The committee posited that he was qualified for the election. 委员会假定他是够格参加选举的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assume, postulate, presuppose, premise, presume</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]falsify 证明为假</div>
<h2>postulate[sound:postulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">前提条件：</font>something taken as being true or factual and used as a starting point for a course ofaction or reasoning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]One of the postulates that the true agnostic rejects is the assumption that it is even possible for us to knowwhether God exists. 我们无法知道上帝是否存在——这是一个真正的不可知论者所反对的假设。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]premise, presumption, presupposition, supposition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conclusion 结论</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">假定为真：</font>to assume or claim as true, existent, or necessary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]postulate a causal relationship 假定存在因果关系</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assume, conjecture, hypothesize, posit, presuppose, premise, presume, suppose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]belie, disprove, falsify 证明为假</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]postulation n. 推测</div>
<h2>posture[sound:posture.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">姿势，姿态：</font>a general way of holding the body</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A good upright posture will prevent backaches. 良好的站姿可以预防背痛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attitude, carriage, poise, stance, station</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">故作姿态，装模作样：</font>to assume an artificial or pretended attitude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]postured to impress 故作姿态以给别人留下印象</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attitudinize, feign, grandstand, masquerade, pose, pretend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]posturer n. 故作姿态之人</div>
<h2>potable[sound:potable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">饮品，尤指有酒精饮料：</font>a beverage, especially an alcoholic beverage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Potables are offered at bar counter for free. 饮料可以在吧台免费领取。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beverage, drink, juice, liquor, spirits</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]non-intoxicant, soft drink 软饮料</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">适于饮用的：</font>suitable for drinking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Price of the potable water has soared. 饮用水价格飙升。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drinkable, edible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undrinkable 不能饮用的</div>
<h2>potentate[sound:potentate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">有权的人：</font>one who has the power and position to rule over others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a son of a potentate 官二代</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]authority, autocrat, monarch, ruler, sovereign</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]figurehead （有名无权的）傀儡</div>
<h2>potentiate[sound:potentiate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激活，加强：</font>to make effective or active, or more effective or more active</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]additives to potentiate the drug 增强药效的添加剂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]activate, energize, enhance, intensify, stir, wake, vitalize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deactivate 使无效；abate, attenuate, dwindle, lessen, moderate, reduce 减弱，削弱</div>
<h2>pout[sound:pout.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（特别是撅嘴）表示不悦：</font>to show displeasure, especially by thrusting out the lips or wearing asullen expression</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She pouted and didn't say a word to anyone all morning. 她整个早上都闷闷不乐，没和别人说一句话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grump, mope, sulk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]grin 露齿而笑</div>
<h2>practitioner[sound:practitioner.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">职业人士：</font>one who practices a profession</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]medical practitioner 医护人员，行医者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]expert, expounder, guru, professional, specialist, virtuoso</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fledgling 无经验的人；quack 冒充内行的人</div>
<h2>prairie[sound:prairie.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大草原：</font>an extensive area of flat or rolling, predominantly treeless grassland</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Canadian Prairie 加拿大大草原地区</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grassland, meadow, plain, savanna</div>
<h2>prate[sound:prate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">闲聊，空谈：</font>to talk long and idly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They have been prating on the phone for hours. 他们已经煲了几个小时的电话粥了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]babble, chat, chatter, converse, gabble, jabber, prattle, twitter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]prater n. 闲聊的人</div>
<h2>preach[sound:preach.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">传道，布道：</font>to deliver a sermon</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a minister who loves to preach 一个爱布道的牧师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discourse, sermonize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]preacher n. 布道者</div>
<h2>precarious[sound:precarious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">危险不稳定的：</font>dangerously lacking in security or stability</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a precarious livelihood  不稳定的生计</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delicate, fragile, sensitive, touchy, unstable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]firm, stable 稳定的；safe, secure  安全的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可疑的，不明确的：</font>dependent on uncertain premises</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His entire argument relies on a precarious assumption. 他的整篇论证都建立在一个可疑的假设之上。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambiguous, doubtful, dubious, equivocal, uncertain, unfounded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]indubitable, unambiguous, unequivocal, unquestionable 明确的，毋庸置疑的</div>
<h2>precedent[sound:precedent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">先例，前例：</font>an earlier occurrence of something similar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There has not been any precedent so far. 到目前为止还没有先例。‖a landmark decision that set a legalprecedent 在法律上首开先河的重大决议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]example, instance, model, paradigm, pattern, standard</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">先前的：</font>prior in time, order, arrangement, or significance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her violent behaviors may be explained by some precedent events in her troubled life.  她的暴力行径或许可以由她之前苦难生活中遭遇到的一些事件来解释。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antecedent, anterior, former, preceding, previous, prior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ensuing 继而发生的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]unprecedented adj. 前所未见的</div>
<h2>precipice[sound:precipice.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">悬崖峭壁：</font>a very steep or overhanging place</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a precipice too steep to climb 过于陡峭而无法攀爬的悬崖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bluff, cliff, crag, escarpment, palisade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ridge  山脊</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]precipitous adj. 陡峭的</div>
<h2>precipitate[sound:precipitate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">匆忙的：</font>acting or done with excessive or careless speed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the army's precipitate withdrawal from the field of battle 匆忙将军队从战场上撤下</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cursory, flying, headlong, hurried, overhasty, precipitous, rash, rushed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deliberate 慎重考虑的；leisurely, unhurried, unrushed 从容不迫的，不慌不忙的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">促使，导致：</font>to cause to happen, especially suddenly or prematurely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to precipitate an international crisis 产生国际危机</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accelerate, escalate, expedite, hasten, impel, speed, trigger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]check, encumber, enfetter, hamper, handicap, hinder, manacle, obstruct, retard, trammel 阻碍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]precipitation n. 急促；沉淀；降水</div>
<h2>precipitation[sound:precipitation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">沉积物，尤指降水：</font>something precipitated as a deposit on the earth of hail, mist, rain, sleet, orsnow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The storm brought several inches of precipitation. 风暴带来的降水量高达数英尺。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deposit, sediment</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">仓促：</font>excited and often showy or disorderly speed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I fear that I may have acted with some precipitation on this matter, so I would like to reconsider.  我害怕自己在这个事情上考虑得太仓促了，因此我想再想想。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]haste, hastiness, hustle, precipitousness, rush</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deliberation 深思熟虑</div>
<h2>precipitous[sound:precipitous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常陡峭的：</font>very steep, perpendicular, or overhanging in rise or fall</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a precipitous gorge 险峻的峡谷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrupt, arduous, precipitate, sheer, steep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flat, level  平坦的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">匆忙的：</font>acting or done with excessive or careless speed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They soon regretted their precipitous actions in international affairs 他们很快就为他们在国际事务中的匆忙举动感到后悔。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cursory, flying, headlong, hurried, overhasty, precipitate, rash, rushed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deliberate 慎重考虑的；leisurely, unhurried, unrushed 从容不迫的，不慌不忙的</div>
<h2>preclude[sound:preclude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">预先阻止：</font>to make impossible, as by action taken in advance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Age alone will not preclude him from standing as a candidate. 年龄并没有阻止他成为候选人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avert, deter, forestall, obviate, prevent, stave off</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">排斥  ：</font>to exclude or prevent (someone) from a given condition or activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He refused to preclude the subject from discussion . 他拒绝将这个话题排出讨论范围。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bar, exclude, except</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enclose 圈入</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]preclusive adj. 预先阻止的</div>
<h2>precursor[sound:precursor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">先驱者，先导：</font>one that precedes and indicates the approach of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]18th-century lyric poets like Robert Burns were precursors of the Romantics. 十八世纪的抒情诗人（如罗伯特·彭斯）是浪漫主义的先驱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]foregoer, forerunner, harbinger, herald, outrider</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sequela, successor 后继者；descendant 后代</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]precursory adj. 先驱性的，开创性的</div>
<h2>predecessor[sound:predecessor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">前任，先辈：</font>a person who has  previously occupied  a position or office to which another hassucceeded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a political legacy left by his predecessor 他的前任留下来的政治遗产</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ancestor, antecedent, foregoer, forerunner, precursor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]successor 继任者；descendant 后代</div>
<h2>predilection[sound:predilection.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">爱好，偏袒：</font>a partiality or disposition in favor of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a predilection for travel 热爱旅行</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affection, affinity, bias, disposition, inclination, leaning, penchant, predisposition, propensity, tendency</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aversion, loathing, nausea, repugnance, repulsion, revulsion 反感</div>
<h2>preeminent[sound:preeminent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">优秀的，重要的：</font>having paramount rank, dignity, or importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The writer's style is brilliant and his command of words, preeminent. 作者的文风和用词都十分出色</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]distinguished, illustrious, incomparable, notable, outstanding, peerless, superb, supreme, unmatchable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]negligible, trivial 不重要的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]preeminence n. 杰出</div>
<h2>preempt[sound:preempt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">预先占有：</font>to appropriate, seize, or take for oneself before others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The naughty children had preempted front-row seats that were reserved for the guests of honor. 调皮的孩子们把前排留给贵客的座位占了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appropriate, arrogate, commandeer, convert, expropriate, preempt, press, seize, usurp</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">替换：</font>to replace with something considered to be of greater value or priority: take precedence over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The special newscast preempted the usual television program. 特别新闻取代了常规节目。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]displace, replace, supersede, supplant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]preemptive adj. 先发制人的</div>
<h2>preen[sound:preen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">整理（羽毛）：</font>to smooth or clean (feathers) with the beak or bill</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]plume</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rumple 弄皱</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">打扮修饰：</font>to dress or groom (oneself) with elaborate care</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She always preen herself in an elaborate suit before going to the opera. 她去听歌剧之前总要精心打扮一番，穿上最豪华的服装。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]groom, plume, primp</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">自满：</font>to take pride or satisfaction in (oneself)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He always preen himself on his ancestry.  他总是因为他的血统而洋洋得意</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gloat, plume, pride</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]efface 表现出谦卑</div>
<h2>preface[sound:preface.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">序言：</font>a  preliminary statement or essay introducing a book that explains its scope, intention, orbackground and is usually written by the author</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]An informal brunch served as a preface to the three-day conference. 一顿非正式的便餐作为为期三天的会议的序曲。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exordium, foreword, introduction, overture, preamble, prelude, prologue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]epilogue 尾声</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]prefatory adj. 序言的</div>
<h2>pregnant[sound:pregnant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">重要的，意味深长的：</font>weighty or significant; full of meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the pregnant phrases of the Bible              《圣经》中充满哲理的话语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]eloquent, meaningful, momentous, profound, revelatory, significant, suggestive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inane 空洞的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">怀孕的：</font>containing a developing embryo, fetus, or unborn offspring within the body</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Being pregnant represents great news, but it comes with a lot of responsibilities. 怀孕是件大好事，但是它也带来了许多的责任。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enceinte, expectant, expecting, gravid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]pregnancy n. 怀孕</div>
<h2>premeditate[sound:premeditate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">预先考虑：</font>to think, consider, or deliberate beforehand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]carefully premeditating each step of his plan 细致谋略他计划的每一步</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deliberate, prearrange, prepare, preplan</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disregard, ignore, neglect, omit, overlook  忽视</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]premeditation n. 谋略，事先考虑</div>
<h2>preoccupation[sound:preoccupation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">非常关心，全神贯注：</font>extreme or excessive concern with something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He kept sinking back into gloomy preoccupation. 他陷入了深深的忧虑之中。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absorption, engagement, engrossment, immersion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathy, indifference, nonchalance, unconcern  漠不关心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]preoccupied adj. 全神贯注的</div>
<h2>preponderant[sound:preponderant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">占优势的，更重要的：</font>having superior weight, force, importance, or influence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a preponderant misconception 一个影响甚广的错误概念</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dominant, paramount, predominant, prevalent, overruling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]secondary, subsidiary 次要的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]preponderance n. 优势地位</div>
<h2>prepossessing[sound:prepossessing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">给人好感的：</font>serving to impress favorably</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was fascinated by her prepossessing appearance at first sight. 他第一眼就被她迷人的外表吸引了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alluring, attractive, appealing, captivating, charming, enchanting, pleasing, riveting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abhorrent, appalling, disgusting, hideous, loathsome, repellent, repulsive  令人反感的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]unprepossessing adj. 不吸引人的</div>
<h2>preposterous[sound:preposterous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">荒谬的，不符合常理的：</font>contrary to nature, reason, or common sense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a preposterous conclusion of quantum mechanics  量子力学里有悖于常理的结论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absurd, asinine, fallacious, fatuous, lunatic, ludicrous, insane, irrational, unreasonable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commonsensical 常识性的；reasonable, sensible 有道理的</div>
<h2>presage[sound:presage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">征兆：</font>something believed to be a sign or warning of a future event</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sight of the first robin is always a welcome presage of spring. 第一只知更鸟的出现总是迎接春天到来的象征</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]augury, auspice, boding, foreboding, foreshadowing, portent, prefiguring</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">预示，预言：</font>to foretell or predict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The incident may presage war. 这个事件可能是战争的征兆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adumbrate, augur, forecast, foretell, portend, predict, prognosticate, prophesy</div>
<h2>prescience[sound:prescience.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">预知，先见：</font>knowledge of actions or events before they occur</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Most believers would probably agree that complete prescience is one of God's attributes. 所有的信徒大概都会同意上帝能够预见未来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]foresight, forethought, providence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]improvidence, myopia, shortsightedness 目光短浅</div>
<h2>prescription[sound:prescription.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">规定，传统的规矩：</font>something prescribed as a rule; especially an inherited or established way ofthinking, feeling, or doing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]convention, custom, decree, law, regulation, rule</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]prescribe    v. 开药方；设立规定</div>
<h2>preservative[sound:preservative.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">防腐剂：</font>an additive used to protect against decay, discoloration, or spoilage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]containing no chemical preservative  不含化学防腐剂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]preserve    v. 保存</div>
<h2>prestige[sound:prestige.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">声望，威望：</font>the level of respect at which one is regarded by others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The prestige of the university has been irrevocably impaired by the plagiarism scandal. 这所大学的声望已经因剽窃丑闻而受到了不可挽回的损失。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]credit, fame, influence, reputation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]infamy 坏名声</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]prestigious adj. 有名望的</div>
<h2>presumptuous[sound:presumptuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">放肆的，冒昧的：</font>overstepping due bounds (as of propriety or courtesy)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Under such a circumstance his demand for attention was utterly presumptuous. 在那种情况下他要求被关注是极其冒昧的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, bold, brash, impertinent, impudent, insolent, pompous, presuming</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]courteous, decorous, genteel, gracious, urbane 举止得体的，有礼貌的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">傲慢的：</font>having a feeling of superiority that shows itself in an overbearing attitude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The presumptuous doctor didn't even bother to explain to me the treatment that I would be receiving. 傲慢的医生连给我说明我会接受何种治疗的耐性都没有。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assumptive, bumptious, cavalier, haughty, imperious, lofty, overweening, peremptory, supercilious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humble, modest 谦卑的</div>
<h2>pretense[sound:pretense.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">虚假，伪装：</font>the act of pretending; a false appearance or action intended to deceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There is too much pretense in his piety. 他的虔诚大多都是伪装。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectation, camouflage, deceit, disguise, imposture, mask, masquerade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sincerity 真诚</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">自大，优越感：</font>an  exaggerated sense of one's importance that shows itself in the making ofexcessive or unjustified claims</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assumption, hauteur, imperiousness, loftiness, lordliness, pomposity, superciliousness, superiority</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humility, modesty 谦逊</div>
<h2>preternatural[sound:preternatural.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">超乎寻常的：</font>surpassing the normal or usual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They exhibited preternatural courage in face of danger. 他们在危险面前显示出了超乎寻常的勇气。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aberrant, abnormal, anomalous, extraordinary, phenomenal, magical, miraculous, unearthly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]common, ordinary, prosaic 平凡的</div>
<h2>prevail[sound:prevail.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">盛行，战胜：</font>to be greater in strength or influence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a custom that still prevails 依然盛行的传统</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conquer, dominate, overcome, reign, triumph</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]yield  屈服；lose 失败</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]prevailing adj. 盛行的</div>
<h2>prevalent[sound:prevalent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">流行的，普遍的：</font>widely or commonly occurring, existing, accepted, or practiced</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The kinds of accidents are frequently seen in places where snowmobiles are prevalent. 这种类型的事故在摩托雪橇盛行的地区是很常见的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conventional, dominant, common, popular, predominant, preponderant, prevailing, rife</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absent, rare 缺少的，稀少的；unusual  与众不同的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]prevalence n. 流行，遍及</div>
<h2>prevaricate[sound:prevaricate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">支吾其词，撒谎：</font>to stray from or evade the truth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]During the hearings the witness did his best to prevaricate.  听证会上证人在竭尽全力地支吾其词。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]equivocate, fabricate, falsify, lie, palter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]prevarication n. 支吾其词</div>
<h2>primordial[sound:primordial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">原始的，最初的：</font>being or happening first in sequence of time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]primordial forms of life 最原始的生命形态</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ancient, early, primal, primeval, primitive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]late, recent 最近的</div>
<h2>primp[sound:primp.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">精心打扮：</font>to dress, adorn, or arrange in a careful or finicky manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She primps for hours before a date. 她出门约会前要花数小时打扮。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]preen, dress up</div>
<h2>principal[sound:principal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">主要的，重要的：</font>first, highest, or foremost in importance, rank, worth, or degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The region's principal city is getting hammered by a series of terrorist attacks. 该地区的中心城市正在被一系列恐怖袭击攻击。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capital, cardinal, chief, dominant, grand, main, major, paramount, predominant, preeminent, primary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]secondary, subordinate 次要的</div>
<h2>pristine[sound:pristine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">纯净的，质朴的，未被文明腐蚀的：</font>remaining in a pure state; uncorrupted by civilization. remainingfree from dirt or decay; clean</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a pristine forest 一片未被文明影响的森林</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]immaculate, spotless, stainless, unsoiled, unstained, unsullied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]tainted, squalid, contaminated, besmirched ,corrupted by civilization  污染的，被文明腐蚀的</div>
<h2>privation[sound:privation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏，穷困：</font>lack of what is needed for existence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the constant privation of sleep was starting to affect his work 长期以来的睡眠不足开始影响他的工作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deprivation, loss</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]repletion 充满</div>
<h2>probe[sound:probe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v./n. 深入调查：a penetrating or critical investigation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]probe into his background 深入调查他的背景</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delving, disquisition, exploration, inquisition</div>
<h2>probity[sound:probity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">正直：</font>faithfulness to high moral standards</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a person of indisputable probity should head the disciplinary panel 一个绝对正直的人应该来领导纪律委员会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]honesty, integrity, rectitude, righteousness, uprightness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unscrupulousness, shiftiness, baseness, dishonor, lowness  肆无忌惮，欺骗</div>
<h2>proclivity[sound:proclivity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">癖性，偏好：</font>a natural propensity or inclination; predisposition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]showed artistic proclivities at an early age 在很小的时候就表现除了对艺术的喜好</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aptitude, disposition, leaning, partiality, penchant, predilection, propensity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aversion, antipathy, disinclination 厌恶，反感</div>
<h2>procrastinate[sound:procrastinate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（因为懒散）拖延：</font>to put off doing something, especially out of habitual carelessness or laziness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She procrastinated and missed the submission deadline. 她一直拖拖拉拉，导致错过了截止日期。</div>
<h2>procure[sound:procure.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">获得，取得：</font>to get possession of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]procured the prisoner's release 得到了释放囚犯的许可</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquire, attain, garner, knock down, pull down, bring in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]relinquish, forfeit, lose 放弃</div>
<h2>prod[sound:prod.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">促使……行动：</font>to try to persuade (someone) through earnest appeals to follow a course of action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The strike may prod the government into action. 罢工也许会迫使政府采取行动。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]encourage, exhort, goad, nudge, prompt, spur, egg on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]rein 抑制</div>
<h2>prodigal[sound:prodigal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">挥霍的：</font>recklessly spendthrift</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]prodigal outlays for her clothes 买衣服时挥金如土</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extravagant, profligate, squandering, unthrifty, wasteful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]frugal,  parsimonious, conserving, economical, economizing, penny-pinching, scrimping, skimping, thrifty节省的，吝啬的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]prodigality 浪费挥霍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]penury, husbandry 贫困，节约</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">败家子：</font>someone who spends money freely or foolishly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The million-dollar lottery winner was such a prodigal that his windfall was exhausted after only a few years.靠彩票中了百万的赢家是个败家子，几年之内就把这笔意外之财全部花完了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fritterer, high roller, profligate, spender, spendthrift, squanderer, waster, wastrel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]economizer, penny-pincher  吝啬的人</div>
<h2>prodigious[sound:prodigious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">巨大的：</font>impressively great in size, force, or extent; enormous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a prodigious supply of canned food kept in the basement 地下室贮存着大量罐头食品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]colossal, elephantine, enormous, gigantic, titanic, tremendous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]slight 微小的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]prodigy n. 天才，神童</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">惊人的，了不起的：</font>causing wonder or astonishment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]stage magicians performing prodigious feats for rapt audiences  舞台魔术师在全神贯注的观众们面前表演</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amazing,  astonishing,  astounding,  awesome,  fabulous,  miraculous,  portentous,  staggering,  stunning, stupendous, sublime, surprising</div>
<h2>profane[sound:profane.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">亵渎：</font>to treat (something sacred) with abuse, irreverence, or contempt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]invading troops profaned the altar by playing poker on it 侵略军亵渎了祭坛，竟然在上面打扑克</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defile, violate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]profaned  被亵渎的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unviolated, inviolable 未被亵渎的，不可亵渎的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">滥用：</font>to put to a bad or improper use</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]profaned his considerable acting talents by appearing in some wretched movies 在一些烂俗的电影里面出现简直就是浪费表演才华</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abuse, misemploy, misuse, pervert, prostitute</div>
<h2>proffer[sound:proffer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v./n. 献出，提供：to offer for acceptance; tender</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]proffered her assistance in helping the two sides reach a compromise 她在斡旋双方达成妥协过程中尽了力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extend, give, proffer, tender, trot out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]retain, withhold 保留</div>
<h2>proficient[sound:proficient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">熟练的，精通的：</font>having or marked by an advanced degree of competence, as in an art, vocation,profession, or branch of learning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]proficient in translating foreign languages 精通外语翻译</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accomplished, complete, expert, skilled, versed, virtuoso</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inept, incompetent, amateur, inexperienced, inexpert, jackleg, unprofessional, unseasoned, unskilled 无能的</div>
<h2>profligate[sound:profligate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj./n. 挥金如土的，挥霍的：recklessly wasteful; wildly extravagant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]leading a profligate life  过着骄奢淫逸的生活</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extravagant, high-rolling, spendthrift, squandering, thriftless, unthrifty, wasteful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]parsimonious, provident, thrift, economical, frugal, conserving 吝啬的，节俭的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">败家子：</font>someone who spends money freely or foolishly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]profligate who could not really afford the grand style he maintained at Monticello, Jefferson died deeply indebt 再也支撑不了在蒙蒂塞洛之时的大手大脚的作风，败家子杰斐逊最终深陷债务危机</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fritterer, high roller, spender, spendthrift, squanderer, waster, wastrel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]economizer, penny-pincher  吝啬的人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">堕落的人：</font>a person who has sunk below the normal moral standard</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a drunken profligate, he was given to wretched excess in every aspect of his life 一个喝醉的堕落的人，在生活的方方面面都日趋堕落</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backslider, debauchee, debaucher, decadent, deviate, libertine, perv, pervert, profligate, rake, rakehell, rip</div>
<h2>profundity[sound:profundity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">深奥，深刻：</font>something profound or abstruse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His books are a mixture of playfulness and profundity. 他的作品都是搞笑和深刻的结合体。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deepness, profoundness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]superficiality 肤浅</div>
<h2>profusion[sound:profusion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">丰富，大量：</font>the state of being profuse; abundance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]snow falling in profusion 雪量很大</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundance, mass, plentitude, scads, volume, wealth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]paucity 极小量</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]profuse 丰富的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]scanty 缺乏的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">挥霍，浪费：</font>the quality or fact of being free or wasteful in the expenditure of money</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]in giving gifts to his girlfriend, he was generous to the point of profusion 对于给女朋友的礼物支出一项，他慷慨到了几乎奢侈的地步</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extravagancy, lavishness, prodigality, wastefulness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]economy, frugality, penny-pinching</div>
<h2>prohibitive[sound:prohibitive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">禁止的；阻止的：</font>tending to prohibit or restrain</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（价格高得）抑制购买的：</font>so high or burdensome as to discourage purchase or use</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]prohibitive prices 抑制购买的高价</div>
<h2>proliferate[sound:proliferate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">快速繁殖，激增：</font>to grow or multiply by rapidly producing new tissue, parts, cells, or offspring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]rumors about the accident proliferated on the Internet 关于事故的小道消息在网上迅速扩散</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balloon, boom, build up, escalate, expand, mushroom, snowball</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decrease in amount, dwindle, contract, decrease, diminish, dwindle, lessen, recede, wane 数量减少，缩小</div>
<h2>prolix[sound:prolix.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">罗嗦的，冗长的：</font>tending to speak or write at excessive length</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]habitually transforms brief anecdotes into prolix sagas that exhaust his listeners 总是将简短的小趣事变成冗长的传说故事，让听众很疲倦</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diffuse, garrulous, rambling, verbose, windy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pithy, taciturn, terse, succinct, concise, extreme brief 精炼的，寡言的</div>
<h2>prologue[sound:prologue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">序言：</font>the preface or introduction to a literary work</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the burglary, which he committed while still a teen, was but a prologue to a wasted life of crime 他青少年时犯过的入室抢劫拉开了他偷盗生涯的序幕</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exordium, foreword, preamble, preface, prelude, proem, prolusion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]epilogue 结尾</div>
<h2>prolong[sound:prolong.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">延长，拖延：</font>to lengthen in extent, scope, or range</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Additives are used to prolong the shelf life of packaged food. 添加剂被用来延长包装食品的保存期限。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elongate, lengthen, outstretch, protract, stretch, drag (out), draw out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abbreviate, abridge, curtail, cut, cut back, shorten , truncate 截短</div>
<h2>proofread[sound:proofread.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">校对：</font>to read (copy or proof) in order to find errors and mark corrections</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She proofread the paper carefully. 她仔细把论文校对了。</div>
<h2>promulgate[sound:promulgate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">正式宣布：</font>to make known openly or publicly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The law was promulgated in June 1988. 法律在1988 年6 月出台。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annunciate, declare, enunciate, proclaim, publicize, herald</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]keep secret 保密</div>
<h2>propagate[sound:propagate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">繁殖：</font>to cause to continue or increase by sexual or asexual reproduction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the dams along the river are interfering with the salmon's ability to propagate  河上的大坝影响了大马哈鱼的繁殖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breed, multiply, reproduce</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fail to multiply  根除，繁殖失败</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">传播，宣传：</font>to cause to spread out and affect a greater number or greater area: extend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the various ways in which churches can propagate the faith  不同的宣传教义的方法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]broadcast, circulate, disseminate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]check 阻止</div>
<h2>propensity[sound:propensity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">倾向，癖好：</font>an often intense natural inclination or preference</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a neighbor who has an unfortunate propensity for snooping  好管闲事的邻居</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affinity, aptitude, bent, partiality, penchant, predilection, predisposition, proclivity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aversion 厌恶</div>
<h2>prophetic[sound:prophetic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">预言的，预示的：foretelling events：</font>predictive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]those lower-than-expected sales numbers were a prophetic indicator of the financial trouble the companywould soon be in  那些低于预期的销售数字就是公司即将陷入的金融危机的先兆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]predictive</div>
<h2>propitiate[sound:propitiate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">慰抚，劝解：</font>to conciliate (an offended power); appease</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the temple was built to honor the gods in times of plenty and to propitiate them in times of trouble 该庙宇的作用是，丰收之时感谢神明，有难之时安抚神明</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appease, assuage, conciliate, disarm, mollify, placate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enrage, incense, inflame, infuriate, ire, madden, outrage, antagonize, arouse hostility 激怒</div>
<h2>propitious[sound:propitious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">吉祥的：</font>favorably disposed: pointing toward a happy outcome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]propitious sign 吉祥的征兆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]auspicious, encouraging, fair, heartening, optimistic, promising, upbeat</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dim, discouraging, disheartening, futureless, hopeless, inauspicious, unfavorable, unpromising, unpropitious  不吉利的</div>
<h2>proponent[sound:proponent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">建议者，支持者：</font>one who argues in support of something; an advocate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a proponent of the use of electric-powered cars 电动能源汽车的支持者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advocate, apostle, champion, expounder, espouser, friend, promoter, supporter, protagonist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adversary, antagonist, opponent , detractor 诋毁者，反对者</div>
<h2>propriety[sound:propriety.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">礼节：</font>conformity to what is socially acceptable in conduct or speech</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]When attending a wedding, there are certain proprieties that must be followed. 参加婚礼时，有一些礼节需要遵守。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decorum, form, etiquette</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impropriety, indecency, indecorum</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">适当得体：</font>the quality or state of being especially suitable or fitting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I'm not sure about the propriety of serving champagne in these glasses. 我不确定在这种杯子里倒香槟是否得体。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appositeness, aptness, felicity, fitness, properness, rightness, seemliness, suitability</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]improperness, impropriety, inappositeness, inappropriateness, inaptness, infelicity, unfitness, unseemliness, unsuitability, wrongness 不得体</div>
<h2>prosaic[sound:prosaic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">单调的，常见的：</font>being of the type that is encountered in the normal course of events</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]prosaic advice 老掉牙的建议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commonplace, everyday, routine, unexceptional, unremarkable, workaday</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abnormal,  exceptional,  extraordinary,  odd,  out-of-the-way,  strange,  exciting,  preternatural,  ingenious, imaginary 不寻常的，有独创性的</div>
<h2>proscribe[sound:proscribe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">禁止，排斥：</font>to prohibit; forbid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]acts proscribed by law  被法律禁止的行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ban, enjoin, interdict, outlaw, prohibit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sanction, permit, allow, let, suffer 允许</div>
<h2>prosecution[sound:prosecution.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">实行，执行：</font>the doing of an action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]oversaw the prosecution of the president's foreign policy 监督总统对外政策的执行情况</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accomplishment, achievement, discharge, enactment, execution, fulfillment, implementation, performance,perpetration, pursuance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nonfulfillment, nonperformance 不履行，不完成</div>
<h2>proselytize[sound:proselytize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">改变信仰：</font>to persuade to change to one's religious faith</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The  efforts  of  early  missionaries  to  proselytize  the  Native  Americans  of  Minnesota  were  largelyunproductive. 早期传教士对于明尼苏达的土著人的改变信仰的努力大多无功而返。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]convert</div>
<h2>prospect[sound:prospect.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">探查，勘探：</font>to go into or range over for purposes of discovery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]people had arrived in the valley to prospect it for gold 人们来到山谷淘金</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hunt, probe, search, skirr</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">期待，被期望的某物：</font>the act or state of looking forward to some occurrence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The prospect of a quiet, restful Sunday ended when our basement flooded. 对一个宁静休闲的周日的期待被地下室涨水打破了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anticipation, contemplation, expectancy</div>
<h2>prosperous[sound:prosperous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">成功的，繁盛的：</font>marked by vigorous growth and well-being especially economically</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The company had a prosperous year. 公司今年业绩斐然。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]booming, flourishing, halcyon, lush, palmy, roaring, thriving</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]depressed, impecunious 萧条的，贫穷的</div>
<h2>prostrate[sound:prostrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj./v. 平躺：lying flat or at full length</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was lying prostrate on the bed. 他平躺在床上。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debilitated, effete, enervated, enfeebled, languid, sapped</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]erect, upright 直立的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj./v. 衰弱的/使衰竭：to reduce to extreme weakness or incapacitation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]illness that prostrated an entire family 将整个家庭拖垮的疾病</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debilitate, devitalize, enervate, enfeeble, etiolate, sap, tire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fortify, strengthen, beef up</div>
<h2>protean[sound:protean.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">善变的，多才多艺的：</font>displaying great diversity or variety; versatile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He loved to show off his protean talent. 他喜欢炫耀自己多样的才华.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adaptable, universal, all-around</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]static 固定的</div>
<h2>protocol[sound:protocol.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">正确的礼仪规范：</font>a code of correct conduct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a breach of protocol 社交礼仪的破坏</div>
<h2>protract[sound:protract.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">延长，拖长：</font>to draw out or lengthen in time; prolong</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elongate, lengthen, prolong, stretch, drag out, draw out,</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]curtail, abridge, abbreviate, shorten, cut back 缩减</div>
<h2>protrude[sound:protrude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">突出：</font>to jut out; project; bulge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a handkerchief protruding from his breast pocket 手帕从他的上衣口袋里突出出来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bulge, overhang, poke, project, stand out, stick out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concave 凹陷</div>
<h2>protuberant[sound:protuberant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">隆起的，凸出的：</font>thrusting out from a surrounding or adjacent surface often as a rounded mass</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]protuberant eyes 暴鱼眼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]depressed 下陷的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]protuberance 隆起</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concavity  凹陷</div>
<h2>provident[sound:provident.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">节俭的：</font>frugal; economical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]it is possible to be provident without being miserly  人可以做到节俭但不吝啬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]economical, sparing, thrifty, farsighted, provident, scrimping</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]profligate  挥霍的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有远见的：</font>having or showing awareness of and preparation for the future</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]her provident measures kept us safe while we waited out the hurricane 她之前有远见的准备让我等待飓风结束的期间安全无恙</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]farseeing, farsighted, forehanded, foreseeing, forethoughtful, prescient, proactive, visionary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]half-baked, half-cocked, improvident, myopic, shortsighted 目光短浅的</div>
<h2>providential[sound:providential.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">天意的，幸运的：</font>happening as if through divine intervention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a providential escape 幸运的逃脱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lucky, fluky, fortuitous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unfortunate, mishap, hapless, ill-fated, ill-starred, luckless, star-crossed 不幸的</div>
<h2>provincial[sound:provincial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj./n. 狭隘的：limited in perspective; narrow and self-centered</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an artist who has been criticized for being provincial 一个被批评非常狭隘的艺术家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]illiberal, insular, parochial, sectarian, narrow-minded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ecumenical, broad-minded, catholic, cosmopolitan, liberal, open, open-minded, receptive, tolerant 世界范围的，开放包容的</div>
<h2>provisional[sound:provisional.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">临时的：</font>provided or serving only for the time being; temporary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he was appointed provisional executor of the industrialist's vast estate 他被任命为庞大工业帝国的临时执行官</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impermanent, interim, provisionary, short-term</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]long-term, permanent 永久的</div>
<h2>provisory[sound:provisory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有附带条件的，临时的：</font>depending on a proviso; conditional; serving in a position for the timebeing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a provisory permit to block off the street while movie scenes were being shot 一个同意在电影拍摄期间封锁道路的临时许可</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]interim, provisional, provisionary, provisory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unconditional, long-term, permanent  无条件的，永久的</div>
<h2>provoke[sound:provoke.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激怒：</font>to incite to anger or resentment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his teasing finally provoked her to anger 他的调戏最终把她激怒了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arouse, excite, incite, instigate, pique, stimulate, stir, fire up</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">驱使，激起：</font>to stir to action or feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]rankings that are sure to provoke an argument among film critics 排名必将引发影评家们的争论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abet, ferment, foment, instigate, stir up, whip up</div>
<h2>prowess[sound:prowess.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">英勇，勇敢：</font>superior strength, courage, or daring, especially in battle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]his prowess on the football field  他在球场上过人的勇气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bravery, courageousness, daring, gallantry, guts, intrepidity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]timid, cowardice, cravenness, dastardliness, poltroonery, spinelessness 胆怯</div>
<h2>prowl[sound:prowl.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">潜行，巡游以猎取食物：</font>to roam through stealthily, as in search of prey or plunder</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I prowled the shop looking for sales.  我在商店里转悠，寻找打折商品。</div>
<h2>prude[sound:prude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">过分正经的人：一个过分关心自己是否是或显得得体、谦逊或正确的人：</font>a person who is greatlyconcerned with seemly behavior and morality especially regarding sexual matters</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the racy sitcom frequently satirizes exactly the sort of prude who would like to see the show taken off theair</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bluenose, moralist, puritan</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]immoralist 不道德的人</div>
<h2>prudish[sound:prudish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过分守礼的：</font>marked by prudery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]By the prudish standards of the 19th century, any depiction of the nude was scandalous. 根据 19 世纪的保守标准，任何对裸露的刻画描述都是下流无耻的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]nice-nelly, prim, puritanical</div>
<h2>prudent[sound:prudent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">明智的：</font>marked by wisdom or judiciousness; wise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]prudent advice 明智的建议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advisable, desirable, judicious, politic, tactical, intelligent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fool 傻的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">小心谨慎的，审慎的：</font>marked by circumspection</div>
<h2>prune[sound:prune.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">梅干：</font>a plum dried or capable of drying without fermentation</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">修剪：</font>to cut off or remove dead or living parts or branches of (a plant, for example) to improveshape or growth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The students were asked to prune their essays. 学生们被要求修改文章。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]shave, shear, snip, trim</div>
<h2>pry[sound:pry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">刺探：</font>to look or inquire closely, curiously, or impertinently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]don't go prying into other people's business 别去打探别人的事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]interlope, intermeddle, intrude, nose, obtrude, snoop</div>
<h2>pseudonym[sound:pseudonym.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">假名，笔名：</font>a fictitious name</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Mark Twain is the pseudonym of the American writer Samuel L. Clemens. 马克·吐温是美国作家塞缪尔·L ·克莱蒙斯的笔名。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alias, nom de guerre</div>
<h2>psychology[sound:psychology.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">心理学：</font>the science that deals with mental processes and behavior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She studied psychology in college. 她大学专业是心理学。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">心理战术：</font>subtle tactical action or argument used to manipulate or influence another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He used poor psychology on his employer when trying to make the point. 他表达观点时，对老板用了拙劣的心理战术。</div>
<h2>pucker[sound:pucker.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">撅（嘴），使收缩：</font>to become gathered, contracted, and wrinkled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pucker my lips 撅起嘴</div>
<h2>puckish[sound:puckish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">淘气的，顽皮的：</font>mischievous; impish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She had a puckish smile on her face. 她脸上挂着顽皮的笑容。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]devilish, impish, prankish, rascally, waggish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sober, grave, staid  严肃的</div>
<h2>puerile[sound:puerile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">幼稚的，不成熟的：</font>immature; lacking in adult experience or maturity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]puerile remarks 幼稚的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adolescent, green, immature, puerile, unfledged, unformed, unripened</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adult, experienced, grown-up, mature, ripe, sagacious 睿智的，成熟的</div>
<h2>puissance[sound:puissance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">权力：</font>power; might</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the president pledged to put the full puissance of the nation into the war effort  总统下令全国进入战争状态</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]force, might, potency, strength, vigor, sinew</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]powerlessness, impotence, weakness 无力</div>
