<h2>pulchritude[sound:pulchritude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">美丽：</font>great physical beauty and appeal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ugliness, homeliness, hideousness 丑陋，平庸</div>
<h2>pulverize[sound:pulverize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">研磨成粉：</font>to bring to a complete end the physical soundness, existence, or usefulness of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Bits of pulverized rock filled the air. 被碾碎的岩石碎片充斥在空气里。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]solidify, build, construct, erect, put up, raise, rear, set up 硬化，构建</div>
<h2>pun[sound:pun.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">双关语：</font>the usually  humorous  use of a word in such a way as to suggest two or more of itsmeanings or the meaning of another word similar in sound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He's a skillful pilot whose career has—no pun intended—really taken off.  她是个技术娴熟的飞行员，飞行生涯——没有别的意思——真正腾飞了。</div>
<h2>punctilious[sound:punctilious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">注意细节的，一丝不苟的：</font>strictly attentive to minute details of form in action or conduct.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decorous, proper, starchy, stilted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]remiss, slipshod, casual, easygoing, informal, laid-back, unceremonious  粗心的</div>
<h2>pundit[sound:pundit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">权威人士，专家：</font>a person who gives opinions  in an authoritative  manner usually through themass media</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the new laptop has gotten a thumbs-up from industry pundits 新出的笔记本电脑受到了业界专家的一致好评</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]savant, scholar</div>
<h2>pungent[sound:pungent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">辛辣的，讽刺的：</font>marked by the use of wit that is intended to cause hurt feelings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pungent language  辛辣讽刺的语言</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acerbic, acid, acrid, caustic, mordant, sardonic, scalding, scathing</div>
<h2>puny[sound:puny.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">微小的，弱小的：</font>of inferior size, strength, or significance; weak</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I wouldn't mess with him—he makes bodybuilders look puny in comparison. 我不敢招惹他——其他健身的人和他比起来都像小孩。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diminutive, dwarfish, slight, subnormal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enormous,  considerable,  grand,  husky,  king-size,  outsize,  overscale,  substantial,  whacking,  whopping巨大的</div>
<h2>purity[sound:purity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">纯净；清白，无罪：</font>the quality or state of being morally pure; the quality or state of being morallypure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]struggling to live a life of purity while surrounded by wickedness即使周围充满邪恶，也要使自己生命纯粹、完美</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chasteness, immaculacy, innocence, modesty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impurity, unchasteness, unchastity 堕落，没有节操</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]impurity n. 杂质</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]purist n. 纯粹主义者</div>
<h2>purlieu[sound:purlieu.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">常去的地方：</font>a place for spending time or for socializing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The restaurant, the preferred purlieu of the theatergoing crowd, is always packed an hour or two beforeshowtime. 观剧的人群经常去的那间餐厅，总是在演出开始前1-2 小时爆满。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]haunt, purlieu, rendezvous, resort, stamping ground, stomping ground</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">临近的地区：</font>an adjoining region or space</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We stopped at one of the several pubs in the purlieus of the stadium. 我们在体育馆附近的一间酒吧停下来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backyard, neighborhood, purlieus, vicinage, vicinity</div>
<h2>purloin[sound:purloin.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">偷窃：</font>to steal, often in a violation of trust</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fearing that someone might attempt to purloin a copy of the script for the show's season finale 害怕该剧的完季那集剧本被盗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appropriate, filch, pilfer, snitch, thieve</div>

<h2>pusillanimous[sound:pusillanimous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">懦弱的，胆小得令人鄙视的：</font>lacking courage and resolution : marked by contemptible timidity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pusillanimous politicians who vote according to whichever way the political wind is blowing 胆小懦弱的政客，舆论风向倒向谁就投票给谁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]craven, dastardly, gutless, poltroon, recreant, spineless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brave,  courageous,  daring,  dauntless,  doughty,  gallant,  gutsy,  intrepid,  lionhearted,  stalwart,  stout, stouthearted, valiant, valorous 勇敢的</div>
<h2>quack[sound:quack.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">骗子医生，江湖郎中：</font>a pretender to medical skill</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]don't bother to see that guy, as I've heard he's a quack with no actual training  别再找他看病了，我听说他就是个没有真才实学的江湖郎中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charlatan, fake, fraud, hoaxer, mountebank, phony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]honest practitioner 诚实从业者</div>
<h2>quaff[sound:quaff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">大口地喝：</font>to drink (a beverage) heartily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He stopped at a bar and quaffed a few beers.  他在酒吧停下来，痛饮了几杯啤酒。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]draft, gulp, swig, swill</div>
<h2>quail[sound:quail.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">胆怯，畏缩：</font>to shrink back in fear; cower</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She quailed at the thought of seeing him again. 她想到还要再见他就害怕。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blench, cringe, recoil, shrink, wince</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]become resolute, give bold  变得坚决、大胆</div>
<h2>qualify[sound:qualify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">限定：</font>to reduce from a general to a particular or restricted form</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]qualified support 有限的支持</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]qualified</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unreserved, absolute, categorical 无保留的，不受限制的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">使有资格，有能力：</font>to  make competent  (as by training, skill, or ability) for a particular office orfunction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]raising five children has qualified her to be an advice columnist on parenting 抚养五个孩子的经历让她成为了育儿板块的专栏作家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]equip, fit, prepare, ready, season, train</div>
<h2>quandary[sound:quandary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">困惑，窘境：</font>a state of perplexity or doubt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I've had two job offers, and I'm in a real quandary about/over which one to accept.  我有两个工作机会,但实在是进退两难，不知道应该选哪一个.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catch-22, double bind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]state of complete certainty 胸有成竹</div>
<h2>quarantine[sound:quarantine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">隔离：</font>to isolate from normal relations or communication</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The cows will be kept in quarantine for another two weeks.  牛群还需要被隔离观察两周。</div>
<h2>quarry[sound:quarry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">采石场：</font>an open excavation or pit from which stone is obtained by digging, cutting, or blasting</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">目标，猎物：</font>an object of pursuit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a hunter relentlessly tracking his quarry 无情捕杀猎物的猎人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chase</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]predator 捕猎者</div>

<h2>rambunctious[sound:rambunctious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">喧闹的，骚乱的：</font>being rough or noisy in a high-spirited way</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That beach is often taken over by packs of rambunctious young people, so don't go there expecting peaceand quiet. 那个海滩经常被一帮吵闹的年轻人占领，所以不要指望过去能享受到平静和安宁。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boisterous, clamorous, raucous, riotous, rowdy, tumultuous, turbulent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]orderly 有秩序的；calm, noiseless, peaceful, placid, quiet, serene, silent, soundless, tranquil  安静的</div>
<h2>ramshackle[sound:ramshackle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">摇摇欲坠的：</font>appearing ready to collapse; rickety</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a ramshackle cabin in the woods 树林中摇摇欲坠的小木屋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rickety, shaky, tottering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concrete, firm, solid, sturdy  坚固的；stable 稳定的</div>
<h2>rancor[sound:rancor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">敌意，深仇：</font>a bitter deep-seated ill will</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A good man terminates a friendship without rancor. 君子绝交不记仇。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animosity, animus, antagonism, antipathy, bitterness, gall, grudge, hostility, jaundice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amity, harmony, goodwill, rapport, rapprochement  和睦，友好；friendship 友谊</div>
<h2>random[sound:random.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">随机的，随意的：</font>lacking a definite plan, purpose, or pattern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We received several answers and picked one at random. 我们收到了若干答案，并随机抽取了一个。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]aimless, arbitrary, desultory, erratic, haphazard, scattered, slapdash, stray</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]methodical, orderly, organized, regular, systematic, systematized 井然有序的，系统化的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]randomly adv. 随机地；randomize    v. 随机挑选、排列</div>
<h2>rankle[sound:rankle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激怒：</font>to cause anger, irritation, or deep bitterness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It rankles me when some schools can't even afford paper and pencils for the students.  当我获悉有些学校连纸张和铅笔都无法提供给学生时，我感到十分愤怒。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, enrage, exasperate, incense, inflame, infuriate, ire, madden, rile, roil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delight, gratify, please 使愉悦；appease, assuage, conciliate, mollify, placate, propitiate 安抚</div>
<h2>rant[sound:rant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（尤指长时间的）训斥，责骂：</font>a long angry speech or scolding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After complaining about the hotel’s lousy service, the woman went off on another rant about the conditionof her room.  在抱怨完旅店差劲的服务之后，她继续对房间的条件开骂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]castigation, diatribe, harangue, lambasting, philippic, reprimand, reproach, vituperation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]encomium, eulogy, panegyric, rhapsody, tribute 赞美之词</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">怒吼：</font>to speak or write in a noisy, angry or violent manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The old expert ranted that nobody paid any attention to his opinion. 老专家怒气冲冲的叫嚷说没人听他的观点。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bluster, fulminate, huff, rave, roar, spout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]grumble, murmur, mutter 低声抱怨</div>
<h2>rapacious[sound:rapacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">食量大的，贪食的：</font>having a huge appetite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The manager at the buffet restaurant was apparently astonished by a team of rapacious professionalbasketball players. 自助餐厅的经理很明显被那一队胃口巨大的职业篮球队员们震惊到了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]edacious, esurient,gluttonous, greedy, ravenous, voracious</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过度贪婪的：</font>excessively grasping or covetous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some companies is rapacious and hardly looking for the long-term value. 有些公司十分贪婪，而且不考虑长期利益。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquisitive, avaricious, avid, coveting, covetous, grasping, mercenary, moneygrubbing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]content, sated, satiated, satisfied 心满意足的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]rapaciousness n. 贪婪</div>
<h2>rapport[sound:rapport.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">和睦，友好：</font>a friendly relationship marked by ready communication and mutual understanding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His good rapport with his students was one of the reasons why the school board named him Teacher of theYear. 他和学生的关系和睦是他被提名为“年度教师”的原因之一。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amity,communion, concord, fellowship, harmony, rapprochement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]animosity, antagonism, antipathy, bitterness, enmity, hostility, jaundice, rancor 敌意</div>
<h2>rapprochement[sound:rapprochement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">和睦，友好：</font>establishment of or state of having cordial relations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an era of rapprochement betweenChina and Russia 中俄两国睦邻友好关系的新纪元</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amity,communion, concord, fellowship, harmony, rapport</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]animosity, antagonism, antipathy, bitterness, enmity, hostility, jaundice, rancor 敌意</div>
<h2>rapscallion[sound:rapscallion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">流氓，恶棍：</font>a mean, evil, or unprincipled person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unsafe place frequented by drunkards and rapscallions 一个酒鬼和流氓经常造访的不安全的地方</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brute, devil, evildoer, fiend, knave, miscreant, rascal, reprobate, rogue, savage, scamp, varlet, wretch</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]saint  圣人；cavalier, chevalier （尤指对女士）彬彬有礼的绅士</div>
<h2>rapt[sound:rapt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">狂喜的：</font>experiencing or marked by overwhelming usually pleasurable emotion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a rock band that still attracts rapt crowds  一个仍然拥有者狂热粉丝的乐队</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elated, elevated, enraptured, entranced, euphoric, exhilarated, intoxicated, rapturous, rhapsodic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crestfallen, dejected, depressed  沮丧的；doleful, gloomy, melancholy, mournful, woeful 哀伤的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">全神贯注的：</font>deeply absorbed; engrossed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With a mixture of delight and awe, the rapt children stared at the chick in the incubator breaking out of itsshell. 怀着愉快和敬畏的复杂心理，孩子们全神贯注地盯着孵化箱中的小鸡破壳而出。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absorbed, concentrated, deep, engrossed, enthralled, focused, immersed, intent, observant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absent, abstracted, distracted, inattentive 不专心的；apathetic, disinterested, unconcerned  冷漠的，不关心的</div>
<h2>rash[sound:rash.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">草率的，仓促的：</font>marked by or proceeding from undue haste or lack of deliberation or caution</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That was too rash a move: for now you've lost your bishop and probably the whole chess game. 那一招棋着实是太草率了，现在你丢掉了象，很有可能会输掉整场比赛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cursory, gadarene, headlong, hurried, overhasty, precipitate, precipitous, rushed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deliberate 慎重考虑的；leisurely, unhurried, unrushed 从容不迫的，不慌不忙的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]rashly adv. 草率地，仓促地</div>
<h2>rarefy[sound:rarefy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使稀薄：</font>to make rare, thin, porous, or less dense: to expand without the addition of matter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]rarefy the air 使空气变得稀薄</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attenuate, dilute, thin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concentrate, condense  使稠密，浓缩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]rarefaction n. 稀薄，稀疏</div>
<h2>raspy[sound:raspy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">声音刺耳的：</font>harsh and dry in sound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The dying man was speaking in a raspy and barely discernible voice. 将死的人在用一种沙哑刺耳且难以听清的语调说话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cacophonous, coarse, croaky, harsh, grating, gravelly, gruff, husky, rasping, rusty, scratchy, throaty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mellifluous, sweet  声音甜美的；gentle, soft, tender 声音轻柔的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">容易生气的：</font>easily irritated or annoyed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Overwork tends to make him raspy. 过度的工作让他变得烦躁易怒。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choleric, fiery, grouchy, irascible, peevish, pettish, petulant, prickly, ratty, testy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agreeable, amiable, good-natured, good-tempered, well-disposed 脾气性格好的</div>
<h2>ratify[sound:ratify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（官方地）认可，批准：</font>to give official acceptance of as satisfactory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Lincoln's home state of Illinois was the first to ratify the 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, which provided for the abolition of slavery. 林肯的老家——伊利诺伊是美国第一个通过《宪法第十三修正案》的州，该决案提供了废除奴隶制的法律基础。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accredit, approbate, authorize, certify, endorse, finalize, formalize, pass, sanction, validate, warrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decline, deny, disallow, disapprove, negative, reject, veto 否决</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ratification n. 正式批准</div>
<h2>ratiocination[sound:ratiocination.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">推理：</font>the thought processes that have been established as leading to valid solutions to problems</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As an expert in ratiocination, the detective Sherlock Holmes has few rivals. 作为推理专家，大侦探福尔摩斯可谓无人能及。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deduction, intellection, reason, reasoning, sense</div>
<h2>ration[sound:ration.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">定额供应量，配给量：</font>an amount allotted or made available especially from a limited supply</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The meat ration was down to one pound per person per week. 肉的人均供给量降至了每周一磅。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allotment, allowance, apportionment, portion, provision, quota, share</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">按比例分配：</font>to give as a share or portion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The region has had to ration water during times of drought.  干旱时该地区不得不按比例分配水资源。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allocate, allot, allow, apportion, assign, distribute, lot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]keep, retain, withhold 扣留，拒接给予</div>
<h2>rational[sound:rational.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">合乎逻辑的：</font>consistent with or based on reason; logical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He insisted there was a rational explanation for the strange creaking noises and that there were no suchthings as ghosts.  他坚持认为奇怪的咯吱声一定有一个合理的解释，而不是所谓的鬼在作怪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]analytic, coherent, consequent, logical, reasonable, sensible, sound, valid, well-founded, well-grounded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]illogical, incoherent, inconsequent, invalid, irrational, unreasonable, unsound, weak 不合逻辑的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">理性的：</font>based on sound reasoning or information</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Betting all of your savings on the lottery is not a rational move. 把你所有的存款赌在彩票上可不是一个理智的决定。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commonsensical, firm, informed, just, justified, levelheaded, sober, solid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]groundless, unfounded, unjustified 无理由的，无根据的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]rationalize    v. 使合理化；找借口</div>
<h2>rave[sound:rave.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">狂热赞扬：</font>to make an exaggerated display of affection or enthusiasm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Critics raved about the new play. 新剧得到了评论家们的热烈赞扬。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drool, effuse, enthuse, fuss, rhapsodize, slobber</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blame, censure, condemn, criticize, denounce, pan, reprehend 批评，指责</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（发疯般地）怒吼：</font>to talk irrationally and wildly in or as if in delirium</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a man standing outside the city hall,raving like a lunatic about his tax bill  站在市政大厅外、像疯子一样叫嚷着自己税单的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bluster, fulminate, huff, rant, roar, spout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]grumble, murmur, mutter 小声抱怨</div>
<h2>ravel[sound:ravel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">解开，松开：</font>to separate the various strands of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Since the sweater is too small, you could ravel the yarnout and make something else with it. 既然这个毛衣太大，你可以把它拆了然后织些新的东西。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disentangle, extricate, unbraid, unsnarl, untwine, unweave</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]braid, knit, plait, weave 编织</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">阐明：</font>to clarify by separating the aspects of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clarify, clear, elucidate, untangle, unravel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]complex, complicate, entangle, perplex, sophisticate, snarl, tangle 使复杂化</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使纠缠，使复杂化：</font>to tangle or complicate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a ravelled story 一个复杂的故事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]complex, complicate, entangle, perplex, sophisticate, snarl, tangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clarify, clear, elucidate, untangle, unravel  阐明</div>
<h2>ravish[sound:ravish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使陶醉，使沉迷：</font>to overcome with emotion (as wonder or delight)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I was completely ravished by those marvelous pictures taken by HST. 那些哈勃太空望远镜拍摄的壮观图片让我彻底的陶醉了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]captivate, enchant, enrapture, enthrall, rapture, transport</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disenchant, sober  使清醒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ravishing adj. 极美丽的</div>
<h2>raze[sound:raze.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">摧毁，粉碎：</font>to destroy completely by or as if by knocking down or breaking to pieces</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Excavators were began to raze old school building. 挖土机开始夷平学校的老建筑。‖An  entire  cityblock razed by a terrible fire. 大火摧毁了整个街区。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annihilate, decimate, demolish, devastate, level, nuke, pulverize, ruin, smash, vaporize, wreck, tear down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]build, construct, erect, raise, rear, set up 建造</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]razor n. 剃须刀</div>
<h2>react[sound:react.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">做出反应：</font>to act or behave in response (as to a stimulus or influence)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]didn't know how to react to the cheers of the crowd 不知如何对人群的欢呼声做出回应</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]answer, reply, respond</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reaction n. 反应；reactant n. （化学反应当中的）反应物</div>
<h2>reactionary[sound:reactionary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">反对变革的，极保守的：</font>characterized  by  reaction,  especially  opposition  to  progress  orliberalism; extremely conservative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]reactionary rulers  保守的统治者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brassbound, conservative, die-hard, hidebound, traditionalistic, ultraconservative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]liberal 允许变革的；progressive 进步的；radical, aggressive 激进的</div>
<h2>ream[sound:ream.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">怒斥，训斥：</font>to criticize (someone) severely or angrily especially for personal failings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You are so going to get reamed out when the boss learns that you wrecked the company car. 要是老板知道你把公司的车弄坏了，你肯定会挨骂的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baste, berate, castigate, chastise, hammer, lambaste, rail, rebuke, reprimand, reproach, upbraid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accredit, applaud, commend, eulogize, extol, laud, praise 表扬，赞扬</div>
<h2>reap[sound:reap.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">收割，收获：</font>to collect (a crop or natural resource) or to receive as return for effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As you sow, so shall you reap. 唯有付出，才有回报。‖She reaped large profits from her patents.  她的专利给她带来了丰厚的回报。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquire, attain, capture, harvest, gain, garner, obtain, procure, secure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plant, seed, sow  种植，播种；forfeit, lose  丧失，没收</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reaper n. 收割机；死神</div>
<h2>reassure[sound:reassure.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使安心，打消疑虑：</font>to restore to confidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I tried to reassure her that the dog would come back home by nightfall. 我尽力让她安心，说夜幕降临之前小狗一定会回家的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assure, cheer, console, solace, soothe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]distress, torment, torture, trouble 使忧虑，折磨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reassurance n. 消除疑虑</div>
<h2>rebuff[sound:rebuff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">严词拒绝：</font>to reject or criticize sharply</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]rebuffed an invitation from her colleagues 回绝了同事们的邀请‖She rebuffed him when he asked her fora date. 她拒绝了他约会的邀请。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decline, deny, refuse, reject, repudiate, repulse, snub, spurn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accept 接受；approve 赞同；welcome 欢迎</div>
<h2>recalcitrant[sound:recalcitrant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顽抗的，不顺从的：</font>marked by stubborn resistance to and defiance of authority or guidance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a recalcitrant teenager  执拗的少年 ‖The  manager  worried  that  the  recalcitrant  employee  would  try  toundermine his authority. 经理担心那些不听命的员工会削弱它的权威。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balky, contumacious, defiant, incompliant, insubordinate, intractable, obstreperous, rebellious, refractory,unruly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amenable, compliant, conformable, docile, governable, obedient, ruly, submissive, tractable 服从的，顺从的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]recalcitrance n. 固执，不服从命令</div>
<h2>recant[sound:recant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">撤回，放弃，改变：</font>to withdraw or repudiate (a statement or belief) formally and publicly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The man has refused after torture to recant his heresy.  这个人在受折磨后依旧拒绝放弃他的异教信仰。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abjure, abnegate, forswear, renege, renounce, repeal, repudiate, retract, withdraw</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adhere, insist, maintain, stick 坚持</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]recantation n. 改变论调</div>
<h2>recessive[sound:recessive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（基因等）隐性的，由隐形基因控制的：</font>of, relating to, or designating an allele that does notproduce a characteristic effect when present with a dominant allele</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a recessive disease 阴性基因控制的疾病</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dominant 显性的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">内向的，内敛的：</font>not comfortable around people</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]For such a recessive genius, the most comfortable thing is working alone in his lab. 对于这样一个内向的天才而言，最舒服的事情就是一个人在实验室里干活。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backward, bashful, coy, demure, diffident, introverted, modest, retiring, self-effacing, sheepish, withdrawn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extroverted, immodest, outgoing 外向的；gregarious, sociable 好交际的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]recession n. 后退，衰退</div>
<h2>recidivate[sound:recidivate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">回到原先的习惯，尤指重新犯罪：</font>to return to a previous pattern of behavior, especially to return tocriminal habits</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The suspect has recidivated for several times. 这个嫌犯是个惯犯了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]regress, relapse, retrogress, revert</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]habilitate, reclaim, redeem, regenerate, rehabilitate 洗心革面</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]recidivism n. 再犯，重犯；recidivist n. 再次犯罪的人</div>
<h2>reciprocate[sound:reciprocate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">往复运动：</font>to move forward and backward alternately</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]According to Marx’s economic principle, the average price of a certain product should be reciprocatingover its value. 根据马克思的经济学理论，商品的平均价格应该在它的价值周边波动。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fluctuate, oscillate, sway, swing, vacillate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">报答，回报：</font>to return in kind or degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]reciprocated the favor by driving their neighbor to the airport 开车送邻居去机场以还人情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]recompense, repay, requite, retaliate, return</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]owe 欠（钱、人情等）</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reciprocal adj. 相互之间的，互惠的</div>
<h2>reckless[sound:reckless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不考虑后果的，大胆鲁莽的：</font>careless of consequences; foolishly adventurous or bold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His reckless driving accounted for the accident. 他鲁莽的开车行为导致了这场事故。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, bold, brash, brassy, brazen, careless, daredevil, rash, madcap, temerarious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careful, cautious, circumspect, guarded, heedful, prudent, wary 慎重的，小心的</div>
<h2>recluse[sound:recluse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">隐士：</font>a person who lives away from others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was sick of cities and crowds, so he decided to go live by himself in the woods as a recluse.  他厌倦了城市和拥挤的人群，因此他决定像隐士一样遁隐山林。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anchorite, eremite, hermit, isolate, solitary</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">隐居的，不爱社交的：</font>marked by withdrawal from society</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a recluse poet who left a large amount of literature legacies 一个留下了大量文学遗产的隐居诗人‖Myneihgbor is so recluse that I only see him about once a year. 我的邻居太神秘了，一般我一年只能见他一面。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cloistered, hermetic, secluded, secluse, seclusive, sequestered</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gregarious, social 好交际的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reclusive adj. 隐居的</div>
<h2>recoil[sound:recoil.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">退却，畏缩：</font>to shrink back, as under pressure or in fear or repugnance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]recoil from the snake 因为害怕蛇而畏缩不前 ‖She recoiled from his touch.  她因害怕与他接触而退缩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blench, cringe, flinch,quail, shrink, squinch, wince</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confront, meet 面对</div>
<h2>reconcile[sound:reconcile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使和解，协调：</font>to restore to friendship or harmony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Historians have never been able to reconcile the two eyewitness accounts of the battle. 历史学家们一直以来都无法协调这场战役两种记载之间的矛盾。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accommodate, attune, conciliate, conform, coordinate, harmonize, key</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disharmonize  使不和谐；estrange 离间</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reconciliation n. 协调</div>
<h2>recondite[sound:recondite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">深奥的，难解的：</font>difficult  or  impossible  for  one  of  ordinary  understanding  or  knowledge  tocomprehend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I think Quantum Mechanics and Random Process arethe two most recondite courses in our curriculum thissemester. 我觉得量子力学和随机过程是这学期课表中最难的两门课程</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstruse, arcane, deep, enigmatic, esoteric, hermetic, occult, profound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]facile, shallow, superficial 肤浅的；easy, simple  简单的</div>
<h2>reconnoiter[sound:reconnoiter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">侦察，勘查：</font>to make a preliminary inspection of, especially in order to gather military information</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The wide utilization of unmanned aerial vehicles makes it much less risky to  reconnoiter a certain area.无人飞行器的广泛运用大大减少了军事侦察的风险</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]probe,scout, survey</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reconnaissance n. 侦察</div>
<h2>reconstitute[sound:reconstitute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">重建，（尤其是通过加水）使复原：</font>to constitute again or anew; to restore to a former condition,especiallyby adding water</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]reconstitute dried  coffee  powder 冲咖啡 ‖Slowly  Jewish  communities  ravaged  by  Nazi  Germany  werereconstituted and life began anew.被纳粹德国摧残的犹太人社区慢慢得以重建，新的生活开始了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reconstruct, reorder, reorganize, reshuffle, retool</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annihilate, decimate, demolish, devastate, level, nuke, pulverize, ruin, smash, vaporize, wreck 摧毁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reconstitution n. （加水）复原</div>
<h2>reconvene[sound:reconvene.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">重新集合，重新召集：</font>to gather, call together, or summon again, especially for a formal meeting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The leaders will reconvene tomorrow. 明天领导们会再次召开会议。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reassemble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adjourn, suspend 休会</div>
<h2>rectitude[sound:rectitude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">正直：</font>the quality or state of being straight; moral integrity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The principal encouraged the graduates to go on to live lives of rectitude.  校长鼓励毕业生们在今后的生活中做一个正直的人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]honesty, integrity, probity, righteousness, scrupulousness, uprightness, virtue, virtuousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]badness, evil, immorality, iniquity, sin, villainy, wickedness 邪恶，罪恶</div>
<h2>recumbent[sound:recumbent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">躺着的：</font>lying down, especially in a position of comfort or rest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lying recumbent on the floor 躺在地板上势</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decumbent, procumbent, prone, prostrate, reclining, supine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]erect, upright 直立的</div>
<h2>recuperate[sound:recuperate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">恢复（健康或力量），康复：</font>to recover health or strength</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is gradually recuperating from a serious back injury. 他正渐渐地从严重的背部损伤中恢复过来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]convalesce, heal, rally, recoup, recover, rehabilitate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deteriorate, flag, wane, weaken  衰退，变得衰弱；die, expire, perish, pass away 死亡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]recuperative adj. 有助于康复的</div>
<h2>redolent[sound:redolent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">芳香的：</font>having or emitting fragrance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be redolent with the aroma of baking bread 充满了烤面包的香味</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambrosial, aromatic, fragrant, perfumed, savory, scented, sweet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unscented 没有香味的；fetid, foul, malodorous, noisome, rancid, reeky, stinky  恶臭的，腐臭的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]redolence n. 芳香，香味</div>
<h2>redoubtable[sound:redoubtable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">杰出的，值得尊敬的：</font>worthy of respect or honor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a surprising discovery by one of the most redoubtable figures in Egyptian archaeology  埃及考古学领域最值得敬重的人物之一所做出的一个惊人发现</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bright, distinguished, illustrious, luminous, notable, noteworthy, outstanding, preeminent, prestigious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]average, inferior, mediocre  平庸的，中等偏下的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可怕的：</font>arousing fear or awe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His next opponent would be by far the most redoubtable adversary the young boxer had ever faced.  年轻的拳击手的下一个对手将会是迄今为止他见过的最可怕的敌人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]direful, dreadful, fearsome, formidable, frightening, ghastly, horrifying, intimidating, scary, terrifying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calming, comforting, consoling, lulling, pacifying, quieting, reassuring, relaxing, soothing 令人放松的</div>
<h2>redundant[sound:redundant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多余的，冗余的：</font>exceeding what is necessary or normal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This area is already chockablock with shopping malls; another one would be redundant. 这个地区已经是商场扎堆了，再建一个完全是多此一举。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excess, extra, supererogatory, superfluous, supernumerary, surplus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deficient, inadequate, insufficient, meager, niggardly, scant, scarce, short, sparse 缺乏，稀疏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]redundancy n. 过剩，过多</div>
<h2>reel[sound:reel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">感到眩晕：</font>to be in a confused state as if from being twirled around</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My head reeled with the facts and figures. 我的头脑被这些事实和数据给弄晕了。‖His  mind  reeled upon hearing the news that his employer had been indicted for fraud. 当他听到雇主因为欺诈而被起诉时，他顿觉天旋地转。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]spin, swirl, turn, whirl</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm  保持镇定</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">蹒跚地走路：</font>to move forward while swaying from side to side</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The drunkard reeled down the alley.  醉汉蹒跚地沿着小巷走去</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careen, dodder, falter, lurch, stagger, stumble, teeter, totter, waddle</div>
<h2>referee[sound:referee.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">仲裁者；裁判员：</font>a person who impartially decides or resolves a dispute or controversy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]served as the unofficial referee in disputes over the family business 作为一个非官方协调员，解决家庭事务中的纠纷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjudicator, arbiter, arbitrator, judge , umpire</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（就纠纷或争议）给出意见：</font>to give an opinion about (something at issue or in dispute)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their father usually ends up refereeing any disputes concerning use of the big TV. 最后往往是他们的父亲决定该看什么电视频道，从而解决了相关争执。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjudge, adjudicate, arbitrate, decide, determine, settle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consult 咨询</div>
<h2>refine[sound:refine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">提纯，精炼：</font>to free (as metal, sugar, or oil) from impurities or unwanted material</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Oil is refined so as to remove naturally occurring impurities. 原油通过精炼可去除其中天然存在的杂质。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]filter, garble, purify, winnow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adulterate, contaminate, pollute  掺杂，污染</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">改善，改进：</font>to improve or perfect by pruning or polishing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You’d better refine your backhand before the big tennis match if you want to throne. 如果你想获得冠军的话，你最好在网球大赛开赛前再提升一下反手的技术。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ameliorate, amend, better, enhance, enrich, help, meliorate, perfect, polish, upgrade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deteriorate, worsen 恶化，降低</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]refined adj. （物品）精雕细琢的，（人）彬彬有礼的；refinery n. 炼油厂</div>
<h2>reflect[sound:reflect.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">反射：</font>to prevent passage of and cause to change direction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The color of an objective is largely determined by what light it reflects. 物体的颜色很大程度上是由它能反射的光所决定的。‖Mirrors indiscriminately reflect all visible lights.  镜子不加区分地反射所有的可见光。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorb 吸收</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">反映，显露：</font>to make manifest or apparent: show</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her book clearly reflects her religious beliefs.  她的书反映了她的宗教信仰。‖Where you come fromcouldbe easily reflected in your accent. 你的口音可以轻易地暴露你来自哪里。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bespeak, betray, demonstrate, evince, manifest, reveal, show</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conceal, cover, hide, mask, obscure, occlude, veil  隐藏</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">思考：</font>to think seriously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I reflected on my path as an undergraduate and my future as a PhD candidate. 我思考了我作为一名本科生的成长足迹以及我读博士的未来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consider, cogitate, contemplate, deliberate, meditate, muse, ponder, ruminate, think</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reflective adj. 思考的，深思熟虑的</div>
<h2>refractory[sound:refractory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">倔强的，不顺从的：</font>resisting control or authority</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Refractory players will be ejected from the game. 不服从裁判命令的球员将会被驱逐出场。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balky, contumacious, defiant, incompliant, insubordinate, intractable, obstreperous, rebellious, refractory,unruly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amenable, compliant, conformable, docile, governable, obedient, ruly, submissive, tractable 服从的，顺从的</div>
<h2>refulgent[sound:refulgent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">辉煌的，灿烂的：</font>shining radiantly; resplendent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Refulgent sunlight broke through the clouds, creating huge swaths of light in the valley below us. 耀眼的阳光穿透了云层，在我们脚下的峡谷中投下了一块巨大的光斑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beaming, brilliant, dazzling, incandescent, lucid, luminous, lustrous, radiant, resplendent, splendid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dim, dull, lackluster 黯淡无光的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]refulgence n. 灿烂，光芒四射</div>
<h2>refute[sound:refute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">否认：</font>to declare not to be true</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]While the speak woman was publicly refuting rumors of a merger, behind the scenes the CEO was workingto effect that very outcome. 尽管女发言人一再公开否认合并的谣言，首席执行官却在幕后为这一目标而努力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contradict, disaffirm, disavow, disclaim, disconfirm, deny, gainsay, negate, negative, reject, repudiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acknowledge, admit, avow, concede, confirm  承认</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">证明为假，证伪：</font>to prove wrong by argument or evidence: show to be false or erroneous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The triumph of Chinese athlete Liu Xiang in the 2004 Olympics effectively refuted the views that Asians are physically inferior to others. 中国运动员刘翔在2004 年雅典奥运会上的胜利有效地驳斥了亚洲人在体格上不如其他人种的观点。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belie, confute, debunk, discredit, falsify, rebut, shoot down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confirm, prove, validate, verify 证明为真，证实</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]refutable adj.可辩驳的</div>
<h2>regenerate[sound:regenerate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使重获新生，使焕然一新：</font>to bring back to life, practice, activity or a former condition of vigor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The lizard is able to regenerate its tail. 蜥蜴能够重新长出断尾。‖The  whole community was regenerated thanks to a government grant for repairing all the old buildings. 多亏了政府用于维修老楼的专项拨款，整个社区焕然一新。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]recharge, refresh, rejuvenate, rekindle, renew, restore, resurrect, resuscitate, revitalize, revivify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]degenerate, deteriorate, worsen 衰退，恶化</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi./vt. （使）洗心革面：to make better in behavior or character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Every time he made a mistake, he would promise to regenerate. 每次犯错他都会保证洗心革面，下次不再犯。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]habilitate, reclaim, redeem, rehabilitate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]regeneration n. 复兴</div>
<h2>regimen[sound:regimen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（政治上的）统治：</font>lawful control over the affairs of a political unit (as a nation)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A new party will have regimen over the nation and, hopefully, bring some much-needed change. 一个新的政党将要上台，希望他们能带来一些迫切的改革。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]administration, authority, governance, jurisdiction, regime</div>
<h2>regress[sound:regress.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">后退：</font>to go back; move backward</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]To stand still is to regress.不进则退。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]retrogress, return, revert</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advance, develop, evolve, progress 前进，发展</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">退化，恶化：</font>to become worse or of less value</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The annual celebration has regressed to the point where it's nothing more than an excuse to get drunk.年度的庆祝活动已经堕落成一个尽情喝醉的借口了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]atrophy, crumble, decay, decline, degenerate, descend, deteriorate, ebb, retrograde, rot, sink, worsen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ameliorate, improve, meliorate 改善</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]regressive adj. 后退的，退化的；regression n. 后退，退化</div>
<h2>rehabilitate[sound:rehabilitate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使复原，使康复：</font>to restore to a former state (as of efficiency, good management, or solvency) ora healthy condition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]new policies in hopes of rehabilitating the national economy 被指望能振兴国家经济的新政策‖Shedecided to undergo physical therapy to help rehabilitate her broken elbow. 她决定采取理疗来治疗受伤的手肘。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cure, fix, mend, rejuvenate, resuscitate, revitalize, revive, set up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debilitate, enervate, enfeeble, weaken 使虚弱；relapse 旧病复发</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi./vt. （使）洗心革面：to make better in behavior or character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an organization that rehabilitates criminals so they can reenter society 一个让罪犯洗心革面的机构，以便让他们能重返社会</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]habilitate, reclaim, redeem, regenerate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]rehabilitation n. 康复，复原</div>
<h2>rehearsal[sound:rehearsal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">排练，彩排：</font>the act of practicing in preparation for a public performance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We made a few mistakes in rehearsal, but we were pretty sure that we'd be OK on opening night. 彩排过程中我们犯了几个错误，但正式开幕式当晚我们有信心做得很好。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]practice, trial, dry run</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extemporization, impromptu, improvisation （无准备的）即兴表演</div>
<h2>reign[sound:reign.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">统治权：</font>the right or means to command or control others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A healthy nation should be governed by the reign of law and not by the will of its chief executive. 一个健康的国家应该是法制的，而非由最高领导人的意志统领。‖They  accused  him  of  carrying  out  a  reign  of  terror.他们指责他搞独裁暴政。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arm, authority, clutch, command, control, dominion, grip, hold, mastery, sway</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impotence, impotency, powerlessness 无权，无能</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">占统治地位或盛行：</font>to be predominant or prevalent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Chaos reigned in the classroom. 整个教室充满了混乱。‖Panic reigned as the fire spread. 随着大火的扩散，恐慌也迅速蔓延。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dominate, domineer, prevail, predominate, rule</div>
<h2>rein[sound:rein.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">抑制，限制：</font>the act or practice of keeping something (as an activity) within certain boundaries</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The  oversight  committee  called  on  the  corporation  to keep  a much  tighter  rein  on  the  activities  of itscontractors. 监督委员会要求这个公司对其承包商的行为采取更为严格的管控。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circumscription, confinement, limitation, stint</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">抑制，控制：</font>to keep from exceeding a desirable degree or level (as of expression)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A good man knows how to rein in his temper. 君子知道如何按捺住火气。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bridle, check, constrain, contain, curb, govern, hold, inhibit, keep, measure, regulate, restrain, rule, tame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]liberate,loose, loosen,unleash 释放，不再加以管束</div>
<h2>reiterate[sound:reiterate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">重申：</font>to say or state again</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Let me reiterate our stance. 让我来重述我们的立场。‖I want to reiterate that under no circumstances areyou to leave the house. 我想再次重申：无论如何你都不能离开这间房子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chime, din, iterate, recapitulate, rehearse, repeat</div>
<h2>rejoice[sound:rejoice.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">欣喜，喜悦：</font>to feel joy or great delight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We rejoiced over our unexpected victory on the soccer field.我们为预料之外的足球胜利而感到欢喜。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crow, delight, exuberate, glory, jubilate, joy, kvell, triumph</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bemoan, bewail, deplore, grieve, lament, moan, mourn, regret, weep 感到伤感，痛苦或遗憾</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]rejoiced adj. 高兴的</div>
<h2>relapse[sound:relapse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">故态复萌，再犯：</font>to slip or fall back into a former worse state</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The patient wondered whether his illness would relapse. 病人想知道他的病会不会复发。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]recidivate, regress, retrogress, revert</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]habilitate, reclaim, redeem, regenerate 变好，洗心革面；convalesce, rehabilitate 康复</div>
<h2>release[sound:release.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">排放：</font>to throw or give off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We bought an air freshener that releases a pleasing scent into the room.  我们买了一个能向房间里释放怡人香味的空气净化机。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cast, exhale, expel, irradiate, issue, vent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorb 吸收</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">释放，使获得自由：</font>to set free from restraint, confinement, or servitude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The government was asked to release the prisoners immediately. 政府被要求立即释放囚犯。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discharge, disenthrall, emancipate, enfranchise, liberate, loose, loosen, manumit, unchain, unfetter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bind, confine, enchain, fetter, restrain 限制自由</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">解雇：</font>to let go from office, service, or employment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They released the workers who couldn't handle the new technology.  他们解雇了所有不能掌握新技术的工人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bounce, cashier, dismiss, fire, remove, retire, sack, terminate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]employ, engage, hire 雇用</div>
<h2>relentless[sound:relentless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">残酷的，无情的：</font>showing or promising no abatement of severity, intensity, strength, or pace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was the most teacher enemy I have ever known. 他是我所知的最狠的老师。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grim, inexorable, ironfisted, merciless, mortal, ruthless, unrelenting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]charitable, clement, merciful, lenient  仁慈的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固执的，不肯妥协的：</font>showing no signs of slackening or yielding in one's purpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The team's offense was relentless in trying to score. 进攻球员毫不妥协地努力得分。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant, dogged, headstrong, mulish, obdurate, pertinacious, rigid, uncompromising, unyielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquiescent, amenable, compliant, complying, flexible, pliable, pliant, relenting, yielding 易屈服的</div>
<h2>relevant[sound:relevant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有关系的，重要的：</font>having a bearing on or connection with the matter at hand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Make sure your answers during the interview are short and relevant.  确保你在面试时的回答简短而恰当。‖You need to bring all the relevant certificates with you. 你需要携带所有的相关证明。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]applicable, apposite, apropos, germane, material, pertinent, pointed, relative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extraneous, immaterial, impertinent, inapplicable, inapposite, irrelevant, pointless 无关的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]relevance n. 关联</div>
<h2>religion[sound:religion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">宗教，信仰：</font>a body of beliefs and practices regarding the supernatural and the worship of one ormore deities</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Jewish religion has followers in many parts of the globe. 犹太教在全球范围内有大量信徒。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]credo, creed, cult, faith, persuasion</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（对于宗教信仰的）忠诚，虔诚：</font>belief and trust in and loyalty to God</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Without his religion, he would not have been able to survive all the difficulties he has faced over the years.如果不是他的虔诚，他是不可能渡过这些年来一直面临的难关的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]devotion, piety</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]atheism, godlessness 无神论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]religious adj. 宗教的，忠诚的</div>
<h2>relinquish[sound:relinquish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">放弃 （职位、权力等）：</font>to give up (as a position of authority) formally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She relinquished his position to the company's vice president with very mixed feelings.  怀着十分复杂的情感，她放弃了公司副总裁的职位。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abnegate, cede, renounce, resign, surrender</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inaugurate 就职；usurp  篡位</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">移交，交出：</font>to  give  (something) over to the control or possession  of another usually underduress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The boy reluctantly relinquished the illegal fireworks to the police officer. 小男孩不情愿地把非法的焰火交给了警察。‖The court ordered him to relinquish custody of his child.  法庭要求他交出孩子的监护权。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deliver, render, yield, turn in, turn over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]keep, retain, withhold 保留，不给予</div>
<h2>relish[sound:relish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">喜好，偏好：</font>an appetite for something; a strong appreciation or liking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She has great relish for early morning walks, which she takes nearly every day. 她对早晨散步有格外的喜好——几乎每天早上她都会如此。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appetite, fancy, favor, fondness, like, love, partiality, preference, taste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aversion, disfavor, disgust, dislike, distaste, hatred, loathing 反感，厌恶感</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（愿望达成时的）高兴，满足感：</font>the feeling experienced when one's wishes are met</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He ate the bowl of ice cream with relish. 他高兴地吃着冰淇淋。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]content, delectation, delight, enjoyment, gladness, gratification, happiness, satisfaction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discontent, displeasure, dissatisfaction, unhappiness 不满，不悦</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">享受，喜欢：</font>to take keen or zestful pleasure in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is so hungry that he will relish even plain food.  他是如此的饥饿，以至于普通的食物也能让他满意。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adore, enjoy, like, love, rejoice, revel, savor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abhor, abominate, detest, dislike, hate, loathe  厌恶，讨厌</div>
<h2>reluctant[sound:reluctant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不情愿的，反感的：</font>feeling or showing aversion, hesitation, or unwillingness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I'm reluctant to let him borrow my CDs since he never gives back anything I lend him. 我很不愿意把我的CD 借给他，因为他借了我东西从来不还。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]averse, disinclined, indisposed, loath, unwilling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]willing 乐意的；disposed, inclined 倾向于做某事的；eager 渴望的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reluctance n. 不愿意，不情愿</div>
<h2>remiss[sound:remiss.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">疏忽的，不留心的：</font>exhibiting carelessness or slackness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I would be remiss if I didn't tell you how much I appreciated the lovely gift. 如果我不告诉你我是多么的喜欢这个可爱的礼物的话，那我就太疏忽大意了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careless, derelict, disregardful, heedless, lax, lazy, neglectful, neglecting, slack</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]attentive, careful, conscientious, meticulous, painstaking, scrupulous 细致的，仔细的</div>
<h2>remodel[sound:remodel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">改造，改变结构：</font>to alter the structure of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We decided to remodel the warehouse into a museum displaying the products of the company. 我们决定把仓库改造成展览我们公司产品的博物馆。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alter, modify, recast, redo, refashion, remake, revamp, revise, rework, vary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fix, freeze, set, stabilize 固定</div>
<h2>remonstrance[sound:remonstrance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">抗议，抱怨：</font>an expression of protest, complaint, or reproof, especially a formal statement ofgrievances</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She seems deaf to her son’s remonstrances. 她似乎对儿子的抗议充耳不闻。 ‖Aggravated by the noisymetro construction, many residents wrote letters of remonstrance to city officials.  许多被地铁建设的噪音激怒的居民向市政府投去了抗议信。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]challenge, complaint, demur, difficulty, fuss, objection, protest, question, remonstration, stink</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acceptance, acquiescence, agreement, approval, assent, sanction 同意，接受</div>
<h2>remorse[sound:remorse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">懊悔，悔恨：</font>moral anguish arising from repentance for past misdeeds; bitter regret</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He felt a deep remorse for having neglected his family over the years. 他为多年来忽略家人的行为表示懊悔。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contriteness, contrition, penitence, regret, remorsefulness, repentance, rue, self-reproach, shame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impenitence, remorselessness 不知悔改</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]remorseful adj. 懊悔的，悔恨的</div>
<h2>remunerate[sound:remunerate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">支付报酬或补偿：</font>to pay an equivalent to for a service, loss, or expense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He promptly remunerated the repair company for fixing the satellite TV. 他迅速地支付了维修公司修卫星电视所应得的酬劳。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compensate, indemnify, recompense, recoup, redress, remedy, repay, requite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]remunerative adj. 有报酬的</div>
<h2>rend[sound:rend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">撕裂，猛拉：</font>to tear or split apart or into pieces violently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Wolves rend a game to pieces. 狼群会把猎物撕成碎片。‖pain that rends the heart 撕心般的痛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cleave, lacerate, ribbon, rip, rive, rupture, shred, split, tatter, tear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]associate, coalesce, combine, conjoin, conjugate, connect, fuse, interfuse, join, link, unify 联合</div>
<h2>renegade[sound:renegade.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">背教者，叛徒：</font>one who rejects a religion, cause, allegiance, or group for another; a deserter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A band of renegades who had deserted their infantry units were making their way to Mexico. 一支背叛了他们所属的步兵编队的士兵朝着墨西哥前进。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apostate, betrayer, defector, deserter, recreant, traitor, turncoat</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adherent, loyalist, partisan 忠诚者</div>
<h2>renounce[sound:renounce.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（正式地）放弃：</font>to give up, refuse, or resign usually by formal declaration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]renounce his nationality 退出国籍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abnegate, cede, relinquish, resign, surrender</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inaugurate 就职；usurp  篡位</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">宣布与…决裂：</font>to refuse to follow, obey, or recognize any further</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]renounce the authority of the church  宣布与教廷彻底决裂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forswear, recant, renege, repeal, repudiate, retract, withdraw</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adhere, stick 坚持，忠于</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]renunciation n. 放弃</div>
<h2>renovate[sound:renovate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">修复，维修：</font>to restore to a former better state (as by cleaning, repairing, or rebuilding)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We will have to renovate the house extensively before we can move in. 在入住之前我们必须大规模翻修一下这栋房子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doctor, fix, patch, recondition, repair, revamp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blemish, break, damage, deface, disfigure, harm, hurt, impair, injure, mar, ruin, vandalize, wreck 破坏</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使重获新生，使焕然一新：</font>to bring back to life, practice, activity or a former condition of vigor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The church was renovated by a new ecumenical spirit.  新的宗教领袖的到来让教堂焕发新生。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]recharge, refresh, rejuvenate, rekindle, renew, restore, resurrect, resuscitate, revitalize, revivify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]degenerate, deteriorate, worsen 衰退，恶化</div>
<h2>repartee[sound:repartee.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">机智的回答：</font>a quick witty response</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That repartee to the reporter's question drew laughs from the bystanders. 对记者问题的那个机智回答引来了旁观者的笑声。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comeback, riposte</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">打趣，善意的玩笑：</font>good-natured teasing or exchanging of clever remarks</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Repartee is harder to do with text messaging.  用短信开起玩笑来困难多了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backchat, badinage, chaff, jesting, joshing, persiflage, raillery</div>
<h2>repatriate[sound:repatriate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">遣返：</font>to restore or return to the country of origin, allegiance, or citizenship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As soon as the war ends, the government will start to repatriate war refugees. 只要战争一结束，政府就会开始遣返战争难民。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]banish, deport, expatriate 放逐，驱逐</div>
