<h2>repeal[sound:repeal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">撤销，废除（法律等）：</font>to rescind or annul by authoritative act</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The company called the furniture store to repeal the order for six new desks. 公司要求家具店撤销六张新桌子的订单。‖In 1933, Congress passed the 21st Amendment which repealed the Prohibition Amendment of1919, thus making the sale, distribution, and use of alcohol legal once again. 1933  年，国会通过了《第二十一修正案》，该法案废除了于1919 年制订的《禁酒法》，从而使得酒的买卖、配送和使用再次合法化。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abort, abrogate, annul, cancel, disannul, invalidate, negate, null, nullify, rescind, revoke, vacate, void</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continue, keep 继续执行；enact, establish, legislate 立法，制订</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">宣布与…决裂：</font>to refuse to follow, obey, or recognize any further</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]If I find that you have been lying about this, I'll instantly repeal every promise I made to you. 只要我发现在这个问题上你对我撒了谎，那我们之间的承诺就彻底断裂了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forswear, recant, renege, renounce, repudiate, retract, withdraw</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adhere, stick 坚持，忠于</div>
<h2>repel[sound:repel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">抵制：</font>to fight against; resist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Self-discipline ensures that you can repel the things that induce you.  自律可以保证你抵制那些诱惑你的事物。 ‖I repelled the temptation to stay out late and call in sick the next day. 我抵住了晚上玩通宵然后第二天谎称生病的诱惑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]buck, defy, fight, oppose, resist, withstand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]capitulate, submit, succumb, surrender, yield, give in 屈服</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使厌恶：</font>to cause aversion in: disgust</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Evil odors always repel me. 臭味总是让我恶心。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disgust, nauseate, repulse, revolt, sicken</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allure, attract, bewitch, captivate, charm, enchant, entice, fascinate, lure, seduce, tempt 吸引，诱惑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]repelling adj. 令人厌恶的</div>
<h2>repertoire[sound:repertoire.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（技术、设备或原料等的）详单：</font>the complete list or supply of skills, devices, or ingredients usedin a particular field, occupation, or practice</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The chef's repertoire of specialties seems to be limited, with several of the dishes appearing over and over again in slightly varied guises. 这个厨师的所有拿手好戏看来是很有限的，因为上来的几盘菜看起来只是稍微换了一下装饰而已。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]budget, fund, inventory, pool, reservoir, stock</div>
<h2>repine[sound:repine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">抱怨，表达不满：</font>to feel or express discontent or dejection</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There is no use repining over a love that's been long lost. 抱怨早已失去的爱情是没有用的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carp, complain, fuss, gripe, grouch, grouse, growl, grumble, inveigh, moan, murmur, mutter, wail, whine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crow, delight, rejoice 高兴</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">渴望：</font>to long for something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]During the deep cold of winter, I repine for warm tropical beaches. 在寒冬，我渴望温暖的热带海滩。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ache, covet, crave, desiderate, hunger, itch, long, lust, pine, salivate, thirst, want, wish, yearn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abhor, abominate, detest, dislike, hate, loathe  厌恶，讨厌</div>
<h2>replete[sound:replete.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">彻底吃饱了的：</font>having one's appetite completely satisfied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Everyone is completely replete after the huge meal. 在大餐之后，每个人都吃撑了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sated, satiate, satiated, stuffed, surfeited</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]empty, famished, hungry, starved, starving 挨饿的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">充满…的，富于…的：</font>possessing  or covered with  great numbers  or amounts of somethingspecified</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a scholar replete with knowledge 博学的学者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abounding, abundant, awash, flush, fraught, lousy, swarming, teeming, thick, thronging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]depleted, drained, exhausted 耗竭的；deficient, incomplete, insufficient, short 缺乏的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]repletion n. 装满</div>
<h2>repose[sound:repose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（劳作后的）休息：</font>a state of resting after exertion or strain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The doctor ordered a period of repose for the patient suffering from insomnia. 医生要求正在饱受失眠折磨的病人好好休息一阵。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ease, leisure, relaxation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exertion, labor, toil, work 劳动，工作</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">平静，宁静：</font>a state of freedom from storm or disturbance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We enjoyed the repose of a summer evening on a remote island. 我们在遥远的小岛上共享了夏日傍晚的片刻安宁。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]calmness, hush, peace, placidity, quietness, restfulness, serenity, still, tranquility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commotion, pandemonium, tumult, turmoil, unrest, uproar 骚乱，动乱</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">休息：</font>to take a rest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They have to repose on couches because all beds have been occupied. 因为所有的床都有人占了，他们不得不在沙发上休息。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]idle, loll, lounge, relax, rest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]drudge, hustle, moil, strive, struggle, sweat, travail 努力工作</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">放置，交给他人：</font>to put (something) into the possession or safekeeping of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Constitution reposes the power to declare war to Congress, and to that body alone. 宪法将宣战的权力交给了国会单独保管。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consign, delegate, deliver, entrust, leave, pass, transfer, transmit, vest, hand over, turn over, give over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hold, keep, retain, withhold  保留</div>
<h2>reprehend[sound:reprehend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">谴责，责难，批评：</font>to express one's unfavorable opinion of the worth or quality of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Without exception, book reviewers reprehended the novel's trite plot. 毫无例外的，小说缺乏新意的故事情节收到了评论家们的责难。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]berate, blame, castigate, censure, condemn, denounce, dispraise, fault, knock, lambaste, pan, upbraid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extol, laud, praise  表扬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reprehensible adj. 应受谴责的</div>
<h2>repress[sound:repress.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">镇压：</font>to put down by force, usually before total control has been lost; quell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Military quickly repressed the rebellion in the city and restored order.  军方迅速平息了市内的暴乱，恢复了秩序。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crush, quash, quell, silence, squash, squelch, subdue, suppress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]foment, incite, instigate, provoke, stir 煽动，激起</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">阻止（正常的表达、活动或发展等）：</font>to  prevent  the  natural  or  normal  expression,  activity,  ordevelopment of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You can't repress your feelings forever, so tell her that you love her. 你不可能永远压抑自己的感受，所以大胆地跟她表白吧。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bridle, check, curb, muffle, smother, stifle, strangle, swallow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]express, loose, release, take out, unleash, vent （情感等的）表达，宣泄</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]repression n. 阻止，镇压</div>
<h2>reprieve[sound:reprieve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">暂缓处刑，免罪：</font>to postpone or cancel the punishment of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Fourteen people, waiting to be hanged for the murder of a former prime minister, have been reprieved十四个因为谋杀前首相而等待绞刑的人获得了缓刑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absolve, acquit, amnesty, condone, excuse, forgive, pardon, remit, respite, spare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]penalize, punish 惩罚</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">维持运行：</font>to prevent (something) from being closed, destroyed, etc., for a period of time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The library has been reprieved and will remain open for at least another year.  图书馆的状况得到了缓解，还将继续开放一年。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deliver, rescue, save</div>
<h2>reproach[sound:reproach.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">令人羞愧的事物，耻辱：</font>one that causes shame, rebuke or blame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a reproach to this entire school 整个学校的耻辱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dishonor, opprobrium, reflection, spot, scandal, stain, stigma, taint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]credit, honor 荣誉</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">批评，责备：</font>to express disapproval, criticism, or disappointment in (someone)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]reproached by their mother for untidiness  因为邋遢而被他们的母亲批评</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]admonish, berate, castigate, chide, condemn, denounce, lambaste, rebuke, reprimand, reprove, upbraid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commend, eulogize, extol, laud, praise 表扬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]irreproachable adj. 无可指责的</div>
<h2>reprobate[sound:reprobate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">堕落者，道德败坏的人：</font>a morally unprincipled person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The program rehabilitates reprobates and turns them into hard-working, law-abiding citizens. 这个项目让那些堕落的人改过自新，并将他们变成勤劳守法的好公民。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brute, devil, fiend, miscreant, rapscallion, rascal, villain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]saint  圣人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">堕落的，放荡的：</font>morally corrupt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is a reprobate judge who could be bribed, and often with astonishing ease. 他是一个堕落的法官，极其容易就被贿赂了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debased, debauched, degraded, depraved, dissipated, dissolute, libertine, perverse, perverted, rakish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]good, moral, righteous, virtuous  有道德的；pure, uncorrupted 纯净的，未受污染的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">谴责，痛斥：</font>to condemn strongly as unworthy, unacceptable, or evil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He reprobated his son's unconventional lifestyle. 他怒斥他儿子不遵循传统的生活习惯。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blame, criticize, censure, condemn, denounce, denunciate, reprehend</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commend, eulogize, extol, laud, praise 表扬</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">拒绝，不提供：</font>to be unwilling to grant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The government will most likely reprobate the request for parole. 政府很有可能会拒绝假释的要求。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decline, disallow, disapprove, negative, nix, refuse, reject, reprobate, repudiate, withhold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allow, concede, grant, let, permit, vouchsafe 允许，给予</div>
<h2>reproof[sound:reproof.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">批评，反对：</font>criticism for a fault, rebuke</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The head teacher speaks in tones of gentle reproof. 校长的话语中带有隐晦的批评。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commination, condemnation, denunciation, excoriation, rebuke, reprimand, reproach, stricture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commendation, eulogy, praise 赞扬；endorsement 同意</div>
<h2>reprove[sound:reprove.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">温和地责备，警告：</font>to scold or correct usually gently or with kindly intent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My piano teacher often  reproves me for slouching while playing, observing that good posture helps oneplay better. 我的钢琴老师常常会因为懒散的坐姿而批评我，他认为良好的坐姿能让我弹得更好。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]admonish, blame, chide, criticize, reprimand, reproach</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lambaste  严厉地责备；commend, eulogize, extol, laud, praise 表扬</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">不欣赏，不喜欢：</font>to hold an unfavorable opinion of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The older generation has always reproved the younger generation's taste in music. 老一代的人总是不喜欢新一代的音乐品味。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deprecate, discountenance, disesteem, disfavor, dislike, frown</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adore, approve, endorse, enjoy, favor, like 支持，喜欢</div>
<h2>repudiate[sound:repudiate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">否认：</font>to declare not to be true</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She repudiated the charge that she had lied on her résumé. 她否认了她在简历中作假的指控。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contradict, disaffirm, disavow, disclaim, disconfirm, disown, gainsay, negate, negative, refute, reject</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acknowledge, admit, allow, avow, concede, confirm 承认</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">拒绝接受：</font>to show unwillingness to accept, do, engage in, or agree to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We didn't like the terms, so we repudiated the contract. 我们没有接受这份合同，因为我们对其中的条款表示不满。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balk, deselect, disapprove, negative, nix, refuse, reprobate, spurn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accept, agree, approve 接受，承认</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]repudiation n. 拒绝，否认</div>
<h2>repugnant[sound:repugnant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人厌恶的：</font>arousing disgust or aversion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The idea of moving again became repugnant to her. 又要搬家的想法让她感到厌恶。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abhorrent, abominable, awful, disgusting, distasteful, hideous, loathsome, noisome, obnoxious, repulsive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]innocuous, inoffensive  无害的；agreeable, delightful, enjoyable, gratifying, pleasing 令人愉悦的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不和谐的，不协调的：</font>not being in agreement or harmony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Technically speaking, it may not be a violation, but it is certainly repugnant to the spirit of the law. 技术上来说这还算不上违法，但是这肯定违背了法律的精神。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conflicting, discordant, incompatible, incongruous, inconsonant, inharmonious, mutually exclusive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accordant, agreeing, compatible, concordant, conformable, congruent, congruous, consistent, consonant,harmonious 和谐的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]repugnance n. 厌恶；不一致</div>
<h2>repulse[sound:repulse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（使）厌恶，排斥：</font>to rebuff or reject with rudeness, coldness, or denial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The scenes of violence in the film may repulse some viewers. 电影中某些暴力场景可能会使观众反感。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disgust, nauseate, repel, revolt, sicken</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allure, attract, bewitch, captivate, charm, enchant, entice, fascinate, lure, seduce, tempt 吸引，诱惑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]repulsion n. 排斥</div>
<h2>repute[sound:repute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（尤指好的）名声，名誉：</font>a good reputation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Before his national bestseller, he was a writer of little repute. 在他的畅销书出来之前，他是个没什么名声的作家。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]celebrity, fame, name, renown, reputation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]infamy, notoriety 坏名声</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reputable adj. 有好名声的</div>
<h2>requite[sound:requite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">酬谢，报答：</font>to make repayment or return for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]requited her love with hatred 恩将仇报</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indemnify, reciprocate, recompense, recoup, reimburse, remunerate, repay</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">报仇：</font>to punish in kind the wrongdoer responsible for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The future writer would later requite the abuse he  suffered at the hands of his classmates by creating scathing portraits of them in his novels. 未来的作家会把在同学那受的委屈的帐算清的——他会在小说中把他们描绘成恶人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avenge, redress, retaliate, revenge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absolve, condone, forgive, pardon 饶恕，宽恕</div>
<h2>requisite[sound:requisite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">必需品：</font>something necessary, indispensable, or unavoidable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Calculus is a requisite for modern physics. 微积分是学习近代物理的必要知识。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]condition, demand, necessity, need, requirement</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">必不可少的，必备的：</font>essential, necessary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Oxygen is requisite for human to survive.  氧气是维持人类生命的必要条件。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]critical, compulsory, imperative, indispensable, mandatory, necessary, obligatory, required, vital</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]needless, unnecessary 不必要的；dispensable, optional 可替换的，可选择的</div>
<h2>rescind[sound:rescind.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">废除，取消：</font>to make void</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The government refused to rescind the order of curfew. 政府拒绝撤销宵禁的决定。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abolish, abrogate, annul, cancel, invalidate, negate, null, nullify, recall, repeal, revoke, void</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]establish, enact 建立；continue, keep  维持，保持</div>
<h2>reserved[sound:reserved.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">内向的，缄默的：</font>restrained in words and actions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]too reserved to offer a spontaneous criticism 过于缄默而不愿意发表真实的看法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]closemouthed, constrained, laconic, reticent, restrained, silent, taciturn.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]communicative, expansive, talkative  健谈的；garrulous, loquacious  话多的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]unreserved adj. 无保留的，外向的</div>
<h2>residue[sound:residue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">剩余物：</font>something that remains after a part is taken, separated, or designated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In the race of nature, there is no residue left for the late. 在大自然的竞争中，总是早起的鸟儿才有虫吃。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debris, remainder, remnant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]residual adj. 剩余的</div>
<h2>resign[sound:resign.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">辞职，放弃（职位）：</font>to give up one's job or office</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]resigned her position at the university 自动放弃她在大学的职位</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abnegate, cede, relinquish, renounce, surrender, step down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assume, inaugurate 就职，承担（责任）；usurp 篡位</div>
<h2>resilience[sound:resilience.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">弹力：</font>the property of a material that enables it to resume its original shape or position after beingbent, stretched, or compressed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]elasticity, flexibility, malleability, pliability</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inelasticity n. 无弹性</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">恢复能力：</font>the ability to recover quickly from illness, change, or misfortune</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her mental resilience helped her promptly walk out of the shadow of her father’s death. 她的精神恢复能力让她迅速地走出了父亲去世的阴影当中。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adaptability</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]resilient adj. 有弹性的；能迅速恢复的</div>
<h2>resolute[sound:resolute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">坚定的：</font>marked by firm determination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We are glad to have such a resolute ally.  我们很高兴能拥有这样一个坚定的盟友。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bound, decided, faithful, resolved, unwavering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]faltering, hesitant, indecisive, irresolute, jittery, vacillating, wavering 犹豫的，踌躇的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]resolution n. 坚定的决心</div>
<h2>resonant[sound:resonant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（声音）洪亮的，共鸣的：</font>strong and deep in tone</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A deep resonant voice rang out.  传来了洪亮的声音。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consonant, orotund, plangent, resounding, reverberant, sonorous, vibrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]faint, low, muffled, muted, smothered, soft, weak 声音模糊的，低声的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]resonance n. 洪亮</div>
<h2>resourceful[sound:resourceful.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有创造力的，机智的：</font>able to act effectively or imaginatively, especially in difficult situations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a resourceful man capable of dealing with difficult situations 一个能巧妙解决困局的能人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]able, adroit, competent, talented</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]resourcefulness n. 能解决困难的能力</div>
<h2>respite[sound:respite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">间歇，休息：</font>an interval of rest or relief</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to toil without respite 埋头苦干 ‖In the middle of each semester there came a short respite. 在每个学期的期中，会有一个短暂的休假。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]break, lull, intermission, recess, pause, rest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resumption 继续进行；exertion, labor, toil, work 劳动，工作</div>
<h2>respire[sound:respire.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">呼吸：</font>to inhale and exhale air successively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]unable to respire due to heart attack  因心脏病发作而无法呼吸</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breathe, inhale</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]smother, stifle, suffocate 停止呼吸，窒息</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]respiration n. 呼吸</div>
<h2>resplendent[sound:resplendent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">华丽辉煌的：</font>shining brilliantly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Geography teacher showed us a picture of the resplendent aurora borealis. 地理老师给我们展示了一张壮丽的北极光的照片。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brilliant, glorious, gorgeous, grand, magnificent, splendid, sublime, superb</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dim, dull, lackluster 黯淡无光的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]resplendence n. 辉煌</div>
<h2>responsive[sound:responsive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">敏感的：</font>quick to respond or react appropriately or sympathetically</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Children are often the most responsive members of the audience. 儿童通常是观众中最为敏感的群体</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]prompt, sensible, sensitive, susceptible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dispassionate  无动于衷的；detached, indifferent 冷漠的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]responsiveness n. 敏感</div>
<h2>restive[sound:restive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">急躁的，忧虑的：</font>marked by impatience or uneasiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I spent a restive night worrying about the next day's exam. 我度过了忧虑的一晚，担心明天的考试。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]restless, nervy, uneasy, uptight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]imperturbable  沉着的；phlegmatic 冷静的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难以管束的：</font>stubbornly resisting control</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Tired soldiers grew restive.  疲惫的士兵变得越来越难以管理。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balky, contumacious, defiant, insubordinate, intractable, obstreperous, obstinate, perverse, recalcitrant,refractory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amenable, biddable, compliant, conformable, docile, obedient, ruly, submissive, tractable 服从的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]restiveness n. 不安，躁动</div>
<h2>restless[sound:restless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不平静的：</font>marked by or causing a lack of quiet, repose, or rest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The patient felt restless from pain. 病人因疼痛而无法平静。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agitating, anxious, distressful, disturbing, fraught, restive, perturbed, uneasy, unquiet, unsettled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]halcyon, peaceful, serene, tranquil 平静的，安宁的</div>
<h2>restrain[sound:restrain.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">限制，控制：</font>to limit, restrict, or keep under control</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The old lady restrained the child from picking the flowers. 老妇人不准孩子们采摘花朵。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bridle, check, constrain, curb, inhibit, measure, prevent, refrain, withhold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discharge, release 释放</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]restrained adj. 受限制的</div>
<h2>resurgence[sound:resurgence.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">复兴：</font>a restoration to use, acceptance, activity, or vigor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Let’s witness the resurgence of classical school. 让我们见证古典乐派的复兴。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reanimation, rebirth, regeneration, rejuvenation, renewal, resurrection, resuscitation, revitalization</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decay, degradation, deterioration, downfall, ebb, fall 衰落</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]resurgent adj. 正在复兴的</div>
<h2>resuscitate[sound:resuscitate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使复活，使苏醒：</font>to restore consciousness, vigor, or life to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]resuscitated by the kiss of the prince  因王子的吻而苏醒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reanimate, recharge, refresh, rejuvenate, rekindle, renew, resurrect, revitalize, revive, revivify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]faint 昏迷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]resuscitation n. 复活，复兴；resuscitated adj. 复活的</div>
<h2>retainer[sound:retainer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">家仆：</font>a person attached or owing service to a household</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Knights are dressed for battle by their retainers. 骑士们在上战场之前是由他们的家仆帮助着装打扮的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]menial, servant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lord, master 主人</div>
<h2>retaliate[sound:retaliate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">报复，反击：</font>to pay back  （as an injury ）in kind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We swear to retaliate for our losses.  我们发誓要以牙还牙。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avenge, redress, requite, revenge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absolve, condone, forgive, pardon 饶恕，宽恕</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]retaliation n. 报复</div>
<h2>retard[sound:retard.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">减速，延迟：</font>to cause to move or proceed slowly; delay or impede</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Language barriers retarded their negotiating progress.  语言障碍让谈判进程受阻。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bog, brake, decelerate, delay, detain, hamper, impede, mire, slacken</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accelerate, catalyze, expedite, hasten, precipitate  加速，促进</div>
<h2>retinue[sound:retinue.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">随行人员：</font>a group of retainers or attendants</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The premier inspected the factory with his retinue.  总理与随同人员一起视察了工厂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]associates, entourage, followers, posse, retainers</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]leader 领导者</div>
<h2>reticent[sound:reticent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">沉默不语的：</font>inclined to be silent or uncommunicative in speech</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was reticent about his plans. 他对他的计划三缄其口。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]closemouthed, constrained, laconic, reserved, restrained, silent, taciturn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]communicative, expansive, talkative  健谈的；garrulous, loquacious  话多的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不愿意的：</font>slow to begin or proceed with a course of action because of doubts or uncertainty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Understandably, she's reticent about becoming involved with another religious sect. 不难理解，她不愿意被牵扯另一个宗教派别之中。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cagey, disinclined, dubious, indisposed, loath, reluctant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]willing 乐意的；disposed, inclined 倾向于做某事的；eager 渴望的</div>
<h2>retort[sound:retort.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（尤指机智的）回应，回答：</font>something  spoken  or  written  in  reaction  especially  to  a  question,especially a quick, witty, or cutting reply</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She responded to the heckler with a scathing but hilarious retort  that instantly won over the audience.面对故意起哄捣乱的人，她那严厉但不失幽默的回答立刻得到了观众的肯定。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comeback, rejoinder, repartee, reply, response, return, riposte</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inquiry, query, question  问题，问询</div>
<h2>retouch[sound:retouch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">润饰，改进：</font>to improve or change (a photographic negative or print)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was retouching her painting before the deadline. 在截止日期到来之前，她一直在润色她的画作。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ameliorate, enhance, furbish, meliorate, perfect, polish, refine, upgrade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deteriorate, downgrade, worsen  恶化，降低</div>
<h2>retract[sound:retract.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">收回，否认：</font>to take back</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The newspaper had to retract its allegations against the mayor.  报纸不得不收回针对市长的谣言。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abjure, abnegate, disavow, forswear, recall, recant, renounce, repeal, repudiate, withdraw</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]tender 提出（建议，想法）；adhere, stick 坚持</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]retractable adj. 可收回的</div>
<h2>retrench[sound:retrench.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">削减开支：</font>to curtail expenses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Declining business forced the company to retrench. 衰减的业务迫使公司削减开支。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]economize, reduce, cut down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enlarge, expand 扩大，扩张</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]retrenchment n. 削减开销</div>
<h2>retribution[sound:retribution.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">报偿，报应：</font>the dispensing or receiving of reward or punishment especially in the hereafter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The neighborhood is being torn apart by an endless cycle of gang violence and retribution. 这个社区正在被帮派间斗争和仇恨的恶性循环割裂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avengement, payback, recompense, reparation, repayment, requital, retaliation, revenge, vengeance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]retributive n. 报应的</div>
<h2>retrograde[sound:retrograde.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">倒退的：</font>moving or tending backward</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This is a retrograde step and you will regret it. 这是后退的一步，你以后肯定会后悔的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backward, receding, regressive, reversed, withdrawing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]progressive 前进的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">退步，退化：</font>to decline to a worse condition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Dark Ages  is the period following the fall of the Roman Empire when Western civilization seriouslyretrograded. “黑暗时代”指的是罗马帝国崩溃之后，西方文明严重退步的一个历史时期。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]atrophy, crumble, decay, decline, degenerate, descend, deteriorate, ebb, regress, rot, sink, worsen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ameliorate, improve, meliorate 改善</div>
<h2>retrospective[sound:retrospective.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">回顾的：</font>looking back on, contemplating, or directed to the past</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a retrospective glance at my youth 朝我少年时代投去的回顾性一瞥</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backward</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]anticipatory 预想的；prospective 预期的，未来的</div>
<h2>revelry[sound:revelry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">狂欢，喧闹的作乐：</font>noisy partying or merrymaking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They were exhausted after the night of revelry. 一夜狂欢后大家都筋疲力尽</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conviviality, festivity, gaiety, jollity, merriment, rejoicing, revel, whoopee</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gloom, grief, melancholy, misery, mournfulness, sorrow, woe 悲哀，哀痛</div>
<h2>revenge[sound:revenge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">报复，复仇：</font>an act or instance of retaliating in order to get even</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Both sides were determined to get revenge for losses and showed little interest in ending the feud. 双方都下定决心要为失去的东西报仇，对于结束他们之间的世仇毫无兴趣。‖The  bombing  was  in  revenge  for  theassassination of their leader. 此次轰炸是对暗杀他们领袖的报复行动。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avengement, payback, reprisal, requital, retaliation, retribution, vengeance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forgiveness, pardon 饶恕，原谅</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">复仇：</font>to avenge (as oneself) usually by retaliating in kind or degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He finally revenged the death of his brother. 他终于为兄弟的死报了仇。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avenge, redress, requite, retaliate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absolve, condone, forgive, pardon 原谅，宽恕</div>
<h2>revere[sound:revere.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（尤指对神的）尊崇，尊敬：</font>to offer honor or respect to (someone) as a divine power</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is revered for his valor. 他因为他的英勇而受到尊敬。‖In  some  cultures  people  revere their ancestors, even leaving food offerings for them. 在一些文化当中，人们非常敬重先人，甚至将一些食物留下来供他们享用。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adore, deify, glorify, esteem, regard, respect, venerate, worship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blaspheme, desecrate, profane, violate 亵渎</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reverence n. 尊重；reverent adj. 恭敬地，虔诚的</div>
<h2>revise[sound:revise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">更改，修正：</font>to look over again in order to correct or improve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There are many problems involved in revising a dictionary.  修正字典会牵涉到诸多问题。‖With the snow,we'll need to revise our travel plans. 因为下雪了，我们不得不更改旅游计划。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amend, correct, emend, polish, redraft, refine, rework, upgrade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discard 丢弃，抛弃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]revision n. 修改</div>
<h2>revive[sound:revive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">恢复意识：</font>to return to consciousness or life, become flourishing again</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]successfully revived him with artificial respiration 用人工呼吸使成功他恢复意识</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]come around</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]faint, black out 昏迷，失去知觉</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">再获新生：</font>become active or flourishing again</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Around midnight, I usually need to revive myself with a cup of strong coffee. 在午夜时分，我需要一杯浓咖啡来提神。‖The success of the movie has revived her career. 这部电影的成功让他的事业焕发第二春。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reanimate, recharge, refresh, rejuvenate, rekindle, renew, resurrect, resuscitate, revitalize, revivify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]degenerate, deteriorate, worsen 衰退，恶化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]revival n. 复苏</div>
<h2>revoke[sound:revoke.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">撤回，宣告无效：</font>to annul by recalling or taking back</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to revoke a will 废除遗嘱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abolish, abrogate, annul, cancel, invalidate, negate, null, nullify, recall, repeal, revoke, void</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]establish, enact 建立；continue, keep  维持，保持</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]revocation n. 撤销，废除</div>
<h2>revolt[sound:revolt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使厌恶，反感：</font>to fill with disgust or abhorrence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The smell of seafood revolts him. 他对海鲜的腥味十分反感。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disgust, nauseate, repel, repulse, sicken</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allure, attract, bewitch, captivate, charm, enchant, entice, fascinate, lure, seduce, tempt 吸引，诱惑</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">反叛：</font>to renounce allegiance or subjection (as to a government)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The revolted against the dictator by burning his palace. 他们通过焚烧宫殿来对抗独裁者。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defy, insurrect, mutiny, oppose, rebel, resist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obey, submit 遵从，服从</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]revolter n. 反叛者</div>
<h2>ribald[sound:ribald.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">举止、言语下流粗俗的：</font>characterized by or indulging in vulgar, lewd humor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]entertained the guests with ribald jokes 用荤段子来取悦客人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bawdy, blue, coarse, crude, dirty, filthy, gross, indecent, nasty, obscene, pornographic, profane, vulgar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decent, proper, seemly  恰当的，得体的</div>
<h2>rickety[sound:rickety.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不稳的：</font>lacking stability or firmness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The rickety coalition may break at any moment. 脆弱的联盟随时都可能破裂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]insecure, precarious, shaky, unsound, unsteady, weak</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]firm, sound, stable, sturdy 稳定的，稳固的</div>
<h2>rider[sound:rider.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">骑马的人：</font>one that rides</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]horseman, knight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pedestrian, walker  行人，步行者</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">附件：</font>a clause appended to a legislative bill to secure a usually distinct object</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]addendum, appendix, attachment, supplement</div>
<h2>ridicule[sound:ridicule.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">嘲笑：</font>to make fun of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]always ridiculed everything she said  总是嘲笑她说的话‖The  term  “big  bang  theory”  was  originally coined to ridicule the belief that the universe was created by a giant explosion. “大爆炸理论”期初是为了嘲笑一种观点而创造的，这种观点认为宇宙源自一场巨大的爆炸。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deride, gibe, jape, jeer, lout, mock, taunt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commend, praise 表扬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ridiculous adj. 荒谬的</div>
<h2>rife[sound:rife.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">丰富的，普遍的：</font>possessing or covered with great numbers or amounts of something specified</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a video game rife with violence and abuse 充满暴力与虐待的电子游戏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abounding, abundant, awash, flush, fraught, lousy, replete, swarming, teeming, thick, thronging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deficient, incomplete, insufficient, short 缺乏的</div>
<h2>rift[sound:rift.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">离间：</font>a break in friendly relations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a rift between two once allied nations 两个往昔盟国的决裂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crack, fissure, fracture, schism</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reconciliation, rapprochement 调和</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使开裂：</font>to cause to split open or break</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Hills were rifted by the earthquake. 地震使得山崩地裂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cleave, divide, rip, split, sunder, tear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]associate, coalesce, combine, conjugate, join, link  接合</div>
<h2>rile[sound:rile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激，惹怒：</font>to make agitated and angry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new work schedules riled the employees. 新的工作时间表激怒了员工</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, annoy, enrage, exasperate, grate, inflame, infuriate, irritate, nettle, peeve, pique, provoke, roil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allay, alleviate, assuage, ease, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soothe 平息，缓和</div>

<h2>ruffle[sound:ruffle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">皱褶，褶裥花边：</font>a strip of fabric gathered or pleated on one edge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rumple, wrinkle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ruffled adj. 有褶裥边修饰的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使粗糙：</font>to destroy the smoothness or evenness of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The acid ruffled the surface of the catalyst. 酸使得催化剂的表面变得粗糙。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrade, chafe, erode, roughen, rub, wear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]glaze, smooth 使平滑</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">扰乱，打扰：</font>to disturb the peace of mind of (someone) especially by repeated disagreeable acts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The stream of minor complaints finally ruffled him into snapping, “If you don’t like the way I’m doing it, do ityourself!” 一系列的抱怨终于让他爆发：“如果你不喜欢我做事的方法，你就自己去做！”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annoy, bother, chafe, frost, gall, grate, itch, nettle, peeve, persecute, pique, rasp, rile, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allay, alleviate, assuage, ease, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soothe 平息，缓和</div>
