<h2>runic[sound:runic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">神秘的：</font>having some secret or mysterious meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]painstaking efforts to decipher the runic inscriptions 为破解神秘的碑文付出的辛勤劳动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arcane, enigmatic, impenetrable, inscrutable, mysterious, mystic, occult, uncanny</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comprehendible, fathomable 可理解的</div>
<h2>rupture[sound:rupture.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">打破；打碎：</font>to part by violence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Jealousy ruptured our friendly relationship. 嫉妒心破坏了我们的友谊。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breach, burst, disjoin, dissect, fracture, separate, split, sunder, tear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]associate, coalesce, combine, conjoin, conjugate, connect, fuse, interfuse, join, link, unify 联合</div>
<h2>ruse[sound:ruse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">诡计：</font>a wily subterfuge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This was a ruse to divide them. 这是一招反间计。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artifice, maneuver, stratagem, trick, wile</div>
<h2>rustic[sound:rustic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">乡下人，头脑简单的人：</font>an awkward or simple person especially from a small town or the country</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a rustic who was awed by the prices that city dwellers had to pay 一个被大城市房价所吓到的乡里人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bumpkin, churl, countryman, provincial, rube, yokel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cosmopolitan, cosmopolite, sophisticate 见多识广的人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">乡村的：</font>of, relating to, associated with, or typical of open areas with few buildings or people</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We went to a rustic area that is devoid of skyscrapers and shopping malls. 我们去了一个没有摩天大楼和购物中心的乡村原野。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bucolic, country, pastoral</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]urban 都市的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗俗的：</font>lacking in social graces or polish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clumsy, discourteous, gauche, impertinent, impolite, inelegant, rude, stiff</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]graceful, polished, urbane 文雅的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]rustically adv. 粗俗地</div>
<h2>rustle[sound:rustle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">快速地行动：</font>to move or act energetically or with speed; to proceed or move quickly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The little boy rustled around enthusiastically on the first morning of the trip. 旅行的第一个早晨，小男孩充满热情地在那活蹦乱跳。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bolt, breeze, careen, career, hasten, hustle, jump, run, rush, scurry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crawl, creep 匍匐前行；poke 缓慢行动</div>
<h2>sabotage[sound:sabotage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">妨害，破坏：</font>treacherous action to defeat or hinder a cause or an endeavor; deliberate subversion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]sabotage of the project by government officials 被政府官员阻止的项目</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]damage, impairment, subversion, undermining</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assistance 支援</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">从事破坏活动，阻止：</font>to practice sabotage on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He sabotaged his opponent's campaign with rumors. 他用谣言来破坏对手的竞选活动。‖My  ex-wifedeliberately sabotages my access to the children. 我的前妻故意想方设法阻止我和我的孩子们见面。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disrupt, foil, frustrate, obstruct, undermine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assist, support 支持；advance, cultivate, forward, foster, further, nurture, promote 促进</div>
<h2>saccharine[sound:saccharine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">像糖一样的，有甜味的：</font>of, relating to, or resembling that of sugar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a powdery substance with a saccharine taste  有甜味的粉状物质</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cloying, sugary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bitter 苦涩的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">做作的，矫情的：</font>appealing to the emotions in an obvious and tiresome way</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The movie was funny, but it had a saccharine ending in which everyone lives happily ever after.  电影还是很有意思的，但是结局太做作了——所有人从此都幸福地生活在了一起。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fruity, maudlin, mawkish, mushy, sentimental, sugarcoated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unsentimental 不动感情的</div>
<h2>sacrilege[sound:sacrilege.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">亵渎圣物：</font>desecration, profanation, misuse, or theft of something sacred</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]To play Mozart's music on a kazoo is sacrilege. 用小木笛演奏莫扎特的音乐是对它的一种亵渎。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blasphemy, defilement, desecration, irreverence, impiety, profanation, violation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adoration, glorification, respect, reverence 爱慕，尊敬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sacrilegious adj. 不敬的，亵渎神明的</div>
<h2>saddle[sound:saddle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使某人负担：</font>to load or burden</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He has saddled himself with a houseful of impecunious relatives. 一屋子的穷亲戚成了他的负担</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burden, encumber, freight, lade, lumber, impose, inflict, tax, weight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disburden, discharge, disencumber, unburden, unlade, unload 卸下</div>
<h2>safeguard[sound:safeguard.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">保护措施：</font>a technical contrivance to prevent accident</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]legal safeguards against fraud 防止欺诈的法律措施</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aegis, caution, defense, fail-safe, guard, palladium, precaution, preventive, security</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">保护：</font>to make safe: protect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]sheepdogs safeguard the flock from attacks by wolves  保护兽群免受狼群攻击的牧羊犬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bulwark, cover, defend, fence, fend, guard, keep, protect, screen, secure, shield, ward</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assail, assault, attack 攻击</div>
<h2>sage[sound:sage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">智者：</font>one (as a profound philosopher) distinguished for wisdom</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The young prince made a pilgrimage to the sage, hoping to learn the meaning of life. 年轻的王子走上了向智者取经的道路，希望能领悟到生命的真谛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]expert, illuminati, master, mentor, savant, scholar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dolt, fool, idiot, simpleton 傻子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sagacious adj. 睿智的；sagacity n. 聪慧</div>
<h2>salient[sound:salient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">显著的，最突出的：</font>standing out conspicuously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The most salient feature of the book is its papyrus cover. 该书最明显的特点就是莎草纸的封面。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conspicuous, noticeable, outstanding, prominent, remarkable, striking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconspicuous, unnoticeable 不明显的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]salience n. 突出，特点</div>
<h2>salubrious[sound:salubrious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有益健康的：</font>favorable to or promoting health or well-being</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Every year I go to Kunming to enjoy its cool and salubrious climate. 每年我都会去昆明享受它那凉爽宜人的气候。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]good, healthy, restorative, salutary, tonic, wholesome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]debilitating, deleterious, noxious, virulent  有害的，有毒的</div>
<h2>salutary[sound:salutary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有益健康的：</font>beneficial, promoting health</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a salutary warning  善意的警告</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]good, healthy, restorative, salubrious, tonic, wholesome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]debilitating, deleterious, noxious, virulent  有害的，有毒的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有利的，利好的：</font>promoting or contributing to personal or social well-being</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The low interest rates should have a salutary effect on business. 低利率对于商业而言应该是有利的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advantageous, benefic, beneficent, benignant, favorable, friendly, helpful, kindly, profitable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bad, disadvantageous, unfavorable, unfriendly, unhelpful, unprofitable 不利的</div>
<h2>salutation[sound:salutation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">致敬，打招呼（表示欢迎和礼貌）：</font>a polite expression of greeting or goodwill</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The veteran stepped forward, raising his hand in salutation. 老兵向前一步，举起手致敬。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]greeting, regards, salute</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]farewell, bon voyage （离别时的）再见，一路顺风</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">表扬：</font>a formal expression praise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The speaker introduced the evening's honored guest with a lavish salutation. 主持人用大量表扬的话介绍了今晚的嘉宾。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accolade, citation, commendation, eulogium, eulogy, homage, hymn, paean, panegyric, tribute</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]salute    v. 敬礼，致敬</div>
<h2>salvage[sound:salvage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（从灾难中）抢救：</font>to save from loss or destruction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]salvaged the torpedoed vessel 拯救被鱼雷击中的舰艇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rescue, retrieve, save</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abandon, desert, forsake 放弃，抛弃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]salvageable adj. 可以挽回的</div>
<h2>salve[sound:salve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">减轻，缓解：</font>quiet, assuage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The company give him a raise in salary to salve his feelings. 公司决定给他加薪以安抚他的感情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allay, balm, becalm, compose, lull, lullaby, quiet, settle, soothe, still, tranquilize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitate, discompose, disquiet, disturb, perturb, upset, vex 打扰，扰乱</div>
<h2>sanctify[sound:sanctify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使神圣，敬为神：</font>to make holy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Constitution sanctified the rights of the people. 宪法认为人权是至高无上的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consecrate, hallow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]desecrate, profane 亵渎</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sanctification n. 敬为神明</div>
<h2>sanctimonious[sound:sanctimonious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">假装虔诚的：</font>hypocritically pious or devout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sickening sanctimonious smile 令人厌恶的伪善的笑容</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]canting, deceiving, hypocritical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]devout, religious, pious 虔诚的</div>
<h2>sanction[sound:sanction.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">批准，同意，认可：</font>to make valid or binding usually by a formal procedure (as ratification)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The President sanctioned covert operations. 总统批准了秘密行动‖The  administration  will  sanctionalmost any field trip with educational value. 基本上任何有教育意义的实地考察都可以得到批准。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accredit, approbate, authorize, certify, confirm, finalize, formalize, license, ratify, warrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]interdict, prohibit, proscribe  禁止；decline, deny, disallow, disapprove, negative, reject, veto 否决</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">制裁：</font>an economic or military coercive measure adopted usually by several nations in concert forforcing a nation violating international law to desist or yield to adjudication</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Another trade sanction is in effect. 又一项贸易制裁生效了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]penalty, punishment</div>
<h2>sanctuary[sound:sanctuary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">避难所：</font>a place of refuge and protection</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In earlier times a criminal could use a church as a sanctuary. 在早期，犯罪分子可以将教堂当作避难所。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asylum, cover, harbor, haven, port, refuge, shelter</div>
<h2>sand[sound:sand.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">磨光：</font>to make smooth by friction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Be sure to sand before you paint the shelf. 在上漆之前一定要先磨光。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]buff, file, hone, rasp, rub</div>
<h2>sanguine[sound:sanguine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">乐观的，确信的：</font>having or showing a mind free from doubt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I'm reasonably sanguine about the adoption of the latest proposal. 我非常看好最新的那项提议获得通过。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assured, confident, doubtless, implicit, positive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doubtful, dubious, uncertain, unsure  怀疑的，不确信的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">面色红润的：</font>having a healthy reddish skin tone</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a baby with a sanguine complexion is more likely to leave the hospital early than a sickly-looking one 面色红润的新生儿比病怏怏的能更早出院</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blooming, florid, flush, glowing, rosy, rubicund</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ashy, doughy, livid, lurid, mealy, pale, pallid, pasty, peaky, sallow, wan 面色苍白的</div>
<h2>sanitary[sound:sanitary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">健康的，清洁的：</font>of or relating to health</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]sanitary measures  保健的手段</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aseptic, germfree, hygienic, sterile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]noxious 有毒的</div>
<h2>sap[sound:sap.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">削弱：</font>to weaken or exhaust the energy or vitality of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Weeks of hard work had sapped hum and left him exhausted. 连续几周辛苦工作让他筋疲力尽。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debilitate, devitalize, enervate, enfeeble, etiolate, prostrate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bolster, fortify, invigorate, beef up 增强，使有活力</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">健康，活力：</font>active strength of body or mind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a child full of sap and vivacity 活力满满的孩子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dynamism, energy, esprit, get-up-and-go, gusto, verve, vim, vitality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lethargy, listlessness, sluggishness, torpidity 无精打采</div>
<h2>sapient[sound:sapient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">聪明的，有洞察力的：</font>having or showing deep understanding  and  intelligent  application ofknowledge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a man who is always good for valuable insights and some sapient advice 一个以见解深刻、建议明智著称的男人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discerning, insightful, perceptive, prudent, sagacious, sage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]foolish, unperceptive, unwise 愚蠢的，不明智的</div>
<h2>sarcasm[sound:sarcasm.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">讽刺，轻蔑：</font>a sharp and often satirical or ironic utterance designed to cut or give pain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a voice full of sarcasm  充满轻蔑的言论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affront, barb, indignity, offense, slap, slight, slur</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]praise 表扬</div>
<h2>sartorial[sound:sartorial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">裁缝匠的，裁缝的：</font>of or relating to a tailor or tailored clothes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]poor sartorial taste 很烂的穿衣品位</div>
<h2>sate[sound:sate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使饱足，充分满足：</font>to glut; to satisfy (an appetite) fully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The information sated her curiosity. 这个消息满足了她的好奇心。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cram, glut, stuff, surfeit, satiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]starve 饿</div>
<h2>satiate[sound:satiate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v./adj. 饱足，过分满足：to satisfy fully or to excess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A long drink of water satiated my thirst. 一顿痛饮之后我的口渴得到了缓解</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]replete, sate, stuff, surfeit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]tantalize 挑逗，不去满足</div>
<h2>satire[sound:satire.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">讽刺诗，讽剌文学：</font>a literary work holding up human vices and follies to ridicule or scorn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a satire about the music industry in which a handsome but untalented youth is turned into a rock star 一部关于一个长得帅却没才华的年轻人如何被打造成一个摇滚巨星的讽刺文学作品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lampoon, pasquinade</div>
<h2>satirize[sound:satirize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">讽刺：</font>to ridicule or attack by means of satire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The movie satirizes contemporary life. 这部电影讽刺当下生活。</div>
<h2>saturate[sound:saturate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v./adj. 使饱和，浸透：to wet thoroughly with liquid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Saturate the sponge with water.  将海绵浸透</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bathe, douse, drench, soak, souse, bedraggle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]wring out</div>
<h2>saturnine[sound:saturnine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">忧郁的，阴沉的：</font>causing or marked by an atmosphere lacking in cheer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The men awaiting interrogation by the police shared a saturnine silence.  等待警察审问的人们脸色阴沉，沉默不语。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bleak, depressive, dismal, dreary, miserable, solemn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]jovial , bright, cheerful, comforting, cordial, festive, heartwarming, sunshiny 欢乐的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">讥讽的：</font>having a sardonic aspect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a saturnine smile 讥讽的笑容</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]genial 友善的</div>
<h2>saunter[sound:saunter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">闲逛，漫步：</font>to travel by foot for exercise or pleasure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]sauntered slowly down the street 在街上闲逛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amble, ramble, range, stroll, wander, perambulate</div>
<h2>savant[sound:savant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">博学之士，学者：</font>a person of learning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a savant in the field of medical ethics 医学伦理方面的专家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]pundit, scholar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unlearned person 没有学问的人</div>
<h2>savory[sound:savory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">口感好的，味道好的：</font>appetizing to the taste or smell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cedar is one of the most savory of all woods 雪松是所有树木中味道最好闻的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambrosial, appetizing, dainty, palatable, scrumptious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]noisome, fetid, foul, malodorous, putrid, rancid, reeking, smelly, stenchy, stinky 难闻的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人愉悦的：</font>giving pleasure or contentment to the mind or senses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]having to fire someone was not a task that the manager found at all savory 经理发现不得不开除某人是件非常不讨好的事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agreeable,  blessed,  congenial,  delectable,  delicious,  delightful,  dulcet,  enjoyable,  felicitous,  grateful,gratifying, heavenly, jolly, luscious, palatable, pleasurable, satisfying, tasty, welcome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disagreeable, pleasureless, unpalatable, unpleasant, unwelcome 讨厌的，不受欢迎的</div>
<h2>savvy[sound:savvy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">老练，机智：</font>knowledge gained by actually doing or living through something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]political savvy 政治上的老脸精明</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chops, expertise, proficiency, know-how</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]simplicity, tactlessness, inexperience 单纯，缺乏经验</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">明确了解：</font>to have a clear idea of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The man growled, “Don't ever date my daughter again—you savvy ” 那男人咆哮道，“你丫以后不准再见我女儿，你的明白？”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appreciate,  apprehend,  assimilate,  behold,  catch  on,  cognize,  compass,  conceive,  decipher,  decode,discern, grasp, perceive, recognize, register, seize, tumble to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]miss  不理解</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有见识，精明能干的：</font>having or showing a practical cleverness or judgment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a particularly savvy investor, he was among the first to see the potential in tech stocks  一个有卓识远见的投资者，是第一批看到科技类股票升值潜力的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]astute, canny, clear-eyed, clear-sighted, hard-boiled, hardheaded, heady, sharp, sharp-witted, smart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unknowing 无知的</div>
<h2>scads[sound:scads.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">许多，大量：</font>a large number or quantity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]scads of people showed up for the party 参加派对的人们蜂拥而至</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundance, plenitude, profusion, slew, spate, wealth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]paucity 极小量</div>
<h2>scant[sound:scant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不足的，缺乏的：</font>barely or scarcely sufficient</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]jobs for teenagers were scant that summer 那年暑假适合青少年们做的工作很少</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exiguous, niggardly, scarce, sparse, stingy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]considerable, copious, voluminous, profuse, myriad 大量的，相当多的</div>
<h2>scathing[sound:scathing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">尖酸刻薄的：</font>marked by the use of wit that is intended to cause hurt feelings</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a scathing review of the book 尖刻的书评</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acerbic, acid, acrid, pungent, scalding, snarky, tart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]polite, calm compliment 客气的，平静的称赞</div>

<h2>scintillate[sound:scintillate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">闪耀：</font>to emit sparks</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]diamond ring scintillated in the sunlight 钻戒在阳光下闪闪发光</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gleam, glimmer, glisten, glister, luster, sparkle, winkle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]scintillating 才气横溢的：brilliantly lively, stimulating, or witty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a scintillating conversation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dull, foolly 迟钝的</div>
<h2>scion[sound:scion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">子孙：</font>descendant, child</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]scion of a railroad empire 铁路大王的后代</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ancestor 前辈</div>
<h2>scission[sound:scission.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">切断，分离，分裂：</font>a division or split in a group or union: schism</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The scission of the labor union will compromise the workers' bargaining power 工会内部的分裂会削弱工人讨价的力量</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bifurcation, cleavage, dissolution, division, partition, schism, sundering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unification, union 统一</div>
<h2>scoff[sound:scoff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">嘲笑：</font>to treat or address with derision: mock</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]scoffed at the idea  对这个提议不屑一顾</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">狼吞虎咽：</font>to swallow or eat greedily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]scoffed dinner before running off to the basketball game 风卷残云般把晚饭消灭了，就直奔向篮球场</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cram, devour, glut, gorge, gormandize, gulp, ingurgitate, inhale, raven</div>
<h2>scorch[sound:scorch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">炙烤，烘干：</font>to burn on the surface; to make dry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]scorching sun  火辣辣的太阳</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dehydrate, desiccate, parch, sear, singe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dampen, hydrate, wash, water, wet 使潮湿</div>
<h2>scorn[sound:scorn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">轻蔑，鄙视，不屑：</font>reject or dismiss as contemptible or unworthy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They were scorned as fanatics.  他们被指责为狂热分子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]despise, disregard, flout, contemn, disdain, slight, look down (on or upon)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adulate; venerate, honor, respect, revere  谄媚；尊敬</div>
<h2>scotch[sound:scotch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">停止：</font>to put an abrupt end to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The prime minister scotched the rumors of her illness. 首相出面澄清了关于她死亡的谣言。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hinder, thwart</div>
<h2>scour[sound:scour.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">用力擦洗：</font>to clean, polish, or wash by scrubbing vigorously</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">搜查：</font>to  look  through  (as  a  place)  carefully  or  thoroughly  in  an  effort  to  find  or  discoversomething</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the police scoured the city for the criminal 警方全城搜索罪犯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comb, dig through, dredge, hunt through, rake, ransack, rifle, rummage, sort through, troll</div>
<h2>scowl[sound:scowl.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">皱眉（表现出不高兴）：</font>to contract the brow in an expression of displeasure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]scowled down at the misbehaving child 对淘气的孩子皱起了眉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]frown, pout, glare, gloom, glower, lower</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beam, grin, smile 微笑（表示高兴）</div>
<h2>scrappy[sound:scrappy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">好斗的，好吵架的：</font>having an aggressive and determined spirit，quarrelsome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was a scrappy girl despite—or, perhaps, because of—her small size.这个妹子好打斗，但是身材娇小，不过这很可能是原因</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggressive, assaultive, combative, militant, pugnacious, truculent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nonaggressive, nonbelligerent, pacific, peaceful, unbelligerent, uncombative,, timorous 胆小的，爱好和平的</div>
<h2>scrap[sound:scrap.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">废料，废物：</font>discarded or useless material</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The rest of this stuff is just scrap, so sweep it up and throw it away. 剩下的这堆东西都是没用的，把它们打扫一下就扔了吧。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chaff, debris, dreck, dross, dust, effluvium, junk, litter, offal, offscouring, raffle, refuse, riffraff, rubbish, waste</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">抛弃：</font>to get rid of as useless or unwanted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We've decided to scrap the first car. 我们决定丢弃第一辆车。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ditch, dump, jettison, junk, toss, throw away</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]retrieve 找回</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">终止，放弃原计划：</font>to put an end to (something planned or previously agreed to)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We scrapped our plans to go to Paris, and set out the next day for Prague. 我们取消了去巴黎的计划，第二天启程奔赴布拉格。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abandon, abort, drop, recall, repeal, rescind, revoke, call off, cry off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]continue, keep 继续，持续</div>
<h2>scrawl[sound:scrawl.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">乱涂，潦草地写：</font>to write or draw awkwardly, hastily, or carelessly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]scrawled a quick note, stuck it in their mailbox, and hurried off 草草写了张便条，塞进他们的信箱然后匆匆跑了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]scratch, squiggle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]write carefully  仔细地写</div>
<h2>scribble[sound:scribble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">潦草地书写，乱写：</font>to cover with scribbles, doodles, or meaningless marks</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Students scribbled furiously as the teacher lectured. 老师一边讲，学生们一边狂抄笔记。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]scratch, scrawl, squiggle</div>
<h2>scrupulous[sound:scrupulous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">正直的：</font>guided by or in accordance with one's sense of right and wrong; principled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Less scrupulous companies find ways to evade the law. 道德程度略低的公司钻法律的空子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conscionable, ethical, honest, honorable, moral, principled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cutthroat, dishonest, dishonorable, immoral, unconscionable, unethical, unjust, unprincipled 不道德的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">一丝不苟的：</font>taking, showing, or involving great care and effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The task requires scrupulous attention to detail. 这项任务需要对细节一丝不苟。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careful, conscientious, fussy, meticulous</div>
<h2>scrutable[sound:scrutable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可以理解的：</font>capable of being understood through study and observation; comprehensible.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her machinations and motives are all too scrutable to us who know her. 她的阴谋和动机对于了解她的我们来说非常昭然若揭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accessible, apprehensible, comprehensible, fathomable, legible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mysterious, incoherent, incomprehensible, inscrutable, insensible 神秘而不可知的</div>
<h2>scrutinize[sound:scrutinize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">仔细检查：</font>to examine or observe with great care</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I closely scrutinized my opponent's every move. 我仔细注意着对手的每一个举动。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]examine, review, scan, survey, plumb, check (out)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]casually glance, gloss over  随意一瞥，敷衍处理</div>
<h2>scuff[sound:scuff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">磨损：</font>to become scratched, chipped, or roughened by wear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a countertop that won't scuff 一块不易磨损的厨房台面</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrade, graze, scratch</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">脚步拖沓：</font>to move heavily or clumsily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The miners scuffed past in heavy boots. 矿工们脚着厚重的靴子，步履蹒跚。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]barge, clomp, clump, flog, flounder, lump, plod, pound, shamble, slog, slough, stamp, stomp, stumble,stump, tramp, tromp, trudge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]breeze, coast, glide, slide, whisk 滑行</div>

<h2>sedate[sound:sedate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">淡定的，安静的：</font>free from emotional or mental agitation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She remained sedate under pressure. 她在压力下仍保持镇静。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collected, composed, self-possessed, serene, tranquil, undisturbed, unperturbed, unruffled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitated, discomposed, disturbed, flustered, perturbed, upset 不淡定的，狂乱的</div>

<h2>self-absorbed[sound:self-absorbed.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">自恋的，自私的：</font>absorbed in one's own thoughts, activities, or interests</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a self-absorbed man who seems utterly oblivious to the social problems of his own urban neighborhood一个超级自私的人，对于街坊的事情完全视而不见</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]narcissistic, self-centered, self-infatuated, self-obsessed, self-oriented, self-preoccupied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]self-forgetting, selfless, unselfish 无私的</div>

<h2>sensation[sound:sensation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">感觉，知觉：</font>a perception associated with stimulation of a sense  organ or with a specific bodycondition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We felt just the smallest sensation of warmth when we leaned against the radiator. 当我们靠着取暖器的时候，我们也仅仅感到了一点点的温度。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]anesthesia, numbness 麻木</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">轰动事件：</font>a state of intense public interest and excitement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the rookie hitting sensation of the American League 这个菜鸟的表现轰动了整个全美大联盟</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flash, marvel, miracle, phenomenon, portent, prodigy, splendor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unnoticed event 不知名的小事</div>
<h2>sensitive[sound:sensitive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">敏感的：</font>susceptible to the attitudes, feelings, or circumstances of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]he's very sensitive to the sun and will burn if he's outside for any amount of time 他的皮肤对日光非常敏感，在外时间长了就会烧灼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]susceptible, vulnerable, subject (to)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]numb 麻木的</div>

<h2>sere[sound:sere.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">干枯的，凋萎的：</font>being dried and withered</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sere region that can't support agriculture 一片贫瘠不能发展农业的地区</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arid, droughty, thirsty, waterless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lush, damp, dank, humid, moist, wet  葱绿的，湿润的</div>
<h2>serendipity[sound:serendipity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">意外发现珍奇(或称心)事物的本领：</font>the faculty of making fortunate discoveries by accident</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They found each other by pure serendipity. 他俩的相识属于缘分天注定。</div>
<h2>serene[sound:serene.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">安静的：</font>free from disturbing noise or uproar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a serene vacation spot  一处宁谧的度假胜地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arcadian, calm, hushed, peaceful, placid, restful, still, tranquil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]boisterous,  clamorous,  clattery,  deafening,  raucous,  roistering,  romping,  rowdy,  tumultuous,  unquiet, uproarious</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">稳重的，镇静的：</font>unaffected by disturbance; calm and unruffled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a serene man who was everyone's source of support 一个沉着镇静的男人，他是所有人的精神支柱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collected, composed, possessed, recollected, undisturbed, unperturbed, unruffled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitated, discomposed, disturbed, flustered, perturbed, unhinged, unstrung, upset  暴躁的，不安的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]serenity n. 平静  the quality or state of being serene</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]havoc, pandemonium, tumult, bedlam, riot, furor 混乱，骚动</div>
<h2>sermon[sound:sermon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">布道，说教：</font>public speech usually by a member of the clergy for the purpose of giving moralguidance or uplift</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]sermon whose message was that we should love our neighbors as much as we love ourselves 主题是教导我们要像爱自己一样爱邻居的一次布道</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]homily</div>
<h2>serpentine[sound:serpentine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">弯曲的：</font>winding or turning one way and another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the country inn lies at the end of a rather serpentine road 乡村小酒吧坐落在一条非常蜿蜒的道路的尽头</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]curved, curvy, devious, sinuous, tortuous, twisted, winding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]direct, straight, straightaway 直的</div>
<h2>serrate[sound:serrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">锯齿状的：</font>notched or toothed on the edge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a serrate leaf 锯齿状的叶片</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]without notches, smooth 无凹口的，平滑的</div>
<h2>serried[sound:serried.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">密集的：</font>having little space between items or parts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Flowers came up every spring in their serried ranks. 大量的鲜花在春季盛开。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compact, dense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]widely separated, airy, loose, open, uncrowded 稀疏的</div>
<h2>servile[sound:servile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">低下的，卑屈的：</font>meanly or cravenly submissive: abject</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]had always maintained a servile attitude around people with money 对有钱人卑躬屈膝</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]base, humble, menial, slavish</div>
<h2>severe[sound:severe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严厉的，要求严格的：</font>given to exacting standards of discipline and self-restraint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a severe, uncompromising teacher 一位严厉、不妥协的老师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]austere, harsh, ramrod, rigid, rigorous, stern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clement, forbearing, gentle, indulgent, lax, lenient, tolerant 温和的，随意的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难以承受的，艰难的：</font>difficult to endure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a severe winter that was among the coldest on record 有记录的最寒冷的冬天之一</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brutal, excruciating, grievous, onerous, oppressive, tough, trying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easy, light, soft 轻松的</div>
<h2>shackle[sound:shackle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">束缚：</font>to deprive of freedom especially of action by means of restrictions or handicaps</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]unwilling to shackle the dogs to the wall of the house 不愿意把狗拴在墙边</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chain, enchain, enfetter, fetter, gyve, handcuff, manacle, pinion, trammel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]loose, emancipate, unbind, unfetter, unshackle 解放</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">限制，阻碍：</font>to create difficulty for the work or activity of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shackled by poverty and ignorance 被贫穷和无知所阻碍</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clog, cramp, encumber, fetter, hinder, impede, inhibit, interfere with, manacle, obstruct, short-circuit, stymie,tie up, trammel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aid, assist, facilitate, help 促进，帮助</div>
<h2>shadow[sound:shadow.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">偷偷尾随：</font>to follow especially secretly: trail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shadowing the suspect to see what he was up to 尾随嫌犯行踪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chase, course, pursue, trace, track, trail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]shadowy  模糊的：faintly perceptible: indistinct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He had only a shadowy idea of what they wanted him to do. 他对要做的事只有一个模糊的想法。</div>
<h2>shallow[sound:shallow.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">浅显的，浅薄的：</font>having or showing a lack of depth of understanding or character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shallow generalizations 一个浅显的概览</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]facile, one-dimensional, skin-deep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]profound  深刻的，有深度的</div>
<h2>sham[sound:sham.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">欺瞒：</font>the quality of deceitfulness; empty pretense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]condemned the rigged election as a total sham 指责这次有作弊的选举是彻头彻尾的骗局</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]debunk 揭穿真相</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">掩饰，假装：</font>to present a false appearance of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shammed a most unconvincing limp just to get sympathy 非常拙劣地假装自己腿脚不便，以博得同情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]act, affect, bluff, counterfeit, dissemble, fake, simulate, pretend, profess, put on, pass for</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">虚假的：</font>not genuine; fake</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]street vendors selling sham designer handbags to gullible tourists 街头小贩向易上当的游客兜售山寨的设计师手包</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bogus, forged, phony, spurious, unauthentic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]genuine, authentic, bona fide, real, unfaked 真正的</div>
<h2>shiftless[sound:shiftless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">胸无大志，懒惰的：</font>lacking in ambition or incentive: lazy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shiftless spongers who never thought to do anything for themselves  无志气的弃民们，从来没有想过改变自己</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]idle, indolent, slothful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]industrious 勤奋的</div>
<h2>shipshape[sound:shipshape.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">井然有序的：</font>marked by meticulous order and neatness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I like to keep my car shipshape.  我喜欢打理我的车。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antiseptic, kempt, orderly, prim, uncluttered, well-groomed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disheveled, disordered, disorderly, messy, sloven, unkempt, untidy</div>

<h2>shopworn[sound:shopworn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">陈旧的：</font>worn-out, as from overuse; trite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the shopworn suggestion to job applicants to “just be yourself ” 老掉牙的让应征者“做你自己”的提议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banal, cliché, commonplace, hackneyed, trite, well-worn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]new, fresh, novel, original, unclichéd, unhackneyed 新的</div>

<h2>shrewd[sound:shrewd.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精明的，机敏的：</font>having or showing a practical cleverness or judgment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He's shrewd about his investments. 他是个精明的投资人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crafty, cunning, devious, sly, subtle, wily, astute, savvy, sharp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]foolish, naive, unknowing 愚蠢的，幼稚的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">刺骨的，强烈的：</font>causing intense discomfort to one's skin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She pulled her coat tighter against the shrewd breeze whipping down the alley. 巷子里挂着刺骨的风，她拉紧了大衣。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]biting, bitter, keen, penetrating, piercing, raw, sharp, stinging</div>
<h2>shrink[sound:shrink.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">在数量或价值方面变低；减小：</font>to become reduced in amount or value; dwindle:</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His savings quickly shrank.  他的存款急剧减少。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compress, condense, constrict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]balloon, expand, snowball, swell</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">本能性地退却 （如因遇到使人惊恐的某物）；退缩：</font>to draw back  instinctively, as from somethingalarming; recoil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shrinking back from the approaching flames 对着燃烧的火焰望而却步</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blench, cringe, quail, recoil, squinch, wince</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">表示出不情愿；犹豫：</font>to show reluctance; hesitate:</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shrink from making such a sacrifice 对做出这样的牺牲犹豫不决</div>
<h2>shroud[sound:shroud.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">隐蔽物，可起隐藏、保护或屏护作用的某物：</font>something that conceals, protects, or screens:</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]under a shroud of fog 在迷雾的掩护下</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">将…从视线中隔离，遮蔽：</font>to shut off from sight; screen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shrouded the fact that the child had been adopted  将孩子是领养的这个事实隐藏起来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belie, blanket, cloak, conceal, cover, curtain, disguise, mask, occult, screen, veil, blot out, paper over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bare, disclose, display, divulge, expose, reveal, show 展示，暴露</div>
<h2>shrug[sound:shrug.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">轻视，忽略：</font>to dismiss as of little importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The administration was willing to shrug off the problem. 当局有意忽略这个问题。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disregard, gloss, ignore, minimize, overlook, overpass, slight, slur, wink</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]attend, heed, mind 留心，注意</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">脱下（衣物等）：</font>to rid oneself of (a garment)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She shrugged off her coat and hung it up neatly. 她脱下了她的大衣，将其整齐地挂好。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doff, douse, put off, take off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]don, put on 穿上</div>
<h2>shun[sound:shun.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">避开，避免：</font>to avoid deliberately; keep away from</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After his divorce he found himself being shunned by many of his former friends. 自从他离婚以来，他发现许多曾经的朋友都刻意躲着他。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avoid, dodge, duck, elude, eschew, evade, finesse, scape, shirk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accept, embrace, welcome  接受，欢迎；pursue, seek 追寻</div>
<h2>sidestep[sound:sidestep.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（通过逃避而）不遵守：</font>to avoid having to comply with (something) especially through cleverness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The eager enlistee sidestepped the regulations by lying about his age. 急切的应募者通过谎报自己的年龄躲过了规定的限制。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beat, bypass, dodge, shortcut, skirt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comply, follow, keep, obey, observe 遵守</div>
<h2>signal[sound:signal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（在重要性、成就方面）非同寻常的：</font>standing above others in rank, importance, or achievement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Louisiana Purchase is cited by many historians as one of the most signal events in American history.从法国手中购买路易斯安那被许多历史学家认为是美国历史上最重要的事件之一。‖a signal feat 一项非同寻常伟业</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]distinguished, illustrious, luminous, notable, noteworthy, outstanding, preeminent, prestigious, redoubtable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]average, inferior, mediocre 一般的，低下的；insignificant, minor, unimportant 不重要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">给出信号：</font>to direct or notify by a movement or gesture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They signaled at me to come over to their table. 他们向我打招呼要我到他们那桌去。‖A  lock  on  thesuitcase might signal that there's something of value inside. 手提箱上的锁可能意味着其中有贵重物品。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beckon, flag, gesture, wave</div>
<h2>simpleton[sound:simpleton.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（缺乏常识的）笨蛋：</font>a person lacking in common sense; a stupid person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His silly antics at office parties have earned him a reputation as a simpleton. 他在办公室聚会上愚蠢的古怪行为让他被人认为是个蠢货。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]airhead, dolt, donkey, dullard, fool, idiot, moron</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]intellectual, sage, wit 智者；genius, prodigy 天才</div>
<h2>simulate[sound:simulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">假装，模仿：</font>to have or take on the appearance, form, or sound of; imitate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]cosmetics that simulate a suntan 用来模仿晒黑效果的化妆品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]act, affect, assume, counterfeit, dissemble, fake, imitate, pretend, profess, sham</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">模拟：</font>to create a representation or model of (a physical system or particular situation)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]carrying out an experiment to simulate weightlessness  进行了模拟失重状态的实验</div>
<h2>sin[sound:sin.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">罪恶的事：</font>an action that is or is felt to be highly reprehensible; morally unacceptable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It's a sin to waste food when people are starving. 当有人还在挨饿时浪费食物是一种罪过。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bad, evildoing, ill, immorality, iniquity, villainy, wrong</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]good, morality, right, virtue 美德，美好的行为</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sinful adj. 罪恶的，有罪的</div>

<h2>skimp[sound:skimp.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏的，不足的：</font>less plentiful than what is normal, necessary, or desirable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The dieter complained about skimp meals that were served at the fat farm. 这个节食者抱怨说减肥疗养地的伙食少得可怜。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exiguous, meager, niggardly, poor, scant, scanty, scarce, skimpy, slender, slim, sparing, sparse, stingy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abundant, ample, bountiful, copious, generous, liberal, plenteous, plentiful 大量的，丰富的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">节省花费，吝啬：</font>to give insufficient or barely sufficient attention or effort to or funds for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We must skimp and save if we are going to afford a vacation this summer. 要是我们这个夏天要出去旅行，那么就得开始节省出一些钱了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]pinch, save, scrimp, spare, stint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dissipate, lavish, prodigalize, squander, waste  浪费，挥霍</div>

<h2>slant[sound:slant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（看待问题、思考的）角度，看法：</font>a way of looking at or thinking about something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an interesting slant on the problem of underage drinking 在青少年饮酒这个问题上一个有趣的视角</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]angle, outlook, perspective, standpoint, viewpoint</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">倾斜的：</font>running in a slanting direction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The computer keyboard has a slightly slant surface so that typing is more comfortable for the wrists.  电脑键盘有一个微小的倾斜角，因此打字不会使手腕感到不适。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]canted, graded, inclined, leaning, listing, oblique, pitched, raked, slanted, sloping, tilting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]perpendicular, plumb, vertical 垂直的；horizontal, level 水平的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">歪曲（事实等）：</font>to change so much as to create a wrong impression or alter the meaning of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Reporters slanted the truth in order to push a political agenda. 为了推动政治进程，记者们歪曲了事实。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bend, color, distort, falsify, misinterpret, misrelate, misrepresent, misstate, pervert, twist, warp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarify, clear, elucidate, illuminate, illustrate 澄清，阐明</div>

<h2>slight[sound:slight.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不重要的：</font>deficient in weight, importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a slight comedy that did nothing to further her career 一个并没有帮助她事业发展的小喜剧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fiddling, frivolous, inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, little, minor, minute, nugatory, trifling, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consequential, eventful, important, meaningful, momentous, significant, substantial, weighty 重要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">轻微的：</font>small in degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]only a slight chance of success 只有很小的成功概率‖If you have even the slightest doubt, then don't doit. 只要你有一点点疑惑，那就不要去做了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fragile, frail, negligible, outside, slim, small, tiny</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]distinct 显著的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">轻蔑，看不起：</font>to treat with disdain or indifference</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Those snobbish music critics slight any style of music that doesn't fit their personal taste. 那帮自命不凡的音乐评论家看不起所有不符合他们个人口味的音乐。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contemn, disdain, disrespect, snub, look down</div><div fail to give proper attention to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She slighted several major authors in her survey of 20th-century fiction. 她在调查 20 世纪幻想文学时中忽略了几个重要的作家。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bypass, disregard, forget, ignore, overlook, overpass, slur</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]attend, heed, mind 留心，注意</div>
<h2>sling[sound:sling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">投掷：</font>to send through the air especially with a quick forward motion of the arm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]slinging stones at the checkpoint 朝着检查站扔石头</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cast, chuck, dash, fire, fling, heave, hurl, hurtle, launch, lob, loft, pelt, pitch, toss</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]catch 接住</div>
<h2>slippery[sound:slippery.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">光滑的：</font>causing or tending to cause something to slide or fall</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The road is slippery after rain, so drive cautiously.  雨后路滑，谨慎驾驶。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]greased, greasy, lubricated, oiled, slicked, slithery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coarse, rough  粗糙的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">隐秘的：</font>given to acting in secret and to concealing one's intentions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a bar where a lot of slippery characters were known to hang out  一个有许多秘密人物出没的酒吧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]furtive, shady, shifty, sly, sneaking, stealthy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aboveboard 光明正大的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">意义不明确的：</font>not precise or fixed in meaning, elusive or tricky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a slippery concept that we had trouble understanding 一个难以理解的模糊概念</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambiguous, elusive, equivocal, evasive, fugitive, obscure, unintelligible, vague</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apparent, clear, distinct, evident, manifest, obvious,  palpable, patent, plain,  unambiguous,  unequivocal明确的</div>
<h2>slipshod[sound:slipshod.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗心的，随意的：</font>marked  by  carelessness  or  indifference  to  exactness,  precision,  andaccuracy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a slipshod piece of research 一项随意的研究‖The hotel had always been run in a slipshod way. 酒店总是在以一种随意的状态运营。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]botchy, careless, messy, slapdash, sloppy, slovenly, untidy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fastidious, meticulous 极仔细的；accurate, exact, precise  准确的</div>
<h2>sloppy[sound:sloppy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">邋遢的，不整洁的：</font>lacking neatness in dress or person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sloppy child who always seems to have spilled something on his clothes 一个外表邋遢的小孩子，他的衣服似乎总被沾上了什么东西</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blowsy, dowdy, frowsy, slovenly, unkempt, untidy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dapper, dashing, sharp, smart, spruce 外表整洁的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">混乱的：</font>lacking in order, neatness, and often cleanliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dumped the papers in a sloppy pile on the desk 把纸张随意地叠放在书桌上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chaotic, disarranged, disarrayed, disheveled, disorderly, jumbled, littered, rumpled, tousled, tumbled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bandbox, crisp, kempt, neat, orderly, organized, shipshape, snug, tidy, trim 有序的</div>
<h2>sloth[sound:sloth.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">怠惰，懒惰：</font>disinclination to action or labor: indolence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Sloth is the mother of poverty. 懒惰是贫穷的原因。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]idleness, indolence, inertia, languor, laziness, lethargy, shiftlessness, sluggishness, torpor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assiduity, diligence, industry 勤奋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]slothful adj. 懒惰的</div>
<h2>slouch[sound:slouch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">懒人：</font>a lazy person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]is no slouch when it comes to cooking 做起饭来可一点也不懒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deadbeat, drone, idler, loafer, slug, sluggard</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doer, hummer, hustler, rustler 活跃的人，精力充沛的人</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">缓慢行走：</font>to go or move slowly or reluctantly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He slouched towards the church as if going to his own funeral. 他缓缓地向教堂走去，仿佛是要去参加自己的葬礼一般。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]creep, drag, inch, limp, nose, ooze, plod, poke, snail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fly, race, speed, whiz, zip 快走</div>
<h2>slovenly[sound:slovenly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">邋遢的，不整洁的：</font>lacking neatness in dress or person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]For the sake of their image, the band members transformed themselves from clean-cut lads to slovenlyrockers.  为了他们自身的形象，乐队成员从健康向上的青年变成了邋遢的摇滚乐手。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blowsy, dowdy, frowsy, sloppy, unkempt, untidy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dapper, dashing, neat, sharp, smart, spruce, trim 外表整洁的</div>
<h2>sluggard[sound:sluggard.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">懒人：</font>an habitually lazy person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The teacher tried to wake up the sluggards who were still sleeping at that late hour. 老师尝试去叫醒那些还在睡觉的懒鬼们。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deadbeat, drone, idler, loafer, slouch, slug</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doer, hummer, hustler, rustler 活跃的人，精力充沛的人</div>
<h2>sluggish[sound:sluggish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缓慢的，迟缓的：</font>markedly slow in movement, flow, or growth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sluggish pace of the project is worrisome. 项目进展缓慢让人担忧。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crawling, creeping, dallying, dilatory, dragging, lagging, languid, leisurely, snaillike, tardy, unhurried</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bolting, brisk, fast, fleet, hasty, lightning, meteoric, quick, racing, rapid, rocketing, speedy, swift 快速的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迟钝的，反应慢的：</font>slow to respond (as to stimulation or treatment)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Reptiles are naturally sluggish at low temperatures. 在低温下爬行动物的生理机能自然会趋于迟缓。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dull, indolent, inert, lethargic, quiescent, sleepy, torpid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]active, animated, bouncing, dynamic, energetic, kinetic, spirited, vigorous, vital, vivacious 有活力的</div>
<h2>slumber[sound:slumber.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">睡着：</font>to be in a state of sleep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She slumbered for hours while the train rolled on. 她在火车行进过程中睡了四个小时。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catnap, doze, nap, rest, sleep, snooze</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arouse, awake, waken  醒来</div>
<h2>slur[sound:slur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">耻辱：</font>a mark of guilt or disgrace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Your drunken behavior at the wedding has cast a slur on this family.  你在婚礼上醉酒后的行为给整个家族都带来了耻辱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blot, brand, onus, smirch, smudge, spot, stigma, taint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]award, credit, glory, honor 荣誉，荣耀</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">含糊地发音：</font>to pronounce indistinctly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]If you slur your words, the visa officer will have a hard time following you. 如果你说话含糊不清，签证官就很难听懂你的话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mumble, murmur,mutter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]articulate, enunciate 清楚地表达</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】v. <font color="#aa00ff">疏忽，忽略：</font>to slide or slip over without due mention, consideration, or emphasis</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This documentary slurs over certain important facts as it offers a very biased case for a conspiracy theory.这部纪录片忽略了许多重要的客观事实，而只给出了带有偏见的阴谋论解释。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bypass, disregard, forget, ignore, overlook, overpass, slight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]attend, heed, mind 留心，注意</div>
<h2>sly[sound:sly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">狡猾的：</font>clever or cunning, especially in the practice of deceit.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The movie pairs a sly, dissembling ex-con with an upstanding, straight-arrow cop. 电影把一个狡猾、善于骗人的出狱犯和正直、坦率的警察搭配在了一起。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beguiling, cagey, crafty, cunning, designing, devious, foxy, guileful, scheming, shrewd, subtle, tricky, wily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artless, guileless, ingenuous, innocent, undesigning 天真纯朴的，无伪装的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">隐秘的，偷偷的：</font>given to acting in secret and to concealing one's intentions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]took a sly look at the letter on the table 偷偷地看了一眼桌上的信</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]furtive, shady, shifty, slippery, sneaking, stealthy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aboveboard 光明正大的</div>
<h2>smarmy[sound:smarmy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">虚情假意的，过分恭维的：</font>hypocritically, complacently, or effusively earnest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is slightly smarmy and eager to impress. 他有点虚伪，急于给人留下印象。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fulsome, oily, slick, soapy, unctuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artless, earnest, genuine, heartfelt, sincere, unaffected  真诚的，真挚的</div>
