<h2>smart[sound:smart.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">反应敏捷的，聪颖的：</font>characterized by sharp quick thought</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a smart child who could do well in school  一个能在学校取得良好成绩的聪明孩子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alert, brainy, bright, brilliant, clever, exceptional, fast, intelligent, keen, nimble, quick, sharp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]airheaded, brainless, doltish, dumb, fatuous, mindless, obtuse, senseless, simple, stupid, vacuous, witless愚钝的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">整洁的：</font>being strikingly neat and trim in style or appearance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Dressed in their smart new uniforms, the cadets proudly paraded around the grounds of the military school.穿着整洁的制服，军校的学员们骄傲地在训练场上游行。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dapper, natty, neat, sharp, snappy, spruce, trim</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disheveled, frowsy, sloppy, slovenly, unkempt  不整洁的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">感到疼痛，感到痛苦：</font>to suffer acutely, as from mental distress, wounded feelings, or remorse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The injection only smarted for a moment.  打针只会痛一小会儿。‖He is still smarting over criticism of hisclumsy performance. 那些对他笨拙表演的批评仍然让他感到痛苦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ache, hurt, pain, suffer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allay, alleviate, assuage, ease, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soothe 缓和</div>
<h2>smattering[sound:smattering.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">浅薄的知识：</font>superficialor piecemeal knowledge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a smattering of Greek grammar  略懂希腊语语法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]erudition 博学；insight 深刻的见解</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">少量：</font>a small scattered number or amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Only a smattering of spectators presented. 只有少数几个观看者出席了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ace, bit,driblet, glimmer, handful, hint, mite, mouthful, nip, ounce, pittance,sprinkle, trace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundance,bundle, dozen, multiplicity, myriad, plentitude, profusion, scad, shipload, slew, volume, wealth大量</div>
<h2>smirk[sound:smirk.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（自鸣得意地）笑：</font>to smile in an affected, often offensively self-satisfied manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She tried not to smirk when they announced the winner. 当他们宣布她获得了胜利时，她尽可能地保持不露出笑容。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grin, simper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cry, weep 哭泣；groan, moan, sigh 叹息</div>
<h2>smother[sound:smother.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使窒息：</font>to be or cause to be killed by lack of breathable air</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Children should never be leftin cars alone because they could become trapped and smothered.  小孩子不应该被单独留在车中，因为他们很容易因而被困并且窒息死亡。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asphyxiate, choke, smother, stifle, strangle, suffocate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">抑制（表达、说出），压制：</font>to refrain from openly showing or uttering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He quickly smothered his inappropriate laughter at the funeral ceremony. 他很快就控制住了自己在葬礼上不适当的笑声。‖Management smothered the true facts of the case. 管理层隐瞒了案件的真相。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bridle, check, choke, control, curb, muffle, quash, quell, repress, squelch, suppress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unleash, vent （感情的）爆发，宣泄；express 表达</div>
<h2>smug[sound:smug.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">自大的，自鸣得意的：</font>having too high an opinion of oneself</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The winner was so smug that he lost the support of the crowd. 胜利者过于自大，以至于失去了群众的支持。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]complacent, egoistic, overweening, pompous, proud, self-satisfied, vain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]egoless, humble, modest 谦逊的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">整洁的，有序的：</font>being clean and in good order</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The suburb's smug lawns and tree-lined streets bespeak a comfortable affluence.  郊区整齐有序的草坪和种满树木的街道，代表着其间的舒适和财富。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dapper, kempt, orderly, shipshape, spruce, tidy, trim, uncluttered, well-groomed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disheveled, disordered, messy, slovenly, unkempt, untidy 邋遢的，混乱的</div>
<h2>smuggling[sound:smuggling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">走私，私运：</font>secret importation or exportation contrary to the law and especially without payingduties imposed by law</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was arrested for smuggling drugs into the country. 他因为向境内走私毒品而被逮捕。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bootlegging, contraband</div>
<h2>snare[sound:snare.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">无法逃脱的困境：</font>something that catches and holds</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Someday you'll find that your lies are a snare from which you can't escape. 总有一天你会发现，你所说过的谎话都会变成你无法逃脱的困境。‖caught in the snare of drug addiction 处于吸毒上瘾的困境之中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]entanglement, mesh, morass, net, noose, quagmire, quicksand, toil, trap</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">捕捉：</font>to capture by or as if by use of a snare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They snared a rabbit earlier in the day. 今天的早些时候他们捕获了一只兔子。‖The  car  salesmansuccessfully snared three potential customers. 汽车销售员成功地让三个潜在的客户上钩了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catch, enmesh, ensnare, ensnarl, entrap, tangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disentangle 解开；free, liberate 释放</div>
<h2>snarl[sound:snarl.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">纠缠，纠结：</font>to twist together into a usually confused mass</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You'll be awfully sorry if you snarl your fishing line.  要是你把渔网给缠在一起，你肯定会非常后悔的。‖The new regulation has succeeded in nothing but snarling up rush-hour traffic throughout the city. 新的政策只将全城高峰时期的交通变得更为复杂难解。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]entangle, ensnarl, interlace, intertwine, intertwist, interweave, knot, ravel, tangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disentangle, extricate, unravel, unsnarl, untwine, untwist 解开</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">咆哮，怒吼：</font>to give vent to anger in surly language</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She snarled at me after I kept badgering her with questions. 在我不断用问题骚扰她之后，她终于忍不住爆发了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bark, fulminate, rant, roar, scream, shout, storm, vent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm  冷静下来</div>
<h2>sneer[sound:sneer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（轻蔑地）嘲笑：</font>to speak in a scornful, contemptuous, or derisive manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They would invariably sneer every time they passed the hapless nerds. 每次经过那个不幸的书呆子身边时，他们总是会报以不变的嘲笑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deride, gibe, laugh, jeer, jibe,  mock, ridicule</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]esteem, honor, respect, revere, venerate  尊敬</div>
<h2>snobbish[sound:snobbish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">谄上傲下的，自大的：</font>being or characteristic of a person who has an offensive air of superiorityand tends to ignore or disdain anyone regarded as inferior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I expected her to be snobbish but she was warm and friendly. 我本以为她会是个自大的人，结果她非常热心和友好。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aristocratic, bumptious, elitist, haughty, imperious, persnickety, pompous, presumptuous, supercilious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]egoless, humble, modest 谦逊的，不自大的</div>
<h2>snub[sound:snub.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">轻视，不理睬：</font>to treat with contempt or neglect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The snob in town always snubbed anyone she thought was beneath her.  镇上那个自命不凡的人总是对那些她认为不如她的人不屑一顾。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contemn, disdain, disrespect, slight, look down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]esteem, honor, respect, revere, venerate  尊敬</div>
<h2>soak[sound:soak.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使…湿透：</font>to make thoroughly wet or saturated by or as if by placing in liquid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That downpour soaked my hair, and now I look like a sight.  那场大雨把我的头发淋湿了，所以我现在看起来格外滑稽。‖We ran for home as soon as the rain started, but our clothes still ended up soaked.  我们一发觉下雨就开始往家里跑，但我们的衣服还是湿透了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]douse, drench, drown, impregnate, macerate, saturate, sodden, sop, souse, steep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dehydrate, dry, desiccate 脱水；parch, sear, scorch  烤干，烧焦；wring 拧干</div>
<h2>sober[sound:sober.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严肃的：</font>marked by seriousness, gravity, or solemnity of conduct or character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She made a sober reply to what was only a teasing comment. 她很严肃地回复了那个恶搞的评论。‖Illness is a sober reminder of our mortality. 疾病是死亡给我们发出的严肃警告。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]earnest, grave, humorless, sedate, severe, sober, solemn, staid, weighty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]facetious, flip, flippant, humorous, jesting, jocular, joking, playful  轻佻的，幽默有趣的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">节制的：</font>given to or marked by restraint in the satisfaction of one's appetites</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]decided to live a sober life after bankruptcy 破产以后决定过有节制的生活</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstentious, abstinent, continent, self-denying, temperate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hedonistic, licentious, self-indulgent, sensual, sybaritic, voluptuary 纵欲的，享乐主义的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有理有据的：</font>based on sound reasoning or information</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sober assessment of the situation 关于局势有理有据的分析</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]firm, informed, justified, levelheaded, logical, rational, reasonable, sensible, solid, valid, well-founded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]groundless, illogical, invalid, unfounded, uninformed, unjustified, unreasonable, unsound 没有道理的</div>
<h2>sodden[sound:sodden.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">湿透的：</font>containing, covered with, or thoroughly penetrated by water</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We stripped off our sodden clothes and wrung them dry. 我们脱下湿透了的衣服并将它们拧干。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]awash, bathed, doused, drenched, logged, saturated, soaked, watered, waterlogged</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arid, dry 干燥的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使…湿透：</font>to wet thoroughly with liquid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Soldiers' boots were soddened by endless hours in muddy trenches. 长时间身处泥泞的战壕使得士兵的靴子湿透了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]douse, drench, drown, impregnate, macerate, saturate, soak, sop, souse, steep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dehydrate, dry, desiccate 脱水；parch, sear, scorch  烤干，烧焦；wring 拧干</div>
<h2>solace[sound:solace.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">安慰：</font>comfort in sorrow, misfortune, or distress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The kind words brought a little solace to the grieving widow. 这些同情的话语给痛苦的寡妇带来了些许安慰。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consolation, relief</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">安慰，安抚：</font>to comfort, cheer, or console, as in trouble or sorrow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I did their my to solace those bereaved children. 我尽力去安抚那些失去双亲的孩子们。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheer, comfort, console, soothe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agonize, distress, harrow, torment, torture, trouble  使痛苦，折磨</div>
<h2>solder[sound:solder.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">连接，联合：</font>to join or unite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Wires are soldered onto the circuit board. 电线被焊接在电路板上。‖The agreement soldered the factionsinto an alliance. 两个派系因这份协议而结成同盟。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]associate, coalesce, combine, conjoin, conjugate, connect, couple, fuse, interfuse, join, link, marry, unify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disassociate, disconnect, disjoin, divide, sever, split, sunder 分开</div>
<h2>solemnity[sound:solemnity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">严肃：</font>the quality or condition of being solemn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Solemnity is a trick of the body to hide the fault of the mind. 一本正经的态度，是肉体为了掩饰精神上的缺陷而耍的花招。‖The coronation ceremony requires absolute solemnity.加冕典礼需要绝对的庄严肃穆。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]earnest, graveness, gravity, intentness, seriousness, sobriety, solemnness, staidness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]facetiousness, flightiness, flippancy, frivolity, frivolousness, levity, lightheartedness, play 轻挑，欢快</div>
<h2>solicitous[sound:solicitous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">为他人操心的，体谅他人的：</font>given  to  or  made  with  heedful  anticipation  of  the  needs  andhappiness of others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The solicitous husband had already cleaned the house and cooked dinner by the time his wife returnedhome from work.  这个十分体谅妻子的好丈夫在他妻子回家之前就把家里清理干净，还把晚餐都做好了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attentive, considerate, kind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heedless, inconsiderate, thoughtless, unthinking 不关心的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迫切的，渴望的：</font>showing urgent desire or interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The family  is solicitous to put this whole unfortunate affair behind them and to move on with their lives.这个家庭迫切希望能忘记那些不幸的事情，开始崭新的生活。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agog, anxious, ardent, avid, desirous, eager, enthusiastic, greedy, hungry, keen, thirsty, voracious, wild</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathetic, indifferent, uneager, unenthusiastic 无所谓的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]solicitude n. 关切，挂念</div>
<h2>solid[sound:solid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固态的，坚固的：</font>having a consistency that does not easily yield to pressure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The ice cream is too solid to scoop right now.  冰淇淋现在太硬了，根本舀不动。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compact, hard, rigid, stiff, unyielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flabby, soft, spongy, squashy, squishy 柔软的，容易挤压的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有理有据的：</font>based on sound reasoning or information</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the only solid conclusion that the jury could have reached 陪审团唯一可能做出的合理结论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]firm, informed, justified, levelheaded, logical, rational, reasonable, sensible, sober, valid, well-founded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]groundless, illogical, invalid, unfounded, uninformed, unjustified, unreasonable, unsound 没有道理的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">坚定的，不迟疑的：</font>not showing weakness or uncertainty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some people see a solid handshake as a sign of strong character. 有人认为握手毫不迟疑的人有着很强势的性格。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forceful, hearty, iron, lusty, robust, stout, strong, sturdy, vigorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]uncertain, weak 迟疑的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]solidify    vt. 使固化</div>
<h2>soliloquy[sound:soliloquy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（尤指自言自语的）独白：</font>a dramatic or literary form of discourse in which a character talks to himselfor herself or reveals his or her thoughts without addressing a listener</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A soliloquy always reveals the character’s thoughts and feeling.  一段独白经常反映出人物的思想和感情。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]monologue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]chorus, ensemble  合唱</div>
<h2>solitude[sound:solitude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">孤独，避世：</font>the quality or state of being alone or remote from society</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He sought the kind of solitude where his thoughts would be his only companions. 他在寻找一种孤独感，只有他的思想陪伴着他。‖She wished to work on her novel in solitude.  她想一个人安静地完成小说。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aloneness, insulation, privacy, seclusion, segregation, separateness, sequestration, solitariness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]camaraderie, companionship, company, comradeship, fellowship, society 陪伴</div>
<h2>solvent[sound:solvent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有偿付能力的：</font>able to pay all legal debts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They're going to have to prove that the company is now solvent. 接下来他们必须要证明公司的偿贷能力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bankrupt 破产的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">溶剂：</font>a substance in which another substance is dissolved, forming a solution</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some organic solvents, such as benzene, pyridine, furan, are poisonous to human’s reproductive system.一些有机溶剂（比如苯、吡啶、呋喃）对人体的生殖系统有毒性。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]solute 溶质</div>
<h2>somatic[sound:somatic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">肉体的：</font>of the body, especially as distinguished from a body part, the mind, or the environment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a somatic disorder that was once thought to be “all in the patient’s head” 曾被认为“全是病人头脑中的问题”的生理机能紊乱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animal, bodily, carnal, corporal, corporeal, fleshly, material, physical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mental, spiritual 精神上的；nonmaterial, nonphysical 非肉体的</div>
<h2>somber[sound:somber.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">昏暗的，无光的：</font>so shaded as to be dark and gloomy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The prison's somber interrogation room has the desired effect of striking fear and despair into the prisoner.牢房中阴暗的问讯间有着能让囚犯感到恐惧和绝望的效果。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]black, caliginous, dark, dim, gloomy, lightless, murky, obscure, pitch-dark, rayless, stygian</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bright, brilliant, illuminated, lit, lightsome, lucent, lucid, luminous  光亮的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">悲伤的，不愉快的：</font>causing or marked by an atmosphere lacking in cheer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her death put us in a somber mood.  她的死让我们陷入了悲伤沮丧的情绪之中。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]depressing, dire, dismal, funereal, lugubrious, melancholy, miserable, morbid, morose, saturnine, sullen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cheerful, delighted, festive, gay, jocund, jovia l  快乐的</div>
<h2>somnolence[sound:somnolence.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">瞌睡，嗜睡：</font>the quality or state of desiring or needing sleep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Somnolence is likely to be the most typical reaction to this novel. 读这部小说最典型的感受就是想睡觉。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doziness, drowsiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insomnia, sleeplessness, wakefulness 失眠</div>
<h2>sonnet[sound:sonnet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">十四行诗：</font>a 14-line verse form usually having one of several conventional rhyme schemes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sonnet that celebrates love 一首歌颂爱情的十四行诗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doggerel  幽默不正式的诗，打油诗</div>
<h2>soothe[sound:soothe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">带来慰藉，安慰：</font>to bring comfort, solace, or reassurance to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There seemed to be no words sufficient to soothethe widow. 任何话语好像都不足以安慰这个寡妇。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheer, comfort, console, solace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agonize, distress, harrow, torment, torture, trouble  使痛苦，折磨</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使镇静，使安心：</font>to free from distress or disturbance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He took her in his arms and soothed her.  他把她抱在怀中以让她镇静下来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]becalm, compose, lull, lullaby, quiet, quieten, salve, settle, still, tranquilize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitate, discompose, disquiet, disturb, perturb, upset, vex 打扰，使不安</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">弱化，缓解：</font>to make more bearable or less severe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Hot tea with honey will soothe a sore throat. 加了蜂蜜的热茶可以缓解喉咙的酸痛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abate, allay, alleviate, assuage, ease, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soften</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggravate, exacerbate, intensify 恶化</div>
<h2>sop[sound:sop.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">安慰物：</font>something yielded to placate or soothe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to provide with the salary raise as a sop 提高工资作为安慰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balm, emollient, placebo,salve, unguent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]irritant, stimulant 刺激物</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">贿赂，回扣：</font>something given or promised in order to improperly influence a person's conductor decision</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As a sop to the teachers' union for supporting his reelection campaign, the mayor promised to push for the abolition of the residency requirement. 市长答应推动废除获得绿卡的限制条件，以此作为换取选举中教师联盟支持的条件。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backhander, boodle, cumshaw, fix</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">浸湿，湿透：</font>to wet thoroughly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My book fell in the swimming pool and was thoroughly sopped before I could fish it out. 我的书掉进了游泳池，在我把它捞出来之前已经彻底湿透了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]douse, drench, drown, impregnate, macerate, saturate, soak, sodden, souse, steep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dehydrate, dry, desiccate 脱水；parch, sear, scorch  烤干，烧焦；wring 拧干</div>
<h2>sophism[sound:sophism.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">假推理，诡辩：</font>deceptive or fallacious argumentation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Political selection is more dependent on sophism and less on economic literacy. 政治选举更多的是依靠诡辩，而非简练的文笔。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sophistry</div>
<h2>sophisticated[sound:sophisticated.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精明的，老于世故的：</font>having  acquired  worldly  knowledge  or  refinement;  lacking  naturalsimplicity or naiveté</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]On the train I met a surprisingly sophisticated and widely traveled child. 在火车上我见到了一个老练得让人惊讶的、见多识广的孩子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cosmopolitan, debonair, knowing, smart, suave, urbane, worldly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]guileless, ingenuous, innocent, naive 天真的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">复杂的：</font>very complex or complicated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a very sophisticated machine that is a marvel of modern design  一个十分复杂的机器，是现代设计的最高成就</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baroque, byzantine, complicated, convoluted, elaborate, intricate, involved, knotty, labyrinthine, tangled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plain, simple 简单的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sophistication n. 精明；复杂</div>
<h2>soporific[sound:soporific.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">安眠药：</font>a drug or other substance that induces sleep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Alcohol is a poor hypnotic because it disturbs sleep patterns, and so can worsen sleep disorders. 酒精是一种欠佳的安眠药，因为它会干扰睡眠的固定模式，从而恶化睡眠紊乱的情况。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hypnotic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stimulant  兴奋剂</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">催眠的：</font>causing or tending to cause sleep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This medication is soporific, so do not drive after taking it. 这种药物是催眠的，服用之后切忌开车。‖thesoporific heat of summer 夏日里催人欲睡的阳光</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]narcotic, opiate, slumberous, somniferous, somnolent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arousing, waking, invigorating, stimulating 刺激性的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">慵懒的，困倦的：</font>of, relating to, or marked by sleepiness or lethargy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A big lunch always makes me soporific in the afternoon. 中午一顿大餐总是让我下午感到困倦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dozy, drowsy, sleepy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]awake, conscious, wakeful 清醒的；alert 警醒的；sleepless, insomniac 无法入睡的</div>
<h2>sordid[sound:sordid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">肮脏的，不干净的：</font>not clean</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I will not let my children grow up in such a sordid environment. 我绝不会让我的孩子在这样一个肮脏的环境之中成长。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]besmirched, dirty, dusty, filthy, foul, grubby, muddy, nasty, smudged, soiled, stained, sullied, unclean</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clean, immaculate, spotless, stainless, unsoiled, unstained, unsullied 干净的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">卑鄙的：</font>marked by baseness or grossness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]Behind his generous donation were sordid motives. 在他慷慨捐资的背后有着卑鄙的动机。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]base, contemptible, despicable, detestable, dishonorable, execrable, ignominious, mean, vile, wretched</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]honorable, lofty, noble, straight, upright, venerable, virtuous 高尚的，值得尊敬的</div>
<h2>sound[sound:sound.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">牢固的，不可动摇的：</font>marked by the ability to withstand stress without structural damage ordistortion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The bridge is structurally sound.  这座大桥在结构上是稳固的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bombproof, fast, firm, stalwart, strong, sturdy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ramshackle 摇摇欲坠的；rickety, unstable, unsteady 不稳定的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">健康的，强壮的：</font>free from injury or disease: exhibiting normal health</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The horse is getting old, but still perfectly sound. 虽然在变老，但这匹马依然相当健康。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bouncing, fit, hale, healthy, hearty, robust, well, well-conditioned, wholesome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ailing, diseased, ill, sick 生病的；decrepit, enfeebled, feeble, infirm 虚弱的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（逻辑上）严谨的：</font>based on valid reasoning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Sound reasoning alone should tell you that the result is invalid. 从纯粹严谨的逻辑演绎出发，这个结论是不正确的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]analytic, coherent, consequent, rational, reasonable, sensible, valid, well-founded, well-grounded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]illegitimate, illogical, incoherent, inconsequent, invalid, irrational, unreasonable, unsound, weak （逻辑上）站不住脚的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]soundness n. （逻辑上的）无疵</div>
<h2>sparse[sound:sparse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">稀疏的，稀少的：</font>less plentiful than what is normal, necessary, or desirable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Many slopes are rock fields with sparse vegetation. 许多山坡都是不长植物的石坡。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exiguous, meager, niggardly, poor, scant, scanty, scarce, skimpy, slender, slim, sparing, stingy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abundant, ample, bountiful, copious, generous, liberal, plenteous, plentiful 大量的，丰富的</div>
<h2>spartan[sound:spartan.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">简朴的，节约的：</font>marked by simplicity, frugality, or avoidance of luxury and comfort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Accommodations on the windjammer are spartan but clean and comfortable nevertheless. 帆船上的装饰十分朴素，但还是很干净和舒适。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]austere, plain, simple, stark</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deluxe, luxurious, plush 奢华的</div>
<h2>spat[sound:spat.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（小的）争吵：</font>a brief petty quarrel or angry outburst</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Like any couple, they have their spats. 像其他夫妻一样，他们也会有争执。‖They were typical sisters,spatting one minute, playing together the next. 她们是典型的姐妹：上一分钟还在吵架，下一分钟又玩在一起了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]altercation, controversy, disagreement, dispute, imbroglio, quarrel, squabble, tiff, wrangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amity, concord, harmony, rapport, rapprochement 和睦，友好</div>
<h2>spate[sound:spate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">突发的洪水：</font>sudden flood</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bath, deluge, flood, inundation, overflow, torrent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]drought 干旱</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大量：</font>a large number or amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a spate of books about GRE 很多关于GRE 的书</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundance,bundle, dozen, multiplicity, myriad, plentitude, profusion, scad, shipload, slew, volume, wealth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ace, bit, driblet, glimmer, handful, hint, mite, mouthful, nip, ounce, pittance, sprinkle, trace 少量</div>
<h2>specific[sound:specific.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">特有的，独特的：</font>of a particular or exact sort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We need a specific type of pen to sign the diplomas. 我们需要一种特制的笔来签署学位证书。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]concrete, distinct, especial, peculiar, precise, special, unique</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]general, generic, universal 普遍的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">明确的：</font>so clearly expressed as to leave no doubt about the meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]specific instructions regarding the interrogation of prisoners 有关如何审问犯人的明确指示</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clear, definite, definitive, explicit, express, unambiguous, unequivocal, univocal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ambiguous, equivocal, implicit, indefinite, inexplicit, unspecific, vague 模糊的</div>
<h2>specious[sound:specious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">似是而非的，欺骗性的：</font>having a false look of truth or genuineness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a specious argument that really does not stand up under close examination 一段经不起仔细推敲的论证</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beguiling, deceitful, deceiving, deluding, delusive, delusory, fallacious, false, misleading</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aboveboard, forthright, straightforward 明确的</div>
<h2>speck[sound:speck.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">小点，少量：</font>a very small amount: bit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She writes without even a speck of humor. 她字里行间一点幽默感也没有。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ace, bit, driblet, glimmer, handful, hint, mite, mouthful, nip, ounce, pittance, sprinkle, trace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundance,bundle, dozen, multiplicity, myriad, plentitude, profusion, scad, shipload, slew, volume, wealth大量</div>
<h2>spectator[sound:spectator.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">观众，目击者，旁观者：</font>one who looks on or watches</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]join the organization as temporary spectator 作为短期观察员加入该组织‖The  accident  attracted  alarge crowd of spectators.  事故引来了大量的围观群众。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bystander, observer, onlooker, viewer, watcher</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]actor, performer, player 表演者</div>
<h2>spectrum[sound:spectrum.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">范围，系列：</font>a broad sequence or range of related qualities, ideas, or activities</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the whole spectrum of 20th-century thought 20 世纪所有不同的思潮 ‖A  political  spectrum is a way  of modeling different political positions by placing them upon one or more geometric axes symbolizing independent political dimensions. 所谓的政治光谱是一种将不同的政治立场可视化的模型，它通过一根或者多根几何坐标轴来定位不同的政治态度。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diapason, gamut, scale, spread, stretch</div>
<h2>speculate[sound:speculate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">推测，揣测：</font>to take to be true on the basis of insufficient evidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I speculate that someone has been using this cabin as a trysting place. 我猜测有情侣把这个小屋当做他们幽会的地方。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assume, conjecture, daresay, imagine, presume, speculate, suppose, surmise, suspect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]prove, substantiate, validate 证明</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">投机倒卖：</font>to buy or sell in expectation of profiting from market fluctuations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]speculating on the oil market 在石油市场上投机倒卖</div>
<h2>spendthrift[sound:spendthrift.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">挥霍者，败家子：</font>a person who spends improvidently or wastefully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The spendthrift managed to blow all of his inheritance in a single year. 这个败家子只用了一年就把自己继承的遗产挥霍一空。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fritterer, profligate, spender, squanderer, waster, wastrel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]economizer, penny-pincher  节约的人；hoarder, miser, niggard 吝啬鬼</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">挥霍的，不节俭的：</font>given to spending money freely or foolishly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Spendthrift consumers amassed a mountain of debt on their credit cards. 那些爱挥霍财富的消费者们在他们的信用卡上累积了一大笔债务。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extravagant, improvident, squandering, thriftless, unthrifty, wasteful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conserving, economical, frugal, penny-pinching, provident, scrimping, skimping, thrifty  节俭的</div>
<h2>spent[sound:spent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精疲力竭的：</font>drained of energy or effectiveness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After all that exertion, we were completely spent. 在完成所有的锻炼之后我们已是筋疲力尽。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beaten, bleary, done, drained, enervate, exhausted, fatigued, jaded, prostrate, tired, wearied, worn-out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]active, energetic, invigorated, peppy, strengthened, strong, tireless, vitalized, weariless 充满活力的</div>
<h2>spindly[sound:spindly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">细长纤弱的：</font>frail or flimsy in appearance or structure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I prefer having rather spindly legs. 我更希望有一双细腿。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gangling, gangly, lanky, spindling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]squat 矮胖的</div>
<h2>spiny[sound:spiny.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多刺的：</font>bearingspines, prickles, or thorns</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]low spiny bushes of sage 低矮多刺的长满鼠尾草的灌木丛</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brambly, prickly, thorny</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]even, flat, plane, smooth 平滑的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">棘手的，麻烦的：</font>requiring exceptional skill or caution in performance or handling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This promises to be a spiny problem to negotiate.  这有可能成为谈判过程中棘手的问题。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catchy, delicate, difficult, knotty, problematic, sensitive, sticky, ticklish, thorny, tough, troublesome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easy, effortless, manageable, painless, simple, straightforward, uncomplicated, undemanding 简单的</div>
<h2>spleen[sound:spleen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">怒气，怨恨：</font>feelings of anger or ill will often suppressed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She vented her spleen on her boyfriend and felt much better for having done so. 在她把怒气一股脑地倾泻到她男朋友身上之后，她感觉好多了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]angriness, choler, furor, fury, indignation, ire, madness, outrage, rage, wrath</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delight, pleasure 高兴，愉悦</div>
<h2>splice[sound:splice.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">接合，叠接：</font>to unite (as two ropes) by interweaving the strands, or to join (as two pieces of film)at the ends</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He taught me to edit and splice film.  他教会我如何剪辑和叠合胶卷。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]associate, coalesce, combine, conjoin, conjugate, connect, couple, fuse, interfuse, join, link, marry, unify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disassociate, disconnect, disjoin, divide, sever, split, sunder 分开</div>
<h2>spontaneous[sound:spontaneous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">自发的，不经思索的：</font>acting or activated without apparent thought or deliberation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Hugging a crying child is simply a spontaneous reaction. 去抱一个哭泣的小孩是很自然而然的反应。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]automatic, impulsive, instinctive, involuntary, mechanical, natural</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calculated, deliberate, intentional, planned, predetermined, premeditated, studied  有计划的，蓄意的</div>
<h2>spoof[sound:spoof.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">轻松幽默的模仿，小恶搞：</font>a work that imitates and exaggerates another work for comic effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Many viewers thought that the spoof of a television newscast was the real thing. 许多观众认为这则新闻报道被恶搞之后的作品才是真实的东西。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burlesque, caricature, mimicking, parody, travesty</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">诱骗，诱使相信：</font>to cause to believe what is untrue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The public was spoofed by a supposedly plausible report of a UFO encounter.一个听起来真实的UFO 遭遇报告欺骗了大众。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beguile, cozen, delude, dupe, fool, hoax, misguide, misinform, mislead, trick</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disabuse, disenchant, disillusion, undeceive 使醒悟</div>
<h2>sporadic[sound:sporadic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">偶尔的，零星发生的：</font>not often occurring or repeated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]On the whole, situation has significantly improved with only sporadic disturbances. 总体而言，局势得到了明显的改善，现在只有偶尔发生的骚乱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]few, infrequent, occasional, odd, rare, scarce, seldom, uncommon</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]frequent, habitual, repeated 时常发生的</div>
<h2>sprawl[sound:sprawl.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">杂乱无序地发展：</font>to grow, develop, or spread irregularly and without apparent design or plan</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The city sprawls down the whole coast. 城市顺着整条海岸线蔓延。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ramble, scramble, straddle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sprawling adj. 蔓延的，不规则伸展的</div>
<h2>sprightly[sound:sprightly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">活泼的，充满活力的：</font>full of spirit and vitality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was deeply impressed by the sprightly Gypsy dance. 活力四射的吉普赛舞蹈给他留下了深刻印象。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]active, airy, animated, brisk, energetic, frisky, gay, jaunty, kinetic, mettlesome, racy, spirited, vital, vivacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dead, inactive, inanimate, lackadaisical, languid, languishing, leaden, lifeless, listless, spiritless, vapid 没精神的</div>
<h2>spur[sound:spur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激物：</font>something that arouses action or activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The threat of losing its only sports franchise was the spur the city council needed to finally do something about the rising crime rate. 有可能失去唯一的体育赛事举办权带来的威胁，成为了刺激市政府决定就攀升的犯罪率采取相关措施的因素。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boost, catalyst, impetus, incentive, incitement, instigation, momentum, motivation, provocation, stimulus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deterrent, disincentive 阻碍物</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">支撑物：</font>a structure that holds up or serves as a foundation for something else</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a weak wall that might need a spur 一面或许需要支撑的墙</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brace, buttress, mount, prop, reinforcement, shore, underpinning</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激，激励：</font>to incite or stimulate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Appreciation spurred his ambition. 赞扬激起了他的雄心壮志。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arouse, excite, exhort, goad, instigate, prod, stir, urge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bridle, check, constrain, curb, deter, fetter, hamper, inhibit, manacle, shackle 制止，阻碍</div>
<h2>spurious[sound:spurious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">假的，伪造的：</font>lacking authenticity or validity in essence or origin; not genuine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In statistics, a spurious relationship is a mathematical relationship in which two events or variables have no direct causal connection, but it may be wrongly inferred that they do, due to either coincidence or the presence of a certain third, unseen factor. 在统计学中，“伪相关关系”是两个不存在因果关联的事件或变量，因为巧合或是不可见的第三方因素，而被误判为存在因果联系的关系。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apocryphal, bogus, counterfeit, fake, forged, phony, sham</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]authentic, bona fide, genuine, real 真实的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]spuriously adv. 伪造地，虚假地</div>
<h2>spurn[sound:spurn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">摈弃，拒绝：</font>to reject with disdain or contempt</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]spurned his recommendation 拒绝了他的推荐‖Fiercely  independent,  the  elderly  couple  spurned  alloffers of financial help. 这对老夫妻极其独立，回绝了所有经济上援助。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decline, disapprove, negative, refuse, reject, reprobate, repudiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accede, accept, agree, approve, assent, consent, embrace  同意，接受</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]spurned adj. 被摒弃的，被拒绝的</div>
<h2>squabble[sound:squabble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">口角，小争吵：</font>a noisy quarrel, usually about a trivial matter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a brief squabble over what to do next 关于接下来该做什么的争吵</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]altercation, argument, controversy, disagreement, dispute, imbroglio, quarrel, riff, spat, skirmish, wrangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]harmony  和谐</div>
<h2>squalid[sound:squalid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">污秽的，肮脏的：</font>dirty and wretched</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The migrants have been living in squalid conditions. 移民们一直居住在肮脏的条件下。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]black, dirty, filthy, foul, impure, nasty, slipshod, slovenly, unclean</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clean, immaculate, spotless, unsoiled, unsullied 干净的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">道德败坏的：</font>morally repulsive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the squalid atmosphere of intrigue and betrayal 充满了阴谋与背叛的不正之风</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]base, despicable, ignoble, scurvy, sordid, vile, wretched</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]moral, noble 品格高尚的</div>
<h2>squall[sound:squall.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（通常伴随着雨或雪的）风暴，暴风雪：</font>a brief, sudden, violent windstorm, often accompaniedby rain or snow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A snow squall is expected tonight. 今晚预计有暴风雪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blizzard, hailstorm, snowstorm, tempest</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">尖叫：</font>to scream or cry loudly and harshly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The baby squalled in pain. 婴儿因为疼痛而大叫。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cry, howl, screech, shout, shriek, shrill, squeal, thunder, yelp, yell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]murmur, mutter, whisper 低声细语</div>
<h2>squander[sound:squander.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使分散：</font>to cause (members of a group) to move widely apart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A single blast of the shotgun squandered the herd of deer. 猎枪的一声枪响让鹿群四处逃窜。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disband, dispel, disperse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assemble, cluster, collect, concentrate, congregate, gather, ingather  使聚集，使集中</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">浪费：</font>to spend wastefully or extravagantly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He squandered his inheritance on women and gambling. 他把他继承的遗产浪费在女人和赌博上。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blow, dissipate, fritter, lavish, misspend, waste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conserve, husband 节约，节俭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]squandering adj. 浪费的</div>
<h2>squat[sound:squat.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">又矮又胖的：</font>being compact and broad in build and often short in stature</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a squat but adroit craftsman 一个又胖又矮，但是手艺灵巧的工匠</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chunky, dumpy, heavyset, squatty, stocky, stout, stubby, stumpy, thickset</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gangling, lanky 瘦高的</div>
<h2>squint[sound:squint.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">斜视，睥睨：</font>to look or glance sideways</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The driver squinted as the sun hit his windshield. 阳光使得驾驶员不得不把眼睛偏向一边</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]leer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gaze, goggle 直视</div>
<h2>squelch[sound:squelch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">压制，镇压（运动）：</font>to put a stop to (something) by the use of force</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The authority tried to squelch the workers’ protest.  政府试图镇压工人的游行。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crush, muffle, quell, repress, squash, subdue, suppress, crack down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abet, aid, assist, back, help, support, prop up  支持，帮助</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">击溃，使无言以对：</font>to put down or silence, as with a crushing retort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His irritated glare squelched any other potential objectors. 他怒目而视，使得其他的反对者都不敢说话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dumb, extinguish, mute, quiet, settle, still, shut up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]foment, incite, instigate, provoke, stir 激发，激起</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]squelcher n. 镇压者</div>
<h2>stabilize[sound:stabilize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt./vi. 使稳定；变得稳定：to make stable, steadfast, or firm; to become stable, steadfast, or fixed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a policy that intended to stabilize the situation in Iraq 一项旨在维护伊拉克局势稳定的政策 ‖Thecountry's population has stabilized at 3.2 million. 这个国家的人口维持在三百二十万。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ballast, poise, steady</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]destabilize 使不稳定；overthrow, overturn, subvert  推翻，颠覆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]stability n. 稳定性</div>
<h2>stalwart[sound:stalwart.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无所畏惧的：</font>feeling or displaying no fear by temperament</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the stalwart soldiers in the army of Alexander the Great, who willingly followed him to the ends of theknown world  亚历山大大帝军队中无所畏惧的士兵们，他们愿意跟随亚历山大奔赴世界的尽头</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bold, courageous, dauntless, fearless, gallant, intrepid, manful, stout, stouthearted, valiant, valorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cowardly, craven, fearful, gutless, nerveless, pusillanimous, spineless, spiritless, timorous 怯懦的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（体魄等）强健的：</font>marked by outstanding strength and vigor of body, mind, or spirit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a stalwart supporter of the UN 联合国的坚定支持者‖a lithe yet stalwart athlete 瘦小但结实的运动员</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brawny, firm, muscular, rugged, sinewy, sound, stout, strong, sturdy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delicate, feeble, frail, weak, wimpy 脆弱的</div>
<h2>stamina[sound:stamina.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">耐力：</font>physical or moral strength to resist or withstand illness, fatigue, or hardship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A marathon challenges a runner's stamina. 马拉松挑战参赛者的耐力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]endurance, tolerance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]frailty 脆弱</div>
<h2>stammer[sound:stammer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">口吃，结巴：</font>to speak with involuntary pauses or repetitions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The frightened child started to stammer. 受惊吓的小孩开始结巴地说话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]falter, stutter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]articulate  清楚地说</div>
<h2>startle[sound:startle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使吓一跳，使大吃一惊：</font>to frighten or surprise suddenly and usually not seriously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They were startled at the prohibitive price. 他们被高得离谱的价格吓到了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amaze, astonish, astound, dumbfound, rock, scare, shock, stun, stupefy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reassure  消除恐惧或疑虑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]startling adj. 惊人惊奇的</div>
<h2>static[sound:static.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">静态的，停滞的：</font>characterized by a lack of movement, animation, or progression</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Both your pictures are of static subjects. 你的两张照片都是静物。‖a static economy  停滞不前的经济</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inactive, fixed, immobile, immotile, immovable, inert, stable, stagnant, stationary, still</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]active, dynamic, lively, vibrant 充满活力的；mobile, movable 可移动的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无改变的：</font>showing little change</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a static population  没有变化的人口</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inflexible, invariable, rigid, stiff, steadfast</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]capricious, changeful, fluid, mercurial, temperamental, versatile, volatile 容易变化的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]stasis n. 静止不变</div>
<h2>stature[sound:stature.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">高度，身高：</font>natural height (as of a person) in an upright position</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a man of surprisingly great stature 拥有惊人身高的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]altitude, elevation, inches</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">才干，水平：</font>quality or status gained by growth, development, or achievement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This club has grown in stature over the last 20 years. 二十年间这家俱乐部的水平得到了提升。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]merit, quality, value, virtue, worth</div>
<h2>steadfast[sound:steadfast.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">坚定的，忠诚的：</font>firm in belief, determination, or adherence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her comrades remained steadfast despite brutal tortures. 尽管有残酷的折磨，她的同志们都保持了忠诚。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constant, dedicated, devoted, devout, loyal, pious, staunch, steady, true-blue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disloyal, perfidious, recreant, traitorous, treacherous, unfaithful 不忠的</div>
<h2>stealth[sound:stealth.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">秘密行动：</font>the act or action of proceeding furtively, secretly, or imperceptibly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Both sides advanced by stealth.  双方都隐秘地行军。</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">秘密的：</font>intended not to attract attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The SWAT team carried out a stealth raid on the house, which was believed to be harboring a terrorist cell.特警们对这间被认为是恐怖分子老巢的房屋进行了秘密的突袭。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backstairs, clandestine, covert, furtive, private, sneak, stealthy, surreptitious, undercover, underground</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]open, overt, public  公开的，光明正大的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]stealthy adj. 秘密的，隐秘的</div>
<h2>steep[sound:steep.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">浸泡：</font>to make thoroughly wet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]steep the tea for five minutes 浸泡茶叶五分钟</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drench, drown, impregnate, macerate, saturate, sodden, sop, souse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]desiccate, dry, parch, sear 烘烤，烤干；wring 拧干</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">陡峭的：</font>having an incline approaching the perpendicular</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a very steep rock face that is nearly impossible to climb 一面非常陡峭以至于不可能攀爬的岩石</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrupt, precipitate, sheer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gradual 逐渐变化的；flat  平坦的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过分的，过高的：</font>going beyond a normal or acceptable limit in degree or amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We would like to hire him, but his salary demands are just too steep.  我们很想雇用他，可是他对于薪水的要求实在是太高了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exorbitant, extravagant, extreme, immoderate, inordinate, insane, lavish, overdue, overweening, plethoric,stiff</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]moderate, modest, reasonable, temperate 适度的</div>
<h2>stench[sound:stench.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">臭气，恶臭：</font>a strong, foul odor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We finally discovered the dead rat that was causing the stench in the living room. 我们终于发现是死老鼠带来了卧室里的恶臭。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fetor, funk, malodor, reek, stink</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aroma, fragrance, perfume, scent 香气</div>
<h2>stentorian[sound:stentorian.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">声音洪亮的：</font>extremely loud</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an tenor with a stentorian voice 拥有洪亮声音的男高音‖The professor's stentorian voice was enough tokeep even the drowsiest student awake. 教授洪亮的声音足以使最困的学生保持清醒。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blaring, blasting, clamorous, deafening, earsplitting, plangent, resounding, roaring, sonorous, thunderous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gentle, low, soft 声音轻柔的</div>
<h2>sterile[sound:sterile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贫瘠的：</font>not productive or effective</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a sterile land which used to be a forest 曾经是森林的一块贫瘠土地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]barren, effete, fruitless, impotent, infertile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]verdant （因长满植物而）青翠的；fat, fertile, fruitful  肥沃的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无菌的：</font>free from live bacteria or other microorganisms</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The hospitals in the war-torn city often lack necessary drugs and sterile surgical supplies. 在这个被战争所蹂躏的城市中的医院通常缺乏必需的药物和无菌的手术用品。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aseptic, germfree, hygienic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insanitary, unhygienic 不卫生的；contaminated, polluted 受污染的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sterilize    v. 消毒，杀菌</div>
<h2>stickler[sound:stickler.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">坚持细节的人，一丝不苟的人：</font>one who insists on exactness or completeness in the observanceof something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a stickler for perfection  完美主义者‖a stickler for neatness 有洁癖的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disciplinarian, pedant, purist, martinet</div>
<h2>stiff[sound:stiff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">僵硬的，无法弯曲的：</font>lacking in suppleness or flexibility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a stiff cardboard packing box 不易弯折的硬纸板盒‖When I got out of bed this morning my back wasstiff as a board. 今早起床时我的背和木板一样僵硬。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]immalleable, impliable, inflexible, petrified, rigid, unbending, unyielding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flexible, floppy, pliable, pliant, supple, yielding  柔软的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（在社交场合）缺乏优雅的，不自在的：</font>lacking social grace and assurance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She always felt stiff and ill-at-ease whenever she was introduced to her father's friends. 只要她被介绍给父亲的朋友，她就会感到不自在和浑身不舒服。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clumsy, gauche, graceless, inelegant, rustic, stilted, uncomfortable, uneasy, wooden</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]graceful, suave, urbane 风度翩翩的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过分的，过高的：</font>going beyond a normal or acceptable limit in degree or amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Don't you think that's a pretty stiff fine for such a minor infraction  你难道不觉得对于这么小的一个错误，罚款实在太高了么？</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exorbitant, extravagant, extreme, immoderate, inordinate, insane, lavish, overdue, overweening, plethoric,steep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]moderate, modest, reasonable, temperate 适度的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">艰苦的，费力的：</font>requiring considerable physical or mental effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We'll have a stiff climb to actually reach the summit. 我们还有一段艰苦的征途才能登顶。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arduous, challenging, difficult, formidable, grueling, laborious, strenuous, sweaty, testing, toilsome, tough</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]easy, effortless, facile, light, mindless, simple, soft, undemanding 容易的</div>
<h2>stifle[sound:stifle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">抑制（声音、呼吸等）：</font>to keep in or hold back</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to stifle free expression 限制言论自由</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choke, muffle, mute, repress, smother, strangle, suffocate, suppress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]foment, incite, instigate, provoke, stir 激发，激起</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]stifling adj. 抑制的</div>
<h2>stigma[sound:stigma.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">耻辱，污名：</font>a mark of shame or discredit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the stigma of cowardice 由懦弱而带来的污点‖There's a social stigma attached to receiving welfare.伴随着社会福利有一种社会耻辱感。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blemish, brand, onus, slur, smirch, smudge, spot, stain, taint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]award, credit, honor 荣誉；fame, glory, renown, repute 好名声</div>
<h2>stint[sound:stint.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">吝惜，节省：</font>to be sparing or frugal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They never stint with their praise. 他们从不吝啬他们的赞美之词。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]scrimp, skimp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blow, dissipate, fritter, lavish, misspend, squander, waste 浪费</div>
<h2>stingy[sound:stingy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">小气的，吝啬的：</font>being unwilling or showing unwillingness to share with others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]too stingy to tip the waiter 小气到不肯给小费</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]closefisted, mean, mingy, miserly, niggardly, parsimonious, penurious, sparing, stinting, tightfisted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bountiful, charitable, freehanded, generous, liberal, munificent, openhanded 慷慨的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极少量的：</font>less plentiful than what is normal, necessary, or desirable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Many people may consider this a rather stingy amount of food. 很多人都会认为这是分量比较少的食物。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exiguous, poor, scant, scanty, scarce, skimpy, sparse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abundant, ample, bounteous, copious, plenteous, plentiful 大量的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]stinginess n. 小气</div>
<h2>stipple[sound:stipple.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">点刻，用点标记：</font>to mark with small spots especially unevenly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They crossed a field stippled with purple lavender.  他们穿越了一片有紫色薰衣草点缀的田野。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blotch, dapple, dot, freckle, marble, mottle, speckle, splotch, sprinkle, spot</div>
<h2>stipulate[sound:stipulate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">规定，特定要求：</font>to specify or arrange in an agreement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Total disarmament was stipulated in the peace treaty. 和平协约中要求彻底解除武装。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]claim, designate, detail, particularize, qualify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]relinquish, surrender, yield, waive 放弃（权力等）</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]stipulation n. 规范，要求</div>
<h2>stitch[sound:stitch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">突然剧痛：</font>a sharp unpleasant sensation usually felt in some specific part of the body</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He had to drop out of the race when the stitch in his side became too painful.  因为他突然感到剧痛，所以不得不放弃比赛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ache, pang, prick, shoot, smart, sting, throe, tingle, twinge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comfort, ease, easiness 舒适的感觉</div>

<h2>stodgy[sound:stodgy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平庸的，乏味的：</font>dull, unimaginative, and commonplace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sitcom was offbeat and interesting in its first season, but has since become predictable and stodgy.这部情景喜剧在第一季是离奇而有趣的，但是近来变得老套和乏味。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arid, dreary, dull, flat, jading, jejune, monochromatic, monotonous, pedestrian, stale, tedious, wearisome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 吸引人的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非常守旧的：</font>extremely old-fashioned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Without notice she received a letter from his stodgy father. 她毫无征兆地收到了一封来自她保守父亲的信。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conservative, hidebound, intolerant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]avant-guard 先锋派的；radical 激进的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]stodginess n. 乏味，无趣</div>
