<h2>stray[sound:stray.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">漫无目的的：</font>lacking a definite plan, purpose, or pattern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]No stray sighting of UFO’s has been rigorously analyzed by scientists. 在无规律出现的 UFO 事件之中，尚未有被科学家严谨分析的案例。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aimless, arbitrary, desultory, erratic, haphazard, scattered, slapdash</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]methodical, orderly, organized, regular 有条理的，有组织的；systematic, systematized 系统性的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">离群，迷途，偏离：</font>to move away from a group, deviate from the correct course, or go beyondestablished limits</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to stray from the main road  偏离了主干道</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deviate, digress, err, wander</div>
<h2>strength[sound:strength.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">力量：</font>the ability to exert effort for the accomplishment of a task</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We are facing an army of great strength.  我们面对的是一支强大的军队。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]energy, force, might, potency, power, puissance, sinew, vigor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impotence, impotency, powerlessness, weakness 无力</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（抵抗攻击、压力的）强度：</font>the  ability  to  withstand  force  or  stress  without  being  distorted,dislodged, or damaged</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This cheap shelve unit doesn't have the strength to hold all those books.  这个廉价的书架不足以支撑所有的书本。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]firmness, soundness, sturdiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insecurity, instability, precariousness, shakiness, unstableness, unsteadiness  不稳固</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]strengthen    vt. 增强</div>

<h2>strike[sound:strike.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">攻击：</font>the act or action of setting upon with force or violence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The first strike was directed at a munitions warehouse.  第一轮攻击的目标是军火仓库。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggression, assault, charge, offense, onset, onslaught, raid, rush</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">铸造（奖牌）：</font>to form by stamping, printing, or punching</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]build, fabricate, forge, form, make, mold, shape</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">击打：</font>to aim and usually deliver a blow, stroke, or thrust (as with the hand, a weapon, or a tool)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]angrily stuck the security guard 愤怒地殴打保安</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bat, beat, hammer, hit, knock, nail, punch, swat</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">袭击，攻击：</font>to take sudden, violent action against</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A rattlesnake strikes its prey with lightning speed. 响尾蛇以惊人的速度攻击了它的猎物。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assail, beset, storm, set on</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法5】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">撞击：</font>to come into usually forceful contact with something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]One bullet-train struck the other one which had been forced to stop on a viaduct due to lightning strike,resulting in huge casualties. 一辆动车撞向了另一辆因雷击而停在高架桥上的动车，造成了巨大的人员伤亡。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bang, bash, bump, collide, crash, impact, impinge, ram, slam, smash, swipe, thud</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]striking adj. 引人注目的</div>
<h2>stringent[sound:stringent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">紧绷的：</font>tight, constricted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inflexible, rigid, taut</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lax, loose, slack 松弛的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严格的：</font>marked by rigor, strictness, or severity especially with regard to rule or standard</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Its drug-testing procedures are the most stringent in the world. 它的药检程序是世界上最严格的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]draconian, exacting, ironhanded, rigorous, severe, strict, uncompromising</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lenient 宽大的，仁慈的</div>
<h2>strip[sound:strip.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">脱衣，剥去：</font>to remove clothing, covering, or surface matter from</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Guards stripped and start to search the prisoners.  守卫剥光了犯人，开始搜身。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]denude, disrobe, doff, unclothe, undress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dress, gown, robe  穿衣；bedeck 穿衣打扮</div>
<h2>strut[sound:strut.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">趾高气扬地走：</font>to walk with a pompous and affected air</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A pompous general strutted off the parade ground. 盛气凌人的将军从阅兵场上趾高气扬的走过</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]parade, prance, stalk, swagger</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">支柱，压杆：</font>a structural element used to brace or strengthen a framework by resisting longitudinalcompression</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brace, buttress, column, girder, support, underpinning</div>
<h2>studio[sound:studio.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">工作室，画室，摄影室：</font>the working place of a painter, sculptor, or photographer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]moved to a larger studio 搬进了更大的工作室</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]workshop</div>
<h2>stultify[sound:stultify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使无效，抑制：</font>to  deprive  of  vitality  and  render  futile  especially  by  enfeebling  or  repressiveinfluences</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The accident stultified his previous efforts. 这场意外使他过去的努力都白费了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constipate, stagnate, stifle, trammel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]encourage, foster, nourish 鼓励，培养</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]stultifying adj. 抑制的</div>
<h2>stupor[sound:stupor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">迟钝，麻痹，无知觉：</font>a condition of greatly dulled or completely suspended sense or sensibility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lapsed into an alcoholic stupor 陷入了无知觉的酒醉状态</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coma, dullness, languor, lethargy, lassitude, listlessness, torpidity, torpor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alertness, vigilance 警惕，警戒；vigor, vim, vitality, vivacity 活力，精力</div>
<h2>stunt[sound:stunt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">阻碍（成长）：</font>to hinder the normal growth, development, or progress of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The inhospitable climate had stunted all vegetation. 不佳的气候条件抑制了所有植物的生长。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]check, curb, dwarf, suppress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advance, boost, foster, nourish, nurture, promote 培养，促进</div>
<h2>sturdy[sound:sturdy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">强健的，结实的：</font>marked by or reflecting physical strength or vigor; substantially made or built</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]sturdy young athletes 年轻有力的运动员‖Remember to wear sturdy boots because we will be goingover sharp rocks and uneven terrain. 别忘了穿一双靠谱的靴子，因为我们要在锋利的岩石和不平的地形上行走。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]durable, firm, robust, rugged, stalwart, stout, strong, sound, tough, vigorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delicate, feeble, frail, weak, wimpy 脆弱的；rickety, unsound, unstable, unsteady 不稳固的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sturdiness n. 强健</div>
<h2>stygian[sound:stygian.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极黑暗的：</font>extremely dark, gloomy, or forbidding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the stygian blackness of the cave 山洞里令人恐惧的黑暗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]black, caliginous, dark, dim, gloomy, pitch-black</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bright, brilliant, illuminated, illumined, light, lightsome, lucent, lucid, luminous 明亮的</div>

<h2>subject[sound:subject.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">臣民，受支配的人：</font>one that is placed under authority or control</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Because of the tense situation in that country, British subjects were advised to return home as soon aspossible. 因为该国紧张的局势，英国公民被建议尽快返回英国国内。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]citizen, national</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alien  外来人；potentate 统治者</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">取决于其他因素的：</font>contingent on or under the influence of some later action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The price of seafood is subject to weather conditions. 海鲜的价格受天气影响。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affected, conditional, contingent, dependent, reliant, subordinate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]independent, unconditional  独立的</div>
<h2>subjugate[sound:subjugate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">征服，镇压：</font>to bring under control and governance as a subject</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I would rather die than be subjugated. 我宁死也不愿臣服。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conquer, dominate, overpower, pacify, quash, squelch, subdue, vanquish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]capitulate, surrender 投降；lose 失败</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">剥夺自由：</font>to make subservient</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enfetter, enslave, enthrall</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discharge, emancipate, enfranchise, liberate, manumit, release, unfetter 解放，释放</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]subjugation n. 征服</div>
<h2>sublime[sound:sublime.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">崇高的，庄严的：</font>of high spiritual, moral, or intellectual worth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the sublime virtue of having given all one's worldly goods to the poor 将所有财产都捐给穷人的崇高美德</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chivalrous, elevated, gallant, greathearted, lofty, magnanimous, noble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]base, debased, degenerate, degraded, ignoble, low 可鄙的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（因为杰出、装光、美丽等而）令人惊叹的：</font>tending to inspire awe usually because of elevatedquality (as of beauty, nobility, or grandeur) or transcendent excellence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the sublime beauty of the canyon 峡谷令人惊叹的美丽</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amazing, astonishing,  astounding, awesome, fabulous, miraculous, portentous, prodigious, staggering,stunning, stupendous, wonderful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]common, ordinary  平常的，普通的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sublimity n. 庄严，壮观</div>
<h2>subliminal[sound:subliminal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">下意识的，潜在意识的：</font>below the threshold of conscious perception</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]subliminal advertising in movies  电影中的潜意识广告</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]concealed, hidden, subconscious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apparent, clear, evident, manifest, obvious, patent  明显的</div>
<h2>submerge[sound:submerge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使淹没：</font>to put under water</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The river burst its banks, submerging an entire village.  河水冲上了堤岸，淹没了整个村庄。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dip, douse, drench, drown, immerse, inundate, sop, submerse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]emerge 显现</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]submerged adj. 被淹没的</div>
<h2>submissive[sound:submissive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">服从的，顺从的，恭顺的：</font>submitting to others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]submissive employees  恭顺的员工‖It's not in her nature to be submissive. 服从不是她的本性。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amenable, biddable, compliant, conformable, docile, obeisant, obsequious, servile, subservient, tractable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contumacious, defiant, intractable, obstreperous, rebellious, recalcitrant, refractory, unruly 不顺从的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]submission n. 服从，顺从</div>
<h2>subordinate[sound:subordinate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">下级的，次要的：</font>belonging to a lower or inferior class or rank</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His contention is that environment plays a subordinate role to heredity in determining what we become.他的观点就是：在决定我们成长的因素——环境和遗传之中，前者处于更次要的地位。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inferior, junior, lower, minor, secondary, subject, tributary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]greater, higher, major, primary, prime, senior, superior 更优等的，更高等的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">征服：</font>to bring under one's control by force of arms</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It is one of the lessons of history that more powerful civilizations often subordinate weaker ones. 强大的文明往往征服弱势的文明，这是历史的教训之一。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conquer, dominate, overpower, pacify, subdue, subject, subjugate, vanquish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]capitulate, surrender 投降；lose 失败</div>
<h2>subservient[sound:subservient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">奉承的，屈从的：</font>obsequiously submissive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amenable, biddable, compliant, conformable, docile, obeisant, obsequious, servile, submissive, tractable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contumacious, defiant, intractable, obstreperous, rebellious, recalcitrant, refractory, unruly 不顺从的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]subservience n. 服从</div>
<h2>subside[sound:subside.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">下陷，下沉，减弱：</font>to tend downward</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Local officials say the flood waters have subsided.  当地官员表示洪水已经退去。‖As  the  noise  of  the siren subsided, I was able to fall back to sleep. 随着警笛声的减弱，我可以再次睡着了。‖The pain will subsidein a couple of hours. 几个小时之内疼痛感就会退去的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abate, decline, decrease, diminish, drop, dwindle, ebb, fall, lessen, moderate, recede, wane</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]balloon, burgeon, escalate, expand, grow, increase, intensify, rise, snowball, soar, wax  上升，增大</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]subsidence n. 下沉</div>
<h2>subsidiary[sound:subsidiary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">次要的：</font>of secondary importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The river has several subsidiary streams. 这条河拥有数条支流。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]minor, secondary, subordinate, tributary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]capital, cardinal, central, chief, key, leading, main, paramount, predominant, primary, principal, supreme主要的，重要的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">起辅助作用的：</font>furnishing aid or support</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Attached are subsidiary materials. 附件当中的是辅助资料。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accessory, auxiliary, contributory, supplemental, supporting, upholding</div>
<h2>subsidy[sound:subsidy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">补助金，津贴：</font>monetary assistance granted by a government to a person or group in support ofan enterprise regarded as being in the public interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a subsidy to manufacturers during the war 战争期间对制造商的补贴金</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allotment, allowance, appropriation, grant, subvention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]subsidize    vt. 提供补助</div>
<h2>substantial[sound:substantial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">物质的：</font>of, relating to, or having substance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a world of dreams, even less substantial than a rainbow 一个梦想中的世界，甚至比彩虹还虚无缥缈</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]corporeal, concrete, gross, material, objective, physical, tangible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]tenuous, vaporous 空洞的，空幻的；diaphanous, ethereal, immaterial 非物质的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有重大意义的：</font>considerable in importance, value, degree, amount, or extent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]made a substantial progress 取得了实质性的进展</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consequential, considerable, earthshaking, important, meaningful, momentous, significant, weighty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, little, minor, negligible, slight, trifling, trivial 微不足道的</div>
<h2>substantiate[sound:substantiate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">证实：</font>to support with proof or evidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There is little scientific evidence to substantiate the claims.  现在还缺乏足够的科学证据来证实这种言论。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attest, authenticate, confirm, corroborate, justify, validate, verify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]controvert, disprove, rebut, refute 反驳</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]substantiated adj. 经证实的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt  使实体化：to give material form to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The artist's intense feelings are substantiated by his paintings' bold colors and broad brush strokes. 画家强烈的情感通过他画作中鲜艳的色彩和很宽的笔画体现出来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]embody, epitomize, externalize, incarnate, incorporate, manifest, materialize, personalize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disembody 使脱离肉体</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]substantiated adj. 已证实的</div>
<h2>substantive[sound:substantive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">本质的，关键的：</font>of or relating to the essence or substance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The substantive information is their political stance. 关键的信息是他们的政治立场。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]constitutional, elemental, essential, fundamental, substantial, vital</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, insubstantial, negligible, nominal 不重要的</div>
<h2>subterfuge[sound:subterfuge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">狡计：</font>deception by artifice or stratagem in order to conceal, escape, or evade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The spy obtained the documents by subterfuge. 间谍通过狡猾的计谋获得了文件。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artifice, cheat, chicanery, deception, fraud, trickery, wile</div>
<h2>subtle[sound:subtle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">微妙的，难以感知的：</font>(so slight as to be)difficult to understand or perceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]subtle differences in meaning between the words 单词词义之间的细微差别</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delicate, elusive, evasive, faint, fine, impalpable, intangible, nice, slight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blatant, conspicuous, obvious, patent, plain 明显的；  open, public 公开的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">巧妙的，间接或带有欺骗性的：</font>clever  at attaining one's ends by indirect and often deceptivemeans</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]used subtle methods of persuasion 采用了十分巧妙的劝说方式</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beguiling, crafty, cunning, cute, designing, devious, foxy, guileful, scheming, shrewd, sly, tricky, wily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artless, guileless, ingenuous, innocent, undesigning 天真纯朴的，无伪装的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]subtlety n. 微妙；微妙的想法</div>
<h2>subvert[sound:subvert.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">颠覆：</font>to overturn or overthrow from the foundation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an alleged plot to subvert the state 一个谣传的旨在推翻政权的阴谋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]overthrow, overturn, topple</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reinforce  加强</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]subversion n. 颠覆</div>
<h2>succinct[sound:succinct.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">简明的，简洁的：</font>characterized by clear, precise expression in few words</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His speech is always succinct and perspicacious. 他的发言总是简洁而一针见血。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apothegmatic, brief, compact, compendious, concise, laconic, pithy, summary, telegraphic, terse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circuitous, circumlocutory, diffuse, long-, prolix, rambling, verbose, windy, wordy 冗长的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]succinctness n. 简洁，扼要</div>
<h2>succor[sound:succor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">救援，援助：</font>to go to the aid of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We see it as our duty to succor anyone in need. 我们视帮助他人为自己的职责</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aid, assist, help, relieve, support</div>
<h2>suffocate[sound:suffocate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使窒息：</font>to deprive of oxygen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The law requires the owner of a discarded refrigerator to remove its door so that a child won't get trappedinside and suffocate. 法律要求废弃冰箱的所有者移除箱门，从而防止儿童被困其中而窒息致死。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asphyxiate, choke, smother, stifle, strangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]suffocating adj. 令人窒息的，压抑的</div>
<h2>suffuse[sound:suffuse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（色彩等）弥漫，染遍，充满：</font>to spread through or over, as with liquid, color, or light</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a room suffused with warm sunlight 一个充满温暖阳光的房间</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flush, fill, imbue, infuse, interpenetrate, percolate, pervade, transfuse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]suffusing adj. 弥漫的</div>
<h2>sulk[sound:sulk.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">生气，愠怒：</font>to be sullenly aloof or withdrawn, as in silent resentment or protest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He would sulk for hours whenever he didn’t get what he want. 当他的愿望没被满足时，他会生几个小时的闷气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]frown, grump, mope, pout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crow, delight, exuberate, jubilate, rejoice, triumph 感到高兴，雀跃</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]sulky adj. 生气的，不悦的</div>
<h2>sullen[sound:sullen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">闷闷不乐的：</font>causing or marked by an atmosphere lacking in cheer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She remained sullen amid festivities alone. 她独自一人在喜庆的气氛中闷闷不乐。‖sullen  skies  thatmatched our mood on the day of the funeral  葬礼当天与我们很搭调的沉闷天气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bleak, cheerless, dark, depressing, dire, gloomy, glum, gray, lugubrious, morose, saturnine, sulky, surly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bright, cheerful, cheering, cordial, festive, gay  欢快的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lighthearted 高兴的</div>
<h2>summary[sound:summary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">摘要：</font>an abstract, abridgment, or compendium especially of a preceding discourse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Many book reports choose to begin with a summary of the book. 许多书评以该书的摘要开始。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstract, brief, epitome, outline, recapitulation, synopsis, summarization</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elaboration 详细解释</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">就地的，立即的：</font>done or executed on the spot and without formality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a summary trial and speedy execution 就地的判决和快速的处决</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drumhead</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]prolonged, protracted 拖延的</div>
<h2>summit[sound:summit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">顶点：</font>the highest point</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the summit of his ambition 他雄心壮志的顶点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acme, apex, climax, crescendo, crest, crown, culmination, meridian, peak, pinnacle, top, zenith</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bottom, nadir 最低点</div>
<h2>summon[sound:summon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">召集，召唤：</font>to call together</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The general summoned all his troops before the operation. 行动之前，将军把所有的部队召集到了一起。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assemble, convene, convoke, muster, rally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dismiss 解散</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">传唤（出庭、出席）：</font>to command by service of a summons, especially to appear in court</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]was summoned to answer charges 他被传唤出庭应对起诉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]call, hail</div>
<h2>sumptuous[sound:sumptuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">豪华的，奢侈的：</font>extremely costly, rich, luxurious, or magnificent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The hotel claims to offer sumptuous furnishings and exquisitely prepared cuisine. 酒店宣称有奢华的装潢和精心准备的食物。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deluxe, lavish, lush, luxurious, opulent, palatial, resplendent, splendid, superb</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ascetic, austere, humble, spartan 简朴的</div>
<h2>sunder[sound:sunder.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">分裂，分离：</font>to break apart or in two</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a city sundered by racial conflict  一个因种族冲突而分裂的城市</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disassociate, disconnect, disjoin, disunite, divide, part, rend, rive, separate, sever, unyoke</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bond, connect, join, link, unify, unite, yoke 连接，结合</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]asunder adv. 分开地，分裂地</div>
<h2>supercilious[sound:supercilious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">高傲的，傲慢的：</font>feeling or showing haughty disdain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The aristocrat reacted to their breach of etiquette with a supercilious smile. 贵族对破坏他们破坏礼节的行为报以傲慢的一笑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arrogant, assumptive, bumptious, haughty, imperious, pompous, presumptuous, overbearing, superior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]humble, moderate, modest  谦逊的</div>
<h2>superficial[sound:superficial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">表面的，肤浅的：</font>lacking in depth, solidity, and comprehensiveness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The official’s superficial report on the situation provoked wide blame on the Internet. 官员对于情况敷衍般的描述激起了网络上的广泛谴责。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cursory, facile, perfunctory, shallow, sketchy, skin-deep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]profound  深刻的；comprehensive, exhaustive 全面的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]superficiality n. 表面现象</div>
<h2>superfluous[sound:superfluous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多余的，过剩的：</font>exceeding what is sufficient or necessary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a complicated algorithm that could filter all superfluous information 一个能滤除所有的多余信息的复杂算法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excessive, extra, redundant, surplus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deficient, inadequate, insufficient, scanty, scarce, short, skimpy, sparse 不足的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]superfluity n. 多余，过剩</div>
<h2>superimpose[sound:superimpose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">添声加色，使形象、某因素或性质更加清楚：</font>to add as a distinct feature, element, or quality:</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]superimposed her own interpretation when she retold the story 她重复故事的时候，加入了自己的解释</div>
<h2>supine[sound:supine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">懒散的，懒得动的、倦怠的、消极的或漠不关心的：</font>showing lethargy, passivity, or blameworthyindifference</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a supine legislature that is afraid to take action 害怕采取行动的不作为的立法机关</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inert，  passive，  dormant，  torpid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vigilant 警惕的</div>
<h2>supple[sound:supple.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易弯曲的，柔软的：</font>readily bent; pliant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]supple limbs 柔软的四肢 || a supple mind 灵活的头脑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bendy, flexible, limber, lissome, lithe, pliable, pliant, lithesome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inflexible, stiff, rigid 坚硬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]suppleness n.柔软</div>
<h2>supplant[sound:supplant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">排挤，篡夺…的位置：</font>to usurp the place of, especially through intrigue or underhanded tactics</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Old traditions were fading away and being supplanted by modern ways.  老传统逐渐式微，被现代方式取代。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]displace, displant, substitute, supersede, cut out</div>
<h2>supplement[sound:supplement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v.增补，补充：something that serves to complete or make up for a deficiency in something else</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]recommends taking a vitamin C supplement to prevent colds 建议补充维生素C 来预防感冒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]addendum, addition, expansion, increment, proliferation, step-up</div>
<h2>supplicate[sound:supplicate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">恳求，乞求：</font>to make a request to (someone) in an earnest or urgent manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]God is not just someone to be supplicated in times of trouble. 我们不应该只在困难时候才向主祷告。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beseech, conjure, entreat, impetrate, implore, solicit, plead to, appeal to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demand 强求</div>
<h2>supposition[sound:supposition.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">猜想，推测：</font>an opinion or judgment based on little or no evidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It's pure supposition on your part that there's something illegal going on next door. 你说隔壁在进行非法勾当纯属猜测。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hypothesis, proposition, surmise,premise, presumption</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]certainty 确定</div>
<h2>suppress[sound:suppress.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">抑制 （表情）：</font>to inhibit the expression of (an impulse, for example); check</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]suppress a smile 忍住笑容</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]repress, smother, stifle, choke back, hold back</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stimulate 激励</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">用暴力终止，镇压：</font>to put a stop to (something) by the use of force</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Nothing could suppress the rising tide of protest. 暴力也难以控制越来越激烈的游行示威活动。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clamp down on, crack down on, put down, quash, repress, silence, slap down, snuff out, squash, squelch,subdue</div>
<h2>surcharge[sound:surcharge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v./n. 过高收费：to charge (someone) too much for goods or services</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The airline has added a $30 fuel surcharge on all international flights. 该航空公司对所有国际航线上涨了30 美元的燃油税。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gouge, soak, sting</div>
<h2>surfeit[sound:surfeit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v./n. 过量，饮食过度：to feed or supply to excess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He surfeited himself with chocolate. 他巧克力吃多了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]overabundance, overage, overflow, plethora, redundancy, superfluity, surplus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deficiency, deprivation, insufficient supply, famish, starve 短缺，匮乏</div>
<h2>surrender[sound:surrender.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">交出，放弃，投降：</font>to give (something) over to the control or possession of another usually underduress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]surrender a contractual right 放弃契约上规定的一项权利</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abnegate, cede, relinquish, renounce, resign</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appropriate 挪用，占为己有</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">沉溺于：</font>to give (oneself) over to something especially unrestrainedly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]surrendered himself to grief 沉湎于悲伤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deliver, give up, indulge, yield</div>
<h2>surreptitious[sound:surreptitious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">偷偷摸摸的，保密的：</font>undertaken or done so as to escape being observed or known by others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]took a surreptitious glance at her knees 偷偷瞟了一下她的膝盖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backstairs, clandestine, covert, furtive, privy, underground, underhanded, behind-the-scenes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]barefaced, aboveboard, open, overt, public 光明正大的</div>
<h2>susceptibility[sound:susceptibility.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">易受感染的性质或状态：</font>the quality or state of having little resistance to some outside agent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A weak immune system causes increased susceptibility to disease. 弱的免疫系统会增大患病的概率。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defenselessness, vulnerability, weakness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]immunity, invulnerability 免疫</div>
<h2>suspend[sound:suspend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">暂停，中止：</font>to bring to a formal close for a period of time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]suspended the trial 暂停审判</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]prorogue, recess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]invoke 实行</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">悬挂：</font>hang</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]suspended a banner proclaiming the town's “Heritage Days” from the archway在拱门上方悬挂了一条庆祝 “遗产日”的条幅</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]erect, let fall 使直立，落下</div>
<h2>suture[sound:suture.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 缝合：the process of joining two surfaces or edges together along a line by or as if by sewing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The doctor cleaned, sutured, and bandaged the wound. 医生将伤口清洗、缝合、包扎。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]incision, avulse 切开，撕脱</div>
<h2>svelte[sound:svelte.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（女人）体态苗条的，优雅的：</font>slender or graceful in figure or outline; slim.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The svelte dancer seemed to float across the stage. 苗条的舞者看起来就像在舞台上漂浮。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bony, lean, skinny, slender, slim</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plump, corpulent, paunchy and awkward  丰满的，大腹便便而笨拙的</div>
<h2>swagger[sound:swagger.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">大摇大摆地走，趾高气昂地走：</font>to  conduct  oneself  in  an  arrogant  or  superciliously  pompousmanner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The young man confidently swaggered across the room.  年轻人高傲地在房间里走来走去。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]prance, sashay, stalk</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">自夸，吹嘘：</font>boast, brag</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I would swagger if I'd won first place in the bowling tournament.  如果我赢了保龄球锦标赛我肯定会自夸。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brag, vapor, vaunt, gasconade</div>

<h2>sweltering[sound:sweltering.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">酷热的：</font>oppressively hot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The air conditioning was broken, and it was sweltering in the room. 空调坏了，房间里酷热难耐。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boiling, scorching, searing, sultry, torrid, fiery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]algid, arctic, bone-chilling, freezing, frigid, frozen, glacial, ice-cold, iced, icy 严寒的</div>

<h2>sybarite[sound:sybarite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">沉于奢侈逸乐者，酒色之徒：</font>a person devoted to pleasure and luxury; a voluptuary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The prince was remembered as a self-indulgent sybarite. 王子酒色之徒的名声远扬。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debauchee, decadent, hedonist, sensualist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]spartan, ascetic 禁欲者</div>
<h2>sycophant[sound:sycophant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">马屁精：</font>a servile self-seeking flatterer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]When her career was riding high, the self-deluded actress often mistook sycophants for true friends.  当她的事业如日中天之时，该演员总是把一些马屁精误以为是真朋友。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fawner, flunky , lickspittle, toady, apple-polisher, bootlicker, brownnoser</div>
<h2>syllabus[sound:syllabus.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">提纲，摘要：课文、演讲或研究课题的要点的概要或提纲：</font>an outline or a summary of the main pointsof a text, lecture, or course of study</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Have you got next year’s syllabus  你拿到明年的教学大纲了吗？</div>
<h2>syllogism[sound:syllogism.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">由一般到个别的推理；演绎：</font>reasoning from the general to the specific; deduction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The syllogism was at the core of traditional deductive reasoning, where facts are determined by combining existing  statements, in  contrast  to inductive  reasoning where  facts  are  determined  by  repeated  observations.从一般到个别的推理是传统演绎推理的核心由结合现存状态所确定，而归纳推理则由重复观测来确认。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]syllogize v. 用三段论论证</div>
<h2>symbiosis[sound:symbiosis.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">共生关系：</font>the living together in more or less intimate association or close union of two dissimilar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The bird lives in symbiosis with the hippopotamus. 这种鸟和河马是共生关系。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unrelated growth 无关联的生长</div>
<h2>symmetry[sound:symmetry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">对称：</font>balanced proportions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The building has perfect symmetry. 这栋房子是完美的对称构造。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balance, coherence, consonance, proportion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disproportion, asymmetry, discordance, disproportion, disunity, imbalance, incoherence, violence 不均衡，混乱</div>
<h2>synchronous[sound:synchronous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj  同时期的，同相的：having identical period and phase</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The synchronous arrival of a baby sister and loss of a beloved grandmother strongly affected the girl.妹妹的出生和奶奶的去世同时发生，给小姑娘造成了巨大的影响</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coetaneous, coeval, coexistent, concurrent, contemporaneous, simultaneous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]occurring at different times, noncontemporaneous, out-of-phase  发生在不同时代的</div>
<h2>synergic[sound:synergic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">合作的：</font>working together: cooperating</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]synergic muscles 协同肌肉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]antagonistic 敌对的</div>
<h2>synonymous[sound:synonymous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">同义的：</font>having the same or a similar meaning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Paris has always been synonymous with elegance, luxury and style.  巴黎在人们心中就是优雅、奢侈、时尚的同义词。</div>
<h2>synopsis[sound:synopsis.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">摘要，概要：</font>a brief outline or general view; an abstract or a summary.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Just give me a synopsis of the movie. 把电影的大致情节给我说说就行。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstract, brief, digest, recapitulation, roundup, summarization, epitome</div>
<h2>synthesis[sound:synthesis.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">合成，综合：</font>the combination of parts or elements so as to form a whole</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a philosophy that is a kind of synthesis of several schools of Western and Eastern thought 哲学史东西方很多流派思想的综合</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]admixture, alloy, amalgamation, compound, conflation, fusion, meld</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]analysis, take apart 分解</div>
<h2>tacit[sound:tacit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">暗示的：</font>implied or indicated (as by an act or by silence) but not actually expressed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tacit consent 默许</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]implied, unexpressed, unspoken, unvoiced, wordless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]explicit, express, expressed, spoken, stated, voiced 明确的表达，直率的</div>
<h2>taciturn[sound:taciturn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">沉默寡言的，话少的：</font>temperamentally disinclined to talk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A taciturn man never initiates a conversation. 一个寡言的男人从不主动和人说话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]laconic, reserved, reticent, tight-lipped, uncommunicative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]garrulous, loquacious, glib, expansive, prolix, voluble 多话的</div>
<h2>tackle[sound:tackle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">着手处理：</font>to start work on energetically</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Once I clean the kitchen, I think I'll tackle the bathroom. 等我把厨房收拾干净了，就去收拾浴室。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dive into, wade in</div>
<h2>tact[sound:tact.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">机敏，精明，不冒犯：</font>a keen sense of what to do or say in order to maintain good relations withothers or avoid offense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She talked to her neighbor with supreme tact.  她和邻居说话语调十分圆滑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diplomacy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clumsiness, insensitivity, tactlessness 笨拙</div>
<h2>tactile[sound:tactile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有触觉的，能触知的：</font>perceptible by touch: tangible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The thick brushstrokes give the painting a tactile quality. 粘稠的笔触给了这幅画一种厚实的感觉。</div>
<h2>tactless[sound:tactless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不机智的，笨拙的：</font>bluntly inconsiderate or indiscreet.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tactless comments 不明智的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]graceless, ill-advised, imprudent, indelicate, injudicious, undiplomatic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advisable, discreet, judicious, prudent, tactful, wise 小心谨慎的，明智的</div>
<h2>talisman[sound:talisman.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">护身符：</font>something worn or kept to bring good luck or keep away evil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A pendant of white nephrite jade is often worn by Indians as a talisman to ward off heart disease. 印度人通常戴一串软玉项链防止心脏病发作。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amulet, fetish, mascot, mojo, periapt, phylactery</div>
<h2>taint[sound:taint.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（品质）污损：</font>to affect slightly with something morally bad or undesirable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A tendency toward conceitedness taints that athlete's status as a role model. 该运动员自负的倾向玷污了其行为模范的地位。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blemish, darken, mar, spoil, tarnish, vitiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]tainted 污损的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pristine, unspoiled, wholesome, unadulterated 纯洁的，健全的</div>
<h2>tamper[sound:tamper.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">恶意窜改，损害：</font>to handle thoughtlessly, ignorantly, or mischievously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tamper with tradition 坏了规矩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diddle with, fiddle with, fool with, mess with</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">玩弄：</font>to tinker with rashly or foolishly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Don't tamper with my feelings. 不要玩弄我的感情。</div>
<h2>tangent[sound:tangent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. / adj. 离题 （的），不相关 （的）：diverging from an original purpose of course: irrelevant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tangent remarks 不相关的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excursive, digressive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]essential  重要的</div>
<h2>tangible[sound:tangible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可感知的：</font>capable of being perceived</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]palpable, touchable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impalpable, intangible, unable to perceive 无法感知的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">确凿的，  真实的：</font>possible to be treated as fact; real or concrete</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tangible evidence 确凿的证据</div>
<h2>tangy[sound:tangy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激的：</font>having a powerfully stimulating odor or flavor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tangy sauce with a strong aftertaste 味道很刺激的酱料，回味无穷</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]pungent, strong</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bland, mild, smooth 不刺激的</div>
<h2>tantalize[sound:tantalize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">激起，挑逗：</font>to excite (another) by exposing something desirable while keeping it out of reach</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was tantalized by the possibility of earning a lot of money quickly. 有人用迅速致富挑逗他。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comfort, console, solace, alleviate, assuage, relieve, satiate 安慰，缓和</div>
<h2>tantamount[sound:tantamount.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">等价的，与…相等的：</font>equivalent in value, significance, or effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a relationship tantamount to marriage 到了谈婚论嫁地步的关系</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]incommensurate 不相称的</div>
<h2>tantrum[sound:tantrum.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">勃然大怒，发脾气：</font>a fit of bad temper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]had a tantrum  大发脾气</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blowup, explosion, fit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pacification 平静</div>

<h2>tardy[sound:tardy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缓慢的，迟缓的：</font>moving slowly: sluggish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was tardy to work. 他做事拖拖拉拉。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crawling, creeping, dallying, dawdling, dilatory, dragging, lagging, languid, sluggish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bolting, brisk, fleet, flying, meteoric, rocketing, scooting, scudding, scurrying, swift, whirling  迅速的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">延后的，迟的：</font>delayed beyond the expected or proper time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tardy arrival  迟到</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]behind, belated, delinquent, overdue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]early, inopportune, precocious, premature, unseasonable, untimely 提早的</div>

<h2>tasty[sound:tasty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">美味的，令人愉悦的：</font>giving pleasure or contentment to the mind or senses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the tasty prospect of getting his revenge 报仇成功的诱人前景</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agreeable, delectable, delightful, satisfying, savory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]uninteresting, disagreeable, unpalatable, unpleasant, unwelcome 无趣的，令人失望的</div>

<h2>tawdry[sound:tawdry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">俗丽的：</font>cheap and gaudy in appearance or quality; ignoble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tawdry attempt to smear his opponent 企图污蔑对手的下三滥的手段</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]meretricious, gaudy, flashy, garish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exquisite  高雅的</div>
<h2>taxing[sound:taxing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">繁重的，费力的：</font>requiring much time, effort, or careful attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The journey proved to be very taxing. 旅途很艰辛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arduous, burdensome, exacting, grueling, laborious, onerous, toilsome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]light, easy 轻快的</div>
<h2>tedious[sound:tedious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冗长乏味的：</font>tiresome because of length or dullness: boring</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tedious public ceremony 冗长无聊的公开仪式</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drab, dreary, jading, monotonous, stale, stodgy, stuffy, weary, drudging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]entertaining,  absorbing,  stimulating,  engaging,  engrossing,  gripping,  interesting,  intriguing,  involving, riveting 令人愉快的，吸引人的</div>
<h2>teeter[sound:teeter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">蹒跚，不稳定的行走：</font>to move unsteadily: wobble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She teetered down the street in her high heels. 她穿着高跟鞋，在街上摇摇欲坠。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careen, dodder, lurch, reel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stabilize 使…稳固</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">犹豫不决：</font>to show uncertainty about the right course of action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]was teetering on the brink of making a decision about college</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balance, dither, falter, hang back, scruple, shilly-shally, stagger, vacillate, waver, wobble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dive in, plunge in</div>
