<h2>telling[sound:telling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有效的，显著的：</font>effective, expressive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the most telling evidence 最有力的证据</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compelling, conclusive, convincing, forceful, persuasive, satisfying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconclusive, indecisive, ineffective, uncompelling, unconvincing, unpersuasive 无效的</div>
<h2>temerity[sound:temerity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">鲁莽，冒失：</font>foolhardy disregard of danger; recklessness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was punished for his temerity. 她因冒失迟到了苦头。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacity, brashness, presumption, presumptuousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circumspection, cautious approach, pusillanimity 谨慎</div>
<h2>temporize[sound:temporize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">行动躲躲闪闪以争取时间、躲避争论等：</font>to act evasively in order to gain time, avoid argument, orpostpone a decision</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]“Colonial officials . . . ordered to enforce unpopular enactments, tended to temporize, to find excuses for evasion”(J.H. Parry) “被命令来执行不受欢迎法案的殖民地官员们倾向于敷衍了事，去寻找逃避的理由”(J.H.帕里)</div>
<h2>temperate[sound:temperate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">言行举止有分寸的：</font>avoiding extremes in behavior or expression</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]rather temperate in his appraisal of the movie, calling it good but not great 对于电影的赞赏很适度，说其“还好”而不是“很棒”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]immoderate, extreme, frivolous 极端的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有节制的：</font>given to or marked by restraint in the satisfaction of one's appetites</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a soft-spoken, serious-minded person of temperate habits 一个说话温和、认真严肃的人，兴趣爱好都很适度</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abstentious, abstinent, continent, self-abnegating, self-denying, sober</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]self-indulgent  放纵的</div>
<h2>tempestuous[sound:tempestuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">突然且剧烈的变化：</font>marked by sudden or violent disturbance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In terms of social change, the 1960s are generally considered the most tempestuous decade in recentAmerican history.  就社会变革来说，20 世纪60 年代是近现代美国历史上最动荡的十年。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cataclysmal, tumultuous, turbulent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]serene 平静的</div>
<h2>tenable[sound:tenable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有据可依的，无懈可击的：</font>capable of being held or defended; reasonable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tenable theory 一个站得住脚的理论 || a tenable outpost 一个守得住的前哨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defendable, justifiable, maintainable, supportable, sustainable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unjustified, unsound, specious, indefensible, fallacious 不合理的</div>
<h2>tenacious[sound:tenacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">顽固的，不屈不挠的：</font>persistent in maintaining something valued or habitual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tenacious advocate of civil rights 公民权的坚定捍卫者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dogged, insistent, persevering, pertinacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]negotiable, vacillated 可商量的，踌躇的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粘着的：</font>tending to adhere to objects upon contact</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You'll have enough time getting those tenacious gum off of your wool sweater. 你有足够的时候去把羊毛毛衣上面那块粘着的泡泡糖弄下来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adherent, adhesive, clingy, glutinous, tacky, viscid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nonadhesive 不具有粘性的</div>
<h2>tendentious[sound:tendentious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有偏见的：</font>marked by a tendency in favor of a particular point of view: biased</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He made some extremely tendentious remarks. 他有些评论颇具偏向性。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]partial, distorting, subjective, biased</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unbiased, unprejudiced 公平的</div>
<h2>tender[sound:tender.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">正式提出：</font>to offer formally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tender a letter of resignation 正式提交辞职信</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]extend, proffer, trot out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]withdraw 撤回</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">考虑周到的，关心同情的：</font>having or marked by sympathy and consideration for others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an especially tender teacher who loves having kids with special educational needs in her class 特别无微不至的老师，爱着那些需要特别教育的孩子们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beneficent, benevolent, benignant, compassionate, softhearted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]atrocious,  barbarous,  bestial,  brutal,  callous,  cruel,  fiendish,  inhuman,  insensate,  sadistic,  savage, truculent, uncompassionate, vicious 尖酸刻薄的</div>
<h2>tenuous[sound:tenuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">没有实际内容的：</font>having little substance; flimsy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tenuous argument 站不住脚的论点</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]substantial 实质的</div>
<h2>tepid[sound:tepid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不太热心的：</font>showing little or no interest or enthusiasm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tepid response 冷漠的回应 || the tepid conservatism of the fifties 五十年代那种温和的保守主义</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lukewarm, halfhearted, uneager, unenthusiastic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ardent, ebullient, feverish, keen, passionate, wholehearted 热心的</div>
<h2>terminology[sound:terminology.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">专业术语：</font>the special terms or expressions of a particular group or field</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the terminology favored by sportscasters  体育节目转播员喜欢用的那些术语 ||  medical  terminology  thatcan be hard for the patient to understand 那些病人们难以理解的医学术语</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]argot, cant, dialect, jargon, jive, lingo, patois, patter, slang</div>
<h2>terminus[sound:terminus.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">终点，终点站：</font>the final point; the end</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Stockholm is the terminus for the southbound train. 斯德哥尔摩是南向去的列车的终点站。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]outset, sustain 开始，持续</div>
<h2>terror[sound:terror.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">极度恐惧：</font>a state of intense fear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Many civilians fled in terror.  很多黎民百姓极度恐慌逃难去了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anxiety, dread, fearfulness, fright, horror, panic, trepidation</div>
<h2>terse[sound:terse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">简洁的，简明的：</font>brief and to the point; effectively concise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dismissed me with a terse “no” 用一个简单的“不”把我打发了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compact, compendious, laconic, pithy, succinct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circuitous, circumlocutory, diffuse, long-winded, prolix, rambling, verbose, windy, wordy 冗长啰嗦的</div>
<h2>testimony[sound:testimony.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">证词，声明：</font>firsthand authentication of a fact</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The jury heard 10 days of testimony.  陪审团进行了10 天的听证。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attestation, confirmation, documentation, substantiation, testament, validation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disproof 反驳</div>
<h2>testy[sound:testy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易怒的，暴躁的：</font>easily annoyed: irritable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That coworker would be easier to get along with if she weren't so testy all the time. 如果那个同伴不是一直那么暴怒的话，她还是挺好相处的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choleric, irascible, peevish, perverse, pettish, petulant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]affable, good humor, unable to irritate, imperturbable, patient 和蔼可亲的，冷静的，忍耐的</div>
<h2>tether[sound:tether.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（用绳，铁链）拴系，束缚：</font>to fasten or restrain by or as if by a tether</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They tethered the horses in the shade. 他们把马摔在棚子里</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]detach, tear loose  分开，撕裂</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">能力或忍耐力的极限：</font>the limit of one's strength or resources</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]drought-stricken farmers at the end of their tether 受干旱打击的农民忍无可忍</div>
<h2>theatrical[sound:theatrical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">做作的，夸张的，矫揉造作的：</font>marked by exaggerated self-display and unnatural behavior</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]assumed a theatrical pose 摆出夸张的姿势</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dramatic, histrionic, melodramatic, stagy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]natural, understated, reserved, restraint  自然的</div>
<h2>therapeutic[sound:therapeutic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">治疗的：</font>of or relating to the treatment of disease or disorders by remedial agents or methods</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Gentle exercise can be therapeutic for hospital patients. 适量的运动对病人恢复有好处。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]curative, healing, officinal, remedial, restorative</div>
<h2>thorny[sound:thorny.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多刺的：</font>full of thorns</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Stay out of the thorny brambles unless you want a ton of scratches. 离那些荆棘丛远一点，除非你想满身都是窟窿。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]smooth 平滑的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">棘手的：</font>full of difficulties or controversial points : ticklish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a thorny problem 棘手的问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catchy, delicate, knotty, prickly, ticklish</div>
<h2>threadbare[sound:threadbare.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">陈腐的：</font>overused to the point of being worn out; hackneyed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a novel filled with nothing but threadbare clichés 一部满是陈词滥调的小说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banal, cliché, commonplace, hackney, shopworn, trite</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贫穷的：</font>lacking money or material possessions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]never knew that she had so many threadbare relatives until she won the lottery 赢了彩票之后才知道她有这么多穷亲戚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beggared, destitute, down-and-out, famished, impecunious, impoverished, indigent, necessitous, needful,pauperized, penniless, penurious, poverty-stricken, skint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]affluent, deep-pocketed, flush, opulent, silk-stocking, wealthy, well-heeled, well-off, well-to-do 富裕的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">破烂的：</font>worn or torn into or as if into rags</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I loved that threadbare shirt, but after 10 years of wear, it was time to throw it away. 我很喜欢那件旧旧的衬衣，但是已经穿了10 年了，是该扔了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]frayed, raggedy, ratty, seedy, shabby, tattered, worn-out</div>
<h2>throng[sound:throng.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi./n. 大量聚集：to crowd together in great numbers</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]commuters thronging the MTR platform 持月票的乘客拥向地铁站</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flock, mob, swarm</div>
<h2>thwart[sound:thwart.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">阻挠：</font>to oppose successfully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She did all she could to thwart his plans.  她竭尽所能阻挠他的计划。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baffle, balk, checkmate, discomfit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advance, cultivate, encourage, forward, foster, further, nurture, promote, support, aid, bolster, abet, foment, facilitate  促进，支持</div>
<h2>ticklish[sound:ticklish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易怒的：</font>easily offended or upset; touchy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]ticklish about his baldness 大家一提起他的秃头，他就暴怒 [近]huffy, tetchy, thin-skinned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]imperturbable  镇静的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">棘手的，对技巧要求高的：</font>requiring exceptional skill or caution in performance or handling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Trying to tell him that his zipper is down without embarrassing him will be a ticklish task. 如何体面得体地提醒他拉链没关好是一个技巧活儿。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catchy, delicate, difficult, dodgy, knotty, prickly, problematic, sensitive, spiny, sticky, thorny, touchy, tough, tricksy</div>
<h2>tiff[sound:tiff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 小争吵：a petty quarrel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]got into a little tiff about what color sheets to buy for their bed 对于买什么颜色的床单争吵</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]altercate, bicker, brabble, hassle, quarrel, quibble, row, scrap, spat, squabble</div>
<h2>tightfisted[sound:tightfisted.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">吝啬的：</font>close-fisted; stingy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The company is pretty tightfisted when it comes to bonuses. 这个公司分红的时候很吝啬。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]mean, miserly, parsimonious, penurious, sparing, stinting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bounteous,  bountiful,  charitable,  freehanded,  generous,  liberal,  munificent,  openhanded,  unsparing, unstinting 慷慨大方的</div>
<h2>timeworn[sound:timeworn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">陈腐的：</font>hackneyed, stale</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]timeworn jokes 老掉牙的笑话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]banal, cliché, commonplace, hackneyed, stereotyped, threadbare, trite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fresh, new, novel, original, unclichéd, unhackneyed 新奇的</div>
<h2>timid[sound:timid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">胆小的，不自信的：</font>lacking in courage or self-confidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He gave her a timid smile. 他给了她一个羞赧的微笑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fainthearted, fearsome, scary, timorous, tremulous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stalwart, adventurous, audacious, bold, daring, dashing, gutsy, venturous 坚定勇敢的</div>
<h2>timorous[sound:timorous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">胆小的：</font>of a timid disposition: fearful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be as timorous as a rabbit  像兔子一样胆小</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]timid, undaring, quailing, recoiling, scary, skittish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stalwart, intrepid, adventurous, audacious, bold, daring, dashing, gutsy, venturous 大胆的</div>
<h2>tinge[sound:tinge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">给…着上少量的色彩：</font>to color with a slight shade or stain; tint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]just slightly tinge the frosting with yellow food coloring to give it a lemony look  略微在霜糖表面加一点黄色色素，有一点柠檬的感觉就可以了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dye, pigment, stain, tincture, tint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]suffuse, decolorize 遍染，使脱色</div>
<h2>tinker[sound:tinker.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">乱修，乱调整：</font>to handle thoughtlessly, ignorantly, or mischievously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tinkering with the engine  胡乱调整发动机</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diddle with, fiddle with, fool with, mess with, toy with, twiddle with</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adjust, repair 调整，修理</div>
<h2>tint[sound:tint.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">涂浅色，微染：</font>apply a usually slight or pale coloration to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tint with only one color 只用一种颜色染色</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dye, pigment, stain, tincture, tinge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]suffuse, decolorize  遍染，使脱色</div>
<h2>tirade[sound:tirade.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">长篇抨击性演讲：</font>a long angry or violent speech, usually of a censorious or denunciatory nature;a diatribe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tirade of angry protest 一个表达愤怒的抗议的长篇抨击性演讲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]harangue, diatribe, jeremiad, philippic, rant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eulogy, encomium, panegyric, tribute  颂词</div>
<h2>toady[sound:toady.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 马屁精，拍马屁：one who flatters in the hope of gaining favors</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He criticized that I was a toady. 他批评说我是一个马屁精。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]sycophant, groveler, flatterer</div>
<h2>tonic[sound:tonic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">滋补的，有益健康的：</font>producing or stimulating physical, mental, or emotional vigor; beneficialto the health of body or mind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]tonic medicine 补药</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]medicinal, restorative, salubrious, salutary, salutiferous, sanative, wholesome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insalubrious, noxious, unhealthful, unhealthy, unwholesome 不健康的</div>
<h2>topsy-turvy[sound:topsy-turvy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">混乱的：</font>lacking in order, neatness, and often cleanliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He left his room topsy-turvy. 他把他的房间弄的很乱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disordered, chaotic, messy, anarchic, jumbled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]kempt, neat, orderly, organized, shipshape, tidy, trim, uncluttered, well-ordered 有序的</div>
<h2>torpid[sound:torpid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">麻木的，没有知觉的：</font>lacking in sensation or feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My tongue and throat remained torpid for a time following the endoscopy.  胃镜检查之后，我的舌头和喉咙一直是麻木的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asleep, benumbed, dead, insensitive, numbed, unfeeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]feeling, sensible, sensitive</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迟钝的，行动迟缓的：</font>slow to move or act</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a torpid sloth that refused to budge off its tree branch 趴在树枝上一动不动的树獭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dull, inert, lethargic, quiescent, sleepy, sluggish, torpid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]active 活跃的</div>
<h2>torpor[sound:torpor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏兴趣：</font>lack of interest or concern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After a lifetime of setbacks, defeats, and failures, he could only greet the latest bad news with a resignedfatalism and dull torpor. 一生都充满了挫折、失败，他只能用宿命论和麻木不仁来迎接又一次的坏消息。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apathy, casualness, complacence, disinterestedness, disregard, incuriosity, insouciance, nonchalance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]concern, interest, regard 有兴趣</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（肉体或精神上的）迟钝：</font>physical or mental inertness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Following Thanksgiving dinner, we spent the rest of the day lounging about in a contented torpor. 吃完感恩节晚餐后，我们慵懒地靠在沙发上打发剩下的时间。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]languor, lassitude, listlessness, stupor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vigor, vim, vitality, vivacity 活力</div>
<h2>torrential[sound:torrential.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">急流的：</font>caused by or resulting from action of rapid streams</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a torrential rain 倾盆大雨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]trickling  涓涓细流的</div>
<h2>torrid[sound:torrid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">酷热的：</font>intensely hot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the dry, torrid summers in southern Arizona 南亚利桑那州干燥、炎热的夏天</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hot, scalding, scorching, sweltering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arctic, bone-chilling, freezing, frigid, frozen, glacial, icy  寒冷的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">热情的，情感深厚的：</font>having or expressing great depth of feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]torrid love affair 炙热的爱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardent, burning, fervid, flaming, glowing, impassioned, incandescent, intense, passionate, vehement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dispassionate, emotionless, impassive, unemotional 冷漠的</div>
<h2>tortuous[sound:tortuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">转弯抹角的：</font>marked by devious or indirect tactics: crooked, tricky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tortuous path 一条蜿蜒的道路</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bending, curling, curvy, devious, serpentine, sinuous, twisted, windy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]direct, straightforward  直接的</div>
<h2>tout[sound:tout.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">极力赞扬：</font>to promote or praise energetically; publicize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]to tout victory in the war 鼓吹战果</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acclaim, laud, praise, ballyhoo, tout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]asperse, censure, denounce, berate, rate, revile, vituperate 指责</div>
<h2>toy[sound:toy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">草率或不认真地对待：</font>to handle thoughtlessly, ignorantly, or mischievously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That microscope is a delicate instrument, not something to be toyed with. 那个显微镜是精密仪器，不是随随便便的一个玩具。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]diddle with, fiddle with, fool with, mess with, monkey with, tinker with, twiddle with</div>
<h2>tractable[sound:tractable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易驾驭的，温顺的：</font>readily giving in to the command or authority of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a tractable horse 一匹温顺的马</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]obedient, amenable, docile, flexible, manageable, compliant, submissive, tame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]balky, contumacious, defiant, disobedient, incompliant, insubordinate, obstreperous, rebellious, recalcitrant, refractory, restive, unamenable, ungovernable, unruly, untoward, wayward, willful 任性的，难以驯服的</div>
<h2>tranquility[sound:tranquility.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">宁静，淡定：</font>a state of freedom from storm or disturbance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]enjoyed the tranquillity of the snow-covered field at dusk 享受傍晚时分被雪覆盖的田野的静谧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]calm, quiet, silence, serenity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bustle, commotion, hubbub, pandemonium, tumult, turmoil, unquietness, unrest, uproar 喧闹，骚乱</div>
<h2>transcend[sound:transcend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">超越，超过极限：</font>to rise above or go beyond the limits of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a person who believes that any true understanding of God transcends human intelligence 认为对上帝的真正理解是超越人类智商极限的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]break, outreach, outrun, overpass, overreach, overrun, overshoot, overstep, surpass</div>

<h2>transient[sound:transient.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">短暂的，瞬时的：</font>passing with time; transitory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]transient pleasure 短暂的快乐</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]transitory, ephemeral, evanescent, fleeting, temporary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ceaseless,  dateless,  deathless,  endless,  enduring,  eternal,  everlasting,  immortal,  lasting,  long-lived, permanent, perpetual, timeless, undying, unending 永恒持久的</div>
<h2>transitory[sound:transitory.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">短暂的：</font>existing or lasting only a short time; short-lived or temporary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]most of life’s joys are transitory 尘世间的欢乐都是过眼烟云，转瞬即逝</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]transient, ephemeral, evanescent, fleeting, temporary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ceaseless,  dateless,  deathless,  endless,  enduring,  eternal,  everlasting,  immortal,  lasting,  long-lived, permanent, perpetual, timeless, undying, unending</div>

<h2>transparent[sound:transparent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">透明的：</font>capable of transmitting light</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]translucent, limpid, pellucid, lucent, lucid, transpicuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cloudy, opaque 不透明的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">没有歧义，清晰易懂的：</font>not subject to misinterpretation or more than one interpretation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His  meaning  in  leaving  the  conversation  is  transparent:  he  doesn't  want  to  talk  about  his  combatexperiences. 他结束这个话题的意图很明显：不想谈论当年参战的事。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]obvious, clear, apparent, patent, understandable, apprehensible, comprehendible, fathomable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ambiguous, clouded, cryptic, enigmatic, equivocal, indistinct, mysterious, obfuscated, obscure, unapparent, unclarified, unclear, unclouded  难以理解的</div>
<h2>travail[sound:travail.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 辛苦劳动：work, especially when arduous or involving painful effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]writer’s literary travail 作家辛勤的文学创作 || Labor Day is the day on which we recognize those men and women who daily travail with little appreciation or compensation. 劳动节是我们向那些平日辛勤劳作但是很少受到大家关注和补偿的工人致敬的日子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drudgery, fatigue, grind</div>

<h2>travesty[sound:travesty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./v. 拙劣的、嘲弄性模仿：an exaggerated or grotesque imitation, such as a parody of a literary work</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a travesty of his classmate’s manner  滑稽的模仿其他同学的举止</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]caricature, burlesque, parody, spoof, mock</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]paragon 完美的模范</div>
<h2>treacherous[sound:treacherous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">背叛的：</font>marked by betrayal of fidelity, confidence, or trust</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a treacherous ally  不忠的盟友</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]faithless, disloyal, perfidious, recreant, traitorous, unfaithful, unloyal, betraying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]constant, dedicated, devoted, staunch, down-the-line, faithful, fast, loyal, steadfast, steady, true  忠诚的</div>
<h2>trenchant[sound:trenchant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">锐利的：</font>keen, sharp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Even the most trenchant sword could not sever the bonds of loyalty between them. 即使最锋利的刀剑也不能切断他们的忠诚。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]keen, sharp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blunt, blunted, dull, obtuse  钝的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（言辞）一针见血的：</font>vigorously effective and articulate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]trenchant criticisms 一针见血的批评</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incisive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vague 含糊的</div>
<h2>trepidation[sound:trepidation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">恐惧，战栗：</font>the emotion experienced in the presence or threat of danger; apprehension</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]trepidation about starting a new career 对开创一项新事业而感到恐惧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fear, fright, horror, apprehension</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]boldness, bravery, dauntlessness, intrepidity 大胆</div>
<h2>trespass[sound:trespass.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">非法侵入，违反：</font>to commit an offense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I consider him to be trespassing against all of us when he trespasses against any one of us. 当他冒犯我们当中一个人的时候，他就冒犯了我们全部</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]transgress, invade, intrude</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]withdraw, retreat 撤退</div>
<h2>tribute[sound:tribute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">颂词：</font>a gift, payment, declaration, or other acknowledgment of gratitude, respect, or admiration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]pay a high tribute to… 赞颂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accolade, eulogy, encomium, panegyric, tribute 颂词</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]denunciation, condemnation, criticism, censure, reproof, reprobation 批评，指责</div>
<h2>trickle[sound:trickle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">一滴滴地流，徐徐地流：</font>to issue or fall in drops</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Tears trickled down her cheeks.  眼泪从她的脸上一滴一滴地流下。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pour, roll, stream, gush  喷涌</div>
<h2>trite[sound:trite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">陈腐的，陈词滥调的：</font>hackneyed or boring from much use, not fresh or original</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]“You win some, you lose some” is a trite expression. “有得必有失”是老生常谈了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bathetic, cliché, hackneyed, threadbare, timeworn, banal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fresh, new, novel, original, unclichéd, unhackneyed  新鲜的</div>
<h2>trivial[sound:trivial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">琐碎的，无足轻重的：</font>of little worth or importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]why spend so much time on trivial decisions, like whether the cola should be regular or diet  为什么花这么多时间在这种琐碎的决定上，比如可乐要喝一般的还是健怡？</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inconsiderable, insignificant, minor, petty, inconsequential, paltry, trifling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consequential, material, momentous, weighty, indispensable, substantive, grandiose, massive 重要的</div>
<h2>truant[sound:truant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj./ n./ vi. 逃避责任的：shirking responsibility; one who shirks duty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]play truant 逃学</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]shirk, malinger, goldbrick, avoid, escape, evade, parry, sidestep, circumvent, fence, hedge, avert, elude,shun, skirt, dodge, bilk, eschew</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dutiful 尽职尽责的</div>
<h2>truce[sound:truce.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">休战，休战协定：</font>a suspension of fighting especially of considerable duration by agreement ofopposing forces</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]truce agreement 休战协议</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]armistice, cease-fire, peace</div>
<h2>truculent[sound:truculent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">尖酸刻薄的：</font>marked by harsh insulting language</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a theater critic who was notorious for his titanically truculent reviews  一个以超大量尖酸刻薄言论著称的话剧评论家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contumelious, invective, opprobrious, scurrilous, vitriolic, vituperative</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">好战的：</font>feeling or displaying eagerness to fight</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]in an aggressively truculent manner 以好战的，进攻性的方式</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belligerent, bellicose, combative, militant, aggressive, feisty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nonaggressive, nonbelligerent, pacific, peaceable, peaceful, uncombative, uncontentious 好和平的</div>
<h2>trudge[sound:trudge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">吃力而笨拙地走：</font>to move heavily or clumsily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]trudge over hill 翻山越岭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]plod, lug, slog, flounder</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]breeze, glide, slide, waltz, whisk, flit 快速通过</div>
<h2>trumpet[sound:trumpet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">大声说出或宣告：</font>to make known openly or publicly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The losing party lost no time in trumpeting allegations of election fraud. 落败的政党马不停蹄地开始公开宣称选举存在作假。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advertise, annunciate, blare, broadcast, declare, proclaim, promulgate, release, give out</div>
<h2>truncate[sound:truncate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">截短 （时间，程度）：</font>to shorten by or as if by cutting off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a truncated version of the 11 o'clock newscast followed the awards show, which ran over its time slot 颁奖典礼之后缩短版的11 点新闻节目，已经超出了预定时长</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abbreviate, abridge, curtail, retrench</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elongate, extend, lengthen, prolong, protract 延长</div>
<h2>truss[sound:truss.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">系紧，扎紧：</font>to gather into a tight mass by means of a line or cord</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After stuffing the turkey, the chef quickly trussed it so the forcemeat wouldn't fall out during roasting.  把填料塞进火鸡后，大厨迅速把它扎紧防止在烘烤过程中肉馅掉出来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]band, bind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unbind, untie 解开</div>
<h2>tumult[sound:tumult.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">骚动，暴动：</font>a disorderly commotion or disturbance, a riot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His mind was in a tumult. 他心烦意乱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disorder, disturbance, commotion, convulsion, ferment, turmoil, pandemonium, uproar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]quietude, quiescence, serenity, tranquility 安静</div>
<h2>turbid[sound:turbid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">混浊的：</font>deficient in clarity or purity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a turbid stream 一条混浊的河</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]muddy, murky, obscure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear , limpid, lucid, pellucid, , crystalline 清澈的</div>
<h2>turbulent[sound:turbulent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">动荡的：</font>marked by sudden or violent disturbance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a turbulent period in history  历史上动荡时期</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cataclysmal, stormy, tempestuous, tumultuous</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">湍急的，汹涌的：</font>marked by turmoil or disturbance especially of natural elements</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the turbulent rapids of the river were certainly daunting to those of us who were new to river rafting 湍急的流水必定让那些初玩漂流的人们吓得不轻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rough, rugged, stormy, tempestuous</div>
<h2>turgid[sound:turgid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">浮夸的，过分装饰的：</font>excessively embellished in style or language</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]turgid prose 浮华的散文</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flatulent, bombastic, pompous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]simple, austere, unadorned, undecorated, unembellished 简朴的</div>

<h2>ubiquitous[sound:ubiquitous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无所不在的，普通的：</font>being everywhere at the same time; often observed or encountered</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The conflict between opposites is ubiquitous.  对立的冲突无所不在。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]omnipresent, universal, general, common</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]extraordinary, infrequent, rare, seldom, uncommon, unfamiliar, unusual, unique, particular  独特的，不常见的</div>
<h2>unassailable[sound:unassailable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无可争辩的，无法否认的，不可亵渎的：</font>not to be violated, criticized, or tampered with</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unassailable article  无可争辩的文章</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]undeniable, inviolable, sacrosanct , irrefutable, indisputable, unexceptionable, unimpeachable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]controversial  有争议的</div>
<h2>uncanny[sound:uncanny.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">离奇的，奇异的：</font>being so extraordinary or abnormal as to suggest powers which violate thelaws of nature</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The silence was uncanny. 静得出奇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]magical, miraculous, phenomenal, preternatural, superhuman, supernormal, transcendent, transcendental,uncanny, unearthly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ordinary, commonplace, normal  平凡的</div>
<h2>uncouth[sound:uncouth.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗俗的，没有品位的：</font>lacking in refinement or good taste</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the movie's uncouth humor seemed to be purposely offensive 电影里一些恶俗的幽默貌似是故意的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crass, rude, discourteous, disgracious, ungraceful, crude, ill-bred, ill-mannered, uncivil, unrefined</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]genteel, cultivated, cultured, polished, urbane, seemly  得体的，有教养的</div>
<h2>unctuous[sound:unctuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">油嘴滑舌的，谄媚的：</font>overly or insincerely flattering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unctuous appraisal of the musical talent shown by the boss's daughter 拍老板马屁，说他女儿音乐剧的才能非常卓越</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adulatory, gushing, hagiographic, oily, oleaginous, soapy</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">夸张的，做作的：</font>characterized by affected, exaggerated, or insincere earnestness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unctuous effort to appear religious to the voters 过分做作想在选民面前表现地虔诚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artificial, backhanded, counterfeit, fake, feigned, hypocritical, phony, pretended</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artless, candid, genuine, heartfelt, honest, sincere, undesigning, unfeigned 真实的</div>
<h2>underdog[sound:underdog.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">受害者，输家：</font>a loser/ victim or predicted loser in a struggle or contest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She always supports for the underdog. 她经常支持受害者。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]loser, victim</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bully 欺凌弱小者</div>
<h2>undergird[sound:undergird.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">加强，巩固…的底部：</font>to support or strengthen from beneath</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]facts and statistics undergird his commentary  事实和数据支持了他的评论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]strengthen, support, fortify, reinforce, bear, bolster, brace, buttress, carry, stay, sustain, underpin, uphold,prop up, shore up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]undermine, weaken, debilitate, enfeeble, enervate  削弱</div>
<h2>undermine[sound:undermine.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">削弱，破坏：</font>to weaken, injure, or impair, often by degrees or imperceptibly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]undermine a fortress 挖地道破坏堡垒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]undermine, weaken, debilitate, enfeeble, enervate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]strengthen, support, fortify, reinforce  加强</div>
<h2>underscore[sound:underscore.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">强调：</font>to emphasize; stress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]underscore the value of education 强调教育的重要性</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accentuate, italicize, stress, underline, bring out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deemphasize, downplay 轻描淡写</div>
<h2>understate[sound:understate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">保守陈述：</font>to state or present with restraint especially for effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]understate a problem 低调处理问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]downplay</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]vaunt, exaggerate, overstate  夸大</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]understated adj. 朴素的：avoiding obvious emphasis or embellishment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conservative, low-key, muted, repressed, restrained, sober, subdued, unflashy, unpretentious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flamboyant, flaring, flashy, garish, gaudy, glitzy, ostentatious, splashy 夸张的，华丽的</div>
<h2>understudy[sound:understudy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">替补演员：</font>one who is prepared to act another's part or take over another's duties</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be an understudy to sb 作为某人的替补</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deputy</div>
<h2>unexceptionable[sound:unexceptionable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无懈可击的：</font>not open to objection or criticism, beyond reproach</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unassailable, undeniable, irrefutable, indisputable, unexceptionable, unimpeachable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assailable, controversial  有争议的</div>
<h2>unflappable[sound:unflappable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">镇定的，从容不迫的：</font>not easily upset or excited</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a unflappable general 一个镇定的将军</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collected, composed, disimpassioned, imperturbable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]perturbable, shakable, disturbed, nervous  紧张的</div>
<h2>ungainly[sound:ungainly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">笨拙的，不雅的：</font>having or showing an inability to move in a graceful manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]ungainly movements 笨拙的动作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clumsy, awkward, blundering, maladroit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coordinated, graceful, adroit, dexterous, lissome 协调的，灵巧的</div>
<h2>unimpeachable[sound:unimpeachable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无可置疑的：</font>beyond doubt; unquestionable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]An unimpeachable evidence 无可置疑的证据</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unassailable, undeniable, irrefutable, indisputable, unexceptionable, unimpeachable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assailable, controversial, open to question 可争辩的</div>
<h2>unkempt[sound:unkempt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凌乱的，无序的：</font>lacking in order, neatness, and often cleanliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]unkempt hotel rooms 凌乱的酒店房间</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]slovenly, slipshod, sloppy, unneat, untidy, topsy-turvy, jumbled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bandbox, neat, orderly, organized, shipshape, tidy, trim, uncluttered, well-ordered 有序的，井井有条的</div>
<h2>unlettered[sound:unlettered.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">未受教育的，文盲的：</font>not adept at reading and writing; deficient in the knowledge that can beacquired from books. illiterate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]unlettered sector of society 未受教育的地区</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ignorant, illiterate, uneducated, untutored</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]educated, knowledgeable, erudite, literate, schooled, well-informed, well-read 博学的，受过教育的</div>
<h2>unpretentious[sound:unpretentious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">低调的，谦逊的：</font>lacking pretension or affectation; modest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unpretentious virtuoso 一位谦虚的大师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]demure, down-to-earth, lowly, meek, unassuming, humble, modest, unostentatious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]arrogant, bumptious, conceited, egotistic, fastuous, haughty, imperious, lordly, overweening, peremptory, pompous, presuming, presumptuous, self-asserting, supercilious, superior, toplofty, uppish, flamboyant, ostentatious 傲慢的，自负的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">坦诚的，自然的：</font>free from any intent to deceive or impress others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a simple and unpretentious account about growing up in the rural South 一段简单坦率的关于在南部乡村成长经历的叙述</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artless, genuine, honest, ingenuous, innocent, naive, simple, sincere, true, unpretending</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]affected, artful, artificial, assuming, dissembling, dissimulating, fake, guileful, insincere, phony 做作的，虚伪的</div>
<h2>unproductive[sound:unproductive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">徒然的，无效的：</font>not productive; idle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]her attempts to write a novel have been unproductive 她一直想写本小说的努力只是徒然</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abortive, barren, fruitless, otiose, profitless, unavailing, unprofitable, unsuccessful, useless, vain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deadly, effective, effectual, efficacious, efficient, potent, productive, profitable, successful, virtuous, telling有效的</div>
<h2>unrequited[sound:unrequited.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无报答的，无报酬的：</font>not reciprocated or returned in kind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]unrequited love 无报答的爱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unreciprocated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]remunerative, gainful, lucrative, profitable 有报酬的</div>
<h2>unruly[sound:unruly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难驾驭的，不守规矩的：</font>difficult or impossible to discipline, control, or rule.</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unruly child 一个不听话的孩子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indocile, indomitable, intractable, recalcitrant, uncontrollable, undisciplined, ungovernable, unmanageable,insubordinate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amenable,  biddable,  compliant,  conformable,  docile,  obedient,  submissive,  tractable,  subdued,  mild, manageable, disciplined 顺从的，守纪律的</div>
<h2>untenable[sound:untenable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">防守不住的，站不住脚的：</font>not able to be defended</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an untenable position 一个站不住脚的立场</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assailable, controversial, open to question 可质疑的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unassailable, undeniable, irrefutable, indisputable, unexceptionable, unimpeachable 无可指责的，无懈可击的</div>
<h2>untold[sound:untold.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">数不清的，无数的：</font>too great or numerous to count</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]untold wealth  不知其数的财富</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incalculable, innumerable, countless, innumerous, uncountable, uncounted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]countable, enumerable, numberable, quantifiable, calculable 可以计算的</div>
<h2>untoward[sound:untoward.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">倒霉的，不吉利的：</font>not favorable, unpropitious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an untoward incident 不幸的事故</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unpropitious, unlucky, misfortunate, unfortunate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]auspicious, propitious, favorable, fortunate 吉利的，幸运的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">难以驯服的，难以驾驭的：</font>given to resisting control or discipline by others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a program for untoward teenagers that is designed to give them the kind of discipline that their parentswere unable or unwilling to administer 一个以任性、桀骜不驯青少年为对象的项目，旨在弥补家长管教不周之处</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]froward, headstrong, intractable, recalcitrant, refractory, unruly, wayward, willful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]controllable, governable, manageable, tractable 易管教的，顺从的</div>
<h2>unwitting[sound:unwitting.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不知道的，未觉察的：</font>not knowing, unaware</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Please forgive my unwitting interruption of your conversation. 请原谅我无意间打断了你们的谈话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]unaware, ignorant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquainted, aware, cognizant, conscious, conversant, grounded, informed, knowing, mindful 有意识的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">偶然的，并非有意的：</font>happening by chance; not intended</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unwitting mistake made in copying the material  在打印过程中一个无心的过失</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]casual, chance, fluky, fortuitous, inadvertent, incidental, unintentional</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calculated, deliberate, intended, intentional, planned, premeditated, prepense 故意的，蓄意的</div>
<h2>unwonted[sound:unwonted.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不习惯的，不寻常的：</font>not habitual or ordinary; unusual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]honored for the unwonted courage he showed in battle  因在战争中表现出的过人的勇气受到嘉奖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]uncommon, unordinary, unusual</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]wonted, usual, routine, habitual, accustomed, customary 平常的</div>
<h2>upbraid[sound:upbraid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（严厉地）谴责，责骂：</font>to reproach severely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]upbraid sb. with his ingratitude 责备某人忘恩负义</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baste, scold, revile, berate, vituperate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]laud, extol, glorify, hymn, magnify, panegyrize, flatter, fawn, cringe, adulterate  赞扬</div>

<h2>vaccinate[sound:vaccinate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">预防接种：</font>to inoculate with a vaccine in order to produce immunity to an infectious disease, suchas diphtheria or typhus</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]vaccinate sb. for smallpox 为某人接种牛痘疫苗以防天花</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]immunize</div>
<h2>vacillate[sound:vacillate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">犹豫不决：</font>to waver in mind, will, or feeling: hesitate in choice of opinions or courses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Parents vacillate between saying no and  yes,  but  actually  neither response seems satisfactory to theirchildren. 父母总是犹豫不定，不知道是该同意还是该反对，但是事实上哪种答案对他们的孩子都不理想。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hesitate, dither, waver, teeter, falter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resolute, decide, dive in, plunge in  决定</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">摇动，摇摆：</font>to sway from one side to the other; oscillate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]oscillate, fluctuate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]equipoise 平衡；静止</div>
<h2>vacuous[sound:vacuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">茫然的，愚蠢的：</font>marked by lack of ideas or intelligence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a movie that was derided for its vacuous dialogue  一部因为对白十分愚蠢而被嘲讽的电影</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]airhead, brainless, dull, dumb, fatuous, foolish, inane, moronic, obtuse, simple, stupid, witless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apt, bright, brilliant, clever, intelligent, keen, sharp, smart 聪明的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vacuity n. 空虚，空白</div>
<h2>vagary[sound:vagary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不可预测的思想或行为：</font>an erratic, unpredictable, or extravagant manifestation, action, or notion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Recently he had been prone to strange vagaries. 最近他逐渐变得行为古怪起来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]caprice, fancy, freak, humor, vagrancy, whimsy</div>
<h2>vague[sound:vague.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">表达不清的：</font>not clearly expressed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The diplomat gave as vague a reply as he could at the press conference. 外交官在记者招待会上尽其所能来含糊其辞。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambiguous, enigmatic, equivocal, indefinite, inexplicit, unclear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear, definite, express, explicit, specific 清楚明确的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">轮廓不清晰的：</font>lacking definite shape, form, or character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the vague outline of a building through the dense fog 浓雾中建筑物模糊的轮廓</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dim, faint, foggy, hazy, indistinct, indistinguishable, misty, murky, nebulous, obscure, opaque</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pellucid 清澈透明的</div>
<h2>valediction[sound:valediction.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">告别：</font>an act of bidding farewell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]farewell, goodbye</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]greeting 欢迎；debut  初次登台，首次亮相</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">告别词：</font>an address or statement of farewell or leave-taking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a valediction given by the college president upon his retirement  大学校长退休时的告别演说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]valedictory adj. 告别的</div>
<h2>valiant[sound:valiant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">勇敢的，英勇的：</font>possessing or acting with bravery or boldness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a valiant and moral knight 一个勇敢和有道德感的骑士‖Despite their valiant efforts, they lost the game.尽管他们英勇奋战，但还是输掉了比赛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, bold, brave, courageous, dauntless, fearless, gallant, intrepid, stalwart, stout, valorous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cowardly, craven, gutless, nerveless, pusillanimous, spineless, timorous 胆怯的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]valiance n. 英勇</div>
<h2>valid[sound:valid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">逻辑上正确的：</font>logically correct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Only further experiments will show whether your theory is valid.  只有进一步的实验才能验证你的理论是否正确。‖Your  argument  isn't  valid  because  you're  taking  what  should  be  the  conclusion  and  using  it  as  apremise. 你的论述逻辑上是错误的，因为你把本该是结论的东西当成了前提条件。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]analytic, coherent, consequent, rational, reasonable, sensible, sound, well-founded, well-grounded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]groundless,  illegitimate,  illogical,  incoherent,  inconsequent,  invalid,  irrational,  unreasonable,  unsound（逻辑上）站不住脚的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]validity n.合乎逻辑</div>
<h2>vanquish[sound:vanquish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">打败，征服：</font>to defeat in a conflict or contest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]vanquished his inner fear 战胜了他内心的恐惧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conquer, dominate, overpower, pacify, subdue, subject, subjugate, subordinate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]capitulate, succor, surrender, yield 头像，屈服</div>
<h2>vapid[sound:vapid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无趣的，乏味的：</font>lacking liveliness, animation, or interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a song with vapid lyrics 一首歌词乏味的歌曲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]driveling, dull, flat, inane, insipid, jejune, sapless, tasteless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, arresting, engaging, engrossing, enthralling, fascinating, immersing, intriguing, riveting 吸引人的</div>
<h2>vaporize[sound:vaporize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使（液体）蒸发：</font>to convert (as by the application of heat or by spraying) into vapor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]gasify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]condense （气体）液化</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">彻底消灭：</font>to destroy by or as if by converting into vapor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The entire fleet was vaporized. 整个舰队都被消灭了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annihilate, decimate, demolish, devastate, extinguish, nuke, pulverize, raze, ruin, smash, wreck</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]build, construct, erect, establish, raise, rear 建造</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vaporous adj. 模糊的，空洞的</div>
<h2>variance[sound:variance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不一致，不和谐：</font>a lack of agreement or harmony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Persistent variance within the band eventually caused it to break up.  乐团中持续不断的分歧最终导致了它的解散。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conflict, disaccord, discordance, disharmony, dissent, division, friction, schism, variation, war</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accord, agreement, concord, concordance, harmony, peace 和谐，一致</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]variant adj. 变体的，不同的</div>
<h2>variegated[sound:variegated.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">杂色的，斑驳的：</font>having discrete markings of different colors</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]variegated costumes of the dancers in the nightclub 夜总会舞者身上色彩斑驳的服装</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chromatic, kaleidoscopic, iridescent, motley, rainbow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]monochromatic 单色的；colorless 无色的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]variegation n. 杂色</div>
<h2>varnish[sound:varnish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">上清漆，使有光泽：</font>to give a smooth and glossy finish to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Don't sit on that chair - I've just varnished it. 不要坐在那张椅子上——我刚刚上过漆。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adorn, bedeck, bedizen, decorate, embellish, garnish, ornament</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">粉饰（令人不悦的东西）：</font>to cover or conceal (as something unpleasant) with something that givesan attractive appearance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She tried to varnish her mistakes. 她试图掩盖她的失误。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blanch, extenuate, gloss, palliate, sugarcoat, veneer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bare, disclose, discover, divulge, expose, reveal, uncloak, uncover, unmask, unveil 揭露</div>
<h2>vault[sound:vault.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">跳起，跳跃：</font>to propel oneself upward or forward into the air</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The horse vaulted over the obstacle with ease. 骏马轻松地跃过障碍物。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bound, hop, jump, leap, spring</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">一跃而至：</font>to accomplish something as if by leaping suddenly or vigorously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She vaulted into a position of wealth. 她一夜暴富。</div>
<h2>vaunt[sound:vaunt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">吹嘘：</font>to speak boastfully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]vaunted his country’s military might 吹嘘他的国家的军事实力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boast, brag, brandish, swagger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]belittle, deprecate, diminish, minimize, underrate, undervalue 轻视，瞧不起</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vaunting adj. 吹嘘的</div>
<h2>veer[sound:veer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">转向，改变航线：</font>to change direction or course</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He veered the car abruptly to the right to avoid a collision. 他向右猛打方向盘以避免撞击</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avert, deviate, deflect, divert, redirect, swerve, swing, wheel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]straighten 直行</div>
<h2>vehement[sound:vehement.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（情感）强烈的，热情的：</font>having or expressing great depth of feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a vehement defender of the rights of minorities 一个立场强烈的少数民族维权者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardent, demonstrative, emotional, fervid, impassioned, intense, passionate, perfervid, torrid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cold, cool, dispassionate, emotionless, impassive, unemotional 冷淡的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vehemence n. 强烈</div>
<h2>venal[sound:venal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">容易贪污受贿的：</font>open to corrupt influence and especially bribery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a judge who is known for being venal and easily bought 一名因为贪污和容易收买而闻名的法官</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bribable, corruptible, dirty, purchasable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]incorruptible 不受贿赂的；scrupulous 正直的</div>
<h2>vendor[sound:vendor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">小贩，商贩：</font>one that sells or vends</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We're thinking of making a deal with that other software vendor.  我们在考虑和那个软件供应商的交易。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]broker, dealer, merchandiser, retailer, seller, trader</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]buyer, consumer, purchaser 消费者</div>
<h2>veneer[sound:veneer.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">薄木板，用以贴在家具外面的饰面板：</font>a thin surface layer, as of finely grained wood, glued to abase of inferior material</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cover, fa ade, mask</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]center, core, kernel 核心</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">粉饰（不好的东西）：</font>to cover over with a veneer; especially to conceal (as a defect of character)under a superficial and deceptive attractiveness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blanch, extenuate, gloss, palliate, sugarcoat, varnish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bare, disclose, discover, divulge, expose, reveal, uncloak, uncover, unmask, unveil 揭露</div>
