<h2>venial[sound:venial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可宽恕的：</font>easily excused or forgiven</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Taking the restaurant's menu as a souvenir seems like a venial offense. 把餐厅的菜单当成纪念品带走似乎是一个可以宽恕的罪行。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]condonable, excusable, forgivable, pardonable, remissible, remittable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heinous, indefensible, inexcusable, mortal, unforgivable, unpardonable 罪大恶极的，不可饶恕的</div>
<h2>venom[sound:venom.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">毒液：</font>poisonous matter normally secreted by some animals as snakes, scorpions, or bees</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an antidote to snake venom 蛇毒的解药</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]toxic, toxin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]antidote 解药</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">恶意，恶毒的用心：</font>the desire to cause pain for the satisfaction of doing harm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She spoke of him with venom in her voice. 她的评论怀揣着恶意。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]despite, malevolence, maliciousness, malignance, malignity, meanness, nastiness, spite, viciousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comity, friendship, goodwill  友善</div>
<h2>veracious[sound:veracious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">诚实的，说实话的：</font>being in the habit of telling the truth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a veracious witness 诚实的证人 ‖He has a reputation for being veracious, so people generally takehis word for things. 他诚实的名声让其他人通常都相信他说的话</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]honest, truthful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dishonest, lying, mendacious, prevaricating, untruthful 说谎的，不诚实的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精确的，准确的：</font>precise, accurate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a novel that presents a fairly veracious and unvarnished picture of the lives of affluent suburbanites 一部准确而不加修饰地描述郊区富人生活的小说</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accurate, exact, precise, proper, right, true</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]false, improper, inaccurate, incorrect, inexact, untrue, wrong 不准确的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]veracity n. 诚实</div>
<h2>verbatim[sound:verbatim.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adv. <font color="#aa00ff">逐字地，一字不差地：</font>in the exact words</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You can't just copy the encyclopedia article verbatim for your report - that's plagiarism.  你不能一字不差地抄百科全书上的内容——这是剽窃。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ad verbum, directly, exactly, word for word</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inaccurately, inexactly 不准确地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]verbalism n. 言辞，单词</div>
<h2>verbose[sound:verbose.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冗长的，啰嗦的：</font>containing more words than necessary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a verbose orator 啰嗦的演讲者‖She has a verbose writing style. 她的文风很啰嗦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circuitous, circumlocutory, diffuse, garrulous, long-winded, prolix, rambling, verbose, windy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brief, compact, concise, pithy, succinct, terse 简洁的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]verbosity n. 冗长，啰嗦</div>
<h2>verdant[sound:verdant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（因长满植物而）翠绿的，郁郁葱葱的：</font>green with vegetation; covered with green growth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]verdant fields  翠绿的田野</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]green, grown, leafy, luxuriant, overgrown</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]barren, impoverished, infertile, leafless, sterile 贫瘠的</div>
<h2>verify[sound:verify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">校验，证实：</font>to determine or test the truth or accuracy of, as by comparison, investigation, orreference</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We need to verify your passport. 我们需要校验阁下的护照。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attest, authenticate, certify, corroborate, substantiate, support, validate, vindicate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disprove, rebut, refute 反驳，驳斥</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]verified adj. 经证实的；verification n. 证实</div>
<h2>verisimilar[sound:verisimilar.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">似乎真实的：</font>appearing to be true or real</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a verisimilar tale 一个似乎为真的传奇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]likely, plausible, probable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]implausible, incredible, unbelievable  难以置信的</div>
<h2>veritable[sound:veritable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">真正的，确实的：</font>being in fact the thing named and not false, unreal, or imaginary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a veritable manuscript 一份原稿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]authentic, credible, genuine, real, true, unquestionable, bona fide</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bogus, counterfeit, fake, false, mock, phony, pseudo, sham, spurious 伪造的，虚假的</div>
<h2>vernacular[sound:vernacular.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">方言：</font>a nonstandard language or dialect of a place, region, or country</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]phrases that occur in the common vernacular  常见方言中的词组</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]argot, cant, dialect, jargon, lingo, slang</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">非正式的，口头的：</font>used in or suitable for speech and not formal writing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]writes essays in a very easy-to-read, vernacular style 用一种易懂的口头化风格写作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conversational, informal, nonliterary, vulgar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bookish, formal, learned, literary 书面的，正式的</div>
<h2>versatile[sound:versatile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多才多艺的，全能的：</font>able to do many different kinds of things</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We have found a versatile baseball player who can play any position. 我们发现了一个能打任何位置的全能型球员。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adaptable, all-around, ambidextrous, protean, universal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]limited 受限制的，有限的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易改变的：</font>changing or fluctuating readily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a versatile disposition 多变的性格</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capricious, changeable, fluid, inconstant, mercurial, skittish, temperamental, variable, volatile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]certain,  changeless,  constant,  immutable,  invariable,  settled,  stable,  stationary,  steady,  unchangeable, unvarying 固定的，不变的</div>
<h2>verse[sound:verse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使精通，使熟悉：</font>to familiarize by close association, study, or experience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]well versed in the theater 精通剧院‖While in prison, he versed himself in the rights of the incarcerated.当他身处监狱时，他通过自学熟悉了囚犯所享有的权利。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquaint, familiarize, inform</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]misinform, mislead 误导</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">诗歌：</font>a composition using rhythm and often rhyme to create a lyrical effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]composed a short verse for his father’s birthday 为他父亲的生日创作了一首小诗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ballad, lyric, poetry, song</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]prose 散文</div>
<h2>vertigo[sound:vertigo.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">眩晕：</font>a dizzy confused state of mind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He had a dreadful attack of vertigo at the top of the tower. 他站在塔顶，感到一阵令人窒息的眩晕。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dizziness, giddiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sobriety 清醒</div>
<h2>verve[sound:verve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">活力，热情：</font>vitality, liveliness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The instrumentalists played with skill and verve. 器乐表演者们有着高超的技巧与饱满的热情</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animation, dynamism, energy, exuberance, liveliness, robustness, vibrancy, vigorousness, vim, vitality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lethargy, listlessness, sluggishness, torpidity 精神不振</div>
<h2>vessel[sound:vessel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n.<font color="#aa00ff">管：</font>a tube or canal (as an artery) in which a body fluid is contained and conveyed or circulated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]blood vessel 血管</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]artery, vein</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">船，舰艇：</font>a watercraft bigger than a rowboat</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the largest military vessel afloat  最大的军用舰艇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boat, cruiser, destroyer, ferry, ship, watercraft</div>
<h2>vestige[sound:vestige.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">微小的遗迹，小痕迹：</font>the smallest quantity or trace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A few strange words carved on a stone were the only vestige of the lost civilization. 石碑上刻着的几个奇怪的字符是这个失落文明的唯一的遗迹。‖the  fossilized  vestige  of  a  dinosaur  that  traversed  that  muddylandscape millions of years ago 千万年横跨那块泥泞土壤的恐龙的化石碎片</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]echo, ghost, relic, remain, remnant, residual, shadow, trace</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vestigial adj. 残留的；退化的</div>
<h2>vestigial[sound:vestigial.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">退化的，发育不全的：</font>(of certain organs or parts of organisms) having attained a simple structureand reduced size and function during the evolution of the species</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]snake that has vestigial limbs 拥有退化四肢的蛇</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]incomplete, rudimentary, undeveloped</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adult, full-blown, full-fledged, matured, ripe, ripened 成熟的，发育完全的</div>
<h2>veteran[sound:veteran.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">老兵，有丰富经验的人：</font>one having knowledge or ability gained through long experience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]As a veteran of overseas travel, she offered us solid advice about planning our trip. 作为一名资深的旅行家，她给了我们提供了许多关于旅行规划的中肯建议。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]doyen, expert, master, maven, warhorse</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beginner, colt, fledgling, freshman, greenhorn, neophyte, novice, recruit, rookie, tenderfoot, tyro  新手</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">经验丰富的，资深的：</font>having or showing exceptional knowledge, experience, or skill in a fieldof endeavor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She is a veteran teacher who can mentor new teachers. 她的教师资历都老到可以教新教师了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accomplished, adept, consummate, experienced, masterful, professed, skilled, versed, virtuoso</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amateur, inexperienced, inexpert, unprofessional, unseasoned, unskilled, unskillful 业余的，经验不足的</div>
<h2>veto[sound:veto.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./vt. 否决，禁止：to forbid or prohibit authoritatively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The President vetoed the bill. 总统否决了提案。‖We wanted to do a cross-country trip, but our parentsvetoed it. 我们想来一次跨国旅行，但是父母不肯批准。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blackball, decline, disallow, disapprove, kill, negative, refuse, reject</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accredit, approbate, authorize, clear, confirm, finalize, formalize, ratify, sanction, warrant 批准</div>
<h2>vex[sound:vex.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使烦恼，使恼怒：</font>to bring trouble, distress, or agitation to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]vexed by her son's failure to clean his room 因为她儿子不清理房间而恼怒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggravate, annoy, bother, exasperate, gall, grate, irk, nettle, peeve, rile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appease, assuage, conciliate, mollify, placate, propitiate 平息怒火</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vexation n. 烦恼</div>
<h2>viable[sound:viable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可行的：</font>capable of being done or carried out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a viable solution to the problem  解决问题的一个可行方案</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]achievable, attainable, doable, feasible, practicable, realizable, workable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hopeless, impossible, impracticable, infeasible, unattainable, unviable, unworkable 不可行的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]viability n. 可行性</div>
<h2>vicarious[sound:vicarious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">代理的，取代的：</font>performed or suffered by one person as a substitute for another  or to thebenefit or advantage of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]use Internet as a vicarious form of social life 把互联网当作一种虚拟的社交生活</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indirect, substitute, surrogate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]firsthand 直接的</div>
<h2>vicious[sound:vicious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凶恶的，恶毒的：</font>having or showing the desire to inflict severe pain and suffering on others</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]vicious slander 恶意的诽谤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]atrocious, barbaric, barbarous, brutal, butcherly, fiendish, heartless, inhumane, sadistic, savage, truculent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benign, benignant, compassionate, humane, kind, kindhearted, merciful, sympathetic 仁慈的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">猛烈的：</font>marked by violence or ferocity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a vicious storm ripped through the region  在境内肆虐的强烈风暴</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dreadful, excruciating, explosive, fearsome, ferocious, fierce, intensive, profound, vehement, violent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]light, moderate, soft 轻柔的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]viciousness n. 邪恶</div>
<h2>vicissitude[sound:vicissitude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">自然变化：</font>natural change or mutation visible in nature or in human affairs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]vicissitude of daily life 日常生活的跌宕起伏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fluctuation, mutation, shift, variation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]uniformity 一致性，无差异</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vicissitudinous adj. 有变化的</div>
<h2>victimize[sound:victimize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使受骗：</font>to subject to deception or fraud</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]victimized by a confidence man with a slick story 被一个骗子用圆滑的故事欺骗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cheat, cozen, deceive, defraud, dupe, fool, hoax, swindle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disabuse, disenchant, disillusion, undeceive 使醒悟</div>
<h2>vigilant[sound:vigilant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">警醒的，警惕的：</font>alertly watchful especially to avoid danger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Police warned the public to be vigilant and report anything suspicious. 警方要求公众保持警惕，并上报任何有嫌疑的人或事。‖When traveling through the city, tourists should be extra vigilant. 在这个城市旅行的游客应该保持格外的警惕。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alert, attentive, awake, cautious, observant, sharp, watchful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careless, heedless, inattentive, unmindful, unthinking, unwary 不谨慎的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vigilance n. 警惕</div>
<h2>vignette[sound:vignette.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">简介短文：</font>a vivid representation in words of someone or something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The  general's  memoirs  are  filled  with  revealing  vignettes  of  some  of  the  war’s  most  compellingpersonalities. 将军的回忆录里充满了短小的文章，它们揭露了战争中最引人注意的人物。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]definition, delineation, depiction, picture, portrait, portraiture, portrayal, rendering, sketch</div>
<h2>vigorous[sound:vigorous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精力旺盛的：</font>having active strength of body or mind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He remains vigorous despite being over 80 years old. 尽管他已80 高龄，但仍活力不减</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brisk, dynamic, energetic, lively, robust, spirited, vital</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dull, lethargic, listless, sluggish, torpid 没有精神的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">强健的：</font>able to withstand hardship, strain, or exposure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]vigorous and sturdy little sheep bred to live in mountainous regions 在山区喂养的健壮的小羊</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hard, hardened, inured, rugged, stout, strong, sturdy, tough, toughened</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delicate, soft, tender, weak 脆弱的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vigor n. 精力</div>
<h2>vilify[sound:vilify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">诽谤，辱骂：</font>to utter slanderous and abusive statements against</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]be vilified by the press because of her radical views 因为她激进的观点而被媒体抨击</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asperse, blacken, calumniate, defame, libel, malign, smear, traduce</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acclaim, applaud, commend, praise 表扬</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vilification n. 辱骂</div>
<h2>vim[sound:vim.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">活力，精力：</font>robust energy and enthusiasm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A little rest should give me back some of my vim. 稍事休息一会我应该就能回复些许精力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animation, bounce, dynamism, energy, liveliness, robustness, verve, vibrancy, vigorousness, vitality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lethargy, listlessness, sluggishness, torpidity 精神不振</div>
<h2>vindicate[sound:vindicate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">为…平反，为…辩护，使无罪：</font>to free from allegation or blame</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The evidence would completely vindicate him. 这个证据将彻底证明他的清白。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absolve, acquit, exculpate, exonerate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]incriminate 使有罪</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">证明，证实：</font>to give evidence or testimony to the truth or factualness of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Recent discoveries have generally vindicated the physicist's theories. 近期的发现整体上证明了物理学家的理论。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attest, authenticate, certify, corroborate, substantiate, support, validate, verify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disprove, rebut, refute 反驳，驳斥</div>
<h2>vindictive[sound:vindictive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">复仇的（有寻仇倾向的）：</font>disposed to seek revenge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]vindictive hatred for his brother 对他兄弟的仇恨</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avenging, resentful, retaliatory, revengeful, vengeful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forgiving, merciful, relenting 仁慈的</div>
<h2>virtuoso[sound:virtuoso.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">艺术鉴赏家，专家：</font>a person with masterly skill or technique in the arts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a violin virtuoso 资深小提琴艺术家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adept, connoisseur, maestro, master, maven, proficient, wizard</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amateur, inexpert 业余爱好者，非专业玩家</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">经验丰富的，技艺精湛的：</font>having or showing exceptional knowledge, experience, or skill in afield of endeavor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The  American  virtuoso  cellist  Lynn  Harrell  joins  the  orchestra  as  soloist  in  Shostakovich ’s  technically challenging Cello Concerto No 2. 来自美国的技艺精湛的大提琴家林恩·哈雷尔作为独奏者加入了乐队，共同演绎肖斯塔科维奇充满挑战的《第二大提琴协奏曲》。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accomplished, adept, consummate, experienced, masterful, professed, skilled, versed, veteran</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amateur, inexperienced, inexpert, unprofessional, unseasoned, unskilled, unskillful 业余的，经验不足的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]virtuosity n. 精湛技艺</div>
<h2>virtuous[sound:virtuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">品德高尚的，正直的：</font>having or showing virtue, especially moral excellence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Virtuous behavior is its own reward. 美德本身就是一种回报。‖She  felt  that  she  had  made  a  virtuousdecision by donating the money to charity. 她觉得把钱捐赠给慈善基金是一个高尚的决定。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decent, ethical, honest, honorable, moral, noble, righteous, straight, upright</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bad, evil, immoral, indecent, sinful, unethical, unrighteous, wicked, wrong 邪恶的</div>
<h2>virulent[sound:virulent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有毒的：</font>extremely poisonous or venomous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]virulent bacteria 有毒的细菌</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]poisonous, toxic, venomous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]innocuous 无害的；healthy, salubrious, wholesome 有益健康的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凶残的：</font>marked by a rapid, severe, and destructive course</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a virulent look on her face 面露凶色</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cruel, malevolent, malicious, malignant, spiteful, vicious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benevolent, benign, benignant, loving 仁慈的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]virulence n. 毒性，恶毒</div>
<h2>viscid[sound:viscid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有粘性的：</font>having a glutinous consistency</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]viscid tree resin 粘性的树脂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adherent, adhesive, clingy, gluey, glutinous, tenacious, viscous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]slick  光滑的</div>
<h2>viscous[sound:viscous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粘稠的，粘的：</font>viscid; sticky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]viscous syrup that takes forever to pour from a narrow-neck bottle 不知要花多久才能从窄口瓶中倒出来的粘稠糖浆</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]glutinous, syrup, viscid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fluid, watery 流体的，易流动的</div>
<h2>visionary[sound:visionary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">空想的，不切实际的：</font>having or marked by a tendency to be guided more by ideals than by reality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a visionary plan for a manned flight to Mars 一个构想中的载人火星计划</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]idealistic, imaginary, impractical, quixotic, romantic, utopian</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pragmatic 实事求是的，务实的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">幻觉的：</font>not real and existing only in the imagination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]claimed to have had visionary experiences of hell 宣称有过到达地狱的幻觉</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chimerical, dreamy, fabulous, fantastic, illusory, phantom, unreal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]actual, existent, existing, real 真实存在的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有远见的：</font>having or marked by foresight and imagination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a visionary and legendary leader 一个有远见的传奇性领袖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]farseeing, farsighted, forehanded, foreseeing, forethoughtful, prescient, proactive, provident</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]improvident, myopic, shortsighted 目光短浅的</div>
<h2>vitality[sound:vitality.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">活力，生命力：</font>physical or mental vigor especially when highly developed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Her vitality seemed to spread to everyone around her. 她的活力似乎能影响身边的每一个人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animation, bounce, dynamism, energy, liveliness, robustness, verve, vibrancy, vigorousness, vim</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lethargy, listlessness, sluggishness, torpidity 精神不振</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vitalize vt. 激发，使有活力</div>
<h2>vitiate[sound:vitiate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">削弱，损害：</font>to reduce the value or impair the quality of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Too many grammatical errors can vitiate the soundness of your writing, so double-check is recommendedbefore submission. 太多的语法错误会削弱你论证的力度，所以强烈建议交稿前检查几遍。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blemish, cripple, deface, degrade, deteriorate, flaw, harm, impair, mar, undermine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doctor, fix, mend, patch, rebuild, recondition, reconstruct, renovate, repair, revamp 修复，再生</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">（在道德、审美上）降低，堕落：</font>to debase in moral or aesthetic status</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Penchant for coarse language vitiates what is otherwise a refined literary style. 使用粗俗语言的倾向使得本该是一个高雅的文体变得不堪入目。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abase, cheapen, corrupt, debauch, demean, demoralize, deprave, pervert, profane, prostitute, subvert</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elevate, ennoble, uplift  使高尚</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vitiated adj. 受损害的</div>
<h2>vitriolic[sound:vitriolic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（言辞）刻薄的：</font>bitterly scathing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]vitriolic criticism 刻薄的批评</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acerbic, acid, acrid, bitter, biting, caustic, corrosive, harsh, mordant, scalding, scathing, sharp, tart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]balmy, benign, bland, delicate, light, mellow, mild, nonabrasive, soft, soothing, tender 柔和的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vitriol n. 刻薄的话语</div>
<h2>vituperate[sound:vituperate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">谩骂，责骂：</font>to abuse or censure severely or abusively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]was vituperated for betraying his friends 因为背叛他的朋友而被责骂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abuse, assail, belabor, berate, castigate, excoriate, lambaste, reprimand, scold, rail, revile, upbraid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]admire, commend, laud, praise 赞赏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vituperative adj. 辱骂的</div>
<h2>vivacious[sound:vivacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">活泼的，快活的：</font>lively in temper, conduct, or spirit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a vivacious girl who became a successful sales rep 一个成为了成功销售代表的活泼女孩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]active, animated, bouncing, brisk, energetic, frisky, kinetic, mettlesome, spirited, sprightly, vital, zippy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dead, inactive, inanimate, languid, languorous, leaden, lifeless, listless, spiritless, vapid 无活力的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vivacity n. 活力，活泼</div>
<h2>vociferous[sound:vociferous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">喧哗的，大叫大嚷的：</font>making, given to, or marked by noisy and vehement outcry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Vociferous opponents of the bill protested angrily outside the Congress. 议案的反对者在国会外愤怒地举行了声势浩大的抗议活动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blatant, boisterous, clamant, clamorous, obstreperous, strident, yowling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reticent, taciturn 沉默的；serene, tranquil 宁静的</div>
<h2>volatile[sound:volatile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多变的：</font>characterized by or subject to rapid or unexpected change</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a boss of volatile moods 一个性情多变的老板 ‖The stock market can be very volatile. 股市瞬息万变。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capricious, changeable, fluid, inconstant, mercurial, skittish, temperamental, variable, versatile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]certain,  changeless,  constant,  immutable,  invariable,  settled,  stable,  stationary,  steady,  unchangeable,unvarying 固定的，不变的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]volatility n. 易变性，易挥发性</div>
<h2>volition[sound:volition.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">意志，自愿选择的行为：</font>the act or power of making one's own choices or decisions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]beyond his volition or control 超出了他的意志和控制范围</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choice, decision, discretion, will</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coercion, compulsion, constraint, duress, force, pressure 强迫，迫使</div>
<h2>voluble[sound:voluble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">健谈的，话多的：</font>characterized by ready or rapid speech</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The voluble gadfly ruined the party. 聚会被那个话又多又让人讨厌的人破坏了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chatty, eloquent, garrulous, glib, loquacious, talkative, vocative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reticent, taciturn 沉默的；laconic, reserved, succinct 惜字如金的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]volubility n. 口若悬河</div>
<h2>voluminous[sound:voluminous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">卷数多的，大量的，庞大的：</font>having great volume, fullness, size, or number</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]trying to keep a track of voluminous academic database 尝试追踪数目庞大的学术数据库</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]colossal, considerable, elephantine, enormous, gargantuan, gigantic, mammoth, numerous, oversize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]scanty, scarce 缺乏的；dwarf, little, small, undersized 数量少的</div>
<h2>voluptuous[sound:voluptuous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">奢侈逸乐的，沉溺酒色的：</font>given  to  or  spent  in  enjoyments  of  luxury,  pleasure,  or  sensualgratifications</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They spent a long and voluptuous holiday in Venice. 他们在威尼斯度过了一个漫长而奢华的假期。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carnal, epicurean, luscious, lush, luxurious, indulgent, sensual, sensuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ascetic, spartan, self-denying 克己的，自制的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]voluptuary n. 酒色之徒</div>
<h2>voracious[sound:voracious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有很大食量的，贪吃的：</font>having a huge appetite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He has a voracious appetite. 他的食量惊人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]edacious, esurient, gluttonous, swinish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abstemious, abstentious 有节制的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">贪婪的，如饥似渴的：</font>having or marked by an insatiable appetite for an activity or pursuit</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a voracious reader who locked himself up in the study 一个把自己锁在书房的贪婪的读者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquisitive, avid, covetous, grasping, greedy, hungry, rapacious, ravenous, thirsty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathetic, indifferent, uneager, unenthusiastic  无所谓的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]voracity n. 食欲，贪婪</div>
<h2>votary[sound:votary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">崇拜者，信徒：</font>a person who is fervently devoted, as to a leader or ideal; a faithful follower</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]votaries of the religious leader 宗教领袖的追随者们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acolyte, adherent, devotee, disciple, fan, fanatic, partisan, pupil, zealot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bellwether, leader 领导；apostate, defector, renegade, traitor, turncoat 叛徒</div>
<h2>vouch[sound:vouch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">担保，声称为真：</font>to declare (something) to be true or genuine; to give a guarantee</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]willing to vouch for her integrity 愿意担保她的人格</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attest, avouch, guarantee, testify, warrant</div>
<h2>vulgar[sound:vulgar.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗俗的，无教养的：</font>morally crude, undeveloped, or unregenerate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is a vulgar man but his music is quite divine. 虽然他是一个粗俗的人，但他的音乐却十分神圣。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bawdy, coarse, crass, crude, dirty, filthy, gross, lowbred, indecent, nasty, obscene, ribald, rude, uncouth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]civilized, cultivated, cultured, genteel, polished, refined, urbane, well-bred 有教养的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">口头的，非正式的：</font>used in or suitable for speech and not formal writing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Latin was once the language of scholars, and English the vulgar language used by the common people.很久以前拉丁语才是学术界的官方语言，而英语是普通百姓所使用的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conversational, informal, nonliterary, unliterary, vernacular</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bookish, formal, learned, literary 书面的，正式的</div>
<h2>vulnerable[sound:vulnerable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易受攻击的，脆弱的：</font>open to attack or damage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The troops were deployed in a vulnerable position. 部队被部署在了一个容易遭受攻击的位置。‖The  fortwas undefended and vulnerable. 堡垒没有设防，十分脆弱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assailable, endangered, exposed, subject, susceptible</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]guarded, protected, shielded 有保护的；invincible, invulnerable 无敌的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vulnerability n. 弱点，易受伤害</div>
<h2>waddle[sound:waddle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">摇摇摆摆地走：</font>to walk with short steps that tilt the body from side to side</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The duck waddled back into the water. 鸭子一摇一摆地回到了水中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]careen, dodder, reel, teeter, totter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]waddling adj. 摇摇摆摆的</div>
<h2>waffle[sound:waffle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">胡扯：</font>to talk or write foolishly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This lecturer will waffle on for hours.  这个老师会胡说八道地扯几个小时。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]babble, blather, drivel, gabble, prattle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]articulate  清楚地说</div>
<h2>waft[sound:waft.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">飘荡，漂浮：</font>to float easily and gently, as on the air</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Heavenly aromas wafted from the kitchen. 令人欣悦的香气从厨房飘出。‖A  feather  wafted  past  usand settled on the grass. 一片羽毛飘过我们身边，落在草地上。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]buoy, drift, glide, hang, hover, raft</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]flounder, sink  沉没；submerge  下沉</div>
<h2>wag[sound:wag.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">幽默诙谐的人：</font>a humorous or droll person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some wag wrote a droll satire on the scandal. 一些有才的人就丑闻写了一个搞怪的讽刺。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]comedian, comic, droll, humorist, joker, wit</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">摆动：</font>to move to and fro or up and down especially with quick jerky motions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The dog wagged its tail. 狗摆动着它的尾巴。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]swish, switch, waggle</div>
<h2>wan[sound:wan.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">苍白的，病态的：</font>suggestive of poor health</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She looks a little wan after all that tiring work.  在完成那些繁重的工作之后她看起来有些虚弱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ashen, ashy, blanched, livid, lurid, sickly, pale, pallid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blooming, florid, flush, full-blooded, glowing, red, rosy, rubicund, ruddy, sanguine 红润的，健康的</div>
<h2>wanderlust[sound:wanderlust.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">旅行癖：</font>a very strong or irresistible impulse to travel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His wanderlust would not allow him to stay long in one spot. 他对旅行的渴望让他不可能在一处久待。</div>
<h2>wane[sound:wane.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">减少，衰退，降低：</font>to decrease in size, extent, or degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In the evening the storm finally waned. 傍晚时分风暴终于减弱了。‖The moon waxes and then wanes.月有阴晴圆缺。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abate, decline, diminish, dwindle, ease, ebb, fall, lessen, lower, moderate, recede, shrink, subside, taper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accumulate,  balloon,  burgeon,  enlarge,  escalate,  expand,  grow,  increase,  intensify,  mushroom,  rise,snowball, soar, wax 增加，扩大，上升</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]waning adj. 衰退的，减少的</div>
<h2>want[sound:want.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">短缺：</font>the condition or quality of lacking something usual or necessary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There's a notable want of teachers in rural areas. 农村地区存在着值得注意的师资短缺问题</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absence, dearth, deficiency, drought, famine, inadequacy, insufficiency, lack, paucity, scarcity, shortage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abundance, adequacy, amplitude, opulence, plenitude, plenty, sufficiency, wealth 丰富，大量</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">渴望：</font>to have a strong desire for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I want a new car so badly! 我太想要一辆新车了！‖She wanted more time to finish the test. 她希望能有更多的时间来完成考试。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ache, covet, crave, hunger, itch, long, lust, pine, repine, thirst, wish, yearn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abhor, abominate, despise, detest, execrate, hate, loathe 厌恶，反感</div>
<h2>warmonger[sound:warmonger.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">好战者：</font>one who urges or attempts to stir up war</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Fortunately, the warmongers met with overwhelming opposition. 幸运的是，好战者们碰到了巨大的阻力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belligerent, hawk, jingoist, war hawk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dove, pacifist 和平主义者</div>
<h2>warp[sound:warp.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使偏向：</font>to turn from a correct or proper course</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avert, deflect, divert, veer</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]straighten 使变直，使回归正轨</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">扭曲，变形：</font>to twist (something) out of a natural or normal shape or condition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The heat caused the wood to warp. 高温使得木头变形了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deform, misshape, screw, torture</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">曲解：</font>to change so much as to create a wrong impression or alter the meaning of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The faulty English translation really warps the meaning of the original Chinese text. 错误的英语翻译曲解了中文的原意。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]distort, falsify, misinterpret, misrepresent, twist</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarify, clear, explain, illuminate, illustrate  澄清</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]warped adj. 弯曲的，变形的</div>
<h2>warrant[sound:warrant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">承诺：</font>to assume responsibility for the satisfactory quality or performance of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The computer company unconditionally warrants all of its products for one full year. 这个电脑公司对所有的产品提供为期一年的质量保证。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assure, avouch, guarantee, vouch</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">批准，认可：</font>to give official acceptance of as satisfactory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The law warrants these measures. 法律允许这些措施。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]approbate, authorize, clear, confirm, finalize, formalize, ratify, sanction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decline, deny, disallow, disapprove, negative, reject, veto 禁止，否决</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]warranted adj. 有正当理由的；warranty n.保证，承诺</div>
<h2>wary[sound:wary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">小心的，机警的，谨慎的：</font>marked by keen caution, cunning, and watchfulness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]kept a wary eye out for signs of the enemy 对敌人出现的征兆保持警惕</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alert, cautious, chary, circumspect, conservative, guarded, heedful, vigilant, watchful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careless, heedless, incautious, unguarded, unmindful, unwary 不谨慎的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]wariness n. 谨慎，小心</div>
<h2>wastrel[sound:wastrel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">肆意挥霍的人，败家子：</font>one who expends resources foolishly and self-indulgently</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He ended up being a wastrel and a drunkard.  他最后成了一个花天酒地的败家子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fritterer, profligate, spender, spendthrift, squanderer, waster</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]economizer, penny-pincher  节约的人；hoarder, miser, niggard 吝啬鬼</div>
