<h2>wax[sound:wax.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">月亮渐满：</font>to increase in phase or intensity, used chiefly of the moon, other satellites, and inferiorplanets</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]wane 月亮渐亏</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">用蜡涂、处理或上光：</font>to coat (something) with a slippery substance in order to reduce friction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wax the floor 给地板打蜡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]grease, oil, slick</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coarsen, rough, roughen 使粗糙</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">增大，增强：</font>to increase in size, numbers, strength, prosperity, or intensity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The commitment of the young volunteers to the cause seems to wax. 青年志愿者们对于这项事业的投入似乎在增多。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accelerate, accumulate, appreciate, balloon, boom, burgeon, enlarge, escalate, expand, proliferate, rise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contract, decrease, diminish, dwindle, lessen, recede 减少，减弱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]waxing adj. 增加的</div>
<h2>waylay[sound:waylay.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">埋伏，伏击：</font>to lie in wait for or attack from ambush</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Unsuspecting tourists are often waylaid by gangs.  不警惕的旅客们常常被犯罪团伙偷袭。‖We  werewaylaid by a group of protestors with rocks. 我们被一群示威者用石头偷袭了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambush, assault, lurk, surprise</div>
<h2>welter[sound:welter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">混乱；动乱：</font>a state of wild disorder</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There was a welter of pushing and shoving. 到处是推搡和拥挤的混乱局面。‖The  troop  withdrawal would plunge the country into a welter of anarchy and endless civil war.  撤军会使得这个国家陷入无政府的动乱和无尽的内战中。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disturbance, furor, hurricane, pandemonium, turmoil, turmoil, uproar, whirl</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, peace, tranquility 平静，宁静；order 秩序</div>
<h2>wheedle[sound:wheedle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（用花言巧语）诱惑，哄骗：</font>to persuade or attempt to persuade by flattery or guile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wheedled him into working for them 哄骗他为他们工作‖She pleaded and wheedled, but I wouldn't beswayed. 她软磨硬泡地求我，但我仍不动摇。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adulate, blandish, cajole, coax</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coerce, compel, demand, force, oblige, require 迫使，强求</div>
<h2>whet[sound:whet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">磨快：</font>to sharpen by rubbing on or with something (as a stone)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]whetted the dagger with the grindstone 用磨石把匕首磨锋利</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]edge, grind, hone, stone, strop</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blunt, dull 使变钝</div>
<h2>whiff[sound:whiff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">微风：</font>a quick puff or slight gust especially of air, odor, gas, smoke, or spray</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A whiff of fresh air reinvigorated him.  一股清新的空气让他恢复了活力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breath, puff</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blast  强烈的气流</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">细微的信号，略微痕迹：</font>an almost imperceptible sign of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Even a whiff of appreciation for everything I've done for her would have been nice. 她哪怕是对我为她的付出流露出一丁点的感激之情也好啊。 ‖Humanity is unregenerable and hates the language of conformity, since conformity has a whiff of the inhuman about it. (Anthony Burgess) 人性是不能改造也无发统一的，因为一致性本身带有一点点不人道的意味。（安东尼 伯吉斯）</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flicker, glimmer, suggestion, touch, trace</div>
<h2>whimsical[sound:whimsical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">反复无常的：</font>prone to sudden illogical changes of mind, ideas, or actions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It’s hard to make plans with such a whimsical friend. 和这样一个反复无常的朋友做决定是很困难的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capricious, fickle, freakish, mercurial, volatile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resolute, unwavering 坚决的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]whimsicality n. 反复无常</div>
<h2>wholesome[sound:wholesome.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有益身心健康的：</font>promoting mental, moral, or social health</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]trying to eat a more wholesome diet 尽可能有更健康的饮食习惯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]healthy, restorative, salubrious, recuperative, tonic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]insalubrious, noxious, unhealthy, unwholesome 不健康的，有害的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]wholesomeness n. 健康</div>
<h2>wicked[sound:wicked.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">邪恶的：</font>morally very bad</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a wicked urge to steal just for the sake of stealing 纯粹为了偷盗而偷盗的邪恶冲动</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dark, evil, immoral, iniquitous, nefarious, sinful, vicious, villainous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decent, ethical, good, honest, honorable, moral, righteous, sublime, upright, virtuous 高尚的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]wickedness n. 邪恶</div>
<h2>wince[sound:wince.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">畏缩：</font>to shrink back involuntarily as from pain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]winced at the horrible corpses 在令人恐惧的尸体面前畏缩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blench, cringe, quail, quiver, recoil, shrink, tremble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confront, face, meet 直面；challenge 挑战</div>
<h2>windbag[sound:windbag.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">健谈的人：</font>an exhaustively talkative person</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With a windbag like that, who needs a wind farm to meet our energy needs  有了他这样一个多话的“吹风机”，谁还要风力发电厂来满足电力需求呢？</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]babbler, conversationalist, gabbler, gasbag, prattler</div>
<h2>windy[sound:windy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冗长的：</font>characterized by wearisome verbosity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a windy saleswoman who told us a lot more than we wanted to know about vacuum cleaners 一个啰嗦的女销售员，一个劲地说着我们不想知道的关于吸尘器的细节</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]circuitous, circumlocutory, diffuse, garrulous, prolix, rambling, verbose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]compact, concise, crisp, pithy, succinct, terse  简洁的</div>
<h2>winsome[sound:winsome.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迷人的，漂亮的：</font>generally  pleasing and engaging  often because of a childlike charm andinnocence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]fascinated by her winsome smile 为她动人一笑所倾倒</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adorable, charming, disarming, enchanting, endearing, sweet, winning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abhorrent, abominable, detestable, hateful, loathsome, odious 令人厌恶的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]winsomeness n. 迷人</div>
<h2>wit[sound:wit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">机智，智慧：</font>the natural ability to perceive and understand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lacked the wit to judge  缺乏判断的智慧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]astuteness, brilliance, foxiness, intelligence, keenness, perspicacity, sagacity, sharpness, shrewdness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brainlessness, dullness, fatuity, lunacy, silliness 愚蠢</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">智者，有智慧的人：</font>a person of exceptional intelligence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a man who fancied himself as a great wit  一个把自己想象成智慧的化身的男子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]illuminati, pundit, sage, savant, scholar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dolt, fool, idiot, simpleton 傻子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]witty adj. 有智慧的</div>
<h2>withdraw[sound:withdraw.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">撤退：</font>to take back or away</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The army was forced to withdraw from the frontline. 部队被迫从前线撤回</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]recede, retreat, fall back</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advance 前进；place, position, put 放置，安置</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]withdrawal n. 撤退；withdrawn adj. 性格内向的，离群的</div>
<h2>wither[sound:wither.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">枯萎，凋谢：</font>to become dry and sapless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Amaranth is a legendary flower that never withers. 传说中的Amaranth 是一种永不凋谢的花。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dry, fade, shrivel, wane, wilt, wizen</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]revive 复活；bloom, flourish, prosper, thrive 繁茂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]withering adj. 凋谢的，凋亡的</div>
<h2>withhold[sound:withhold.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">扣压，不给予：</font>to refrain from granting, giving, or allowing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]withhold sensitive information 限制敏感信息的传播</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decline, disallow, disapprove, detain, refuse, reject, reprobate, restrain, retain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]allow, concede, grant, permit 授予</div>
<h2>wizen[sound:wizen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（使）凋谢，（使）枯萎：</font>to become dry, shrunken, and wrinkled often as a result of aging or offailing vitality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dry, mummify, shrivel, wither</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]revive 复活；bloom, flourish, prosper, thrive 繁茂</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凋谢的,  枯萎的：</font>shriveled or dried up</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]faded, withered</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blooming  盛开的</div>
<h2>wobble[sound:wobble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">摇晃，颤抖：</font>to move or proceed with an irregular rocking or staggering motion or unsteadily andclumsily from side to side</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The drunk stood up, wobbled for a moment, and fell forward. 醉汉站了起来，晃动了一阵，然后向前倒了下去。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]rock, totter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stabilize 使稳定</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">犹豫不决：</font>to show uncertainty about the right course of action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We cannot tolerate the government wobbling at this critical time. 我们不能容忍政府在这种关键时刻犹豫不决。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]falter, stagger, teeter, vacillate, waver</div>
<h2>worldly[sound:worldly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">世间的，世俗的：</font>of this world rather than spiritual or religion affairs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]preoccupied with worldly concerns 纠缠于世俗的忧虑 ‖It  is  time  you  woke  up  and  focused  yourthoughts on more worldly matters. 现在你应该停止做梦然后把自己的精力集中在更现实的问题上了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carnal, corporeal, material, mundane</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]mental, spiritual 精神的；heavenly 天国的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">老练的：</font>experienced in human affairs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My little sister was worldly and sophisticated, quite unlike me. 与我截然不同的是，我的妹妹在为人处世方面非常老练。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cosmopolitan, sophisticated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ingenuous, innocent, naive, unsophisticated 天真的</div>
<h2>worship[sound:worship.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">崇拜，敬仰：</font>extravagant respect to an object of esteem</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the belief in swords and the worship of force 刀剑信仰与武力崇拜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adulation, adoration, deification, idolatry, reverence, veneration</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dislike, dismissal, disregard, hatred, loathing, scorn 反感，厌恶</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】v. <font color="#aa00ff">崇拜，膜拜：</font>to offer honor or respect to (someone) as a divine power</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The ancient Greeks worshipped many different gods. 古希腊人崇拜不同的神明。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adore, deify, glorify, revere, venerate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blaspheme, desecrate, profane, violate 亵渎</div>
<h2>wrangle[sound:wrangle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">纷争，争端：</font>an often noisy or angry expression of differing opinions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There was a bit of a wrangle over how much money to give the high school for its sports programs. 这个高中应该获得多少体育项目的拨款引起了一阵纷争。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]altercation, controversy, disagreement, dispute, fight, imbroglio, quarrel, squabble</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]harmony  和谐</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">争吵：</font>to quarrel noisily or angrily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Local residents wrangled for hours about property taxes. 当地居民就房产税的问题争吵不休。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]altercate, argue, bicker, controvert, hassle, quibble, spat, tiff</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]wrangler n. 争吵的人</div>
<h2>wretched[sound:wretched.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极差的：</font>very poor in quality or ability</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the wretched conditions of the refugee camp 难民营极恶劣的条件</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bad, coarse, inferior, low-grade, mediocre, miserable, poor, rubbishy, terrible, trashy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]excellent, fine, first-class, first-rate, good, high-grade, superior 优质的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">沮丧的：</font>deeply afflicted, dejected, or distressed in body or mind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was wretched for weeks after breaking up with her boyfriend. 她与男友分手后郁闷了几个星期。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blue, crestfallen, dejected, doleful, dolorous, gloomy, melancholy, mournful, rueful, sorrowful, woeful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blissful, buoyant, cheerful, delighted, glad, happy, joyful, jubilant 欢乐的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]wretchedness n. 沮丧</div>
<h2>wry[sound:wry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">扭曲的：</font>abnormally twisted or bent to one side</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a wry smile 扭曲的笑容</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bending, crooked, curving, devious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]common, normal, usual 正常的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">坚持错误的：</font>stubborn in adherence to wrong opinion or principles</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]headstrong, obstinate, pertinacious, perverse, stubborn, wrongheaded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amenable, compliant, complying, flexible, pliable, pliant, relenting, yielding 容易改变立场的</div>
<h2>xenophobe[sound:xenophobe.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">仇视 （或畏惧）外国人 （或外国事物）者：</font>one unduly fearful of what is foreign and especially ofpeople of foreign origin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]But  from  what  I  know,  no  way  could  this  thoroughly  US-educated  woman  (from  the  age  of  12)  be  axenophobe. 但根据我的了解，这个从12 岁起就接受彻底的美国教育的女人不可能是抵触外国事物的人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]xenomania 媚外的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]xenophobia n. 仇外情绪</div>
<h2>yoke[sound:yoke.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】v. <font color="#aa00ff">连接：</font>to become joined or linked</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]yoked several ideas together to propose a novel theory 将几个想法结合起来提出一个全新的理论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chain, conjugate, hook, interconnect, join, link, unite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disconnect, disjoin, dissever, disunite, separate, sunder, unchain, unlink, unyoke 分开</div>
<h2>yokel[sound:yokel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">乡下人，天真纯朴的人：</font>a naive or gullible inhabitant of a rural areaor small town</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a lame comedy about the misadventures of yokels in the big city 描述乡下人在大都市中遭遇的不幸的劣质喜剧</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bucolic, bumpkin, churl, provincial, rustic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cosmopolitan  云游四海的人</div>
<h2>zeal[sound:zeal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">热心，热诚：</font>enthusiastic  devotion  to  a  cause,  ideal,  or  goal  and  tireless  diligence  in  itsfurtherance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]preaches with fanatical zeal 带着狂热进行传教</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardor, devotion, enthusiasm, fervidness, fervor, passion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathy, indifference, nonchalance, torpor, unconcern 麻木，冷漠</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]zealous adj. 狂热的</div>
<h2>zealot[sound:zealot.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">狂热者：</font>a zealous person; especially: a fanatical partisan</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a religious zealot calling for another Crusade 呼唤下一场十字军东征的宗教狂热者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]activist, crusader, fanatic, partisan, red hot</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]zealotry n. 狂热的行为</div>
<h2>zenith[sound:zenith.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">最高点，巅峰：</font>culminating point</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]at the zenith of his power 位极人臣</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acme, apex, apogee, climax, crescendo, crest, peak, pinnacle, summit, top</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bottom, nadir 最低点</div>
<h2>zesty[sound:zesty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激的，开胃的：</font>appealingly piquant or lively</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a zesty sauce  味道刺激的酱汁</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]peppery, piquant, pungent, salty, savory, spicy, zingy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bland, insipid, vapid, zestless 乏味的</div>
<h2>ravenous[sound:ravenous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">食量大的，贪食的：</font>having a huge appetite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He had moderated his ravenous appetite. 他克制了自己的食欲。‖ravenous for power  渴望权力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]edacious, esurient, gluttonous, greedy, rapacious, voracious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]content, sated, satiated, satisfied 心满意足的</div>
<h2>simile[sound:simile.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">明喻：</font>a figure of speech comparing two unlike things that is often introduced by like or as</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Even though both similes and metaphors are forms of comparison, similes indirectly compare the two ideas and allow them to remain distinct in spite of their similarities, whereas metaphors compare two things directly. For instance, a simile that compares a person with a bullet would go as follows: "Chris was a record-setting runner as fast as a speeding bullet." A metaphor might read something like, "When Chris ran, he was a speeding bullet racing along the track." 尽管明喻和暗喻都是比喻的手法，明喻会间接地对两个对象进行比较，同时允许差异的存在，而暗喻则直接对两者进行比较。比如说，用明喻来把一个人比作子弹会这样说：“克里斯是一个不断打破记录的选手，他跑得就和高速子弹一样快。”而暗喻可能会说：“当克里斯奔跑的时候，他就是一颗在赛场上高速飞行的子弹。”</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]metaphor 暗喻</div>
<h2>shift[sound:shift.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">改变…的位置：</font>to change the place or position of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She shifted the vase closer to the wall so that it wouldn't get knocked over. 她把花瓶靠墙挪动了一点，从而防止它被碰倒。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]budge, dislocate, displace, disturb, relocate, remove, reposition, transfer, transpose</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]anchor, fix, freeze, secure, set 使固定</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">改变，变化：</font>to pass from one form, state, or level to another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She watched the aurora in fascination as its colors shifted from green to blue. 她着迷地看着极光的色彩从绿变成蓝。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fluctuate, mutate, snap, vary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]plateau, stabilize 达到稳定点，不变</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">交换：</font>to give up (something) and take something else in return</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My father and I shifted seats just before takeoff so that I could sit by the window. 起飞前我和我父亲交换了座位，这样我就可以靠窗坐了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commute, exchange, shift, substitute, swap, switch, trade</div>
<h2>damn[sound:damn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（在道德上）谴责：</font>to declare to be morally wrong or evil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a cleric who damned gambling and strong drink 一个严厉谴责赌博和酗酒的牧师</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anathematize, censure, decry, denounce, execrate, reprehend, reprobate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bless, eulogize, exalt, extol, glorify, laud, praise 赞颂</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adv. <font color="#aa00ff">非常地，极其地：</font>to a great degree</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Let's have a damn good party. 让我们尽情享乐狂欢吧。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deadly, desperately, exceedingly, extremely, greatly, heavily, highly, incredibly, really, seriously, very</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]little, negligibly, nominally, slightly, somewhat 一点点，稍微</div>
<h2>nirvana[sound:nirvana.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">彻底放松的状态：</font>a state of being disregardful or unconscious of one's surroundings, concerns,or obligations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The spa experience was a week of pure nirvana. 去泡温泉水疗的经历真是彻底的放松。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]forgetfulness, obliviousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]alertness, awareness, cognizance, consciousness  警觉，知觉</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">天堂，极乐世界：</font>an often imaginary place or state of utter perfection and happiness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They believe in a continuous cycle of births and deaths until the soul is perfected and achieves nirvana.他们相信生命会不断轮回，直到灵魂变得完美并升入天堂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]empyrean, fantasyland, heaven, lotusland, utopia</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hell, inferno 地狱</div>
<h2>nourish[sound:nourish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">养育，抚养：</font>to provide with food or other substances necessary for life and growth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He willingly nourished a child that was not his own. 他主动地抚养了一名不是他亲生的孩子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breed, foster, nurse, nurture, raise, rear</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">培养，促进：</font>to help the growth or development of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a friendship nourished by trust 在信任的基础之上开出的友谊之花</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advance, cultivate, encourage, forward, further, incubate, promote</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discourage, frustrate, hinder, inhibit 阻碍，妨碍</div>

<h2>ferocious[sound:ferocious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极端的，剧烈的：</font>marked by unrelenting intensity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Ferocious heat wave kept people indoor.  剧烈的热浪使人不能出门。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dreadful, excruciating, explosive, fearsome, fierce, intensive, profound, vehement, violent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]light, moderate, soft 轻柔的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">激烈的，爆发性的：</font>marked by bursts of destructive force or intense activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Ferocious forest fires threatened to destroy hundreds of homes in the scrubland. 肆虐的森林大火威胁着灌木丛中数百户居民的住所。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cyclonic, explosive, furious, paroxysmal, rabid, stormy, tempestuous, tumultuous, turbulent, volcanic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nonviolent, peaceable, peaceful  平静的，平和的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">凶猛的，残暴的：</font>violently unfriendly or aggressive in disposition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]captured and slaughtered by the ferocious tribesmen 被残暴的部落居民所抓获并惨遭屠杀</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]feral, grim, savage, vicious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gentle, mild, unaggressive 温和的，不具攻击性的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ferocity n. 凶猛，残暴</div>

<h2>equilibrium[sound:equilibrium.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">均势，平衡：</font>a condition in which opposing forces are equal to one another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We must find an equilibrium between commercial development and conservation of our natural treasures.我们必须在发展经济和保护自然资源之间找到一个平衡点。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]counterpoise, equilibration, equipoise, poise, stasis</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disequilibration, disequilibrium, imbalance, nonequilibrium, unbalance 不平衡</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（感情上的）平静：</font>evenness of emotions or temper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That stunning insult left me speechless, and several minutes passed before I recovered my equilibrium.那个令人震惊的侮辱弄得我哑口无言，我花了好几分钟才使心情得以平静。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aplomb,  calmness,  composure,  countenance,  imperturbability,  placidity,  repose,  sangfroid,  serenity,tranquillity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitation, discomposure, perturbation 不安，焦躁</div>
<h2>delegate[sound:delegate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">代理人，代表：</font>a person authorized to act as representative for another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The real estate developer sent a delegate to the town meeting to represent his interests. 房地产开发商派了一名能代表自己利益的代理前往镇上开会。‖the U.N. delegates from African countries 非洲国家的驻联合国代表</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agent, assignee, commissary, deputy, emissary, envoy, legate, minister, proxy, representative</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">移交（权力，任务等）：</font>to put (something) into the possession or safekeeping of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The manager is reluctant to delegate authority to subordinates while abroad. 经理不愿意在国外期间将自己的权力转交给下级。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commit, confide, consign, deliver, entrust, repose, transfer, transmit, vest, give over, hand over, turn over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hold, keep, retain 保持，持有</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]delegation n. 代表团</div>

<h2>wiretap[sound:wiretap.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n./vt. 偷听，窃听：to tap a telephone or telegraph wire in order to get information</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This line is not clean asCIAmight have wiretapped it. 这根线路不安全，因为中情局可能已经在监听了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]eavesdrop, overhear, tap</div>
<h2>surveillance[sound:surveillance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">监视，监控：</font>close observation of a person or group, especially one under suspicion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]government surveillance of suspected terrorists 政府对于恐怖分子嫌疑人的监控</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]oversight, supervision, watch</div>
<h2>perceptive[sound:perceptive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">敏锐的：</font>able to sense slight impressions or differences</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Due to their ability to rotate their ears, cats are very perceptive when it comes to pinpointing the source ofa sound. 由于猫能够转动它们的耳朵，所以它们能十分敏锐地确定声源的位置。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delicate, fine, keen,quick, sensitive, sharp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dead, imperceptive, insensible, insensitive, numb 反应慢的，麻木的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">洞察力强的：</font>having or showing deep understanding and intelligent application of knowledge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A perceptive teacher was able to discover what was really troubling the youth. 一个洞察力强的老师应该能察觉真正困扰青少年是什么。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]discerning, insightful, prudent, sagacious, sage, sapient</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brainless, dumb, foolish, idiotic, imbecile, moronic, silly, simple, slow, stupid, thoughtless,  unintelligent, unwise, witless 愚钝的</div>
<h2>renege[sound:renege.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">放弃，摒弃：</font>to solemnly or formally reject or go back on (as something formerly adhered to)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She refused to renege the principles by which she had always lived her life, even if it resulted in losing herbusiness. 尽管有可能使她失去她的事业，但她仍然拒绝放弃她在生命中所坚持的那些原则。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abnegate, forswear, recant, renounce, repeal, repudiate, retract, withdraw</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adhere 坚持</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]renegade n. 叛徒</div>
<h2>rigmarole[sound:rigmarole.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">混乱而无意义的话：</font>language marked by abstractions, jargon, euphemisms, and circumlocutions;confused or meaningless talk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The security guard gave me some kind of rigmarole about passes and authorizations. 保安不知所云地跟我说了一些关于通关和授权的话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abracadabra, babble, drivel, gabble, gibber, jabber, nonsense, prattle</div>
<h2>implicit[sound:implicit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不言而喻的，心照不宣的：</font>capable  of  being  understood  from  something  else  thoughunexpressed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The implicit agreement among members of the outing club is that everyone pays his or her own way on alltrips. 野外俱乐部成员之间一条心照不宣的约定就是：沿途所有开销都AA 。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]implied, unexpressed, unspoken, unvoiced, wordless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]explicit, expressed, spoken, stated, voiced 明确声明的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无疑问的，无保留的：</font>being without doubt or reserve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Members of the expedition must have implicit trust in their leaders. 远征的队员必须百分之百地信任他们的领队。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assured, clear, confident, doubtless, positive, sanguine, sure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doubtful, dubious, uncertain, unsure  不确定的，存有疑惑的</div>
<h2>marginal[sound:marginal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">边缘的：</font>located at or near a border</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Marginal locations in the open-air market are a bit cheaper.  露天市场边缘的地段通常都要便宜些。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]frontier</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]interior 内在的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不重要的：</font>not of central importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]regards violence as a marginal rather than a central problem 并不把暴力问题当作重要的核心问题来看</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, minor, minute, negligible, nugatory, slight, trifling, trivial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consequential, eventful, important, meaningful, momentous, significant, substantial, weighty 重要的</div>
<h2>pivotal[sound:pivotal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">最关键的，最为重要的：</font>of the greatest possible importance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The report was missing a pivotal piece of information. 报告遗漏了最为重要的信息。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]critical, crucial, decisive, key, vital</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, marginal, minor, minute, negligible, nugatory, slight, trifling, trivial 不重要的</div>
<h2>unavailing[sound:unavailing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">徒劳的，无果的：</font>producing no results</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an unavailing effort to avert a war 试图避免战争的徒劳尝试</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abortive, barren, bootless, fruitless, ineffectual, unproductive, unprofitable, unsuccessful, useless, vain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]effective, effectual, efficacious, fruitful, potent, productive 有效的；successful 成功的</div>
<h2>cachet[sound:cachet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">威望，声望：</font>a mark or quality, as of distinction, individuality, or authenticity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Federal courts have a certain cachet which state courts lack. 联邦法院拥有州立法院所不具备的威信。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]credit, distinction, esteem, homage, kudos, prestige</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]infamy, notoriety 不好的名声</div>
<h2>graft[sound:graft.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">移植，移接：</font>to implant (living tissue) surgically or as if surgically</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The top layer of skin has to be grafted onto the burns. 顶层的皮肤需要被移植到烧伤的伤口上。 ‖graftold traditions onto the new ones 把老传统移植到新的习俗之上</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]implant, transplant</div>
