<h2>favoritism[sound:favoritism.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">偏爱，偏袒：</font>the showing of special favor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Favoritism blinded the administrator to the benefits of the proposed system for distributing work. 偏袒使得经理无法意识到这一待讨论的分配系统所带来的收益。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]favor, one-sidedness, partiality, prejudice, tendentiousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]impartiality, neutrality, objectivity, open-mindedness, unbiasedness 公平，公正</div>
<h2>overwrought[sound:overwrought.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">十分激动的，非常不安的：</font>being in a state of increased activity or agitation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She became overwrought when she heard that her child was missing. 当她得知自己孩子失踪的消息后变得极其激动和不安。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agitated, excited, frenzied, heated, hectic, hyperactive, overactive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, collected, composed, placid, serene, tranquil 冷静的，沉着的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（装饰）过分华丽的：</font>elaborately and often excessively decorated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The author's prose is overwrought with purple passages and florid metaphors. 这个作者的散文里充满了词藻华丽的段落和比喻，显得有些过分。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baroque, bedizened, flamboyant, florid, fussy, gingerbreaded, ornate, overdecorated</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]austere, plain, severe, stark, unadorned 朴素的</div>
<h2>sequel[sound:sequel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">结果：</font>a result or consequence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Higher prices are a logical sequel to higher costs for manufacturers.  从逻辑上来说，更高的价格是更高的生产成本的结果。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aftermath, conclusion, consequence, fate, fruit, outcome, product, result, sequence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]antecedent, causation, cause, occasion, reason 起因，原因</div>
<h2>fad[sound:fad.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（短暂的）流行，时尚：</font>a practice or interest that is very popular for a short time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Once the fad for that kind of music had passed, nobody would have been caught dead listening to it. 一旦那种流派的音乐流行风刮过之后，就没有人会来听它出丑了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]buzz, craze, enthusiasm, fashion, trend, vogue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]classic 经典；standard 标准</div>
<h2>arid[sound:arid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">干燥的：</font>marked by little or no precipitation or humidity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]arid wastelands unfit for human habitation 不适合人类居住的干燥荒原</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]droughty, dry, sere, thirsty, waterless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]damp, dank, humid, moist, wet 湿润的，潮湿的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无趣的，无聊的：</font>causing weariness, restlessness, or lack of interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]arid wastelands unfit for human habitation 不适合人类居住的干燥荒原</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dreary, dull, flat, humdrum, jading, jejune, monochromatic, monotonous, pedestrian, stale, stodgy, tedious,wearisome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 有趣的，吸引人的</div>
<h2>avowal[sound:avowal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">承认：</font>a solemn and often public declaration of the truth or existence of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With jingoism rampant, the peace candidate felt compelled to make an avowal of his patriotism.  在沙文主义肆虐的情况下，爱好和平的候选人被迫承认自己是个爱国主义者。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affirmation, assertion, asseveration, avouchment, claim, declaration, insistence, profession</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disavowal 否认，否定</div>
<h2>backfire[sound:backfire.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">产生相反的结果，事与愿违：</font>to have the reverse of the desired or expected effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My plan to throw her a surprise party backfired when she ended up sobbing that everyone had forgottenher birthday.  我本想给她的生日开一个聚会作为惊喜，但没想到事与愿违：她啜泣着说所有人都忘记了她的生日。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boomerang</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]succeed 成功</div>
<h2>baffle[sound:baffle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">挫败，阻挠：</font>to frustrate or check (a person) as by confusing or perplexing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]baffled by the language barrier 受到语言障碍的阻挠</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balk, beat, check, discomfit, foil, frustrate, thwart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]advance, cultivate, encourage, forward, foster, further, nurture, promote 促进，鼓舞</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使疑惑：</font>to throw into a state of mental uncertainty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I was baffled by many of the scientific terms used in the article. 这篇文章中各种学术词汇让我很困惑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]befog, befuddle, bewilder, confound, discombobulate, disorient, maze, mystify, perplex, puzzle, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarify, elucidate 澄清，阐明</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]baffling adj. 令人困惑的</div>
<h2>careen[sound:careen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">蹒跚而行，不稳地行走：</font>to lurch or swerve while in motion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He careened unsteadily to the couch after hitting his head. 在撞到头以后，他摇摇摆摆地走向沙发。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dodder, lurch, reel, sway, teeter, totter, waddle, wobble</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">狂奔，快速运动：</font>to rush headlong or carelessly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Sounding its siren, an ambulance careened through the intersection. 救护车响着警笛飞驰通过十字路口。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blast, bolt, bustle, career, dash, fly, hustle, rush, rustle, speed, whirl</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crawl, creep, lag, poke  缓慢行进</div>
<h2>constrict[sound:constrict.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">压缩，压紧：</font>to make smaller or narrower by or as if by binding or squeezing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lives constricted by poverty  因为贫穷而拮据的生活‖Severe migraine can be treated with a drug whichconstricts the blood vessels. 某些能使血管收缩的药物可用来治疗严重的偏头痛。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]capsule, collapse, compact, condense, constringe, contract, narrow, squeeze, telescope</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decompress, expand, open, outspread, outstretch  扩张，使伸展</div>
<h2>dampen[sound:dampen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（特指稍稍地）弄湿：</font>to make or become slightly or moderately wet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]dampen a paper towel with water and use it to clean up the mess 把纸巾弄湿用来清扫</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bedew, damp, douse , drench, impregnate, saturate, soak, souse, steep</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dehydrate, desiccate, dry, parch, scorch, sear  使脱水，烤干</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">抑制，压抑（感情，精力等），泼冷水：</font>to check or diminish the feeling, activity or vigor of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Nothing could dampen their enthusiasm.  没有什么能扼杀他们的激情。‖The oppressive heat dampenedour spirits. 让人难以忍受的酷暑让我们精神不振。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]benumb, blunt, castrate, deaden, devitalize, enervate, geld, lobotomize, petrify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]brace, energize, enliven, invigorate, quicken, stimulate, vitalize, vivify 使充满活力</div>
<h2>debonair[sound:debonair.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无忧无虑的，不在乎的：</font>having or showing freedom from worries or troubles</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His debonair dismissal of my inquiry concerning his financial situation led me to believe that nothing waswrong. 对于我有关他个人理财的问题，他表现得毫不在乎，这使我相信没有问题。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blithe, carefree, gay, insouciant, lighthearted, lightsome, slaphappy, unconcerned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careworn  焦虑的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">风度翩翩的：</font>having or showing very polished and worldly manners</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The debonair gentleman charmed all of the ladies in the room. 风度翩翩的绅士吸引了在场的所有女士。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]civilized, graceful, polished, refined, smooth, sophisticated, suave, svelte, urbane</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]boorish, churlish, loutish, uncouth 粗鲁的，粗野的；clumsy, gauche, graceless 笨拙的</div>
<h2>fabulous[sound:fabulous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">传说中的：</font>based on, described in, or being a fable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The city of Phoenix is named after a fabulous bird that every 500 years destroys itself with fire, only to rise again from its own ashes. 凤凰城的名字来源于传说中的一种鸟，它每隔500 年会在火焰中毁灭，然后再从灰烬中重生。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]fabled, legendary</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">幻想中的，不真实的：</font>not real and existing only in the imagination</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a story of a fabulous land where the people know nothing of war and live together in perfect harmony一个有关世外桃源的故事，当地的居民不知道战争为何物，和谐融洽地生活在一起</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chimerical, dreamy, illusory, phantom, unreal, visionary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]actual, existent, existing, real 真实存在的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人惊讶的，令人称奇的：</font>causing wonder or astonishment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the fabulous endurance of a marathon runner  马拉松参赛者令人惊讶的耐力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amazing, astonishing, astounding, miraculous, portentous, prodigious, staggering, stunning, stupendous,sublime, wonderful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]common, ordinary  平常的，普通的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极好的：</font>extremely pleasing or successful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We had a fabulous time on our vacation. 我们的假期赞极了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]awesome, divine, fantastic, heavenly, marvelous, noble, prime, splendid, superb, superior, terrific</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]atrocious, awful, execrable, lousy, pathetic, poor, rotten, terrible, wretched 极差劲的</div>
<h2>hobble[sound:hobble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">跛行，蹒跚而行：</font>to walk or move along haltingly or with difficulty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She picked up her cane and hobbled across the room.  她拿起了一根手杖，一拐一拐地穿过了房间。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]falter, halt, limp, stagger, totter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stride 大步走</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">阻碍，妨碍：</font>to hamper the action or progress of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We were hobbled by the snowstorm from getting out to do some Christmas shopping. 暴雪阻碍了我们圣诞购物的计划。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]encumber, fetter, handicap, hamper, hinder, impede, inhibit, manacle, obstruct, shackle, stymie, trammel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aid, assist, facilitate 帮助</div>
<h2>plush[sound:plush.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（味道等）浓郁的：</font>having an abundance of some characteristic quality (as flavor)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a plush, ripe wine 味道浓郁的陈年老窖</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]concentrated, full, heady, lusty, muscular, potent, rich, robust, strong</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delicate, light, mild, thin, weak （味道等）淡的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">奢华的，豪华的：</font>notably luxurious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a plush castle filled with priceless art and antiques 一座充满了无价艺术品和古董的奢华城堡</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deluxe, lavish, luxuriant, luxurious, opulent, palatial, silken, sumptuous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ascetic, austere, humble, spartan 朴素的，平凡的</div>
<h2>rhetorical[sound:rhetorical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">语言上的，文字上的：</font>of or relating to words or language</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The next war that those two nations fight won't be rhetorical - it will be with bombs and bullets. 两国之间的下一场战争可不会是斗嘴皮了——他们会来真格的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lexical, linguistic, vocabular, wordy</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">言辞华丽（却往往无内涵的）：</font>full of fine words and fancy expressionsbut mostly meaninglesswords and phrases</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You can skip over the rhetorical passages and still get the gist of the essay. 你可以跳过那些词藻华丽的段落，直接获取文本的主旨。‖The new governor delivered a long rhetorical speech about our state's bright future but laid out no specific programs for ensuring it. 新的执政官发表了词藻华丽的演说，畅谈国家的美好未来，但却没有提出实现这一目标的具体措施。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bombastic, flatulent, florid, fustian, gaseous, gassy, grandiloquent, oratorical, orotund, purple, windy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]prosaic 平凡无奇的；plain, simple  简单的</div>
<h2>thick-skinned[sound:thick-skinned.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冷漠无情的，不顾及他人感受的：</font>largely unaffected by the needs and feelings of other people</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was so thick-skinned that she was clueless about the fact that the joke had hurt her friend's feelings.她很少顾及他人的感受，以至于她根本没有意识到那个玩笑伤害了她朋友的感情。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectless, callous, cold-blooded, heartless, indurate, inhumane, insensitive, merciless, obdurate, ruthless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]charitable, compassionate, humane, kindhearted, merciful, sympathetic, tender, warmhearted 慈善的</div>
<h2>trifle[sound:trifle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不重要的事：</font>something of little importance or value</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Let us not speak of trifles when our nation may be going to war.  战事在即，我们还是先放下这些琐事吧。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bagatelle, frippery, triviality</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">不正经地对待，玩弄：</font>to behave amorously without serious intent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Do not trifle with me unless you mean to ask me to marry you. 如果你不是真心想和我结婚，就请不要来玩弄我的感情。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coquet, dally, flirt, frivol, toy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]trifling adj. 不重要的</div>
<h2>weather[sound:weather.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">安全渡过（危机等），经受住：</font>to come through (something) safely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We haveve weathered worse crises, and so we'll survive this one. 更为严重的危机我们都闯过了，这个也不会有问题的。‖They weathered a terrible storm while at sea. 他们在海上平安渡过了一场巨大的风暴。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]survive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]decease, die, expire, perish, succumb, pass away  死亡，消亡</div>
<h2>wily[sound:wily.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">狡诈的，狡猾的：</font>clever at attaining one's ends by indirect and often deceptive means</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is an experienced and wily old statesman. 他是一个经验丰富而狡诈的老销售员。‖His wily plan onlyrebounded on him. 聪明反被聪明误。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beguiling, cagey, crafty, cunning, devious, foxy, guileful, scheming, shrewd, slick, sly, subtle, tricky</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artless, guileless, ingenuous, innocent, undesigning 天真的，单纯的</div>
<h2>arable[sound:arable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">适合耕种的：</font>fit for or used for the growing of crops</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]explore the west for arable land  向西探索适合耕种的土地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cultivable, tillable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]barren, sterile, infertile, unfruitful, unproductive 贫瘠的</div>
<h2>convene[sound:convene.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">召开，召集：</font>to bring together in assembly by or as if by command</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]convened the members of the council for an emergency session 召集委员会的成员进入紧急议程</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assemble, call, convene, muster, summon</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disband, dispel, disperse, dissipate, dissolve, squander 驱散，驱逐</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">聚集，集合：</font>to come together in a body</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The students convened in the auditorium to hear the principal’saddress. 学生们在大礼堂集合，聆听校长的致辞。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cluster, collect, concenter, concentrate, conglomerate, congregate, converge, gather, meet, rendezvous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]convention n. 集会，大会</div>
<h2>decadent[sound:decadent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">堕落的，腐败的：</font>having or showing lowered moral character or standards</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Opponents of gambling casinos claim that gambling is a decadent form of entertainment. 赌场的反对者们宣称赌博是一种堕落腐化的娱乐形式。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debased, debauched, degenerate, depraved, dissolute, perverse, perverted, reprobate, warped</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pure, uncorrupted  纯净的，未腐化的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">放纵的人：</font>a person whose life is devoted to luxury and sensual pleasures</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a decadent who squandered her once considerable family fortune 一个挥霍了大量的家族财富的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debauchee, hedonist, libertine, sensualist, sybarite, profligate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ascetic 苦行者，禁欲者</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">道德上堕落的人：</font>a person in a condition or process of mental or moral decay</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]avant-garde artists who were scorned by the bourgeoisie as talentless decadents  被中产阶级鄙视为没有才华的堕落者的前卫艺术家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deviate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]saint  圣人</div>
<h2>demotion[sound:demotion.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">降级，降职：</font>the act or an instance of bringing to a lower grade or rank</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Anyone who objects will get a demotion. 任何胆敢反对的人都会被降职。‖received  a  demotion  fromsergeant to corporal 从中士降为下士</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]degradation, downgrading, reduction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elevation, promotion 晋升</div>
<h2>glower[sound:glower.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">怒目而视：</font>to look or stare with sullen annoyance or anger</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Baseball fans glowering at their TVs as they watched their favorite team lose.  看着他们支持的球队输球，棒球迷们恶狠狠地盯着电视屏幕。‖He just glowered without speaking.  他一言不发地怒视着我。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]glare, gloom, lower, scowl</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beam, grin, smile 笑</div>
<h2>grit[sound:grit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（面对困难时所表现出来的）毅力：</font>the strength of mind that enables a person to endure pain orhardship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She was an athlete with true grit, continuing her training despite bad weather and an injury.  她是真正一个有着惊人毅力的运动员，即便是在受了伤外加天气恶劣的情况下仍然坚持训练。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backbone, constancy, fiber, grittiness, guts, intestinal fortitude, pluck, spunk</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cowardliness, cravenness, gutlessness, pusillanimity, spinelessness  懦弱</div>
<h2>infraction[sound:infraction.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">违背，违犯：</font>a failure to uphold the requirements of law, duty, or obligation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Speeding is only a minor infraction, but vehicular homicide is a serious felony. 超速只是小的违章，但是用机动车故意杀人就是重罪了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]breach, contravention, infringement, transgression, trespass, violation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]observance 遵守</div>
<h2>madcap[sound:madcap.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">热爱冒险的人：</font>a  person  who  seeks  out  very  dangerous  or  foolhardy  adventures  with  noapparent fear</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an incorrigible madcap who loves drag racing and white-water rafting 一个热爱飙车和激流竹筏的无药可救的冒险狂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]daredevil, madman</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大胆的，鲁莽的：</font>behaving or acting impulsively or rashly;foolishly adventurous or bold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They switched from one madcap scheme to another. 他们从一个鲁莽的方案换到了另一个。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]audacious, bold, brash, daredevil, overbold, overconfident, reckless, temerarious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careful, cautious, circumspect, guarded, heedful, prudent, wary  谨慎的，小心的</div>
<h2>novice[sound:novice.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">新手，初学者：</font>a person new to a field or activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a novice chess player 象棋初学者</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apprentice, colt, fledgling, freshman, greenhorn, neophyte, newcomer, recruit, rook, tenderfoot, tyro, virgin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doyen, maven, veteran  有经验的人</div>
<h2>observant[sound:observant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">警惕的，警觉的：</font>paying close attention  usually for the purpose of anticipating approachingdanger or opportunity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Good reporters are keenly observant of everything around them. 优秀的记者应该对身边所有的事情都保持高度的警惕。‖If you were more observant, you would perceive that something is troubling her deeply. 如果你能再警觉一些的话，你就会发现她正被某些东西困扰。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alert, attentive, awake, cautious, sharp, vigilant, watchful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careless, heedless, inattentive, unmindful, unthinking, unwary 不谨慎的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">严格遵守（规章、制度或原则）的：</font>diligent in observing a law, custom, duty, or principle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]observant of the speed limit 严格遵守速度限制‖pious and religiously observant families 虔诚而严守教规的家庭</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]law-abiding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]observance n. 遵守 （规定）</div>
<h2>plenitude[sound:plenitude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">丰富，充沛：</font>an amount or supply more than sufficient to meet one's needs</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a region blessed with a plenitude of natural resources 充满着上帝赐予的丰富资源的地区</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundance, cornucopia, feast, plentitude, plethora, wealth</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deficiency, inadequacy, insufficiency, undersupply 匮乏，不足</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大量：</font>a considerable amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She has gathered a plenitude of information on the topic. 有关这个话题她收集了大量的资料。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bunch, bundle, dozen, multiplicity, myriad, plateful, plenty, profusion, reams, scads, spate, stack, volume</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ace, bit, glimmer, handful, hint, mite, nip, ounce, pittance, speck, spot, trace 少量</div>
<h2>replenish[sound:replenish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">补充：</font>to fill or make complete again; add a new stock or supply to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He went to replenish her glass. 他去续杯了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]refill, reload</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]consume, drain, empty, exhaust  清空，耗尽</div>
<h2>stasis[sound:stasis.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">平衡，停滞：</font>a condition of balance among various forces</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]For the time being, the populations of the national park's predators and prey remain in stasis. 目前国家公园中捕食者和猎物的数量保持着一定的平衡。‖Language is a primary element of culture,and stasis in the arts is tantamount to death. (Charles Marsh)  语言是文化当中的主要元素，艺术的停滞和平衡就等同于死亡。——查理斯·马氏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]counterpoise, equilibration, equilibrium, equipoise, poise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disequilibration, disequilibrium, imbalance, nonequilibrium, unbalance 不平衡</div>
<h2>tycoon[sound:tycoon.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大亨，巨头：</font>a person of rank, power, or influence in a particular field</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an oil tycoon who's widely considered the most powerful man in the county 被认为是郡上最有势力的一个石油大亨‖The automobile tycoon is on the verge of bankruptcy. 汽车巨头濒临破产的边缘。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baron, captain, king, lion, lord, magnate, mogul, monarch, prince</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nobody, nothing, zero 不起眼的人物</div>
<h2>umbrage[sound:umbrage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">不悦，生气：</font>the feeling of being offended or resentful after a slight or indignity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He would take umbrage at the slightest suggestion of disrespect. 哪怕是一点点的不敬也会让他不悦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dudgeon, huff, miff, offense, peeve, resentment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contentment, delight, gratification, happiness, pleasure 满意，高兴</div>
<h2>wilt[sound:wilt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（花、植物等）萎蔫：</font>to become limp or flaccid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The plants wilted after I forgot to water them for three whole days. 在我整整三天忘记浇水之后，植物们全都萎蔫了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flag, hang, loll, sag, swag</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">精神萎靡，憔悴：</font>to feel or exhibit the effects of fatigue or exhaustion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She had wilted a bit after walking around the hot and humid city. 在炎热潮湿的城市中行走使得她略显憔悴。‖His brain wilted from hitherto unprecedented weariness. 在前所未有的疲劳面前，他的开始变得神情憔悴。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decay, droop, emaciate, fade, fail, lag, languish, sink, waste, wither</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]convalesce, rally, rebound, recover, recuperate 康复，复原</div>
<h2>agape[sound:agape.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">急切盼望的：</font>having or showing signs of eagerly awaiting something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]At the sound of the sleigh bells the children were all agape, waiting for Santa to appear. 听到雪橇铃，孩子们开始好奇地等待圣诞老人的到来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]agog, anticipant, anticipatory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathetic, indifferent, unconcerned, uninterested 不感兴趣的，不为所动的</div>
<h2>annex[sound:annex.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">裙楼，副楼：</font>a building added on to a larger one or an auxiliary building situated near a main one</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new annex that will serve as the permanent home for the school library. 新的裙楼将成为学校图书馆的永久住所。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]addition, extension, penthouse</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">添加，合并：</font>to join  (something) to a mass, quantity, or number so as to bring about an overallincrease</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]plans to annex the supply room so as to make the classroom bigger  计划将工具房并入教室，从而扩充其容量</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjoin, affix, append, attach, subjoin, tack</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abate, deduct, remove, subtract  削减</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">吞并，夺取（土地等）：</font>to incorporate (a country or other territory) within the domain of a state</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Rome annexed the Nabatean kingdom in 106 AD.  公元前106 年罗马帝国吞并了古城那巴顿。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquire, appropriate, arrogate, expropriate, seize, take over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lose 失去</div>
<h2>baffling[sound:baffling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">令人疑惑的，难以理解的：</font>making great mental demands; hard to comprehend or solve</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I was constantly ill, with a baffling array of symptoms. 我常常生病，而且有着一系列令人困惑的症状。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]befuddling, bewildering, confounding, confusing, enigmatic, puzzling, perplexing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apparent, distinct, evident, lucid, manifest, obvious, patent, pellucid, perspicuous, plain, transparent 明确的，明显的</div>
<h2>bewitching[sound:bewitching.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迷人的，令人着迷的：</font>having an often mysterious or magical power to attract</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]bewitching woman who has never lacked for suitors 一个从不缺乏追求者的迷人女子</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alluring,  appealing,  attractive,  captivating,  charismatic,  enchanting,  engaging,  entrancing,  glamorous,luring, magnetic, seductive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]repellent, repelling, repugnant, repulsive, revolting  令人反感的</div>
<h2>bore[sound:bore.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">令人厌烦的人或事物：</font>one that causes boredom</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]For once, the graduation speaker wasn't a real bore. 就这一次毕业演讲者不是那么令人厌倦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]drip, droner, snoozer, yawner</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使厌倦，使厌烦：</font>to make weary by being dull, repetitive, or tedious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The professor's lifeless and unimaginative teaching style bored the students to death. 教授毫无生气和想象力的说教方式让学生厌倦至极。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]jade,  pall, tire, weary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorb, engage, engross, enthrall, fascinate, grip, interest, intrigue 使充满兴趣，使全神贯注</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]boring adj. 令人厌烦的；boredom n. 厌烦，乏味</div>
<h2>bumble[sound:bumble.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">含糊不清地说，杂乱无章地说：</font>to speak rapidly, inarticulately, and usually unintelligibly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Overcome with stage fright, I could only bumble through the speech.  由于怯场，我结结巴巴地说完了演讲稿。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]babble, drivel, drool, gabble, gibber, jabber, prattle, sputter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]articulate, enunciate, pronounce 清楚地说</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">笨拙地行动：</font>to move, act, or proceed clumsily</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I sort of bumbled through the dance number, hoping that it would soon end. 我笨拙地跟着曲子舞蹈，心里指望着它快点结束。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blunder, flounder, limp, lumber, plod, struggle, stumble, trudge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]coast, drift, glide, sail, slide （轻松地）行动，滑动</div>
<h2>carefree[sound:carefree.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无忧无虑的：</font>free from care as having no worries or troubles</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]passengers on a luxury cruise ship enjoying a carefree vacation 在豪华游轮上享受着无忧旅途的乘客‖carefree college students on spring break 春假期间无忧无虑的大学生</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blithe, debonair, gay, insouciant, lighthearted, lightsome, slaphappy, unconcerned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]careworn  焦虑的</div>
<h2>chaperone[sound:chaperone.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">同行，护送：</font>to go along with in order to provide assistance, protection, or companionship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Three parents will chaperone the students on the school trip. 本次班级旅行将有三名家长同行。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accompany, attend, companion, company, convoy, escort, squire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abandon, desert, ditch, dump, forsake 抛弃，不顾</div>
<h2>charisma[sound:charisma.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">魅力，吸引力：</font>a special magnetic charm or appeal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a movie star with unique charisma 有着独特魅力的电影明星‖The candidate was lacking in charisma.候选人就是缺乏了点个人魅力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allure, appeal, attractiveness, captivation, enchantment, fascination, glamor, seductiveness, witchery</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]repulsion, repulsiveness 反感，厌恶</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]charismatic adj. 有魅力的，吸引人的</div>
<h2>conflagration[sound:conflagration.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大火：</font>a large destructive fire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]All the stock was destroyed in a warehouse conflagration. 仓库里所有的货物都被一场大火烧毁了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]holocaust, inferno</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">武装冲突，战争：</font>a state of armed violent struggle between states, nations, or groups</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]What began as a skirmish over disputed territory erupted into a conflagration that swept the continent.这场席卷整个大陆的战争是由之前关于有纠纷的领土的小冲突引发的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conflict, war, warfare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]peace 和平；truce 休战</div>
<h2>crow[sound:crow.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">感到高兴：</font>to feel or express joy or triumph</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Being the home of the new Super Bowl champs was the first thing that city residents had to crow about in a very long time. 当地的队伍获得超级碗冠军队伍是这个城市居民长期以来得以感到高兴的第一件事情。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]delight, exuberate, glory, jubilate, joy, rejoice, triumph</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bemoan, bewail, grieve, lament, weep 感到悲伤，叹息</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">自鸣得意：</font>to praise or express pride in one's own possessions, qualities, or accomplishmentsoften to excess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is already crowing over his victory. 他已经在那里为自己的胜利而自鸣得意了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blow, brag, swagger, vapor, vaunt</div>

(Crane Brinton) 被统治者总能找到发牢骚的理由。——瑞恩·布林顿</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carp, croak, fuss, gripe, grouch, grouse, grump, moan, murmur, mutter, repine</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crow, delight, rejoice 感到高兴</div>

<h2>lag[sound:lag.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">最终的，最后的：</font>following all others of the same kind in order or time</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We're now in the lag end of the project. 现在我们到了项目的尾声阶段。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bottommost, closing, concluding, final, hindmost, last, latest, rearmost, terminal, terminating, ultimate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beginning, earliest, first, foremost, inaugural, initial, maiden, opening, original, pioneer, primary 最初的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">缓慢行走：</font>to proceed or develop with comparative slowness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The tired puppy was lagging behind the rest of the pack. 疲倦的小狗在队伍的后面缓缓地走着。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crawl, creep, dally, dawdle, dillydally, linger, loiter, mope, poke, tarry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blast, bolt, bustle, careen, career, dash, fly, hustle, rush, rustle, speed, whirl 疾行，快速行走</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">萎靡，失去活力：</font>to lose bodily strength or vigor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]During the fourth quarter the whole team seemed to lag. 到了第四节整支队伍似乎都已经精疲力竭了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decay, droop, emaciate, fade, fail, languish, sink, waste, wilt, wither</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]convalesce, rally, rebound, recover, recuperate 康复，复原</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]lagging n. 延迟</div>
<h2>lance[sound:lance.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">长矛，标枪：</font>a weapon with a long straight handle and sharp head or blade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The lance struck squarely on the knight's shield, knocking him from his horse. 标枪正中盾牌，将骑士掀于马下。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]javelin, pike, shaft , spear</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">刺穿，刺破：</font>to penetrate or hold (something) with a pointed object</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Doctors used to lance infected sores, so that they could drain clean. 以前医生会刺破受感染的疮，从而使脓液流出。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]gore, harpoon, jab, pierce, puncture, spike, stab, stick</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]lancer n. 枪骑兵</div>

<h2>rampant[sound:rampant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（植物）生长茂盛的：</font>growing thickly and vigorously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a rampant growth of weeds in the neglected yard 被遗忘的院子里杂草疯长</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lush, luxuriant, prosperous, weedy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]sparse 稀疏的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">猖獗的，不受限制的：</font>occurring without restraint and frequently, widely, or menacingly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Mayor promised to put a stop to the rampant crime that plagued the city. 市长承诺要采取措施，消灭那些扰乱城市治安的猖獗的犯罪活动。‖rampant corruption in city government 市政府中猖獗的腐败</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abandoned,  intemperate,  runaway,  unbounded,  unbridled,  unchecked,  uncontrolled,  unhampered,unhindered, unrestrained</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bridled, checked, constrained, controlled, curbed, governed, hampered, hindered, restrained, temperate受制约的</div>
<h2>remnant[sound:remnant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">残余，剩余物：</font>something left over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a remnant of his past glory 他辉煌过去的一丝残余‖The shop is selling remnants of cloth at half price.商店在半价抛售剩余的衣物。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debris, remainder, remains, residue, vestige</div>
<h2>residual[sound:residual.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">剩余的，残存的：</font>of, relating to, or characteristic of a residue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]residual radiation from nuclear tests 核试验所遗留下来的残余辐射</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]leftover, remaining, vestigial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comprehensive, entire, full, integral, total, whole 全部的，完整的</div>
<h2>screen[sound:screen.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">掩护物，屏障：</font>something that shelters, protects, or hides</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The target will be difficult to reach as it is behind a screen of anti-aircraft batteries.  目标在防空炮火的掩护之下难以靠近。‖Please keep away from the screen door. 请不要倚靠屏蔽门。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aegis, ammunition, armor, cover, guard, protection, safeguard, security, shield, wall, ward</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">保护，使…免受攻击：</font>to drive danger or attack away from</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Gunships were called in to help screen the troops from further attacks. 武装直升机被呼叫对步兵进行支援，使之免受进一步的攻击。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]defend, fence, fend, forfend, protect, secure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assail, assault, attack 攻击</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">掩护，遮蔽：</font>to keep secret or shut off from view</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Bushes screened the swimming pool from passersby on the street. 灌木丛将游泳池和外面的行人隔绝开来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belie, cloak, conceal, curtain, disguise, enshroud, mask, obscure, occult, shroud, veil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disclose, expose, reveal, uncloak, uncover, unmask, unveil  揭露</div>
<h2>scrimp[sound:scrimp.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">节俭：</font>to avoid unnecessary waste or expense</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They had to scrimp and save for years in order to be able to afford a house. 他们不得不节俭度日才能攒够钱买房。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conserve, economize, husband, pinch, save, skimp, spare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dissipate, lavish, squander, waste 浪费</div>
<h2>willy-nilly[sound:willy-nilly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adv. <font color="#aa00ff">不论是否愿意的（地）：</font>whether desired or not</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]After her boss fell sick, she willy-nilly found herself directing the project. 在她老板生病后，她发现自己不论愿不愿意，都得指导这项工程。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]helplessly, inescapably, inevitably, perforce, unavoidably</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无秩序的，随意的：</font>without order or plan</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]willy-nilly taxing laws 杂乱无序的税收法</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aimless, arbitrary, desultory, erratic, haphazard, scattered, slapdash, stray</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]methodical, orderly, organized, regular, systematic 有序的，有组织的</div>
<h2>adjudicate[sound:adjudicate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">裁决，判定：</font>to hear and settlea case, dispute or conflict</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]When my wife and I  asked the salesclerk to adjudicate our disagreement, she agreed with me that the white shoes looked better.  我和我妻子要求售货员来裁决我们之间的争论，最后她还是同意了我的观点，认为白色的鞋子看起来更漂亮。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjudge, arbitrate, decide, determine, judge,  referee, settle, umpire</div>
<h2>belligerence[sound:belligerence.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">好斗，好战：</font>an aggressive or truculent attitude, atmosphere, or disposition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Among the Native American tribes of the colonial period, the Iroquois were known for their belligerence.在殖民时期的美洲土著部落中，易洛魁人因为他们的好战而著名。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggressiveness, assaultiveness, bellicosity, combativeness, contentiousness, disputatiousness, feistiness,militance, pugnacity, quarrelsomeness, scrappiness, truculence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]pacifism 爱好和平</div>
<h2>canny[sound:canny.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精明的，聪明的：</font>careful and shrewd, especially where one's own interests are concerned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is a canny card player who is good at psyching out his opponents. 他是一个善于琢磨对手心思的精明的扑克玩家。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]astute, clever, hardheaded, heady, knowing, savvy, sharp, shrewd, smart</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ignorant, unknowing 无知的；foolish, idiotic, imbecile, moronic, silly, thoughtless, witless  愚笨的</div>
<h2>disenchant[sound:disenchant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使清醒：</font>to free from illusion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]If you thought that you could pass this course without doing any work, let me be the first to disenchant you.如果你觉得你不做任何功课也能及格，那就让我做第一个让你清醒的人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disabuse, undeceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]beguile, cozen, delude, dupe, fool, gull, hoax, hoodwink, misguide, misinform, mislead  诱骗</div>
<h2>forage[sound:forage.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">寻找：</font>to make a search</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]went foraging for change for the parking meter 寻找付停车费的零钱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chase, hunt, pursue, quest, rummage, search</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ignore, neglect 忽视，忽略；conceal, hide 隐藏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]forager n. 为动物寻找饲料的人</div>
<h2>illustrious[sound:illustrious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">著名的，杰出的：</font>well known and very distinguished</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the most illustrious scientists of the century 本世纪最为杰出的科学家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]distinguished, luminous, noble, notable, noteworthy, outstanding, preeminent, prestigious, redoubtable,signal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]average, inferior, mediocre  平凡的，较差的</div>
<h2>monarch[sound:monarch.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">君主，帝王：</font>one who rules over a people with a sole, supreme, and usually hereditary authority</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The ruling monarch of Britain at that time was Queen Elizabeth I. 伊丽莎白一世是当时英国的君主。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]autocrat, lord, potentate, ruler, sovereign</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">巨头，大亨：</font>a person of rank, power, or influence in a particular field</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the reigning monarchs of the recording industry 唱片业的巨头们</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baron, captain, king, lion, lord, magnate, mogul, prince, tycoon</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]nobody, nothing, zero 不起眼的人物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]monarchy n. 君主体制</div>
<h2>plebeian[sound:plebeian.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">平民的，社会下层的：</font>belonging to the class of people of low social or economic rank</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a man who rose to greatness but never forgot his plebeian past  一个仕途通达，但从未忘却自己平民出身的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baseborn, common, humble, inferior, lowborn, lumpen, mean, prole, proletarian, unwashed, vulgar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aristocratic, genteel, gentle, highborn, highbred, lofty, noble, partrician, wellborn 上流社会的</div>
<h2>squeamish[sound:squeamish.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">恶心的，晕船的：</font>affected with nausea</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the rolling of the ship made the young sailor squeamish 摇晃的船只让年轻的水手感到恶心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ill, nauseated, qualmish, queasy, queer, queerish, sick, sickish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]healthy, well 状态良好的</div>
<h2>wrest[sound:wrest.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">拧，扭动：</font>to pull, force, or move by violent wringing or twisting movements</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wrest the lid off this pickle jar 把泡菜罐的盖子拧下来</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]twist, wrench, wring</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">辛苦地获得：</font>to gain with difficulty by or as if by force, violence, or determined labor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]farmers who were used to wresting a living from the barren land 一度依靠贫瘠的土地恶劣度日的农民</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]scrape, scrounge, squeeze</div>
<h2>complacent[sound:complacent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">自满的，自鸣得意的：</font>feeling or showing an often excessive or unjustified satisfaction andpleasure in one's status, possessions, or attainments</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a complacent junior accountant who was certain of her indispensability to the company 一个确信自己对于公司而言无可替代而自满的年轻会计</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assured, consequential, egoistic, overweening, pompous, prideful, proud, smug, vain, vainglorious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]egoless, humble, modest, uncomplacent  谦逊的，谦卑的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无所谓的，不关心的：</font>having or showing a lack of interest or concern</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We can't afford to be complacent about rural illiteracy rates. 我们不能对农村的文盲率坐视不理。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apathetic, casual, disinterested, insouciant, nonchalant, perfunctory, pococurante, unconcerned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]attentive, concerned, heedful, interested, mindful 关注的，感兴趣的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]complacency n. 自满</div>
<h2>imposter[sound:imposter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">冒名顶替者，骗子：</font>one that assumes false identity or title for the purpose of deception</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The man who claimed to be my townsman turned out to be an impostor. 那个自称是我老乡的人结果是个骗子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charlatan, fake, fraud, hoaxer, humbug, mountebank, phony, pretender, quack, quacksalver, ringer, sham</div>
<h2>incumbent[sound:incumbent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">义不容辞的，必须的：</font>imposed as an obligation or duty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It is incumbent upon individuals to sacrifice for their country when it is in danger. 当国家受难时，个人应该义不容辞地为国做出牺牲。 ‖It is incumbent upon the press to act not in its own best interests, but in society'sbest interests. 对于媒体来说，为社会的利益 （而非自身利益）服务是其应尽的义务。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compulsory, forced, imperative, incumbent, involuntary, necessary, obligatory, peremptory, required</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]elective, optional, voluntary  可选择的</div>
<h2>splinter[sound:splinter.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">尖细条，刺：</font>a sharp, slender piece, as of wood, bone, glass, or metal, split or broken off from amain body</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She got a splinter from the unfinished wall. 她的手被还没有装修的墙扎了一根刺。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chip, flake, sliver, spall, splint</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]chunk, slab 厚板</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">切成细条：</font>to split or break into sharp, slender pieces</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]splintered the carrots into little sticks  把胡萝卜切成丝</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]slice</div>
<h2>calibrate[sound:calibrate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">校准，调校：</font>to check, adjust, or determine by comparison with a standard (the graduations ofa quantitative measuring instrument)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We need to calibrate the sextants navigation. 我们要为航行校准六分仪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adjust, align, gauge, graduate, measure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]calibration n. 校准</div>
<h2>commiserate[sound:commiserate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">表示怜悯，同情：</font>to feel or express sympathy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]commiserated over their failure 对他们的失败表示同情‖We commiserated with him but there was littlewe could do to make the situation better. 我们很同情他的遭遇，但是也只能表示无能为力。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ache, bleed, compassionate, condole, sympathize, yearn</div>
<h2>nullification[sound:nullification.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（尤指法律条文等正式的）废除，废弃：</font>the doing away with something by formal action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the nullification of a treaty 废除条约</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abolishment, abrogation, annulment, cancellation, invalidation, negation, repeal, rescindment, voiding</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]enactment, legislation 立法；establishment, founding, institution 建立</div>
<h2>behoove[sound:behoove.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">对…有利的：</font>to be necessary, proper or advantageous for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It behooves you at least to try. 你至少也应该尝试一下。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]befit, beseem, fit, serve, suite</div>
<h2>coarse[sound:coarse.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗糙的，表面不平整的：</font>not having a level or smooth surface</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the coarse surface of the sandpaper  砂纸的粗糙表面</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]broken, bumpy, irregular, jagged, lumpy, pebbly, ragged, rough, roughened, rugged, scraggy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]even, flat, level, plane 表面平整的；smooth 表面光滑的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（声音）刺耳的：</font>harsh, raucous, or rough in tone</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a coarse laugh from the living room 客厅里传来的一阵刺耳笑声</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]croaking, croaky, grating, gravel, gruff, husky, rasping, raspy, rusty, scratchy, throaty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]gentle, gliding, golden, liquid, mellifluent, mellifluous, mellow, soothing, sweet, tender （声音）柔美的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">粗俗的：</font>lacking in delicacy or refinement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They don't know how to behave, and are coarse and insulting. 他们不知道平常的行为礼节，因此显得粗俗而冒犯。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crass, crude, gross, incult, lowbred, raffish, rude, uncouth, uncultivated, unpolished, unrefined, vulgar</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]civilized, cultivated, cultured, genteel, polished, refined, smooth, tasteful 有教养的，举止得体的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（质量）低劣的：</font>of low, common, or inferior quality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]coarse imitations of quality merchandise 高级商品的粗劣仿制品</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]execrable, inferior, lousy, mediocre, miserable, rotten, rubbishy, shoddy, sleazy, terrible, trashy, wretched</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]excellent, fine, superior （品质）优良的</div>
<h2>defray[sound:defray.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">支付：</font>to undertake the payment of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The government has committed billions toward defraying the costs of the war. 政府为战争付出了成百上千亿元的代价。‖I don’t have sufficient fund to defray the expense. 我身上的现金还不够埋单。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disburse, expend, pay</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquire, earn, gain, garner, procure, realize, secure, win 获得，获取；charge 收取</div>
<h2>imperishable[sound:imperishable.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不能被摧毁的：</font>impossible to destroy; not subject to decay</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Energy is imperishable. 能量本身是不能被毁灭的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inextinguishable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]destructible, extinguishable, perishable 可被毁灭的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不朽的，永恒的：</font>enduring or occurring forever</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My memories are within me, imperishable. 我的回忆已经和我融为一体，不可改变。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ageless, continuing, eternal, everlasting, immortal, lasting, perennial, perpetual, timeless, undying</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]emphemeral, evanescent, fleeting, transient, transitory  稍纵即逝的</div>
<h2>machination[sound:machination.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">诡计：</font>a scheming or crafty action or artful design intended to accomplish some usually evil end</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The incredibly complicated machination to assassinate the president inevitably failed. 刺杀总统的诡计极其复杂，以至于不可避免地失败了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conspiracy, design, intrigue, plot, scheme</div>
<h2>onset[sound:onset.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">攻击，进攻：</font>attack, assault</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]withstand the onset of the army  抵挡住了敌人军队的进攻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggression, assault, charge, offense, onslaught, raid, rush, strike</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defense 防御</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">起始，开始：</font>the point at which something begins</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]If you take enough vitamin C at the onset of a cold, you'll probably recover faster. 如果你感冒刚一开始就服用足量的维他命C，你可能会康复得更快。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alpha, baseline, commencement, dawn, genesis, inception, kickoff, launch, nascence, outset, threshold</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]close, conclusion, end, ending, omega, termination 结束</div>
<h2>automatic[sound:automatic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（机器等）自动的：</font>acting or operating in a manner essentially independent of external influenceor control</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Will your next car be a manual or an automatic  你下辆车是手动挡还是自动挡？‖ Modernsubwaysare equipped with automatic screen doors. 现代地铁都装备了自动屏蔽门。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]automated, robotic, self-acting, self-operating, self-regulating</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]manual 手动的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">自发的，情不自禁的：</font>acting or done spontaneously or unconsciously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Carl’s automatic use of the brakes narrowly averted a collision. 卡尔不经意间所踩的刹车勉强避免了一场车祸。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]impulsive, instinctive, involuntary, mechanic, mechanical, natural, spontaneous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calculated, deliberate, intentional, planned, predetermined, premeditated, studied  有计划的，蓄意的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]automatically adv. 自动地</div>
<h2>bustle[sound:bustle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">忙乱，喧闹：</font>noisy, energetic, and often obtrusive activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the hustle and bustle of the big city 熙熙攘攘的大都市‖I  couldn't  concentrate  in  all  the  bustle  of  thestudent lounge. 学生休息室里过于嘈杂，我无法专心。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bluster, coil, disturbance, furor, hurricane, pandemonium, stir, storm, tumult, turmoil, uproar, welter, whirl</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]calm, hush, peace, quiet, rest, stillness, tranquillity 宁静，祥和；order 秩序</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（快速地）行走：</font>to move briskly and often ostentatiously</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the hostess bustled about, taking care of last-minute preparations for the party. 女主人四处走着，为聚会做最后的准备。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blast, bolt, careen, career, dash, fly, hustle, rush, rustle, speed, whirl</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]crawl, creep, lag, poke  缓慢行进</div>
<h2>canonize[sound:canonize.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">过分宠爱，过分崇拜：</font>to love or admire too much</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a singing star so canonized by his fans that they refuse to believe anything bad about him 一个受到粉丝疯狂追捧的歌星，他们不会相信任何关于他的负面新闻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adore, adulate, canonize, dote, worship</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abhor, abominate, belittle, despise, detest, disdain, dislike, disparage, hate, loathe 厌恶，鄙视</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使…崇高，使…神圣：</font>to assign a high status or value to</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some movie buffs canonized David Fincher as today’s most preeminent director. 一些影迷把大卫·芬奇视作是当今世界上最为出色的导演。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aggrandize, deify, dignify, elevate, ennoble, enshrine, ensky, enthrone, glorify, magnify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abase, degrade, demean, humble, humiliate 贬低，瞧不起</div>
<h2>endeavor[sound:endeavor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">努力，奋斗：</font>a conscientious or concerted effort toward an end</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We hope that this latest endeavor will yield much information about the atmosphere of the planet. 我们希望这最后一次的努力能够获取关于行星大气层的大量信息。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]attempt, essay, striving, struggle, trial, undertaking</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">努力做…，拼搏：</font>to devote serious and sustained effort</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]endeavor to improve the quality of life in the inner city 努力改善市内的生活质量‖They  endeavored  tocreate a government that truly serves its people. 他们在努力地创立一个一心为人民服务的政府。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assay, drudge, hustle, moil, plod, slave, strain, strive, sweat, seek, toil, travail, tug</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]drop, quit 放弃</div>

<h2>featureless[sound:featureless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏特征的：</font>lacking distinguishing characteristics or features</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the featureless landscape of the steppe 大草原上缺乏特色的地貌</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beige, characterless, faceless, indistinctive, neutral, noncommital, vanilla</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diagnostic, discriminating, distinct, distinctive, distinguishing, identifying, peculiar, typical 特征的</div>
<h2>frosty[sound:frosty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">寒冷的：</font>having a low or subnormal temperature</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a frosty autumn that was a sign of the brutal winter that followed 一个极为寒冷的秋天，它象征着随之而来的、可能更加残暴的冬季</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]algid, arctic, bitter, chilling, coldish, cool, freezing, frigid, gelid, glacial, icy, nippy, numbing, polar, snappy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]ardent, blazing, burning, fervent, fervid, molten, roasting, scalding, scorching, searing, sultry, sweltering, torrid 炎热的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无强烈感情的，冷淡的：</font>lacking in friendliness or warmth of feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She gave the telemarketer on the phone a frosty “No, thank you” and hung up. 她向电话那头的推销员冷冷地说了一句“不，谢谢”之后就挂掉了电话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antiseptic, apathetic, brittle, chilly, cold-blooded, frozen, indifferent, unfriendly, unsympathetic, wintry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cordial, friendly, genial, hearty, sympathetic, warm, warm-blooded, warmhearted 友善的，热心的</div>
<h2>sacrosanct[sound:sacrosanct.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极为神圣的，不可侵犯的：</font>most sacred or holy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The teacher's book of grades is sacrosanct, and someone could be expelled for changing anything in it.老师记录的成绩小册子是极为神圣的，任何篡改它的人可能受到被退学的惩罚。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hallowed, holy, inviolable, sacred, unassailable, untouchable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]blasphemous, irreverent, profane, sacrilegious 亵渎的</div>
<h2>shifty[sound:shifty.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（显得）狡诈的，（显得）欺诈的：</font>having, displaying, or suggestive of deceitful character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]shifty practices such as turning back the odometers on used cars 一些欺骗性的花招，比如把旧车的里程表调零 ‖He had a shifty face so I won’t trust him. 他看起来贼目鼠眼的，我不会相信他。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]crooked, deceitful, deceptive, duplicitous, fraudulent, guileful, rogue, shady, sharp, underhanded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aboveboard, honest, straight 正派的，光明正大的</div>
<h2>topsy-turvy[sound:topsy-turvy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">混乱的，不整洁的：</font>lacking in order, neatness, and often cleanliness; totally disordered</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The office is still topsy-turvy even though we moved in months ago. 尽管我们上个月就搬了进来，办公室还是混乱不堪。‖turning our ordered life topsy-turvy 把原本有序的生活彻底打乱</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chaotic,  confused,  disarranged,  disarrayed,  disheveled,  disorderly,  jumbled,  messed,  rumpled,  sloppy,unkempt, untidy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bandbox, crisp, kempt, neat, orderly, organized, shipshape, tidy, trim, well-ordered 整洁的，有序的</div>
<h2>wayward[sound:wayward.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">刚愎自用的，不服管束的：</font>following one's own capricious, wanton, or depraved inclinations</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]had always been the most wayward of their three children 总是三个小孩里最不听话的一个 ‖waywardchildren with a history of behavioral problems 过去行为上有些问题的调皮小孩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balky, contrary, contumacious, defiant, intractable, obstreperous, rebellious, recalcitrant, refractory, unruly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amenable, biddable, compliant, conformable, docile, obedient, ruly, submissive, tractable 顺从的</div>
<h2>backslide[sound:backslide.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（情况等）倒退，固态萌发：</font>to revert to a worse condition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Keep these things in mind to help prevent you from backsliding.  牢记这些东西，他们能防止你旧病复犯。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]degenerate, lapse, recidivate, relapse, retrograde, retrogress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advance, progress 进步，前进</div>
<h2>beholden[sound:beholden.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">欠他人人情的：</font>owing something, such as gratitude, to another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Not wanting to be beholden to anyone, he insisted on paying his own way. 因为不想欠别人的人情，所以他坚持出自己的那一份钱。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]indebted, obligated, obliged</div>
<h2>beige[sound:beige.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">缺乏特征的：</font>lacking distinction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some food critics have dismissed that chef's version of French cuisine as beige and boring. 一些美食评论家认为那名厨师所做的法国菜平凡无奇，令人厌倦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]characterless, faceless, featureless, indistinctive, neutral, noncommital, vanilla</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diagnostic, discriminating, distinct, distinctive, distinguishing, identifying, peculiar, typical 特征的</div>
