<h2>bluff[sound:bluff.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">直率的，（说话）直截了当的：</font>being or characterized by direct, brief, and potentially rude speechor manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Frankly speaking, he is a bluff but good-hearted teacher. 老实说，这个老师说话很直率，但是心地善良。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abrupt, brusque, crusty, curt, downright, forthright, snippy, straightforward, unceremonious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]circuitous, mealy-mouthed （说话）拐弯抹角的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">欺骗：</font>to cause to believe what is untrue; deceive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I successfully bluffed the interviewer into believing that I could really speak French and thus would be the perfect person to serve in the newspaper’s Paris bureau. 我成功地欺骗了面试官，让他相信我会法语，从而成为报社在巴黎办事处的不二人选。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bamboozle, beguile, cozen, deceive, delude, dupe, fool, hoax, misguide, misinform, mislead, trick</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disabuse, disenchant, disillusion 使清醒</div>
<h2>brim[sound:brim.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">边缘，边界：</font>an upper or outer margin</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The brim of the teacup was banded with gold. 茶杯的边缘被镀上了金。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]borderline, bound, boundary, circumference, confines, edge, frame, fringe, margin, perimeter, periphery,skirt, verge</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]center, core, heart, kernel 核心</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">充满：</font>to be or become full often to overflowing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a secondhand bookstore that was brimming with bargains 一个到处都是减价品的二手书店‖eyesbrimming with tears 饱含热泪的双眼</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bristle, bulge, burst, bustle, buzz, crawl, hum, overflow, pullulate, swarm, teem</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lack, need, want 缺少，缺乏</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">加满，倒满：</font>to put into (something) as much as can be held or contained</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He brimmed the glass with milk, and now I’m afraid that I will spill it. 他向杯子里倒了太多牛奶，我现在担心会不会洒出来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]charge, cram, heap, jam, load, pack, stuff</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clear, empty, evacuate, vacate, void 清空</div>
<h2>calamity[sound:calamity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">大灾难：</font>a disastrous event marked by great loss and lasting distress and suffering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]This latest breakdown of the car is inconvenient, but not a calamity. 最近的汽车抛锚确实带来了不便，但还不是一场灾难。‖an economic calamity 金融风暴</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apocalypse, cataclysm, catastrophe, debacle, disaster, tragedy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benediction, boon, felicity, godsend, manna, windfall 天赐好运，幸事</div>
<h2>calculated[sound:calculated.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">经过计算（成败得失）的，经过深思熟虑的：</font>engaged in, undertaken, or displayed after reckoningor estimating the statistical probability of success or failure</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He took a calculated risk and got in on the ground floor of the new enterprise.  他深思熟虑一番之后决定冒这个险，踏出了迈向新计划的第一步。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advised, considered, deliberate, knowing, measured, reasoned, studied, thoughtful, weighed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]automatic, casual, instinctive, spontaneous, unstudied  随意的，不假思索的</div>
<h2>captious[sound:captious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">吹毛求疵的，爱挑毛病的：</font>marked by an often ill-natured inclination to stress faults and raiseobjections</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a captious and cranky eater who has never met a vegetable he didn’t hate 一个古怪又挑剔的食客，从来就没有他不讨厌的蔬菜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carping, caviling, critical, faultfinding, hypercritical, judgmental, overcritical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]appreciative 表示欣赏的</div>
<h2>cellular[sound:cellular.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">多孔的：</font>containing cavities; having a porous texture</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the cellular construction of a beehive 蜂巢的多孔结构</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]porous</div>
<h2>ceremonious[sound:ceremonious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">讲究礼节的，庄重的：</font>marked by or showing careful attention to set forms and details</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A century ago everyday life was much more ceremonious than in our anything-goes era. 一个世纪之前的生活和我们现在这个随便怎么都无所谓的年代相比，多出了许多要讲究的礼节。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]correct, decorous, formal, nice, proper, punctilious, starchy, stiff, stilted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]casual, easygoing, informal, unceremonious 随意的，不正式的</div>
<h2>certitude[sound:certitude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">确信无疑：</font>the state of being or feeling certain</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I believes with certitude that he is the best candidate for the job. 我确信他是这项工作的最佳人选。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assurance, assuredness, certainty, confidence, conviction, doubtlessness, positiveness, sureness, surety</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]doubt, dubiety, incertitude, uncertainty 不确定</div>
<h2>channel[sound:channel.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">水渠：</font>an open man-made passageway for water</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Water was drained from the swamp through a specially constructed channel. 这块沼泽通过一条特殊建造的水渠源源不断地向外输水。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aqueduct, canal, conduit, course, flume, racecourse, raceway, watercourse, waterway</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">海峡：</font>a narrow body of water between two land masses</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the world record for swimming the channel between Alaska and Chukotskiy 横渡阿拉斯加和楚科奇之间海峡（也即白令海峡）的世界纪录</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]narrows, neck, sound, strait</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">将…导向，投入：</font>to cause to move to a central point or along a restricted pathway</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a youth who channeled all of his energy into sports 一个将毕生精力都投入体育之中的少年</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]canalize, channelize, conduct, direct, funnel, pipe, siphon</div>
<h2>chivalrous[sound:chivalrous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有骑士风度的，（尤指对女性）彬彬有礼的：</font>marked by gracious courtesy and high-mindedconsideration(especially to women)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]still engages in chivalrous behavior, such as opening doors for people 仍然坚持着有风度的行为，比如帮别人开门</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]big, elevated, gallant, great, greathearted, high, high-minded, lofty, lordly, magnanimous, natural, sublime</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]base, debased, degenerate, degraded, ignoble, ignominious, low 品行低劣的，可鄙的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]chivalry n. 骑士风度</div>
<h2>chorale[sound:chorale.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">赞美诗：</font>a hymn or psalm sung to a traditional or composed melody in church</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]practiced a chorale to perform in church 练习吟唱要在教堂表演的赞美诗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anthem, canticle, carol, hymn, paean, psalm, spiritual</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">合唱班，合唱团：</font>an organized group of singers</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a chorale that is regarded as being among the best in the state 一个被认为是国内一流的合唱班</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choir, chorus, consort, ensemble</div>
<h2>clamor[sound:clamor.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">喧闹，喧哗，噪声：</font>loud, confused, and usually inharmonious sound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A clamor arose from the crowd as the prisoner was brought forward.  当犯人被带上前台时，人群中爆发出一阵骚动。‖the clamor of a dozen people practicing the trumpet at once 一群人同时练习小号时发出的噪音</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]blare, bluster, cacophony, clangor, discordance, howl, racket, rattle, roar, tumult, uproar, vociferation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]quiet, silence, still, stillness  寂静；calm, lull, serenity, tranquility 宁静，祥和</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]clamorous adj. 喧闹的</div>
<h2>clan[sound:clan.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（有共同爱好的）团体，帮派：</font>a group united by a common interest or common characteristics</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That clan of football fans has parties every weekend on which the New England Patriots play. 只要是新英格兰爱国者队有比赛的周末，那帮球迷就会举行聚会。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]body, bunch, circle, clique, community, coterie, coven, crowd, fold, network, pack, ring, set</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clannish adj. 派系的；团结的</div>
<h2>cleave[sound:cleave.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">紧贴，坚持：</font>to adhere firmly and closely or loyally and unwaveringly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]You should resolutely cleave to the facts in your report. 你应该在报道中坚持客观的原则。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adhere, cling, hew, stick</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defect 叛变</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">分隔，割裂：</font>to divide by or as if by a cutting blow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]His spade cleaved the firm sand with a harsh crunch.  他的锹凿开了坚实的砂土，发出尖锐刺耳的嘎扎声。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cut, decouple, disconnect, disjoin, dissever, dissociate, divide, part, ramify, sever, slice, split, sunder</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]join, link, unify, unite 连接，接合</div>
<h2>cling[sound:cling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">粘结，粘合：</font>a physical sticking to as if by glue</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]For certain types of materials that plastic wrap has very little cling. 对于某些材料，那种塑料保鲜袋的粘性不好。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adherence, bonding, cohesion</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">紧贴，支持：</font>to adhere as if glued firmly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dozen magnets clinging to the refrigerator 贴靠在冰箱门上的磁石‖continued to cling to the old ideasof child rearing long after they had gone out of fashion 仍然坚持关于抚养孩子的老观念，尽管它们已经过时</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adhere, cleave, hew, stick</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defect 叛变</div>
<h2>cohesive[sound:cohesive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有粘性的，有凝聚力的：</font>exhibiting or producing cohesion or coherence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a cohesive social unit 有凝聚力的社会个体‖cohesive soils  有粘性的土壤</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adherent, adhesive, clingy, gluey, glutinous, gummy, tacky, tenacious, viscid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]non-adhesive, non-viscous  无粘性的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]cohesion n. 粘结；凝聚力</div>
<h2>collaborate[sound:collaborate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">合作：</font>to work jointly with others or together especially in an intellectual endeavor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The two men collaborated on a blockbuster in 1986 which gained both of them fame. 两人在 1986 年合作出演了一部十分卖座的电影，由此获得了巨大的名声。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]band, concert, cooperate, concur, conjoin, conspire, join, league, unite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]stonewall 拒绝合作</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]collaboration n. 合作，协作</div>
<h2>compatible[sound:compatible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">一致的，能共存的：</font>capable of existing together in harmony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I don’t think that they could be compatible as roommates. 我不觉得他们做了室友之后生活会很和谐。‖a theory that is compatible with what we already know about early man 一个与对远古人类的已有知识不存在矛盾的理论</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accordant, coherent, concordant, conformable, congruent, congruous, consonant, harmonious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conflicting, incompatible, incongruous, inconsistent, inharmonious 有冲突的，矛盾的</div>
<h2>compelling[sound:compelling.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">极具说服力的：</font>having the power to persuade</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]made a compelling argument against military intervention 就反对军事干预提出了很有说服力的论证‖If you can’t present any compelling evidence to prove your innocence, you will be found guilty. 如果你找不出任何能证明你清白的有力证据，你就会被定罪。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conclusive, convincing, decisive, effective, forceful, persuasive, satisfying, strong, telling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]feeble, weak 说服力不足的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迫切的，紧迫的：</font>needing immediate attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There is no compelling need to raise taxes at this time.  现在没有迫切的提升税率的必要。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burning,  clamant,  critical,  crying,  dire,  emergent,  exigent,  imperative,  imperious,  importunate,  instant,necessitous, pressing, urgent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]minor, negligible, trivial, unimportant  不重要的，琐碎的</div>
<h2>complementary[sound:complementary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">互补的：</font>mutually supplying each other’s lack</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The complementary contributions of the cooking and cleanup committees were essential to the success ofthe barbecue. 负责食物和卫生的两个小组之间的相互配合是野炊成功的关键。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]correlative, interdependent, reciprocal, supplemental, supplementary</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contradictory, incompatible 矛盾的</div>
<h2>complicate[sound:complicate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使复杂化：</font>to make complex or difficult</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Don’t complicate matters by getting the parents involved. 不要把父母牵扯进来，这会让问题更复杂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]complex, embarrass, entangle, ravel, perplex, sophisticate, tangle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]simplify, streamline 简化</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]complicated adj. 复杂的，麻烦的</div>
<h2>comprehend[sound:comprehend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">理解，了解：</font>to grasp the nature, significance, or meaning of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]the age at which children can comprehend the difference between right and wrong 一个小孩可以开始分辨是非的年龄‖With internet, television, cellphone and even radio down, we are unable to comprehend what hashappened. 互联网、电视、手机乃至无线电都不起作用了，我们无法获知发生了什么。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appreciate, apprehend, assimilate, behold, catch, cognize, conceive, discern, grasp, perceive, recognize,savvy, see, seize, sense, understand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]misapprehend, misconceive, misinterpret, misperceive, misunderstand 误解</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">包括，包含：</font>to contain or hold within a total scope, significance, or amount</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Our notion of morality should comprehend much more than proper sexual behavior. 我们的道德观不应该仅仅止步于恰当的性行为。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carry, contain, embrace, encompass, entail, involve, number, subsume, take in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]exclude, leave, omit, preclude 排除，忽略</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]comprehensive adj. 全面的，综合的；comprehension n. 理解；  comprehensible adj. 可理解的</div>
<h2>concrete[sound:concrete.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">实体的，实在的：</font>relating to or composed of matter</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]concrete objects like rocks and trees 像石头、树这一类的实物</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]physical, substantial, substantive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]airy, diaphanous, gossamery, immaterial, tenuous, thin, vaporous 虚无飘渺的，非实体的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">事实性的，明确的：</font>existing in fact and not merely as a possibility</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Concrete evidence, and not just a theory, must be presented at a trial. 在法庭上需要出示确凿的证据，而非臆测。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]effective, existent, factual, genuine, real, true, very, de facto</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conjectural, hypothetical, ideal, platonic, suppositional, theoretical 猜测的，理论上的</div>
<h2>condemn[sound:condemn.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">谴责（为不道德的、邪恶的）：</font>to declare to be reprehensible, wrong, or evil usually after weighingevidence and without reservation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a policy widely condemned as racist  一个被广泛谴责为种族歧视的政策‖It  is  a  sign  of  human  progress that slavery, which was once common, is now universally condemned. 曾经很平常的奴隶制如今却沦落到人人谴责的境地，这不能不说是人类文明的进步。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]anathematize, censure, damn, decry, denounce, execrate, reprimand, reprehend, reproach, reprobate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]commend, endorse, extol, laud, praise 赞扬，赞颂</div>
<h2>conditional[sound:conditional.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有条件的，受制约的：</font>subject to, implying, or dependent upon a condition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a conditional offer  有条件限制的录取‖Their support is conditional on their approval of his proposals.  他只有让他的提案得到他们的同意才能得到援助。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contingent, dependent, subject, tentative</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absolute, categorical, unconditional 不受制约的；independent  独立的</div>
<h2>conflate[sound:conflate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">混合：</font>to turn into a single mass or entity that is more or less the same throughout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The movie conflates documentary footage and dramatized reenactments so seamlessly and ingeniously that viewers may not know what is real and what is not. 电影将纪实档案和娱乐性的夸张如此巧妙无缝地糅合起来，以至于观众不知道哪一部分是真实的，哪一部分是虚构的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amalgamate, combine, composite, fuse, homogenize, immingle, incorporate, integrate, interfuse, meld,merge, mingle, mix</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disunite, divide, part, separate, sunder 分离</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conflation n. 合并</div>
<h2>conform[sound:conform.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使协调：</font>bring into harmony or accord</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We  have to conform this new rule with existing policy regarding student-run organizations on campus.我们必须要让这些新规定与现行的校园学生社团的政策相协调。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accommodate, attune, conciliate, coordinate, key, reconcile</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disharmonize  使不和谐</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">调整（以适应）：</font>to change (something) so as to make it suitable for a new use or situation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I can be funny or serious, for I always conform my behavior to the situation. 我会根据情况调整举止，因此我有时候会很活泼，有时候会很严肃。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acclimate, acclimatize, accommodate, adjust, condition, doctor, edit, fashion, fit, put, shape, suit, tailor</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">遵照，遵从：</font>to be obedient or compliant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an independent-minded person who refuses to conform to another’s wishes 一个思想独立的拒绝遵照他人的意愿行动的人</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adhere, comply, follow, goose-step, mind, observe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]defy, disobey, rebel 不从，反抗</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]conformist n. 墨守成规的人；conformism n. 守旧</div>
<h2>conjure[sound:conjure.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">请求，恳求：</font>to charge or entreat earnestly or solemnly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I conjure you to hear my plea for mercy. 请您发发慈悲吧。‖He  conjured  them  with his dying  breath  tolook after his children. 临终前他恳求他们照顾他的孩子。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appeal, beseech, besiege, entreat, impetrate, implore, importune, petition, plead, pray, solicit, supplicate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">在脑海中浮现：</font>to form a mental picture of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With certain flowers I instantly conjure up memories of our Caribbean honeymoon. 这些鲜花让我立即回想起加勒比海的蜜月之旅。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conceive, dream, envisage, envision, fancy, fantasize, feature, ideate, image, picture, vision, visualize</div>
<h2>consent[sound:consent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">同意，赞同：</font>the approval by someone in authority for the doing of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We had to get our neighbor’s consent in order to trim the tree from his side. 想要从邻居家那边修剪树木，我们得先得到他们的同意。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allowance, approval, authorization, clearance, concurrence, granting, license, sanction, warrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]interdiction, prohibition, proscription 禁止</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">同意：</font>to give assent or approval</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]consent to being tested in her neurobiology experiment 同意作为被试参加神经生物学的实验‖refused  toconsent to the marriage 拒绝这桩婚事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acquiesce, agree, approve, assent, subscribe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dissent 反对；deny, veto  否决</div>
<h2>consign[sound:consign.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">转交，转移（给他人）：</font>to give, transfer, or deliver into the hands or control of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The record shows that the deliveryman had consigned our package to a next-door neighbor. 记录显示邮递员把我们的包裹转投给隔壁邻居了。‖a writer consigned to oblivion 湮没无闻的作家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]commend, commit, confide, delegate, deliver, entrust, hand, recommend, repose, transfer, transmit, vest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hold, keep, retain 保留</div>
<h2>consternation[sound:consternation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">惊愕，恐慌，恐惧：</font>a state of paralyzing dismay</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The two girls stared at each other in consternation without any idea about what to do. 两个小女孩惊恐地望着对方，显得不知所措。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alarm, apprehension, dread, fear, fright, horror, terror, trepidation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bravery, courage, dauntlessness, fearlessness, fortitude, intrepidity, stoutness, valor 勇气，无畏</div>
<h2>contemplate[sound:contemplate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt./vi. 沉思，仔细思索：to view or consider with continued attention</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]contemplate the vastness of the universe 沉思着宇宙的广袤无垠‖She  contemplated  the  problem  forseveral hours before reaching a decision. 她苦苦思索了几个小时的问题后才做出决定。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cogitate, consider, deliberate, meditate, mull, perpend, pore, revolve, ruminate, study, weigh, wrestle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disregard, ignore, overlook, slight 忽视</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contemplation n. 沉思，思索</div>
<h2>contempt[sound:contempt.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">蔑视，鄙视：</font>open dislike for someone or something considered unworthy of one's concern orrespect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]my undying contempt for people who abuse animals 我对于虐待动物者的无尽鄙视‖Her  contempt  forilliterate was obvious.  你可以很明显地看出她对文盲的鄙夷。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]contemptuousness, despisement, despite, despitefulness, disdain, misprision, scorn</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]admiration, esteem, estimation, regard, respect, reverence, veneration 尊敬，敬仰</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contemptible adj. 可鄙的；contemptuous adj. 蔑视的</div>
<h2>contend[sound:contend.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">竞争，争夺：</font>to strive or vie in contest or rivalry or against difficulties</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]two traditional rivals contending for the championship 两支争夺冠军头衔的老对手</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]battle, fight, race, rival, vie</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]capitulate, quit, succumb, surrender, give in 投降</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">声明，声称：</font>to state as a fact usually forcefully</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]contended that his opponent was wrong about practically everything  宣称对手几乎在所有问题上都犯了错误‖that the his considerable experience made him the best candidate  声称因为他见多识广，所以是最佳人选</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affirm, allege, assert, aver, avouch, avow, declare, insist, maintain, profess, protest, purport, warrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deny, gainsay  否认</div>
<h2>contradict[sound:contradict.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">否认，反驳；相矛盾：</font>to assert the contrary of; to imply the opposite or a denial of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]contradict a rumor  反驳谣言‖Your actions contradict your words. 你的行为和你说的话自相矛盾。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deny, disaffirm, disavow, disclaim, disconfirm, disown, gainsay, negate, negative, refute, reject, repudiate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acknowledge, admit, avow, concede, confirm  承认</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]contradictory adj. 矛盾的，相反的</div>
<h2>contrived[sound:contrived.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不自然的，刻意的：</font>lacking in natural or spontaneous quality</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We are bored with the contrived applause of a TV studio audience that has been told when to clap. 摄影棚中的观众会被告知什么时候鼓掌，这种经过精心指挥的掌声让我们倍感困倦。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affected, assumed, bogus, factitious, feigned, plastic, pretended, pseudo, simulated, unnatural</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]artless, natural, spontaneous, unaffected, uncontrived, unfeigned, unforced 真诚的，不虚伪的</div>
<h2>correlate[sound:correlate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使…相关联：</font>to establish a mutual or reciprocal relation between</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a demanding father who always correlated success with hard work 一个总将成功和辛勤工作关联起来的严格父亲‖In this work, we correlate the simulation in the lab and the observation in the field  to examine thevalidity of our theory. 本文中，我们将实验室的模拟结果和场地外的观测数据联系起来以验证理论的真实性。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]connect, identify, link, relate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]separate  分离</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]correlation n. 关联，关系</div>
<h2>counterpart[sound:counterpart.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（地位、功能）对等的人或物：</font>one having the same function or characteristics as another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She worked with her counterpart in the other office to get the job done. 她与另一个办公室的同职人员一起努力完成这项工作。‖U.S. presidents and his British counterpart 美国总统和英国首相</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]coequal, compeer, coordinate, equivalent, fellow, like, match, parallel, peer, rival</div>
<h2>courteous[sound:courteous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">礼貌的，恭谦有礼的：</font>marked by polished manners, gallantry, or ceremonial usage of a court</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Their customer service department always gives courteous responses, even to rude people. 哪怕是对粗鲁的消费者，他们的客服部门总是用一种非常有礼貌的态度回复。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]civil, civilized, couth, genteel, gracious, mannerly, suave, urbane, well-bred</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discourteous, ill-bred, ill-mannered, impertinent, impolite, impudent, insolent, rude  粗鲁的，不礼貌的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]courtesy n. 礼貌，恭谦</div>
<h2>credible[sound:credible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可信的，值得信赖的：</font>worthy of being accepted as true or reasonable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It’s not perfect, but is at least a credible explanation. 尽管还不算完美，但这好歹也算是可信的解释了。‖a credible account of an accident 事故的可靠报道</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]believable, creditable, likely, plausible, presumptive, probable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]implausible, improbable, incredible, unbelievable, unlikely 不可信的，难以置信的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]credibility n. 可靠性，公信力</div>
<h2>credit[sound:credit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">信任，信赖：</font>mental conviction of the truth of some statement or the reality of some being orphenomenon</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I give full credit to this report on the prevalence of cheating among college students today. 我非常相信这则有关大学中作弊成风的报道。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belief, credence, faith, trust</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disbelief, doubt, dubiety, incertitude 不信任，不确定</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">表扬，赞扬：</font>public acknowledgment or admiration for an achievement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She deserves all the credit, since she did all the work. 是她完成了所有的工作，因此荣誉都应该归她所有。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acclaim, accolade, applause, commendation, distinction, endorsement, homage, honor, kudos, laud</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]denunciation, excoriation, rebuke, reprimand, reproach, reproof, stricture  谴责，责难</div>
<h2>decry[sound:decry.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">强烈反对，否定：</font>to express strong disapproval of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Scientists were quick to decry the claims of the psychic. 通灵者的说法很快就遭到了科学家的反对。‖decry the excessive emphasis on sex 谴责对于性的过分重视</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belittle, denigrate, denounce, deprecate, depreciate, derogate, disapprove, dismiss, disparage, minimize</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acclaim, applaud, exalt, extol, glorify, laud, magnify, praise 表扬，称颂</div>
<h2>deign[sound:deign.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">（不情愿地）屈尊，俯就：</font>to condescend reluctantly and with a strong sense of the affront to one'ssuperiority that is involved</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I would never deign to answer that absurd accusation. 我根本不屑于去解释那样一个荒谬的指责。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]condescend, stoop</div>
<h2>delineate[sound:delineate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">勾勒，用线条描绘：</font>to indicate or represent by drawn or painted lines</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]lights delineating the narrow streets 勾勒狭窄街道线条的路灯</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]define, silhouette, sketch, trace</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">描写，描绘：</font>to describe, portray, or set forth with accuracy or in detail</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]delineate the steps to be taken by the government  具体描述了政府所应该采取的措施‖The  film  does  a remarkable job of delineating the emotions that immigrants feel upon their arrival in a strange country. 就描绘移民者踏上陌生国土时的心情而言，这部电影是相当成功的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]depict, display, draw, image, limn, paint, picture, portray, render</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]color, distort, falsify, garble, misrepresent, misstate, pervert, twist, warp 曲解，篡改本意</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]delineation n. 描绘</div>
<h2>desperate[sound:desperate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">绝望的：</font>feeling or showing no hope</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a desperate spirit crying for relief 一个渴望宽慰的绝望的灵魂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]despondent, despairing, forlorn, hopeless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hopeful, optimistic  充满希望的，乐观的</div>
<h2>dichotomy[sound:dichotomy.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">一分为二，分割：</font>a  division into two  especially mutually exclusive or contradictory groups orentities</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dichotomy between the academic world and the industrial world 学术界和工业界的割裂</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bifurcation, breakup, cleavage, division, fractionalization, partition, schism, scission, split, sundering</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unification, union 统一</div>
<h2>dictate[sound:dictate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">指令，命令：</font>a command by one in authority</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]followed the dictates of my conscience 遵从我的良心准则‖The army must abide by the dictates of thenew government.  军队必须服从新政府的命令。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]behest, charge, commandment, decree, direction, directive, edict, imperative, injunction, instruction, order</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（仗着地位、权力）下令：</font>to request the doing of by virtue of one’s authority</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The general dictated that the terms of surrender be negotiated by his senior staff.  将军要求投降书中的若干条款交付手下的高级将领进行讨论。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]call, decree, direct, impose, mandate, ordain, order, prescribe</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cancel, countermand, rescind 撤销命令</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dictator n. 独裁者</div>
<h2>discreet[sound:discreet.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（言行）谨慎的：</font>having or showing good judgment and restraint especially in conduct or speech</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He was very discreet, only saying what was necessary. 他是个十分谨慎的人，从来不说多余的话。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]intelligent, judicious, prudent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]imprudent, indiscreet, injudicious 不谨慎的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不易察觉的：</font>not readily seen or noticed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]With a discreet gesture, she signaled to her husband that she was ready to leave the party. 她用一个不起眼的手势向丈夫暗示准备离开聚会。‖followed at a discreet distance 远远地跟踪</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]inconspicuous, invisible, unnoticeable, unobtrusive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apparent, conspicuous, distinct, evident, manifest, noticeable, obvious, patent, visible 明显的</div>
<h2>disprove[sound:disprove.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">证伪，证明为假：</font>to prove to be false or wrong</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Magellan’s circumnavigation of the globe disproved any lingering notions that the earth is flat. 麦哲伦的环球旅行彻底否认了任何残存的“地球是平的”的观念。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]belie, confound, confute, debunk, disconfirm, discredit, falsify, rebut, refute, shoot down</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confirm, establish, prove, validate, verify 证实，证明为真</div>
<h2>distinctive[sound:distinctive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">完全不同的：</font>being not of the same kind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She seems to alternate between two distinctive hairstyles. 她的发型似乎在两种截然不同的样式中交替。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disparate, dissimilar, distant, distinct, distinguishable, diverse, unalike, unlike</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]identical, indistinguishable, same 相同的；alike, analogous, kindred, like, parallel, similar 相似的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">特征性的，典型的：</font>serving to identify as belonging to an individual or group</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She seems to alternate between two distinctive hairstyles. 她的发型似乎在两种截然不同的样式中交替。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]characteristic, classic, diagnostic, discriminating, distinguishing, identifying, peculiar, symptomatic, typical</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]atypical, uncharacteristic, untypical 非典型的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]distinction n. 区别，差别</div>
<h2>doctrinaire[sound:doctrinaire.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">教条主义的，照本宣科的：</font>given  to  or  marked  by  the  forceful  expression  of  strongly  heldopinions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A doctrinaire conservative, the columnist takes special delight in baiting liberals. 这个专栏作家是个谨遵教条的顽固保守主义者，他很享受挑衅那些自由主义者。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dogmatic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]latitudinarian （宗教方面）能容纳不同意见的</div>
<h2>drab[sound:drab.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">单调的，无聊的：</font>characterized by dullness and monotony</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The new city hall turned out to be another drab pile of masonry for the town. 新的市政大厅结果又是城镇里一座单调无趣的砖瓦堆积物。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arid,  dreary,  drudging,  humdrum,  jading,  jejune,  monochromatic,  monotonous,  pedestrian,  ponderous,stale, stodgy, tedious, tiresome, wearisome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 令人感兴趣的</div>
<h2>dramatic[sound:dramatic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj.<font color="#aa00ff">显著的，惹人注意的：</font>striking in appearance or effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a dramatic drop in the temperature overnight 夜晚气温的显著下降</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arresting, bold, brilliant, catchy, conspicuous, flamboyant, prominent, remarkable, splashy, striking</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discreet, inconspicuous, invisible, subtle, unnoticeable, unobtrusive 不易引起注意的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dramatically adv. 显著地</div>
<h2>dread[sound:dread.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">恐惧：</font>great fear especially in the face of impending evil</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We were filled with dread when we saw the rapids we would be rafting down. 当我们看到竹筏驶向的激流时，我们的内心被恐惧所占据。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]alarm, apprehension, consternation, fear, fright, horror, terror, trepidation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bravery, courage, dauntlessness, fearlessness, fortitude, intrepidity, stoutness, valor 勇气，无畏</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]dreadful adj. 令人恐惧的</div>
<h2>duplicate[sound:duplicate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">复制品：</font>either of two things exactly alike and usually produced at the same time or by the sameprocess</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a duplicate of a house key 房间钥匙的复制品‖Your computer is almost a duplicate of mine. 你的电脑和我的几乎一模一样。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]copy, dupe, duplication, facsimile, imitation, mock, reduplication, replica, replication, reproduction</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]archetype, original, prototype 原型</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">复制：</font>to make a copy of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A cell duplicates itself when it divides. 当一个细胞分裂时，它会完全按着自己的样子复制。‖Art students are trying to duplicate paintings in the museum’s collection as part of their training. 艺术生们努力地复刻博物馆中的作品，由此作为他们的训练。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clone, copycat, imitate, reduplicate, render, replicate, reproduce</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]originate 原创</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">重复，反复：</font>to do over or again often needlessly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We were unable to duplicate the experiment with the same result in our own lab, so we’re suspicious.我们不能在自己的实验室中重复之前的实验并得到相同的结果，因此我们很怀疑。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]redo, reiterate, renew, repeat</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]duplicable adj. 可模仿的</div>
<h2>dynamic[sound:dynamic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有力量的，有活力的：</font>marked by usually continuous and productive activity or change; energetic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He has become a dynamic new challenger for the title of champion. 他成为了有望夺的有活力的新选手。‖a dynamic speech expressing her goals and values 宣扬她的目标和理念的慷慨激昂的演讲</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]brisk, energetic, flush, forceful, gingery, kinetic, lusty, peppy, robust, sprightly, vital, vivacious</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dull, lethargic, listless, sluggish, torpid 无精打采的</div>
<h2>eclectic[sound:eclectic.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">混合的，多元化的：</font>composed of elements drawn from various sources</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The museum’s eclectic collection has everything from a giraffe skeleton to medieval musical instruments.博物馆里的展品丰富多样，从长颈鹿的骨架到中世纪的乐器都有。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assorted, diverse, heterogeneous, indiscriminate, magpie, mixed, motley, piebald, ragtag, varied</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]homogeneous, uniform  同一性的</div>
<h2>efficacious[sound:efficacious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">有效的：</font>having the power to produce a desired effect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Taking break with a cup of coffee while studying is one of the most efficacious ways of rejuvenating themind that I have ever discovered. 在紧张的学习中休息一会，喝杯咖啡，是我发现的最能提神的方法之一。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]effective, effectual, efficient, fruitful, operative, potent, productive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bootless, fruitless, ineffective, ineffectual, inefficient, inoperative, unproductive, useless 无效的</div>
<h2>elude[sound:elude.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">躲闪，躲避：</font>to avoid adroitly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]managed to elude capture 成功躲过了追捕‖The millionaire had been eluding his fair share of taxes foryears before getting caught. 在被逮捕之前，这名富翁逃税已经有若干年了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]avoid, dodge, duck, eschew, evade, finesse, scape, shirk, shun, sidestep, weasel</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confront 直面，面对</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使无法理解，使困惑：</font>to escape the perception, understanding, or grasp of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a metaphor that eluded them 一个让他们无法理解的比喻</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]baffle, befog, befuddle, bewilder, confound, discombobulate, disorient, maze, mystify, perplex, puzzle, vex</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]clarify, elucidate, explicate, expound, illuminate, illustrate 解释，阐明</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]elusive adj. 隐秘的；难懂的</div>
<h2>enamored[sound:enamored.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">迷恋的，热爱的：</font>filled with an intense or excessive love for</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Many teenage girls became enamored of the movie idol for her boyish good looks. 很多年轻的女孩子因为影星男性化的帅气面庞而对她深深迷恋。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]besotted, bewitched, captivated, crazy, dotty, enraptured, fascinated, infatuated, mad, nuts, obsessed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathetic, detached, indifferent, insouciant, nonchalant  无所谓的，冷漠的</div>
<h2>enthrall[sound:enthrall.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（像用魔咒般）吸引：</font>to hold the attention of as if by a spell</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Enthralled by the flickering aurora in the sky, we lost all track of time. 我们被夜空里变化莫测的极光深深地吸引，以至于忘却了时间。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absorb, arrest, bedazzle, enchant, engross, fascinate, grip, hypnotize, immerse, mesmerize, spellbind</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bore, jade, pall, tire, weary 使厌恶</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]enthralling adj. 吸引人的</div>
<h2>ethos[sound:ethos.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">道德准则：</font>the code of good conduct for an individual or group</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Rigorous self-discipline was central to the ethos of the ancient Spartans.  严格的自律是古代斯巴达人所尊崇的核心道德准则。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ethics, morality, morals, norms, principles, standards</div>
<h2>exorcise[sound:exorcise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">除去：</font>to get rid of (something troublesome, menacing, or oppressive)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Please exorcise that offensive word from your vocabulary. 请把那个粗鲁的词从你的字典里删掉。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cashier, cast, ditch, dump, fling, jettison, lose, pitch, reject, scrap, shed, slough, throw, toss, unload</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]adopt, employ, use, utilize 采用，使用</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]exorcism n. 除魔，驱鬼</div>
<h2>explicate[sound:explicate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">解释，说明：</font>to give a detailed explanation of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The physicist did his best to explicate the wave theory of light for the audience of laymen. 物理学家尽其所能向一群非专业的群众解释了光的波动性理论。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clarify, clear, construe, demonstrate, demystify, elucidate, explain, expound, illuminate, illustrate, interpret,simplify, unriddle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]obscure 使晦涩</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]explication n. 解释</div>
<h2>exterminate[sound:exterminate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">根除，消灭：</font>to get rid of completely usually by killing off</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We  hope  that  the  fumigant  exterminates  the  whole  colony  of  cockroaches,  for  any  survivors  may  beresistant to any poison. 我们希望所有的蟑螂都能被杀虫剂根除，因为任何幸存者都可能产生抗药性。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]annihilate, decimate, efface, eradicate, expunge, extirpate, liquidate, obliterate, raze, sweep, wipe out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conserve, preserve, protect  保护；rescue, save 拯救</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]extermination n. 消灭</div>
<h2>extrapolate[sound:extrapolate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（通过逻辑）推断：</font>to form an opinion or reach a conclusion through reasoning and information</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We can extrapolate from past economic recessions the probable course of the current one. 通过以往经济衰退的原因我们可以推断出本次危机的可能起源。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conclude, decide, deduce, derive, gather, judge, reason, understand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conjecture, guess, speculate, surmise （无根据地）猜测，揣测</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]extrapolation n. 推论</div>
<h2>fallible[sound:fallible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">可能出错的：</font>tending or likely to be erroneous or capable of making an error</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They are only human and all too fallible. 他们都是人类，因此难免犯错。‖a hasty, fallible generalization有可能出错的匆促总结</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]errant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fail-safe, foolproof, infallible, unfailing 万无一失的，不可能出错的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]fallibility n. 易错</div>
<h2>fervent[sound:fervent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">充满感情的，热情洋溢的：</font>exhibiting or marked by great intensity of feeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a fervent speech that called for tolerance and compassion for those who are physically challenged 一个充满感情的演说，它呼吁人们对残疾人持有一颗包容和同情的心</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ardent, demonstrative, fervid, flaming, glowing, impassioned, incandescent, passionate, perfervid, torrid,vehement, zealous</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]cold, cool, dispassionate, emotionless, impassive, unemotional 冷漠的</div>
<h2>figment[sound:figment.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">虚构的事物，幻觉：</font>something made up or contrived</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Unable to find any tracks in the snow the next morning, I was forced to conclude that the shadowy figure had been a figment of my imagination. 第二天一早，我没有在雪地上发现任何足迹，由此我不得不相信昨晚幽灵一样的物体只是我的空想。‖Thus far, the invisible human being has been nothing more than a figment of fantasywriters. 到目前为止，隐形人还仅仅只是玄幻小说笔下的构想。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]chimera, conceit, daydream, delusion, dream, fancy, fantasy, hallucination, illusion, phantasm, vision</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fact, materiality, reality  客观存在的事物</div>
<h2>forebode[sound:forebode.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">预示，预兆：</font>to show signs of a favorable or successful outcome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That police car parked outside the house doesn’t forebode well.  门外停着的那辆警车可不是什么好兆头。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]augur, predict, promise</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]foreboding n. 预感，预兆</div>
<h2>forfeit[sound:forfeit.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">罚金：</font>a sum of money to be paid as a punishment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The forfeit for each baseball player involved in the brawl was $5,000. 参加大家的篮球运动员都受到了五千美元的罚款。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]damages, fine, forfeiture, mulct, penalty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bonus, premium, prize  奖金</div>
<h2>forsake[sound:forsake.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">彻底放弃，抛弃：</font>to renounce or turn away from entirely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Forsaking most of our possessions, we evacuated just before the hurricane struck. 我们抛下了绝大多数的财产，终于在海啸来袭之前撤离了。‖Her boyfriend has forsaken her.  她的男朋友将她抛弃。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abandon, desert, maroon, quit, renounce, strand</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]reclaim 重新获得；hold, keep, retain, withhold 保留</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]forsaken adj. 被抛弃的</div>
<h2>germinate[sound:germinate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">发芽：</font>to begin to grow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some seed varieties germinate very quickly. 有一些种子的变异体能够迅速发芽。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]burgeon, shoot, sprout</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fade, flag, wilt, wither 枯萎</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">出现：</font>to come into being</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A truly marvelous proof of this theorem germinated in his mind. 这个定理的一种绝妙证明方法浮现在他的脑海之中。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]develop, evolve, grow</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disappear, vanish 消逝，消失</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]germination n. 萌芽</div>
<h2>grudge[sound:grudge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">怨恨，仇恨：</font>a feeling of deep-seated resentment or ill will</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There has been a grudge between the two families for years. 两家之间积怨已深。‖He has had a deep grudge against her ever since she snubbed him at the dance. 自从她在舞会上对他不理不睬之后，他就对她怀有深深的怨念。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]animosity, animus, antagonism, antipathy, bitterness, gall, hostility, jaundice, malice, rancor, resentment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amity 和睦，友好</div>
<h2>halfhearted[sound:halfhearted.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不感兴趣的，不热情的：</font>lacking heart, spirit, or interest</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a halfhearted attempt to clean the house before the arrival of the in-laws  在亲家到来前草草地收拾房间了事</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lukewarm, tepid, uneager, unenthusiastic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]eager, enthusiastic, keen, passionate, warm 充满热情的；hearty, wholehearted 全心投入的</div>
<h2>humdrum[sound:humdrum.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">千篇一律，单调：</font>a tedious lack of variety</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She has been loathing the humdrum of daily life in a small town for a long time. 一直以来她很反感于小城镇里一成不变的生活。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]monotone, monotonousness, sameness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]diversity, variety 多样性</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无聊的，乏味的：</font>lacking variety or excitement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]trapped in a humdrum but well-paid job 陷于无聊但是收入可观的工作之中</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arid, drab, dreary, drudging, jading, jejune, monochromatic, monotonous, pedestrian, ponderous, stale,stodgy, tedious, tiresome, wearisome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 令人感兴趣的</div>
<h2>humiliate[sound:humiliate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">羞辱，使丧失尊严：</font>to reduce to a lower position in one’s own eyes or others’ eyes</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]No student feels humiliated for not having the “right” clothes because everyone is wearing a school uniform.因为所有学生都统一穿着学校的校服，所以没有人会因为“不正确”的衣着而感觉尊严扫地。‖He humiliatedme in front of my parents and I swear to retaliate. 他在我的父母面前让我难堪，我发誓要报复他。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abase, chasten, cheapen, debase, degrade, demean, discredit, disgrace, dishonor, shame, sink, smirch</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]aggrandize, canonize, deify, elevate, exalt 使崇高</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]humiliation n. 羞辱，蒙羞</div>
<h2>hypothetical[sound:hypothetical.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">假设，前提条件：</font>something taken as being true or factual and used as a starting point for a courseof action or reasoning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He believes that predictions of the extinction of certain species as the result of global warming are basedupon too many hypotheticals. 他认为所谓全球变暖会导致某些物种灭绝的说法基于过多的假设。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assumption, given, postulate, premise, presumption, presupposition, supposition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conclusion, consequence, deduction, induction, inference 结论</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">假定的：</font>existing only as an assumption or speculation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]We talked about what we would do in various hypothetical emergencies.  我们讨论了在假定的各种紧急情况下的对策。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conjectural, speculative, supposed, suppositional</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]actual, factual, real 事实的</div>
<h2>impunity[sound:impunity.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">免责，免受处罚：</font>exemption or freedom from punishment, harm, or loss</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]She mistakenly believed that she could insult people with impunity. 她错误地认为她可以肆无忌惮地羞辱他人。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exemption, immunity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]liability 责任</div>
<h2>incentive[sound:incentive.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">刺激，诱因：</font>something that incites or has a tendency to incite to determination or action</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The handsome reward for the missing wallet was an incentive for me to start looking. 找到丢失钱包的可观报酬激励我展开搜寻。‖A little bonus will give employees an incentive to work harder. 一点点奖金就可以刺激雇员更加努力地工作。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]boost, goad, impetus, incitement, instigation, momentum, motivation, motive, provocation, spur, stimulant,stimulus, yeast</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]deterrent, disincentive 抑制剂，阻碍物</div>
<h2>justify[sound:justify.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">证明…的合理性，辩解：</font>to prove or show to be just, right, or reasonable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]failed to justify the need for a new expressway at this time 没能证明修建新的高速公路的合理性‖Thestorm warning justified his leaving early.  他的早退因为风暴预警而显得理所当然。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]excuse, rationalize, warrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]justification n. （正当的）理由</div>
<h2>license[sound:license.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">许可，认可：</font>the approval by someone in authority for the doing of something</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The company is seeking license to operate several more power plants in the state. 公司正在寻求在国内建造更多电厂的许可。‖A restaurant owner has to get a license to serve food and drink. 餐厅营业者必须要获得食物和饮品的销售许可。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]allowance, authorization, clearance, concurrence, consent, empowerment, granting, sanction, warrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]interdiction, prohibition, proscription 禁止</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">自由：</font>the right to act or move freely</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Military  commanders  on  the  ground  must  be  granted  considerable  license,  as  wars  cannot  be micromanaged by people back in Washington. 战地指挥官应该被赋予相当大的自由，因为一场战争只靠华盛顿的人是不可能打赢的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]freedom, latitude, liberty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]confinement, custody, imprisonment  拘留，囚禁</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】n. <font color="#aa00ff">放荡：</font>disregard for standards of personal conduct</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a night of drinking and license at the nightclub 夜店里放纵饮酒取乐的一夜</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]debauchery, hedonism, libertinage, libertinism, licentiousness, profligacy, voluptuousness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abstinence, asceticism, sobriety, temperance  节制，克制</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法4】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">准许，授权使用：</font>to permit or authorize especially by formal license</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]A state statute licenses county sheriffs to choose their own deputies. 法律允许郡上的司法长官选择自己的副手。‖licensed to use deadly force  获准使用致命火力</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accredit, certify, commission, empower, enable, invest, qualify, vest, warrant</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disqualify  取消资格；  forbid, interdict, prohibit, proscribe, veto 禁止</div>
<h2>ludicrous[sound:ludicrous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">荒唐的，可笑的：</font>meriting derisive laughter or scorn as absurdly inept, false, or foolish</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He made a ludicrous and easily detected attempt to forge his father’s signature on a note to school.  他试图在要上交学校的纸条上伪造父亲的签名，这实在是既可笑又容易被发现的花招。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]absurd, comical, derisive, derisory, farcical, laughable, ridiculous, pathetic, preposterous, risible, silly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]logical, rational, reasonable, sensible 有道理的</div>
<h2>luminous[sound:luminous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">发光的，有光泽的：</font>emitting or reflecting usually steady, suffused, or glowing light</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The luminous moon bathed the snow-covered fields with a pearly glow. 在明亮的月光下，雪地仿佛被罩上了一层珍珠般的光晕。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]beaming, bright, candescent, dazzling, effulgent, glowing,  incandescent, lambent, lucent, lucid, lustrous,radiant, refulgent, shiny, splendid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]dim, dull, lackluster 黯淡无光的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">杰出的，重要的：</font>standing above others in rank, importance, or achievement</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]some of the most luminous writers in the nation’s history 该国历史上最杰出的一批作家</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]astral, brilliant, distinguished, illustrious, notable, noteworthy, preeminent, prestigious, redoubtable, signal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]average, inferior, mediocre 一般的，中庸的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]luminosity n. 发光；亮度</div>
<h2>malevolent[sound:malevolent.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">恶意的，恶毒的：</font>having, showing, or arising from intense often vicious ill will, spite, or hatred</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The novel grossly oversimplified the conflict as a struggle between relentlessly malevolent villains on oneside and faultless saints on the other. 小说把这场斗争彻底简化成凶残恶毒的坏人和完美无暇的圣人间的纠纷。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cruel, despiteful, evil, malicious, malign, malignant, mean, nasty, spiteful, vicious, virulent</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benevolent, benign, benignant 善意的，和善的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]malevolence n. 恶意，恶毒</div>
<h2>meditate[sound:meditate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">思索，沉思：</font>to focus one’s thoughts on</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]meditated a visit to her professor 思索着去拜访她的导师‖I  have  been  meditating  a  career  changefor months. 我花了几个月的时间在考虑换一个工作。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cogitate, consider, contemplate, deliberate, mull, perpend, ponder, ruminate, study, weigh, wrestle</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disregard, ignore, overlook, slight 忽视</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]meditation n. 沉思</div>
<h2>meretricious[sound:meretricious.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">艳俗的，俗气的：</font>attracting attention in a vulgar manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The paradise they found was no more than a meretricious wasteland of casinos and bars. 他们所发现的所谓“天堂”只不过是一块有着赌场和酒吧的俗气不堪的荒漠罢了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]flamboyant, flaring, flashy, garish, gaudy, glaring, loud, ostentatious, tawdry</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conservative, quiet, understated, unflamboyant 低调的，不张扬的</div>
<h2>milieu[sound:milieu.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">环境，氛围：</font>the physical or social setting in which something occurs or develops</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Young, innovative artists thrive in the freewheeling milieu that a big city offers. 在那个大都市所提供的自由氛围中，年轻而富有创造力的艺术家们的事业蓬勃发展。‖ahistorical milieu conducive to democracy  有助于民主制度的历史背景</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ambient, atmosphere, climate, context, environment, environs, medium, setting, surroundings, terrain</div>
<h2>military[sound:military.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">军事的，军用的：</font>of or relating to soldiers, arms, or war</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]NATO struggles with how to proceed military operation against Libya. 北约就如何延续针对利比亚的军事行动出现了内部分歧。‖an encyclopedia of modern military aircraft 现代军用飞行器百科全书</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]martial, service</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]civilian 民用的</div>
<h2>nostalgia[sound:nostalgia.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">思乡之情：</font>the state of being homesick</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Overwhelmed by nostalgia, she started to cry. 被思乡之情淹没的她开始啜泣。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]homesickness</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">怀旧，怀念：</font>a wistful or excessively sentimental yearning for return to or of some past period orirrecoverable condition</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He felt a wave of nostalgia for the life he had left behind him. 他开始怀念往昔的时光。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reminiscence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]oblivion 遗忘</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]nostalgic adj. 怀旧的</div>
<h2>numb[sound:numb.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">失去感觉的：</font>devoid of sensation especially as a result of cold or anesthesia</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I have been sitting in the same position for too long and now my feet are numb. 我一个姿势坐得太久，以至于双腿都发麻了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]asleep, benumbed, dead, insensitive, numbed, torpid, unfeeling</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]feeling, sensible, sensitive 有感觉的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">麻木的，无感情的：</font>devoid of emotion</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Apparently in shock, he answered the police officer’s questions with a numb expression on his face.  她显然是受到了惊吓，以至于在回答警官的问题时一脸茫然。‖Years of physical and emotional abuse had renderedthe woman numb and withdrawn. 常年累月的肉体和精神上的折磨已让她麻木而寡言。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affectless, apathetic, catatonic, deadpan, emotionless, impassible, passionless, phlegmatic, stoic, stolid</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demonstrative, emotional, fervent, fervid, impassioned, passionate, vehement 充满感情的</div>
<h2>ordeal[sound:ordeal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">严峻的考验：</font>a severe trial or experience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The hikers were finally rescued after a three-day ordeal in the wilderness. 在野外度过了三天的严峻考验之后，登山者终于获救了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]calvary, crucible, fire, gauntlet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]delight, enjoyment, pleasure 令人愉快的事物</div>
<h2>ostensible[sound:ostensible.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">表面上的，佯装的：</font>appearing to be true  on the basis of evidence that may or may not beconfirmed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It must be the ostensible reason for their visit while their actual motives may be malignant 这肯定只是他们上门拜访的表面原因，他们背后的动机说不定恶劣至极。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]apparent, assumed, evident, ostensive, presumed, putative, reputed, seeming, supposed, prima facie</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]actual, real 真实的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]ostensibly adv. 表面上地</div>
