<h2>outgrowth[sound:outgrowth.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">结果，后果：</font>a condition or occurrence traceable to a cause</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Crime is often an outgrowth of poverty. 犯罪往往可以归因于贫穷。‖A  predictable  outgrowth  of  the suburb’s ever growing population will be the need for more schools. 郊区人口攀升所导致的一个可以预见的后果就是需要更多的学校。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]aftereffect, aftermath, consequence, fate, fruit, outcome, precipitate, product, result, sequel, sequence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]antecedent, cause, occasion, reason 原因；origin, root, source 源头</div>
<h2>outmoded[sound:outmoded.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">过时的，废弃的：</font>no longer acceptable, current, or usable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]outmoded computers that can be recycled 可供回收的废旧电脑</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antiquated, archaic, demoded, fossilized, moribund, moth-eaten, obsolete, outworn, prehistoric , rusty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]contemporary, current, modern 现代的，当代的</div>
<h2>override[sound:override.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">不顾：</font>to set aside</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The Congress overrode the President’s veto and passed the law. 国会不顾总统的否决，强行通过了那项法令。‖He overrode all opposition to his plans. 他对所有的反对意见不闻不问。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]disregard, ignore, neglect, overlook, overpass, pass over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]comply, observe 遵守</div>
<h2>overwhelm[sound:overwhelm.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">淹没：</font>to cover with or as if with a flood</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That spring the massive runoff from melting snows overwhelmed the valley. 那个春天，整个村庄被融雪形成的洪流吞没了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]deluge, drown, engulf, inundate, overflow, submerge, submerse, swamp</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]drain 抽干</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">（感情上、精神上）使无所适从，使难以承受：</font>to subject to incapacitating emotional or mentalstress</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Just the thought of how much work there is to do overwhelms me. 仅仅是想想还有多少工作没完成就几乎让我喘不过气了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]devastate, oppress, overcome, overmaster, overpower, prostrate, whelm</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]relieve 使舒缓</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]overwhelming adj. 势不可挡的，无法抗拒的</div>
<h2>panacea[sound:panacea.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">万能药，万灵药：</font>a remedy for all ills or difficulties</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a woman who seems to believe that chicken soup is a panacea for nearly everything 一个相信鸡汤是万能灵药的妇女‖Bicycles are not a panacea for the traffic problem. 自行车并不是解决交通问题的万能药。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catholicon, cure-all, elixir, nostrum</div>
<h2>perquisite[sound:perquisite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">额外的好处：</font>something given in addition to what is ordinarily expected or owed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]give the movers a perquisite if they do a good job 如果搬家工人做得好就会获得一定的小费‖The use ofa company car is one perquisite of the job. 能使用公司的汽车是这项工作的附加好处之一。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cumshaw, dividend, donative, extra, gratuity, gravy, lagniappe, perk, tip</div>
<h2>petulant[sound:petulant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">易怒的，爱发脾气的：</font>easily irritated or annoyed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]He is a petulant and fussy man who is always blaming everyone else for his problems.  他是一个对细节非常在意而又容易生气的人，还总是把自己的问题怪罪到别人的头上。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]choleric, grouchy, grumpy, irascible, irritable, peevish, perverse, pettish, prickly, raspy, ratty, stuffy, testy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]forbearing, obliging, patient, stoic , tolerant 容忍的，忍让的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]petulance n. 易怒，坏脾气</div>
<h2>pitfall[sound:pitfall.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">陷阱：</font>a pit flimsily covered or camouflaged and used to capture and hold animals or men</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]caught in a pitfall 掉下了陷阱‖Renting a house can be full of pitfalls for the unwary. 对于那些不注意的人来说租房也是危机四伏的。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]catch, gimmick, gotcha, hitch, joker, snag, snare, trap</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（不易察觉的）危害：</font>a hidden or not easily recognized danger or difficulty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]One of the pitfalls of ignorance is that people will also assume you are stupid. 无知的一个危害就是，人们总会假设你一无所知。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]hazard, imminence, menace, peril, risk, threat, trouble</div>
<h2>placid[sound:placid.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">宁静的，风平浪静的：</font>free from storms or physical disturbance</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a vacation in the placid lake community 在宁静的湖区度过的假日</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]calm, halcyon, hushed, peaceful, quiet, serene, still, stilly, tranquil, untroubled</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]boisterous, clamorous, noisy, raucous, roistering, rowdy, tumultuous, uproarious 喧闹的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">冷静的，淡定的：</font>free from emotional or mental agitation</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I know an exceptionally placid mother who was rarely upset by her six children 我认识一个异常淡定的母亲，她几乎从未因为自己的六个孩子而烦恼过。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]collected, composed, coolheaded, level, limpid, possessed, recollected, sedate, undisturbed, unperturbed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]agitated, discomposed, disturbed, flustered, perturbed, upset 不安的，焦虑的</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]placidity n.宁静，安宁</div>
<h2>playful[sound:playful.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">爱开玩笑的，好打闹的：</font>given to good-natured joking or teasing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The little girl was lighthearted and playful. 小女孩性格很轻松愉快，喜欢和别人打闹。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]antic, coltish, elfish, fay, frisky, frolicsome, larky, rollicking, sportive</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]earnest, grave, serious, sober, solemn, somber 严肃的</div>
<h2>prerequisite[sound:prerequisite.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">先决条件，前提：</font>something that is necessary to an end or to the carrying out of a function</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Competence is prerequisite to promotion. 能力是提升的必要条件。‖I don’t think a large dwelling place isa prerequisite for a happy life. 我并不认为大的住所就能带来幸福的生活。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]condition, essential, must, necessity, precondition, requirement, requisite, sine qua non</div>
<h2>prerogative[sound:prerogative.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">特权，权力：</font>an exclusive or special right, power, or privilege</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]It is your prerogative to refuse to attend religious services. 你有权力不参加宗教活动。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]appanage, birthright, entitlement, privilege, right</div>
<h2>proclaim[sound:proclaim.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">宣告，使…公之于众：</font>to declare publicly, typically insistently, proudly, or defiantly and in eitherspeech or writing</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]wearing a button that proclaimed my choice for president 身上挂着一个纽扣，它能够彰显我支持谁当总统‖He launched a coup and proclaimed himself president. 他发动了一场政变，然后宣称自己已成为总统。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]advertise, announce, blare, blazon, broadcast, declare, enunciate, herald, promulgate, publicize, publish,release, trumpet</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]conceal, hide 隐藏；silence, suppress 压制（观点的发表）</div>
<h2>project[sound:project.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">方案，计划：</font>a specific plan or design</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an ambitious project to develop the city’s underground transport  一项开发城市地下交通系统的雄心勃勃的计划</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arrangement, blueprint, design, plan, program, scheme, strategy, system, road map</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">凸出：</font>to extend outward beyond a usual point</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Some boulders projected dangerously out above the trail. 一些巨石非常危险地在道路上凸了出来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]balloon, beetle, billow, bunch, jut, overhang, poke, pouch, pout, protrude, swell</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">预测，预计：</font>to calculate, estimate, or predict (something in the future), based on present data ortrends</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]projecting next year’s expenses  预测明年的开销</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]augur, estimate, extrapolate, forecast, predict, predetermine, presage</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]projected adj. 计划的；projection n. 凸起物；投影</div>
<h2>proprietary[sound:proprietary.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">所有权：</font>ownership</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dominion, ownership, possession, property, proprietorship</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">私营的：</font>privately owned and managed and run as a profit-making organization</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a proprietary hospital 私人医院</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]private</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]public 政府提供的；state-owned  国有的</div>
<h2>prototype[sound:prototype.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">原型：</font>an original model on which something is patterned</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The manufacturer exhaustively tested the prototype of the vehicle before approving production. 生产商在将该车型投入生产之前对其原型进行了详细的测试。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]archetype</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]copy, imitation, replica, reproduction  复制品</div>
<h2>redeem[sound:redeem.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">实践，履行（诺言等）：</font>to do what is required by the terms of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The coach redeemed his promise to take the players out for ice cream if they improved their fielding overthe season. 教练履行了他的诺言，那就是如果球员们能够在赛季中提升防守能力的话，他就请他们吃冰淇淋。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]answer, complete, comply, fill, fulfill, keep, meet, satisfy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]breach, break, transgress, violate 违反，违背</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">改过自新：</font>to make better in behavior or character</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The unfaithful husband made a determined effort to redeem himself in the eyes of his wife and children.在妻子和孩子的监督下，不忠的丈夫下定决心要改过自新。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]habilitate, reclaim, redeem, regenerate, rehabilitate</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]redeemable adj. 可赎回的，可挽救的</div>
<h2>replicate[sound:replicate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">复制，复刻：</font>to make an exact likeness of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]replicated the famous painting in our art class  在艺术课上复刻一幅名画</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]clone, copy, copycat, duplicate, imitate, reduplicate, render, reproduce</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]originate 原创</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">重复，反复：</font>to make or do again</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I cannot replicate your results when I do the experiment myself.  我自己的实验里无法重复你的结果。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]redo, reiterate, renew, repeat</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]replicable adj. 可复制的，能复现的</div>
<h2>restitution[sound:restitution.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">补偿，赔偿：</font>a making good of or giving an equivalent for some injury</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The victims are demanding full restitution. 受害者要求全额补偿。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]damages,  indemnity,  quittance,  recompense,  recoupment,  redress,  remuneration,  reparation,  reprisal, requital</div>
<h2>resurrect[sound:resurrect.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">使重生，使复苏：</font>to bring back to life, practice, or activity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]believed that his body would be resurrected 相信他的身体将会复活‖Attempts are being made by bothparties to resurrect the stalled arms negotiations.  双方正在努力重启受阻的武装谈判。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reanimate, recharge, regenerate, rejuvenate, rekindle, renew, resuscitate, revitalize, revive, revivify</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]kill 杀死</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]resurrection n. 重生，复苏</div>
<h2>retrieve[sound:retrieve.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">寻回，找回：</font>to get back again</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]I needed to retrieve the book from my friend so I could return it to the library. 我需要先把书从朋友那里拿回来才能还给图书馆。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]reacquire, recapture, reclaim, re-collect, recoup, recover, regain, repossess, retake</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]lose, mislay, misplace 丢失</div>
<h2>reverberate[sound:reverberate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">回荡，回响：</font>to continue or be repeated in a series of reflected sound waves</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sound of thunder reverberated from one end of the mountain pass to the other. 打雷的声音在山间不断回荡。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]echo, reecho, resonate, resound</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]reverberation n. 回响，回音</div>
<h2>ruthless[sound:ruthless.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">没有怜悯心的，残忍的：</font>having no pity</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an office supervisor with a ruthless disregard for others’ feelings 一个从不顾及他人感情的无情领导</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]cruel, heartless, inhumane, ironfisted, iron-hearted, pitiless, merciless, mortal, relentless, remorseless</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]charitable, compassionate, humane, kindhearted, merciful, sympathetic, tender 有同情心的，善良的</div>
<h2>scourge[sound:scourge.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">祸害：</font>a source of harm or misfortune</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sheer ubiquity of food seems to be the scourge of humanity, as evidenced by the obesity epidemic.无所不在的食品似乎要成为人类的罪恶之源了，这一点可以从肥胖病的泛滥得以佐证。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]affliction, bane, curse, nemesis</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]benefit, blessing, boon, felicity, godsend, manna, windfall 恩赐，福音</div>
<h2>scruple[sound:scruple.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（良心上的）不安：</font>an uneasy feeling about the rightness of what one is doing or going to do</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The survey showed that many students had few scruples about cheating on papers or exams. 调查显示很多学生对于在考试时作弊没有丝毫的愧疚。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]compunction, misgiving</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assurance, certainty, certitude, confidence, conviction, sureness 确信</div>
<h2>sectarianism[sound:sectarianism.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">宗派主义，顽固：</font>stubborn or intolerant adherence to one's opinions or prejudices</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]An ideological sectarianism prevented the political party from ever being anything more than a fringe group.意识形态上的顽固和保守使得这个政党只能成为一个边缘团体。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dogmatism, illiberalism, intolerance, narrow-mindedness, partisanship, small-mindedness</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]broad-mindedness, liberalism, open-mindedness, tolerance 开明</div>
<h2>secular[sound:secular.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">世俗的，尘世的：</font>of or relating to the worldly or temporal</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That’s an issue for the secular authorities, not the church. 这个问题和宗教无关，是一个世俗事务。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carnal, earthborn, earthbound, fleshly, material, mundane, sublunary, temporal, terrene, terrestrial, worldly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heavenly, unearthly, unworldly 非尘世间的；spiritual  精神上的；religious 宗教的</div>
<h2>sparing[sound:sparing.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">节俭的，节约的：</font>marked by or practicing careful restraint (as in the use of resources)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The sparing couple are trying to save up enough for a house. 节俭的夫妻希望能够攒钱买套房。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]economical, economizing, provident, scrimping, thrifty</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]prodigal, profligate, spendthrift, squandering, wasteful 浪费的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">不足的，缺乏的：</font>less plentiful than what is normal, necessary, or desirable</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Unfortunately, the explanation of the health insurance plan was somewhat sparing on details. 不幸的是，健康保险上的说明似乎不够详细。‖The map is sparing of information. 这张地图的信息量太少了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]exiguous, niggardly, poor, scant, scanty, scarce, skimp, skimpy, slender, slim, spare, sparse, stingy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]abundant, ample, bountiful, copious, generous, liberal, plenteous, plentiful 足量的</div>
<h2>stereotype[sound:stereotype.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">成见，老套的理念：</font>a conventional, formulaic, and oversimplified conception, opinion, or image</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The noble savage was a stereotype that appealed to 18th-century intellectuals, who viewed European civilization as decadent and corrupt.  “高贵的野蛮人”这一概念是为了迎合十八世纪的文人而提出的，他们将欧洲视作一支正在堕落和腐化的文明。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]concept, conception, generality, notion</div>
<h2>substitute[sound:substitute.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">取代者，替代品：</font>a person or thing that takes the place or function of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]If you like, you can use nuts as a substitute for coconut in that recipe. 如果您不反对，我们可以将菜单里的椰子换成坚果。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backup, cover, fill-in, relief, replacement, reserve, stand-in, surrogate</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">取代，替代：</font>to take the place of</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]substituting moral power for physical force 将暴力用道德的力量代替‖BFR  molecules  have  some atoms substituted by bromide atoms, which makes it fire-resistant. 在溴化阻燃剂的分子中，一部分原子被溴原子取代，从而使它不易燃烧。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]displace, relieve, replace, supersede, supplant, cut out</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]substitution n. 取代</div>
<h2>succumb[sound:succumb.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">屈服：</font>to yield to superior strength or force or overpowering appeal or desire</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]refused to succumb to her fears and defiantly walked through the dark cemetery 拒绝向自己的恐惧屈服，而是倔强地走过了幽暗的墓地</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bow, capitulate, concede, submit, surrender, give in</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]resist 抵抗</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vi. <font color="#aa00ff">死亡：</font>to be brought to an end (as death) by the effect of destructive or disruptive forces</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The patient lay so still and pale that everyone thought he had succumbed, and then he opened his eyes.面色惨白的病人静静地躺在床上，正当所有人都怀疑他已经过逝时，他突然睁开了眼睛。‖The doctor workedtirelessly until finally he, too, succumbed to the plague. 医生不知劳累地工作，直至最后，他也死于瘟疫。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]decease, demise, expire, perish, pass away</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]endure, stand  忍受住；breathe, live, survive 存活</div>
<h2>supersede[sound:supersede.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">取代，替代：</font>to displace in favor of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That edition of the dictionary that you have has been superseded by a more recent one. 你买的那一版的字典已经被最近新出的版本取代了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]displace, relieve, replace, substitute, supplant, cut out</div>
<h2>surly[sound:surly.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">脾气不好的：</font>irritably sullen and churlish in mood or manner</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The surly receptionist told us we would have to wait outside in the rain. 态度粗暴的服务员说我们必须在外面等——哪怕是在下雨。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]acid, bearish, bilious, cantankerous, disagreeable, dyspeptic, ill-humored, ill-natured, ornery, splenetic</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]amiable, good-humored, good-natured, good-tempered 性格好的</div>
<h2>surmise[sound:surmise.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">（根据不足的）推测，揣测：</font>a thought or idea based on scanty evidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My surmise is that the couple’s “good news” is the announcement that they are going to have a baby.我猜那对夫妻说的“好消息”就是他们要有小孩了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]guess, hypothesis, shot, supposition, theory</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]fact 事实</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">推测：</font>to form a notion of from scanty evidence</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]From his tone I surmised that he was unhappy. 从他的语气中我猜测他并不高兴。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]assume, conjecture, daresay, imagine, infer, presume, speculate, suppose, suspect</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]demonstrate, prove, substantiate, validate 证明</div>
<h2>surmount[sound:surmount.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">战胜，获得胜利：</font>to achieve a victory over</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]an Olympic swimmer who surmounted endless obstacles to achieve her goals 一个克服重重困难最终实现目标的奥运游泳运动员</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conquer, defeat, overbear, overcome, overmatch, prevail, subdue, triumph, win</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]lose 失败</div>
<h2>surrogate[sound:surrogate.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">替代品：</font>one that takes the place of another</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]For some people, Google Earth is never a justified surrogate for actual travel.  对于一部分人而言，谷歌地球决不是旅行的合理替代品。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]backup, cover, fill-in, relief, replacement, reserve, stand-in, substitute</div>
<h2>tame[sound:tame.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">被驯化的：</font>reduced from a state of native wildness especially so as to be tractable and usefulto humans</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Every evening, a wild Canada goose is at the food trough with our tame geese. 每天傍晚的食槽边总会出现一只野生加拿大鹅和我们的饲养家鹅一起进食。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]domestic, domesticated, tamed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]feral, savage, undomesticated, untamed, wild  野生的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">无聊的，乏味的：</font>lacking spirit, zest, interest, or the capacity to excite</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]That action movie was so tame I fell asleep about 20 minutes into it.  那部动作片实在是太无聊了，我刚开场二十分钟就睡着了。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]arid, drab, dreary, drudging, humdrum,  insipid, jading, jejune, monochromatic, monotonous, pedestrian,ponderous, stale, stodgy, tedious, tiresome, wearisome</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 令人感兴趣的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法3】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">控制，抑制：</font>to keep from exceeding a desirable degree or level (as of expression)</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Try to tame your language when you are in front of the kids. 在孩子面前注意一下你的措辞。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bridle, check, constrain, contain, curb, govern, hold, inhibit, keep, measure, regulate, rein, restrain, rule</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]unleash 宣泄（感情等）</div>
<h2>tangle[sound:tangle.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">困惑，不解：</font>a state of perplexity or complete bewilderment</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]My mind has been in a tangle ever since I learned some information about an old, deceased acquaintance.自从我获知一些关于已故的老熟人的消息之后我就陷入了困惑之中。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]bafflement, befuddlement, bemusement, bewilderment, confusedness, distraction, muddle, mystification,perplexity, puzzlement, whirl</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]assurance, certainty, certitude, confidence, conviction, sureness 确信</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】vt. <font color="#aa00ff">纠缠，使…纠结：</font>to seize and hold in or as if in a snare</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]was at last tangled in the web of lies that he had told to everyone 最终被自己所编织的谎言缠住了</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]enmesh, ensnare, ensnarl, entrap, mesh, net, snare, trap</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]disentangle 解开</div>
<h2>teeming[sound:teeming.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">大量的：</font>possessing or covered with great numbers or amounts of something specified</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]oceans teeming with life 孕育着无穷生命的海洋</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abundant, ample, awash, cornucopian, flush, fraught, lousy, replete, swarming, thick, thronging</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]bare, barren, blank, devoid, empty, stark, vacant, void 贫瘠的，空无一物的</div>
<h2>temporal[sound:temporal.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">世俗的，尘世的：</font>of or relating to earthly life</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The master told his disciples not to worry about temporal concerns, but instead focus on spiritual matters.大师要弟子们不要为尘世间的纷争而苦恼，而是将精神集中于灵魂上的思考。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]carnal, earthborn, earthbound, fleshly, material, mundane, secular, sublunary, terrene, terrestrial, worldly</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]heavenly, unearthly, unworldly 非尘世间的；spiritual  精神上的；religious 宗教的</div>
<h2>tentative[sound:tentative.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">暂时性的，尝试的：</font>not fully worked out or developed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Our plans are only tentative at this point and will depend on whether you can come. 我们的计划只是暂时性的，具体还要看你能否前来。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ad interim, impermanent, interim, provisional, provisionary, provisory, short-term, temporary, trial</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]final 最终的；ceaseless, endless, eternal, immortal, permanent, perpetual, undying 永久性的</div>
<h2>tyrant[sound:tyrant.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">暴君：</font>a ruler who exercises absolute power oppressively or brutally</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]The people universally feared the tyrant, who was notorious for his frequent use of torture. 人们非常恐惧这个暴君，因为他有着经常折磨犯人的臭名。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]dictator, oppressor, pharaoh, strongman</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]tyranny n. 暴政，苛政</div>
<h2>unanimous[sound:unanimous.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">一致同意的：</font>having the agreement and consent of all</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a unanimous vote to upgrade the school’s computer facilities 一致同意对学校的计算机设备进行升级</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]consentaneous, uncontested</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]unanimity n. 一致同意</div>
<h2>unremitting[sound:unremitting.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">连续不断的：</font>going on and on without any interruptions</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Unremitting rain lasted for six days. 连续下了六天的雨。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ceaseless, continual, continuing, incessant, nonstop, perpetual, unbroken, uninterrupted</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]discontinuous, intermittent 不连续的，有间断的</div>
<h2>versed[sound:versed.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">熟知的：</font>having information especially as a result of study or experience</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]versed in the latest developments in aeronautics 熟知当今航空业的发展情况</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]abreast, acquainted, conversant, informed, knowledgeable, well-informed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]ignorant, unacquainted, unfamiliar, uninformed, unknowledgeable 无知的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">精通的：</font>having or showing exceptional knowledge, experience, or skill in a field of endeavor</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]well versed in the techniques of laser surgery  精通激光手术方面的技术</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]accomplished, adept, complete, consummate, experienced, expert, master, practiced, professed, skilled,veteran, virtuoso</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]amateur, inexperienced, inexpert, jackleg, unprofessional, unseasoned, unskilled 业余的，不精通的</div>
<h2>vocation[sound:vocation.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">职业：</font>the work in which a person is regularly employed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]finally made soccer her vocation instead of just a hobby 终于将足球从爱好升级为谋生的职业</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]calling, employment, occupation, profession, trade, work</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]hobby 爱好</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]vocational adj. 职业的，为职业做准备的</div>
<h2>voyeur[sound:voyeur.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】n. <font color="#aa00ff">淫窥狂：</font>one obtaining sexual gratification from observing  unsuspecting individuals who arepartly undressed, naked, or engaged in sexual acts</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]They accidentally found out that their ostensibly benign neighbor is actually a voyeur. 他们偶然间发现那个表面和善的邻居居然是一个偷窥狂。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]peeper</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[派]voyeurism n. 偷窥癖</div>
<h2>willful[sound:willful.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固执的，倔强的：</font>obstinately and often perversely self-willed</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]Finally the parents sought professional counseling for the willful child. 最终家长不得不为倔强的小孩寻求专业咨询。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant,  headstrong,  immovable,  implacable,  inconvincible,  inflexible,  intransigent,  mulish,  obdurate,pertinacious, perverse, stubborn, unyielding, wrongheaded</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquiescent, agreeable, amenable, compliant, flexible, pliable, pliant, relenting, yielding 易受影响的</div><div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法2】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">故意的：</font>done deliberately</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]a willful attempt to cheat her siblings out of their rightful inheritance 一个想将继承权从她的姊妹手里骗过来的故意企图</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]conscious, deliberate, intended, intentional, knowing, purposeful, voluntary, willed, witting</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]accidental, chance, haphazard, inadvertent, incidental, random 不经意的，偶然的</div>
<h2>wistful[sound:wistful.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">（带着忧伤而）渴望的，怀念的：</font>full of yearning or desire tinged with melancholy</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]There was a wistful look in his eyes when he spoke of his childhood.  当他谈起他的童年时，眼眶中不禁流露出一种带有忧伤的怀念之情。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]longing, nostalgic, reminiscent, yearning</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]apathetic, indifferent, insouciant, nonchalant, perfunctory, unconcerned 无所谓的，不感兴趣的</div>
<h2>wrongheaded[sound:wrongheaded.mp3]</h2>	<div style="font-size:20px;text-align:left">【考法1】adj. <font color="#aa00ff">固执己见的，坚持（错误观点）的：</font>stubborn in adherence to wrong opinion or principles</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[例]In spite of other’s objections, he is always wrongheaded in his opinions. 他总是不管他人的反对而坚持自己哪怕是错误的观点。</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[近]adamant,  headstrong,  immovable,  implacable,  inconvincible,  inflexible,  intransigent,  mulish,  obdurate,pertinacious, perverse, stubborn, unyielding, willful</div><div style="text-indent:3em;font-size:15px;text-align:left">[反]acquiescent, agreeable, amenable, compliant, flexible, pliable, pliant, relenting, yielding 易受影响的</div>
